0vfzTU9uABMvaI3MRZ7D6w.text: One of the better buffets in the "Buffet of Buffets" 24 hour deal in Vegas I don't MIND coming here but it's not the most amazing place ever.  (+) A huge variety of foods and they were all quite yummy! (+) Freshly made crepes mmmm... P: (+) GET THE PRIME RIBBBB!  (-) 17% gratuity for 8+ people

s4CQl0KBFUqRw9qZY_9qXg.text: Buffets... again. I think my mom would love the buffets in Las Vegas (especially if you buy the Total Rewards deal, you pay about $57, for a 24 hour buffet-eating spree)  But buffets and hangover do not blend very well. I was a bit miserable buffet-hopping in the day time. It sucks many of the mom n pop pho shops or dim sum restaurants are not located on the strip. It is taken over by the bigger businesses owned by the hotels, otherwise they would have great business. We started off at Le Village at noon, the line was a bit long for a 3-star buffet. I would expect Wynn or Bellagio would be ridiculous, but  nevertheless it went by quick, especially if you have large parties. There is a service/gratuity charge if your party exceeds 7. There were 7 of us so we made the cut! (huzzah!)  Since it is located in the Paris Hotel, many food were French inspired like French toast, crepes, Eggs Benedict. I tried to make the most of my buck, but buffets and I don't get along since I eat very little portions. We chose the buffet-hop for the experience since some of my friends really wanted to try as many buffets as possible. There is an extra $15 charge if you buy the Total Rewards deal and eat at Caesars'. I recommend coming here hangover free, starved, and with some big pants.    It's a good experience--but not for me. I just stick with the simple ole' fast food and maybe one buffet for dinner.

gH64BZn63T9-57sV4TDtOA.text: Not surprised that this place wasn't a 5-star buffet, as the prices were a lot cheaper than the other ones I've been to.  Overall, not a bad meal after three days of losing hundreds of dollars, but if you want quality and options, this is not your place.    The food is ok, like I said, for a groupon deal of $18 it's not bad, but would I pay more for this place, no way.  I think it's $24 for lunch w/o the groupon.  Quality of the food was bleak, as the selection was.  I don't remember seeing a seafood bar but that may be b/c I was dining at lunch time.   The line was long, but it moves pretty fast.    Heh, save your money and hit up one of the fancier buffets..........

rVjU7Y9BQOx_pcrwzdrbDg.text: I normally don't like to write bad reviews,  but this buffet is highly overrated.  I came here for dinner with my husband ($67 for two including tax). The lines are very long which I don't mind but only if it's worth it (we waited for 45 mins). The decor is highly outdated, probably haven't renovated in over 10+ years since it has this dungeon feel.  The staff is stretched thin as I can see they are overworked.  The waitress didn't give us drinks until we flagged her, when we ordered hot tea she gave us very watered down milk which was a complete turnoff. We were missing spoons and napkins such I'm sure it's due to the waitress running around covering such a huge section.  The variety of food is very very poor. I can't even explain.  Their vegetarian option is horrible and there really isn't much to choose from.  I would stay the hell away from here for dinner.  I had a  decent breakfast from here a while ago,  but the dinner experience has turned me off forever.  Do yourself a favor and go to Aria for a dinner buffet instead.

-vUEIp2jUSGAG8Jodho6Sg.text: Used a BOGO groupon and we got a free bottle of wine.  Very underwhelmed with this buffet....the food was pretty bland. The duck al'orange tasted like chicken and the baguette I had tasted really stale. The dessert buffet was only half full, one whole side of the are was empty.  For a 'French' dining experience, it makes me never really want to visit France! The best thing I had was the Yukon gold mashed potatoes and the creme brulee was ok (that is my favorite dessert so I was glad that at least tasted decent!)

Dm3WmOaW78Ne9ox2vDkrsg.text: The only thing that i liked about this buffet were the split-opened crab legs but then again not really, because its not as juicy as the ones that WErent cracked yet.   Speaking of juicy, the only thing that was... was the prime rib. Man, it was good! But with meat, its always a hit or miss.  Small buffet, needs more selections.

OTOiD3q2nSQ5iD92eTutIg.text: I didn't mind the hour+ wait on a Wednesday, that was expected. But when we finally got seated, all the food stations looked like they just got bum rushed and the place was a mess. Drinks took forever to come and the table next to us sat uncleaned the entire time with dirty dishes. The quality of food was very poor. The only bright spot was dessert pastries, those were quite nice.

8JlWOyyMQgoL3kwc45DYiA.text: Ohh how they've loss their luster. I came here when the casino first opened and every time I'm back I'm just not pleased with the buffet. The hotel itself and rooms are great, but the buffet may have taken my money for the last time this last visit. I don't know why i keep coming back here always giving them the benefit of the doubt. But this last visit did it for me, im done with Le Village Buffet at Paris. With so many other hotels having great Buffets (eg: Aria, Bellagio, Wynn and even Rio still going strong) their are too many choices too be a sub par buffet especially in Las Vegas.  Honorable Mention: Go elsewhere! (unless it's a comp than maybe)

u2JFrx8IVarTA8iFUhEQdw.text: If you're looking for a buffet on the Strip that offers a difference experience (in both food and presentation) from ordinary buffets, definitely try the buffet at Paris.  This buffet is a great reminder of what can be great about Vegas; dining in Le Village will immerse you into the feel and charm of eating in a nice village in France. From the setting to the waiters, and of course the food, the ambiance certainly sets Le Village apart from other contemporary buffets.  But the food. That's what we came here for right? And believe me, it won't disappoint. Beyond offering some of the more traditional stuff you'll see at every buffet, Le Village has French-influenced food (surprise surprise) which was a big hit for me. I definitely loved the selection and was able to try different things. And perhaps the best part of it all is that there's a crepe station to fulfill all your sweet-tooth desire. But be forewarned, the crepe line can get mighty long, so if there's an opening, it might be smart to grab one real fast.   Overall, I've been here on a couple occasions and I had a stellar experience each time. Definitely recommending Le Village if you're looking for a buffet that's not at the Wynn or Caesar's.

PIRv7fbedCe5rc4v4EKPGg.text: Not really a fan. This place has obviously gone down hill, because it used to be one of the best. Workers and cooks didn't seem happy, especially our server who rarely came by to clean our table and refill drinks.  Food was the biggest disappointment. Nothing tasted amazing to me, and usually I like at least one entree at a buffet. BUTTTTT... the crepe station is worth it. I ordered my absolute favorite - NUTELLA AND BANANA. Freshly made! Unfortunately, there was only one cook, which made a "short" line more like 20 minutes. Food was salty and DRY. Wasn't impressed. I'm pretty easy to please when it comes to buffets, too...  In short, it's hard to swallow (literally) $64 for two. I'd rather spend that money at Mon Ami across the way, one of my favorite restaurants in Las Vegas.

Dp74T5x1JbcQO94KK6oBZg.text: I normally do not care for buffets, even the concept bothers me a little.  With that said, Natasha and I managed to find what I consider to be perhaps the best buffet in Vegas replete with many notable French classics.    The selection was especially large, and I was very pleased to see favorites like cassoulet, coq au vin, boeuf bourguignon, and so forth.  Each of these particular dishes was decidedly good, and the selection by no means ended there.  I had a cheese course, creme brulee, carrot cake, and, well, a handful of plates by the time everything was said and done.  Apparently, I am a glutton for the classics.    The wait in line is a notable drawback to coming here though.  We showed up for a late lunch, but by the time we paid and we were seated, it was actually an early dinner.  I would estimate we waited a good 40 minutes, but the timing was such that we saved $14 between the different prices and were afforded an even grander selection of proteins.  So who is really going to complain about that?  Aesthetically everything was pleasing, and we managed to have a grand time here.  Highly recommend.

2ZDwNS_PYHiR42IJCBjyxg.text: Uh, this buffet was actually kind of disappointing. I loved the french themed food: creme brule, french onion soup, and some other french delicacies. Unfortunately, all the other food was pretty disappointing. Even the creme brule was okay.  The best thing has got to be the crepe making station. There was a lady making crepes with the desired fruit topping you want. The lady unfortunately messed up my order and gave me cherries instead of strawberries. So, I had a blueberry, cherries, and banana crepe topped with powdered sugar and nutella. It was pretty good.   The potatoes were really old and soggy. The vegetables that I got were  not fresh at all. I compared this buffet to the one at Planet Hollywood and I have to say that the buffet at Planet Hollywood was better, even though it does not have all the french stuff that this buffet has.

REZuL0Wc68BzSR0-8vGYCQ.text: Stay away from this buffet! There was not much of a selection and the food that was there was mislabeled. Why is there a sign for Tiramisu in front of the chocolate eclair and no tiramisu at all? The worst part about the buffet is that 20 minutes after I left, both my friend and I started feeling sick. We both spent the rest of the night throwing up. I ate at the buffet nearly 12 hours ago and I still feel sick. Don't waste your time here, stick with the Bellagio!

eeT0pgGf-R9lrpTcQb4vnw.text: One of the best and affordable buffets on the strip! The service was tremendous and the food quality is honestly what you pay for.

hCai4rLz0O7TrugP0WI1Ng.text: This buffet was the bomb!!   An AMAZING selection of food laid out in a little village atmosphere, the service is on the spot and the food, not only extensive...but so tasty!!  Stuffed myself silly on breakfast here! Just had to try almost one of everything! Not a huge buffet fan, but found myself really wishing we went back the next day instead of trying out the Wynn.   Homemade crepes - yummy!!  Super Great egg concoctions...did I mention I love Brie and Feta?! Spinach too...you bet?!  Nothing was sitting out for too long - probably too crowded for that! And rightfully so, everything was delicious! Can't say I had one bad thing here. Even smuggled out a few cookies to snack on during our adventures that day - couldn't eat them there at the buffet, was too stuffed!!  Really loved my dinning experience here!!

dTDWckHWIbf90oczgUC4cA.text: Food is below ok. I didnt know what to eat because food didnt look good and it didnt taste good. You can save your money for somewhere else

_UKb-mP4gCdkjMFrURf0dQ.text: Wow. Talk about disappointing!! We tried to go once, but the line was ridiculous, so we tried a different day hoping that it would be mind blowing. It was not!  BAD: EVERYTHING looked soaked in oil. The veggies were in butter baths. The pastas had pools of oil seeping in where ever you scooped it out. The fish (surprisingly NOT in oil) was so hard my fork couldn't even penetrate the meat. The buffet was slammed packed and I saw them constantly bringing out new food, but that was just as bad as the old stuff. A lot of it looked like it was made ealy in the morning and then stored under a heat lamp until dinner time.  GOOD: The prime rib was surprisingly good (the horseradish not so much) and the crepes were really good.   If you get dragged there stick to the savory and sweet crepes. The rest is a disappointment. Or better yet go to the WORLD CARNIVAL BUFFET at the Rio, that one never disappoints..

K1-gn4mjNJoEwndDwoniRg.text: Where to begin?  How about at the beginning.  The organization of the seating/line situation is abhorrent.  It took half an hour for about 25 people to be processed and seated.  There are two problems with solutions right there.    One: Suggest to customers buying the 24 hour dining pass (great deal, by the way) that for an upcharge they can bypass the line so as to avoid the lengthier processing line since all they have to do is get scanned.  You make money, we don't get stressed before a meal.  This is a "french" restaurant, right?  The stress should be in the back of the house.  Two: Maybe have, oh, I don't know, a HOSTESS to seat and a SERVER to fill drinks?  Or have a soda/juice/coffee station for customers to get themselves beverages?  If you trust people to carry their own plates, why not trust them to carry their own cups?  Having a willy-nilly seating arrangement with three or four ladies to seat guests and immediately get them their drinks makes absolutely no sense at all.    One more thing in terms of running this shin-dig, and this is not a problem with just Le Village Buffet alone.  WHY.  WHY is breakfast served until 11?  WHY?  This is Vegas, right?  Famous for late nights and breakfast buffets.  So, tell me why you encourage guests to stay up late gambling and then do not reward them for their hard work by allowing them to sleep and get up for a lovely brunch?  Obviously, you should not stop serving breakfast, but perhaps should begin to add lunch items around noon and phase out things like omelets and bacon around that time too.  11 is unacceptable.  What is this, prison?  And another thing!  What is going ON back there?  With a French theme, I would expect some technically superior food.  Come on, chief!  What are y'all DOing back there?  Southern style corned beef hash, biscuits with gravy, stale bread (bread, of all things!) limp, overcooked pasta, uninspired eggs benedict wherein someone lost control of their hot sauce holding hand, and finally, crepes that were far, FAR too thick.  Wait, also the desserts were badly executed.  Creme brulees were torched like nine hours ago and did not crunch but the custard was good. No finesse, no sense of intention or dedication or grace or communication.  I tasted confusion and lack of organization.  The complete opposite of what I expect from a True french cook.  The best thing there besides the salad bar was the quiche, and I suspect it came frozen out of a package.  Get. It. Together. Chief.  Seriously.   And management.  Where is your business sense?  Really.

pxBKQ47IGq82g6RvUFo_9A.text: Wow not good... Dessert wasn't worth the $40 a plate! Mac and cheese was the best thing I tasted. Not much was labeled had to figure out what the food was and no plates. Very disappointing!!

hqgICbc4T_p_z77PvM2lHA.text: By far, this is the best buffet in Las Vegas. I have been to all the others but this one takes top place in my book for breakfast.   The best thing about this buffet is the crepe bar. They have basic to moderate ingredients that makes starting the day with a nutella, banana, and bacon crepe simply great.   If sweet breakfast is not your thing then try hitting up the savory brunch options. In the hour between breakfast and lunch they start to bring out lunch options which is an added bonus if you're looking for more savory dishes.   If there is still room for dessert try one of each of the pastries. You're in Vegas you have to live a little.   The service is a mixed bag at times but overall it's a fun time.   Fun note: Even though you're in the "Paris" Casino you will not find anyone in the Le Villiage Buffet that speaks French. Using my Spanish has gotten me better service and food options.

hq9YRDRqU831hwCHAqhZKw.text: This is a good buffet with a variety of foods and flavors. I liked their savory and sweet crepes, but I think they're a little overrated.   My favorite item at this buffet was the sirloin. Though the bacon slab was delicious, too.  Service was very good. Especially considering it's a buffet. And the long lines at the register moved pretty fast.

ULMPsg-VaIb4v3vMyd4iEw.text: We have been coming here for years but it seems to have gone down in quality and attention to detail over the last couple years. The service was nice and restaurant was clean. However, There is no more flare at Paris' buffet. I think I'd have more opinions at a Golden Corral. It's nice for a person not expecting much but basic options and some crepes but if you expect more, skip Paris. It was well after 2 and they still had breakfast options when Brunch was scheduled for the day. They also didn't pay much attention to restocking empty food dishes. I'm also a little peeved that they assembled the macaroons top to bottom instead of bottom to bottom. I mean it may seem small and insignificant but it IS a Paris themed restaurant, right...  I think the buffet of buffet pass is a great option but I'd rather pay a little more than to have these staple locations decline in options and service.

uONxmDMjo0bd7_UXagkd3w.text: This is a nice buffet, but the crab legs were not that great. The macaroni and cheese were delicious. Their prime rib is served rare to medium rare. Crepes are delicious! They have great service but some of the food quality could improve

8IfY5xbNyQV6prBzXIY1yQ.text: The crab legs were frozen before.  The quality of food was poor.  It was crowded with a long line.  The food and atmosphere are not worth the wait.

E892dPNog_ZZ6v19MH05GA.text: Used to be one of the best buffets in town...Now it's just meh.  We were disappointed with the quality of food compared to how it once was.  I wish they would charge more and serve the quality of food that they use to.

yJVhau_EpZgSOVNnAfLRRQ.text: Used to be a good buffet not anymore..  golden coral has more selection than this dump. No seafood, no soup, no Asian or Mexican food. Not even American food. Pretty much your paying to eat prime rib and macaroni and maybe some chicken and mash.. the selection is just horrible, well not be going back

7A3WEzaTU2X43u2JshaErQ.text: I love breakfast food, so I like coming here for brunch. I've been to other (more expensive) buffets on The Strip for brunch, but Le Village Buffet has actually become my favorite.  The ambiance is pretty & cozy. It reminds me of the set of Beauty & The Beast (which is probably another reason why I like this place so much).  For brunch, they have a wide selection of breakfast items along with lunch/dinner items such as crab legs & prime rib. I love how they have a crepe station (although there's typically a line), and they serve endless mimosas.  Servers can be hit & miss, but typically, our servers have been good. The managers are super awesome tho, & they always make sure we're well taken care of.  Downside, woman's bathroom only has 1 stall for the entire buffet. I'm not sure why they planned it this way as there's always a line in the ladies bathroom.  Other than that, food is worth the price & I always leave this place happy & fully stuffed!

McbEYmb42SEiC16HvCs3zQ.text: Awful dinner selection. Cold, gel like crab legs. Salad section for example was three types of lettuce with dressing choices. No toppings. Desserts left much to be desired and looked like they were prepared 3 days prior. Very lack luster and over priced. Worst buffet I've been to.

4FQjA6ZWWuKKUNuxc_GZmQ.text: Mediocre at best for breakfast buffet.   As many iterations of potatoes as you can imagine.   Eggs Benedict were hard hockey pucks with a quarter sized dollop of Hollandaise.    Service in the morning was barely there with zero greeting or follow up after I was seated.    No need to check this one out.

gsoT1I38hulYaWlEdrIHgA.text: We had not yet had lunch so came in for an early dinner buffet very hungry. The food was very disappointing. Everything was under seasoned and had no flavor. The crab legs were tasteless. The meats looked dry, so my husband and I both passed on the roast beef and turkey. I could not eat the clams or muscles. What was enjoyable was the sushi. We sampled a variety of desserts and were disappointed with all of them with the exception of the Berry French crepe, the crepe was delicious. All in all not worth the $31 dinner price.

p2y7gvS2U8SRpqmw1ZpgJw.text: Seriously the best breakfast buffet in Vegas! We were so please with this place! First off, this place is located in one of the paris themed hotels, so as you are walking to get here, you pass all these stores and pastries shops that are look like the buildings in Paris. There can be a long line to get in, which there was when we went, but the line moved so quick. I think we waited maybe 5 - 10 minutes. Once we got our table we went straight to the buffet. OMG everything was amazing! The make your own omelette station was my personal fave. I am so picky with omelettes and the guy who made mine did so good! They have an assortment of typical breakfast food like eggs, bacon, sausage then they have a straight breakfast pastry section on their buffet and everything was so fresh! I was so please. When my husband and I decide to come back, we will be come back here for sure!

Pd7zH6UWACBUSuhsPcbzug.text: You have to come here if you're in Vegas. Bottomless mimosas and buffet for only $30! Such good food. Cute environment. If you can try and get Kaye as your server she is the sweetest and the best! Definitely a new must when we come to Vegas!

PyC8eYArMaSj-lZUBYE9xA.text: Definitely has taken a huge decline over the years. Shocked at the lack of quality and selection. None of the meats were fresh, the sides were random and most all were carbs. The salad selection was minima and not replenished. The desserts weren't even labeled correctly. It appeared as though the day starts off ok then they start consolidating and the food sits around a long time and they shuffle things around. We were there at 5pm for dinner you would think everything would be hot and fresh??  It wasn't. They offer a Groupon, but I still don't think it's worth the cost.

jUZeOS5ahGGJrDmpmkhj5g.text: It was the best.  Excellent food, excellent service you couldn't have gotten anything better.  Groupon offers a special for 2 and 4 people.  Well worth the money for it.  Lots of different food from crab legs to crapes.  I suggest you save room for dessert.

hNcntIRmdOaoaNKmovOLTQ.text: Been dying to try the breakfast cause ive heard everyone rave about how amazing it is. . . Was thoroughly disappointed.   The dinner was actually far better. The crepe makers actually took the time to make them correctly unlike the morning crepe masters.  The macaroons were delicious.  The duck deli meats were good.  In any case I won't be back here for any buffet other than dinner.

GnaDFSI67E87FP4AqlwRCg.text: Breakfast here was amazing. Crepes are delicious. I would definitely tell people to go for breakfast. I also went here for dinner night before, the prime rib was amazing. It melts in your mouth. I was disappointed with there crab legs. But they had lots of choices. If they had good crab I would go there for dinner again.

Until then, Cheers! ~ :p

KYzFqU02CXuit5_dXxoqag.text: Not sure what happend to this place but quality of the food just went south! Used to love this place and the variery of selections it used to offer. Came here for dinner last night and it was so disappointing. Food was dry, minimal selections, staff serving the food were miserable. Crab legs looked like left overs, prime rib was over cooked. Sushi had 2 options, salmon roll with hard rice or veggie rolls that looked really sad. Even desserts did not taste good at all. Not sure how u ruin desserts but they did. Quite disappointing. Save your money and eat elsewhere.

G5D57ctoZJC3jDkaqxgNCA.text: No. No. No. And...no. Our cups had dried food on it. The stacks of plates had like large amounts of food in between them. The woman serving us drinks had the worst stank face. We sat inside the area where the utensils/napkins were being rolled. She rolled her eyes, gave a "whatever" and got our drinks. She only became nice when it came time for tips. All we wanted was water and orange juice. Nothing special. Interesting thing was, all the tables she was assigned to had complaints about her attitude. Crazy right? Yes it is a buffet and service is minimal but wow her customer service was THAT terrible. It was to the point where the table next to us asked us for spoons.   OMG and the food. We liked the fresh tomatoes and potatoes. Nothing else. The meats were dry and the desserts were a joke. Why does the pie taste like something fermented?? No wonder this buffet is part of the 24-hr buffet deal. Not worth the money or time.

FkAnsnOsOuf4Duz1llBUqw.text: My first time eating here and I really enjoyed the food. Most of all I would like to thank Roxane for the great job and service she gave us i will never forget her. She wasn't our waitress at first but she came to help when our waiter never came to help us she didn't hesitate to ask what we needed and was quick to help thanks again Roxane. Then there is Cindy who was a manager on duty I spoke with her about Roxane a she was quick to answer about how great of an employee Roxane was an said great things about Roxane to me that is great customer service thanks again to the both of them.                                                                      A very happy customer

Ri8u6uUi8QXE-NsJdI7e2g.text: We came for breakfast and were not disappointed. They have a large selection of foods and everything I had was good. I enjoyed the layout of the buffet itself. The feeling of being in a little French village was cool.

03j4qHgRvyx05K4o6iBDLw.text: I went to Le Village buffet on Sunday May 1st 2016, I arrived at the buffet shortly before closing time where I was made aware by the hostess that I would only have 45 minutes to eat. I find it to be extremely frustrating that they rushed me for my $31.99 buffet. I should have had an unlimited amount of time if not atleast an hour. How are you supposed to enjoy everything a buffet has to offer in 45 minutes? Ridiculous.  I quickly began getting as much food at the buffet to ensure that I could try everything there was to offer. I was extremely dismayed whenever I realized that the dinner rolls were not kept in warmers nor was their honey butter. The dinner rolls we're terrible quality I've had much better dinner rolls at Ryan's Buffet or Golden Coral Buffet which are both about $20 cheaper.   Another item that I tried was the sirloin steak. The steaks were terrible quality, did not taste good at all and for a $30 buffet you couldn't even order a steak medium rare they were all well done. While chewing the steak I tried to gather what the taste reminded me of and I soon realized that it tasted like a hot dog. I was not pleased with the quality of steak nor was I pleased with the quality of prime rib.   Whenever it got time for dessert I was really excited because I had been saving room to ensure that I would be able to try everything on the dessert section of the buffet. I love bread pudding and it is always one of my go-tos at buffets and the bread pudding at Le Village buffet was not good at all. I've had much better at every other buffet I've visited and I've been to a lot of buffets.   I would say that the mashed potatoes and gratin potatoes along with macaroni and cheese along with alfredo pasta was good, yes I tried them all. They still did not make up for the price point and had me in the bathroom thirty minutes later.  As an avid buffet eater I've learned before purchasing buffet to ask the hostess if I can take a look at whats out. I normally do this whenever I visit a new buffet, but I did not do that this time, I wish I would have because it would have saved me money because i wouldnt have gotten the buffet.

PjD_SkdCpUiBny-73hai_Q.text: Sad that I had to drop off a star because of the poor staff.   Our waiter, a man named Galo, gave my husband and I the stink eye as we were shown to our table. It was obvious enough that I noticed it even before anything else happened. When seated, our table already had two pitchers on it, one I assumed was coffee and one with tea. My husband went to the crepe stand and I started to try to pour my coffee. I noticed that only a tiny trickle would come out into my cup. I tried to unscrew the lid of the pitcher  so that more coffee could come out easier- a totally normal thing to do. Galo rushed to my table and literally ripped the pitcher out of my hands saying "No No No!!!" I just stared at him, not understanding what was going on. He looked at me angrily and said, "OK you want coffee, what else do you want?!?" I was so startled and I said well I guess water and I know my husband will want juice. He walked away but while he was less than a full table away, he said "please...!" In a tone of voice that told me he was annoyed that I hadn't said it.  I don't appreciate it. That meal was expensive and I don't deserve to be treated like that for absolutely no reason. Why did Paris sit us at a table with a used up carafe of coffee? Gross. Why did this man pull it out of my hands??  Why give me intense attitude when I answered his question politely? Not cool. While I love the food here, I can't afford to pay to be treated so poorly. There are other options.

2BQM9LS2lV7y6UEXpl3aiQ.text: We came for DINNER: the food is high end to me, pastas, meats, sea foods and it was decent to me. I wouldn't come again but a good one time experience. The desert wasn't all that either. The view is nice though...  I recommend RIO BUFFET I go to a lot of buffets that one is my number one

I-HzPRuhPzb1d1z1FiD2yg.text: Date & Time:  Saturday December 5, 2015 @ 8pm Location:  Paris Hotel Dining Companions:  Sister-in-Law, Brother-in-Law, Nieces, Nephews, Mommy & Husband Scene:  Hefty Tourists in SweatShirts & Uggs Decor:  Buffet Stations Representing 7 Provinces of Paris Service:  Efficient Devour:  French Onion Soup, Macarons, Steak Total:  $357

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NbNWs9rRPiJaQxSjoDwT6w.text: Le Village Buffet in the Paris Hotel & Casino was pretty decent!  Not my favorite buffet of all time or even favorite buffet in Las Vegas, but I was still pretty satisfied with my meal.  The food was fresh, the service was friendly, and there was a good variety of foods.  This buffet has a unique structure - it has different stations corresponding with different regions / themes in France, which I thought was pretty cool.    I especially liked the omelette bar and was not disappointed with my savory pesto omelette.   I also really liked their fresh salad bar, which had some excellent options.  Their steak was also delicious.   What I was actually pretty disappointed in was their dessert section. I mean, c'mon, this is Paris right?  I was expecting some amazing pastries, but they came up short and mostly just had macarons (which I don't eat).  Other than that, I have no complaints about the food.  The wait in line was a bit annoying, but you can find some amazing deals through GroupOn, so check it out.  The three of us got in for the price of 2.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory pesto crepe.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waiting in line for crepes.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The decor.

N4gk-vnTsM5ed9a17TmMNQ.text: Definitely one of my favorite buffets in Las Vegas. Did the buffet of buffets package. The food was very fresh and well cooked. The crepe station was absolutely amazing, their sweet and savory options were both delicious!  The desserts were really great, especially the flan and creme brulee! I would certainly come here again :)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Savory food variety :)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of desserts :)

Qla0K8iNokcWLgEIXsOtNw.text: What happened to this place? It's just sad. It was my favorite buffet so I was so excited to be able to enjoy it again. It was horrible and nothing like how I remembered it.   Let's start with cleanliness and service... 1. My cup of water was so dirty. There were white things all over the inside.  2. Lipstick on my napkin 3. I couldn't find the French cheese section so I asked the person in charge on the station and he told me "I don't know. I just got here?" And then after he figured it out, he showed me a bucket of shredded cheese.   Now food. 1. Soup station was messy and cold 2. This is a French buffet without warm baguette bread.  3. There was a random sushi station.  4. They got rid of their cheese platter and cold cuts.   I guess I also expected more considering it was New Years and we paid holiday price.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sausages were very salty
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold and messy soup station
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The shredded cheese they pointed to when I asked them for French cheese section

1cbjBJgmd_2np5HMAAeG1w.text: The food was ok but not the greatest. My prime rib had a layer of tough gristle and was cold. Plus the server was pretty rude. I expected more for $40 a person.

GF5v4oTCNY6G8VeFEu_jvQ.text: Simply awful. When they first opened, it was a great buffet with fresh food and a great selection. It's been progressively getting worse every year and we stopped going. We had a misfortune of going there for dinner on Thanksgiving. Big mistake . We only went because my mother in law really wanted to go . We were in line from 6:30 pm to 8:40 pm. Over 2 hours to eat the mediocre overpriced fare. They had a very limited selection of food, tiny shrimp and super salty low quality crab legs . Their great desserts were not so great either , no eclairs and just a few variations. This buffet should coat no more than 15.99 a person and certainly not 40.00 Never again.

CyNfdC8WxHOEbJzyD_fljg.text: Dinner experience last night ,  Stood 10 minutes in line (when many tables were vacant...  But I understand the marketing strategy,  line makes a place looks busier...)  paid the 32 something dollars (with tax) and was escorted in to a table,  food selection and freshness was great,  to much to list, everything you can think of,  breads,  meat,  chicken,  fish salads and desert but the drinks were horrible,  so dialuted with water that it is better to just  order water... Ordered an orange juice (water...)  asked (the very kind yet way too busy waitress)  for diffrent (apple)  juice,  got the apple juice real fast bit again was tasting like water,  for the high price of the buffet meal and the line I would expect you guys to serve better beverage who will go better with your well made food. If not the drinks I would have given 4 stars rating  at least.

XD4tzIvF8Y8vxwg6x3w8Jw.text: I'm not a fan of buffets at all, but decided to join friends to Paris' buffet. Heard it was good for brunch, but we got there for lunch on a Friday. Before noon, the line was fairly long, but it went by pretty quickly. If you have a Total Rewards card, you get $1 off, which equals to about $20 a person.   We were seated in the back, and our drink orders were taken. Sodas, juices, and coffee is unlimited. The buffet area does look very Disneyland-esque as others had mentioned. Selections varied from salads, meats, French inspired food, and of course, the crepe station.   Was really dissapointed that there wasn't a vast array of cheeses and breads as I had expected, although towards the end of our stay, they did put out some cheeses, but they were very typical kinds. Most of their food was not flavorful, and choices were limited. My favorite was the ham and cheese quiche, but it was comparable to the frozen ones you can find at Costco. Saved room for the crepes, and they have about 4 sweet choices and 4 savory. The line is usually long and we waited about 20 minutes. Luckily you can choose up to 2, and they make it really quick.   I seemed to have gotten the crepe maker that didn't really care as I could see him burning the crepes and not paying attention. My sweet crepe had candied walnuts, and my savory had spinach, mushrooms, etc. Can't remember all the ingredients, and he must've forgotten as instead of bechamel, he poured powdered sugar all over the top and had to make it all over again. Both were not memorable at all.   Overall, we all agreed this place is whatevers, and wouldn't return.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More quiche
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quiche was my favorite

d6VLuF9Gd17Aa0CTKPLkxA.text: $23.99 a person may seem a little steep - but all you can eat crab legs, shrimp, freshly-made crepes and lox make the bill just a little easier to swallow. The crab legs are fat, pre-split and full of sweet, fresh meat (from brunch time onward). Oh, and you get all-you-can-drink mimosas to help wash down all that rich food!

zXTc2BBMP5H9avcMpKq5rw.text: The worst buffet in Vegas. Pay the extra $20 and go across the street to bellagio or Caesars palace instead. Very minimal selections. All they had were a few pasta dishes, soup, veg, clams, 2 kinds of fish, sushi, 1 beef option, 1 chicken dish & 1 porky dish. There's also salad, cheese & cold cut meats. The best part of the buffet was the dessert. Would not recommend this place to anyone. The worst buffet I've tried in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only thing worth eating here

HcIzP7aY6d0KUGoUXgaXbw.text: The food was better than expected.  The people were really friendly.  And the atmosphere was ok too.  The only drawback is the price.  $33.00 per person (kids 8 and under are less) seems like a lot but then again you can eat all you want.  I had some eggs Benedict and even a small omelette (the guy making the omelettes was awesome) plus lots of sides and fruit and it was all really good.  We even loaded up on desserts (we took some out with us so don't tell anybody) and they were all really good too.  Not sure I would ever need to eat here again but it was a nice experiences and if you're in the mood for a buffet with lots of great food then I would definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

o-ujus6q-Y7g5oKuyZ_E4w.text: Like most Vegas buffets recently, this one has gone down a bit in quality but I think it's still good and worth it. Definitely good for lunch at $31 each. Some of the best ice cream and bread pudding that I've ever tasted!  The sides are great and the meats are decent but can be kinda dry from the heat lamps. The preopened crab legs are small but there's plenty of them.

RKHEkxSIsnBrSYn8PbJ1Aw.text: We did the weekend champagne brunch. Highlight was the crepe station (both savory and sweet crepes). Other notable dishes were prime rib, crab, and truffle mac and cheese. The buffet's dining room has seen better days (it's a tad bit too dark but still has those cool Parisian details). The staff were very nice, but the food was nothing to write home about. This buffet is def not in the same tier as the upper echelon of Vegas buffets. It's about the same price as the upper tier buffets, but gives you mid tier quality. For example, there's no ice cream/gelato at the dessert station. Most of the upper end buffets also have live cooking stations so food is fresher. Paris had the usual cooked food under heat lamps. For the price, I would recommend going to Bellagio, Aria, Cosmo, or spending a little bit more and going to Caesars or Wynn.

_7VqQWxsKjzjbXFmV35Y5Q.text: I usually LOVE going here whenever I'm in Vegas but today was a different story. I came for breakfast with my boyfriend and within the last hour, the power went out in Paris while we were in line. At first we were like okay, that's weird. The hostess in front stated that has never happened before. Within minutes, power came back off then turned off again. This kept happening more than a handful of times while we were waiting in line still. We finally got seated, and mind you, the power kept going on and on when we were getting food and eating. Everyone had their phones out using their light to eat and walk around. Had only one plate of food, the food was cold, and they couldn't make food because the gas was out. And I am so disappointed because all I wanted were the crepes because I kept bragging about it..   I know it isn't the casino's fault but the reason behind me giving them two stars is because management and staff didn't acknowledge the problem. With it being a major issue like that, you would at least think they would apologize for the inconvenience to their paying guests and explain the situation, which they didn't. Please work on your management and staff if any problems occur like this one.

LFaNZvm0S_W4oynW0QuC_g.text: I normally don't do buffets, but you can't usually go wrong when it's breakfast. At this particular buffet in Paris Hotel, they had a long line for regular customers and no wait for platinum, diamond, or seven stars total rewards members. Which is awesome because platinum doesn't usually get the same special treatment as diamond and seven stars. Since I am platinum I took advantage of this opportunity!  The food was good, better than a typical buffet. They had seven different stations of food including a ham carving station which you don't typically see for breakfast. It was very good. I also enjoyed some eggs, biscuit, shrimp, and grits. Plenty for all tastes to enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

P_2ertzRNX3-6lbA1LS7Pw.text: Buffett inside Paris Hotel across from Bally's. We just missed the breakfast buffet which looked like it would've been worth it. So, we settled in on lunch ($25) and would agree with most that the seafood selection was subpar. Although, there were many choices and selections not many seemed appetizing. Overall, the selection was fine, but not what I would've expected for a premier hotel like Paris. Then again, it did feed the hunger after a hangover night!

4zDsykyRWZEI5arxSK2A7g.text: I am not a fan of buffets. So why in the world would I have chosen to go to one? Because on this (rare) occasion, Yelp let me down. The reviews said this was different, that the food was fresh and the ambiance unique. The food was not good - or even hot in some instances.  The workers behind the buffet tables were sullen. While the European village decor was a nice idea, it's not enough to make you forget you're being served slop. Our server was sweet, but I ended up paying $80 to spit food into a napkin twice from disgust.

HD2ODb00kXC_BW6sKXTfXg.text: I was so disappointed with their dinner buffet. The chef making the Crepes (which is the main reason I choose Le Village Buffet) had attitude and she just threw the crepe on my platter. The food did not look fresh and there was little variety.   So disappointed. If i go back, I will probably to brunch, as food seems fresh and the staff on the morning shift is friendlier.

yytjruw4TdVaIouhDtwDeA.text: Large wait times. Food getting over, 1+ hr wait for the crepe after you're in, small dessert selection, slow service.

uET1BWuBv9Ct3r0LjgY5Fg.text: [late post of 02.22.15] only came here to grab lunch since fam had some comps...long a$$ line for a reg buffet, but i worked my nettie magic to get line cuts ;-) ...  ambiance: 4 stars only thing going for them is the kool village setting...feels like u r eating seated on the streets of france (tho i've nvr been, yet).. w/ charming buildings, blue skies & clouds above...  food: 2 stars barely ok...meats, like prime rib, were dry & tough...even more than most buffets... they had crab legs, which i can alwaz grub on...but how can u go wrong w/ boiling frozen legs & providing drawn butter?...  low quality overall esp. aftr being to MUCH better ones!...i'd spend more & go to one of the top 2 newer buffets w/ grand selections, nom nom & wOw presentations...Bacchanal @Caesars (if u don't mind waiting) or Wicked Spoon @Cosmo (no wait)...  well, this would be what my chinese fam calls a "good deal" tho cuz it is part of the "Buffet of BuffetS" 24hr AYCE pass! ($54.99 to 5 locays, add supplement for another 2)...reg. $20.99-32.99, depending on day & time, just for this 1 anywaz...  p.s. takes opentable reso

i7uaEyRecAGBcF3BcbTcCQ.text: Was very excited to read the great reviews. Was completely disappointed. For $30+ I expected more than 3-4 stations with no French cuisine except for a crepe station. Wish we would have gone some place else.

Le81lUPqgATa1UpiZEqiFg.text: This review is for the buffet located in the Paris Hotel Casino, it can be pretty pricey to eat here since there are different prices for Breakfast/Lunch/Dinner and those prices are subject to change during holidays as well.  I waited in line about 20 minutes for dinner and around 2 minutes for breakfast so please be aware the waiting times do vary.  The food in my opinion for dinner is definitely top 5 for Vegas buffets, large selection of meats (Prime Rib, Roast, Sausages, Chicken, Pork, Duck, Lamb) fish (Shrimp, Crab legs, Mussels, Clams, salmon) and a variety of french dishes and pasta.  Please be aware the this place gets packed on weekends and holidays, so wait times for drinks etc. can be lengthy, the staff was very helpful and courteous during my meal.  For Breakfast they pretty much cover everything under the sun as well, it opens at 7am so if you get there around 8am, you should be okay.  There wasn't as large of a selection of fresh fruits as I would like for a breakfast buffet, but the rest of the items made up for it.  Definitely try a cut of bacon with your eggs, they have the normal type bacon, but where the prime rib cutting station is, they have a huge slab of bacon, freshly cut and thick.  I would definitely recommend this buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Slab of bacon at the Prime Rib station, with canadian bacon also.  A must have for Breakfast.  Bacon!! :)

_cC8G-0qfiVMmrt2r24YYw.text: I don't really get the low ratings at all... we were absolutely in love with this place!  We did the 24-hour buffet of buffets and we liked the food here so much we came here for lunch AND brunch.  I don't understand people's complaints about lack of selection... how much food do you need?!? They had pretty much every kind of protein (fish, beef, pork, shellfish) and several different types of starches and vegetables.  Personally, I loved the Brussels sprouts.  My favorite - by FAR - was the omelette station.  Yummy!! The crepe station was pretty great, too.  My husband loved the crab legs.  The unlimited mimosas for brunch was a nice added bonus.  All the food was really flavorful...none of that bland other crap we had at some other buffets.  While a little corny and "Disney-ish", I actually really enjoyed sitting in the little village that they created inside Paris.  It was cute.  There was a line for the buffet, but not as long as at some of the other buffets we saw (like Caesar's) and it moved fairly well.  I think we stood in line for 20 minutes, which for a Saturday at 10:00am really wasn't bad.  There was no line at all when we came for lunch on Friday.  I would highly recommend this buffet!!

TzW2LGQRBvurWtQHdt77dw.text: - Good buffet from the Buffet of the Buffets list, I enjoyed that.  I wish I did go for dinner though instead of lunch.  The mimosas did hit the stop for early afternoon- Loved it. Breakfast food is what sold me here.    -  The french toast was really good too, two different types of sausage there-tasted excellent as well.  I sampled a bit of everything and like I said, it was nice to finally eat some BREAKFAST food, compared to any other meals that me and the group had been eating lately.  Since I had this deal for 24 hours of buffets, this was a place to try, NO COMPLAINTS HERE.  Loved the fresh fruits and the pasta was even good too.  LUNCH buffet is normally $20 plus tax,  It is maybe somewhere I would not come again but nice to go even at least this one time.  I loaded up on bacon and potatoes on my plate as well, hash browns were money also to eat.  Check this one out, especially if you have this deal.

Wc_7Kj1txuSYbLI4lrIDCg.text: Definitely not the most fantastic buffet I have been to in Vegas, but it did the trick on a Sunday afternoon with some buddies and a Groupon. $45 for 2 to eat with all you can drink adult beverages. That was a great thing.. but the buffet itself left alot to be desired.   The layout of the space is so clumsy and awkward that you are shoved into back corners of the place.. we actually had a table IN THE WALKWAY of the back room we were seated in. It's not so comfortable. On top of it all, there was no selection of 'Asian-Style' food.. no sweet and sour, no tempura anything.. and really not alot of selection overall.   The main thing that saved this dining experience is that they have a crepe counter. Both savory and sweet crepes.. they are a great addition to the pretty weak selection. I say give it a try for that reason, and if you can get a deal. Happy Eating!

qMF_xOHRziwoezelCMizWw.text: We got the 24 hour buffet pass.  We ate at Paris, Planet Hollywood, and Harrah's.  Paris, hands down, was the best!!!  The ambience alone is worth the trip.  The other two reminded me of eating at an old country buffet or a Denny's. But Paris made you feel like you were in France.  The food was fantastic! We had the afternoon brunch and enjoyed made-to-order crepes, creme brulee that was out of this world, and a couple pastas that were very good. We didn't get it, but you could get all-you-can-drink mimosas for $12 per person. And right now there is a Groupon 2 for one and a bottle of wine included for $30ish.    We loved eating at Paris, would definitely go back again.

Mwrk4jnjcrhyZVCEszT8jw.text: After the debacle at Excalibur's buffet, this one was a welcome change. The eggs managed to stay moist even as they were switching over to lunch fare. I suspect the use of cream of some variety. The mini Eggs Benedict impressed me the most. I figured if it had been sitting out a while, the egg would have been seriously overcooked. Again, not sure how they pulled it off, but the egg was still runny. Well done. I also sampled chocolate croissants, mini pancakes, and a macaroon of some variety.  The only annoying thing was they didn't let you get your own drinks. I was literally chewing ice waiting for another round because I was so thirsty. For reference, I hate ice in my drinks, much less chewing on it. We only had to wait a few minutes to be seated, though the drinks took much longer to come out.  The decorations were fun. It did feel like you were sitting in a cafe somewhere in Paris enjoying a meal.

bkbwgrZM5eDhnoSk-qZ1pg.text: We did the "Buffet of Buffets", and this was our first stop, and man, was it worth it! Just the Crepes alone made our day, we went 2 times for breakfast, we loved the Crepe station, the first day we ordered the Sweet kind, and the second day, we had the savory ones, wow!!  Delicious!  All the stations had something really good to offer, like the omelet stations, the meats and deli, sausages, bacon, you name it!!  All kinds of preparation for potatoes: roasted, a la Dauphinoise, scalloped, fried, mashed, etc! Salads, sweets, loved the dessert presentations!! Gotta try it!

AavALaL8zV6IscFweG1qXA.text: It's aiiiite.  I came here for Saturday brunch.  Someone else paid for my meal,  didn't have to wait in line, and drank bottomless mimosas, but I was STILL not impressed.  Perhaps it's the "buffet theory."  What's that, you ask?  Well my theory is that buffets, even the best ones, might have a few stellar menu items, but overall everything is mediocre or just whatevs.  This wasn't my first time at the Le Village buffet, but each time I go, nothing really wows me.  I'm not saying that it's bad.  Eggs were eggs.  Sausages. Waffles.  Typical stuff. The only thing that stood out was that they offered to bring our made-to-order omelettes to the table so that we don't have to wait in line.  That was cool.  Ambiance is nice.  Looks like you're eating outside in a small French village.   I would go back, but of all the places to eat in Vegas, this is not in my "must eats."

aFxjXdbR49xLaaDM73v1BA.text: By far my favorite buffet I've been to on the strip! $25 and all you can drink for $11.99. The food was so great! We went for lunch and they still had some breakfast items. Our waitress was attentive and the staff making the food was friendly. Crepe station was the best! I love the dessert area, so many awesome choices! We'll be back!

A9UEwjzgmNRlMu4qcJzHUA.text: Very disappointed in this place, cold food, server only came by once during our entire meal. They put us in his tiny awkward room with about 4 other couples it was dead silent and it smelt terrible. I would not recommend this place to any family or friends.

7XrsLWv2pJrCpJDmHv1WYA.text: I guess I'm not a huge fan of buffets HOWEVER this one is notably better than most of the buffets in Vegas, and here's why. The food selection AND quality are up to par.  Doesn't have that metallic or plastic taste like if it came from the bottom of a freezer.  The pasta with truffle sauce was absolutely amazing.  For me, of course, the drawback was the price but I personally like spending no more than $20 for an amazing lunch meal.  The other drawback were the crepes.  Now the dessert ones are great, from what I heard.  The meal crepes, however, can use some improving.  The chef asked me to wait a little longer for the cheese to melt inside the crepe which I thought was totally fine.  However upon indulgence, the cheese was not warm and not fully melted either.  Think of putting sliced cheese in the microwave then having someone cut the time short because everyone is in a hurry.  Yea, that kind of cheese consistency. Overall it's not too bad, but like I said I'm not a buffet kind of guy, but this did exceed my expectations.

U7CbooTPcOnu1_Fw51V91Q.text: If I could give 5 stars solely for their crepe station I would. However, that isn't the case. Besides the crepes, everything was mediocre. I got tired real quick of everything. Desserts weren't anything special either. I suggest you get a savory crepe and leave some room for a sweet crepe! That's all you need. Our waitress was an older lady who kept forgetting to get us what we asked for or she would not acknowledge us when we called out for her. She is older so I don't want to bash her or anything, but I'd suggest management to really crack down on their employees and remind them the importance of customer service after all you are in the service industry. It's what is expected from your customers. The buffet itself feels a little outdated, but it does lean on the cheaper side in comparison to the others. I still prefer Bacchanal above all or Rio's seafood buffet.

5yW5Y6Is2_m-4lvTyC_eOA.text: My husband and I went here for breakfast. It was good, excellent selection, especially choices of different types of eggs, waffles, crepes, etc. I would not say, that quality was over the top but selection was good, price was reasonable. I would come back again

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice seating areas
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast at le village

RmKY_tt44nbML0srJv9Ang.text: After trying a few buffets at different hotels we decided to try this one. We were surprised by what we found here. The food is overall pretty good and the service is much better than any other buffet we tried (including the more expensive ones)...  Paris is a small, big hotel, in that it's just the right size and is comfortable vs getting lost and walking 10 miles inside to find anything...

eIwa0F_13TvCUYxpUysqUg.text: Eh. This was not a great introduction to buffets in Vegas. It's hard to navigate around, and compared to Bacchanal, it just does not hold up.

cdv502GXszDovYi3Pd2Lyg.text: We had a Groupon voucher (2 for for one - I wouldn't pay full price for this buffet) or the quality of food. When we were sat our table was wobbly, the cabinet for the servers was old and dirty.  The placed looked like it could use a good cleaning.  Compared to other buffets this had a lack of selection.  The prim-rib had a lot of fat.  This was our second time at the Le Village Buffet and I am sure it will be our last.

ssZ99B6KVX7_f95kGw4uBQ.text: Le village buffet is mediocre at best. We witnessed a brown cockroach crawling across the crepe bar and entering the plate dispenser. They seem to not care any longer about quality.  It's just about quantity.

2mY0fE21rZVtHxFMBrj4pA.text: It's all about the crepe station and the dessert section. That's all this buffet has going for it in my opinion. Well, I also thing the atmosphere of the buffet is awesome. you do kinda feel like you're eating in a little French town square.   The food offering here is not only small (very small compared to other casino buffets) but it's also just not all that appetizing. Everything is just bland tasting. Nothing really stands out here and that's a shame.

xuM0PkTrEu0ppZN7tzW1_g.text: I don't usually visit the casino buffets on the strip because I feel like they'd be overly crowded or not worth the prices. But my parents had been to the buffet at the Paris before and were excited to share it with me when I visited them. When we got there I was excited to see the interiir resembled a little village. Definitely something I hadn't seen before. But unfortunately, that's one of the only thing that impressed me.   They had the usual buffet stuff: sushi, shrimp, pasta, pork, turkey, prime rib, roast beef, mac and cheese, assorted vegetables, mussels, rice, etc. But nothing I put on my plate was warm when I got back to the table. I ended up eating room temperature meat and vegetables which was quite a disappointment. When we got around to dessert, the macroos and eclairs were so hard you needed a knife to cut thru them. The only thing I truly savored was the huge banana and Nutella crepe I got.  I guess all in all, I can chalk it up to another experience, but not one I'd care to repeat. This wasn't the worst buffet I've been to in Las Vegas, but it's definitely not one I plan to return to since there are so many other better options around.

rM9TRet5RjhPLswqUh-X4g.text: Not impressed!! Silverware filthy, crepe line took 30 minutes with one guy working two grills...crepes were below average, macaron's all made backwards-guy in pastry thought it was all the same...plus one filling/flavor...one kind boo!!...nothing substantial for vegan options.......wanted to give my 3 kids a great 1st time Vegas buffet experience...FAIL. Geneva, our server was precious and accommodating...one redeeming factor!!

KxDE0Pp0dJKzQNEfgQ6vEQ.text: Kaye is the best waitress at Le Village Buffet she is so sweet and happy. She is so hard working and just beyond sweet! The food here is really good, less options thank some of the other buffet but the food is good quality and everything is delicious

T3ryInccSeBufpKLPinSaA.text: Food was great, atmosphere was lovely.  Everything on menu was delicious.  Price was decent compared to others

bZ5-Zg0T8tgxJ0EGYQmaIQ.text: We went here for breakfast after reading reviews saying this was one of the best breakfast buffet options. It was just okay in my opinion. I liked the theme, but the set up was very congested and it was hard to move around tables. The food was also hard to reach in a lot of areas because it was set so far back and under a low glass cover.  As far as the actual food went, it was typical buffet food. Edible but nothing special. My two favorite things where the french toast made with good thick bread and smoked trout.  Overall, they had a lot of decent breakfast options but I would prefer to go to a normal sit down restaurant. The large number of options doesn't offset the mediocre food.

FmIgzNm0S8vTq_FU3hf6OQ.text: Food selection poor for Sunday brunch.  Dessert bar doesn't have good selection and both counters and glass is very dirty.  Not enough help to keep tables cleaned.  Very disappointed!

HF-Bnj5aUih2i311qjHcEw.text: Terrible!!  Don't waste your money.  The waitress took the 5 dollar tip off the table before she waited on us and never refilled the water glasses.  The roast beef was like shoe leather.   There was no prime rib for 15 minutes.  There were no mashed potatoes for 15 minutes.  When the mashed potatoes did come out they were partly boxed and had chunks of fake potato mix in them.  There were many burned and old food options.  Many things they were out of.  They were out of bananas for the banana nutella crepes.  The cook said the bananas they delivered were green and couldn't be used.  Fast food would have been more satisfying!

NB1rwALnpw9JU03hCJbtyg.text: WOW!  This place has gone downhill! We arrived for dinner around 4pm, there were empty spaces for food, nothing was labeled and the selection was severely lacking.  Definitely not worth the $33.

jN0Yn7PeGR-m3dUxkcKPQA.text: The dinner buffet was lacking in selection this evening. It definitely was not worth the $32.99 price tag.

1wmulF-dWPU7SsvV7Axttg.text: Went there for breakfast buffet and everything was really good tasting the clams were good and the desserts were good too

LGmV1vZix24HbcbA5Evqsg.text: I've never left a buffet hungry, yet here I am.  A lot of food was out, the food the had was bland and gross.  If you look close enough I it's really quite dirty.  Used to go here years ago in its heyday and I'm really disappointed of what it has become.

P-hrZ2lrT8iWuU2AAk7wbw.text: Very surprised. I loved the food, the vegetarian options were amazing and I was able to eat a healthy meal in a buffet setting. Who would have thought.

tNCG9GdAYTGX_Zzmz22rFQ.text: Was ok . The quality used to be better three years ago . You 'll get what you have paid for . Sea food and desserts are better

m0f28Fh5Ys3VWy2kMWNrzg.text: The staff was nice and price was very reasonable. The food was good, too. I liked here because it was very quiet and the wait was very short.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fwJAxu1KWoKKx9OD-52MIA.text: Took my family of 6 ages ranging from 4-16 yrs old.  For the price of $145 it was not worth it.   The quality of food was mediocre, the selection was poor, they didn't ever seem to have enough dinner plates or bowls out and the cleanliness was not deserving of 2 stars.   Save yourself the money and find another place to dine.

hlAW46SlPVTCbjdVanC7Tg.text: Solid buffet and perfect for brunch.  They had stations that make omelettes and crepes. The selection here is pretty good. The service here is also great and attentive!  Good deal if you are doing the buffet pass.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3f_EaTIbHOyO6pzfdTGWRA.text: SAD! So sad!! It's truly a sad, sad situation!! This is our sixth or seventh time returning back to Paris casino La village restaurant. We are never coming back again, sad to say. First they are charging $15 for four-24hours of parking. No validation. But what is worse is their food has gone down hill to where it's not even French anymore. The unique regions aren't unique and food is no better than a coffee shop. No nice rotisserie meat area as that is where the new self serve drink station is. The price for 2 seniors was over $70. Thank goodness for all you can drink beer and wine  for  $13. The only thing really authentic is the crepe station, maybe. Haven't had it yet. Oh yes and NO waitresses! Wow! Everything is Self Service. Well there is a nice  player piano.

hughpiLsGQ1MGwVP-gdRqg.text: This place was beautiful! I fell in love with the art inside and the amount of great food. The crab legs were too salty but everything else was perfect. Glad we got there before the long lines come.

FhxPQJ0psqicpN__1zPRlg.text: We did the Sunday brunch with coffee and Mimosas! I really enjoyed it. I loved the made to order omelet and treated myself to an array of European pastries! Yay! Delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8u49gGrjsD813iRz3c7fdQ.text: Over priced big let down. Luckily I had a groupon cause if I would have paid full price I would have been mad!!

gMfxYRUUQidO9U-7zkQhSw.text: My friends and I were here for lunch and what a beautiful buffet! It looks like something out of the beginning scene of 'Beauty and the Beast'. The food was a wide selection and always being restocked, everything was warm and very tasty. I believe I paid $25 per person which is not bad for a buffet in Vegas in my opinion. I will say the service wasn't that great but it was just beautiful here overall.

NUQD618HTe21yzttnsx9hQ.text: This was the worst buffet in Vegas I have ever been. I asked for wet naps, the server said:"Today they don't have wet naps, nor paper napkins". There was a very old lady (about 75 years old) who cuts prime ribs, cut a very tiny (about 2 bites) prime ribs for me. I asked her for another piece of prime ribs (because the 1st piece was too small) and she gave me a very dirty look. I got in at 8:30 pm, and around 9:00, most of the foods are gone and they started to clean up. By the time I finished the main course (around 9:15 pm), most of the desserts are gone (only a couple cake left). I was very disappointed with the foods and the services. The whole time I was there, the server only stopped by my table 2 times. It's a waste of $36.99 for a Sunday Dinner Buffet. PLEASE DON'T EAT AT THIS PLACE!!!

73ExtRK8WTGbn_D6oZgU9A.text: One of the few buffets I'll eat at in Vegas. The food is decent, but there are several things to consider before choosing to eat here. The line, even when "short", moves excruciatingly slow. I waited an hour to be seated after going inside the entrance. You may show up for breakfast, but by the time you get inside, they may have changed over to lunch. The crepe station is, in my opinion, what makes this buffet worth coming to. However, if a crepe is the main thing you're looking for, there is La Creperie just across the walkway, which is probably a better choice. The service was good, and the food was enjoyable. But, waiting that long to get seated is a challenge.

E1WVlDpfMoEqmC-YDsyB0w.text: There are not much food variety specially sweets, compared with other buffet in the same area

1TTFACWbqw7N7lIv7bZUJQ.text: Let's start with the positive...service was great. The food was a tiny collection and very mediocre. Some of tasted like it's been sitting there so didnt risk the seafood. The potatoes were great and the salad bar. Going to stick to AYCE buffet at Palms...much better and cheaper

X_YvBW6o5L-OMeoKG6UeJA.text: One of my favorite buffets. I've been here many times over the years. Solid and consistent. Good food and decent service.   PRO TIP: You can make reservations!

0mJCRDKeiVzuplW4_vf2Xg.text: This was the second time my husband and I came here for dinner.  As before, there was a good variety of food and dessert options for dinner.  However, the food was on the salty side this time, making for an uncomfortable palate.  The desserts were perfect, and made up for the salty savory dishes

R74BjQ9qpG5B0AUlcefv0Q.text: Le Village was one of the better buffets in Vegas.  Now, the food is average at best and service is adequate for a lower-end establishment.   During my last visit, a server confronted a manager on the floor, walls were stained with food debris and the food selection had decreased dramatically.   So sad to see this place take a downward spiral to the levels of average to below average.  Please turn this around!!!

g-8sagZ-nnBYsExNxuPGzA.text: This restaurant at The Paris hotel is disgusting, the place is very dirty, food at buffet was not marked properly and a very cheap quality of food.  Would never recommend this buffet

Fw7i-uCmbUOPTAVJk7ZMPA.text: This buffet is about what you can expect from most of the buffets in Vegas. Yes, some are better and some are worse, but this buffet falls right in the middle between a must visit and a completely avoid. It's also included in theTotal Rewards Buffet of Buffets, which is a great deal especially if you go to a buffet you don't like because you can just leave and go to another without paying an extra fee.  There is a wide selection at this buffet, like at most buffet's. Its a french theme so even though there is a lot to choose from, there isn't a huge variety like you would get at the Planet Hollywood buffet.   Everything to eat here is decent and really depends on your palate and how the food is prepared that day. The menu of what they serve here hasn't changed in the last four years so they'll probably stick to what they have. Most things to eat are a serious hit or miss and the only real consistent thing I've had are the pastas, which are totally not good for you but really tasty in my opinion. My brother got food poisoning from the crab legs here so I would stay away from them. But honestly it's kind of a rule of thumb that you shouldn't eat shellfish from a buffet anyway.  The desserts here are a complete miss in my opinion. It's a French themed buffet and the macarons are different colors and only come in two flavors which are underwhelming to say the least. Another downside to this place is that there's only one stall in the bathroom so good luck to anyone who has to go during a busy time of day.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r0IPLIcoMKiIWCkeXg7w8g.text: Food was just ok, nothing extraordinary except the crepe. Service needs much improvement.

-90ocG2OhHlRdTwaUrSmLA.text: This buffet is pretty good compared to an average buffet.  They have a good selection of different foods and the dessert was good.   I had crab legs, mac & cheese, mash potatoes, coated tilapia, bisque tomato soup, some pasta and I genuinely enjoyed it. Normally, whenever I attend buffets, it's very mediocre, but it was great :)   It's a french themed so they had macarons & fresh made-to-order (sweet & savory) crepes, and lot of other sweet treats!   One thing that really stood out from my experience here was my server. Unfortunately, I can't remember his name but it's an older Filipino gentlemen. He was so sweet and made my time here enjoyable.  He came back often to check on me and my the rest of my party, and made sure we had drinks and our tables were cleared.   He was so great! If you ever read this, thank you!

7REcVM7yvsic5MUUJ1WBZA.text: Well. I'm a platinum TR member and platinum mlife member. This place pretty much killed me from ever even wanting to stay or eat at a CET resort. Kinda. I'd stay, (not at Paris tho) but I'd be very careful what I eat. I gained platinum in a short time so ya I gamble. And my prize was a free buffet. Wowee. Yuck.   You know that scene in Vegas vacation where they go to that rank buffet? I felt like this. The crepes were ok. Barely. Probably only edible thing. I had the ultimate nerve to ask a woman near crab legs if they could heat them. She yelled ONLY FOR 7 STARS!! (Picture the soup nazi screaming). Wow. Really?  So I actually had my first ever experience with spitting out a dessert. I love my sugar but the flan gagged me. And I'm Texan. We love our flan. This was rotten. Horrible. None of the meat was good. I ate a small salad. Hard to mess that up.   Macaroons. Ok those were exceptional. We were starving and ate like 5 each.   I would not eat here again if it were free. And it was. It is that nasty. Oh and we not once got a single refill on our iced teas. Hubby dropped a fork and we had to get a new one because no one ever bothered to check on us. Avoid.   Ohhh one more thing. We had to walk all the way there and were sent back to TR desk to get the voucher for or fabulous dinner. They accused us of already using it. Lol. We had eaten a 250$ dinner about 40 hrs earlier at BLT. Received the offer about 10pm from TR desk. Was told had to use with in 48 hours. At TR desk poor girl had to beg front desk manager to allow us to use this. He said 48 hrs starts at 6am even thought we got it at 10pm. Please explain that to normal people haha. It was 36 to 49 hrs from time we got it. Who said 6am?  It sounded made up. Then manager of TR desk said "I show you used this at 10 pm night before last" um we had just eaten a 5 course meal at an upscale steak house at 8pm. I can most assuredly say we did not turn around and eat at a buffet in another CET resort. Oink oink.   Very argumentative and very unprofessional. Balding guy. Wouldn't get up from behind this small little window cut out of an office. I felt sorry for his worker who was really sweet. Because of this I will never stay at Paris. I liked Ballys and they seemed proficient. But Paris as a whole really turned us off 100%. I take pics usually. But didn't waste my camera space.

cm9SUVH8h0m5u0fWsnt4YQ.text: Service was great - that is why I gave it 2 stars.  Food was not good.  I think they tried to make things seem french but they you have just kept it simple.   My children wanted crepes so that is why we went.  We would have been better off just getting crepes at Blizz in the Bally's mall next door for dessert and getting In and Out at the Promenade at the Linq.  We stayed at Treasure Island and went to their buffet.  Food was much better, key is they followed the Keep it Simple rule which worked

wgmQk7iirBIedeTWET7dmg.text: Awesome buffet. I love it here. Food is really good, but still "buffet food". Variety is decent with some meats, salad bar, and some "French" options. Have been here every time I come to Vegas and do the buffet of buffets. Really like the atmosphere, just waiting for Belle and her cartoon birds to pop out of one of the windows and start singing. Brings me to a happy place!

xNn3JuMvWU1h1VONj1xbQA.text: We have been going to this buffet for years and it was once one of  the top buffets in vegas. Those days are gone and it's evident by the none existent line that once would wrap out the door. It's been going done in quality for several years but now it has hit  rock bottom. The selection of food is half what it used to be. The meat station was OK. The crepes station was good. The macaroons were good as well. Can't say anything good about anything else there. The quality was low and the selection was minimal. You don't have to take my word for it. The good buffets have long lines. This one has no lines now, but still costs the same as when they had quality food.

wH4TIHbZMTq3tsaMyIhOjA.text: Food was good, service was great.  Le Village Buffet is located in the Paris Hotel, but it can be accessed from Bally's through a tunnel passage between the two hotels.   The line was long on a Tuesday at 10 am. I went to ask one of the staff members if I could move my mom (who's in a wheelchair) close to the entrance instead of lining up. She told me to go to the VIP line next door (VIPs had their own entrance, Woo Hoo). Instead of waiting over an hour, we were seated within 5 minutes =)  Because we were seated pass 10 am I paid the breakfast price ($25 each) for my group but was still there for the meal change to lunch at 11 am. Bonus!! Got to try both breakfast and lunch dishes. Yes!  The highlights for me: Omelette station - custom made. Yum.  Tip: you can also ask them to cook eggs only (sunny side up, over easy, etc etc)   Mussel stew - plump and juicy. Yum.   Clams w/ sausage & basil - my favorite dish of the meal. Great broth and tender clams. Yum!   Lemon meringue & Creme brulee for dessert was delicious!!  Everything else I tried was just okay.  French toast  Shrimp cocktail - not deveined  Smoked salmon  Andouille sausage  Corned beef hash - canned? Soups.   Service for our table was good. Refills and empty plates were handled efficiently.  The lady who told me to go to the VIP line came over to make sure my mom was okay and that I really appreciated.   The food was good. But the service and kindness shown to my mom, I will not forget. I'll definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams w/ sausage &amp; Basil. YUM!!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dolma, Shrimp Cocktail &amp; Mussels (Yum)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled Eggs, Smoked Salmon, Omelette  &amp; Andouille Sausage

2RiHc21RPs-ftjiP1QRQHA.text: I didn't think it was awesome or anything.  The food was ok.  Nothing to rave about.  I did like the "village" atmosphere though.  $45 for 24 hour pass is not bad at all.

ERyErVlvqSZYe0VzByUY-A.text: Mediocre food (similar  to Home Town Buffet) for a VERY expensive price and an extremely long wait in line. The locals might tell you its a 'Nice place for brunch' which is True if you're only going for the venue, but as far as the quality of the food goes, well...just don't do it, you"ll be setting yourself up for disappointment like i did. If its a Vegas buffet your looking for, try Rio's world buffet! its hands down the best buffet Ive ever been to. The food Is great, the service is prompt & the wide selection of food will leave you feeling like a kid in a candy store.

YBbyeSKox-2qcpX1bnEU2Q.text: Lunch was such a disappointment :( im not sure if it was because we went to the M resort buffet the day before but this place literally suckedd. We came here for Friday lunch and first of all they charged us full price without even asking if we had players card. Then there was nothing to eat and the prime rib was just ok and for the other meat dishes the meat was so tough i had a hard time putting my knife through it. I was still hopeful for the ready made crepes but they failed to satisfy. The berry crepe was wayyy too sweet and the savory crepe was just so-so. Even the bread wasn't so good- I mean i've had better bread from my local supermarket. The one thing better than the M resort was the creme bru le but it wasn't amazing or anything :/ Overall the food was very disappointing and our waitress was nowhere to be seen for most of the time.

068xqSlvVMqI0_ASNPFy-w.text: Quality not Quantity here! I came on a Saturday night and it was an hour wait but so worth it! There is a new wristband deal where you can eat here all day which caused the long line. I understand why they loved it so much. There is a made to order crepes station, crab legs, and prime rib! All the wonderful things buffets in Vegas should have but with quality taste. Desserts were super delicious and a nice selection.

jNZgRtFvTexvyqu57dPZiA.text: Average food for around $30.00. The duck and the shrimp were the highlights for me. The button mushrooms were good and the salad bar was a salad bar.
