Every piece of meat we had was tough and chewy, the tri-tip had to be spat out, the steamed sole was like fish jerky, even the grilled chicken breast was hard and dry. The macaroni and cheese was like way over cooked shells in kindergarten paste.  The only redeeming items were the sauerkraut and sausage, braised red cabbage and the cassoulet.   To top it off service sucked. I got the all you can drink beer and wine, I placed my order went to load up my plate finished it and was getting ready to go for my second plate before my thimble of wine showed up.

U8TTP5s1dS29V4JIdYD2mA.text: I have to say that Le Village Buffet is one of the top buffets in Vegas! I was able to try so many new things in one sitting- I really liked the fresh cut lamb, eggs Benedict, grilled eggplant, and the creme brulee... I could go on and on. The size of the buffet isn't the biggest, but I have been to a lot of buffets in Vegas, and this one stands out above the rest with the food's flavor. I really was blown away with most of the food's taste. The crepes are made to order, and the cooks are very nice. The dessert station was a little lacking compared to other buffets, but they make up for it with all of the breakfast and lunch foods.   The atmosphere is very nice. It is set up like a small village with many secluded sitting areas inside of small "houses" and you go "outside" to get the food.   Never before had I been able to eat crepes, duck, lamb, and crab legs in one meal. If you are the kind of person who likes a wide variety of food and likes to try new things, I highly recommend this buffet.

ZtJAmODlJjggWXn4Hh2IPw.text: Champagne brunch was AMAZING!  Service was incredible, variety excellent.  Line was at least an hour...but you can pay 10 bucks to skip it!  We didn't know this beforehand.  Bathrooms not so much.  Only one stall...really?????

2D1jl6tKTkn6M8oP9DpHSA.text: I will not comment on the food, it's a buffet, what do you expect. But the service, horribly terrible.  My wife and I was going to meet up with some friends at the Village Buffet and when we got there our group of 6 friends already seated. So I asked the hostess to seat us next to our friends. The hostess then said she will have to charge us an automatic 18% gratuity because our party would be 8 people.  I said, I'm asking you to seat us next to our friends, not at their table, her reply was, that the 18% gratuity would still apply, because it's the same server. I said "WHAT?!?" Not that I'm a stiff, I usually tip at least 15% or higher depends on the service.  After a brief argument trying to explain to the hostess they can't charge 18% because I want to sit next to someone.  My friend's table would still be 6 people, my table is only 2 people.  After some back and forth she told me she will sit me but I'll have to wait. I said fine, I'm willing to wait. After waiting for about 15 minutes, there were at least 2 tables in that area opened up, but the hostess still didn't sit me.  After waiting for another 5 minutes I saw the hostess walking a group of 4 people from the line to sit in that area.  I walked up to the hostess and confronted the hostess telling her I've been waiting for 20 minutes, how dare she put some one in that table before me?  She then goes to explain "well you don't understand, there's reservation this and that blah blah blah".  I told her, nonsense, this is a buffet, there's no reservation.  At this point I was furious and I was letting the hostess know about it, she knows that I will not let her win so she decided to sit me.  After the meal, I did not leave any tip, because my service that day don't warrant any tip. Except for a TIP I left on a piece of paper for the hostess. Your tip for the day; Try to accommodate customer's simple request Service with a smile Customer is always right If you do all these, you will surely deserve a big gratuity

HcoPlvLILVf3wIU3WW1aXw.text: Le Village Buffet at Paris is le fail.   Expectations weren't that high considering I already knew Wynn, Bellagio, or Studio B buffet would trounce this place any day of the week, even on an off night.  The breads just sucked, no flavor and questionably stale. Insulting to the French culture to serve bread that just isn't good, and calling themselves Paris Las Vegas. I've had better at Hue Thai and Baguette Cafe.   The fettuccine alfredo just tasted like watered down alfredo mix. I know this is a buffet, but how can you fail so badly with fettuccine alfredo? The pesto sauce spaghetti helped to redeem them.  The mussels weren't even remotely fresh, with a strong fishy taste. A sign that it wasn't very fresh.   My experience was the mussels didn't make me want to chance it with the sushi. I didn't want a dose of lax with my meal. The other person in our group confirmed its suckiness, and he isn't as hard of a reviewer as me.  Half of the chicken was very moist since it was near the skin, and the other half was dryer than Vegas on a summer day.  One of the saving grace of the meal was the crepes and waffle station. It amazed me how the chef was just making the crepes with ease. This and the waffles tasted great.  The first round of prime rib was a little dry. Round 2 and 3 were much better, but they were also very rare. It would make even Dexter faint. I could have loaded up on this all day, but a little too early in the day to do this.  This place does have snow crab legs and claws, but its such a PITA to eat because they don't crack it open nicely like the Wynn. I'm sure there are people who would have loaded up on this, but it wasn't worth my time.  The champagne was a poor quality. Don't bother unless you just want the free alcohol. Just go play at the penny slots and get yourself some free drinks instead.  I didn't get a chance to try the desert, but the others in our group says its good.  Our group got a nice cozy and quiet room, but also got a rocky table. We McGuvyer'd it with a bunch of sugar packets on the base of the table.  Service from our first waiter just wasn't good. He forgot which drinks we ordered. Carding me for the champagne even though I didn't want any, couldn't even recognize the birthday on my Nevada ID, and still pouring the champagne into my glass even after I said no. Even interrupting our conversation just to pour the champagne in front of my face. Just either walk around to pour the glasses or just take the glass off the table to pour. I know this isn't a 5 star place, but a little common sense goes a long way. Our second waiter was more attentive, clearing our plates in a timely manner and refilling our drinks without asking.  But $30 for mediocre to below average food for lunch when I can spend a couple of bucks more at the Wynn and get dinner, makes this place already lose a star. Had it been a little less, it would be understandable.   Go to the Studio B buffet if you're coming from SoCal, much better stuff and cheaper prices. Otherwise, spend a little more money for the Bellagio or the Wynn. You're on vacation, spend the extra couple of bucks to get a better meal.

bI7hkDrWUEiRATplYRszOA.text: What happened to this buffet? It started with the cashier when we paid for dinner. The cashier had no sign of any enthusiasm. As if she was ready to go home at 4 pm. Then the host who was in charge to give us a table even lacked more customer service. She was on the phone talking to her family- I'm like really? Aren't you on the clock? As if she was on her break. The server who helped us was nice and very attentive. She knew when to ask us for beverage, water or coffee. Let's talk about the crepe station. That guy looked like he did not want to be there to begin with. The cold section where the seafood was, smelled like nasty sewer. They did not fill what was out, and the floor on that station looked like as if you were in the wet market. I would like to compliment the guys who worked in the steak section. They were very kind and friendly. They had all the enthusiasm in the world that 65 % of the crew did not have. The prime rib is BOMB! It goes well with that french gravy! I think i's called Burgundy sauce. Top it off with mushroom and side of the rice pilaf (the one with butter) and woaaallah! Dinner is served! You have to try the macaroni and cheese- another bomb.com! There were 2 types of rice pilaf, and both were yummy! And last but not the least; the dessert. Creme Bulee, Flan and etc. There were lots of delicious treats to go for. Don't forget the crepe. You can add stuff to your crepe right on your own table like, the flan and some chocolate from the dessert station. I have to say I really like this buffet but, change is definitely a must! The atmosphere with the workers looked like there were tension among the diversity of the race. As if they were not happy to work there. They did not want to work together as a team and just wanted to mind their own business. The guys in the steak section- they need to take a page from their book. They knew what great customer service was, and they looked like they enjoy what they do. If not for the tension among the staff, the dirty seafood section and the cashier & host who lacked professionalism- I would have rated this buffet a 4 or even 5. A lot of delicious stuff in the variety for a fair price.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You got to try these: Prime Rib, top it off with Burgundy sauce and mushrooms, &amp; add a side of this delicious buttery rice pilaf
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe: I added some flan from the dessert station.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delish!

wwrOdx_vAFkdp7yc-23S3g.text: THE BEST $7 DINNER BUFFET (OR DINNER MEAL) EVER  But wait wait a minute Gerald isn't the dinner buffet including taxes cost about $32 per person? Yes it does. Being a Total Rewards Card Member I was eligible to redeem $25 on food. I redeemed that amount and paid the difference of the buffet. Please note my review below isn't normally written for someone that paid the regular price, but someone who paid just $7 for dinner.  The layout of food of this buffet is about one-fourth smaller than Bacchanal Buffet. However for this buffet my approach was similar to Bacchanal Buffet - get small portions on the plate. My goal was at least to get 7 plates so that I would only pay $1 per plate. I won't list all the items I ate, but I will highlight the items that stood out. The lamb leg, which is very French, wasn't gamey but flavorable because of the herbs. Since yesterday was St. Patrick's Day corned beef was served. Classical French dishes like pork and beans cassoulet and sausage and bratwurst choucroute garnie reminded me of dishes at Les Halles in New York. This buffet has a crepe station where your can order different types of crepes. Pork belly with apples is a classical French country dish. In the end I didn't end up getting seven plates of dishes; I got nine. A calculation that results in less than $1 per plate. You can say I got my monies worth.  Whereas most buffets display random items of food, this buffet stands out because there are dishes from different regions of France. These regions act as a food station. When you go to a Chinese Food buffet you can tell the buffet is Chinese because of the food that is served. At this buffet you can tell the food is French because of the regional food station.  Overall this is a decent buffet. In terms of quality and abundance of items this buffet isn't up to par with Bacchanal Buffet. However this buffet is much better in terms of quality and unique items than those Chinese buffets in the suburbs. You still be stuffed at this buffet, but you won't feel bloated as other Chinese buffets.   Is Le Village Buffet worth $32? I'm not sure. Is Le Village Buffet worth $7. HELL YEAH!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Provence food station
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 9th plate: mixed greens and spinach salad no dressing
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 8th plate: vanilla custard &amp; chocolate custard

B0_dx2iuBXVpYFxcZqhy2g.text: Let's begin with some tips!!!  1. You can book online via OpenTable 24 hours in advance to skip the line.  2. If less than 24 hours in advance call for a reservation.  3. If you are a Total Rewards member (free to join) you get a tiny discount.  4. There are 5 regions of France represented here.  5. There are different dining rooms & Le Petit Bar  6. All cocktails are $18 and a bottle of wine is a better buy.  I think I qualify as a foodie.  I studied cooking for a year. Plus, I have gotten to the point that if I can make something I don't buy that dish at restaurants especially if I can easily source the ingredients locally. Furthermore, if I love something I learn to make it ASAP.  Keep in mind this is a buffet. Dinner for two here is the price of one dinner (including appetizers and dessert) at Mon Ami Gabi. This is not Gordon Ramsay Steak.  Don't expect five star gourmet anything.  Expect French type food that can be made easily and taste good.  Expect to see other European influences.  Please tour the buffet area before making your selections. To get the most bang for your buck you might want to do this with salad plates instead of full sized plates.  That way you can try a little of most things.  Foods to skip: Duck L'orange - dry Salmon - dry French Onion Soup - there is no cheese  Foods to try: Lamb Crepes Maracon Spinach Salad Yukon Gold Potatoes Anything involving visible truffles  Miguel was our server and he was kind, informative and prompt. Miguel was also willing to take our photos and keep our glasses full.

DuSRX3e6lD-iRp_ojZb-JA.text: Rude host. His name is Aybaybe. Waited 10 minutes to be seated, he place us in the conner. We wanted to move  to a different table and he said no. The other tables are  only for vip members only .  Lying to us then switching his word once the supervisors showed up.

VPNzFdeXR9kMDRfUeaMk0A.text: Decent Buffett where the highlight used to be the crepes for breakfast. Those days have sailed unfortunately, after recently revisting this staple located in Paris. The legit french dude that worked the station was gone and whoever was manning the station today didn't have the same passion. The options remained the same sweet and savory chicken and mushroom, spinach, artichoke, and brie; and ham and cheese for savory options. Banana and strawberry for sweet.  Also missing were the truffle eggs, man  how I loved those eggs. Two different kinds of hashes  are available:A traditional corn beef hash which is great, and a chorizo hash that has a bit more flavor. Smoked salmon and trout are great solo items and both have excellent flavors. I skipped the omelet station because the line for those was pretty long. The mini apple turnovers are delightful and shouldn't be skipped. Overall a decent Buffett for breakfast, the unlimited drink package added is $13 but getting your moneys worth shouldn't be hard when most beers are $7 in any casino.

A8e5vysae4NhYefOHawoWg.text: I am not a high roller like everyone else that writes reviews here.  I am just a regular guy who likes to be treated decently.  I did not get that at Le Village Buffet.  I have been here a few times and always thought the food was decent and the bakery pretty good.  Unfortunately the staff ruins it.  They are surly and frankly irritated that they have to serve you.  Waiting 45 minutes standing in a cramped line makes me hangry so dealing with poor manners from the staff just makes this a waste of my time and money.  So yourself a favor and go to a buffet not ran by Caesars.  They seem to work hard at recruiting the worlds rudest people.

r8O3pwyc3mQ9Wv6vtD0WQg.text: Decisions decisions are you here for food or dessert? if you want dessert there are too many selections but the very few are good. Must try items include flan, creme brulee, and Crepes made to order. Crepes are delicious!!! Food wise we like saffron rice, pita spread, and fish. The duck meat was ok. A bit dry. I'm not a meat person but the better half who bans vegetables said the meat selections were ok, nothing to rave about. We got groupon for two adults and bottle if wine for 20 a person. That deal will bring us back.  Other than that I wouldn't say food is very good since there are Just took many other competitors.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella Crepes , flan, creme brûlée, macaroons

NcFXZY3szhrbu8Kaaut__w.text: Visited on vacation and loved the crepes! Our server Tan was amazing and super welcoming! He even spoke Vietnamese and helped us when we had a complaint.

bakTZsPmX5T2uAvOZ5Xlsg.text: Not impressed at all Service was not good. Never got my water refilled. Took a while to have server come around for s refill of soda. Dirty plates still on table after getting up for another serving. For ice cream, had to go over to soup station for bowls and spoons. The chocolate topping was empty and it was only 8:30pm. And who puts walnuts in apple pie?

KyU9F1ksHd8JBKIBJ4SQzA.text: If I had to the option to give negative stars I would. Got this buffet complimentary from my resort it was freaking terrible. Service sucked! The guy forgot about my ice. The food was bland no seasoning whatsoever the carving station people were quiet rude just a freaking mess. I would not waste my money going here.

R4ktRL2Pkm1_brB2O5mFNQ.text: Most important: skip the line if you are a platinum, diamond, or seven seas member.  Otherwise, the line is long, expect to wait for 30 minutes or so.  The separate line is close by look for the glass doors.  The quality of the food is ok, nothing really stands out and not a lot of disasters.  To describe the sad state of buffets on the strip, this is one of the better ones.  One thing I must stay is pretty good, is the macaroons and creme brulee.  Save your appetite for these.

xNxFt7QgPMMJogtwCEvgCQ.text: Headed here for my last night in town. Won't be heading there again. The food was mediocre at best. There was nothing worth stuffing myself on, which is the best part of a buffet. I tried a little bit of everything from sushi to pasta to sausage to the desserts. And I didn't finish anything. One or two bites of everything was all I wanted because the food wasn't great. Definitely disappointing for the $31 I spent for dinner.   Waited 30 minutes, which wasn't terrible considering it was 5:45 in the evening. The waiter we had was good about refills and the bussers were good about clearing plates.   I give it 2 stars for the wait staff and the variety of food. But that's all.

nV4ImP6F21jPCHfVtabVkw.text: Food: not a lot to choose from. The Mac and cheese taste like plastic. Pasta salad, the pasta is still a little raw/uncooked. Beef/ham are dry and flavored less. The only thing that taste decent is crepes and soups. Dessert is okay as well. There wasn't much to eat... Maybe because I went during brunch??? Shouldn't make a difference because all the other buffet I went to (Hollywood and Bellagio) had a lot of food choices!  Service: out of ten? 3 asked for milk and she replied back with an attitude "to drink?!" yes...what else would i do with milk? Took awhile to come to our table for refills.   Over all I would not waste $35/person to eat here. Go to Bellagio for brunch. The best yet!! Worth the money. Or Planet Hollywood. The buffet is just right under the casino! I would never come here again. Only Hollywood or Bellagio, It's a must try!

pKMuCgHCp68dThyd7zi1ew.text: On Sunday, April 10th my wife and I attempted to have dinner at this buffet at 3PM. After being seated we browsed through the offerings and to our surprise the tags, which identify the food items, were all wrong - the tags reflected all of the items associated with their breakfast items. The food was not much better than the misguided tags. After a while my wife overheard a few of the attendants saying that much of the afternoon crew did not show up for work - thus the mess-ups. The service was OK but our attendant was, apparently, called away to perform other duties, leaving us with an attendant that took care of our, as well as other customer needs. The only reason I gave it 1 start-rating was because the crab legs were not so bad, although a number of them were still frozen. Not a very good dinning experience...

ODvjJf68WWI1hvhQSlodew.text: This place really sucked. There was an awful smell in some parts of the restaurant. The food looked like it didn't get refreshed often which is surprising since there is heavy traffic. The food just looked really sad... Awful experience.

VLsuav7-sbRBiGwX-b0u3g.text: We used to go to the buffet at Paris because there was never a long wait and the food was great. This time around (a few years since our last visit), we waited an hour for the buffet and then the food assortment wasn't to our liking as well as the quality of the food was not as good as it used to be. Since I only eat chicken, I was hoping for some chicken dishes. There was only one chicken item near the carving station, rotisserie chicken. And of course, that dish was empty. So we asked the guy behind the counter if there's more coming out...he replied that he has to cut up the pieces and then he'll put it out later. Well, I'm here now after waiting an hour in line...sorry to inconvenience you--isn't your job food prep!? Very annoying. So I basically paid $33 for cheese and crackers and some dried out desserts. Go to Planet Hollywood if you want a better assortment of food.  Our waiter was nice...

TrfPtZFyqHv6xL4IIrm4hQ.text: Me and my family had an horrible experience for this buffet. First it started in a long line just get a table so we thinking the buffet is going to be good. Then when we came up to pay the service is rude. After getting seated the table looked a little bit dirty so they then cleaned the table. After all that chaos we went to get good. The variety is pretty good. Now about the food... Me and my family hated it! I don't recommend coming here.

1yPPwckYzG30gbnZBLQIEA.text: This place always has a really long line, expect to wait 30+ minutes  The food here is really good sometimes and upright gross other times.  It's really inconsistent.    The prime rib, tri-tip and quiche here are top notch.  The prime rib is rare and juicy and well seasoned.  The shrimp cocktail is not peeled here... the crab legs are served cold.  Service has always been sub-par here.  Not a huge selection of desserts except for the long line at the crepe bar.

POj5aKqQaZbKCI1q9MtmmA.text: This place is soOo gross...we paid $25 for lunch and I wanted to cry because there weren't that many selections plus option were gross. Only thing good was the prime rib and the salads. We didn't get to the dessert because we lost our appetite. My husband ate the sushi there...and it was spoiled. He almost threw up on the table. They charged my son 4 year old $14.99 and his plate only had sausage and cheese because he didn't like anything there. I'm sorry to say but even circus circus buffet beat Paris buffet. I came here like 3-4 years ago and it use to be good with many selections. Not anymore. Terrible terrible terrible.

ctxTLeXIdz_6uTX_KomJjw.text: I was NOT impressed by the quantity, food was not appetizing at all and the selection did not impress me whatsoever. Everything else is mediocre however, i leave this place bloated, and yet not satisfied. This place, while decent, is not as good as people say it is.

tDwo1_bKeXixZC4sBSv1xQ.text: This place hit the spot!  Paying with cash gets you a cheaper deal and I would highly suggest springing the extra mula for unlimited alcoholic drinks.  There's just something about sipping on mimosas that will make your day start off right!  The food was plentiful and had a lot of selections.  My faves were the: prime rib asparagus fancy mac and cheese scrambled eggs bacon crepes!!! cheese cake  We also had a super hard working and friendly server that made meal even better! Overall, its quite charming with its decorations and has great food.  You're sure to find something you'll enjoy.

8nPnyKwtR6YFAiwjmB5j9A.text: 5 stars for breakfast! Get the Buffet of Buffets for $45 each all you can eat for 24hrs at 6 hotels and Le Village is one of the places you can indulge like a queen at. They have a crepe and omelette station so you can choose what you want which is a WIN WIN right away coz its all you can eat minus the line. (it gets pretty long so go there first). Service is sweet and the interior is cute, makes you feel like you're in Paris. Great variety of foods to choose from so take your time and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Super berry crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round 1

nw_-5Lyu4o3sPaStru7O1g.text: We went for champagne brunch on Saturday. We were seated almost right away. The food was excellent, as were the drinks, and while it didn't have the same selection as some of the other buffets, it was still tasty and filling! Our waitress was super attentive and very polite. All in all, we left satisfied and very happy having spent our money there!

7naQ7JYD9YLSNuvdrJLMzg.text: Fortunately for me, I was saved by another buffet down the strip on my day pass (only reason I'm giving it 2 stars), but this was easily the worst tasting food I had on my vacation.  I did my best to sample everything at the buffet but honestly, everything besides their fresh shrimp and cocktail/horseradish sauce, was not very appetizing and the food did not taste as good as it looked.    The atmosphere was fine, but that's not why we're really here, are we?  The meats were dry, vegetables weren't seasoned well, food wasn't served very warm... maybe they staffed the C-team on a Monday?

fLnLhiDwgzbVdfijHy-zig.text: This was one of the worst buffet experience I have ever had. No service, laterally nothing, I had to walk up to someone wrapping silverware and ask if they could get me a water.  The food is subpar, French toast, Belgian waffles are soggy as hell. Dont know how they made a Belgian waffle soggy but they did.  All for 20.53 per person.

VHKL7k99e1itCuAtL6mM2Q.text: My boyfriend and I bought the Buffet of Buffets pass for all CET properties, and decided to hit up Le Village Buffet at Paris for breakfast, especially after reading about how it has one of the best breakfast buffets in Vegas. Unfortunately, we did not plan it out so well, and ended up having to wait about half an hour to an hour in line. By the time we were finally seated, they were serving lunch.   The ambiance and decor is cute, made to look like you are actually dining in a French village. The service was prompt, and the food was varied from your usual buffet food. My boyfriend enjoyed the mussels, which he said were always the first items to disappear!   The best part of the buffet is the made to order crepe station. There usually is a line, but it does move pretty quickly. The crepes are delicious, and are definitely worth the wait!

nGm8Y9qsPTMcoClJFndDOQ.text: Pretty standard stuff and overpriced, for the same money you could get a better meal elsewhere.

hLiA3uLYa10AolQD_X3b1g.text: As far as buffets goes, this has got to be one of the best! No wonder they've been awarded the silver.  I've spent years trying to replicate their Chicken Coq au Vin, and I am getting closer.  Their braised short rib is also fall off the bone tender. Their quiche, bread and other offerings are not very good replicas though.  2 years ago, they removed both braised short rib and the Chicken Coq au Vin. Now the best thing there remaining is their crepes made to order... which you can get at most good crepe shops.  Its worth the long lines every time I go to Vegas (been here over 7 times now).

qIGETUmBCz24PxAXx5eQpQ.text: The customer service sucks!! They force you to pay 17 percent tip if it's a party of 8 or more! If you don't want to, they won't seat you together! The manager, Matt, is rude and does not care about his customers!! Plus, it's $31 a person!! NEVER again!!!

YTyHrafJ3eUEZcXibY62bw.text: This was our first buffet stop in Vegas. We ate here mainly because we were staying at Paris and my friend, J, raved about their breakfast offerings. The wait can seem like an eternity if you're trying to get in before your 24 hour wristbands expire but in reality we waited 20 minutes on a Thursday am and 30 on Friday. We were told by the cashier if we had their Player's Club card we could have had $10 knocked off our wristband price. I loved the small village ambiance that continued all the way into each dinning area. Both our servers each morning were quick with the drinks and a shout out to our second server who tried her best to locate a keno runner from Bally's for me to place a bet. As for the actual food a must is the rosemary potatoes, eggs Benedict and varieties of sausages from a group consensus. I personally liked the loxs and bagels. The salmon was fresh and there was still tons of it even though we were close to lunch time. I almost never get it and filled up on it like this was my last meal. Oh and if possible try to sit on the outside of buffet seating. People watching is great fun and I actually felt like I was at a small French cafe instead of inside a money gobbling casino.

IqNDRi13P97Q5G0um8dVGA.text: I was excited to go the buffet at Paris after having been there years ago and having fond memories of food, food, and more food.  The place turned out to be sad.  The food had been sitting under heat lamps for too long, the waitress took too long to bring us drinks, the desserts were picked through and melting, and even the waitresses looked sad dressed like wenches.  The only redeeming piece was the crepe maker.  Next time, I'm going back to the Bellagio or Rio.  No more Le Village.

1sBf7Mp4VCz0f54hTAdM2Q.text: I've never been super engaged in the Las Vegas buffet wars. I'm generally a light eater, so the concept of paying a premium for the opportunity to stuff food in my face by the pound and praise this All-American testament to culinary excess is not anything I aspire to, and yet, I can't separate it from the Vegas experience. Fortunately, Le Village Buffet is an honest cut above, perhaps the only buffet I've had in Vegas that didn't taste like a buffet, with the heat lamps and the rubbery food and pink slime and such. Choices are abundant, food is fresh, and really, it doesn't sit, since everyone is attacking all stations at all times. It's a pain in the ass getting in, and while a lot of recent reviews about declining quality give me pause, I will likely return next time I'm in LV to check for myself. Champagne makes it all go down better.

wmrh1OWmzGvd266ElIJPzw.text: WHy do people eat here with so many other better buffets?  Wicked spoon and Aria are tons better.  Crepes are all the rage, but they are not that great.  soggy, greasy and filled with defrosted frozen berries.  Whipped cream was awesome though. Prime rib and lamb were overcooked.  Desserts were horrible!  In a French themed buffet!  Wicked SPoon dessert table was light years ahead.  Skip this place.

-SgjhDy__3BeBdeGJKB-hQ.text: I was Very disappointed with the experience. The cheese bar had 4 cheeses none of them European. I did not expect muenster, cheddar, smoked mozzarella, and pepper jack to be on a French theme buffet. The place was moderately full and it was an hour wait on line. The service after we were in was horrible. When i asked the waitress, what did they have for red wine, it was as if I was talking another language. Is French theme she should be able answer me knowledgeable. Avoid if you can 4 for lunch 135.00

T9n3B3fOa-8AzGzUpTfWgg.text: The food is so good here! I love French food, and fresh food! That is hard to find at a Buffet. Everything was so good, to bad my stomache was not as big as my eyes, I wanted more but I wa so full! I am very picky when it comes to food,  I am from Europe and hard to please!

lN5lKFxsTS60hHzpb0wVwg.text: "Le damn" this place is good!  Came here with my wife during our "Buffet of Buffets" outing and our "breffas" was so good we came back again and paid regular price after our pass expired.  This is definitely the place to go for breakfast or brunch. The only bad thing is that you're in Vegas and who the fuck wakes up before 11am? Well if you haven't gone to bed yet and you feel like the best breakfast buffet in town then you've come to the right place. This place has everything from custom crepes to eggs benedict. Just a great selection overall. The only issue I had was the damn crepe line, that shit was a 30 minute wait!  Besides that, the atmosphere is cool. It does its best to replicate a small french village with the tables in the center of the whole thing. The painting of the sky helps create a unique dining experience.  Overall, I haven't found a better buffet for breakfast so this place gets my top rating. I can't wait to go back and "manger comme je n'ai jamais mange avant!"

UdgNPqLFVaUIuaJEQU9WJQ.text: Overall, the Paris Buffet is a solid choice.  I was fairly pleased.    I will say, however, that of the 4 buffets I visited in Vegas on my last trip (Wynn, Bellagio, Aria being the other 3), it was 4th in line.  It just didn't stack up to the last 2 times I was there.  It's slipped a bit, to be honest.  The food choices overall was a bit skimpy compared to other lunch buffets (Aria, Mandalay, etc).  It's the only buffet I visited where it was pretty easy to get through all the choices and fill up your plate twice (or even once).  The choices just weren't as appealing.  The food also didn't appear that fresh (sorta warmed over looking).  That was odd to me b/c we were there on as Monday and fairly early (about 1130) so it's not like more than a few dozen ppl had even been through it.  The food was a bit "dry" in spots.    The positives were that overall, you'll leave full and fairly satisfied with the meat and other selections.  My wife really liked the sole very much! Also, the decor if you sit "outside", is pretty cool (although the painted "cloud" ceilings is overdone between Venetian, Planet Hollywood and the Paris- everyone does it and it's starting to look 90's, hokey and dated).  The crepe station I didn't take advantage of (just not my thing), although if you are into that, it did look pretty apealing.  A solid B-.  Down from an A- a few years ago.  Don't let it slip any further, Paris, or you'll be equal to a run of the mill (Treasure Island) type buffet.

g9gCi5NyIbi3pSLaEGP-TA.text: We had purchased one of the all day any buffet deals and were out trying a good number of them over 24 hours.  They charged us an additional fee to eat with them which I wasn't happy with.  The food was good and we enjoyed some different choices than you see other places.  Now were super friendly and people persons but it didn't matter here as the servers were not friendly.  From the register, to the hostess and server not many smiled or even cared to talk and the place was not busy.  Drink refills are not dependable even though they walk by or collect dirty plates.  For the food I give three stars but not the service.  My tip reflected my dissatisfaction with the service received and we normally leave good tips where we eat.

YCDYssyoTC-svuM4uBvvFg.text: This buffet is really good. What is also really good, is the fact that patrons can now pay an extra $15 dollars to not have to stand in line.  When you have already made that decision to head to vegas - $15 isn't really too bad.  Now, what is great however, is the Duck that this buffet offers.  We must have spent hours gourging over all the great selections, but as soon as my fellow companions had almost finished eating all of the crab legs known to man, out comes the duck.  Seriously perfection. I still think about that duck and a little bit of my heart was left there that day. Such is love. Such is hunger. Such is Le Village Buffet.

jeSOYc6J1U0uhnK-kt6XoA.text: We went there as a group for lunch. However, I was not hungry.  You have to stay in line to order those average dessert crepes. Everything else was pretty mediocre too.  There were kind of a lot of desserts, but nothing I would want to try.  The interior of the buffer, as the whole hotel Paris, is pretty nice. But this one advantage doesn't overweight the mediocre food.  well... To summarize my whole experience, IT IS NOT WORTH DINING THERE!  There are so many better ones! Not just better, but really good ones.

m3k_haosfDJdy4qI1TZTTg.text: Le Village Buffet at Paris Las Vegas is one of the buffet I like for so many years. I come to Vegas about 2-3 times a year. I have dinners in Le Village half of the times when I come to Las Vegas. The service is very good before. But not anymore! Not just this time. The services is going downhill at the last few years. This time it finally down to the point "better than nothing"! The waitress cannot be found most of the time. No body will refills your drinks until you lucky to see your waitress. The waitress does pick up the plates, but she looks overloaded. Never see a smile! Rush in, rush out!   The foods is also cut down a lots! It used to be reasonable good choice. But it is very limit of choice now due To they closed down one section of the buffet table.   The price of the buffet in Las Vegas is getting much higher. But the qualities of the buffets included Le Village is keeps getting lower. I have so many choices of restaurants or buffets in Las Vegas. This will be my last time to have the buffet at Le Village before they back to the buffet as what they are long time ago. I hope I will see the management at Le Village Buffet or Paris Las Vegas make this buffet becomes one of the best buffet in Las Vegas again!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

84g4JyrpmnR7UHDFdPRAmA.text: Not worth it at all. Like at all.   I've been a few years ago, it's definitely not as good.  They no longer even bring you drinks, but that was no big to me (might be to others), the gal who cleared our plates was super sweet and nice.   The food sucked.  The crab was almost all empty, like full on empty shells laying on ice. People were digging searching for crab legs with actual meat (when you found one it was a pretty small amount of meat and not worth the effort).  I love a salad bar, and this was so basic. You can get better salad at freaking Sizzler. And sizzler is not $39.99!   I ended up eating potatoes and cold pasta salad b/c nothing was good. Potatoes and cold pasta salad do not warrant that price.  There are so many options in Vegas, do not bother with this one.

S9DZY_e9SVztD4Y51DK9UQ.text: What happened to this place?  I came here 5 years ago and there was a 1 hour wait to get in.  The food was great and the buffet was larger.  They closed the grilling area.    I met to give 1 star but our waitress was very friendly.    Let's start w/ the food, that's the main attraction.  The food was okay, the variety is mostly Italian, soup and salads.  The best part should have been the crab legs but look at the pic.  The crab legs are tiny, a mess and previously frozen.  They were 'not good' not quite bad.  But why does it look like such a mess, though customers make it a mess it's ultimately the job of the staff to keep it clean.  I came here because of an online discount.  Because of the discount it's an ok deal, but for me I have to think of quality and spend a few extra at a better buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs were small and total mess.

3Ll7BKEXDIbe0NhnqFdEgA.text: Bought BOB pass and first night visit. Dark environment  Food sucks and boring Not much to eat nor choose from Meat was good no typical smell  As I can say American Beef is awesome Compare Canadian prep the meat in buffet sucks  Crab legs was the most value from eating   All buffet of BOB dessert was same and good

-Gu1VaI0I4uPisCieuSq3Q.text: This would have to be my favorite breakfast buffet, hands down, in all of Las Vegas! They're crepe station won me over! Plus not to mention, their French toasts are so well made and fluffy! They have anything you could possibly want and then more! I'm a lover of sweets so I especially loved their pastries! I get hungry just thinking of this place! A must go for breakfast buffets in Las Vegas!

bKP62UZbF86kOOElvow3fg.text: If your looking forward to great food this place is not your place there food is cold and there attitude is extremely wrong.So if your looking for something good don't even think about going here. We had a horrible experience and will never go to this place again. Not only our table was complaining but also all the table arounds us as well. The manager made us wait more than half an hour just to speak to her and the funny thing was that  when she went to make a remark to her staff they would turn around and laugh about it expression of "whatever"  We noticed a short line going in for dinner now we know why. One of the vip staff there i mentioned to her About how could a take so long to see the manager and and her reply was she is busy and cannot talk to you. the people behind the food counters also very unprofessional

NYmz3kX7QhRLMi60Ugqjdw.text: I wanted to give this buffet a try & well it just didn't meet my expectations.   I do want to start by saying the the service was great and the people we're really helpful!  The main issue was the food. For the cost of the buffet there was pretty much nothing.   We went at around 12 and all they had for breakfast was a little bit of left over eggs and some cold french toast.  There wasn't any meat or poultry except some chicken thighs   A lot of salad tho. For a buffet at the strip i just wouldn't recommend it

cYtNfMKuXbQmZwg0CrODUQ.text: Pros: no wait at 630 on a Fri night. Cute decor. Cons: food was just average. Crab legs were frozen, actually rock hard frozen-huge blunder. Servers behind the food stations were generally glum. For a family of 4, this was a lot of $$ for mediocre food. There a far better buffet options, or we could have had an excellent restaurant meal for a similar or less price.  This place was better a decade ago. 2.5 stars

Fu73acz30OIF4W5cmt6QpA.text: Asked one of the Hispanic guys to make me a crepe  and asked if he could add a topping, he replied with, "that's why we have a menu", pointed to it and as I said, "ok" he continued to say in Spanish, " as if he is my boss", and continued to just be unpleasant.  Guess what I speak Spanish and you are lucky I did not say anything.   The crepe guys are selective on who they make special crepes that are not on the menu.  Guess I won't come back. One of the two Hispanic guys on the morning shift are ass holes. This happened 4-1-2019 at around 1pm

bDYUccBj4vtM90nHZG-vaQ.text: Real French food especially the desserts! They serve steamed crab buckets for dinner.  Cold crab for lunch and dinner. Creme brulee, tarts, soft serve ice cream! Breakfast is especially good. Prime rib always for lunch and dinner!  Crepes are ready to order. Delicious!

LV9ypL6KwNdmROhJeB7X_Q.text: I love breakfast so we came here for the breakfast using our Buffet of Buffet passes. The decor is adorable!  Made me feel like I was in Beaty and the Beast. They had an amazing selection of breakfast favorites including an omelette stations, a build your own eggs Benedict station and a crepe station. The bacon and other meats were plentiful. The coffee was strong. The service was friendly and frequent. I would definitely come back here anytime.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ShEVB1vcHT6K5M3CILrMww.text: Le village buffet has gone wayyyyy downhill from my last visit. Gone are the fresh meats and seafood. Now a majority of the dishes are starch based. Pasta, bread, vegetables, and rice are now the four main points of this buffet. Things to fill you up fast and that are cheap to make. If you're looking for a quality buffet look somewhere else.

TNpDneLlySas_HfWTXCbUw.text: This is the worst buffet I have ever been to in my life and I was "lucky" enough to eat for free...and I am still highly dissatisfied. The prime rib, roast beef, and roasitiree chicken was dry and cold. The options were very limited. The only decent thing there were the crepes. I am up at 1am with stomach aches and food poisoning, feeling very sick and want to vomit! Stay away from this place and save your money! Not even worth 1 star!

5AByDlVjz7pStXq12K2P_g.text: This was the WORST buffet that o ever spent money on! My plate was floating in grease. The croissants were hard, the potatoes in the corned beef hash were under cooked. The response we got??? I'll let my manager know.

4gHuLhSkzhld8VPhAip0lA.text: Terrible. Low to no qualify food. No variety. Disgusting and bland. Salad bar dismal. Items not fresh. Prime rib had weird taste. Bad service. Don't go. Pay a bit more and go elsewhere.

2_jrnX6sxXXFkcKANGmoEQ.text: A number of years ago my husband and I would go to Las Vegas and eat at the Bellagio breakfast buffet which we loved.  On one trip we was the the Le Village Buffet at Paris Las Vegas and I absolutely loved it.  The food was great...I loved the eggs benedict, they had fresh fruit including berries and the choices of food were incredible.  We have gone back several times and each time the buffet has gotten worse to the point that I probably will not go back again.    The one thing that was new this year was a beverage bar to get soda/coffee/juice, etc.  This would have been OK; however, I attempted to get a glass of skim milk which would have taken me forever as it came out super slow.  I asked an employee if he could refill the milk and he looked at it and said that it wasn't empty, just frozen (which didn't do me any good).  I did track down a manager and graciously went and got me a glass of milk.  OK...not a big deal but then came the food...honestly, very disappointing.  The eggs benedict are not make it yourself which is OK, but they used to be outstanding...definitely went way down in quality.  Again, the fruit selection has gone way down.  I used to enjoy a bowl of strawberries, raspberries and blueberries...blueberries and raspberries were no where to be found.    On a somewhat positive note, the cheese selection is nice and I did enjoy the pecan sticky buns; however, this is not enough to make me want to go back.  The crepe station is also good but on this visit there were very limited choices of crepes to choose from.  The food in general is OK, but for the price which continues to go up and seeing the quality go down, I don't think it is worth it.  Just my opinion!

1xojvPnb2n2aOqRrMID79g.text: This used to be my daughter's favorite buffet. Not anymore. We came here for breakfast. The line for crepes was really long, with only one guy slowly manning the station. He was making them one at a time when he had three crepe pans and lots of people waiting. 30 minutes later, we got a delicious crepe.   The scrambled eggs were just ok. The bacon was horribly greasy and either burnt or undercooked. The sausage was a bit rubbery. Croissants were dry and not flaky.   Service was bad. I ordered coffee and got a carafe, no cup. I asked for a cup and she never came back. Finally, I went and got my own cup. The kids' drinks were never refilled.

5VMFFVtB9Gytl8E7L9re6g.text: Ah, I really wanted to like this place. I'm not much of a picky eater so I'm pretty easy to please. However, the food just wasn't great for me.   I went in knowing my options would be a bit more limited since I'm pescatarian. However, I knew there would be plenty of pasta options, and usually, pasta = a happy me! I did also find a tilapia option, which ended up being the best tasting food I had there.   I tried 3 different types of pasta - mac and cheese, a stuffed tortellini, and some sort of penne pasta in vodka sauce with shrimp. Now, on their website, they said one of the "must try" items is their truffle mac and cheese. I love anything with truffles in it, but I searched the whole buffet (which wasn't that big) and didn't find any truffle mac and cheese. They DID have regular mac and cheese, which wasn't great. The shredded blend of american and cheddar cheeses on top wasn't even melted yet, so that was kind of strange, and there was zero hint of truffle. Sad! Their vodka sauce penne pasta didn't taste like vodka sauce at all. The stuffed tortellini was alright, I guess... nothing special.   I was also very excited for their crepe station. I ordered a mushroom, spinach, and brie crepe, which sounded delicious. However, when I took it back to the table, only the outer edges of the crepe were hot. Everything else was cold inside. Also sad!   The desserts were decent. They had plenty of options for dessert - their macarons were pretty tasty and had a really good texture to them. I also enjoyed their soft serve chocolate custard.   All in all, I really wanted to like this buffet, but the food just really wasn't that great. I gave it a 2 though because the buffet itself is beautifully decorated and looks very visually appealing. Our server was nice too, and she checked on us several times, which was nice. I will be trying other buffets next time I'm in Vegas though!

pLk1hkLk3o-fJecrDCokaQ.text: I used to come here often and the food quality and choices were so much better back then today honestly the food  is the low quality The place was almost empty. We used to wait awhile. Very very disappointed. to much money for nothing to eat. LAST TIME IN THIS PLACE

3FPPObPNYmScFnpBx4yK8A.text: Effective today, the buffet has moved to a self-service beverage line. They have a eliminated all of the waitstaff. Dirty Dishes are stacking/piling up on the table. The elegance of the place has been severely diminished. You might as well go to any other strip buffet as this one is now no different.  What a shame!!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They have now moved to a self service drink counter effective today and no waitresses.

t9fQwfV6uEthpldM3VyD2g.text: Decent selection of breakfast items and most items are kept fresh in rotation.   I would call this an average decent buffet.   With a few tweaks it could be a lot better.

Wu5To_GYOJpJl7q2MPRjKA.text: I gave the village only 2 stars.  The food wasn't up to par with what the others have to offer. I bought the 24hr buffet pass and was not impressed.  The decor is great and was friendly but still wasn't worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Ef0mndJvADQ3948M9MVE6g.text: While staying at Aria, we checked out the buffet for brunch the following morning. For $60/person, I was expecting more. The selections seemed limited and not a lot of variety. We were a party of six and no one was really impressed. However, I did find some favorites like the lobster roll sandwich and the crab legs. The desserts were also pretty good. But the rest was just OK -- but not $60 OK. The property is branded as high(er) end resort so they need to step up their game with their buffet. Go check out the Wicked Spoon buffet at the Cosmopolitan next door.

elqtRYuO7oRcwn0g8eNFFQ.text: I purchased dinner for 4 thru Groupon.  We went on a Sunday and food was just ok.  Very limited selection.  Definitely won't return! Oh one more thing...before seating us, the table wasn't set.  The host took us to our table, had us waiting while he asked my husband to move a table with him...seriously?

Nv-ZHdq06QhEctlSVStIgQ.text: Eh, is the best thing I can say about the food. They didn't have half the food from the menu out, so it was a very limited in selection. Dessert was good, crepes were good, and the service was ok.

us_RePKEnY2cRHHTKu9Zcg.text: Went for lunch during my vegas trip with my fiance and our friends who are also engaged. I went to this buffet with no expectations because I never really heard anything about it. However, to my surprise, the decor as well as the food exceeded my expectations. The decor was so cute and mimicked the streets and exteriors of French shops, boutiques, bakeries, etc. Loved the vibe of the buffet interior.  They had a handful of different stations. Compared to other more known buffets in LV, they lacked the variety of multicultural dishes but the quality of food was great and unique. Plus, the theme of the buffet is obviously Parisian theme so obviously they won't have the different ethnic foods. However, they do have some sushi rolls. I've never seen an LV buffet with a Crepe station (made to order). Yes crepes!!    I'll definitely be back .. even if it's just for the crepes.

s09yfcDGci4I48HboYviIA.text: If you want great food and service this is definitely not the place. You like cold food? you got the perfect place!   When we got there it took our server 15 minutes to get our drink order because she didn't know they sat us down on her table. We understood that it was busy so we didn't care. Had to keep asking for drink refills, there was a hair on my shrimp (probably the only thing they add for flavor) the steak was rubbery and cold, honestly, just save yourself time and money, go somewhere else.

yusMuO3f6gO09KyyNZMNPQ.text: The best buffet in the world - we did buffet breakfast. This is insanely amazing, you will find 100s is items, best quality, amazing taste, awesome service. I strongly Recommend this if you are in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

D7Ct5Q9v66Qvmnru_lkD5g.text: Oh yummmmm!!!  I was completely resisting eating at a buffet because my experiences are never good. But my friend chose this place for us all to go to and I was super surprised. It was great!!!    Especially the salmon. It was soft, moist, pepper-y, and a little sweet (maybe from honey?). Totally divine. Perhaps one of the best pieces of salmon I ever had that wasn't cooked at home. My friends were impressed too. They all raved about the cream spinach. I didn't try it because I got distracted by all the other great food.   The desserts were good too.   I ate wayyyyy toooo much and left totally happy.

1EQDPjbN5ckgDmZdbe909Q.text: This is your typical breakfast buffet with the addition of crepes -  yum, yum!  Unfortunately, it was not as good as it used to be. We found that several things on the buffet were cold, the corned beef hash now has ground up corned beef where in the past it was pieces, the turkey bacon as sitting in water and there was very little fresh fruit available.    When we mentioned these things to the manager he did not seem to care.  He had a answer for everything from "the turkey bacon is just an inferior product" to "we can't make any money if we put out better/more fruit and berries".  It was very shocking.  All of this could have been OK if we would have had better service.  We were asked what we would like to drink when we paid (on the way in) and the drinks were delivered while we were getting our food.  I ordered hot tea with cream and I was given two Earl Grey teabags.  As I wanted plain black tea (i.e. English Breakfast) I tried to find our waiter to have the teabags changed out, but he was nowhere to be found.  I was half done with my first plate of food before he ever came out of the back.  We waved him down and I told him what I would like and he left the table without asking anyone else if they needed anything - and they did.  He returned with my teabags and one person asked for water and he turned to leave again without asking if there was anything else.  We grabbed him before he left, but I'm sure this is why he was not around - I saw him helping one person at a table at a time instead of helping the whole table.  They definitely need to do some training - for both their servers and management!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kiDd-4to0268x4CdZ6xldA.text: Worst service ever. The first guy that we asked for a water refill said "oh im leaving someone is coming" second person "yea im already out" third person "okay, im not your server ill her know" if you are looking for a place who can't serve because he/she is not your server MAN YOU FOUND THE RIGHT PLACE!!!   This is very disappointing. What if a person really needs a glass of water to take some medicine and no person does not want to give him/her one. You can be sue of what you are doing!!!!   The food is not even appealing. Most of them were lapsed already meaning they dont reach the minimum amount of heat a food should be served.

WzpQJriW1nQt1cND8xZiLA.text: One word... Sensational. Absolutely delicious crepes & food. Service was awesome & they kept refilling our glass  filled with Mimosas. The line was long but if you don't mind the wait it's totally worth it.

zWig7RHvviVW4TnddRuf3g.text: I'm not going to lie, I'm not usually a fan of Buffets. But I make a point to go to this one every time I stay at the Paris and I'm not entirely sure why but I love it.  It isn't that the food is out of this world or that anything other than the Crepes stand out, but as far as buffets go it's probably one of the better ones I've been to. There's a great selection of food to choose from and they divide it up by nationality which is nice . As I mentioned the crepes are fantastic, and they also have a wonderful salad bar. Their dessert items are also very good which is to be expected in a playset supposedly specializes in French stuff.  It's fairly expensive, and probably not the best buffet in town, but if you find yourself at the Paris it's worth eating there once.

K7P55KrhbHfQ20ZbBmgX5Q.text: 3.5 stars actually. Make a reservation so you don't have to wait. Our waiter was amazing, (forgot his name), but everyone else that worked at the station seemed annoyed and like they hated their job. Anytime I'd ask them a question or ask for something at the station they would get annoyed. Food was average for a buffet. Not the best but not the worst.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QlmYzvSF1_J8u2Iq53hN7g.text: I purchased a Groupon and thought I would give this place a try. I came here for dinner on 9/20/18 and waited in line for about 15 minutes before being seated. This buffet must be one of the smallest buffets I have ever been to. Food quality was ok but could have been better for a buffet that is owned by Ceasars Entertainment Group.

YnjQT_qC_Jn7BfyMhKYaZg.text: Thoroughly enjoyed my time here! Good food throughout, a nice French experience, and quietness like an actual French restaurant. The French countryside and its food felt like it was all around you. Definitely coming back!

C4b7tMKE2wM9-Rd5D0hJFA.text: This was the worst buffet I have been to. Almost all the food looks frozen, the meats available were only prime rib and turkey. The soup pots stayed almost dried and empty, the crab legs were all presplit and the pile was all empty shells, they never got refilled. Desserts looked like they came from a vendor and nothing dressed up. The only thing that I enjoyed was the iced tea. Leaving a buffet hungry in Vegas is not the business. Heading to Carnegie Deli to get s big sandwich now.

j7bNhD9B4nocwcS3F1kesw.text: Abosolute disaster, do not go to this place! The food the horrible and disgusting. Everything is bad, the sink is stocked for a long time and no one cleaned it. OMG

Jnt4ap71GBKBGsw-0_6Chw.text: If I could rate this Buffett a 0 I would. The food looked like it sat out all day. There was awful looking chilled snow crab legs. They do not have steamed legs. Desserts were awful. Service was decent. The price is outrageous for such minimal options.

-9AawJcp-ZkP2oxzrS-xTw.text: I came here during memorial day weekend so it was more expensive than it normally is. I think I payed $42 for the lunch buffet. The day before I came here, I had tried the Bacchanal buffet at Caesars Palace so obviously I ended up comparing the two (Bacchanal was $75).    Overall, it had everything one can expect on a buffet. There was a crepes station which I really enjoyed, seafood, meat, desserts etc. But in comparison to Bacchanal, it was just sad. Not only did Bacchanal provide much more options, but it was also much, much better quality food. I know that there was a huge  price difference so I took that into consideration, but even though I did, I don't think the food was worth $42.   The service and ambiance was honestly quite bad as well. We sat in a separate room of some sort and you could just tell the place was run down. It looked old, the wallpapers were dirty and it was dusty. It was just kind of a unattractive place to eat. The service was also so-so. No one ever came to clear our plates or refill our drinks.   While this buffet is cheaper, it kind of lives up to "you get what you pay for". There are so many great buffets in Vegas. I would definitely avoid this one and maybe pay a little extra $ if you can. It goes a long way!

0HpDCY2o0D_gDlGUTojVvA.text: The wait staff was great, prompt and courteous. Portions were good sized. The french toast was like eating dry bed, but could probably be remedied. Everything else was delicious.  There is even the opportunity to take coffee to go! Great place for a quick breakfast/brunch.

sQgtBPUKv0jacKiULjZnnQ.text: It was a bad idea to have saved my stomach for a huge meal because it's a long wait to get in, and I was near the point of starvation when it was finally our turn to be seated. Once in, however, I was very pleased with the experience and plenty of food to satiate my hunger. They make the inside look like the quartier francais, very quaint and the food classified by province. I made a point to skip the seafood which I can get anywhere else at home and stuck to the more traditional foods like ratatouille veggies, duck a l'orange, creme brulee, etc. The way the tables were set up to accommodate a large group reminded me of the dining room from "Beauty and the Beast."

k6qWvX6aZfVOq63t8Cm8pQ.text: Not bad for buffet food. The atmosphere of the restaurant resembles being in a little Parisian village. Good dessert like the French macarons and fruit tarts, but they could really improve their creme brulee, you're suppose to torch the sugar on top to make it crispy on top.

v_zNx3DuXSsQEkeUxbQMsA.text: I can here with my husband for breakfast before we went to the airport. Sometimes when I pass by this place has a long line. Not much option and didn't think it was good at all. Service was ok but not great either.

L3421pRPRf-EtUrX5I4ZjQ.text: This was my first "Vegas Buffet" experience and I was utterly disappointed.  I found their crab legs too salty. I wanted to eat like a mountain full of crab legs just to feel like I've eaten my money's worth but I couldn't even get myself to finish eating just one. I had the same issue with their "macarons". I've put that word in quotations because I felt like I was eating something out of this world. It tasted so weird we couldn't decide if it was lime or pistachio. I will attach photographic evidence to this review and let the photo speak for itself!  We went around brunch/lunch time on a Friday and the service and overall feel of the place seemed pretty hectic. And there was only ONE WOMEN WASHROOM STALL for the entire buffet. Incredible.  Maybe I had high expectations because the line up going into the buffet was insanely long (actually out of the 4 buffets we ate at in Vegas, we had to wait the longest for Paris).  Not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A very messed up &#34;macaron&#34;. They were ALL like this!

vqj7TRdA-FqKKWRvG6Iosw.text: I wanted to like this buffet, but it ended up being a bit of a disappointment. The food was all very mediocre... the salads were soggy, the meats were overcooked and/or underseasoned, the shrimp were not deveined or deshelled, and the soups were too salty. Not impressed.  The positives were the ambience, crepes (delicious!) and coffee (which, for being mass produced, was pretty good). Overall, not worth the cost.

OSeq3KXbEiIiE-jNoyS3iQ.text: We got here at around 11am and the line os starting to form already. It's $30/person and we found it a good deal for all the different foods you have to choose from. They have good sausages with sauerkraut which is one of my top picks. They also serve some seafoods like crabs,shrimps and mussels. You can have your omelet made in one of the food stations too. But the highlight of this buffet is the crepe station where you can choose from sweet crepes to gourmet crepes. I personally love the banana nutella crepe but my husband tried the caprese crepe and its really good. If you want to have your crepe fast,choose the Asian guy for he is efficient and fast. Lastly,another great thing here is that you can have unlimited mimosas available upto 3pm but if you don't fancy that their cranberry juice is good too. So take time to savor every dish that this buffet has to offer and don't be afraid to try each of them. Just make sure you are super hungry to set your stomach to the scrumptious meal you will have here.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite crepe=banana nutella crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My first plate of everything
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prime ribs..so good!

_biQHSpG0--qjXf9Jc3Xtg.text: Le Village Buffet  was a first for me and I loved it.The buffet was accessible to everyone with no problem and triggered every taste bud I had  in my mouth by looking at everything in front of me. The food was flavorful , fresh and the aroma was heavenly .The organization of the food was really thought through because this could have been a train wreck easily with all of  the tourist/ visitors  running for food. It was packed  and everyone looked hungry. I'm happy I arrived early  and you better believe I tried everything and yes It was delicious (lol). This was a  nice Buffet and Hotel to visit. Try it. AW

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carving Station.AW
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shellfish Station

eyZmG-S6Y2hOi6QuZC4Myg.text: We took a spontaneous trip to Vegas towards the end of September to commit some gluttony, fully armed with a couple of Groupon deals we found for Le Village (inside Paris) & the Spice Market (Planet Hollywood) buffets. yelp.com/biz/spice-marke... From past experiences, there was always a long wait for the Le Village buffet, so I decided to see if they take reservations and to my surprise, they actually do! We were seated rather quickly and the place didn't seem to be as busy as they were in the past (thus the Groupon deal I assume) This particular deal included a bottle of wine of Chard, Cab or Merlot. Unlike the deal at the Spice Market, which offered Miller beer (WTH?), I thought a bottle of wine is a bit classier, so I opted for Merlot. Not wanting to be drunk at lunch time, I was happy to learn though they were required to open the bottle, it was a screw cap and we're allowed to take the rest when we leave. Considering it was a screw cap and a freebie, it actually wasn't too bad. As for the food, the selection was not nearly as plentiful as say Rio, or Studio B (M Hotel) but the quality was evident. Their prime rib was perfect, red, slight bloodiness and had a nice seasoned crust with just the right amount of fat. That was the highlight. All other dishes were very good also. The items were well stocked and kept hot. The crepes were amazing as each was big enough to fill me up. Their dessert selection was much more impressive than the Spice Market (95% cupcakes) Le Village offered macarons, which is very appropriate for being inside Paris. But the one that were served like a lollipop (on a stick) were dry and crumbly, and tasted stale. Overall, it was a better experience than when I went many years ago. Perhaps since they weren't swamped like before, the quality of food and service didn't suffer. Tip: Go to Open Table to make a reservation & also earn points. When you arrive, proceed to the VIP line and avoid the usual long line to get in. What an awesome discovery! You're welcome!

irW7fm1uMzdtYqOrjVQCmQ.text: The buffet wasn't bad. The highlight of the meal was the bottle of wine we got, mussels, clams and the crepes.   The servers were friendly, though not timely. We would wait at least 10 min to get refills on any drinks or even to get our plates cleared but when anyone showed up they were very nice.   I loved loved the selection of cheese. They were pretty much everywhere but some areas I wish there was something to eat w the cheese. Perhaps I am used to eating cheese with crackers or even a selection of cold cut meats would help.   The desserts that were present were yummy and I have no complaints.   The thing that frustrated me the most was out table was uneven. It kept wobbling and literally I'm surprised no cups fell to the ground.  I would recommend this place to go eat but keep in mind it's mostly French inspired foods.

PYvmGUUVOfGQ3LHzQVACZA.text: Food is good! But you have to wait for your drink all night long.... Service need improve a lot !!!!!!!!!

GiBFQW3PTKxkvM2rKcOcPg.text: I got a deal on Travelzoo and I am sorry to say I felt like I was ripped off. It took well over an hour to get into the buffet and once inside I was very disappointed at the selection. Nothing looked fresh and most the selections looked like it came from a can or package. The salad bar looked sloppy and unappetizing. I had the lamb at the carving station and it was grey and tough and tasteless. I then tried a tri tip and took considerable force to cut into it. The dessert are good and the crepe station is the only reason Im giving this place two stars instead of one. Thumbs down.

tFAKna2Se6j3cealMI89rA.text: To make it clear upfront, the food here deserves 5 stars and maybe even more. All the dishes I've tried, from lamb to seafood, were simply phenomenal. Not buffet food by any means.The concept of showcasing different regions of France was great and it was just an excellent experience. We used a Groupon here, but I would easily come back without it.  Main course: tasty duck, juicy lamb leg cuts and pre-cut crab legs Dessert: Creme brulee was amazing and so was tiramisu and macaroons.  The reason I cannot give this 5 stars: Service left much to be desired. Took a long time for the waitress to bring us water and wine. Again, the food was so good that even the lacking service would still make me come here.

NosoQ0tCteWNUC002yDx-w.text: We came for breakfast as part of our gluttony experience (buffet of buffets).  The young man at the crepe station was friendly and fast.  He was awesome.    I tried the ham and cheese. Excellent. The pastries were OK.  The slab bacon and kielbasa wer very good.   After eating at Bacchanal at Caesar's the night before, I didn't have a huge appetite.   I would eat here again however.  It is muuuch better than Spice Market Buffet.   We arrived at 7:15 am.  No waiting.  Small seating area.  I could see how there would be a long wait to get in.

Y000Bd4d8vjBFNc4Qamf-A.text: Had brunch here with a friend.  It cost 33$.  Food was good.  Was lucky enough to come just in time as they were pulling prime rib right out of the oven & it was delicious.  There's a vast selection of food - just your run of the mill buffet food including sushi, and the deserts section was good too with crepes made to order and macaroon lollipops.  Our server Cirilio (sp?) was very kind and attentive.
