Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X05hZVoL2Em8SPopMxFXrQ.text: This place is only good for 1 dinner. We had got the 24 hour pass, and the food was literally the same food from the night before. One waitress we got was really rude and never came back to ask if we wanted refills after she gave us our first cups.

udTtwfYie0n6qZNSStSZ9A.text: What happened? I haven't been to this Buffer since 2013. We went here today for breakfast it must be the worst buffet of all buffets for the price. It used to be good. Now they don't care since they let food run out and plus no smoke salmon? They are being really Cheap about things no. I guess it just the American Corporation way now. Which is Sad :(

PaZDDjTkuXmEkA4AqUADRg.text: I remember this experience being better when I was last here 7 years ago.   Overall the food is still solid. They could do a better job with keeping the buffet stations clean and the food items properly labeled.  They also had several stations blocked by black drapes which was a bit trashy.  With a little better management of these items, it could no doubt be turned around quickly.

twvi4ks-HEQlja3V2ekm8A.text: Used to be a big fan of this place. Today was the worst. Kinda like the buffet in Vegas Vacation.  Very dirty. Not a lot of food out. None of the stations were clean. I get that we were there during the breakfast to lunch transition but the lack of food and lack of cleanliness will lead us to other places to eat. Very disappointed

Gh0tbxLYJpjNNgXc3_7xqw.text: We always make sure to visit this breakfast buffet when we are in Las Vegas. It is so good. The only improvement could be to get some thick cut Canadian bacon on the menu...just an idea.

a9pqdCPy375ez9-4wK-PxQ.text: The Le Village Buffet is not the greatest buffet in Las Vegas. I mean it is only $30 for dinner, but still might as well spend it somewhere else.  The food was okay, nothing great. There was an okay selection but nothing out of the ordinary. The highlight was probably the crepes, but even then the crepes you can get at Jean Philippe is so much better. The macaroons were so stale and the rest of the desserts didn't really taste that great.  The environment is probably the best thing about the buffet because it looks really cool and unique from all the other buffets. Still probably not a good enough reason to pay so much for only subpar food.   Customer service was very friendly and nice.  Overall, just splurge a bit more and go to Bachannal or the Wynn to enjoy a great buffet in Vegas. How often do you get to go to Vegas?

tWy82sAugGe40agraHPsdQ.text: Ok for $30 I expected a good meal.  Had enjoyed the food here on previous visits but found this time to not be so great.  The food choices were pretty limited to basic breakfast choices.  The croissants were so dry (tasted stale) and had no hint of butter (a sin for a 'French' place).  The danish were dry and horrible as well.  I expected more but honestly - the Golden Corral buffet is much better (and I'm NOT a fan of Golden Corral).

P_1FxjQ0NOCb-2Flsd4K3Q.text: This buffet is good, nice variety price is fair food is good. Crap legs and shrimp what more can you want if your looking for seafood. I would definetly come back

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs andsome shrimp too, why go to a seafood buffet when they have it here at a better price, youll save $20 per person her

ApRPON1X1iOpMPk9XAnPnw.text: The buffet is okay, a less than satisfactory experience you'd expect from a buffet in vegas, especially from an iconic hotel such as Paris. You're in the heart of the city , entertainment capital of the world, a leader in the culinary industry. The design of the buffet itself is absolutely gorgeous, making you feel like your outside in a village of France. And it's as far as it gets with it's positivity. The blame here goes on the chef himself/herself. Food is not consistently taken care of making it crust on top, and was not maintained too hot. The selections are varied but the flavors are okay. The waitress we had was quite rude and seemed to always be rushing for us to leave as closing time was approaching in 40 minutes. It is a very sad and heartbreaking experience to be quite honest, with such a beautiful hotel right in the heart of vegas having a mediocre experience. Paris wows you with it's eiffel tower , painted ceilings beautiful decor inside , and is truly crushing the buffet doesn't keep up the standard. Paris was truly a beautiful escape where accordion players would once greet you as you'd walk through the casino. Slowly but surely they have been cutting back a lot for who knows why and the buffet is a victim of this crime. Please go back to how it was, a magical escape, not hey let's go to that average buffet located outside the mall next to the highway

RciZrrSves03sgdX97d32A.text: Bought the 24 hour buffet pass, which seemed like a good deal. What we figured out... We are not really buffet people. There were some good and bad things about the buffet:  Good: Quick seating Great service Good food French food from all areas like Normandy, Burgundy, Provence, etc.  Bad: They were always out of plates and bowls Lots of missing items or out of items. At 4pm they were out of carved turkey and wouldn't have any for 1.5 hours Limited to only French food

yswzvxp-0lxm-CkQYkvlpw.text: The food quality was good; some of it above average; but the service is bizarre and unreliable enough to cost their rating at least two stars.  Yet another meal in Vegas where you'll wait in line to get in for no damned good reason:  plenty of available tables, and yet a handful of hostesses who shuffle back and forth doing nothing in particular, looking at a computer console at the hostess station, ignoring parties waiting to be seated, then shuffling off again.  It was about 2:15 in the afternoon.  We paid $30 for the "champagne brunch" that was running until 3 p.m.  The crowd was dwindling; there were many open tables, but we still waited (why?) for the indifferent hostesses to shuffle over and be bothered to seat us.  We were well into eating what we'd collected from the buffet on our first trip through before a waitress came by to take drink orders.  They don't bring you water unless you order it.  Food was pretty good, by my estimation.  I got a decent slab of prime rib; not too rare, not too fatty, yet still tender.  Mussels were slightly overcooked, but overall capably done.  The potatoes au gratin had just been refreshed as I arrived; and they were excellent.  The crepe bar was good enough, though the crepe itself was a bit flavorless and tasted as though it had come from a boxed mix.  Vegetables near the prime rib station could have used another minute of cooking, but were respectable.  The crab legs were fresh and still plump and appetizing.  Pasta dishes were a little mushy and overcooked.  The mini creme brulees were a pleasure, with flecks of real vanilla bean and a tasty, crisp, caramelized sugar crust.  The fruit selection at the salad bar was disappointing and thin.  But the service really needs to wake the hell up to be worth $30.  A waitress had just brought us refills of Pepsi before we got up to make our 2nd run through the buffet.  We deliberately put our flatware off to one side so that whoever was collecting our empty plates would leave it alone.  When we got back, plates, flatware, and Pepsis were all gone.  Yes, somebody had taken away our freshly-refilled sodas.  Why?  Beats me.  Our original waitress had gone off shift while we were at the buffet for Round 2, and the new one could not be less interested in bringing us replacement flatware.  There are no place settings or utensils available on the buffet, just plates.  So we rummaged in some drawers in a buffet storage/credenza in the dining room behind us, and grabbed our own forks and knives.

i3j_0oVjIGQwj3_g0My05w.text: Our Server "Isela" was great. Food is good and tasty. Enjoyed the desserts. My wife and I enjoyed our dinner. Got a heavy and full belly on the way out.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

94vLi6GdKsGBsUWn1M4YpA.text: Awesome brunch! This is my go to place for buffet brunch in Vegas. Unlimited champagne and mimosas for the alchies! Nice buzz every time when eating brunch here, love it.  I think this buffet deserves better ratings. I have been here many times and never had a problem with service, I find all the waitress to be friendly and very down to earth. The ambiance is quite dark and it may not be fancy schmancy looking like the Wynn buffet but I love the food.  My favorite is the prime rib, very tender and tasty. The made to order crepes stuffed with bananas or fruits of your choice are another highlight. Yes, they also have unlimited amounts of long crab legs as I know a certain population only go to these buffets for the crabs. You know who you are!  Can't go wrong with the brunch buffet here especially with unlimited champagne and mimosas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ed8Dhu7fKGcuaH6EROESQA.text: Make reservations on Open Table!! We waited 1.5 hours in the dinner line after obtaining our Buffet of Buffets pass. Their dinner buffet is 3 stars but their prime rib definitely makes up for it. One of the best I've ever had.   We made reservations for 9am breakfast the next day and it was definitely worth it! The line was already as long as it was the night before. The crepes and this place is very good. Their #1 (Nutella/banana) and #5 (mushroom/spinach) were our favorites. Their smoked salmon from the salad bar also went really well with the #5 crepe. Will definitely make a stop back for breakfast when we come back.

Z-X0_igHhnA-KEyfQf4KWA.text: Nope, nope, nope! For the price this place is an abomination to good food. Yes, they have some edible things - the mac and cheese is pretty good  (hard to screw up mac and cheese), the soup du jour was a lobster bisque and it was perfect. However the prime rib was very dry and hard to chew, the potatoes au gratin looked very unappetizing. Worst of all- the macarons!!! I got excited when I saw macarons in the dessert section only to be extremely disappointed when I bit into one- very flaky, air bubbles inside, way too sweet and turns into a chewey clump in your mouth. I just couldn't believe they get away with calling this stuff macarons. Oh, and the service was very slow, my husband said the slow service is the only thing that reminds him of France. $32 per person is so not worth it.

7HFnPPTBBavufCk9DKREtQ.text: My wife and I brought our auntie and her daughter here for brunch on their last day of vacation. The dishes that stood out were the french onion soup, clams, and of course, crepes. The food was good but there was no dish that really stood out for me. I would probably put this buffet in the middle of the pack along with the Mirage and Monte Carlo. FYI: The secret to getting both the breakfast and lunch foods is to stay in line at around 1020 am. Hopefully you will reach the end by 11 am and that's when the fresh lunch food will be served but you will have paid the cheaper breakfast price instead.

qqS9qO9zteCwACCAHeOraQ.text: This was well worth it!   Crepes are to die for.  Enormous selection of different breakfast items.  Well done!!!   The ham and potatoes were my favorite.  The variety of pastries and the different options for hot items makes this a no-brained if you're hungry and in Vegas.

LOWgTGq6gnXB6EsVff-Pdg.text: I'm bewildered as how this Buffett gets as many stars as it does. Nothing memorable at all. Bland tasting mass produced food. Even the crepes which looked to be promising just missed the mark.   Save your money and go elsewhere.

X1sQ7s5B5EcYcx9sWvPnJA.text: Not a buffet lover but decided since that's Vegas I needed to try one. The Le Village Buffet was rated the best in Vegas and I can see why. The food was delicious and there was plenty of it. I can't imagine anyone making it through all the selections available. Please save room for dessert, I should have started here. I had the lunch buffet and the price is on the high end for Vegas buffets (but you are at the Paris) but worth the extra dollars to make sure you get good food. Very little wait but we were there on a weekday. As you pay for your meal you are asked if you want to add an additional amount for drinks. Do this if you are going to be drinking alcohol as more than one glass can pay for it. Dress was casual for lunch.

kcYOhqhn-WOzoRfEfDgN2A.text: This used to be one of the top two or three buffets in Vegas. While it's still good, it's starting to feel the effects of downsizing the number of options it serves, and I can't quite put it in the same tier as the buffets at Caesar's, Bellagio, or Wynn.  What they serve is usually pretty good. I remember they did a tri-tip one night that was absolutely excellent, and their prime rib never disappoints. They also get points for a very good dessert section.  If you get the Buffet of Buffets deal (which I'd advise; if you eat at more than one buffet in 24 hours, it pays for itself), or are just in the neighborhood, this is a pretty solid lunch or dinner option (haven't eaten breakfast here, so I can't comment on that). Unfortunately, it used to be GREAT, and it isn't anymore.

ou_MLaSof7-gdINpnHJfqA.text: My family bought 2 groupons. Each includes a bottle of wine and the buffet for 2 people. We got there early so we did not have to wait in line. However, the line was long when we were leaving. They had a wide variety of French food - they even had sushi. Not sure how that fits the French theme but people seemed to enjoy it.  Food highlights: Pork belly Brie and bacon Mac and cheese  Dessert: Amazing!! Tina of macarons Soft serve ice cream Cookies Carrot cake Other cakes and cookies   Our server was very nice and was constantly refilling our water glasses  The buffet was good - not the best in town but still enjoyable. The inside is decorated like old French streets.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lots of dessert

HkV_HpAvoHquNtK8uBDZ0g.text: My parents had raved about this one but I thought it was just okay ... maybe I don't like French food, who knows. They have a make your own crepe station which is great but the line was long. They have only ONE bathroom stall in the ladies' restroom which wasn't cool, there was a huge line.  Check in on Foursquare and you get a coupon for $5 off, my friend and I did that and went there for breakfast - not a bad deal. The ambiance is nice and the food was a step above the Flamingo's buffet, which we also went to, but that was about it.

Q0Qcsz_NVzfq8_8MQqx0AQ.text: I seem to come in here almost every time I come to Vegas.  I am usually staying nearby or right here in Paris or Bally's so its convenient, but its also pretty good and with your card you get a discount.  I have purchased the 24 hour buffet pass and have come in here just to get those beautiful Macarons.  I feel that bumps up my making it worth it factor for just a snack, but you have to hit it just right when there isn't a line.  This place is pretty busy and if you aren't staying here or nearby you might not get the opportunity to just walk in and have to wait a bit in line but the food is worth it.  The quality is higher than some other buffets on the strip but there is something for everyone and there is no way your leaving hungry.  If you want to enjoy the unlimited mimosas thats only an extra $12 so drink up and get your tipsy on too while you enjoy some freshly prepared (just for you) crepes and chill out with your macarons too. Thats what I did.  I will certainly be back again when I am in town.

eCII9Ctyq5YXrhzRAkq6Zw.text: The signature treats in this buffet are the crepes and the macaroons. Crepes are prepared to order with the ingredients you choose from their selection. They are topped with jam, whipped cream and powdered sugar. Extremely delicious! The presentation and set up need a little bit of work, though. Not all the stations are maintained cleaned. Read my extended review in my blog: lagamio.com/2014/04/29/l...

YDnz4ycE_IkD4sXYP187RA.text: $30.99 for all-you-can-eat? I'm sold. The all-you-can-drink deal is a great value as well. But what was more noteworthy was the food. Boy was it delicious! I also loved the atmosphere of the place and had quite a relaxing dining experience. My only complaint was the long wait, but this place is busy for a reason. Definitely worth the wait. I've been here before and I will definitely come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WwcqE0ijDUQfy4NYAVXr2A.text: My new favorite LV buffet! What's up with buffets not having bathrooms on the premises? I mean, I get it from a practicality standpoint - keep em full - but isn't there a health code violation somewhere in there? I don't get it.  Dessert bar looked amazing but I didn't get to try anything because a) it was 1pm and I am not an orca and b) there was nothing glutard-friendly aside from some ice creams and other dairy-esque things that I was not brave enough to try before my drive back to LA.  Better than most. If you've got time and some options, choose this one. I think I ate like 12 whole sweet potatoes FTW.

tmyGOWvHHx8XiF-TMCU2_Q.text: Buffets are my kryptonite.  This one is my fave one out of the Buffet-of-Buffets offerings.  When you get endless visits to pile on the dishes you enjoy, it equates to non-stop eating... so I'm not even going to attempt listing what they offer except a few of the memorable dishes here:  * custom-crepe station - hello both savory and sweet concoctions! * Andouille sausage - spicy and fatty! * grilled chicken thighs - super tender! * fresh crab legs platter - ahh, endless too.  SO good! * mimosas - just what the brunch ordered! * cheesecake bites - heavy cream-cheese goodness!  not enough?  go back for 2nds or 3rds...  Service was friendly and our drinks never remained empty...for long.

FgjUo1WlS_6TS7GPVPwqwQ.text: This place was not even worth $30.99!!!! No selection on food and the deserts sucked, if you pay $30.99 I would expect a little more then half cut crab legs!! Never coming back here, we left hungry and unsatisfied!

pNRZZln9GFU5zurjk9QGMQ.text: Paris Buffet food better than fair. Ambiance very nice, quaint. The one downside is while eating, dish carts were coming through the aisles where customers walk to go to the buffet. For the price, I thought it was classier years ago. Dinner was just better than fair.  Classier years ago. Still a good deal though.

4md_4bZ38SCJsqgjND7Grg.text: My husband and I went to gorge ourselves on seafood, duck l'orange, and french pastries. The food was very good: sushi, crab legs, yummy cold seafood and salads. Crepes. Macarons. Cheese. Pate'. Duck l'orange. Great vegetables.   Minus one star for the all-you-can-drink portion. The wine was nasty -- sweet like Livingston or a comparable brand (which I wish I didn't even know, but sadly I do.)  Just do all-you-can-eat and drink somewhere else for the money the all-you-can-drink costs.

LGzbDhq-WHR8-XXpZXjgFg.text: Kudos to Le Village Buffet for being the only buffet I've been to that serves Sierra Mist.  Very unexpected for a buffet I've bookmarked for a while now. By unexpected, I mean average.  Not a lot of variety of food. I had 3 plates of food and came back with almost the same stuff. Prime rib is great - when is prime rib ever not? Do NOT get the "mashed potatoes". They're only semi-mashed..they're all mushed slices of potatoes.   The sushi bar isn't so great. There were only about 3-4 kinds of sushi, which weren't so great. I loved the shrimp & cocktail bar, all the shrimps just lying there. Also, get the crab legs, they're fresh! The BEST part about the buffet was the crepe section. There's a long line for it but well worth the wait. The crepes are good, and you get to choose as much fillings as you want. Really nice lady behind the counter.   And by the way, what's with people not leaving tips? At least leave a dollar for God's sakes, seeing that there are waiters there who clean up your mess. My waiter was so nice, very energetic, despite that he seemed old, but had my plates off the table once I've finished, so huge props to him!   I wouldn't say I got my $30 worth since I've had better, but it's not the worst I've had.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T4bzsq9sul3Q3m4laTiJkQ.text: I thought 33.50 (price without member card) was a bit much, but the food was surprisingly good!  I enjoyed pretty much all the things I put on my plate. I liked all the pastas, different potatoes, cream of spinach, grilled lamb and a bunch more! Desserts were good too! I liked the creme brule and some of the other cakes. Overall I was happy with all the food I got and thought for buffet food, it was great! I walked out happy and full :)  I'd go again, but I'd get a member card for $3 bucks off :P

mjxILuLcQKyO-_iQLZ3DZQ.text: Overpriced , gross , smelly , & old ! Very rude waitresses and sticky tables ! I was so disgusted after ! I felt sick the whole day ! Don't go here ! Go to " The Wicked Spoon Buffet " @ the Cosmopolitan Hotel !

FB1sPHYc8gnyBn0CBTirkw.text: Not only have I experienced better, but this buffet is a complete RIP OFF! Le Village Buffet should be filed under the RIP OFF Report and reported to the BBB for fraud! They call this French food? Where's the smell of butter, where are the homemade pastries, what's up with the peasant uniforms and why are they serving pita bread, but not one French fry is in sight. In short, this buffet lacks authenticity and bang for your buck. For the price head to Red Rock, Caesars or even the Cosmo.  The line was about 100 suckers long at 9 p.m and they close at 10. When we finally got a table the food lacked freshness and the entire buffet seemed like it was closing. Tables were open all over the place, btw. For $33.50 a person I'd expect for them to at least turn up the damn lights; everything seemed covered in a haze and I wasn't even drunk. Only buffet I walked the length of and came up empty.   It was mostly shellfish, but the carving station offered turkey breast and dry roast beef. The sides of Brie Mac and Cheese and Cavatapi Pasta were delicious, but who goes to a buffet for that? They had single servings of Beef Bourguignon (pot roast), which were good, but again where was the good stuff? The salad bar had a overly dressed Caesar salad that tasted as if they forgot to wash the lettuce.  Lastly, the buffet lacked variety, they had sushi, but not one PIZZA? They offered cold apple pie, but no petit fours! Cheap yogurt out of a machine, but no freshly made ice cream? Bread rolls, but no croissants.  Turkey gravy, but no hollandaise! I didn't leave hungry, because I'm a trooper, but I definitely will never go back or recommend to any of my friends.  For a country famed for their food and a company that just spent millions re-doing Caesars buffet I thought I a great dinner was in order. Wrong!

5vcva2SmF7CwxUJ9t8XZPg.text: I was there with my family for new year and I think there is really no difference between this buffet and other buffet! They had unhealthy foods and we did not enjoy. The only food I liked from this buffet was the salmon. The price was really high. So I made a reservation around december 1st and on that time they said the price will be 30 dollars but when we got there they said 35 dollars and that is the holiday price! anyways with the reservation we did not have to wait in any kind of lines and as soon as we got there we went through VIP door. don't go there If you don't have any reservation because there will be a huge line and long waiting time! The waiter, Tram, was a really nice guy and he did his best to provide the best service.

gvxP1UmuT87-7S0bcf5QTw.text: One of our absolute favorite buffets on the Strip! The ambience in Le Village is absolutely charming, it feels like you're dining outdoors in a little French village. Lovely atmosphere, good service.  The menu is always great, breakfast includes the usual staples as well as fancy eggs benedict, delicious pastries, lots of unusual sausages, even prime rib hash. The famous crepe station is busier than ever in the morning and is delicious!  The lunch is even better with lots of heartier foods, including some divine tri tip grilled steak bits which rivalled the roast beef and prime rib. Le Village has some of the most delicious Yukon mashed potatoes I've ever eaten - they're REAL potatoes and are richly golden in color, so buttery and creamy, you'll love 'em.  The crepe station is fabulous, offering several options for a filling - we tried the Brandy Apples with Caramel sauce (with a huge helping of fresh whipped cream on top) and the Bananas Foster with a drizzling of chocolate sauce. I'd pay $15 just for one of these and a cup of coffee out in the real world! Don't miss it!

m78ndJIuMDe7qX2RCkAejg.text: I generally dislike buffets, but this offered some unique French-styled options. Shellfish, pastas, vegetables/salads were above average and desserts exceeded expectations. 4 stars, but graded within the buffet curve!! Located within Paris Casino. Service was friendly, but just fair.

DUdYPuQ-rVCaWMYcsIGq1g.text: A very good buffet. They have different foods arranged by the regions of France they originate from, a nice touch. They have meats, cheeses, breads, pastas, potatoes, veggies, etc. There's also a crepe station where you can get savory or sweet crepes made for you. The other desserts are excellent too. It cost like $30/person, which sounds like a lot but it's actually not as high as some of the other Vegas buffets I researched. The one negative about this place was the long line and wait to get seated.

tBH7dEa0Q-C9eaSClPAc_Q.text: Another day another buffet. Oh yes.  This buffet is definitely more like a normal buffet, some good items, 1 or 2 excellent, and the rest just meh. I give it more points though because there were more unusual items and I found some things I really liked. Still though, at 25 it's not a bad one to go to. I found enough things to make my tummy happy anyways.  Sunday night I waited about 45 minutes to get in. Their line is situated right in front of their buffet with a good view of the inside. So you can kinda see what the place looks like and all. Basically looks like the rest of Paris, so I was kinda excited to be able to eat in a cute quaint "Parisian" atmosphere. Ok so i've never been to Paris, but ya get what I'm talking about. Unfortunately I was shunted off to the side room near the bathroom so that just left the eating part to indulge in.  The stations are all divided into certain areas of Paris with slightly different themes, the dessert station is smack in the middle near the fruit and salad and crab legs station. The best things were the snow crab legs, and the crepes. I don't particularly like king crab legs since they tend to be drier and less flavorful. Snow crab legs are smaller and more work, but I think worth it. They cut slits in the legs here so it wasn't that hard to crack and the meat pulled right out. I really could've eaten so much of this but I didn't want to fill up tooo much. Crepes were made to order, fruity dessert crepes made in a weird location though. Right inbtwn dinner food and not at the dessert area. You picked the stuff inside, they make it, then you top it off with whatever you like. Whipped cream, nuts, fudge, caramel and other things.  There were other things that were pretty decent, but not excellent. At the end I noticed that they had a crayfish dish! I had seen the dish before, but no crayfish since someone prolly picked them all out. Boo...I would've loved to just eat those. Plenty of veggies here also, cooked in several different ways. A cheese platter area, and different types of bread. Desserts were decent, the mini fruit tart was tasty. Brownies too.  Good priced buffet for what you get. Hehe I might come back just to ransack the crayfish dish.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small Fruit Tart

S0KbCikSTXPmzS5Y3Gf_UA.text: Le village buffet dessert has a 33% acceptable rating per Jon. The creme brulee was at least brulee'd here; however the creme lacked body and flavor. Cheese cake was the usual central kitchen fail. The eclaire was stale and creme was the same failed concoction in most of their desserts. The only acceptable dishes offered was their macaroons and flan. Macaroons were soft and moist with good flavor. Flan had body and was covered in light simple syrupy that doesn't over power the flan. This concludes the dessert review of le village buffet

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessertsto avoid
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Acceptable dessert dishes at Le village Buffet.

2_oLLptNeUJT5Y6o3aNFJA.text: They didn't have a good variety. And whatever they had did not match with anything else to eat. They didn't even have pizza! What buffet doesn't have pizza??? No Asian station. This buffet is only good for breakfast.

0OFnNq1Zosu-8nONOuomIg.text: A dinner here is never second best...after all, miss, this is France.   I sang this song in my head for the entire meal at Le Buffet. The ambience of this French themed buffet reminded me of Beauty and the Beast. Unlike most fluorescent lighted buffets, this buffet is beautifully decorated. It's like eating in a French village under a lovely clear blue sky.   The food is good and a step above traditional buffet foods. The roast beef and prime rib were both wonderful. The crepe station is awesome! What could be better than a fresh made crepe?!?   At $30 for dinner, it's a little pricey but what buffet in Vegas isn't anymore? Next time, I'll be sure to take advantage of the $45 all-you-can-eat in 24 hours deal, which included six buffets in the Harrah's family of casinos.

mrivSB4VM0gSIX0ces7b4g.text: Amazing brunch buffet. Bacon and hashed browns are yummy along with fresh fruit. Coffee is delicious with hazlenut cream. Grapefruit and orange juice to start out our day. Best part of Paris buffet are the CREPES! #1 banana nutella crepe with powdered sugar, chocolate, and candied hazlenuts is awesome along with #4 apple with brandy and chocolate. This place is super cute and makes you feel as if you were in a cafe in Paris. Waiters are super friendly. Love it here! My favorite!

Tb7rYZVHxdoDxeGsbgwksw.text: Reading the mixed reviews for some of the buffet items, I concentrated my calories on the famous crepes.  There is a line for the crepe station, but it went pretty quickly.  I waited maybe 15 minutes, and it was well worth it.  I ordered a savory crepe with mushrooms, spinach, and parmesan and a sweet crepe with Nutella and bananas.  Then pretending I was a food artist I paired the savory crepe with salad and smoked salmon.  I then got some fresh strawberries to accompany my sweet crepe.  Both crepes were delicious!  Since we were here a little before 11 a.m. (the latest time for breakfast prices), they also started to change the breakfast dishes out for lunch items.  The only lunch items I tried were the sushi and seaweed salad.  Both were pretty good, but nothing special.    If you're in the mood for all-you-can-eat crepes, Le Village is a winner!  The ambiance will also make you feel like you are dining in a charming Parisian courtyard.

cUkt85ls-sy3oa2UNs5G_A.text: My absolute favorite place to eat in Vegas!  I love the crepes!! What I really like is that this buffet actually has flavor in all its food! The desserts are pretty amazing! Like I said though, you have to have a crepe for sure :)

-jye8K9HiW7QU8JuCcFipQ.text: Great buffet. Lots of delicious options. Very fresh!  The crepe station is awesome and I could have eaten a dozen of them! Definitely recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana crepe with vanilla and chocolate sauce!

xpsQGeQuYu0N3R7JCe-Aug.text: We ate here at our recent stay at the Paris hotel and it was pretty decent. It's kind of nice how they have the tables spread out into different patios/buildings that reflect a little Parisian village.  The food was average, but not disappointing. The only two things I was sad about was that the 1st serving of eggs Benedict had an egg that had been cooked all the way through (due to the heat lamp) but since it's a buffet I just got another and it was fine.  The other thing that bugged me was that there Corned Beef Hash was made by simply using shredded Hash Browns as an ingredient. Just seemed like a lazy move to me. The next day I had Corned Beef Hash next door at Le Cafe Ile Saint Louis, and they were perfectly prepared and cooked with poached eggs on top! So I recommend going next door for that :)  The Croissants were soft inside yet crunchy on the outside, so good!

i42V9Uc164mzCQrV_vx5TQ.text: Great option if you're at Ballys or Paris-buffet is sort of between the two. Came around 6pm on a Friday night, so we beat most of the dinner rush. Wait was about 20 minutes still but the staff were kind and accommodating of our 1 wheelchair. Price was about $30 per person, dinner rate. Food was fairly decent, they refilled often and there was plenty to try from. The spread is kind of random, there's no real order to what goes where (minus the desserts in center), you do sort of have to walk the whole buffet to see what's where. Our server was very good once she eventually got to us-they were very understaffed and she was literally running back and forth to her tables. They offer hot crab legs which was a plus!

pKz0tstznCSKFPUrLBMG5Q.text: I tried brunch buffet. And it's really good. So many selection from seafood to beef and pork. They make omelette and crepes for you and the line was shorter than i expected. All the servers are really kind and trying to make your visit as pleasant as possible. If you stay in Paris hotel, definitely try!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Omelette
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes

CYre8kKkX5dgOfBOkEaCVg.text: Decided to go to Le Village Buffet based on their holiday menu. I was really disappointed to see that some of dishes I was looking forward to they ended up not doing last minute. I understand things happen and their bakery didn't send them any macaroons this morning, etc,  but I would at least expect an apology of some sort.  It was also a little ridiculous that almost half of the stations were either unlabeled or mislabeled.  The food was barely adequate, obviously low quality and not fresh.  The only thing that gave it the second star was the ambiance - absolutely beautiful French village, lovely.

9muk1YZFp0PmvKPYjpNFHw.text: Not a bad buffet. Came here for breakfast when I did the buffet of buffets. For breakfast... I can't say there is anything really "special" about it. They do make FRESH hot crepes here, which are in fact very yummy!!! The line however, is very long... I suggest getting in line when you fill like you may be starting to fill up because by the time you get your food, you will be hungry again!! LOL. I got 2 crepes, as did most people because the line is so long, you might as well get 2 crepes. I got a sweet and savory crepe. There is a menu board that list the types of crepes available, but you can order a custom one if you want. They will make whatever crepe you want within reason. I got a banana nutella one and for my savory, a chicken with asparagus. Both were flavorful and delicious!! Right outside the buffet is a crepe place... charging $10.50 a crepe... my 2 crepes already covered the cost of breakfast, $20 here! LOL.  I think next time I would try lunch or dinner to see if it's really as good as I remembered since I think the crepes are offered all day. I was thinking it was just breakfast so that's why I had breakfast here. Breakfast tasted better than average. There was a good variety and the mini waffles were just so cute! A lot of sausage variety also and at least 3 types of potatoes that I saw! I didn't like the potato triangles as they were too dry, but the hash browns were good and so were the sliced potatoes (can't remember what it's called)  When I left, it had switched over to lunch, but I was too full already to go try lunch. Fresh crepes is why this place deserves a 4 star!  This was the only buffet we had to wait it... about 30 minutes. This is also the only buffet that you can make a reservation with via open table. I did not try that, so I'm not sure how well that works...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks like paris!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 1
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 2. Sweet and savory crepes. Fresh made to order

-vLMvIdpqAv5zPSD9ffGoA.text: Service was on point. The food appears to be pretty consistent as this is my third time having lunch here. The lunch and dinner menu seem very similar.  My favorite part are the desserts. I absolutely love the fruit tarts and often find myself grabbing a bunch ( for peace of mind) lol.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit tarts !
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Prices.

gO06HGn7pbVg6i55O6jbCw.text: Best buffet out of the 3 I visited on my Vegas visited. The first night I had it it blew me away because of how amazing it was. Everything was perfect and there was so much to choose from. The second time we went we were pretty disappointed because it wasn't as good as it had been the night before but I brought it to the managers attention and he was very kind and understanding about the situation and gave us a full refund! We will probably return because I believe they were just having an off night.

iMYsFLoOC3oMi6p5Dlwqvg.text: We're in Vegas.. Do a Buffet. We're in the Paris hotel, might as well do theirs, right?  So we looked up the price on line, Cool! $25  head.. Not so cool.. $35 a head when we get to the registers. Weekend pricing in effect. *FacePalm*     We had a wheelchair in our party and when the seating girl came to us, she admonished us for being in the wrong line.  No one told us differently. There were no signs and the register girl didn't tell us otherwise either, so I'm not sure how we were supposed to intuit where we were to go. Her tone was rude and snippy.  However, we didn't have to wait long for a seat, we were shown quickly to a place close to the food and seated.   The first thing I noticed? The overwhelming stink of seafood. To me, it turns my stomach. I'm certain to others "fresh fish & seafood" smells great, but it made me want to throw up.  But I put that aside as we all took our seats and the majority of our party went to get in line and serve themselves up some food.   There were MANY Selections. Everyone came back with something different, something good. For me, My first stop was the salad bar. I chose a Caprese salad and a bowl of some of the best potato leak soup I've ever had the pleasure of eating. It was made with real cream, and you can tell the difference that makes.  The Caprese salad was good, but there wasn't any basil left on the plate. *sad* I had a small green salad too, but the grilled chicken I chose to go with it, was awfully dried out.  For my main course, I chose steamed veggies, some potatoes augratin, sauteed mushrooms, Prime rib that was a bit over done, grilled lamb, taziki sauce and some parmesan flat bread.  The food was, for the most part, well done and very tasty.   Dessert was a bit of a challenge, but I looked through the options and chose to have my first Macaroon, a Macaroon tart with black berries, a Creme caramel & a lemon tart. I wasn't impressed with the green macaroon. The Macaroon tart with black berries was FABULOUS. The creme caramel (Aka flan) Was ok, and the lemon tart was.. no, there was no lemon, it was a pastry shell with meringue. GROSS.    So for the most part, the buffet would have been fine at $25, but so not worth the extra money, especially if you don't eat from the sushi and raw bar, which none of us did... As one of my party said "I wanted to try the sushi but it doesn't look fresh or healthy"

8pyCvg1-qnplTV3OuWAafA.text: This is a good buffet:: the price is a bit much-- I usually go here for the Breakfast which is AMAZING-- but falls short for lunch and dinner--  CAPRIZI salad, Crab and Clams are your crave this stop is for you!!  Not for the Meaty at heart.. There were meats but cooked (frozen) and just tasted over all ( not Appetizing ) there were Skillets with Ham-- they were good!  The desert was bomb as u can see from my photos- simply yum--  I attacked the crime brulee !!  Lol!! Happy eating all!! Oh! The first glass of wine is free and a mellow red--

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes and macaroons!!

BupYQ5bWkuj1sNI_GcPBbg.text: Before leaving Vegas, my friend and I wanted to hit up an affordable buffet. We both agreed on Paris' Le Village Buffet. $30.99 per person for brunch..not bad!  We waited about a good 45 minutes or so..and the customer service was great!  We were seated in kind of a dark cornered area which was kind of lame, but at least we were to ourselves.  The food? Tasty. Small buffet, but good food nonetheless. They had their Mediterranean area, seafood, breakfast items, dessert bar, omelette and crepe makers, etc.  Not gonna lie..all of the food I got..DELICIOUS.  Got me some grilled chicken that was juicy and flavorful, tasty roasted potatoes, AMAZING yukon gold mashed taters, and this creamy truffled pasta they had? Omg. I pretty much filled my second plate with just that lol.  They had brioch french toast which was just okay. It was moist, but meh.  Sadly, their desserts..allll blah. I didn't like any of them. Creme brulee was kind of chunky-ish..macarons just looked horrible. White chocolate chip cookies..so dry, and when I bit into them, it just broke apart into 4 pieces. Disappointing desserts, but tasty main meals.

TSy6FW_u5rGYjtJsdAMnyA.text: I have been to the Paris buffet many times and it was always good (not spectacular but good).   I went with a friend last Wednesday and the food was MEDIOCRE at best.   The noise level was HORRENDOUS with service personnel pushing carts across the brick floors loaded with dishes -- and it was constant.  The cart made an inordinate amount of noise with dishes loaded on it and we could not hear each other talk.   I will not be going there again unless they figure out a quieter way to move items around.   The price for the breakfast buffet is moderate but the food is sub-par.   Someone needs to come in and renovate this restaurant.

WgLG51DsPvH0t7xU6rOHOA.text: The crepe station is the best part of this buffet. Food choices are great. Unlimited mimosas is a huge plus.   I suggest making a reservation or you'll be waiting awhile especially if you go on a weekend day.   Service was great when we were actually being attended but not a big deal since it is a buffet, you can pretty much expect that.   Definitely worth a visit if you're in Vegas!

2qdjLAPfMLBn3smnhFNdYw.text: I haven't done many buffets in Vegas. I'm too into food I think. It's a problem. However, my friend's dad swore by this buffet in Paris.   I'm still not big into buffets, but I'll give my review.   $24 for the buffet and $11 for bottomless drinks. If you gamble, just save the $11 and go sit at a table or slots. You'll have a couple of mediocre drinks and be on your way. Plus, we waited in line for 15-20 minutes so you tend to want to eat and go about your day.   You've got food from all over the world. This is their theme or attractiveness. I had nothing that surprised me with pleasantness.   I'd recommend getting small portions at each station so you can taste a variety. My friend didn't do this and ended up having one tall hodgepodge of a plate. Plus, you might as well taste it all incase something does entice your tastebuds.   The seafood is supremely overcooked. The mussels had the consistency of smoked oysters. The clams were stuck like chuck to the shell and if you pry them out, you'll end up chewing some shell. Woof.   The meat was tough and dry. And overcooked.   Get some cocktail shrimp. That's a safe good thing.   There was a station that was savoit (something like that, sorry), and the veggies were ok. There was a tomato salad that was also very ok. It could have used more reduced balsamic reduction.   This is all a reach. It wasn't good. This did not turn my dislike of buffets around.

ReV0OXEeH-p8EJQ2lFS1eQ.text: This is a good buffet. Not great, but good and not crazy expensive.  We paid around $52 for two of us and the also have $12 all you can drink bloody Marie's, mimosa, beer, and wine add on.  The food is fresh and varied. We were there for lunch and had shrimp, but no crab. There were several quintessential French dishes - bouillabaisse, choucroute, crepes, mussels, and cassoulet.  The cheese offering was disappointing and the bread and croissant, lackluster. They had pate, but no mousse.  The French onion soup, prime rib, creamed spinach, and sauteed mushrooms were exquisite! The coffee was fresh and strong and the creme brulee delicious.  They had macaroons, which would have been great on their own, but they were sandwiched  around ridiculously sweet custard of sort and that ruined them.  The restaurant is clean and the service was fine. One of our favorite buffets in Vegas and make it a point to always visit.

Z3y01i3rofYOZ_GgLlOOpA.text: Totally unimpressed with Le Village Buffet!  Ate here during the holidays last year, and it was a 4 out of 5 star when the food was a little above average.  Visited here on Father's Day with a friend from SC and my brother and sister-in-law in hopes of celebrating Father's Day.  BIGGEST MISTAKE EVER!!!  The hostess sat us at a table near the desserts, which we did not choose.  The duck, prime rib were so bland and dry!  I had to dress it up over and over before it was up to decent edible flavor. :( I was in total disbelief as to how disappointing the meat was.  I was so turned off, that nothing else seemed up to par except for the Crepe's.  It saved the day!  I had the banana-nutella.  But, now that the crepe shop opened up across from the buffet, the buffet should now be shut down, sealed & condemned because it shouldn't cost  $33.55 for a good crepe.    Service was definitely a MINUS -5 stars.  Servers were dazed and not helpful with ingredients when asked.  My brother had seen tables around us getting their frozen crab legs steamed, so he got a plate full of crab legs and asked the server where to get them steamed.  He instructed him to have the waitress take them to the steamer.  When he asked the waitress, she said our table was for 7Diamond card holders only, and that we were mistakenly seated in the area where only the 7Diamond card holders are seated, and that in no way was she allowed to steam our crab legs.  The manager was requested, and arrived with an attitude before he even spoke. Since we were mistakenly seated in the wrong area, he was going to reprimand the hostess.  No compensation for the customer or apology!  As manager, he could have at least appeased my brother (on Father's Day) and steamed just this once since it was their mistake and not ours that we were seated in the 7Diamond area...?!!  Wth..?  Voices got loud, but the manager clearly was unable to manage his hot temper and proceeded to call security to have us removed.  Asked for our money back and were ignored.    PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND BYPASS THIS MONSTROSITY OF A PIG STY!    Am I upset?  You bet!!  Go to The M, Bellagio or South Point, you'll be glad you did!  There's a definite disconnect among the hostess, servers, waitress & the unqualified manager who definitely needs more training.

Hk7TRqL_nx_Soz76-1PEug.text: I bought tickets to Jersey Boys which included a voucher to the Le Village buffet ($87 for ticket and buffet). I assumed it would be mediocre however I was pleasantly surprised. The service was above average compared to the other buffets in Vegas. The selection isn't huge but the food is flavorful. They have seafood, crab legs, carving stations, salad bar, large dessert section.Their pasta infused with truffle was delicious. The desserts were great too! Highly recommend this place for the taste me value, it's on the cheaper end for buffets. Wish we had more room in our belly and time to try more food.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uyKYtUtq8YE6j0S5F5mw9Q.text: The Buffet at Paris is very good for the price. I think it's more important to compare value in dining, especially in Vegas.  On a weekday night the cost is $31 and it includes crab legs. They also have prime rib and a crepe station. The food was full of flavor and the staff very friendly.

_PlNCWDcIbOR6fJRCxa88g.text: Very low maintenance, short staff, food are badly tasted, cold and unfresh! We came here for the nice blue sky environment and they assigned us to a room has no view. When I asked if we could change to a better view table she assigned me to a crappy corner table right beside the restroom, while when I looked around there were still so many tables that are still empty. They created a fake line up while inside were tons of tables that were available. The choice of food were very limited and croissants were cold and hard. The place is very short staff as we only got our plates picked up twice during the entire buffet. Ladies Restroom is out of maintenance too so we had to go outside. The men restroom was so dirty. The only thing that is okay quality is the made to order crepe, but even that, the strawberries and bananas that go inside the crepes were all pre-syrup so they all taste soggy and too sweet. For that price should definitely go to other buffets instead. Oh one more thing started charging a four year old while all other buffets starts at five years old. Won't come back again for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy frozen strawberries and bananas inside the crepe. Totally ruined the taste of the freshly made crepe.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hard like a rock croissant. So unfresh!

poLY5PBjLGiGG8SLgKxdfw.text: There was not much of a variety here and the food was pretty mediocre overall. However, I did enjoy the crepes that are made fresh in front of you. The restaurant itself isn't aesthetically appealing. There were a few dishes and desserts that were not labeled. The dessert section looked pretty empty and there were no cones for the ice cream dispenser. The dessert section even smelled like a fish market (that was odd). I'm giving a 2 rating because the staff was very friendly. Otherwise, it would have been a one. It was not a memorable experience for me.

812c3oa3ZMweEFLRxyQ4jg.text: This was our first stop on our trip to Vegas and our entire party agreed on a two to three star rating. Since it's my Yelp review, I get final say so I am going with a two star. The service was great - drinks always refilled and plates cleared the moment we were done. The food was okay. Many of the items were lukewarm, but the prime rib was definitely the best, along with the roasted mushrooms. I didn't have the crab legs, but my fella said they "weren't good. No one was wowed by the place.   Not the worst thing in the world but definitely not work the $30 a person price tag.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Meat carving station - prime rib, roast beef and ham
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of the grills

qdi2-ZRCrwJhOA38wsaD3g.text: Shrimp taste not fresh AT ALL comparing to other Vegas Buffet and I went there at 6pm and they said they are already run out of cocktail sauce for shrimp !!!! Crab legs taste terrible as well and most of the food aren't hot anymore.  We pay for around $40 per person and it's def NOT worth it !! We will only stayed there for like 45 mins  which break the shortest record I stay in for Vegas Buffet.   The only food I like is prob " broccoli  and a pasta" that's it !!! I am super regret spending $40 for buffet over there !!  Highly recommend to read other ppls review on Yelp before going to any restaurant !!!!

SdoaaDKfsCMjFFzFiaaKoQ.text: Cold and Dry food that look like been there for long. Not fresh!! Grumpy food server.  There were only two of us in line and the crape guy asked us to stand in the center. He was so rude because  we were a bit off center in line. ( obsessive compulsive guy?) Despite there were People lining up, the steak guy took his time to sharpen his knife and he cut one piece to go to back to heat it and did the same again for the second piece for my order of two pieces of steak. For real???? Horrible experience! Do not come here! Waste of money!!!!

B6xDwUPT2ZfMM7ESUkmvNw.text: Make that Rez Now!  Le Village Buffet is the only buffet that takes reservations.  If you plan to go during busy hours, I suggest making a rez through Open Table, up through the day before.    What a well-designed & delicious buffet!  Each station represents 1 of the Provinces of France.    I chose a table outside in the Town Square, & enjoyed watching people stroll through the French Village themed Hotel.  As the table was just past 2 private Dining rooms, 2 Servers took care of me & we enjoyed a friendly chat.   Ambiance was just right.    All the Soups were rich & definitely French.  The Cioppini was my favorite ~ it was full of tasty seafood.  The Prime Rib was well seasoned & very tender.    The Crepe Chef was amazing!  He turned them out perfectly, cooking 2 @ a time.  Mine was filled with strawberries & powdered sugar, & topped with whipped cream.

BRv1xPJZhcb75g4NXp1Qiw.text: So this buffet is actually one of the better ones I would like to think. The staff here is friendly and welcoming and the food variety was plenty but filled with lots of pork in every item. We got the freshly made crepes which they offer in sweet and savory forms that were good as well as the Omlette station. The hash browns were dry like they had been sitting in the chafing dish for awhile. They had lots of bread choices with butter, some pancakes, french toast but all the other dishes had some form of bacon mixed in ughh. The coffee here is extremely bitter and strong which I don't like buy hey if you do you will love it.   We had gotten the 24ht buffet pass and really didn't think it was worth the quality of the food they offered at the 5 buffet spots. In my opinion, buy yourself a nice plate of food at the many celebrity chef restaurants and you will be far more pleasantly pleased. Quality over quantity my friends.

OtdBo9vqA8CZ5Jk_AQ0RzQ.text: It's expensive $30.99 per person.  Most of the prepared items on the buffet were cold. My sausage and potatoes were cold.  Next up I had the a crepe. It was not worth the wait In line to have it made. Waited for the coffee to be brought out in the thermals, it too was cold.  We've been here in th past and loved it, but we will no return.

6LW99YK8u3wJpxegf_xGtQ.text: Came here on Monday because I was on town foe the ABC conference at ballys. The value of the buffet is better than other pricey buffets on the strip art on $30 for dinner. Food is super expensive in Vegas so I know that will be the highest cost for my trips.  Im trying to stick to a more keto friendly diet and surprisingly this buffet had quite a selection. I was able to get plenty of protein and they had a nice cheese selection so that's always a plus. If I wasn't on a restricted diet I would have definitely hit up that crepe bar and dessert section, it looked beautiful.

NCqrx3tX65p2KGTgkUlgjQ.text: We decided to try this on our last day before heading home this was the perfect choice.  Plenty of items here with a french influence which we loved very much, fantastic service plus you can have all you can drink Champagne with your meal, our waiter Jamie kept my glasses full (3) he was a real great guy always smiling & helpful, he was very knowledgeable on the Champagne they purchase, very informative & delicious. Top  of the tops in service plus he was a True joy!  The buffet had plenty of items to choose from they even have a crepe station which we really enjoyed. This is a must stop in for Brunch you will enjoy it tremendously you feel as if you in a village in Paris, the scenery & decor takes you there :) Service Impeccable! Thank You Jamie :D  It was the perfect end to a lovely trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double Take So Good Love The Champs!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So Beautiful
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lovely

JIYn_YMViI3SqnHy1ieK0g.text: Worth it with the weekday buffet of buffets pass and having it right downstairs while staying in Paris. My family and I tried all 3 meals here. Beautiful themed decorations and relaxing ambiance.  The good stuff: Breakfast: smoked salmon, hash brown, bacon, omelette station, all the eggs and potatoes. Get the CREME BRULEE, available only at lunch. King crab legs at dinner. Cioppino with mussels, clams and scallops was my mom's fave.  Crepe station is awesome. There are both sweet and savory crepes. The guy who made my crepe was conversational--turns out he's from the bay area. Banana nutella crepe was delicious. We gave him a tip.  We kept forgetting to reserve a table...wish we remembered to do it instead of wasting time in line!

YfSBs-lVMRO57O8dZfM4BQ.text: Prime rib was well cooked and there was a lot of tasty food to choose from which has a Parisian flair.   The best thing was the crepe bar. They will prepare a fresh sweet or savory crepe right in from of you. So delicious!

k8PaQYKSWeSLTG5Swv_ufQ.text: This used to be one of our favorite buffets but it has been going downhill.  We were there for breakfast last week and the strawberries had dirt on them!  I hate to think what else was going on if something this obvious was allowed  Too many options in Vegas to be wasting money and time at this buffet.

ZOfTlU8WRwOfiaFLdgahXQ.text: Let's start by saying you get what you pay for.  Cost is $40 after taxes and they offer a variety of food  which includes crab leg, prime rib and more.  I ate here out of desperation because this was what was close and was available at the Paris Hotel.  Basically the reviews are correct, crabs were bad quality with very little meat.  No fish entrees and the rest of the food was blah.  Read all the reviews and follow the consistent remarks that have been stated about what you get here.  It is way to expensive to get mediocre and less level food. Boohoo, I should have listened.

A7jNSYtMnwH64PxUcgngLA.text: I came here once a couple of years ago and LOVED this place. Good food, good service, and a wonderful theme (it's Paris, of course it looks beautiful). Unfortunately, it seems to have gone average with some of the service. More so unfortunate because we came here for my brother's 18th bday dinner and were treated quite poorly.   The food was still pretty good so I can't complain too much there. Large selection and variety of meats, pastas, seafood, salads, dessert (yes they have creme brulee and macarons!), and a bar if you'd like alcoholic drinks as well. While Certain items were super flavorful, others were on the bland side-you can't have it all.   The downside: The service was...underwhelming.  We did see our server to refill our drinks a couple times, however, he was so rushed we could barely understand what he was saying. Of course, we still smiled and said thank you. He was definitely hard to track down and whenever we did need refills, it took a while to find him and an even harder time to get him to come over. (Our table was in an awkward spot, so I understand that, but it Seemed that way for the other tables around us as well). Of course we didn't need too much from our waiter seeing as it is a Buffet, but after this birthday fiasco, I had a hard time wanting to leave a t  If you'd like to read more of a personal story of what happened, Let me explain: I understand buffets don't really do anything too special for birthdays, but I asked my server if he had a candle and he quickly walked away rudely saying, no we don't have anymore. To me that means that you did...but you're too lazy to ask for any. So...I asked a different lady up front and go figure, she had a bunch of colored candles and said my server should've had some, is supposed to bring us the candle and light it. (She also said he would sing...but it's fine. We can do that ourselves).  Our server comes back and is shocked I have a candle sitting on top of one of the desserts. I ask him for a lighter and he just says, no I don't have one. I quickly explain that that's fine, but the lady up front told me to ask my server. He responds rudely with: "well I don't, so What do you want me to do?"  Wow. First off, don't give me attitude. Next, it would be nice if you could find the answer, or see if someone else has one. Three, I DID get a lighter from the same ladies up front. Not sure if it's a server issue or if they don't have very good communication within the buffet. Needless to say, our waiter never showed up at our table after that and, of course, Did not bring us the tea we ordered more than 10 minutes before this.   Got to talk to a manager up front, but Not entirely sure if I'll be back after the night we had.  2 stars for food and the ladies who helped me up front.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wow. Some sad looking macarons. At least they tasted good.

9hrJWdX2TkHE6fS9CyQyrg.text: Short and sweet, We went to breakfast. Lines started to grow fast at 7 am. The omelette bar was amazing. Wish there was more options on what you could put in your omelette, but overall it was great! I was disappointed at the bread by the oatmeal. It was so hard to eat because it seemed old. The rest of the buffet was okay. The food selection was vast as they had crepe (sweet or savory), area to make an eggs benedict, and you can get slices of ham. Our server was incredibly nice and always checked on us. She was so sweet and always attentive to our needs.   Overall, only okay for me as I tried most of the top buffets here in Las Vegas. It's not bad, it's decent. I can definitely come back again if we pass by it as it was an affordable $21 per person for breakfast. Lunch and Dinner are different prices.

Ngkzd8d2KBihbkX-P90Zug.text: I had two buffets here during late April.  I purchased the buffet of buffet pass for Total Rewards members.  Moreover, I had a VIP pass so I was able go to a separate entrance and not wait in line.  Our first meal here was a dinner.  It was ok, but nothing truly exceptional.  The prime rib was excellent and the other options were adequate.  Server was attentive, and eating in one of the rooms was quaint.  Breakfast was exceptional.  The slabbed bacon truly would melt in your mouth and was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  I had multiple pieces of it.  The other breakfast options were equally quite tasty.  My wife enjoyed her crepe immensely.  Overall, the dinner was average but the breakfast was fantastic.  I would visit again but based on the quality of the Total Rewards dining options I'd question purchasing the Buffet pass again.

Ao9vQPr_kYU0MhwuGjIaJg.text: I've been to almost every buffet on strip and this place is not worth it.  They run out of prime rib. The crab is small. Not much food selections.  Also Paris is known for delicate and delicious desserts. Can't say that's True at this buffet. There so called macarons are full of air. Just taking it with the tongs they break open. It's just full of air. Horrible. Not much in dessert selections.  Definitely not worth the price. Maybe if it was $15 or something. Also factor in the $9 price to park just to eat here. Horrible

umlHMNzAz7U_fy6CZkxQBw.text: Mediocre food. Not impressed. There wasn't much that I enjoyed.  If I had to do over again we would have gone elsewhere and saved our money.

y0WMOuDqQLoCMvx7k1FwUg.text: Went here for unlimited mimosa brunch.  We LOVED it!   So much to choose from and everything I tried was excellent. Mimosas flowed quickly from our friendly server.  Really cool decor. The Paris as a whole makes you feel as if you're walking down a side street in Paris and the buffet is no different.    Loved it.

rjs-uthH9WHWa57N0ryNbQ.text: I would say it's a pretty decent buffet and not as pricey as the other buffets within the strip. It has good options but not as much as you would want. Per person it's $33 and I went on a Wednesday near closing time which is at 11:00 p.m.

bDRB-YIdazmX5c028HmyHQ.text: Expected more from a Vegas buffet. Probably better off going to one off the strip or even a different hotel.  I love salt and normally put more salt on top of my meal but the food was extremely salty. I think I paid for the water and not the food. It was more like all you can drink water. But the scenery and atmosphere was beautiful.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1QwD4b5Q2CJgK07opgxdhw.text: The buffet during brunch hours is -Okay. I would appreciate it if they brought out the food for brunch during its opening hour. It took forever for them to change from breakfast to brunch. This left me sitting at my table waiting. And if I wanted to wait I wouldn't have choose a buffet. I am still waiting for the Sushi to be available. Thankfully, they have mismas!

4-mAEf5Efh22NjS_vzciSQ.text: I wish I didn't have to update this, but this buffet took a sharp u-turn and went downhill over the years.  Prime rib is always overcooked, not medium rare like it used to be. Crab legs are skinny and very thin. No more truffle Mac. Less variety of steamed clams and mussels. Only three types of crepes. Workers look like they hate their job and it shows in the quality of service.  They went from one of my favorites to easily one of the worst, what a shame.  Over the years, competing buffets have increased their prices due to inflation (as expected) but this buffet never increased their price. They instead decided to downgrade their quality. I don't think I need to comment on whether management made the right decision or not, because the empty lines speak for itself.

C3yX0_HOdTyXk1uDLU8v1g.text: The buffet is not that great. The coffee is luke warm. Mainly more of egg scrambles, sausage, bacon and ham. The pastries are ok. This is place is very limited for those who are vegetarian.

rovd8Nhx3clVdEJpigIVBQ.text: Holy cow. Quality & quantity of food definitely went down!! This buffet use to be one of my favorites.   Dining for dinner is $35 per person. To go for a container was $20. They advertised it as a plate, but you get a box with a lid.   I'm definitely glad I only got to go for this visit. I shared with my bf and we were both full. The container looks small, but it does fill you up fast! I still enjoyed the Nutella banana crepe the most.

l-3Nx7HdOMVRF9lfe7hUsQ.text: I've been here many times, usually around Thanksgiving, and have always liked it. This time, I wasn't too happy at how they let people not in line get ahead of everyone in line. And I wanted to sit near the center part, where there was lots of empty tables, but those were for "the high rollers". EFFF, I got sent to a claustrophobic room with an Asian Chinese family with two kids who screamed with high pitches, ran around, and just caused mayhem. I kept looking but the parents did not care.  The food I tried this time: Snow crab, pork loin with apples and prunes, prime rib, au jus, paella, bouillabaisse, choucroute garni (variety of sausages with sauerkraut, from the Alsace-Lorraine region, close to the German border), andouille sausage, sweet cream crepes, mixed berries, creme brulee, bananas foster, choc ice cream, waffle cone and cream.   Food is as expected, but some shellfish from the paella were not fresh. How do I know? They did not open when cooked. I have evidence to back this assertion.  I wasn't too thrilled this time around, so that means I have to try other buffets on my next trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The personally made crepe with fruit fillings and whipped cream always saves Le Village buffet.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brulee and some intricate sweet delight.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bananas Foster.

podQQYgcYS0-2y-Iwgn40w.text: Let Village Buffet is located inside the Paris casino. The dinner they serve here is pretty good, but the desserts were disappointing. My crepes tasted like it was undercooked and the filling was frozen.  The service was good. They refilled the drinks consistently and cleared out the plates most of the time.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

uWCSQv4GM7CPiAO8wmOPkA.text: In my opinion, the only saving grace here was the lady who served us our drinks. She was very friendly & efficient.   Food was pretty good, however, the guy who made the crepes was not very polite at all & to top it off, I asked a lady if my crab legs, which were served cold, could be warmed up & she said "only if I have a VIP players card"! What the heck is that about??!?! Ugh. Think we'll go somewhere else next time we're in Vegas.

jM5KZUktCWHDKVkXYCI7jA.text: Love the food and attentive service. We played roulette for one hour and received one buffet worth $25  Worth it.  Have fun guys, best buffet we have been to.  Drinks free is bonus.

Qu0-bWSaoFPBERPACKjaVQ.text: My friend spends a ton of time at casino buffets. On the contrary, I feel like I don't get my money's worth when I do frequent a buffet. I don't have the stomach to gorge. However, I love the variety.  Le Village Buffet is located in Paris Las Vegas. Naturally, having my friend who is an expert at timing when you should go to a buffet, she recommended going at 11 am. It allows you to plop down for both breakfast and lunch foods.  There is a wait before you get seated. It is organized, thankfully. We waited for about half an hour.  We were there for three hours. I loved my breakfast items. I am perfectly happy getting pancakes and sausage. Anything else is a bonus.  Being at a Parisian-themed casino, I will devour chocolate croissants. They are my favourite. They were buttery and perfect.  My friend overdid the crepes. I love crepes, but she brought back three different flavours and expected me to split them with her. I would have been happy with splitting one with her and sampling more of what this buffet had to offer. We had salmon, chocolate, and tomato cheese crepes. They were all good, but I loved the chocolate crepe the best. Yes, I was on a chocolate kick. It's one of my favourite food groups.  I enjoyed having quiche, too. I don't see that as a typical buffet item often, so I had to get it. It was delicious.  Service was a bit slow. It does get busy, so pack your patience.  I enjoyed eating at this buffet. I would do it again when I am back here.  (167)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet goodness
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon crepes
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tomato cheese crepe

Xw56XdorRGwOmX-maq_jTQ.text: The dinner buffet on a Saturday night was $33, which is not bad. The quality was top notch. I normally don't eat heavy carbs at a buffet, but the Mac/cheese and mashed potatoes looked so good, I had to try both. They were both excellent. I also liked the French onion soup.

hXMetdI1AkaccUs7qoMhLA.text: Affordable, delicious, and bottomless mimosas.  There you have it.  If you make a reservation or have the 24 hr pass for buffets you're smart.  But if you walk in it's a little bit of a wait. I suggest you tip at the front you get seated and treated well.  Our waitress was a pro and made sure my wife and I never had an empty glass from water, coffee, and mimosa.  It was wide array of brunch material and you can't go wrong anywhere.  The signature dish is the crepe station in my opinion.  I got the strawberry creme and it was very good for buffet.  It's recommended to go for a stroll on the strip to walk off the food you will need it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful lover face.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch materials.

mAdgswm7h3-qSPH91cvi2w.text: Paris buffet is good but does not have a big selection of food like it used to. They have the typical ham, beef, mashed potatoes, pasta dishes. Very little seafood choices and they no longer have the pizza or kid friendly dishes Expect to wait at least an hour in line each time. The highlight of this buffet are the crepes, so if you go here make sure you try them, they are delicious!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9TI5bvKk_NzxiDrK78rrXQ.text: For a buffet in Vegas - this one is A-Ok!  We were gifted with a 24 hour pass to this (and a few others) buffet and knew we had to stop in for a least one meal - considering we were staying at the Paris hotel. Here are the takeaways:  Pro's: ++ Tons of options to choose from! Each station had a variety of offerings like; Italian lasagna, heaping piles of shrimp scampi, salad bar with endless toppings, freshly carved roast beef, chicken and seafood, an entire sushi station and more! Everything and anything you could crave, is here! ++ FRESH in taste! Normally buffets make a bit wary, considering it's hard to know how long the food has been sitting out, but this one did not disappoint! ++ Plenty of seating options - for parties large or small! ++ Water, soda, coffee and tea are complimentary! Cocktails are offered as well - for a small price. ++ Prime location and decor inside Paris. The "outdoor" setting creates an intimate and unique feel!  Con's: -- Service is insanely slow and understaffed. The entire place was packed and there were only 3 waitress's refilling waters and clearing plates :/ -- PACKED, like line-out-the-door packed. There always seems to be line for breakfast, lunch or dinner, so be prepared. -- The space was pretty dirty. A ton of tables were left unbussed with crumbs on the floor - creating not the best looking space. -- Normal pricing for all you can eat is $24/person. If we didn't have free passes, not sure this would have been worth it.  While this place was convenient and tasty at the time, I'm not entirely sure we'd make a special trip back!

HaQ8eOqgwXM4s-Qt4cEuig.text: This buffet is just okay. If you're hungry and close by and want to eat at a buffet real quick, this place will be okay but it's nothing special. The desserts are dry and the selection isn't that great. The wait staff takes forever to clear your empty plates. The two stars is for their herb crusted tilapia, now that was good.

n37v-4Kevp_Gq-B29ijcLg.text: Inedible deserts. Who serves cold creme brulee? No healthy options. The only French item was a crepe and they had only one savory option. Get your own drinks and since you've already paid, they're more interested in helping customers outside get served. The omelette station looked dirty. Save your money and go to Green Valley Ranch Station's buffet. Much cheaper and better.

YsUsTFsIKI-34d2wTJzQkA.text: I expected a buffet in a nicer Las Vegas casino to be better than the buffets that are cheaper and in smaller casinos than in the Seattle area, but I think my expectations may have been a bit too high!  Once we actually found the buffet, having reservations made getting a table a breeze. If you're hellbent on trying this buffet like I was, I would suggest making a reservation from their website. It uses OpenTable and doesn't cost anything, you pay for your meal when you get there and you get to use the VIP entrance to the side of the buffet... which they should mention in their reservation process.  The concept of this buffet is very charming and intriguing, I wanted to explore each station as it represents a region in France. You'd have a hard time finding much that was actually a French dish but I understand that they cater to wider audience. Nonetheless, I wanted to spend our money there.  When it came to the actual food, that was a bit of a disappointment. Most of what I had on my plate was lukewarm. Even soups being held at the buffet bar were lukewarm. Any dish that included a protein severely lacked in that protein. For example, their chicken lemon artichoke rice pilaf had wonderful flavor but very little chicken. Same goes for their paella, lots of great rice but very little seafood. Their portions of prime rib and other roasted meats were slivers of what their website shows. Also that station's carver was almost rude in her demeanor when she served you, didn't listen to you, just put something on your plate whether you asked for it or not. I don't know about you, but I definitely do not enjoy that attitude. My husband was intrigued by the crab but the crab legs were so skinny, there was barely any meat in them.  Service wise, we barely got any attention from our assigned server. We got one refill for our drinks and looked around for him for more but he was nowhere to be found. Same goes for our empty plates, those were not picked up as quickly as other buffets have done in the past. A lot of the stations did not have tags on each dish either. One station in particular had something I would never have guessed was apple compote, in fact I stayed away at first but once I was able to ask what it was, it was pretty good!  Don't waste your money here looking for a great Vegas buffet experience, this is not it. The food was decent but the combination of the people manning each station, the lack of attention to detail on something as simple as a label and temperature/general lacking in the food really was disappointing. It could be great with a little work on simple things.

L8ec2_Dk1JAtyg41r2lxug.text: Came for the crab which was ok, it was precut but very small... Food was good and the atmosphere was phenomenal. We'll definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6FSYH-pIb3In1Fydju0zrg.text: We went to the champagne brunch here which is between 11 and 3, it cost $32 (around 27 for fellow English people), and that included the cost of the buffet and unlimited mimosas, beers and wines which I thought was pretty good and we definitely got our money's worth drinks wise.  There is plenty of food to choose from as well, and the setting is very quaint, it feels a little dingy as there are no windows but I would definitely recommend if you are after drinks and some lunch.

pgiQFVYbeG0fpuhHkmXg0A.text: This was our second stop during our 24 hour buffet pass. We stopped by at 4pm so the line up was not that long.
