aVcBpSMLuGeY_DMhdBrm8g.text: Less food.  Worse quality.  Higher prices.

e1JRZWvkEgWaEElBb1tHRA.text: Simply,,do yourself a favor and stay away from this Paris(FAKE buffet) not much choices and also very low Quality food and,,BTW,they run out of the food and when i asked for they reply,we RUN OUT, no more :-) seriously,it is funny to go there,,,their management is very RUDE and un professional,,,even my 7y old kid noticed that..

Y41OvpV-3AQoMV2FRvG66w.text: There are tons of choices here. From A-Z. Lunch was great. Sit in the central courtyard section, it has a nice ambiance. Jaime served us and he was great. From helping and guiding us to keeping my ladies champagne glass full. Jaime is an outstanding associate.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Nzfvql-nJKf3UM06pSlOaw.text: This place was terrible all the way around.   I was visiting from out of town and we stopped here for dinner after the Jersey Boys show. We heard the food was good and worth the money. We had 8 in our group and each of us paid individually. Only AFTER we paid, we were notified that parties of 8 or more automatically have to add 17% gratuity. Barbara, the lady standing and taking tickets insinuated (rudely) that she wanted us to go back to the cashier to repay with the 17% added to each persons ticket. We asked if we could add it at the end or use cash and she huffed and puffed while taking all of our tickets and pulling the hostess aside to see how to handle our group.   Not sure why NO BODY mentioned the gratuity until after we paid and there were no signs posted until after we rounded the corner where the hostess was standing. Not our problem that they had poor placement with their sign or that the people taking our money didn't bother to give us a heads up. After that issue, the staff was rude to our whole group. They ended up slitting our group into two and sitting us at opposite ends of the restaurant, then proceeded to give us dirty looks our whole meal. The "waitress" barely said two words when she came to ask what we wanted to drink, 3 waters and one Sprite. She dropped off a tall jar of water for us to refill our drinks ourselves and never came back once to refill the Sprite or check to see how things were going. And they wanted us to tip our server 17%? The only person worth tipping was the gentleman that came and grabbed our empty plates. He was the only kind person on their staff.   On top of all the drama, the food wasn't very good and we sat across from what I'm guessing is the wait staff room and the floor was a mess, which I have included a picture of. I will 100% NOT be returning to this place if I come back to visit and I think any one thinking of dining here should be aware that the staff is rude.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dirty floor if waitstaff station

oMrBnyO3sA5nwNsO3UFUHQ.text: If it wasn't for the "Le Crepe with Nutella, bananas and hazelnuts," this place would warrant a 1-star rating.    Over the many years of having so many people talk about Vegas buffets being the best, I had to try at least once while I was there. I had so many expectations but maybe that's the problem here.   First off, we were seated almost a block away from the actual food stations. This place really makes you work for the food. The food is sectioned off into several stations based on the courses (appetizers, main and dessert). I always go for the seafood and meats....you figured you get your money's worth that way. Seriously who wants to get full on cheap salads?  I got a little bit of everything. I'm a dabbler. The meats were salty and dry. The seafood was just okay. I didn't even touch the salads. But their coffee was good. Overall I felt there wasn't much love put into the food. It was all about quantity versus quality while I'd much prefer the latter. There is something about buffets that makes people pile on everything even the food is awful. I am guilty of this but I ended up not eating 80% of what I had on my plate.  As my evening was not turning out as expected, I decided to try their crepe station. Per recommendation from my friend, I got their nutella, bananas and hazelnuts. I have to say that dish made up for everything else I had before there. It was freshly made infront of me, so how can anyone mess that up?   Now that all the glitz and glamour is gone.....it would take a lot for me to come back to this place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Le Crepe with Nutella, bananas and hazelnuts

sXvgtE2Zp50cy328sppPKg.text: The buffet at lunch was absolute dee-lish! They have tons of great seafood to enjoy. I didn't even bother getting the cut of meats and just loaded on the mussels, clams and shrimp!  They also have a crepe station that is cooked to order. I had the bananas with nutella. I felt the banana slices were a bit too large, it would have been better if it was a bit thinner.  The dessert bar also looked amazing, but I was definitely disappointed on the macaroons. They were soooo many, but didn't taste great. The outer shell tasted like a fortune cookie.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe station! Banana hazelnut crepe

ccpMHk8--b9YuRLJRvmuEA.text: This was probably the worst buffet I've ever been to.  The $40 pp price was not representative of the quality of or selection of food you get.  Albeit we got there at 9:45 (they close at 11:00) but they should still have the same food at 9:45 that they have at 3:00 available.  The potatoes were not cooked through, it was like cutting through a rock!  They didn't have hot crab legs instead they chilled the snow crablegs and split them for you and they were over cooked.  The only good thing on the buffet were the shrimp although they were peel and eat.  I suggest you walk through before spending hard earned money on this slop!  Wish we would have done that!

k8p1qJjwL3epg8TGjPly_A.text: This buffet has taken a deep dive in the quality of their food.  The talapia fish was dry and crunchy on the bottom...totally overcooked. The roast beef was so tough, I couldn't chew it. The cakes were tasteless and extremely dry...perhaps the desserts were sitting out all day. I went around 8pm and could not find joy in eating anything.  The chardonnay was okay.

UsfKMS6TDiFwSSS6zpUABQ.text: This may be a shocker to my long-time Yelp buddies, but I don't have any pictures of my $31.99 weekend dinner. If you want to blame my ravenous, cranky behavior, go right ahead.  Anyway, the all-in-all experience of this buffet in Vegas was not shabby at all. The quality of the foods in each station were standard. Variety was alright and there were some items that I wasn't akin to after taking a few bites, such as all the steak offerings -- whether it's beef or fish. Not surprisingly, there were some edibles that frankly didn't appear to be edible to a superficial foodie: e.g. would you trust overly cracked macarons from the sweet stations?  Yet, I stumbled upon some foods that were quite flavorful. For paying dinner price I'd surely nibble on the Duck a L'Orange and ravage through the Crab Legs, even if some limbs were semi-frozen. Last but not least, I certainly found foods that grabbed my taste buds in awe: the addictive Truffle Mac & Cheese, anything with shellfish (which I was personally surprised), salad, cocktail shrimp, anything with veggies, and the scrumptious Brandy Apple Crepe.  This buffet is definitely not for 1st timers in Vegas and for those who need tons of flavor in their gastronomic life. However, for the joyful company (i.e. family members) and for a last-minute or convenient AYCE that doesn't come with a heinous, excessively serpentine line, Le Village Buffet should be considered.

Awy19dgP-mpum2kZ-7TLpQ.text: First thing to know, DONT GO HERE.  The wait time was horrendous and to be honest a waste of time for a less than mediocre buffet.  Starting off with our table, we were sat in an area where it was open to the passerby's which not only made eating extremely awkward with the people staring and a great trek to the food.  I felt constantly under pressure and self conscious eating with everyone watching.  BAD EXPERIENCE!  Next the food, it was truth be told barely edible.  70% of all the food was way too salty even the desserts.  A highlight of their failure are the macaroons that were clearly left out for too long.  However the few fresh ones were tasty.  Another downfall is the bathrooms, my mother had to walk out and find a bathroom elsewhere due to the long wait time.  I had very high hopes for this restaurant but came out ultimately disappointed.  It was sad for me because the decor and staff were so amazing.  I really wanted to love this buffet.

L1IerE0KBZH18xAzx-sZdg.text: Went here for the "seafood special" on Friday for $31 per person, but the only seafood was the crab legs. The macaroons, which were supposedly one of the highlights of the buffet, were gross and disgusting. I went to the Medley Buffet at the Orleans, and it was eh, but still much better than Le Village. The food here in general has way too much sodium, the restaurant itself is in a fake Paris Village that is way too hot with no AC, and the service is bad, cause if you ask for more than 1 drink, the waiter will glare at you. Not a good place to eat at, and definitely doesn't stand out against other Vegas buffets.

LErGag7yFLXa241-yXPfjg.text: Like many others we had been here many years ago. My what a difference. We came back to try it after a horrid experience at Spice Market and an average experience at Bacchanal. It now seems most of Caesar's properties are suffering from the same poor leadership. I think that if Mr. Frissora made a surprise visit, some folks would be called into the principal's office.  We got there around 3:20 or so. There was no line, so the young lady asked us to come to her register. As soon as we did, another lady said we needed to go back to the other register and wait for the third one to come back from somewhere. After a few minutes, I saw this third one come from across the way. Is it normal for folks/cashiers to leave the front unattended? Weird.  We were seated by a nice pillar that obstructed views from 2 of the seats. When I asked, the hostess said we cold move to the opposite table, but I had to point out it was the same situation but with the pillar on the other side of the table. There was also a semi full bus-cart right next to the table welcoming us to enjoy ourselves. **these come into play later  The food was not up to any standard. Dry, inconsistent and boring are words we used for hours afterward to describe it. Half of the lines were void of food and what was there was obviously just new piled on old (we got to see staff doing this - new fish just tossed on top of old fish, new potatoes scraped into the old bin, even the cold cuts were mixed up...one batch of ham was cut in half and the other batch of ham was whole). Many of the items that were there were so far overcooked, after one bite, you set them aside. The duck (which was labeled as pork-although I know pork has no wings) was so dry, it had an odd taste to it. The mac and cheese had brown bits in it that we are still not sure what they were. Even the crab legs were still frozen...not cold...frozen. Anything with cream in it had an unusual sweetness to it. The only thing we completely ate was the prime rib and au gratin potatoes. These were great - everything else wasn't even diner food.  There were minimal desserts. Of the four sides to the dessert area, 2 of them were completely void and at least one of the remaining sides was 75% empty. The salad area, if you want to call it that, was an interesting place. The staffer working it had her plastic wrap - the nice big roll - right there on the countertop next to storage bins and in use bain marie's (soup pots). She also had her sleeves of souffle cups laying there, next to the bags of salad. This almost seemed to be a theme there. Lets put all our prep and cooking gear around on the surfaces...our guests won't mind.  They really want you to experience eating leftovers in a Parisian alleyway, so the floor is nice and nasty-littered with food scraps, paper and who knows what and they push these carts through at intervals almost like they are trying to recreate trams. Why would anyone decide pushing carts across an uneven floor is the way to bus tables/haul ice/haul dinner ware? Actually, one staffer made it extra special by parking his bus cart next to us again and then wondering off for a while.   Needless to say, this buffet has been removed of our list to EVER visit...and it is looking a lot like it is becoming an issue Caesar's wide. We have thought we would try Flavors (Harrah's) and see if this lack of training and management extends to all of Caesar's Entertainment F&B.  **will also be posting this to other review boards**

vVw90wznQnJnsoLpFLlL2A.text: Very nice server. The buffet is solid for Vegas. It was 33 dollars per person. Pretty much anything you want: crepes, truffle Mac n cheese, sushi, eggs, etc.   PROS: The food was amazing.  Bottomless mimosas. Nuff said.  CONS: They auto charge gratuity for more than 8 people, but they were upfront about it and told is beforehand so we split into two groups.

PaZCu2vJ6gw0CapDfpFJqQ.text: This is by far the worst excuse for food we have ever experienced. $30 a person and it was incredibly horrible. The chicken in different stations tasted the same. Like it was 3 years old, be at to death, way over cooked and the microwaved to heat up. Wow. To many bad thing to mention. They should be a shame.

M1QvzLiHD1GDbXq7rOzFvQ.text: Came in Saturday night, little pricey for not much variety, still every item I tried had good flavor, crepes are good, dessert was good too, it's just it was better years a go..

yF40DqGeFasMNNU8Q3oing.text: This restaurant is very nice! Lots of fresh selections,  friendly servers, clean. My hubby  especially enjoyed the crusted tilapia,  smoked trout, salmon, and cheeses. My favorite was the potatoes brie au gratin. I loved the fresh fruits, prime rib and pastries.

ki-Wuo2Y4BaDuUuPaj4Tsg.text: used to be really good years back gave it a try today for brunch. first the cashier was rube to us secondly the coffee was ice cold in thermal pot, the creamer was curdled gross,the cook gave us attitude we were told 5min. for eggs 23min later they finally came out I already gave up and started eating something else, the desserts were bad for French bakers..cake frosting was grainy like sand..macaroons put togeather inside out. bye bye won't be back.. go to Aria buffet hands down way better.

XyUO6AnqVQ9RkrYJZxEKAQ.text: the worst buffet in las vegas the food is bad and you have to serve yourself the drink where there is no ice and nobody is interested In help I do not recommend it to it's a shame like a buffet of such good prestige to fallen so low

YMTzSvdDq_sMGXDJQsL2Ew.text: I don't do buffets often, but I am SO glad we came here for breakfast. It was absolutely worth it. They have the seating figured out, and I think it may have been the best breakfast of my life. The salmon asparagus omelet, pastries, and brie potatoes were out of this world! It fueled us for the day, and I would also highlight the strawberries. When I bit into one, I felt like I was walking through a strawberry field in the south of France. I don't know about the other buffets in Vegas, but this one was a win.

Nj9HUQegNZrKeRw407xedg.text: My husband & I couldn't eat where we wanted, so we ended up here. IT WAS A BUST!  And, we tried a bit of everything. The one positive?  The crepes...

LuJpBjZFXUZpkvgrZNowGw.text: I thought the food was very good..... I loved the clam and mussels and it's broth omg...... prime rib and the mash potatoes were excellent..... we're talking about going back tomorrow.

hVoVHK5ZKvwdRcRtKZ7t1Q.text: ROXANNE GETS FIVE STARS!!! She was our server and if it wasn't for her, this review would be a one star at best.  We've been here  several times before. When they first opened up at Paris... WOW!  Over the years, though the wow factor was gone, it was always a solid strip buffet.  Not anymore.  The entrees and sides range from meh to yuck.  The desserts were truly meh at best but this place's saving grace on our recent visit was our server...ROXANNE, ROXANNE! She was so outstanding!  my husband has diamond status with Ceasars Entertainment, so we were in the private room being served hot, split crab legs which Roxanne kept bringing to the table.  She was always on top of everything and served us with sweetness and a smile.  It was amazing considering she was the ONLY server for the entire room and there were at least five other tables occupied (one with a rather large party) at any given time.  She never missed a beat!  She totally saved what would have been a pretty disappointing dinner.  Thanks, Roxanne!

DQt6zqEHzC2xB0A9Lo9xQw.text: Waited a long time to be seated. I was very confused why because there was open seats and wasn't during a rush. Food was plain and not worth the money. Crab legs taste like they came from a dirty fish tank. Took a few days for me to shake the taste. Not a good experience here.

f6KcAdoO2yF_TB_1NJpLoA.text: This restaurant is so good! It is very beautiful, but the crab legs, and macaroons aren't as great, but other than that their food selection is amazing and is quite good. I would recommend coming here

68AJYvcemBDlmdSR35CbwQ.text: Food was good, especially the blueberry muffins and croissants. The cook at the omelette station was fantastic. She was friendly and oh so efficient. She was masterful at making about six orders at a time and she did it well. Server was friendly, attentive, and she was hustling around. The drawback was checking in and the hostess was a bit gruff. There is no signage for where those with reservations should enter. I learned from the cashier that if you have a reservation, which I did, you should enter at the VIP entrance. How are people supposed to know this? I wasn't terribly put out because they had just opened and only about 20 people were ahead of me, but I've seen this line before be quite lengthy. They need to address this situation with proper signage.

_bAuNmyqccjRA5YN4aq2rA.text: I came here for Thanksgiving dinner with my family, so my review may not apply to their normal dinner hours.  We arrived at 6:20 to see a huge line and we were a bit concerned. We were seated at 8:40. Unfortunately, there were lines both inside and outside, as there were lines for the individual food stations. The line to get meat from the carving station took another 15 minutes. Lines everywhere!  I wish they had split up their carving stations. There was one person carving the three meats (prime rib, pork, and turkey). When people got there, they would ask questions about the meat, or ask what each meat was, or want specific cuts/parts of one or two meats and not all three. I think it would make for a better dining experience if they split up these carving stations or spaced them out more. The lines got so bad that a man (maybe the manager?) came by to try and get people to go to another station, where there was turkey. Most people stayed in line for the pork and prime rib.  Food quality was disappointing. The first piece of prime rib I got was way too well done. The second piece was rare and red in the center. The duck was really dry. The crab legs tasted so salty that I could only eat a couple. They also stuck to the shell, which made me think they weren't that fresh. I basically filled up on various roasted vegetables and sausages, which I could get anywhere for less than half the price.  I had heard so many good things about the dessert bar, but when I finally got to dessert, 1/4 of the station (gelato? ice cream?) was cleaned up. Of the desserts that were left, they were just the same handful of desserts placed at different areas of the station. The crepe station also had a huge line, and when I finally got my crepe, it was monster-sized (not in a good way). There was so much filling in there that my family of four people couldn't even finish one.  Since it was a holiday, we paid for the holiday price. Including tax and tip (the only saving grace was that the waitress came by occasionally to clear plates and refill drinks), it came out to $45+ per person. All in all, I'm disappointed that I came here for Thanksgiving. Not worth the wait or the price. Next year, I'll know better.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. HUGE crepe - way too much filling
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thanksgiving dinner 2016

ba2sCuW4ik0-mF8k8WcFhA.text: This buffet let me down. We got there around 3:45 for dinner and most of the dishes were cold. They were barely taking away the brunch food. The crabs legs were alright? I saw a guy ask for fresh hot ones and they brought them out from the back. The prime rib was good but other than that I should've paid extra 30$ to eat HOT delicious food somewhere else.

pRj8mNe1Azmgmsv528mCvw.text: great food, but not as much as variety as i hoped. quality was alright, i would've expected a lot more since it is close to $40 per person for dinner. i think that some foods were great, however, i would've paid $40 for a better quality meal rather than this buffet :/

rQJbQolB3ohqBQ-WHl5ovA.text: Awesome time having lunch Thank you Ninayou are the best. Thanks for getting us the best tablefor Panga's Bday

wrxItvlhgI3KSR8Tmcc1Gg.text: Came to this buffet on my 21st birthday. We picked it because we heard good things about it and it was cheaper than some of the other higher end buffets. When we got there, we noticed we can get a discount if we were a Total Rewards member, so we joined. It was like $1 off, but the membership was free so why not? You need to go to the casino to sign up though.   The line was not that long, but it took a while to get through. I think they were waiting for tables to open up so we could be seated. It took a while to be seated too.   The ambiance of the buffet was like no other though and probably my favorite part about it. I love how Vegas portraits different parts of the world and they did a good job at Paris hotel and this buffet. The buffet represented the 5 provinces of France and had some foods that are representative from each province.   The food was good, but not great. I enjoyed the hot meats, crab legs, and especially the desserts. Some meat was over cooked so it was a little tough and the sushi they had did not look fresh so I stayed away from that. The desserts were my favorite part. They had macrons, cookies, cakes, creme brulee, etc.   Not a bad buffet for one of the cheaper ones on the strip. Food quality could be better, but you get what you pay for. The night time French village setting really sets the mood.

9SX6lgtI4myY-XI-vvzkYQ.text: Thoroughly unimpressed and actually a little bit nauseous.  We waited about 30 minutes to get in which was fine, however when we finally got in there were no plates at any of the stations. We waited and we waited and were told that they were bringing plates but we continued to wait for several minutes. In the meantime, they continued to let more and more and more people in so by the time the plates finally arrived, there were so many people waiting for food that you couldn't get anywhere near the buffet.    OK, so that finally settles down and we are actually able to get food. First, there were almost no signs letting you know what the food was so you really had no idea what you were eating. Second, several of the hot food items including the fish and green beans that I had were cold.  Then, I went over to get some crab legs and while I was waiting in line I was going to get some cheese off the cheese platter only to find a big dark hair laying across the cheese. I pointed this out to one of the ladies that worked there and all she did was pick up the hair and the piece of cheese it was laying on. It was just repulsive.  Also, they cut the crab legs in half which in theory could be helpful but really all it does is scatter little pieces of shell all over the meat.    The floor was sticky, covered in food and other debris. And, there is only one bathroom stall for the entire restaurant. Way overpriced for what you get. We would never be back.

kpgT9zImsoYtnKDNyRvm1g.text: This Buffet has really gone down hill. Wish I would've relied on yelp.  This was our go to place years ago; but now it's just your run of the mill basic buffet. Long gone are the days of Raclette, Coq au vin and Beef Bourgoignon. Sorry to say but we won't be back

xbvO6UspwGjp6TmsSOGSBg.text: This used to be our favorite go-to buffet.  On our recent trip, however, the variety of hot foods was disappointing.  It still tasted good but for how much we spent, I didn't feel like it was worth it anymore.  The desserts though, we still thoroughly enjoyed so it's a well deserved 3 for the desserts alone.  We came two days before Thanksgiving so maybe that had something to do with it?

1tFFc9Pc8LYX-e5yesuJrA.text: If you like your crab warm, don't eat here.  They will not heat the cold crab legs up for you unless you're a diamond or platinum card member.  The prime rib was nearly raw.  The carver did not ask how I liked it.  The other foods were just okay. There was not a great selection of desserts.  The tables were bussed slowly.  Had to ask the busboy for coffee.  Waitress ignored me. Very disappointed. I would give a negative star rating if I could.  I will never be back.

ep9SzYMcIyKxpAa62m14zw.text: I really did love it. They have so much food. I went around 2  on a Saturday for lunch and they still had some breakfast. There was no wait so that was really good! They also include champagne! So you could have unlimited mimosas! They had crepes, waffles, bagels, pita, many yummy pastas and Mac and cheese. The steak and chicken were really good. They had some really good soups .Everything was really good and of coarse many yummy desserts!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey crepe with Nutella

zgl1hcNCTtSVwqB0efTbwQ.text: great food and great selection of different kinds of foods, the only negative we have ever had here is the staff was not the friendliest and the staff at the entrance was down right rude this occurred two out of the three times each we were here.

ndaPBFqChufqZJd4MoyKsQ.text: This review is for the Breakfast portion of LeVillage Buffet!!  After a rather disaapointing Buffet at Rio the night before we where almost ready to give up on the whole buffet scene at Vegas. It seems people in this city prefer quantity over quality. NOT my thing.  BUT Then came La Village Buffet...the answer to Vegas mediocrity had been infront of my eyes all along in my very own hotel! (The hotel I was staying in I dont own Paris Paris...I wish!)   What got us to give another buffet a go once again?? Two things!!  1. We were famished.. 2...$5 all you can drink Mimosas...... need I say more??? ;) No...I need not.  It was a breakfast paradise and I am the kind of person who typically just has coffee and a pastry for breakfast... but this was enough to turn breakfast into my favorite meal for a day! A Crepe station, build your own bagles and lox, all sorts of eggs and fresh fruit lovely potatoes and hash......turkey and chicken sausage and bacon.....It was all great quality food as well and choice cut meats  .... this was really the best buffet in Vegas!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  So I just read my own review after about a year and... I think the company and the Mimosas really heightened the experience that night...  Still the best buffet I had in Vegas without a doubt though.

4E3QSRy7n3yW1bRT8_Ls7A.text: Located in the Paris Hotel, Le Village features a cute setting, like a French provincial village. It features some delicious French specialties like a very good cassoulet and a passable cioppino. There are several decent vegetable options too.  But the meats and seafood, including a carving station and grilled lamb are nearly all overcooked and barely edible.  Aside from a decent crepe station, desserts, which in a French setting COULD be dramatic, are largely the same sorts you would find at any other buffet on the Strip. Bland mousses and even blander custards.   If you are drinking alcohol, the unlimited drink option is a good deal.   Service was fairly spotty on our visit with long waits between drink refills and even longer waits for utensils. Not a bad choice overall, but I am still waiting to find the outstanding buffet in Las Vegas.

37JjicUPR_7fer7owRa_rA.text: I think this is one of the most underrated buffets on the strip.  A shame though because their selection of food is just as good as the Wynn's and their staff is just as friendly and efficient.  Love that rib eye!  And those crepes from the dessert station is awesome!  Love going there!

_iL7VHoSbDEUJlkyetT6mQ.text: Worst wait time ever.   Over 30 min. Servers are rude when confronted on the empty seats and the line not moving.

5rvfaRhkXeiPp1IJnMPNow.text: The crepes are a hit. Next time, I am just going to eat all the different crepes.  I loved the flavors and choices. I enjoy french flavors and was impressed by the decadent choices. I was very happy but when I got to dessert they had a huge section but a lot of the same thing. Many macaroons which where soft and yummy but it was a small selection compared to other buffets on the strip.  I must have either eaten too much or eaten something not good because I got sick after I ate and I rarely get sick.  But all in all, I was very happy and with the groupon, I definitely got a good deal!

4-QE0voHXqmkx4O7gPZPJA.text: A friend of mine recommended this place, saying she'd been a few years back and had a great experience. Wish I could say the same....it was mediocre at best.  I am generally an avid fan of buffets, especially in Vegas where spirits are up and alcohol is flowing. But in this case, I was sorely disappointed. To begin with, the line was looong, which is expected for Saturday brunchtime, but for some reason, it seemed especially long. When we were finally seated (I went with a group of 10) and began browsing through the food selection, I cannot say anything looked fantastic, although I did enjoy the setup and decor of the place.   DISCLAIMER: Our group was a little hungover, so my review of the food here may not be 100% accurate.   After picking at a few plates of food, my first impression was sustained. I attempted to try the crepes that all the yelp reviews were raving about, but the line was too long, or I did not have the willpower and patience to wait. The dessert section, which also looked impressive, did not hit the spot either. Many trays were empty and were not replaced during our time there.   3 stars are because the service was good, and despite the average-tasting food, my group still had a good time. Our waitress was friendly, welcoming and very willing to meet our requests, even if it was requesting 3 different drinks per person.   My end thoughts: Standard buffet, not too special, but not terrible. Would not go back though, especially with so many others to try in Vegas!

oEEQsg7NKmojJReQzdw_dw.text: My girls and I loved this place. Thankfully, the line was short when we went (it was during a weekday). I heard that the line can get a bit crazy at this place, so avoid peak lunch times.  - good for family - decent food but not a very large variety - French town theme - great service - high price - expect a very long line - definitely one of the dining places in Vegas that  I recommend   The price: $$-$$$. I got a lunch buffet with unlimited mimosa and champagne option for about $35 dollars. Thankfully, I thought it was totally worth the money.  Our waitress was very sweet. She was quick, friendly, and funny. We even left a compliment to the manager.  I had about 4 mimosas on the spot. Try them with cranberry juice instead of orange juice, if you dare! The waitress recommended it, but sadly, I didn't think I could handle anymore mimosa at 1'o clock in the afternoon. It sure does sound good to me!  Anyway, the food was decent. The presentation was very nicely done. I liked everything that I tried except sushi, which was dry and too fishy tasting (I'm usually a big fan of sushi). But then I figured it is probably too much to ask for fresh fish in the middle of the dessert.  They have Mediterranean, Italian, French cuisines and a salad bar. The dessert option is wonderful with creme brulee, bread puddings, ice creams, and more.   Some people apparently pay in the morning and stay until late lunch. I cannot see myself doing that, but that could be one of the ways to save money in Vegas. Plus, a cute French town themed atmosphere is always cute.

tJ-BtvlA39B82P8sHEzKSg.text: Perhaps being inside the Paris Hotel, the namesake of my favourite city in the world, had me going in with sky-high expectations because DAMN! was I let down...   I went this past weekend (7.14) around lunch time and let me say I've had better buffets at Hometown! First off the wait to get in was 30-40minutes. Now I understand it's a Saturday and at prime lunching hour so I was fine with that but then to not even be fed a decent meal, well that really grinds my gears!   Despite it's creative and Disneyland-esque atmosphere the place was a mess. It had a musty weird smell to it and everything just looked so drab. It was really quite disappointing. Thank god we had a fantastic and friendly server. We got up and did the obligatory "tour" before actually grabbing dishes and at the end I was like "is that it?!" For such a hyped up place the selection was lacking. There were several stations with flys buzzing around, children putting their fingers in the food and some items looked like they'd been sitting there all day. And the dessert section, HA!!, what desserts..?! It takes up a large area of the central dining area and so you'd think it'd be packed of different decadent desserts but it was all the same - stuffed with awful brownies, sad looking apple pie, itty bitty bland cookies and the ubiquitous frozen yogurt machines.   As for the food, well, it wasn't terrible. I had a pretty good crepe and decent roasted potatoes, brussel sprouts and french fries but I mean that's all ordinary food. This place had very little FRENCH about it. I think they need to rethink their branding or expect more customers with unmet expectations....

aYgV-O-TIZA0Ni_KE5xQXg.text: Local approved, not the best (Wynn IMO), but pretty dang good for a buffet! Get a bunch of those macarroons!

2KgppjSry6AQVTKZixtRXQ.text: The BF and I went here for breakfast yesterday and it was just ok. The crepe station was good, the guys working back there were friendly, and the singe crepe was very good (Although it says it has nutella in it, but it most certainly does not....definitely just chocolate sauce, but still good). I also tried the chicken and asparagus crepe and it was alright, but it could be a bit more flavorful. The rest of the food was all pretty lackluster. The pastries were clearly packaged and the eggs were mediocre. I feel like most breakfast buffets are not very good or worth the money, luckily I got a check in special for 5$s off (note, you need to redeem at the total rewards counter in the casino), so I didn't feel totally ripped off. I would consider going back, but it wouldn't be my first choice.

1Ak_PiBe_l5nzBKG6xeG3w.text: Out of the Buffets offered in the Buffets of Buffets that I've tried, this is the best one. It has a generous variety of food. The section we ate at was cute since it was going for the french theme and there were even pigeons on the balconies over our head! BUT to be fair and judging this place against the other LV buffets like THE BUFFET and WICKED SPOON... This place was just OKAY.   Crepes line was long but the portion was huge so I shared with my friend. We had to tell the crepe man to go easy on the chocolate and powdered sugar though because he had a really heavy hand with other diners.   For brunch on a weekend, the line was quick but the service to get new utensils or refills on water was slow and lukewarm.

naVLsiSPm6XNVeJa2soyiw.text: Went in for an early Sunday breakfast, since they open at 7 am. It's been years since we've been here (usually for dinner), so we were trying to change it up from our usual Bellagio or Caesar's Palace.  Despite the main floor being nearly empty, we were sat at a small table in a side room that looked run down and unkempt. The run down part I could attribute to being "quaint, french country style", but not the food stains on the wall at our table. Plain scrambled eggs, scrambled eggs w/ asparagus, and the quiche were ridiculously oversalted to the point of being inedible. Curiously, the frittatas and the eggs benedict were entirely unseasoned. I ended up having to chop up the frittata and mixing it with the scrambled egg to get something edible. Didn't try the made to order omelette, because there was a line that was moving very slow. The smoked salmon looked pretty sad, but tested pretty good. The onions that went with it very chopped very rough, and there was no horseradish to be had. The smoked trout was very fishy. The pastries we tried were ok, but all very light on sugar. I didn't mind it, but it was very one note.  Highlights were the slab bacon and the prime rib hash.  The most annoying part were the bussers clearing tables driving around carts piled with dirty dishes. The table next to ours had a larger party, and the cart full of dirty plates was parked a foot from our table for 5 minutes while the table was being cleaned and food debris scraped into the trash.  All in all, for $24 plus tax per head, it was a bust. Pay an extra 8 bucks and go to Bellagio or Aria, or cut the bill in half and go to a Station casino. Either way you'll be better off.

tSAQY5iSeJtWV4xbKmzwjA.text: Funny buffet X3 reasons...  #1...the ambiance and seating is pretty dismal. I felt like I was sitting in a high school cafeteria fold out chair in the gym that had been decorated by the French Club in Paris theme for a school dance...   #2 Funny, the food looks like its going to be what you expect from an unfortunate buffet experience, dry and under seasoned, but when you sit back down and dig in, it ALL tasted really good. Now I didn't eat every single dish... But the salmon wasn't over cooked, the beef was tender and seasoned well, the chicken was tasty. The desserts were a lot of French fun.Wine comes with your meal, that's nice... #3 Funny... We made reservations and sat down immediately, nice. There was a line disney style curved in a little dark awful "lobby" area. Went on forever. There were at least 8-10 tables empty around us throughout our meal. Why? Generating hype with the line? It ain't a club! Go for the food, with a reservation and you'll be okay.  But really, go to Wicked Spoon.

z3ifOpvtpc98pCQO3yW__Q.text: If it was up to me, I would give this place a 1/2 star (that's being generous). Gordon Ramsey should have this place in his show and have a field day with it! Sanitation problems (would you like some roaches in your omellets?), dark and dingy dining area and food was substandard for the price that you pay. The staff even cleared out our table half way through brunch and left us with no table. Watch out Mr. Ramsey, some creepy crawlers from next door might find their way to your kitchen. Just turn around and go straight to the Bellagio, guaranteed you'll have a great buffet experience in Vegas.

E6x9krNA-YamieF1dl0V9g.text: My family dined here for brunch and overall, the food and service was good.  The negative on our experience was that we were quoted one price and when we showed up, were told a different price.  Plus my 9 and 10 year old children had to may adult prices.  AND they tried to charge us for a 5th person although there were only 4 people in our party.  All in all, I would eat here again for brunch if I was in the vicinity, but probably won't seek it out again.

jfRxI0_C2CZqQbrQXlBbNw.text: Awful. Not much more I can say. Plates so hot that cold food is ruined. Food is either undercooked or overcooked and really awful. Save your money

yjtQsN1ex7VES83MeCSPRA.text: Yes, the crepes are awesome.  But I think what's also nice about this buffet is the size and ambiance.  It's quaint, smaller than the other buffets on the list (Buffet of buffets) but the wait staff are friendly and while being smaller may not necessarily be a good thing during rush hour, wife and I came for brunch and were satisfied with the overall quality, an important distinction considering all of the dining choices people have on the strip.

GaPvlbwhHyM77G1cFnhjEw.text: Wonderful crepe station, exceptional savory mushroom crepes. The prime rib was very good and other dishes were average to above-average. The scenery is relaxing if you don't get stuck in one of the side rooms. The wait service was very slow at bringing drinks and clearing used dishes. Overall worth a visit if you like crepes.

hNlrVzIWSw-ypIPrNtFOdQ.text: This is one of my favorite buffets in Vegas, but why did I only give this place 1 star?!? Because of the AWFUL experience I had in March 2011. I took my girlfriends here to eat on a Saturday afternoon, excited to fill my stomach with some French delicious-ness. We got through the line and we waited at the front to be seated. I felt that we were standing there for an eternity before we got seated at an awkwardly placed table that faced the line. Basically, everyone in line could stare at us as we ate. We felt uncomfortable and asked this waiter named DANRICK (tall, dark Philipino male) if we could move to a more secluded table under the faux trees. DANRICK gives us a look and tells us that the area we requested was reserved for VIPs (which was understandable). He then goes on to say that we can go back to the end of the line to request to be seated in the VIP section. I said, "No, that's not necessary," but he continues his tirade by picking up our receipt and pretends to take it to the front so we would have to go back in line. I repeated that we were fine where we were and eventually he went away. I have never been so UPSET at the service I received. I even complained to our waitress, who acknowledged that he was like that and she apologized for his behavior. DANRICK'S behavior was inexcusable and intolerable. He ruined our day and he needs to be fired.

hgb1wPiGBK4ySfnOA4U3Ag.text: In all my visits to Las Vegas, my expectation level of food can be based on the star rating of the hotel.   The paris being 4 stars, my expecation level was clearly not met.  Its more then obvious management obviosully does not care for its visitors to the le village buffet.  This past saturday was my first and last visit to the buffet. I found many items either luke warm or cold.   Lots of vegetable and fruit items were either rotten looking, and sour tasting.    Lots of entrees did not even have the lable, so you didn't know what have the items were.   Aside from the terrible food. You find employees lacking basic customer service skills,  They cant say hello, and its obvious there miserable.    I rember two couples being seated before me and my mother, even though we were ahead of line.  Last  but not lease.   I learned not to judge a book by its  cover.  I twice went to the flaminog hotel, which is clearly an aged building.  However, i found the buffet exceptionally good for the price.

xBKNkIBh0x0M8MGjhX0-JA.text: We were going to come here at noon on a Sunday, but we somehow got there at 2:30 instead.  Even at 2:30, there were a lot of people there, and we had to wait 45 minutes in line.  It turned out that this wasn't necessarily a bad thing.  When we finally got to eat, we got the tail end of the brunch period, and they were switching the brunch food out for dinner food.  If you want to save money, come here at the end of lunch on a weekday, and eat the dinner stuff for relatively cheap.  There was a lot of expensivish food, like crab legs, bouillabaise, and various carved meats.  All of these were pretty good, although not really anything to write home about.  Unfortunately, I decided to fill up on the gnocchi, risotto, and onion soup (which were quite good) first, which didn't leave much room.  The desserts, including the crepe station, were awesome.  Probably my favorite part of the buffet.  Overall, the buffet was quite good.  Although the food wasn't spectacular, I had a lot of it, and it was definitely worth the $25 or so that I spent.  Also, brunch on weekends includes champagne.  Unfortunately, I don't really have any basis for comparison, as this is the only buffet I've been to in at least 3 years.  I'd probably also like to try the buffets at Wynn and Bellagio next time.

uocT4bWqssurCdM3lxFyxA.text: Vegas buffets will always be controversial.  For the price and what they offer, it's one of the best on the strip.  Crab legs, crepes, stews, you name it.  Beats out most of the others on that half of the strip.  It's no Bellagio in scope of choice but it's varied enough. Get there early or arrive later in the evening or better yet, get Diamond status! The lines can be frustrating.

E2QSX4raWMCDUTMFRC1L1g.text: Alright, the first time I went here 2 years ago I thought it was really good. The vegetables seemed fresh and everything was pretty decent. But when I returned last week it seemed like a hum-drum buffet that I waited in line for almost an hour for. If you get eggs, make sure to get them from the omlet station where they can custom make them. If you get the scrambled eggs from the buffet...they are not real eggs! Definitely a powdered scrambled egg. Ugh... The servers here really need new uniforms because they couldn't flatter anyone. Marilyn Monroe or Angelina Jolie couldn't save these things. Jeeze! Anyhow the food was not quality. What did I expect from a buffet? I don't know.

jXFcvCqgsDw-4u1h9XLeEg.text: Went here for brunch on Sunday after Valentines Day 2009. Long Long Line to wait! We though we'd check it out because we've never been. The Good: Made to Order Crepes, Grilled New York Steak, and their Prime Rib was very good (my favorite). The Quiches were good too. The Bad: the service was horrible and the waitresses didn't give us our Mimosa's until we were pretty much done with our food already. (We attended Champagne Brunch) and it took the waitresses forever to refill our cokes. Not that much selection on the food, as I expected. I've been to better buffets. (Rio Buffet is still my favorite! ) I don't think I will be coming back here.

WHxnqVKfqF8TIBbYEAwiDA.text: I remembered this as one of my favorite buffets but our last visit was terrible. The food was mediocre and the selection was minimal at best. The long wait was not worth it and I don't think we'll be coming back unless they do an overhaul of the food offering.

pxbLCfEvxWuZrhiabC2ylQ.text: I ate at this buffet last year. It's a bit pricey for my taste, but for the variety of food that is offered, it's worth the price.

tZjK02MVWgUmC8JeCFpaQQ.text: Went here for breakfast after reading reviews in Frommers and was not disappointed. Different from other buffets that I have been to, they make things to order. For example, I was able to  custom order my omelet and a crepe. Price was good for the variety and quality. Loved their creme brulee, pate, potatoes, artichoke, olives, crepe! Service is not great but you dont really need service at a buffet so that did not deter me.

o3-7D_d8QhHDvI-GCjatlg.text: We waited in line for 2+ hrs for what ended up being very average food. The variety of food was also a let down. Overall, a huge disappointment. There are PLENTY of other buffet's that are way better than this one, such as the Wynn and Bellagio.

4CeXEFZivJi2CvGHzISaiQ.text: Came here for Saturday Brunch as part of our Buffet of Buffets. Really liked the lay out of the restaurant. You don't feel like you're at a buffet. We sat in a small room off the main dining area. Quiet, relaxing and the ladies taking away the plates and refilling our mimosas were five stars all by themselves.  Wasn't a huge selection but what they offered was done very well. Have stayed at Paris and Bally's for the last 10 conventions, always pass this buffet but never went in. The line always seemed to start from so far back. Now I know why.

IszncuRDoX_apA7WOwzjJw.text: Best buffet in Vegas.  Everything is great.  This is the most vegetarian friendly buffet also with lots of vegetables, crepes and salads.  It is pretty expensive, but worth the price.

_WbXGu9m2ZfMrJkH099JRg.text: Let's just say I was so upset I stormed out of there and I wasn't even half way into my meal yet... The server took too long to take my drink order... I havent even poured my coffee into my cup to come back with my plate to go half way into my meal and these mofoz cleaned out my f***kin table... Ok  FCKKK you guyz too! That was a really bad experience considering I went in thru VIP... the host was too concerned about why I was staying at a different hotel then get me seated... all I wanted to do was have a decent breakfast!  Then the server was nowhere to be found I didn't even have water to drink!!! I thought boy the food didn't seem all great in representation but then the service being horrible... I hope you guys read the reviews and train your employees better because I don't get this sh*t service at other buffets such as the Rio... maybe you all should gather one day and have a field day of training and watch and learn how you are suppose to treat your guests... Didn't even get the chance to fill out the survey... the place was not even busy nor crowded... are u stereotyping me thinking I left didn't tip so I'll clean the table out right away... Too bad I tucked my five dollar bill back in my purse I hope the next person you do that to raises hell on you with a manager! I did have the 24 hr pass and don't waste your time at Cafe Lago Buffet at Caesars Palace either... thats where I headed to after and it was WORST!!!  Trust your instincts and go with what you know... The Rio Carnival Buffet!

mJD8Gx0e9MLFtJGTRGEgDg.text: The line at thebreakfast buffet is definitely worth the 15 minutes. The cost is about $15 pp and well worth it. The assortment is unbelievable. Anything you want for breakfast is available to you. I started with bacon, over medium eggs, and a croissant. Then I tried the pancakes, fresh fruit, a blueberry muffin, and finished by splitting a fresh made apple raspberry crepe (you get to chose the ingredients) with my boyfriend.  The service was impeccable, every time I needed a refill I had it before my last sip. The only thing I didn't like was how full I felt when I left!

C7GXK87t1g96njIlXynbog.text: Great for groups. Suggest making a group reservation. You have to pay gratuity upfront but you can bypass the LONG line.  Food was bland. Nothing really stood out. Wait staff was pleasant. A little overpriced for a Vegas mid-day buffet.

Ws-USr1tSxGkz-3ARQGc0w.text: We went for the Champagne Brunch.  Had to wait 30 minutes, no biggie.  For $25, this buffet was definitely satisfying.  We had a nice Asian waitress named Wendy who kept our glasses full.  We added fresh strawberries (that they hide in the very back, mind you, not with the other fruit) to our glasses for a nice touch.  The food was better than average.   Omelette and crepe bars were good, meats were good, crab legs or course always good.  We certainly got our money's worth.

PIAjmkhDuYizmBNgDKFLBQ.text: Waited 1.5 hrs and paid 30 bucks per person. Food was good but nothing special. The salmon and garlic mash potatoes, were yummy as were the crepes (banana and nutella). Everything else was ok, many of the veggies were over-cooked and mushy. The gnocchi with sage butter were dry.  The salad bar area was sad looking and not well stocked. I don't see myself returning here again.

b8SmpELQK1tSXB-Qu9scbw.text: A good variety of food. Loved the desserts. The food is not exactly French cuisine like many people think except for the desserts.

bfGgD9i12002wrVaO3v0yA.text: We got some discounted vouchers at tickets4tonight discounted ticket  booth and read a glowing review in the Frommer's travel guide.  The wait was 2.5 hours ( Dec 22 - 1:30 ).  However once we got in the food was so disappointing, nothing special.  Also have to mention that a lot of the plates were dirty - between 2 set of plates were still some food.  We got in on lunch prices 3:30 and the only thing different between lunch and dinner was that they brought out king crab and it much of it was still frozen.

eA1otSpfpKCEc8jJ6ko6pg.text: k, so we went around 1130, the line was long for crepes, i waited about 30 mins for some nutella, and strawberry crepes.  it was good, but by the time i got my crepe, it was lunch. i would go here for the breakfast, lunch was okay.

k7yEVtvtCau0kLjyqXRi7Q.text: Did the Buffet of Buffets again and have to take stars away from this buffet. The prime rib was still very rare and very good, but the rest of the offerings were sub-par. There was also an unpleasant, rotten, putrid, smell coming from the raw seafood area...I don't know about you but that is not the smell I want coming from my raw seafood.  The staff was slow, robotic, and scarce. Dirty plates sat on the tables and drinks sat empty for way too long a time. They had changed over from brunch to dinner well over 90 minutes prior to our arrival yet all of the signs on the food were still from brunch and did not match the food that they were describing.  A very disappointing experience.

kXTtml9TgEJONpBdjLTuUg.text: I've been to many buffets in Vegas.  Since we were staying at Paris and never tried this place, I wanted to give it a go.  I was surprised by the quality of the food.  Yes, variety is not exactly there.  They don't have as many stations and choices as some of the other buffets but what's the point of having so many options of bad tasting food.  ((I'm talking to you BELLAGIO buffet!))  I loved the duck dishes here.  Not too oily or fatty, good portion and well marinated.  The prime rib was also good. I was just going to have a "few bites" and ended up eating 80% of my piece.  The crepe station is also popular here though I didn't try it this time due to the long line. No worries, will be back next time :)

xHUGuGdl_jAx4llT0z0jAg.text: Love this Buffett, when I'm in Vegas this is one of the places I must hit. The crepes and food selections are amazing. If you get lucky and get a groupon u get two for one and a bottle of wine. Planning my next trip to Vegas and will sure go back.

4FYDl3gdsuy5iB0TX3fokw.text: Dear Mindy,  I love you, you stole my heart.  At first I thought we were going to be disappointed as we waited in the pending to be seated bench for over 20 minutes as we saw servers slowly clear tables one plate at a time. Soon after, we were seated at a table with no silverware and no one taking our drink orders. When we asked for assistance, Mindy came to the rescue.  She is a doll of a person, a happy-go-lucky lady with the swagger of a G6, sashaying through the tables with her trusty bottle of champagne. Thankfully, she didn't mind that I would finish the champagne before she finished refilling the table, thus getting second helpings.  The food was top-notch. I died on crab legs. Their sausage was so good too, as is their chicken, duck, buttered broccoli, and mashed potatoes. Skip the french onion soup. It looked gross and tasted bland.  However, the hat is tipped to Mindy.  Thank you Mindy for encouraging us to get the most bang for our buck when it came to 3:30 and the last round of champagne has come. Your Grace Kelly charm and Tina Fey wit was not unnoticed, as well as all the strings you pulled to make our buffet experience beyond all buffet experiences.  That little extra effort makes all the difference, and the $$$ in tips.  Though I have thus returned back to my suburban enclave, I've left my heart in Las Vegas.  Je t'embrasse

1Ptfk1-HxRZRvMAJmpUUSA.text: Service at lunch was pretty lousy (took forever to clear empty plates), and the food, other than the crepes, was average.  The crepe station is awesome though, and the guy making the crepes was both nice and funny.  There were a lot of mussel options, so if you like mussels you might enjoy this place a little more than I did.  There was nothing terrible about the experience, it just did not wow me in any way.  And, as silly as it sounds, if you are going to have sushi you should also have pizza.  One more annoying thing was the guy trying to sell you the picture of you that they take before the meal.  Give me a break.

B_s3u0SJyJiGRWOCrjtLzA.text: We did the Groupon and made a reservation.  15 minute wait with a reservation on a Saturday night.  They said to go ahead and get our food and our drinks (water and wine) would be ready when we came back.  We went to the buffet and then sat down with our loaded-up plates.  It was almost ten minutes before they brought wine and water so our food got a bit cold while we waited.  Almost everything was over-salted.  The wine was basically grape juice flavored.  Definitely a "you get what you pay for" situation. Do not skip the gravy!  The meat is extremely dry.  If you are sensitive to salt, do not go here!  Honestly, the best dish I had was grape leaves.  The prime rib, chicken, and lamb simply weren't good.

Tss8YQwtZY664EJiJdhDLg.text: Overpriced and definitely not worth 21.99 a person for breakfast. A large variety to choose from but not great quality. Would not eat here again.

Ibj3210wE6nwg7sCnzWIkA.text: This was an awesome buffet. The atmosphere is adorable. The food is served out of little storefronts that each represent one of the provinces of France and feels as if you are really eating in a cute little French village. Our table was actually situated "outside" a small house so it felt like dining al fresco without the bother of bugs or dirt.  The food itself is amazing. Not all of it is French, but the dishes that are not are pretty seamlessly integrated. For example, there were a couple of Italian dishes at the Provence station, but because Provence borders Italy that made sense and didn't distract from the overall theme. For me, the crepe station and the dessert section were by far and away the best parts of the meal. The crepe chef made both sweet and savory varieties. I had one with mushrooms, cheese, and spinach that was to die for. As for the desserts, 90% of them are french classics such as creme brulee. That's right, all you can eat creme brulee.  The pricing gets a little expensive. A basic adult buffet is around $30 dollars, but you can add on an extra $12 for all you can drink beer and wine (dinner) and champagne and mimosas (brunch/breakfast). You can also pay an extra $10 to jump the line.  The line to get in is also something worth mentioning. If you are in any kind of hurry splurge on the line jump. The line moves relatively quickly, but even on a weeknight it took my husband and I a good 45 minutes to get through it.  As a last note, if you are in the mood to splurge a little, I highly recommend getting the Paris Balloon Cocktail. All it is is your choice of a margarita, daiquiri, or pina colada served in a ceramic glass shaped like the balloon that serves as Paris's logo. The drink was expensive, but the bartender put in enough rum to get both my husband and I buzzing.

mhXonQFVv5gfIl8XiAjMzQ.text: Food was okay and service was okay...the only benefit was booking on opentable so that you didn't have to wait in line.  If you are really hungry and just want okay lots of food then this is your place.

X_i5368HLmvnKvmrBYKgXg.text: Le Blah!  A friend from work told me this was the best buffet she had been to in Las Vegas, but I guess things have changed since she was here 3 years ago.  The wait was interminable...like an hour, and it didn't even appear to be crowded.  The food was cold and tasteless.  I couldn't even pull the chicken off the bone because it was too tough.  The pastas were crusty and bland.  The biggest disappointment was the desserts.  Wouldn't you think a French inspired buffet would have the best desserts?  The cakes tasted like store bought birthday cakes.  Everything was dry and bland. I've eaten better food at a school cafeteria.  Do not waste your money at this buffet.  The Wicked Spoon (Cosmopolitan) and Aria buffets are much better.

Rd-EaYCrnPcQcW7pbCF3qg.text: $32.99 for a Thursday dinner. One glass of wine included pp (cab, chardonney, or merlot). $1 off pp if you use your TR card. One TR card can give you that discount for up to 5 ppl the TR staff told me.  Wine was good; it didn't give me a headache like most red wines do.  The food is overall more dressed up American food than French. About 20% of the selection looked to be traditional French dishes.  Service is quick about taking your plates away but slow to refill your water, get you a beverage, or clean an empty table. Service also seemed overwhelmed/annoyed if you asked for things. I asked one staff member for water and in response, she silently pointed at the server I should be asking. I was turned off by that and would have liked her to provide a more polite response.  What is bizarre is that there is a line to get in that winds around twice in front of the buffet, but if you go inside, there are consistently about 20+ tables that are empty in the back section of the dining area. Why did we wait in line for about 20+ minutes to get seated when there were so many empty tables near the serving area?  They make crepes right in front of you. It was good. Would have loved to finish mine except I was beyond full.  The best dishes there were the pork and apples skillet and the seafood bouillabaisse. There is also a carving station for prime rib.  In the dessert section, there is a variety of cookies, eclairs, cookies, ice cream, flan, creme brulee, macarons, and fresh fruit. The basket of pears was full of rotting pears. The flan was good; not the jell-o kind.  Ambiance is okay. The place is a little bit dark.

dxCoDF_L6-L4a2H1GjCz9w.text: Food was fresh and delicious, and service was friendly. I was pleasantly stuffed afterwards. =) The selection was pretty good concerning meat dishes, so you carnivores should be happy here. I was too stuffed that I didn't have enough room for crepes. So, don't make my mistake and save some room for dessert! I'm sure it was excellent, since the main dishes were pretty tasty!

65NnxKUHOFyaULS3kRtRjg.text: We went here on Sunday for the tail-end of the brunch buffet. We got in line a little bit before 2pm, and finally after about an hour we were finally seated and got to roam the food stations.   None of the food stood out as particularly amazing, but I'd have to say that the highlights were probably the brie and bacon macaroni and the prime rib. I was in a breakfast mood so I also tried the eggs benedict, scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, hash browns, and a crepe. The bacon and sausage were good, but the scrambled eggs were way watery and had a very odd consistency. The eggs benedict was pretty good, but it seemed like it had been sitting out for a while.   However, we were a bit disappointed when we had been sitting at our table for about 15-20 minutes and our server told us that they had completely run out of champagne. How do you run out of champagne for a champagne brunch? That made absolutely no sense to me. They offered us wine after a while, but I was really looking forward to the champagne....boo. It would have been nice if they had comp'ed us something at least.   If you do decide to come here, I'd come early so they don't run out of champagne on you. If you're going to do multiple buffets while you're in Vegas i'd probably do this one first, because compared to the other buffets i've been to in Vegas (Mandalay Bay and Bellagio), the quality of the food just wasn't there.

hwuvspEWx-nJJn_QKi9dkQ.text: There are so many choices in Las Vegas in it comes to buffet, so you can definitely find some good places if you've done enough research or just visit Yelp.  Anyway, this buffet restaurant is on my "avoid it" list. And here is why.   First, it costs $27 per person and there were not much food variety or quality. Some of them were even hard to eat. I visited this buffet on weekend and the only shellfish items I saw was just cold alaska crab legs and they were extremely extremely salty and not fresh.   Other hot food items were just average and so were their deserts. What really annoyed me were there are some items that they reserved for VIP customers only, and these items are not really special. Chocolate covered strawberry or hot crabs are not something I considered luxury. You can find these items available for everybody at most other buffet joints.

TOyUEZaetw79yfPEG4hiuA.text: This review is for the breakfast buffet only.  We waited 15-20 mins for breakfast, arriving around 8:30.  I didn't know vacationers in Vegas woke up that early!    The selection was good for breakfast.  Omlettes, cereal, fresh fruits, baked goods, ham, bacon, other breakfast staples, and my personal favorite, crepes.  The orange juice was delicious, one of the best I've ever had.    The ambience is charming.  It's an French outdoor theme, with the ceilings painted like the sky with clouds.  I enjoyed it.  I probably will return on my next visit to Vegas.

iS8aCBkLivQIzL2DhA0x8A.text: The Le Buffet at Paris casino is not worth the price nor the calories. The only item I enjoyed was the French onion soup.  The chicken was tough, the salmon was dry and the crepe from the crepe station was incredibly sweet.  The best thing I can say about this experience is that having dinner there saved me money in the long run because my husband and I both felt awful after our meal that we went right back to the room and did not gamble anymore.

0F3wzdnKrsmsdjHPoHH46g.text: Great food, wonderful service, very small desert selection for the price. Lovely environment and ambiance. Ask to sit is the Boulevard room by the fireplace for a quieter experience. I hate yelp because they now require you type more just to save what uouve written to finish later. I still cant save!  Still cant click next!

yQVdgvLxst0HMuI53RAF2g.text: I went for dinner to the buffet. It was $27.99 per person, not including the alcohol pass. The food was just okay, sure you get as much as your glutenous heart/stomach can desire but a lot of okay isnt as good as just enough of great. With so many options on the strip for dinner $30 per person can get you some pretty amazing meals. They have a lot of italian and french inspired foods to choose from. Yes they have crab legs, but they are cold and not that big. Also prepare to bring you ingenuity because they dont provide crackers or those handy small forks. Even the roast beef and steak are on the lukewarm side. The pastas are decent but again the quality of the selection of food is only okay at best.  Look around for a better quality of food buffet or more than likely an actual restaurant. Plus then you can avoid all the people running into you while your trying to pile your plate high.

E9_4Ogpok0Dj7YbAYHIogA.text: I love this buffet! There are only two thing I eat here: Crepes and slab of bacon! The world is right when I am here. everything else here is good but this makes it great

AUQnyrIij7-S5umIYogYOg.text: We had breakfast here, and it was a lot of selection. A lot of pastry, deserts, and other traditional breakfast items. The pate was pretty good also.    The fresh made crepes were amazing.  Service was pretty good.   They offered both regular and turkey bacon, sausage and other products.  I must say my favorite dish was the baked oatmeal.

bhE8i0XMZP9Y88BxxExj9g.text: This is the perfect buffet for when you want to feel like you're at Disneyland but in France but in Vegas and ready to consume six plates of food.  If you've been to Disneyland, I'd compare this atmosphere to the Blue Bayou. It's trying to bring the outdoors in, but you feel kind of strange about it but you're glad they tried. The ceiling is painted like a blue sky and that's really the main factor that brought my sister and I here on a Monday night. This was our only buffet of our trip, and we looked at a bunch before deciding. I'm really glad we picked this one - the Bellagio was so ugly inside, and even though it has rave reviews, who wants to be in a dim, themeless, windowless room that you paid $40 to be in? Not us. We'll take a cute little village atmosphere, please and thank you.   Highlights of our food: the mashed potatoes, the truffle pasta, the prime rib, the sushi (don't be scared), the creme brulee, and the crepe station.   Bummer items: carrots (not done enough), sweet potatoes (also not done), beet salad (lukewarm), duck (too tough).  Being that this was my one and only Vegas buffet and we kind of fasted all day for this, I took about six trips back. They cleared our plates real quick and were good about refills. Between the two of us, we had five plates of dessert. FIVE. Get the strawberry crepe, not the apple one. I tried both for you. Get two creme brulees so you don't have to go back when you eat your first one in five seconds flat. Get all the desserts and have one bite of each, you're in Vegas, don't feel guilty, don't be modest. They live for your food waste.  And for goodness sake, ask to sit under the painted blue sky. Don't be stuck in a little room when there are classy fake trees and storefronts awaiting you.

6y-0s2OBMCGenW5rRhvXjg.text: Run!! The food was awful. Yes, yes, the normal cliche...if I could give it 0 stars I would.   I understand the food items at one or at two stations at a buffet are not enjoyable, however the food at ALL stations were undesirable at Paris Buffet. The food was cold and it was missing something...right - flavor!! Please pony up and spend the extra $5 for a better buffet ($27.99 crazy) or please gain a little more energy to walk as far from this place to a better buffet. Ok...let me get off my soap box.   The difficult part, I brought my cousins from Mexico City and they were too caring to tell me this buffet sucked. However, they verified the tasteless food by leaving their plates half full and going to buffet stations in hopes of a decent plate - operation: fail.   Please refrain from coming here, it will only disappoint and embarrass you from the people you bring!!

ENPhj15RCXIXVM7kxpehyw.text: I highly recommend coming here for breakfast. Their breakfast selection is SO good! Eggs benedict, although a little hard, was good! Their sweet palenta was one of my favorites, as well as the smoked salmon. There was a crepe bar and omlette bar. The ambiance is nice, dimly lit, so it made for a romantic but casual vibe for breakfast with the boyfriend. The wait at 9:30 am was long, but there were quite a bit of tables available. Maybe they were short-staffed. Our server was nice. She gave us to-go cups for our apple juice. I wasn't impressed with their dessert bar. And the bathroom only had one stall. Not enough for the size of the restaurant if you ask me. But we got here at the end of breakfast time so they started putting out lunch food right before 11am. So we got to enjoy food from both times.

zX5aFZA1IJ4_MGZRcuT07A.text: Food options are ok. Ambience good but very noisy when thy Clean table they just throw the cutlery so Loud.   If they treat it professionally it can get better ratings

F-3EoHtDy34RkKp5hZDo_g.text: Omg, what this world has become. Le Village was once voted #1 Buffet in Vegas back in the mid 90s WHEN it open.  Over the years it has just succumb to high cost of operation. The food quality and diversity had just denominated and sequentially deteroriooated. I  I was here for internet conference. I paid $35.38 for lunch and was not satisfied. The main dish is scramble eggs and one French style course and prime rib plus some assortments of seafood.   It used to be they had 17 different French style courses and two BBQ stations. I guess the world has changed.  Oh boy...this was not the Le Village like before. It be better seved if i goto Denys next time. I guarantee i will never come back here again. I WOULD NOT RECOMMENDED THIS PLACE.   For the food, i would priced at $14.99, instead of $30.99 I want my $16.00 refund please. Plus tax.  I guess the French style scramble eggs is still good but...i can do that watching youtube.

qlHiORl26iTulp7c-gta8g.text: This was one of the 1st places I took my daughter when we got into Vegas. I wanted to have a theme night. I took her here and we were going to go up in the Eiffel Tower. We got in on Monday the 16th. It was extremely windy so most of the outdoor things were closed for the evening, the Tower, Fountains, Volcanoes, ect... We were a bit disappointed in that, but beyond any ones control. That being said, we did eat at this buffet. The line was a little long, but the staff was awesome!! Once we got in there the food did not disappoint. We both eat low carb. I felt there was a good selection of meat, veggies and salad. My daughter was super stoked to get to splurge on some lower sugar desserts. I am not sure why the negative reviews of this buffet. We walked away very pleased and super full.

RUABTNqDCDgJTxHhIY5Lww.text: Awful food, awful management, awful ambience. The dining area my party was seated in had tables that weren't bussed for 10+ minutes, and when they were finally cleared, they went right to a trolley that was sitting in the dining room less than 20 feet away from where I was eating. Of course, a trolley full of dirty dishes and food waste stunk up the dining room, which immediately killed my appetite. To make matters worse, the food options were extremely disappointing.  They had about 7 varieties of potatoes though, so if you want to spend $40 on a buffet to fill up with potatoes, this is the place for you. The prime rib was tough and filled with gristle, essentially making it inedible. The other meat options were dry with no flavor.  The only saving grace of the meal was the crepe.   During our meal, there was a party of 20+ in the same dining area, who made our meal incredibly unpleasant. They were being extremely rude and disruptive. Our server (Mitzi), dealt like them with a pro, but you could tell she was incredibly overwhelmed by the amount of tables she was in charge of. For some reason, she was working alone, having to serve as well as bus tables. When I spoke to the manager about it, he was extremely dismissive and said "She's slammed like this all the time, she should be used to it". I was disgusted by the manager's attitude toward his servers, especially since this buffet was in a nicer hotel and was not cheap!  Overall, I was EXTREMELY disappointed by both the food and the management. I would NOT recommend this buffet to ANYONE. When others are saying "RUN, DON'T WALK", they are not kidding.

i86aM8By3ECtin6tfZZJWQ.text: Yay brunch! I came to Le Village for the first time for brunch on a Friday morning during spring break, around 11AM. ~25 minute wait for my party of 3. Not too bad. At least the line was moving the whole time.  I'm a huuuuge breakfast food person so this buffet was right up my alley. Some quick tips:  Love: crepe bar, whipped cream, $12 unlimited mimosas, bacon slab, coffee, fresh strawberries, quiche, sausage. Solid selection of extremely delicious breakfast/brunch food.  Watch out for: too many good carb options make it easy to fill up real fast, too many egg-based things (frittatas, omelettes, scrambles, etc) that all basically look/taste the same.  Bottom line, Le Village is a solid buffet in Vegas. Not spectacular/must-stop, but for a reasonable price per person, get pretty good food and drink. If you do the Buffet of Buffets, definitely put Le Village buffet somewhere in your lineup.

I1ELMH-2qDov5_fmp138Wg.text: Food is good, but be prepared to WAIT in line A LONG TIME!! Then when you get in there are about 15-20 empty tables!! And order double beverages because by the time the waitresses check on you (even at night when it's slow) you're eating dry food for quite a while!! We waited in line for about 45 min and find SO MANY empty tables throughout the restaurant when we get in!! LOUSY SERVICE and NOT RECOMMENDED!! You're better off trying another buffet. I know we will!!

Em_25qAsQqKcd37uDj6SuQ.text: This place was about $30 per person. I have to say it was worth it. I loved the food. The deserts were so yummy. I ordered a strawberry crepe. Yummy yummy yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
