jRdDDiR5eHmzeWER7zKKDA.text: Just had a horrible experience at Le Village Buffet today! Go to any other buffet if you have a choice, food and service is deplorable here!!!  I was looking for a buffet to enjoy by myself and decided to give Le Village Buffet @ Paris a try. After waiting for an hour to get seated I got some food that quickly disappointed me.   The made-to-order ham & cheese crepe was rushed out so quickly that the cheese didn't even have a chance to melt and the prime rib was either very well done or completely rare. Still this wasn't what ruined the entire experience since I was aware that I was going to one of the cheaper buffets in Las Vegas.  The service in general was mediocre, but the entire experience got ruined when I got up for a second round of food. After returning to my table, I found out that the bus boys had completely cleared out my table less than 15 minutes after I had gotten seated!!! On top of that nobody seemed to think that this was an issue! The bus boys did quickly put my table back and give me new table setting, however I asked to speak to the waiter and manager regarding this issue and neither seemed to care about the fact that after I waited 1 hour to get in, I was being forced out within 15 minutes. The only thing that the manager said after I talked to him was that I was welcome to continue eating anything from the buffet (something that is already my right after waiting 1 hour in line and paying over 30$ for the buffet). I couldn't put up with the attitude that I was getting from the manager and left afterwards.  TLDR - Food is mediocre at best, and the service is the worst that I have ever experienced at any buffet. Any other restaurant would be a better option then Le Village Buffet. Save your money from eating at this place and go to a better one.

CW6tecQBL2MSfnoyY59G5g.text: I went here twice. Once for dinner and once for brunch. Both were amazing. The crepe bar is a definite must. The apple dessert crepe and the truffle mushroom crepes are excellent. The pastries are fresh and there are so many choices it's hard to decide. The prime rib is better than the tritip. The tomato bisque was excellent. Definitely worth the money.

91u5koDLCRnh3upygRh1_Q.text: The food would have been a solid 4 stars on its own, especially with such a wide selection. The elusive fifth star is for great service (our sweet waitress poured us some to go cups of champs when we complained about being cut off lol) and the CREPES!!!! Have a crepe! Actually, have a s'mores crepe! You won't regret it. #givethecrepeladyaraise PS: please don't forget to tip your server! They work hard and too many people forget or overlook this at a buffet :)

JqThkZ7I3WenD3O_sYFnKA.text: I love buffets, and I have been to some not so great buffets here in Vegas....  I loved this place, my Boyfriend and I left here so satisfied and so full. Of course everything isn't for everyone and there will be food you don't like but what we liked, we had lots of!  The crepe station was SO DELICIOUS, we had the Banana Nutella and the Strawberry Ricotta. They were both delicious but the Strawberry Ricotta beat out the Nutella one by a hair. Haha  The only downside was our server, it was like we didn't have one. For some reason he had a problem with serving us, but didn't have an issue refilling and speaking with the other tables around us, odd, but nevertheless, we will be back!  Nina was very pleasant as well! Greeting us and making sure we were in good moods before we even sat at our table.  We arrived at 5pm and there was about a 10 minute wait for the two of us. As we left, around 6pm, there was a long line out the door and this was during the week. So get here asap!

EnUMmyYuGOlJGpWaM7tFAg.text: I have been to this buffet at least 3 times over the last few years and each time it is fair, some good food, some not so great but I love the theme of it all. Well this last time we went, 1/8/17, we enjoyed our meal before we went to see the Love show at the Mirage. We had nothing to eat afterwards, and had one beer each during the show. After about 3 hours our stomach's started to not feel well. My wife actually had to throw up in the restroom as we walked back to our hotel. We got back to the hotel well we both felt sick. This continued on onto the next day. It was definitely something we ate at Le Village Buffet in Paris Hotel.   I noticed there is no way to reach the hotel via email/customer support and in the past, calling a buffet to explain an experience like this is more hassle than its worth. However there was no point, I had thrown away the receipt and wont be returning to Vegas for a while anyway so a complimentary meal wouldn't have sufficed. I would like to however warn people that it may not be the best option to eat here. Not only did we get food poisoning but in general there are better buffets like the Spice Market buffet or Rio carnival buffet.

PyA2b99pXVzRAS0rgqc2CQ.text: I give this a one because the food was not all that great. It seems to me that their employees do not enjoy working here. The only thing that I thought was good was the steak. The crab legs were frozen. Wtf. For those who are in line waiting to eat here. Go somewhere else.  Eat at yama sushi or at Wynn.

LKatRBkTIgHNewa7pYSC6w.text: food is just okay, nothing that stands out to me. the crepes are just okay too. it was listed on vegas.com's top 10 vegas buffets, but i'm not sure it belongs on a list next to wicked spoon or bacchanal. there is only one stall in the women's bathroom as well.

mgcTeHhIOafzGRozLGs9MA.text: We visited Le Village Buffet on a Saturday around 5:30pm for $31 a person. There was no line when we arrived and were seated immediately. The French village decor was cute and very fitting. The cheese plate and soup was a perfect starter. The Salmon was cooked perfectly, the crab legs were pre-split and easier to eat than most buffets. Neither had the slightest fishy taste. There was a wide variety of vegetables, both sweet and savory crepes, and the creme brulee and macaroons were on par with those served at higher end French bakeries. The staff was very nice and attentive, we could hardly slide a dirty plate to the end of the table before someone was picking it up. As far as mid-priced Las Vegas buffets go, this is one if not THE top.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella Crepe, crème brulee, and a tiramisu cup.

9ut-2GVKbiBAzYhx-dYiiA.text: Pretty good buffet for the price. Not as menu food options as Bellagio but still pretty yummy. I came here for Valentine's dinner and was served unlimited red/white wine and warm crab legs. The service was amazing. I was surprised at how many people came here for a romantic dinner. The food options were decent but I would like more from different cultures. We did not have to wait at all since I am a Platinum Member. We were able to be seated within 5 minutes of arriving.

1aGq5HrACsl4Q8EaxdwyAQ.text: Horrible selections, over cooked slop in  every dish  with vegetables, dry, tough meat. Oh, and the ice cold, wet, split, overly salty crab legs? Save your money. It's simply NOT worth it. Paris buffet brags on their crab legs. They fail to mention they are not served hot. Will never go there again.

jy_wVORRJJIaWg3NTpcaRw.text: I've been to Vegas many, many times and I've tried many places to eat.  The Paris buffet is by far the best value for your money.  I go at least once on every trip.  Brunch, dinner...it's all great!  The desserts are a must!  Do not miss out.  (I'm not big on desserts, by the way).  Creme brulee is very well executed and one of my favorites.  The service has always been friendly and attentive and the atmosphere is what I expect in Vegas.  ALWAYS A GREAT AND SATISFYING EXPERIENCE...from someone who's not so easy to please.

fAvODsxqkbWL46jzMiY3Rg.text: After waiting an hour in line for dinner buffet, I must say I was VERY dissappointed in the variety and quality of food and the service. All of the food was swimming in some kinda of sauce. The waitress kept forgetting to bring our drinks. It was so not worth $25 per person. I would have rather eaten a sandwich at the sandwich shop right across. Do not go here.

adAKDrv8uEP0CXy3vpL7cA.text: Had the weekend brunch that had a wide choice of food and unlimited champagne! The choice of desert was awesome too! I liked it more than the Buffet at the Bellagio. The $10 express pass is a great option to skip the line; I would highly recommend taking that option and not waiting in line for an hour ;)

X75N4Q_83ySJzE9hZb-P5A.text: Had breakfast here. It was a Tuesday morning, about 10 a.m.,the line wasn't too long about 15 to get in. We were seated and drinks brought over right away. The selection was incredible! The made to order omelets were good, but the best was the made to order crepes!! I had cherries in mine, with chocolate sauce and whipped cream on top... the best! If I found this first, I wouldn't have taken the omelet, bagel and lox!! We would definitely go again!!!

JA-WtMaoKdIJ9KkFvNdT7g.text: i  DO NOT KNOW HOW  YOU GUYS  CAN  GIVE S UCH  HIGH RATINGS  TO THIS  MISERABLE PLACE,    long  lines,   high priced   and    bad  food,    of  a  fast food variety,   they do not   cook their own food,  it is  shipped in,    the prime  rib was  tough, turkey was  dry,   beef ribs  were   almost burned,  so  overcooked and  dry,    the  cakes  were  lacking any  sugar ,   and  the  walnut  cake  still  have  the  shellls   in it,  surprised they  didnt  charge extra,,,,  this generation of  fast food  thinks  this is  aweosme   food,     anyone with a  palate would  absolutely  be disappointed,      the  shells in the  cake  almost  broke a  tooth,    management made no comment,    nothing,,,,,,the paris  buffet  is  an awful place and   ought to be  avoided,   i  warned  you

V4gkn9V_iMXTGSefxakizQ.text: very good for a buffet in spite of the incredibly long line.  great desserts (creme brulee) and decent meats and veggies.

C68YB7rIqM-1CpYXqs7cVw.text: Le Village Buffet has it all:  Atmosphere, selection, service, seating (our favorite is the little inn off to the side of the open area, sort of out-of-the-way and more private.  The price was $22.00 per person in 2004, much lower than the Rio.  We started with salad:  various greens, cold shrimp, cheess, and bread; then, main course:  Alaskan King Crab legs (my favorite), oysters, venison, stews, soups, grilled veggies, baked chicken, pork; then for dessert:  what else?  the World's Best Crepes cooked in front of you with your choice of fillings.  And, for those interested, a huge selection of french pastries and wines -- the like of which you only expect in a high-class, expensive, and exclusive hotel restaurant.  And that includes the world-class service to your individual table.  I recommend you get a speed pass early in the day that will help you skip the long lines for lunch and dinner.

esy8PP8HjFKM1y4bsxzyUw.text: I remember having brunch at Le Village Buffet about 2 years ago and thinking it was one of the better buffets in Vegas.  So when I stayed at Paris recently, I knew I had to go back to Le Village for brunch.  Whenever I walked by, there was a long line of patrons waiting to get in so I ended up eating elsewhere. On my last day at Paris, I decided to wait in the line to get in for what I was expecting to be a good meal.  Especially after seeing the crowd of people always waiting to get into this buffet, I was under the impression that it had to still be a good place to eat.  Boy was I wrong, after almost a 1 hour wait, we were seated in one of the small dining areas that are located off the main dining room and had a waitress that was not very friendly.  On top of that, the floor wasn't particularly clean and the silverware had spots on them.  The food itself was not good.  There was a variety to things to select from, but none of it tasted particularly good. None of it!!!!  I thought the crepes or the pastries would be delicious given that it's "Paris", but they weren't.  I felt like I was eating at a bad diner.  What a shame!  The quality of this buffet has definitely gone down over the last few years and I don't know why people are lining up to dine at Le Village.  I will not be returning to this buffet again.

Jag9YZXDh3l8hXJqZkth7w.text: basically you need to get the discount tickets at tix4toniht booths and i think its like 5 dollars off... also if you go in around 3pmish then you can pay lunch prices but if you just chill until 330 then you get to eat dinner stuff, pretty mcuh you pay 1/2 as much as you would at the wynn but the food is like 2/3 as good.  good selections neato theme just overall a solid buffet, basically if i was broke id eat here but if i had the money id goto the wynn every time that place is better than a babys bottom.

iEOx2L3wvHIfV4ifpWsUXQ.text: Le Village Buffet No More!  I went three times in the past, never had such a poor experience, I guess the economy plays a part of the downhill of this buffet.  Crab legs were frozen, very little seafood in the dishes, not much veggies hot or cold, the only fruit available was watermelon which is sad coz all other buffets at least carry two variations, o by the way, people were putting their hands on the melon coz there weren't any salad claw to use, and when I tried to tell the guy at the station, he just looked at me and looked away!  And pardon me....French Buffet?  I don't think so, it's more Italian than French I have to say.  I guess those carbs from pizza and many types of pastas do fill you up, that's why they fill the buffet with carbs, smart move to get more $$$ from you for less huh?  I don't think the French are that into eating that much carbs, fellow diners are very rude, and this buffet is sure not worth the 30+ we paid for.  Rio/Wynn/Bellagio is much better!

Wi0iN0r0H2r8c7h1ezWc8A.text: Very good buffet spot in Paris. The seating area is very unique as it imitates a small village tucked away some where in France with small shops and tables on the streets. The service was very timely and the waiter that helped us was always available and cleaning the plates as patrons finished them. The selection of food was good as well. Plenty of options for all different palates. I enjoyed the truffle Mac and cheese, crab legs (no butter for some reason), and the chicken de provance. The pastry chef made excellent macarons and creme brulee. The crepes were awesome too, they had both savory and sweet options. The price is reasonable and justified for the quality of food you can get. A crepe alone is a third of the price you pay to eat. So if you're looking for a unique and fun place to eat at a buffet I highly recommend putting this on your list

lmjQrr05qM7PgE9-asWIQg.text: it sucks dont come here for the love of god please save yourselves. im doing you a favor pleaseeee. holy shit never been so disappointed in my life. shit clam chowder. shit crab. ok pasta. hash brown & ham pretty good. but worth 45$??? i think not. looks nice though. good day....i said good day

HUWC9OfiyBc5Jaof2tNW7Q.text: I'm no Vegas buffet connoisseur but I found alot of delicious food here. Lamb and Prime Rib were excellent! Thankfully the Prime Rib was not on the rare side (I hate that), BBQ ribs were also good. Lots of potato dishes for this carb addict to enjoy :) Delicious desserts upon desserts Creme brulee, Cheese cakes, flan, apple cobbler, I could go on but I wont because it would be a ridiculously long review. They had a number of dishes I'd never heard of and sounded French which I wanted to try but by the time I'd finished gorging myself with the familiar there was no more room :X  There are many more buffets in Vegas I need to try but if I find myself hungry in the vacinity of the Paris again I will certainly stop here to eat again.

jSO7gzI60gTiGsyYn2wz0g.text: We had purchased a buffet pass and ended up having both breakfast and dinner here. It had a decent selection and decent food. If you get the pass, this one is worth visiting but plan ahead! The best time to come is a little before a typical meal hour so that you don't have to wait on a ridiculous line.

G6WowYpCO9GXQfL1Eaz4eQ.text: this is for the breakfast only. I'm a breakfast person. I'll eat breakfast for lunch or dinner. I also love my eggs and potatoes.  If you love potatoes, come here. Different dishes of potatoes. Breakfast style of course. Not just the plain boring hash browns you find elsewhere.   Different dishes of eggs. I loved the variety of eggs dishes.   Im not a crepe person. Long line didn't want to wait. Yeah, theres an Omelette station. And wait!!!! a bagel toasting station with cream cheese, lox, capers, tomato, and onion -- just like how Einstein Bagels makes em. Sold!  Breakfast at Paris for me from now on if I'm ever up at 9am again in Vegas. I think this is my first breakfast buffet ever..... I'm usually not a morning person, i love to sleep in, it's my therapy! Really.

33-GfkoYL-DUb-_Ssws66g.text: What happen?! So disappointed  No customer service  Felt really dirty sitting in the dining area because I was surrounded by uncleared tables  So sad  Lack of variety  Steak was ok  Not that much choices  I thought Paris buffet was better? I swear.   Never again  Should have walked to Wicked buffet!

qEwjJ4AB2RpZf_r1iJ08iQ.text: Came here for breakfast recently and stuffed my face.  Everything was delicious.  The prime rib was uber good!!  The crepe line can get super long... as does the omelet station.    Only setback for me was their crab legs are not cut in half like most buffets I frequent.  Maybe I've been spoiled by the easy access, but I really had to work for my food when cracking the crab leg shells.

Cd7hpu6VuW4jIDa2IkA4uA.text: So here's the deal. We came here for breakfast and it wasn't great.  The service: It was terrible. I could not get a server to refill our waters and orange juice to save my life, and what we were given was warm. I hate warm water, soda, juice, milk, even coffee. I like my drinks ice cold, so that bothered me.   The food: Eh... it was okay. It was not worth the $25 per person cost, that's for sure.  Several types of eggs and potatoes along with bacon, sausage, mini French toasts, mini pancakes, croissants, muffins, bagels, fruit, etc... is what they had.  I think the only reason to come here and pay this price is if you plan on eating several full plates, which we didn't. We didn't eat that much at all because it was mediocre at best.  EXCEPTION!!!!! The one exception is I did decide to try a crepe.  I got the #1 which was nutella with bananas, hazelnuts, and whipped cream. Okay, this thing was f*****g Delicious!!  With a capital D. It's the only reason I'm giving the two star rating. However, I'm sure you can find a restaurant that is much cheaper and get a wonderful crepe.  Also, after we left my boyfriend started feeling really sick and had to make several trips to the bathroom throughout the day. So while the crepes were good we'd never come back due to price, blah food, and the fact that my boyfriend got pretty sick.

R_YLeSihaPavaeYL-wij7A.text: Hmmmm, not sure why this place is on some of the Vegas Best Buffets list as it was dreadfull.  We went for dinner and the line was pretty long about a 45 minute wait, so the food must be good right?  Well there were a few tasty items but overall the food wasnt very fresh or tasty.  Being in a hurry and exhausted after shopping we came back for lunch. OMG shocking the same food from dinner was there rotting away, the only thing I was brave enough to eat was caesar salad. The place was not clean and the food oh so stale!

gmr0-ISxnSjeTWaOVnRH8A.text: Long line to get in.  You can make reservations online which I highly recommend.    The food was delicious and macarons were very good too.    Prime rib, snow crab legs, lamb, and pasta were my flavors.    Very good flavor.

pIgujZ1TeUtPA5s9dgjulg.text: My husband and I went for brunch. The crape and omelet and pastery were very good. Service was very slow. Tea was not very good. Overall had a good time.

2Xo1WZ0dFCvlqzoncGEvFQ.text: The buffet is really good and they have several unique options to choose from. It is a little on the pricey side, but the food is worth the added cost. 3 stars for the completely abysmal service. I have been here twice now and both times it was bad. Could honestly be the worst I have ever received both times. One time I got up, went to the server station, and got my own oj and water cause it had been over 20 minutes since I ordered it.

4uB9EG8RFYHbeX_oHWbA7w.text: This is the second time we visited this establishment. The first time we were so disappointed. This time we felt welcome, and service was friendly. We came for breakfast instead of dinner and were pleasantly surprised to find fresh made crepes.  The men preparing them were artisans, they had amazing skill to make the most incredible savory and decadent crepes I've ever had.  Our server was sweet and efficient.

ot35GYzvARewy_HPJAKOcw.text: Beautiful atmosphere, feels like you're in Marseille.. Great service, will repeat!  Love french food, great service, great crowd of people. Lots of tables to sit and get away from noisy people.

pV4vc2nva844_JYXIrl6MA.text: You can't beat getting a groupon deal. Two people for lunch with a bottle of wine was $36. Such a good price considering you're in Vegas.   Make sure to make reservations on opentable and you'll save yourself a lot of time waiting in line. We were also able to get a spot in one of the little rooms so it didnt seem as crowded.  Prime rib was delicious, crepe was all the fabulous things everybody says on here. Don't waste time on the sushi ( I mean really? Sushi in a Paris themed buffet?) and the Creme brulee was one of the best I've had   The place is super cute and the staff was actually really friendly and attentive. I'd definitely come back but only if I got another groupon deal.   Happy eating!

sdw-wKSyTKgUlNI0zCY02w.text: Full disclosure:  I'm not much of a buffet fan boy.  When it comes to food, I'm more of quality than a quantity guy and - since I'm paying for it dammit - I prefer my food brought to me rather than the other way 'round.    That said, I've allowed myself to be dragged to the buffets in almost all of the major Vegas hotels (Bellagio, Wynn, Four Seasons, the Venetian, etc).  And in each case I left stuffed but incredibly unimpressed.  Buffet food is almost always the most bland, pedestrian, overcooked, lukewarm dreck.  And I just can't get much of a hard-on over crab legs, sorry.  Then I tried the the Paris buffet.  What a hidden gem.  Instead of a bacchanalian orgy of tasteless dross, I found a casual French buffet featuring surprisingly high quality cuisine.  The dining room is set in a Disney-esq recreation of a French country village, complete with stone buildings and a simulated blue sky (with clouds).  Scattered amongst the faux architecture  are various food stations, each representing a culinary region of the country.    Note that this isn't an American buffet in a French theme park;  Much of it is quite authentic (at least to this gastronaut).  You'll find mostly familiar fare (crepes, quiche, Coq au vin, etc) as well as  a few unique offerings you may not have tried before, all surprisingly tasty and well made.  In the center of all this is the dessert station, strategically located and sporting numerous decadent French mini-pastries (if you were looking for frozen yogurt and sprinkles, sorry you're out of luck), which are continually refreshed and therefore not stale (as with many buffets).  I'm a dessert junkie, so this is my favorite station, one I generally return to more than once in an evening.  There is almost always a line to get in here, so prepare yourself for a 30min wait at peak times.  In my experience, the best time to avoid the crowds is ~3pm.  If you don't mind eating early, you can generally walk right in.  Note that I don't want to over-hype things;  This is still a buffet. Not everything knocks it out of the park, and the food is certainly not going to compete with Bouchon or Le Cirque.  But if you have to do a buffet while in Vegas, this is your best bet, IMHO.  Worth a try the next time you're in Sin City.

1cqVaw0_gFnrbgxWnO0-vQ.text: in my top 3 list of favorite buffets in las vegas!  there's a reason why any total reward member with platinum/7 stars would come here - VIP SERVICE.  we have a separate entrance away from that crazy line.  they sat us way up in the front close to the food, brought us a bottle of wine, and a bucket of steamed crab legs.   the refills of crab legs in a bucket (only for platinum/7 stars), unlimited soda/coffee, and great table service make me want to keep coming back for more.  food is pretty decent - no complaints....except, they don't serve asian food. duh.. it's paris, afterall.   other than that, you need to come here and eat their crepes, prime rib, truffle mac n cheese, crab legs, and pastas!

O2WhYzvLFSl-1SNAZoaf9Q.text: Veggie and pasta lover? Definitely come here.   Meat lover?  You may want to try another dining locale.  Mmm...this place was awesome.  I'm not normally a fan of buffets- usually there's just too many different types of foods that my stomach can't handle all at once.  So the fact that I was able to eat here (and eat LOTS), and not be totally sick afterwards is a good thing.    They had a decent variety of meat, none of which looked too appealing.  Honestly, I like meat, but I would be in just as much heaven with pasta and veggies.  Probably why I liked it so much here- every vegetable dish was cooked 'til perfectly tender and thoroughly slathered in butter and garlic.  In my book, that's definitely the way to go.  Heart attack city disguised in greens and other leafy matter.  Similarly, being an Italian stuck in an Asian body, the pasta dishes were amazing, covered in lots of oh-so-yummy marinara sauce (my fave).  Try the sauteed mushrooms.  Try the grilled Roma tomatoes.  HEAVEN.    Also of worthy note- $2 fabulous looking (and tasting!) mimosas and $5 also fabulous looking (and tasting!) bloody marys.    The restaurant itself has a nice feel to it- outdoorsy-ish and set to look like Paris (or what I imagine Paris would look like).  Cobblestone is always a nice touch.  Wait staff here are very friendly and came to check on us several times throughout our meal.  I tried Le Village using the Buffet of Buffets pass, but even without the pass, I would come back.  I basically ate until I couldn't eat anymore.  A+++

rMka4AocNtRTgEZ2VLqTUQ.text: Wendy was our server. She was friendly and had a sense of humor. We actually came here after reading the menu and looking forward to the French Onion Soup (which they weren't serving today, of course!!) She said to call her ahead next time and she'll make sure they do (making us smile, of course) The crepe station was MY favorite and my companion was very happy with the variety of vegetarian selections. I wasn't going to have any crab legs (not wanting to deal with the shells) well lo and behold they are sliced up the middle for your convenience!! Bonus!! I had several. In my personal opinion, it's a bit expensive but the food was fresh and delicious.

OxfMTSAI1SqnAdVEsrw-KQ.text: Came for lunch.  The assortment was more limited than some of the bigger buffets, but the food was quality and priced extremely reasonably for what they offer.  Definitely not trying to be all things to all people, but as for what they offer, they get it right.

1gWSR-JuWO6xwei3rGTrXw.text: solid four and a half. Good food, great service. The crab was super fresh and I likes the offerings and desert. I would have this as my top seven buffets in Vegas!

ieU39DXX4aaBunINdNmU3A.text: Maybe it was the time of day.. but Lunch time at Le Village buffet was NOT good! I was super disappointed it and I would have given them one star but their dessert was not bad!   I had a girls trip to Vegas recently and we decided to do the buffets of buffets. We never tried it, no boys were with us.. What the hell! Stuff our faces! haha!  The dishes were either over cooked or just not tasty. I was so surprised since some people I've talked to said the buffet was good! But what happened? The muscle was over cooked, the duck wasn't tasty, the pasta was just over cooked and not sauced well. I don't know I was just not happy.   Oh their French Onion soup was good (but serious how can you mess that up?) Their green beans were not even cooked, like they were raw! I don't know. I'm not that picky and usually just find something good at a place but.. ehh! Sorry ya'll!  Oh I should also say.. The first time I ever tried coming here was in last August and it was packed! We waited for almost two hours and we didn't even move. So we really tried hard to get in here and we did.. Man we should have left like last time!

TDBXV-0M3cBpBhl6l2zpHA.text: HUGE buffet. They have everything from salads, meat, seafood, crepes station and lots of deserts. Everything tastes good and the variation of food was amazing. 25 usd for the buffet, very price worthy. We stayed and just ate ate ate for 2,5 hours, I could have been there all day. Do not miss out on the crepes, the best I have ever had. Only thing missing is better service and a little more effort put on the interior. Otherwise, for 25 usd, it was perfect. Would definitely visit again!

ICT7dXqQG_Tk_vCXtlnt-A.text: One of the best buffets on the strip. The layout of the food is in 'shops' and breaks the food into groupings based on the area. There are countless stations filled with great food that never fails to satisfy.  The selection is always vast and varied to cater to everyone in your group. There is often a wait, but it's well worth it!

jSxqAV8Qq32e2qDtrJU8UQ.text: Hubby and I trek through the desert a couple times a year to enjoy the sights, sounds and BUFFETS of Vegas and Le Village Buffet had us hooked from our very first meal there.  We have tried many of the buffets in Vegas but always return to Le Village, at least once and often a couple times during every trip there (the buffet "next door" is our second favorite!).  The ambiance is quaint and charming with the setting reflecting an outdoor French cafe atmosphere looking up into a blue sky.  Relaxed - ready to hit the food line!  While Le Village may not have as huge a selection as some of the other buffets in town, the quality of the food most definitely exceeds most of its competitors.  We have noticed in recent years that they no longer offer as many French items as they once had but, again, what they do have is of the highest quality, and when you can see them cooking it right there in front of you, you know it's fresh!  The breakfast buffet is wonderful and includes every breakfast item imaginable!  One of my faves are the freshly-made Belgian waffles and Eggs Benedict.  Yummy!  And being the coffee-holic that I am, the pot of coffee that is left on your table for instant refills is all I need to make me a happy camper.  If nothing else, the crepes alone, which are made to order, are reason enough to give this place a try - they are to-die-for!    You won't be disappointed in Le Village Buffet!!  :)

SEtAMLsXmwvynVliOgZ9Ug.text: I love the food here.  I've done 24 hours buffet and I keep on coming back every I visit Vegas,  The only thing is the line can be a problem.... especially on the weekend.  My favorite is the desert section.

3Uhne_oW0mYtfq4o_fOQ-A.text: Buffets are interesting.    Some times, you go and eat a ton ignoring the quality of the food.  Other times, you go and eat as much as you can knowing full well that you're scarfing down some good restaurant grade grub.  Le Village Buffet falls kind of in the middle.    The Ups: Good Crepes  The downs: Crab Legs not always fresh tasting and hard to eat Desserts selection is sub par (Minus the crepes) Service  The middle grounds: The prime rib, chicken, veggies, pastas, rice, etc.  So what, why?  When you have so many choices of buffets in a place like vegas, there's no reason you should go somewhere you don't love.  Honestly, most the food is just okay and one of the biggest appealing things for me is the snow crab/king crab legs.  Since this place's weren't that good, it's just okay by my standards.  That and the waitresses that served us on multiple occassions were not attentive.  It could be that we had a big group but it could also just be that they forced us to have the 18% tip and they didn't want to earn it.    In the end, I'd go back if others want to but I'd rather go somewhere else.

yAWG_049daBDTmGwSoHZdw.text: Food was okay. Service was outstanding. Line outside but they move pretty fast. You can make a reservation at opentable.com and skip the line. Located inside of Paris hotel and casino.

It35gGM8JJcpLohs4-ahlg.text: Awful experience, the food option is terrible. I should of gone with the reviews, but I still wanted to give it a chance anyways. I would NOT recommend anyone to try this place. Lack of service, food options, & quality of food.

XSy1HV_u05DGGsIvefeomQ.text: Review is for dinner.  Mmm, it was pretty good food for a buffet, but barely worth the money I paid... ~$35 with included 17% gratuity.  I'd rather go have a nice meal at Bouchon for roughly the same price.  Anyway, at least they have snow crab legs.  I love me some crab legs.  The dinner dishes are somewhat fancier than other buffets like at Rio (i.e. you won't find hamburgers and chicken fingers here).  The duck l'orange was pretty good, the rest of the meat pretty average to slightly above average for a buffet (i.e. completely mediocre outside of the buffet world).  I do recommend the brie cheese and bacon macaroni, sausages, mussels, and crepe station.  In the end, I got my fill and spent about an hour of my time there cracking open crab legs.  However, the dishes aren't spectacularly executed and I don't think it's very good value.

Am6fiXgqTAGKGx830YBbsg.text: Crepes are incredibly delicious! Worth a try and penny! Even there macaroons are freshly baked and different. They used special whipped cream inside then the usual feeling. I even loved their roast beef and pasta!!! Soo yummy!

MGK6nzBAKsJUsnnIc8PUqw.text: Not really worth it.  Line wasn't long but still waited 15 to be seated.  Server was nice however, little slow greeting the table.  Really not a lot of choices for food options either except pasta and more pasta.  Prime was great and dessert was wonderful.  Overall underwhelmed.

FSYPaeC0GN7QviU1do15Kw.text: The menu was unimaginative and the service was strange. Needless to say, I didn't enjoy it.

nxRWexCZbVhqZjGbIEBhKw.text: review for breakfast buffett* for 15.99 it is ok. they had the usual, eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuits & gravy and other stuff. everything tasted ok. i love their OJ tho, so yummy. there is nothing special about this place though. if your hungry and with your boys after a night of gambling, come here. definitely not a place to impress a date with.

aEwd4JpZHVpyKtrsZjgRkg.text: Terrible! Came here for dinner $30.99 per person. Surprisingly, there was a decent line up.  The decor is actually very lovely. A european village or I would think not having been to europe. But its the food.. the food is really poor quality.  I did find some neat stuff but I was not able to find anything good in the entire buffet. Some neat stuff I found were some king crab legs, macaroons, and some poorly done creme brulet.

ZqbCdri9J4t9okk1kXv2zA.text: excellent buffet!!!  I am not a fan of buffets at all BUT this place was amazing!!!!  Such a cute atmosphere, so much food and it actually tastes good!!  Me and the hubby literally rolled out of here!!!!! Oh and I almost forgot you HAVE to try the crepes!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

k5Sk9NSpxia-P8J7n6ynPQ.text: Brunch here is awesome. Unlimited champagne. Dangerous cuz I get beer goggles. When you come to the Paris buffet come with a large appetite like ur ready to eat people because the choices are incredible. The service is great and it's very clean.

Wn2g674LO_hzGNfy8thXsw.text: WOW WOW WOW WOW!!! Everything was bursting with flavor and quaintness that my heart almost exploded from happiness. They had a CUTE antipasti plate with a grape tomato and tiny cucumber that made me squeal with delight. Other AWESOME items were the Gouda Mac and cheese, scalloped potatoes, sauteed asparagus, pastas, creme brulee, Caesar salad and brioled chicken. They were all just pleasing my inner soul and satisfying my spirit's inner core. I know this is much to say after a night of senseless drinking and losing shame and dignity.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Antipasti - delightfully small pickle on the plate!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Only buffet food that&#39;ll look fancy on your plate!

NikVA_vcCauoymuN3nNsiA.text: We did the Buffet of Buffets and out of all the participating buffets, I thought that this was the best... at least for breakfast and dinner. I like the fact that they had a crepe and omelet chef that were available. I thought that the crepe was a bit over-rated but the omelet was deliciously made well. I liked the egg benedict and the waffles. They also had many different choices of breakfast meat (like 3-4 different types of sausages, bacon, ham, etc). They also had many types of egg dishes (like the fritata, scrambles). They also had many choices of bread, muffins selections.  We liked it so much that we went back for dinner. Their dessert selection was awesome. They had many pastries like the macaroons, creme brulee, lemon raspberry tart, lemon meringue pie, etc.

z5bUiZq8jg7Kc54H7Xkuzg.text: About 10 years ago, Le Village Buffet knocked Rio World Buffet out of first place for my favorite buffet in Vegas. My favorite was brunch because we would go in and make sure we got our $25 worth of complimentary champagne. Now that Caesar's has bought Paris, there have been some subtle changes to the buffet. First off, they started charging $12 for beverages (OK, I'll take some responsibility for that one). Still a pretty reasonable price. I think the actual buffet price has gone down a little, so it makes it fair for those who don't imbibe alcoholic beverages. The food was always every French dish you could think of from Alsatian sausages and cassoulet to salads nicoise from Provence, it was all there. Now, they seem to have simplified the selection (although they still have cassoulet and salad nicoise) and made it more like every other buffet in Vegas. This was most apparent when I saw they had sushi rolls near the cold seafood. Really? Although I'm a little disappointed in the sell out, the food is still really good quality and has enough unique dishes that sets it apart. However, that first place spot is teetering on the edge. I'm going to see what Baccanal buffet has to offer.

qcARj_sENVjdCq8l33Y0pg.text: The very worst buffet in Las Vegas. We went there for their branch, hoping to see some good French pastries and fresh baguette. Also, omelette and good coffee. Instead, we had a very bad crepe and donuts. The food was tasteless, not fresh at all with low quality.  Don't waste your money at this place. It's a total disgrace to the French cuisine.

MNw7F0g323isVBSMylwkNg.text: Not to Be Missed  I have no idea what some of the bad reviews are about as my visit was the complete opposite of what some have claimed. Here's the items I tried: snow crabs, boiled shrimp, prime rib, string beans, mixed greens salad, French macaroons, berry filled crepe topped with real whipping cream fixed fresh, creme bruele. I'm a very picky foodie, and a cook myself. I know what's good because I have had plenty bad. I eat out 80% of the time. I'll start off with the details of some of the items that were outstanding: the prime rib was beyond excellent, cooked to perfection, tender at every part and juicy full of flavor. The string beans were awesome. Any cooking fool knows string beans are hard to season. Not these. They were fresh cooked and flavorful. The snow crabs were cut lengthwise for easy shelling, which I have never seen on these kind of cabs at other places. Usually at some places you get rubbery crabs that don't crack open and are mushy and flavorless. Not here. The meat comes out easy as it is exposed being sliced long ways. Even the ones that had no cuts could be cracked and the meat slid out easy, and yes they had flavor, not watered down. The shrimp were easy peel type and had flavor by themselves. The French macaroons were superb as was the creme bruele; all food was as good as one would expect from a 5 star gourmet restaurant, not a buffet.

E34aaeJDGDn6RGX2ZpN_iw.text: We ate breakfast here...its not bad, but not that great.  The 'made to order' stations were good, but the food sitting in the warming trays was pretty mediocre (at best).  Crepe station was the highlight and is would be the reason to return.  Omelette station was pretty standard and high quality.    What puts this in the second tier of buffets is the side options.  Potatoes were cold.  French toast was lukewarm.  Minimal salad or vegetable options (some green beans or roasted potatoes, served hot, should be offered).  For a French theme, the deserts were pedestrian at best.  Better options are out there.

HMEUFTfe-HtVcCbjwUG_vQ.text: Good is pretty good. I don't think they have a wide range of food, but what they do have is pretty good. Service does suck. Crabs are cut in half and are cold. But there is a lot of them so come hungry.

H3IeYLZ0CMq-sYNw8Y6dbQ.text: TLDR:Don't Go There.  It gets worse each time I went there. The food was worse than average and there was not as many choices as the other buffets in LV.  I won't go there any more even if it goes down to like 10 dollars. It is just not worth it. what's worse was the waiting was 2~3 hrs.   The place was crowded with tourists who might have thought it was a good buffet because the location is good. But is is just not True.

15A9M_BML8jEywYE2cJZNg.text: I visited during the breakfast to lunch switch, so I definitely got to experience a delicious brunch at Le Village in the Paris Hotel & Casino. Right when you enter, the warm village ambiance embraces you and draws you in; a self-playing piano further sets the Frenchy mood with jazzy tunes.  The food was wonderful. From freshly-made crepes to mini quiches, and from meaty mussels to succulent pork roast, Le Village offers a wide selection of delectable French-inspired dishes. One item that stood out to me was the red-wine poached pears that were at the waffle bar. They perfectly complemented the crispy waffle.  I'm deducting one star due to the cleanliness. My table was not fully wiped off when I sat down. Especially because the lighting is so dim, it's hard to tell if everything (plates, silverware, cups) is clean.   Overall, I enjoyed dining at this buffet!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute village setting
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Several breakfast delights

YC0IlvP0wtHGApddz2wnZg.text: Its not always about food when you go to a place to eat! This place is huge and crowded yet just one restroom for women and the line is crazy! I won't go to this place again !

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LmrCGd-S5Kf56JipVVcfyA.text: If you're ever in Vegas you just have to try brunch at this buffet. The food and the selection was amazing. The staff was friendly. Not to mention bottomless mimosas. Simply a must try if you're in Vegas.

CyIMbi004Z3f-Uqa7yFxnA.text: Third time here at the village  and still my favorite! Lots  diversity  food! Shrimp penne pasta was amazing, crepes a tr e huge with lots of fillings! But my favorite are definatlly the desserts!   Creme brulee and the flan are a most! I love this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts at Le village

GSi2oNGI0KcHKiiqUNmKNg.text: We reserved brunch on OpenTable for 9am. I expected it to be a la carte or buffet (as the menu provided by OpenTable made it appear to me) - it was only buffet. Fortunately a Paris Hotel concierge had handed us 15% off coupons before we got to the restaurant as we were walking through the hotel. The coupon was good even though we were not Paris Hotel overnight guests. Worth an ask if you're going to go to the brunch. Food was mediocre, honestly. The made-to-order crepes were fine, though the strawberry filling was "meh". Fresh sliced ham was good though it had been sitting out for a while (mind you we got there at 9am). Staff was friendly, but floor was fairly covered with straw and sugar packet trash (did I mention it was 9am?!). Take a stroll around the food serving areas before picking up a plate or queueing up so you can game it out best.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two brunch buffets - be sure to get the coupon from the Paris Hotel concierge for 15% off.

3TMdb6S3olMYEzS1d_cuoQ.text: Used a Groupon voucher (2 for onfor this experience - I wouldn't pay full price for it specially for the quality of food.   Ambiance - old, dirty, and dim.  Sushi - dry and fish had a weird taste to it, almost tasted like it was left out for too long.   Pasta - dry! Minimal selection.   Dessert - lack of selection, Dry.  Cold Crab - thinly sliced, dry.. and no butters  Banana Nutella Crepe - soggy aged brown banana, cook that didn't care that the crepe was burnt.  Not worth a second time.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

TSP258tvUbj_TqFB9-NJng.text: Great food but it's kinda dark lmao! The carrot cake and carrot ginger puree were awesome!

f28Qe59rWwAgoB93JmTP0g.text: Absolutely delicious worth the price. We had some prime rib which was delicious they also serve crab legs are already cut so you don't have to fight with it to get the meat  out of it. The servers and hostess are very sweet and accommodating. Nice atmosphere and clean. We'll be coming back for sure on our next Las Vegas trip.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A great selection of sweets that&#39;s just a few

Fq2EIZNIOqzdRK4S7j0Njg.text: I am always so sad when macarons are hollow. The ones they serve at Le Village Buffet were not only hollow but possibly the worst I've ever had. It's like someone who'd never tasted a correctly made macaron made them.   The prime rib was good, and there was a good selection. Feels like the hotel needs a refresh. Service was friendly without hovering.

AP5IothkDBtW_uWwxKwxLw.text: This place has really gone downhill. It used to be one of my favorite places in Vegas, but it saddens me to see what they have done with it. They walled off an entire section where they used to have more stations for food. They used to also serve delicious little individual cast iron dishes, those are gone. Most of the stations had empty spots where there was supposed to be food, but nothing was there. They also replaced a lot of the options with cheap vegetables. I'm ok with serving veggies, but these were just steamed ones like carrots, potatoes, Brussels sprouts. Nothing was done to them, just simply steamed with no flavor. Looking for French options at a French buffet? Good luck, they removed all of French dishes. Crepes are about all you can get that is French and there are better crepes over at the crepe place not too far from this buffet. The spread here could easily be out done by a family potluck.  I'm so very disappointed. This place always held a special spot in my heart and now to see it like this... I honestly don't know why they ruined it. Country Time buffet has more flavorful dishes and variety. I can no longer recommend this place. I'm upset I recommended it to people already since the last time I ate here was 2 years ago. The fact it has done a complete 180 in 2 years amazes me. It wasn't like this before. I don't even know how to get across how deeply upset I am. It's such a shame. If you want a good buffet for a similar price (cheaper, actually) go to Cravings at the Mirage. It was better than this 2 years ago and it is now hands down way, WAY better than Le Villiage now.

lIqvyOK2AUSH_uDG8hexYg.text: One word: Fail  Having eaten here many times since the buffet opened up a number of years ago, I have to say that it has been on the decline to the point that, unless the owners do a major overhaul (I.e. new management and new chefs), I highly recommend people to avoid this place.   I have eaten at a large number of buffets in Vegas as well as around the world from "no frills" to 5-star establishments.  For a venue like Paris, one would expect to have a four or five-star eating experience.  However, I have to say that this buffet compares to some of the el cheapo Downtown Vegas buffets that costs  the price.  In the many years eating at buffets, this is the very first time I did not go for seconds and left not full. Here's why:  Food Quality All of the main entrees were WAY to salty.  I mean to the point of inedible.  The roast chicken, roast pork, and sauteed fish were very dry. The king crab legs looked as though the crabs were bulimic - and also extremely salty.  A number of food items were also mislabeled.  I was there around 4 PM. About 30% of the entrees and sides were not replenished.  Instead, there were many empty trays with bits and scraps of whatever was there before.  From the looks of them, many were empty for some time as the sauces in them were caked on or dried up. The cooks behind the table didn't seem to care (more on that below).  To top that off, the food area was atrocious. There were bits of food, sauces, etc. all around the area.  Yes, customers are sometimes messy but it should be job of the people working there to constantly keep the area spotless.  Even the low-end buffets do a good job at that.    I used to say that their desserts were one of this buffet's strengths.  Sadly, that's not the case any longer.  While I think the made-to-order crepes and creme brulee were not bad, everything else was average to downright terrible. Such was the case for their macarons. You would think being a French-themed restaurant that this should be a highlight.  It was like eating a hard old cookie.   Staff and Service I think I know why the food was so bad.  From the cooking staff to the servers, the majority of them looked miserable, like they were there just for their paychecks but would rather be somewhere else.  The carver at the meat station never cracked a smile or a "hello" to anyone.  He would just glare at people as they asked for a cut of meat.  The person making the crepes made people feel like they were an inconvenience to him.  Many of the servers walking about were like lifeless zombies.  While I was there, I saw a customer ask for the manager, apparently very displeased with something.  I wonder why?!  One other thing I noticed, while I estimated well over 1/3 of the restaurant was empty, there was a long lineup outside waiting.  My theory:  Create a long lineup to give the illusion that this buffet is real good, which will attract and make people want to go there.  I don't believe this strategy will work for long.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Many empty food trays and messes left around.

l6HA18ERJO5tuz8q7VvHZg.text: The first time I came it was really good it was around brunch time they had breakfast food and some lunch items. But, this past Saturday not so much the food was average in taste and they don't bring your drinks any longer. I paid almost $60 and I got to get my own drinks . Lastly why don't you give discounts to locals, it doesn't matter I won't be returning it's waaaay too many places to try in Vegas for me to be disappointed.

6CZLRwESMxpmH0BJQrNPfQ.text: Let me tell you for those who have never been here the Ambiance is so warm and inviting  my husband and I like to try different Groupon buffets in Las Vegas as we are locals this was our first time at le village buffet... the food was amazing and at dinner time it is self serve they have the bar in the buffet.... you don't even need to sit outside because the Ambiance on the inside of this place makes you feel like you're in the middle of a little town. From cut crab legs to spicy sausages. Everything was cooked to perfection they also offer for 12.99 all you can drink wine and beer and Mimosas and champagne truly worth the time that you will spend here trying every item of food and as well they're amazing desserts. I have to say if you have a bad experience here or don't think the food is good try the other buffets around town and you will see that Le Village Buffet has the best food around

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-Gpg1jN7_AXm_engkSEKIA.text: Second time here while in Vegas and it did not disappoint! Both times were for dinner. It gets super busy as it is a popular stop so get there early or make reservations if you dislike long waits. No Asian or Mexican choices BUT about 80% percent of what they do have is very tasty. Of course the crab legs aren't the biggest and the prime rib can be a little on the dry side of you're doing a late dinner BUT for the price and the amount of choices, you cannot go wrong. Desserts are also decadent, from personalized made to order crepes, to macaroons and other tasty items you will find something to retry multiple times. Will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HuJ758DI2CrjL19qoK8VMg.text: I came here recently with the fam after a recommendation from a friend that we should give it a chance again. The buffet at Paris was actually our go-to place for probably 5-7 years in the early 2000s. Its relatively cheap and the line doesn't take too long as long as you aren't here at exactly noon for lunch. However, we stopped going here for a combination of reasons, but the two main ones: the food quality decreased and the servers managed to pour three drinks on my mom during one sitting.   So after almost a decade, we came back because two different people told me it improved. I would whole-heartedly disagree. Several dishes looked like they were from last week by how dry and crusty they were (no mushrooms are not part of the food group that should get crusty). The variety didn't take a turn for the better either. The only real saving grace is the crepe station, those were probably the best banana and Nutella crepes I have ever had or will have. I had 2. I wish I had 3 and tried some other flavors, including the savory options. The dude behind the station is a bit slow but good god does he know how to cook. The crepes are the only reason my rating isn't dropping lower.  Overall, there are better places to go to, even places that aren't buffets, I know - shocking. However, for the ~$40 a person, the service was still too slow, the food could use an overhaul, and the decor a touch-up.

J94iU3yIdgZTJWVMyDhZDQ.text: You might feel the environment is interesting and cute at the first glance, however, when it came down to the food, it is not helpful. The tables are dark. The choices of food are limited. Some food looks not fresh. The glasses are dirty, and when asking got change, they said no other glasses available.

QHWn0-h4rK-G4Tq_9W82MA.text: We went in for breakfast buffet, and the food was mediocre at best.

492E-u_pniiO_60Q_KtADw.text: We sat down around 2 hours before closing time which was probably a mistake.   ALL the meats were salty and dry. The crab legs are cut in half lengthwise which you would think is a good thing, but it's not. There was so much shell debris in the crab meat (sandy bits) it made eating them very unpleasant. Great strategy by the buffet if they didn't want people eating and enjoying the crab. It was the worst of all the cold crabs served at all the Las Vegas buffets we tried.  Instead of opting to use the 24 hr buffet of buffet passes here, we decided to purchase this buffet through groupon which included a "free" glass of wine or beer. We did the 24 hr buffet pass the following two days.   The desserts look cute, but I think we had better desserts at Carnival at Rio.   I dined here about 10 years ago and had a good experience. Things have changed. Bye good memories.

KsFEuVIHi4SUbQx8V_ai8Q.text: One word. Disgusting. Food was cold. No flavor. Thought there was going to be hope with the dessert but it just got worse and worse. Don't listen to any of these good reviews. Trust me... I made the same mistake. It's not worth it. Currently writing this review from the toilet because that's where I'm going to be for the rest of the night. Each food item is made out of the cheapest ingredients. Oh and service sucks. Rude and no personality. Won't be back.

pKMiSdJr7WqN7jvEAzzOFg.text: This buffet in general is good but nothing great, I like the buffet in the M Hotel better. The main deal to come to eat here, is if you want an AYCE for crepes (savory and sweet) and the desserts (custards, creme brulee, macaroons, etc).  The ambient is nice and the decoration makes you feel like you are sitting outside of a french town... it is very nice to have a good conversation with friends with no hurry and keep eating... ha ha ha  :)  The food is good... the meats like the prime rib and roast beef are very tasty. I like the Alsace station with the sausages and sauerkraut. There were two stations that were not well take care... the Asian and the Italian one, the food was not fresh and actually, some of the trays were empty for more than 15 minutes (I know that some of you would say... "who comes to eat this in Le Village?, but if they have it,  it should be at treated as the same standards of the other stations).  I like the brunch because included the champagne and mimosas... really a plus.  The service was good and friendly...everything clean and they come often enough to take the empty plates and fill your drinks. The restaurant look cleaned too.  This was my third time here... and I will keep coming to satisfy my cravings for crepes until I cannot stand up... ha ha ha  :)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My brother and his gf
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes ayce!!!!!!

sKy342JCgZxv-QBRh6ZNhg.text: Part of Vegas's intrigue (for me, at least) is the Buffet of Buffets tour, an all-access pass to some of the best buffets the city of sin has to offer! For 24 hours after time of purchase, your buffet credentials allow you to literally pack it in, to be the glutton you've never before dared yourself to let loose and become. This--and more! Much, much more!--for only $59.99. My review, then, reflects our complete and utter indulgence--our loosened belts and the imminent guilt--touring the Buffet of Buffets. Paris' "Le Village Buffet": (Breakfast, $21.99 without the pass.) By far, Le Village has the best breakfast within the Buffet of Buffets! It's quaint, themed as if you were strolling along the cobbled pathways of the French countryside. The employees, especially here at Le Village, were hospitable and welcoming, coming to say "hello" over and over again, asking if there's anything needed... Besides the great food--and I loved the waffles!--what continues to stand out for me was the way that the servers took notice and (I believe) really cared about their guests. Rio's "Carnival World": yelp.com/biz/carnival-wo... (Dinner, $34.99 without the pass.) Flamingo's "Paradise Garden Buffet": yelp.com/biz/paradise-ga... (Lunch, $21.62 without the pass.) Planet Hollywood's "Spice Market Buffet": yelp.com/biz/spice-marke... (Dinner, $30.99 without the pass.)

tqAjMjHFqsAg2I9lw9pgzw.text: This is truly a "you get what you pay for" buffet. Le Village Buffet offers a lower price for the buffet compared to the other competitors in the area. For a breakfast buffet on the weekend, it is around $24/person which is pretty reasonable. However the selection at the buffet is very limited. They do offer the typical American breakfast items as well as an omelet station. I was expecting a wider variety on the pastry item as this is located inside the Paris building. They also do offer a crepe station, which is very generous however that was pretty much the only selling point for me at this buffet. Everything was mediocre, food was just okay. I would definitely recommend a higher quality buffet even though you may need to spend a few extra bucks.

qyduooce2GOzHATyisNHQQ.text: We went here for brunch yesterday this is a worst buffet I had in my life.in LA any buffet much much better than this one it cost only half price of this one. The food is cold and dry shrimp is small crap legs also sushi only two kind, soup is cold. It cost 30 dollars not worth it.

QRgRVRRLcFvLyA-T2ItDQQ.text: Not sure why this buffet doesn't have more hype. We visited Paris' buffet along with Caesars Palace and MGM, and although the Paris buffet wasn't as large, it had the best quality food that was fresh and much more affordable than other Vegas buffets. Not to mention, it's such a cute atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

slGhRa5-WS4Tv9kHX8GEDw.text: I went here years ago for lunch and I just remember the desserts being so delicious. However, I went here a couple of days ago for breakfast and it's pretty affordable being less than $30 but a lot of the items were overcooked and hard. It was also very crowded but maybe that's because it was Thanksgiving weekend and we didn't get a lot of service. There's also only one bathroom stall!  The crepe and egg stations had really long lines and there was a tip jar out. The only dessert they had out were some pastries, pie, and not so delicious soft-serve.

k8ogpp7BJoTy1U9czVUWow.text: Atmosphere: I love love love the atmosphere inside of this restaurant. It feels like you are sitting in the streets of Paris surrounded by little shops accompanied by an amazing food smell that makes your mouth water.  Service: The lady who seated us was quite standoffish, but our waitress was such a sweetheart. The waitstaff have the most hideous outfits though, I felt quite bad they were regulated to wear them. Our plates were always cleared when we got back from a trip to the buffet and our water and champagne glasses were always full. She even told us about the restaurant and the layout so we knew where to find food by type.  Food: The food was actually really good for a buffet, much better than anything I've witnessed back home. The mashed potatoes are real, the prime rib was tender, the crab legs are bountiful and cut so it is easy to access the meat, and the gravy was well seasoned. Salad bar was well stocked and I liked that they had such a large fresh fruit selection. The desserts are something to talk about, the apple crumble was amazingggggg, reminded me of my grandma's recipe (it was actually better but I won't tell her that).   I recommend this place if you have a group of people who can't decide what type of cuisine to eat, they have something here for everyone.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a cute little spot to help cure a hangover (with lots of food and unlimited champagne)!

ybvt1EKB35HGceg6EjQjAA.text: No where near worth the money. There are cheaper buffets at places like Mandalay Bay are far better than this. Disappointing considering how beautiful the hotel is. We arrived at 3pm so I understand they need to turn everything over to dinner but some areas never were stocked with food, some never had their labels changed. The service was super slow to the point we had thought he went home and he actually did lol!  The prime rib was over cooked and the majority of the food was equal to Golden Corral's quality but with 1/2 the selection. Do not waste your money here. It's $13 more for Caesar's Palace across the street. Their buffet is awesome.

F88sucdusmqcZgxvEYnhlg.text: Have eaten here several times over the years. Usually, our 2nd or 3rd eating spot. Not as large as some other buffets but more than adequate and usually good. This time, prime rib was good, french onion soup was good but needed some cheese to make it great. First time for chilled sliced crab legs, which were ok. My wife adores the crepe station. Deserts were tasty.  Seems like the price was a little lower which is always welcome. Also, our service was very, very pleasant without being intrusive. We will likely be back next time as well. It is nice being able to have a place that is consistent with past experience and present expectation.

-SG80ziggNnMUlSTUnhtlw.text: I regret spending my money here. Terrible service by waiter. Went around 6pm for dinner and they were already out of lamb. Not much to choose from.There were lot of empty food trays and no sign of refills. Had some roast chicken which was chewy, cold and hard. Peas with prosciutto was cold and grey in color....did not spot any prosciutto pieces. Mashed potatoes tasted like boxed potatoes. No gelato or any type of pasta dishes  I was hoping to have enough selections at the dessert section but no luck there either. Worst buffet in Las Vegas!

_oIA6M0q649TeYKz0YD_lA.text: Not my usual long review.  Just going to say.   Not what it used to be. Not what I remember.  Not as good.  Looked tasted like and had same texture as powdered eggs.  Also.  EVERYONE goes for crapes.  Maybe have two people making them instead of just one.  The line will be shorter and people's food won't get cold waiting in it for crapes.   Find another place fore the price.  Find any other place for the price.

iCJ_r2928nK6FRqVkNi6LQ.text: Food was mediocre at best, and if you want warm crab legs; I was informed you must spend 100k to get 7 diamond. 7 diamond to get steamed crablegs...  overcooked prime rib, soggy room temp desserts, and dried out side dishes. If i could give less of a rating for the 36 dollars i wasted and the 2 hour line i waited in i would definitely do it. Hope this helps people if they are debating on going here or a real restaurant.

XaOtofEONfTzP7EC0zNR8A.text: Food: 4/5.     Price: 5/5.    Service: 5/5.     Ambience: 5/5  La Village is a French styled buffet at Paris Hotel. You are seated on the streets of France, surrounded by different "villages" - each a specific city in France. Breakfast selections include made to order crepe station (sweet and savory), omelette bar, large selection of breakfast pastries(croissant, danish, muffins), carvings (slab bacon, ham, roasted chicken), eggs Benedict, quiche, French toast, waffles, fruit (various poached pears, cherries, blueberry, grape fruit), salad bar, yogurt station. It's probably the breakfast buffet with the best value in Vegas!!   My favorite dishes include: slow cooked cherries, poached pears, Greek yogurt, slab bacon, strawberry ricotta crepe, lox and asparagus scrambled eggs  Pricing: Breakfast: $21.99 Brunch: $30.99 Dinner: $30.99

Yw8nnd62HTDSe4_2fW9lQw.text: I have not been in buffet in ages in Las Vegas. Why? Because then I used to go they were getting worst and worst.  So after many years I have decided to go. Since it was Friday I started calling around for seafood buffet. Friday supposed to be a fish day, right? But not in Las Vegas. I Don't eat meat so the seafood is my only option.  After calling several places I stumbled on Le Village Buffet which was cheaper than other options in Caesar's Entertainment group and they told me on the phone that they had seafood with emphasis on crab legs. For some unknown reason crab legs is a big deal. I also wanted to see new display in Bellagio garden and Paris is across the street.  Well, good thing I have purchased all you can drink option. Food was not good. Those crab legs were extremely salty and skinny. Plus they were on ice. I even heard that someone asked if legs could be warmed up. I had to drink a lot of beer (which was draft and weak) to wash off the salt taste. The funny is that next to the legs is salad so the only option is a tiny plate.  This is supposed to be French place but hardly anything was French. They has sushi but only two. Both rolls. For the seafood it was tiny peel and eat shrimp and two types of fish, tilapia and salmon. There was mussels, shrimp and clams soup and there was paella with crawfish but it had sausage in it so I could not eat it. That was it. No crawfish separate, no oysters or anything else.  I would not call it seafood buffet, I would call it buffet with some seafood.  So, next I though I would have famous French pastries. There is a store here with a lot of pastries called French Baguette and they had a lot of pastries so I though I would experience some good deserts. NOPE!!!! Everything looked really bad and unappetizing. I saw someone carrying crepe so I had that and it was good. Service was good also.  I can't give Zero stars because it starts with 1 so I give 1 for service and 1 for the crepe. All together cost me over $50 for the food, tax and tip plus $9 for the parking. Total RIPOFF. I am from Los Angeles but come here very often. In Los Angeles for less than $20 I would have had better buffet (no drinks) and free parking.  Well, never again I am going to Boulevard buffets. I will spend a little more time on the road but will go to Downtown from now on. At least there I know there is better seafood buffet.

BKGW04J74xqWphUxyCVAbw.text: Food wasn't hot enough, and the workers were all having a bad day. I don't recommend going there.

6ZPW_VAgxOlSSCtT9kRwhQ.text: Very cute atmosphere. Looks like a Paris street, appropriate since it's located in the Paris hotel. Great service! Be sure to ask the server for steamed crab legs. They'll bring you a full plate of them if you ask. The snow crab legs are already split so they're easy to eat. Our server also brought a bowl of butter, extra plates for shells & wipes  otherwise there are cold ones at the buffet. without us asking. Place was clean. Variety of food good. Salad bar could be better as well as the desserts.

xVySqlrKdvTtwyulb_djHw.text: We went for dinner. $30 per person. Our two kids (age 9,10)  were adult prices. This included sodas. Alcohol could be added for $13 extra.   The prime rib was tasty but very rare. The pasta was good but very spicy. Overall I'm going to say it was just OK.. Nothing bad but nothing special either.   If you have picky eaters in your family it may not be a hit. The crab legs and fish have an aroma throughout the buffet.

NwqXsvgz7j9RjWDoXbuFSQ.text: I'm not one to rate places often but I just had to rate this place 5 stars.   I made a reservation at 2 pm for a party of 7. I honestly didn't need it, we were seated right away. The server we had was super sweet and attentive. He continually came by to clear the table of empty plates and made sure we didn't need anything.   The food was delicious! Everyone in my family had no complaints with all the pasta and meat choices. If I had one complaint, it's that the prepared salads were too heavily dressed. But you have the option to create your own salad. And as all reviews state, the dessert bar is AMAZING.   Needless to say, everyone of us left stuffed and super impressed. Being about $25 a person, this has got to be the best value for the food one can get in Vegas.

H5xzQ7QeJZtUFdhkMBOoSA.text: I like this buffet, they have freshly made crepes made to order.  They have a couple flavors of clam and mussels.  the crab was served chill instead of warm so it wasn't as good, the wait was a bit long, when we were finally seated, we saw plenty of empty tables, meaning we could've been sat a lot sooner, but overall all, a good vegas buffet

hjdfLGU0H7fy2MZNcopAHw.text: Very very very disappointed. Customer service was just okay but kinda of rude when they sat us down at the table.  Was about to walk out from the resturant.  The good reviews for this buffet on yelp but was not accurate!   If your gonna pay $35.99 for brunch here you mind of wells go to Bellagio for brunch for $39.99 (holiday price).  Best service and wonderful food.  Dont eat here at Le Village Buffet...not worth it. Trust me.  Its not more expensive than Bellagio.

-w5xY3fCd_s4Cx0j0JN3gw.text: HORRIBLE SERVICE. Bad food. Disappointment of an experience.  I get it, you're a hostess at a buffet restaurant that takes in hundreds of customers every day. It's 8PM and you're probably tired but when my family has to repeat to you for 5 minutes that my cousin has autism and therefore can't wear his buffet wristband, yeah we're going to start off on the wrong foot. Furthermore, if you have to degrade us in front of everyone by slowly repeating "Make sureeee you don't lossseee the wristband" more than 7 times, we definitely have a problem. My family's of vietnamese heritage but my parents speak clear english, there was no miscommunication, just a very dim hostess with a disgusting attitude.   On to the dinner food. I've pay less money for better buffets outside of Vegas. I think that's where the sub-par rating comes in for me. I believe that when you tag seafood as a characteristic of your buffet then there better be some decent seafood to back that up. Instead, all you get is some average shrimp and crab legs. If you want to call the imitation crab sushi as seafood, then i guess that's one more you can add to the list.   All the fish dishes were insignificant. From what i remember Salmon was dry and the sole was less than flavored. I could go on and on but I think we get the point by now. There's a lot of competition in Vegas and relative to that Le Village doesn't seem to be trying at all. The place looks nice and the decor is great but I'm here to eat and food is the most important thing.  Their macaroons fell apart on me :(

9uXPVavFiiIvfKLgMzVq7Q.text: We ate at three buffets in vegas on our last trip...Harrahs, Rio, and the paris.  By far the best one for me was the paris.  The lines were long and there was some food that was above my head ( I had no idea what the hell it was).  However, it was extremely good.  I think I was happy with the buffet because I really love this resort.  Dancing girls, great atmosphere, cold drinks, good music playing...this buffet may have an unfair advantage but it was really good.  The only complaint I have would be the extremely long line to get in.

1OKQU1puQzCqYJkqhFQIOA.text: 2.5 hour wait... freaking ridiculous to wait this long with tables empty but not enough staff.  If you are open on Christmas Day, then man your damn restaurant!   Should have went to Ramsey's so I could REALLY tell them how I Feel!  No consideration for diabetics or disabled!!!!

h9duAFhvM2Ta4cDttdYHOQ.text: I was very happy with Le Village buffet's breakfast. everything was so delicious! there were many items and the crepe station was fantastic. They had this apple streusel stuff that was amazing! Lunch was good too but not as great as breakfast. wish they had crab legs..... I will definitely go back!

fV8-3PepcWC5P6zbL0lxgQ.text: I dont give 1 stars alot. The food is a 2 star. Service is a 1. When you arrive the sunday brunch is 33.00 with tax. I was dining alone. They ask for gratuity before youve even been seated. Bad form and rude. Then I am seated no server. Was off handidly put at a back table. Bad form for solo diners. Eating alone is..well..lonely. Asked for hot tea..may I get stevia or cane sugar please? No. We dont have it. Food on buffet was luke warm. I git a gluten free quiche which was like a microwave tv dinner. Avoid this restaurant go to McDonalds

CkC7WxiMIj3nlCNbGYXkTA.text: We had a dinner at this buffet yesterday. No variety of food. The crabs was very salty.  I wouldn't go there again.  It is over priced.

OZB65ieFn7emVAIG9aEH6A.text: Hands down the best buffet in the "Buffet of Buffets" package or deal! Food is amazing and very fresh and absolutely flavorful and food. Plenty for vegetarians and vegans and pescatarians. Went Thanksgiving and it was superb! Overall, one of the best in Vegas. AND the service was fantastic! Not a buffet fan. But have done so when I come to Vegas. Clean and VERY  well maintained at one of the busiest times.

I don't know why but I was totally in love with the Caesar salad!   Highlights of our experience: prime rib bbq lamb seafood soup pork belly they make crepes fresh, right in front of you unlimited champagne

gz8fAXmlBCJlR-u_JzhtIA.text: We went for breakfast and it was The Bomb.com! A crepe bar, are you kidding me? Wow it was really great food and great options. I believe i paid around $30. Bring your club card. You get $2 off your meal. Every penny counts! Check out my pics! Yum
