QNvifkXEEm0cKfo_L-AcmQ.text: 3.5 stars  I'm normally not a fan of buffets. Mostly because, while I eat a lot, I don't eat *a lot*, and I always feel like I'm wasting my money because I don't gorge myself at every station.   It's also been a while since I've gone to any buffets in Vegas, so my recollections of the food offered bordered on blah.  From what I remembered, you weren't going to have any outstanding culinary experiences, so I preferred to spend my money at sit-down restaurants with fancy menus and, you know...portion sizes.  Of course, our most recent trip out to Vegas turned everything around. We were there with my Vegas-loving, Vegas-knowing cousin, who pretty much planned every meal of every day, with the bulk of our meals happening at various buffets around town.  We came to Le Buffet for our pre-race morning meal, hoping to get our protein and carb fixes while sampling some of the other, non-racer-approved food items.  The wait wasn't terrible, which was a huge bonus. We really didn't want to stand in line for an hour or more a few hours before we were supposed to run 13.1 miles. I'd say we waited about half an hour before we were shown to a table.  The food was impressive - they had a good array of breakfast and lunch items, as well as desserts - and I enjoyed pretty much everything that I got. I only had issues with two food items: the cream cheese that I put on my bagel (with smoked salmon and capers) and the egg dish that I chose. The cream cheese had a strange flavor to it - almost like a "dusty" flavor, for lack of a better term. The egg casserole dish had ham and cheese in it, but was very runny and had a very sweet note to the base that I didn't expect and didn't like.  But everything else was good. I ate way too much, and then went back for more. How I thought that was a good idea, I'll never know.  I'm removing a star for our waitress and for the missing food labels.  Our waitress was terrible. I mean, *terrible*. We each ordered a drink (OJ for my cousin, coffee for my husband and a glass of water for me). She brought back the two cold drinks, and put the pot of coffee on the table, then walked away. Did she have a coffee mug for my husband? No. We kept waiting for her to come back with one, or to just swing by anyway, but she never did. We finally had to poach a coffee cup AND a pot of creamer from the table next to us, since she was basically a no-show.  She never came by to check on us, or to refill my (rapidly emptied) water glass. She DID, however, stop by with another glass of water towards the end of our meal. She totally could have completely changed my opinion of her by saying, "Here's a water refill for you", or something along those lines. Instead, she said, "I have this extra glass of water that nobody wants. Do any of you want it?"  Stellar!  The missing food labels were confusing. The buffet had been open for a few hours by that point, but the labels were either all wrong, or they were missing completely. It's not too big a deal, but when you're trying to figure out if that hunk of meat is beef or pork, a label would be handy.  Still, we enjoyed our meals and left feeling (overly) full. I think it's a good deal, for the amount of food offered and the price you pay. And I'd absolutely go back just for the macaroons alone!

Hrixd8zPIL7B4YluAXRrDA.text: Wow. Amazing. Yeah it's expensive but it's sooooooo worth it!!! Don't miss. Amazing food and it's all you can eat. Seriously don't miss this and don't go to anymore buffets this is the one to end them all!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The atmosphere is one of the best parts of eating here. It&#39;s almost like a mini Disneyland!

N5CE9zcgjWjbCmDzOXNyQw.text: This place is beautiful and great food.... The service however is mediocre, although It seems it may be just our server (Sue) as every other employee has a smile and has asked how we were and wished us a happy anniversary but Sue seems to want to be anywhere but here and she did a good job of not being found almost the entire 2hrs we were here..... So as long as you get any other server this was a wonderful dining experience

RJf0bEzTX1bxMP4tmx_Z6A.text: Not good at all I had to ask for my money back.. Went to lunch but they had breakfast food out.. Omg talk to the Manager and told him that is all I see.. He went to go look.

Krublot6hzCyeMBZnlHcIg.text: There are SO many better buffets in Vegas...not worth the money and can't believe they are charging a "holiday" price for the same food cause it's the holidays and year news is around the corner...and it's not of quality compared to Vegas Buffets standards...the M Resort or Bellagio or Red Rock... Much better buffets Food = Eh. Crepes cool. Prime rib cool. Bread yum. Everything else...boo. The clams were sandy. Do not like sandy clams. Sad.  Seating = cool that's it's like being on the cobble stone seating but rough it's surface to sit with chairs and small chairs too Service = pretty good Over all not worth it unless it's free...even then...much to be desired...

58jPMZVJIi3EuUID6v_nUg.text: Le Village Buffet used to be one of my most favorite buffets in Las Vegas; however, both the quality of the foods and the variety of food selections have gone down over the years, and now i have officially removed it from my must-go buffet list.  My boyfriend and I went in for dinner buffet a few days ago on Sunday, 12/11/11.  The line was okay at around 7:00 PM and we waited just about 20 mins to be seated.  The only highlights of the buffet were the pistachio macarons that tasted sooooo good and also the crepes (both sweet and savory), while everything else was just A-OK.  The snow crab legs were so tiny teeny weeny and sucked!  All the soups (creamy chicken, french onion, and vegetable soup) were freaking salty!  Service was barely acceptable since our server seemed a bit too busy chatting with others....  All in all, it's not worth 67 bucks for the two of us.  Will i go back next time?? nah. i dont think so. I have experienced better for about the same price mann.....

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio Macarons! Yummy!

84Xl-iBodaXTuN_kvuRIag.text: Went to dinner with my husband after purchasing their Groupon deal. I ended up only drinking 1 mimosa and hubby no alcohol so we didn't take advantage of the free alcohol drinks included in the deal. But anyway the food was really good. A lot of protein choices like carving table, sausages, and chicken cooked different ways. Great salad bar you can make your own or they had some made like Greek salad and spinach bacon salad which I tried both And were really good. Other food options were pastas and breads To be completely honest not a lot of options but everything I tried was really good!! I would definitely go back.

u_pTWFxmU7J03-QhO__x_A.text: Definitely not the best buffet, but not the worst either. Overall, for the money, it isn't the greatest compared to others. Before you go in line, take 5 minutes and sign up for the total rewards card to get a small discount.   Wait time: long, even on non-peak times. Be prepared to stand for a while although there were many tables available.   Food: it was decent, but it doesn't stand next to the quality of buffets like the Bellagio. There are a lot of options and many have a French twist. I would say there are not that many options for children or picky eaters.   Desserts: had a wonderful homemade crepe, but the rest of the desserts are pretty standard I.e. cookies. There is good French custard.   Service: The waiters/waitresses are very nice and accommodating. They refilled very quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great creels

chwgmN1KDSZ2pQ-UuL4TIw.text: We haven't been in quite a while and unfortunately the quality has gone way down hill. For $30 per person and $20 for my five year old, the overall experience was disappointing. We went at 2:45pm and had to wait twenty minutes to be seated for a party of seven. There was no line! (That should have been my first clue as there always used to be long wait times just to pay). The place was not busy and there were a lot of free tables.  I would have to say with LV hospitality, I was not impressed with our waitstaff. Forgot my drink, so she brought me water. She never came back to refill any bodies drink or get my drink corrected. My water glass smelled fishy.....I couldn't even drink out the glass. Gross! We ordered coffee for desert and ran out of sugar with no body to get us more. There was also still food on the table when they sat us. I overheard a server next to us at the end of our visit explaining champagne was included on the buffet. That would have been nice to know before we were leaving.  On to the food....I didn't expect a brunch menu at 2:45 in the afternoon on a Saturday....especially for the price! There were about four different sections of eggs and potatoes, and some kind of sweet bread breakfast (ie: French toast, pancake, waffle). One of the French bread dishes was so hard, even with vanilla sauce to moisten it, I thought I was going to break a tooth. No variety!!! Atleast with other LV buffets (not even as highly hailed as Paris) they have a lot more breakfast options. Lots of the food looked old and gross. I love seafood! The shrimp and crab legs looked gross. I just passed them up.....which I have never done!  The crepes I have to admit are still amazing! I also loved the macaroons on the desert section. However, the deserts are not as glorious as the used to be either.  I am such a foodie and would always brag about Paris. I am embarrassed that we took friends from out of town there!  I will never go back here now.....not even for nostalgia. The buffet is only worth $10-$15 per person! I can't get over eggs and potatoes for $30!!!!

BX9FPXcqZsNmT0_-SbIg1g.text: We used a groupon for Le Village Buffet and it even came with a bottle of red wine! The wine was average - not for wine snobs, but it was a super great deal. The service was really lovely, and I never felt like I was annoying the servers when I asked for refills or for extra "stuff". Hands down - best macarons I've ever had! Granted, I haven't been over to Paris but seriously - these kicked the ones from Trader Joe's freezer's ass. Wooooooooooooo-wee those macarons. Once I figured out that these macarons were much better than anything else there, I just kept shoveling them into my mouth and passed out later from major food coma/sugar overload.  Other notable items include the crepe bar and various carved meat stations.  DEM MACARONS, THO.

j79gCtotxJB-KclAPHwcyw.text: Just wanted to confirm my 5 star rating :)  Came back for dinner this time and it was just as good. I think it was about $35 for Sunday night dinner, which is not bad considering how pricey some of the other ones can get. Of course, you can go to ones that are cheaper, but those are just straight up disgusting and not even worth the cheapness. I think this is a good moderately priced buffet for a good quality meal.   I'm not gonna name everything I ate, but everything I did eat was delicious. I especially liked the salmon! YUM! I'm always a fan if the fish isn't dry.  Overall, a good quality, but moderately priced buffet to go to.

wvGfoOKczSBFA1j_rn3YoQ.text: The best part of the buffet is the crepe station. everything else was just meh. Five stars for the sweet  menu on  and the banana crepe with nutella and toasted hazelnuts. Bomb!

E4F4ADLHdT0WDtxbjzcdxA.text: We find this to be the second best Caesar's buffet. Planet Hollywood is slightly better and we find the Bacchanal to be average and way too expensive. What we like about Le Village is the decor, always French Onion soup, creepes station, and many little other things that make ti worthwhile.   We find the salads to be fresh, and plenty of options. Desserts are among the best and a nice variety. However, the location of the desert station is the omelet station for breakfast and it is in an awkward spot.   Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner, we have had them all and we just like this place. The line can be long unless you are Diamond or Platinum where you can just walk right up and get seated right away.   Staff is always attentive and friendly. Most bend over backwards to make your meal enjoyable. Just take a deep breath, and make sure you look over everything. Like we said, not the best in Vegas but really decent. The only drawback is that they keep raising their prices and for a Monday $29 is way too much for dinner when there are plenty of other choices. Sooner or later, people will stop paying these high buffet prices and things can go back to where they should be - around $20 at the most.

J76R3mGCVL5kvWpz2XV92A.text: Make a reservation through 'Open Table' a day in advance. Gotta hit a buffet when your in Las Vegas, right? This wasn't a crazy luxurious buffet but it was decent. We went for lunch. Didn't wait long at all.  All the buffet standerds and French dishes too. Plenty of food choices but not overwhelming. Crepe station was yummy. The pastries were good. Definitely got our money's worth.

WcWS5lRHK_7Uqpv209XJHQ.text: Hands down the BEST buffet I've ever had! Crab legs, shrimp, pasta, crepes, salad bar, sauteed mushrooms, sushi...omg everything is great and only $33! Totally worth it! Plus, for $11.99-UNLIMITED DRINKS. I'll be back!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The food was AMAZING!

pm51h4N7C3nd28n2wuhaJA.text: FOOD: So-so. Nothing I was really amazed, maybe just the basic super thin cheese crackers they had.  They have much to improve. ENVIRONMENT: Very intimate, dim, like in the streets of Paris I guess SERVICE: Ok. VISIT AGAIN: Nope. The food is not attracting me to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. sugar cones
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. crepe~soso
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cheese crackers, super good!!

DPf0kIPtuxazKkoMIVnteg.text: As a local the last place I want to be on a Sunday morning is a Strip buffet, but my cousin was in town and she asked me to meet her here so of course I obliged.  I was pleasantly surprised to find out the Sunday Brunch was only $30.99 and that included bottomless mimosas or champagne.  There wasn't a line when we arrived so we paid and were seated quickly.  It is on the smaller side as far as buffets go but they have the basics,  The crepe station is is not something that you see at a lot of buffets.  I'm a little impatient so the line for that wasn't worth it to me.  Our waitress was a little on the slow side and we had to flag her down a couple of times.  If I had been there for the mimosas I would have asked her to bring two at a time.  I thought the desserts were horrible.  There was nothing on the dessert bar that I found that appealing.  Next time I think I will try the crepe station as a dessert option. Overall not the best buffet I've ever been to but for the price point it met my expectations.

C7x9el8Dd-zZZMYEoVlbCg.text: Buffet 24 hour passport - next stop Paris! I really like this buffet because it has some more unusual selections - like fancy cheese and charcuterie.  And brussel sprouts!  When you go to a lot of buffets, you start to get very discriminating about what you'll settle for.  And this buffet has some nice, quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining room
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert station
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

ozj8bHL_lazBGg71_RKxSQ.text: The crepes here are amazing.  The ham and cheese and mushroom were our favorites.  But the logistics of the long crepe line blocking the busiest entrance for the wait staff is piss poor planning on part of the management at Le Village/Paris Hotel.  PLEASE FIX THAT!  I felt bad for the wait staff already balancing a tray full of drinks, let alone lending their excuse me's and maneuvering between the long ass crepe line.  It's about $20 for lunch per person and it's $1 off with your Total Rewards card.  They had a disappointing platter (yes, one platter) of hard cheese that was hiding in the corner.  No brie or anything fancy here.  The French onion soup was pretty good.  The truffle mac and cheese was pretty good.  I would save room for the crepes, get a bowl of soup and move on to dessert.  Everything else was forgettable, including the large, cafeteria-type room with linoleum flooring in the back where we were seated.  When I came here a couple of years ago, it was pretty good.  But the experience was lackluster and I probably won't be back.  And the waitresses are wearing what look like longer versions of Halloween costumes, like Gepetto's wife.  They need new costumes, this is not Disneyland.

yYzXUrwttK1_XBO7t9AjeA.text: The cashiers are hilarious and outgoing!  They are definitely one of the many champions at this restaurant that made the experience wonderful.  The atmosphere is calm and quiet.  The painted skies give you the impression you're outside in a cafe in France.  Our waitress was awesome too!  As far as food goes... Everything was great EXCEPT the chicken cacciatore, which consisted of chicken and tomato puree.  The crepes, salad, crab legs, salad and cream of chicken soup were amazing!  They even have sushi but I would suggest passing.  If you look at the fish inside the rolls, you too would walk away!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fpVBuWLNU66nsVNzs4vPRA.text: You get what you pay for...  That being said, for $25.00 for a lunch buffet, it was not impressive at all. However, they still had prime rib and shrimp cocktail which was good enough for me for $25.00. Now, the bad parts...  A salad bar with just lettuce pretty much. All the dishes were so saucy it reminded me of hoffbrau  food only. The "sushi" was just a rice roll with cucumber. The soy sauce was served out of a water pitcher. Haha. Embarrassing. The wasabi was runny.  There were a few decent pastries but for a French style buffet, you would think it was better.   Again, it was an affordable price, but not a good experience at all.   Decor was fun though.

yOpz8HmgDFE_bXXVEqAkdg.text: This place is not great at all comparing the cosmopolitan, Caesar, or Belagio buffet. See I don't mind paying for xtra $$$, but I like to enjoy my food and my company. Came here for brunch and waited about 40 min in line which I didn't mind at all too. I told my friends and dragged them to Paris to have some crepes since it s a french place. Again waited in another line to get the crepe and here is the worse thing you see , the chef ( the Asian dude I think his name is ray) called me to take my order since I was next in line. Seemed like  we were in Soviet Union , aggressive , not cleaned, he messed up 2 times our crepes and had the nerve to ask for tips by pointing on the basket next to him. We put the 2 plates he made away and went another time in line to ask the other cook for crepes. The other chef Joey  was professional, knew what he was doing and took his time to ask us one by one  how we would like our dishes to be made. The lady in line behind us did the same thing , ask people to pass her so can go to Joey ( I hope I remembered the right names , and with no offense to anybody , the Asian chef is no good and the other chef A++++++++++++) .

Vjdei-ervnzpPGTjGYSN3g.text: Service was friendly, food was good. Armando, the omelet chef, was outstanding! Lines were long. Did not feel that the servers were overworked like some other places here. This was the only buffet we felt the need to try while in Vegas.   Love the decor. Like Disney World!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A bit of everything.

hFaI-S1q8F6985t8CgBl1g.text: Nothing really changed since the last time I was here. Food just palatable, desserts improved a bit. The prime rib dry like they cooked it earlier and it's been sitting around. Nothing that stands out. A lot of duplicate dishes done slightly different. For $32 that's with tax for dinner it's not worth it unless your a gambler and get a comp or need a quick bite. I would pass plenty of other buffets to choose with bigger selection if your into buffets. I was in a rush and got a comp so ate it today but like I always say never eat at a Vegas buffet it's only a tourist trap with crappy food most of the time.  On a positive note service was decent.

HGsumXo-jMkPzQ4Yptaf7g.text: I can't believe I didn't check the reviews before coming here. This place was disgusting. The price person was ridiculous for such cruddy quality food.   Where do I start off? I started with soup, as soon as I saw it from a far being swirled around by the chef standing by, I felt a little skeptical about getting it. You could automatically tell that shit was all starch, because it was soooooo thick. It was soooo bland, blegh. Crab legs? That stuff tasted so old, it was frozen cold too. And there's barely any meat. My boyfriend took advantage of their meat selection. He mentioned the meat was tough and bland. We are a big fan of truffle recipes. And they had macaroni and cheese made with some truffle oil. It was gross, it was all butter and a tiny dash of truffle oil to make it smell like it.   The only thing good about this place, in terms of food, was their unlimited crepes. I was able to get a dinner crepe and a dessert crepe after. Both were OKAY.   The staff that were working and taking our plates were very sweet. They refilled our drinks as soon as they were empty and they took our plates fast. I was able to converse with one of the chefs making my crepe, she was cool too.   But, I thought this place wasn't good. I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Even one of our taxi drivers said that this place is one of the worst buffets here because we told him how we ate there.

dmtjhDGVbEP_WgnmxMlWXQ.text: This place is a really solid performer, over the years.(I've been a patron for probably 7 years) .  I'm conflicted with the four star, but let me try to explain why -  It's hard to rate a buffet, you know, since they offer three different meals a day and also can have off days.  I'd have to say the breakfast is probably one of the best buffets on the strip, plenty of variety and the food is always a 4 star.  Lunch, again, fantastic selection, maybe lose a half star because there's nothing on the menu that really really shines, but then again, I don't expect a place to really knock me outta my shoes for lunch.  Le Village, for dinner however, I'd skip.  The selection is there again, but there are alot of other fantastic options on the strip for barely a few dollars more.

GjnDuChzJQUBP_ApNQ0P0w.text: This is always a solid brunch/breakfast buffet choice.  If you get there early enough, you can avoid the long lines and still get great breakfast and lunch options.  The brunch also includes champagne/mimosas if you like, and is $27 per person.  The food is great, with different sections for different items.  I especially enjoyed the different choices of meats and the egg concoctions, and the desserts were delicious.    Our waitress was a bit slow about asking us if we'd like drink refills, and I wasn't crazy about the OJ,  but other than that, service was overall fine.   They have carved meats and a crepe station, which expectedly, were really popular.   Of course, everything is French themed, which was cute as well.

8BP2TJDSfb1M0eW9mzX8Mg.text: Came here for lunch based on a military special.  It was very good for the price ($24.99 regular price, kids under 4 free).  Favorites were the Sole Florentine, truffle cavatapi, and creme brulee. Crepes, prime rib, boullabaise, were also good.  One of the chefs whipped up some plain pasta for my son, who has a garlic allergy, and our server was very friendly.  Downside was the line... We waited about an hour to get in. Once you get in, though, the only food we had to wait for was the crepes.  It seemed like you could reserve a table on opentable if you do it the day before...

kkJeKDVkXn-R8I9JeVzOVQ.text: As a breakfast buffet, this is 5 stars. Especially if you are doing the "Buffet of Buffets" and this is your breakfast after a huge buffet dinner the night before. I think it's the best breakfast buffet in Vegas for the money (Bacchanal is outright better, but is also more expensive).  As a dinner or lunch buffet, it's really just a 3. There isn't much special here. Most of the "interesting" dishes are better done elsewhere. It's hard to justify this being your selection for those meals unless you happen to be staying in the hotel.  Four stars.

YaUZSdTA6DnT3aBL_HMczg.text: I would like to express my appreciation of service to the Paris Le Village Buffet Restaurant General Manager, Mr. J. McIntosh.  My husband and I dine at Le Village Buffet whenever we visit Las Vegas (3-4 times/year). We have eaten here for breakfast, lunch and dinner and have never been disappointed.   Our most recent visit was this past week while we were visiting for The Shot Show/ AVN week for breakfast. The crepes were delicious and fresh, made to order. We tried one with fresh berries and another with ham and cheese - both delightful in our mouths. Variety of egg dishes and scrambles. Great meats, ham, sausage.   Exceptional service was provided from our waitress, busser and especially by the Restaurant General Manager, Mr. J. McIntosh. Mr. McIntosh was cordial, professional with a sense of humor. He really made us feel very welcomed and went above and beyond.   *Ladies* - Mr. McIntosh is quite handsome.  Must sign up for the free Harrah's/Caesars Entertainment Total Rewards card for discounts, not just at Le Village buffet but for many of the Harrah's stores and restaurants!

-J6IzQjrTqeeqf6RDyZzPg.text: We came here for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it.  The made-to-order crepes are the star of course (delicious and chewy, stuffed to the point of bursting with your choice of filling) , but there are plenty of other breakfast staples to choose from as well:  anything from an assortment of breakfast meats (different kinds of sausages and bacon) to variations on the egg (quiches, mini-benedicts, scrambles, and made-to-order omelets) to hashes and breakfast potatoes to the requisite carb-fest (and after all, it wouldn't be Paris without croissants).    The food was quite tasty, and the decor was just superb.  The design and attention to detail make you almost feel like you're actually at an outdoor Paris street cafe ... or at the very least, a quite thorough imitation of the France portion of Epcot's World Showcase.

_sR6Btvy_Vn7rfwR5rZe0g.text: This was part of our buffet pass. And honestly I would come to this buffet solely for breakfast. I would go to either planet Hollywood or rio for dinner if I had the world of buffets pass. Simply because the selection here is really small. The meat cutter for dinner is a great guy very comical. But I would stick to breakfast here because the creeps are amazing.

PRdX76DNT4DkIwvDUsG22A.text: Not worth it at all!!!! $27 after tax for lunch has only $10 value! Avoid! You've been warned!

-2aqUHM-90qmJZqWiHWHeA.text: What happened Paris? You have become a tired, stale version of yourself. Poor mgmt I believe. Food mislabeled, cold, not stirred, overcooked & bleak. Soup looked so unappetizing I didn't even bother. Butter for the crab on the entirely other side of the likewise bleak salad bar. Crab labeled cheese. Crab fishy & overly salted. Other items with no placard at all. Mussels dried out. Many items with no serving utensil. Black forest cake how old to be so hard & stale? Empty platters. No spoon brought with my coffee. Service reactive rather than proactive. A disaster. I want my money back. Only decent item was the prime rib. I'm sad, Paris, that someone had run you into the ground.

A3rm7ep5g5b5Q2U5k2tWZg.text: Buffet of Buffets: Stop #2: Dinner  I've always wanted to try out the Paris Buffet so this seemed as good a time as any. We went at 6pm so the wait was almost nonexistent. Many different types of French food were featured. Most of the dishes were pretty heavy. I got filled up real fast. The entrees were good but still on the average side. Of the entrees, I liked the beef stew the best. What really stood out at this buffet were the sweets. The macaroons here are delicious! The French really know their desserts! =P  Pistachio Lemon Macaroons - This is the redeeming factor of the whole Le Village Buffet. They are so amazingly good. I loved that the outside had little bits of pistachio and gave it a nutty taste. The center has a lot of lemon flavored cream. MMmMMmmMm.... Pretty to look at as well. The orange raspberry macaroon was also very tasty. Orange outside with a little bit of raspberry filling. Yay for macaroons!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio Lemon Macaroons

A3Dyy1z_u8mT1ICYrkILZA.text: We went here for dinner.  Overall it was a good buffet! The truffle pasta and brie and bacon mac n cheese were my favorites.  The desserts were delicious, esp the nutella/banana made to order crepe, and creme brulle.    HOWEVER!  In the 90 minutes we were there, our waitress came by to refill our drinks ONCE- and that was within 5 minutes of us receiving our first round.  She was rarely around to clear our dirty plates, we usually had to seek out a bus boy to take them.  And my aunt compared their service and attitude comparable to the service and attitude you would find in Paris itself (enough said on that!)  But their delicious food will still keep me coming back despite this :)

ccGawpvXsaBkpvEVpbCt1g.text: No. Just no. Don't eat here unless you want a mediocre Vegas buffet. Waited 2+ hours for some flavorless food you can find at Golden Corral. The only decent thing is the price - rather marginal compared to the big hitters. Caesar's, Cosmo, and Wynn buffets are must haves. Not this one.

PDwytyrdW-ETrfTzDvexNA.text: Descent. The food was really good. Service is a different story. The server seemed annoyed when we needed refills.

-nsKclgiGNJ3XUeUrEF4PA.text: Loved this buffet. This was apart of the $55 24hr buffet passes. Best buffet to choose from pass options. Line was a bit long but went by quickly. Well worth the wait. A+ desserts!!!

nBIg8qDv2mLk5VpxuiTjsw.text: There was something missing. I cAnt put my finger on it. I wasn't satisfied with the food. I wasn't satisfied with the service, I just didn't feel like I had an overall satisfying experience at this buffet compared to other buffets I have visited in the past.

g-swTUhfA-5KcmxC9KD5Dw.text: I've been here twice and both times I've been dissappointed. $22pp is extremely high for the small breakfast selection. I think $15 is the most they should charge for the quality. I was thinking about the 24hr deal, but they jacked that up to $79 on the weekend. No thanks! My entire family left very unsatisfied. On a positive note, the crepe with the berry mix was very good.   Check out Studio B at the M. Almost half the price and twice the quality.

95TfMfpGfEYqC71-gXDc3A.text: i can't complain too much, we got to grub here for free. i love that it's not superly huge that you feel like you're eating in a cafeteria. the little french village ambiance is gorgeous! and the lines, like many other buffets in LV, are long, but definitely worth it.  like many other buffets, you have a variety of stations from asian to Mediterranean, breakfast, to italian.  my favorite is definitely the made to order crepe station! the only thing it really lacks is seafood. but i guess if you really want seafood you'd just go to Rio.   my overall experience here is good, the food was delicious. the one thing that made me chuckle was that the busboy accidently cleaned our table thinking we left already (even though we still had our jackets hanging on the chairs). when we got back to our table, everything was cleared off, including our drinks. i didn't get upset becuz this was actually the second time it happened on this same trip but at a different buffet.

j9YoNpP09F-UE9IaePGFyA.text: I have been to this buffet a few times and the food and service has been great...but today not so much.  Our waiter was ok...but refused to bring warm crab legs to the table which is one of the perks of being a "diamond member." Finally had to get testy with him and he brought the crab legs. There were no soup bowls for the soup, and that's completely unacceptable at a buffet, keep your dishes stocked people! The food was ok...but seemed to be lacking in the quality I was used too.  I'm hoping that I just came on a bad day...I may give this place another try, but I was really disappointed in today's experience.

nrDoLdoF7D8RTJj0JvhJzg.text: Beautiful setting and crepes are the only selling point of this buffet. The rest of the food is mediocre at best and the servers are not the friendliest in Las Vegas and act like you are an inconvenience to them whenever you ask for anything. Maybe they are trying to be authentically French  :-)

doXeVhAb1dxTXEcp74ycUw.text: The scenery is very enjoyable, make sure they seat you "outside" for a better ambiance during your meal. I would say the star of this buffet is the Crepe station, with a choice of savoury and sweet, we tried several types and they were all very good. The price is not too bad compared to other buffets in the area and the wait not as long either. I would only come here again for the crepes and prime rib though.  TIPS:  Sign up for the Total Rewards program at the Paris hotel prior and you can get a discount on your buffet price per person/member. If you are not an american citizen make sure you have your passport as they take no other form of ID.

JBt7iEzot8XEcvdM-tFZBg.text: Came here for the dinner buffet on a Sunday night which ended up being about $30+ or so a person.  The ambiance is very cute - like you are sitting in a French courtyard "outside".  Overall the food was OK - I wasn't particularly blown away and the prime rib was a bit dry and overdone (but I have yet to find a buffet that serves delicious mouth-watering meat!)  The standouts for me were the crepe station (you can get savory or sweet), the creme brulee, and the king crab legs.  The king crab legs were sweet and not fishy tasting at all - so if you can stock up on those, you will probably make the experience most worthwhile!  I went to 2 buffets which was this one, and the breakfast buffet at Wynn and between the two I have to say Wynn blew Paris away so next time I most likely will opt to try the Wynn dinner buffet.

HhsivzF4E_OVnuelSAauEQ.text: Came here around lunchtime on a Saturday and ended up waiting around 45 min. All in all, not bad at all for a Vegas buffet. We were seated once we got to the front of the line and were unleashed into the madness. They had some fake rustic decorations but I suppose no one is really looking around while they're busy shoveling food into their mouths.  There is the standard meat station, crepe station, seafood (crab legs!), salad/fruit, some random sushi, pastas, and a crap-ton of breakfast food randomly spread out across all the stations. Service was slightly shoddy as the meat carver disappeared for a while and my waitress never brought me me orange juice. However the food overall was quite tasty. The crepe station was popular (don't get the savory crepes, it's never warmed up quite right inside the crepe) because of the freshly made crepes. The prime rib slab was HUGE and I ended up sharing with my friends. The eggs benedict was quite tasty, as well as the ham quiche/tart thing. All the breakfast foods were good, not great.  Shining star for me was the dessert station. So many varieties I couldn't make up my mind. I made a few rounds before I saw one of the workers roll in a huge cart full of creme brulees. They were delicious! I wanted to go back for more but I was way too full already. Overall, a great buffet. Was worth going to as we had the buffet of buffets pass. I would come back again.

5-5hkpNyCNMhqaVyFABmEg.text: Great ambience, wide variety of food, service was very good, but food was not as expected. Clams and mussels good use more seasoning, tasted bland. Rice was dry.  Pastas were great. Sushi was not good at all. Sweets are decent but you expect better quality sweets for a french buffet. I had a banana crepe with Nutella, got chocolate syrup instead of Nutella without even telling me. Macaroons are ok, creme caramel was very good. I really think there is room for improvement. Bathrooms need a huge face lift for sure. Push fucets are way out of style.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B2oZ4YO45YVzI04bhJkBng.text: The lady that brought us our drinks was great. Her name was Kaye and she seemed overwhelmed but on top of things.  We were really hungry so we tried most of the dishes. Here are comments on a few of the dishes, but generally speaking - everything was mediocre at best. Our coffee was cold. None of the food seemed to be hot - just lukewarm. Even the crepe that was made for me wasn't warm in the middle. I wondered if it was safe to eat but thought, "At least the chicken wasn't raw so it should be ok." The scrambled eggs with lox and asparagus were runny - not fully cooked. The bacon wasn't crisp. I can honestly say there was not one item that was served hot. The only topping for oatmeal was brown sugar. Even at a Fairfield Inn they put out nuts and dried fruit for the oatmeal!   There weren't any items that were exciting or different. Lots of potato dishes and basic breakfast fare. The meal was satisfying but was it great? Absolutely not. Truly disappointed for the amount of money paid. Would have been better off going elsewhere.  Grab a Lyft or an Uber and go to The Wynn.  It's actually cheaper and outstanding!

iIiAgpUv8zacs16nAHTRzQ.text: Where to begin with the awful experience my friends and I had here. The food was undercooked and none of it was labeled. The counter tops were greasy; from the looks of it there doesn't seem to be an eye for detail cleaning. The glasses over the food were smudged and had built up grease. In my eyes if you're not spending time cleaning what the customer can see, what does the kitchen look like where the customer can't see?   Our server was sub or at best. She seemed overwhelmed and uninterested. She ran around and wasn't attentive to our needs as a table.   Before we left I decided to speak with the manager due to the lackluster experience, I spoke with Bob who without hesitation issued us a full refund for 4 people. Clearly this is a reoccurring experience for him because he didn't even want to hear me out about the things I noticed that could have been helpful to their future experiences.   Needless to say, next time I'm in town I'll be skipping Paris.

6LqD0oUqDNZGTLRTu6qXsA.text: So disappointed!!! Waiting for 90 mins, so little choice, only snack is eatable! Will never never come here again!

rkcxiKv4q3PhiIZOafdK3g.text: This is one of my favorite buffets on the strip. Smaller than many, the food never disappoints. I have been eating largely a plant based diet with some dairy and fish. I never worry about my options here. Tonight I was impressed with the Brussels Sprouts, salmon, small Yukon fingerling potatoes, creamed spinach and caprese salad. For desert I had a sampling of chocolate mousse cake, creme brulee and tiramisu

2NwIQI8EoTsd2xdetmz5QA.text: This is the breakfast buffet of choice. Paid half the price for two than Aria. Lots of fresh food and orange juice. The crepes are amazing.

vOoXe2CVluYMAb9UnTqQaA.text: I do not understand how bad this buffet was so limited food wise my steak was blood red. Not only was all my food cold as hell my silver ware was dirty and smelled bad. The only good thing was the Mac and cheese and they ran out of that service was also atrocious and mean to us. It was also quite smelly on top of it all I waited 1 hour and 15 minutes and they didn't know where I sit us 10 people as group.

TiylsS1Yif3SUkd6fjyJ4A.text: Food was ok but the desserts were very good.  It is hard to find a good tasting creamy soft-serve ice cream and this place has it. Would definitely go back for the desserts.

XGLKlP1MVW26pb358Kc4lA.text: Went for breakfast ... waited for crepes for 30 min ... all of the potatoes were cold on buffet would not spend money here again big disappointment

mQ07qPJ5LAAvaJSZG2V91g.text: I hate to have to write this review, I really do. As a Vegas local and former Harrah's Diamond card holder, I've frequented the buffet at Paris for the last 10 years. I hadn't been recently so I decided to make a reservation on Open Table so I could bypass the line. When I showed up at 5:30 pm on a Sunday night and there were ZERO other people in line, I should've known right then and there that something was amiss at this buffet. I welcome an explanation or at least an apology from someone in charge of this abysmal buffet.  This buffet used to be one of my favorites but wow, it was downright depressing! First of all, there were many empty tables inside (a sign of a bad restaurant for sure). The food on the stations looked old and tired, and there were many repeats on the bars (how many trays of mussels or rice or green beans do you need)? A lot of my old favorites have been taken off the menu in favor of cheaper fare (mashed potatoes instead of sauteed scallops, for example). The seafood section was horrible! Paris used to have huge, peeled shrimp cocktail but now they have a bowl of peel yourself small shrimp carelessly slapped in a big bowl. It's depressing how steep of a decline in quality has taken place.  It's almost as if the casino has simply given up on this buffet. None of the food was labeled and if it was labeled, it was mislabeled. The employees acted disinterested in everything. Many of the food trays were empty and stayed that way for the duration of my 2 hour visit. It was just sad. It's not like we went at an off time, we went at prime dinner time on a WEEKEND night!  The main reason for my 1 star review is for the lack of cleanliness. I eat at truck stops, street food carts and dives all the time so that doesn't usually bother me, but this buffet was DISGUSTING! Spills everywhere, drips all over, sticky serving untensils, glass crusted with crud -- it was NASTY. The ice cream machine had several used cones with melting ice cream running all over. Some stations had no plates. The crab legs were shameful -- they had been picked over and NOBODY wanted to eat them. It was so gross. I have photos and video to prove how gross this place was, see for yourself.   Quick, somebody call the health inspector!  The food and beverage department at Paris needs some serious help. Harrah's, are you listening? I am so upset that I paid an outrageous $30 per person for this. It's a dump. I can deal with less than fresh food, but the cleanliness of this place is embarrassing. Shame on you, Harrah's!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sugar free desserts don&#39;t look like much but they are good.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yuck! Seriously, do they even care anymore?
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Filthy ice cream machine.

pRf05jZIS8yKQEhox6PjMw.text: Ehh.  I dont know. Its kind of like love and hate relationship with this buffet and I. First of all, I would have never paid the full price to go to this buffet ever if it wasnt for the Buffet of Buffets pass. I happened to stay nearby Paris so I thought I should come here.  I found three things I liked from here. First things first, I liked the interior. How they managed to have the buffet to look like a french village with the blue sky ceiling is pretty different from any other buffets I have gone to in Vegas.   Second, my server was so nice. She had a hard accent but she was so polite and kind. She was super attentive and checked up on us frequently. I really appreciated that.  Third, their crepes! Besides those two I mentioned, their crepes were the best! I only got to try the Mixed Berries Crepe since I was not as hungry as I should have been. My friend said their nutella crepe is super good too but I didnt get to try. My mixed berries crepe was really good. It wasnt overly sweet and the crepe itself was really moist!  Their prime rib was probably the best out of all the other buffets I went within Buffet of Buffets(excluding Bacchanal).  Will I come back? If I get a free pass, I will.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mixed Berries Crepe

zpG4yOu5IOTLGvdiHyKcRA.text: The quality and service of this buffet has gone down since a few years ago. Staff is extremely rude, front of the line waiting to be seated, then someone cut inline and the host was helping them when I asked her if we ll be seated soon, she asked me about my receipt that she took from me half an hour ago and didn't know where she placed it. We finally get a table, and the food looked so unappealing, no variety, it takes them a very long time to reload the dishes, the dessert very disgusting (soggy flan and creme brulee) the alternative cookies & ice cream (McDonald style!), the one star is for our waitress that was attentive with our drinks and very nice. My recommendation skip this buffet and go somewhere else.

UYSQn9OE2MvUQv-EbDQgzQ.text: A friend recommended this buffet as being one of the better ones in Vegas. I'm not terribly into the whole buffet thing, but my friend was really into it and since this one featured French food, I thought I'd give it a try. The first night we tried to go here the line was insane. Okay, lesson learned, we got reservations. The best options here were the truffle mac and cheese and the made to order crepes. I found a lot of the hot food to be cold. The cheeses were like something you'd buy from the grocery store- not particularly gourmet. I was unimpressed. If I were to ever come here again, I'd get a savory and a sweet crepe for dinner and skip most everything else.   I also find it kind of sad how much food is wasted because, oh, this looks good, ew, gross, it's cold, let me leave it and go get something else.

yD5UTr1KrykgHYwiqWM1Uw.text: My second visit across two decades and this remains the best breakfast in Vegas. It seemed less awesome as I remember N my twenties, but I suspect in just more picky.   This seemed to be even a better value than I remembered and they now advertise all inclusive beer, wine, and mimosa options - pretty amazing.   Only issue? Surprisingly hard to find the entrance.

yJVcwTok6i7Lfsxz-YyXeQ.text: The food isn't worth for the price.  Their food selection is limited and it's not a great place to accommodate for children's liking.

JTCymDKAXz77ffVozqQJbg.text: I stay in Vegas 3-4 times a year for the last 10 years. This is the third time I stay in Paris Vegas within 2 years. I have ate in Le Village in the past, This is not the first time. I believe it is above average, service is good, and staff are very friendly. It is on my top 5 buffets in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Typical breakfast Vegas buffet

l7QB5Y9er6sqwtt2Q7homw.text: This place went down hill. The food is sub par to average. The crab legs are served cold and were really watery without any flavor. The prime rib tasted more like roast. All the other items were cheap quality. I do not recommend this buffet. I have had better at the sizzler.  I would of gave one star but our server was nice and tentative. So gave an extra star.

rkvrYh04XndkQDJQ1HlLqA.text: $34.99 for Saturday dinner, but if you're a Total Rewards Diamond cardholder or whatever that is not Gold, then you might get this buffet comped because Paris is part of the group.  I'd say my experience was just ok, not impressed at all for a Vegas buffet, given that the competition has gone up with the new buffets opening up like Wicked Spoon and the oh-so-glorious Bacchanal buffet that everyone should go at least once.  Anyhow, back to this Le Village buffet. The best part is the bucket of crab legs that we ordered for our table. Five of us of course devoured all the crab legs. I believe they were snow crab not Alaskan King but I do like both so I was a happy camper chowing down the crab! The entrees were not bad, edible, but nothing so great. I enjoyed their French onion soup, some pasta and the duck, but I could tell they didn't put any effort in there, which was quite disappointing.   Even more disappointing was the dessert section... REALLY? Cookies at a buffet? Are you kidding me? Their creme brulee wasn't done well. It's old and the caramelized sugar was not crispy anymore. I walked around the dessert booth twice and I didn't pick up ANYTHING. I just tried one bite of my friend's creme brulee.  No Vegas buffet is worth goin' if it ain't got good desserts.  Service was amazing though! Loved our server. So friendly, helpful and cheerful.   The decor of the buffet was ok. Honestly it doesn't look like a place to dine. Maybe because the walls don't go up all the way, I feel like I was still eating in a shopping mall, like a food court kind of deal. Weird. I know other buffets like Bacchanal doesn't have an actual room with walls either, but their decor is much more like a restaurant than a food court...  Bottom line, food not ok, not coming next time. Would not pay to come here, but since it's free, it's still an experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No line outside at 9 PM on a Saturday

3xD_foQkflDL4uCpJeBN2w.text: Sushi is just cucumber rolls cut up and dumped into a BOWL.  Dessert bar is out of half of the items, literally. Every other rack is empty, they have no plates, and the lady said they ran out of chocolate chip cookies.   Food is pretty bland. Not a single thing stood out as good. Pretty solid cafeteria food at Vegas buffet price.

ZQGyb8wHwAMPbHxpVgqZpQ.text: First time in Vegas trying out le village buffet and wasn't very satisfying.  Most of the foods are salty as hell that day.  I don't know if it is because it's a busy holiday weekend or the chefs just short on staff.  The presentation wasn't pleasing rather looks sloppy for the reputation.  The only thing I can say is the carving beef was tender and juicy also the crepe was tasty.  Rest are just ordinary stuffs that you can probably pay less if you go off the strip.  Overall was disappointed and I gotta pay extra for holiday price, not to mention waiting almost 2 hours to be seated.

zTaY6v0-HzmcORIlbucmCw.text: Me and my girlfriend came here on a Wednesday night to use our buffet of buffets pass. We arrived around 850pm. There was seemingly quite a wait, but it wasn't as bad as it could of been. We waited roughly 30mins. And the last call for food and drinks was 1045. They stopped making food I assuming around 10. Unfortunately the crab legs weren't getting replenished but we made up for that at another buffet. =)   The food was pretty good. It tasted like it sat out for a bit. I don't blame them for not having fresh ones. We came at the last hour and it was a weekday. I mostly came for the prime rib and my girlfriend came mostly for the crab legs. The desserts were okay also, my favorite was the raspberry cheesecake.   Our server Tam was very attentive, fast and friendly. We got the all you can drink alcohol deal for 12.99 and we didn't have much time so we kept pounding it. We had a mission and Tam helped us accomplished it. We were very satisfied with his service. He kept checking up on us and kept refilling our drinks and taking plates away when needed without even asking. You can tell he really cares about his section, great guy. We got blue moon on draft and the house red wine. Wish we had more time. We got full fast trying to eat and drink so many. We weren't able to finish our drinks so they let us take it out! Go Vegas! Haha.  Overall, wouldn't mind coming back here. Give it a try on a more prime day.  As long as we get Tam again =)

RpkuE-dYoR4h_sEwoRCiMQ.text: Worst buffet ever; $38.00. Went at 4:00 pm so it wasn't packed. (1) no one manning the stations, (2) all the meat was dry, (3) vegetables cold, (4) salad bar empty and no one to ask to refill ALL the empty bowls. (5) Pasta with sauce was old and dry, (6) dessert areas were primarily  empty and the dessert that was present had flies on them And no staff to tell there were flies, (7) staff was extremely rude when you'd ask for assistance they either ignored you or said they couldn't help. (8) had ask for beverage refills,     (9)  labels for the dishes were still for breakfast.... at 4:00 pm. Save your money and go somewhere else.

FXNVWkqC0q-WpwZuSB1raw.text: So we come here every year and its always great,today was totally different,place looked dirty,there was a weird smell where we were seating at,tortellini were salty,there was no creamy potatoes and i found a piece of plastic in my banana nutella crepe,also the food stations were dirty with food everywhere,we paid $86 and i almost asked for a refund,i wasn't happy with my food,the only good thing was the server,he gave us refills and picked up our plates.

PRZG-mBt3fwdBuIbl3VRWg.text: Went in for dinner on a Sunday night. There was not much in the way of variety. I've gone to this buffet about twice a year for the last 8 years and it's definitely gone down hill. The days of escargot and duck are a thing of the past.   They have reduced the amount of offerings and have added several kinds of pasta dishes which all looked unappealing, and now feature chili as a soup. Minimal poultry offerings, all of the vegetables were drowned  in tons of oil and were not flavorful.    Most of the food on the stations I also found to be pretty cold and the small staff that was working were not replenishing the food very quickly.   Seems like the price of the buffet went down as did the quality.

Pb6006rXmo4wSk1-dbszmw.text: I heard from an uber driver that the Paris buffet was good, but I came in with low expectations.  I was surprised though - my wife and I both agreed that the food was better at Le Villiage Buffet than it was at the Wynn.  There's slightly less selection, but the quality was well worth the price.  The tritip, prime rib, cheesy potatoes, and creamed spinach were all exceptionally good.

7nTHt1z5oeZ7byeMnUss6A.text: Food is terrible except for the prime rib. Very small selection. You would think it's called Paris hotel and they would be good at deserts. The macaroons tasted like rocks and the cakes look like garbage. The wait staff are very friendly but probably have to take care of many tables so the service was very slow. Overall the worst buffee we have eaten in Vegas

5-0bIXXKQQlwyZfu9L5JgQ.text: Came here a few years ago with my son and it was absolutely amazing this time not so good. The food was OK but not as outstanding as it was a few years ago. Always call and make a reservation so you don't have to wait for hours on end to get in.

Tvj8PW8KUiPrE2QUmT75CQ.text: Waited one hour on the line to get the table. Very pricey buffet with limited choice of food.  Not worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waited too long for nothing

1A_ziikULeN8GpRUNoFupg.text: A large majority of this buffet's food is very salty. This includes the soups, pastas, and prime rib. The sushi is poorly made and looked very sad. On top of that, why sushi in a French buffet? The sweet stuff is sweeter than intended like the Crepes.

dWW368zjvtMv9vfja4BTwA.text: This review is for Le Village's breakfast buffet only. I have been told by many people how great this breakfast buffet is; but personally, I don't see it nor do I understand why anyone would think that it's any good. Maybe since I only tried one breakfast in Vegas and this was probably the best one compared to others? Seriously though, the only thing that I enjoyed here were the grapefruits and strawberries. Everything else was just simple breakfast food like bagels, oatmeal, bacon, ham, etc. and it tasted average, if not, pretty bad.    However, the setting, design, and decors at this buffet was just very nice. It was basically like you were in a French village underneath a blue beautiful sky. Also, it was cool that there were different food stations. There was a station where you can make fresh crepes and another where omelettes were freshly made just how you like it.  Here's what went wrong for me:   There were so many different variety of scrambled eggs at one of the stations. Everything had eggs and eventually, it was just quite overwhelming. Another thing was the fruits. Some of the fruits tasted weird and did not taste fresh at all. The grapes tasted soft and weird while the honeydew and cantaloupe were not sweet at all. Then the drinks, I tried the coffee, which tasted horrible, the grapefruit and orange juice, which both tasted horribly.   The service here was horrible!! Besides from our waitress (who was very nice and lovely), everyone else was so rude! So we ordered a crepe and wanted a regular Nutella crepe with nothing inside... We tried to tell the chef that, but he didn't hear or wasn't listening and asked what number. So we thought we had to pick a number and said "one." Then after, we can just leave stuff out. I mean. It's not like I knew and it's not like he even started with the crepe. So when we asked politely if he can you exclude the bananas and such since we just wanted Nutella. He said with so much attitude, "Don't say one then!" Well excuse me rude guy! We did say what we wanted but you asked us for a number!   At the omelette station, the guy before us ordered two eggs prepared sunny side up. The cook broke both of them and asked the guy it. I just thought that was funny. Other places will throw it away and make new ones. Anyways, the point is, service here isn't good. If they didn't say anything rude, they just looked as though they were having the worst morning of their lives or they just hated working there.   Personally, if you don't have a buffet of buffet pass, I wouldn't try this place and I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone. But that's just me.

i9gN9l09kDBPfByQGPmxag.text: Did the buffet of buffets and liked the lunch at paris so much i came back for dinner! I am disgesting to make more room for food as i write this review.    The best things here is the prime rib, truffle mac and cheese and macaroons.  The crab legs (dinner only) are the same as planet Hollywood's with claws included. The salads were delicious and they had a respectable selection of salmon and sole fillet, cooked mussels and clams. Meats included delicious sausage, a carving station with stuffed lamb, prime rib, roasted turkey and roast beef, a tray of trip tips. There were repeated stations of clams. The scalloped potatoes are back instead of the mashed potatoes former reviewers have complained about.  I loved the sweet potatoes too! The crepe station is far better than planet Hollywood's remade stack - fresh and made in front of you.   Avoid the sushi at all costs.  Why there is an Asian section in a parisian buffet is beyond me. The cheese selection as people have mentioned is anemic.  But the truffle mac and cheese! Oh they were the highlight for me and the macaroons have a place amongst the best I've had - including lauderee. The delicate cookie crust has the perfect crunch and the chocolate filling is airy albeit a little too much and i had to scrap some off. The creme brulee is solid.  Skip the tiramisu.  The decor is reminiscent of beauty and the beast very cute and Disney like with the street lights adding to the charm.   While Le Village Buffet isn't the best in Vegas,  it's  a great option at the price point even more so when brought as part of the buffet of buffets!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the best macaroons I&#39;ve had ( Martha&#39;s and bouchon bakery,  lauderee) with that perfectly mastered delicate cookie crust
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious creme brulees! Tiramisu was eh

jkTRS1VSTjdMZWzi8tb-KA.text: This is a good breakfast buffet, and we always leave satisfied. We do the 24 hour pass, and are always sure to hit up Paris for breakfast. The make-your-own omelet station is neat, and the crepe station is to die for! They have fresh made to order sweet and savory crepes, and the peanut butter fluffernutter is my absolute favorite. We have never been here for lunch or dinner, but the options are great for breakfast.   We did have an issue here once, and that was with our waiter, Gallo, the last time we came. He was very rude to us, rolled his eyes at us whenever we asked for a refill (we did the brunch buffet with bottomless mimosas/bloody marys) & then told us out of the blue that he would have to "get permission" to keep serving us bloody marys, and made it seem like he was doing us a favor by getting refills on the mimosas. We aren't sure if maybe he thought we didn't get the bottomless or whatnot, but it was just a bad experience. Our group would stop him for a refill, he would roll his eyes, mumble under his breath, and take off before anyone else could ask for anything. (We were only a group of six, and none of us were even nuked yet so I know he wasn't thinking we needed to be "cut off", it was breakfast!) We aren't ones to generally complain to management (But will always leave a complement!) but that time we just had to let them know. They did handle it nicely though and we felt like we were heard.   This time, we had an awesome experience! Erica was our waitress and she was super nice, friendly, quick, and made us feel welcome. Definitely the best waitress we've had in Vegas, and we appreciate that!  So be sure to visit for the breakfast buffet! We highly recommend the 24 hour pass, so you can do dinner at Rio (or wherever you fancy within Caesars properties) as well, the price is totally worth it!

_FaPtbMzxUlDANtVvuCyEA.text: Nothing was really good. I tried to force myself to taste as much choices as possible but it was jist too plain. Just no... you have been warned.

2IJizAaqHzM6x3iGXJJLlg.text: This was a really fun brunch and was very family friendly.  I saw family friendly in a way that if you don't like kids and don't like a mess then I wouldn't come here.  The kids were picking at items, especially the dessert table.  I saw one kid pick up a macaron then set it back down.  Obviously that made me a little nervous.  You have to know what you're doing getting into a buffer, so I tried to overlook it.  We went for dinner so apparently there is a different crowd for brunch but this was decent.  They had a pretty good variety of items but the crab legs were sawed in half and pieces of shell were in the meat.  That bothered me a little bit.  They did have a very good selection here which is nice.  Just because I gave it 3 stars doesn't mean it's bad.  This is one of those buffets that is a great deal as far as the price for food.

Dr42p4h5E9oYgnNZyuBI1w.text: Le Village Buffet is located in the Paris Hotel.  As you can imagine it capitalizes on the Parisian theme; the food is presented in several different areas modeled after the various regions of France (Alsace, etc).  Most of the seating is in a 'courtyard' setting - it's all inside the hotel but the roof is painted to look like the sky and there are imitation trees and plants designed to make it feel like you are sitting outside.   The food is varied and well prepared.  I was VERY pleasantly surprised by a number of dishes that are normally dry or bland when you find them at a buffet but were carefully done and very tasty here.  They had prime rib and crab legs - both were cooked just right and were delicious.   The mashed potatoes were just right.  They have a crepe station where they make them to order.   My wife loved their 'seaweed salad' and said it was the best she's had in a long time.  I've eaten here several times in my latest Vegas trip and I still haven't been able to try everything.   Drinks are included but they are delivered by servers.  Make a reservation to avoid the line and consider the 24 hour 'buffet of buffets' pass (gives all you can eat access to Le Village and seven other nearby buffets) to maximize your bang for your buck!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#39;Outdoor&#39; seating near the buffet &#39;buildings&#39; - complete with a ceiling painted like the sky and street lamps
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looking over one of the buffet stations towards one of the &#39;building&#39; facades
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The entrance from the hallway of shops - the whole place is set up to look like shops along a street

OGuJdlL_4KrllomMLNWkhA.text: A small selection of food for about $34/person. Most of the food was either too salty or too bland. Want a soda? They only have all the alternate brands. Want coke? They have Pepsi. Want Sprite, they have Sierra Mist. IMO, that's a bit odd for a buffet.  Most important thing to note: my group of six all ended up getting diarrhea. One of us actually vomited about six times the following day--and we didn't even drink!  Waste of money.

0bqw76CwsGwcgXa47Di8Pw.text: Did the Buffets of Buffets. 24 hour buffet pass for 5 different hotels. By far the best buffet was Le Village at the Paris Hotel. Just come for the desserts. Probably the best Flan my family have ever tasted (and we like flan) - so rich and melt in your mouth smooth and creamy. But the macaroons and creme brulee were definitely a very close second. The prime rib, stuffed lamb and crab legs were excellent (better than the others). The setting was also fun and unique.   Breakfast was also worth it. Amazing scrambled eggs and delicious carved back bacon, as well as ham and sausage!! Crepes made to order!!   If I were doing Buffet of Buffets again this would be Breakfast, lunch and dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Back bacon
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroon station

lPMWLpRbvRuGkwMXVY-CMA.text: A great selection of food that is on par, price wise, with the rest of the strip. ambience was great and there was a good selection of well-prepared delicious food. I didn't knock off one star because I went there twice over the course of a week, and both times I was fairly ignored by the servers. Each time they filled up my drinks on the first go, but then never came back around. There were other people who are also audibly complaining about the service, and went as far as shouting out of frustration  at the servers who walked by. The Paris as a whole has a great vibe, and offers free parking, which is becoming a rarity on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Each buffet station was made up to look like a little shop in Paris.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ohhhh yeah!

SZZUkm1Xln642Jbcvegt-A.text: Oh my god, food is really limited. I had diarrhea after I had their buffet. Quality is bad. I will not go back again

g2fsz_vzPLHRmAVjemFULg.text: Dirty! I mean the carpet was so disgusting and unappitizing! Horrible selection and very expensive.  Bought on a Groupon deal only to find it owed more because of tax. What? Confusing!  DO NOT GO HERE!

d0oitVlzukiHMHLzCWsNEg.text: What pissed me off was the waiting, first time  FAIL to wait, i abandoned my spot and left to find somewhere else to eat, i was starving, make matter worst i had already waited 40 minutes and there was still like 30 people in front!!!! wtf why so slow? i saw from outside plenty and i mean plenty of tables... so i dunno why it takes em so long to seat people. By the time i went somewhere else to have dinner and finished eating, i still would have been waiting at the line at le village buffet :/  Second time, we made reservations (yes it takes reservations) came around 10am for brunch. Only waited like 5 minutes for a table. Most remarkable was the omelet station and the crepe station, very friendly chefs and very good food.   Next time i will skip this buffet or i mean its enormous annoying line and go straight across to eat a crepe at La Creperie or a baguette at JJ's Boulangerie ;)

H6l6CD6A8u5yuaGDSukLMg.text: One of the best brunch buffets I have ever seen. Cute french setting, the made to order crepe bar was to die for. Seriously, Le Village has everything under the sun, including a huge seafood & crab leg section, Macaroon bar, truffled Mac & Cheese, unlimited mimosa's.... the list goes on.   I have been to a bunch of Vegas buffets and this one definitely takes the cake for brunch. BE SURE TO BOOK A TABLE AHEAD OF TIME ON "OPENTABLE"  TO SKIP THE LINE.... it can be a bitch.  Bon appetit!

3oByy5r3tXzV_OGvZzbvSA.text: Hi friends!   Here are a few (hopefully useful) comments and tips about this place:  1. The groupon is a big time money saver. I think each groupon was $44 (not including tax/tip obviously) and it included admission for 2 plus a bottle of wine. The wine isn't included usually but they were serving some complimentary wine while we were there. I don't know if they do that every night.  2. Get in line for the prime rib. It was soooooo good. I am pretty sure I had about half a pound of meat while we were in there. Delicious.  3. Just like in any buffet, dont fill up on carbs/salads.   4. The rest of the food was slightly to salty for my taste but overall it was still pretty good.  5. If you do get the groupon (and the bottle of wine), do not order their cab. That thing tasted like vinegar. Luckily there were 4 of us in our party so we have some chardonnay as well. The white wine was surprisingly smooth. Next time we'll get 2 bottles of that.  Overall pretty good buffet. The food was good, service was good, and the location inside the Paris couldn't have been better.  The only reason I wouldn't go back would be for a lack of groupon. I think there are better options at $40 pp.

te5BC8yWrUOWNnFaXHF8ZA.text: Me and my boyfriend were at the Paris buffet last Sat. night and I want to say that it was horrible, food looked old. The service was horrible, they took forever to get refills. My boyfriend got sick right after he finished eating. We will never ever go back to that place.

mjPlkhhUbcWL59cuyzZufA.text: Don't even think about going here.I actually got sick from something I ate at the brunch! Years ago this was a wonderful buffet. Today the food is way below avg.! The mussels were salty and dry. Much of the food was dried out and old. If they are selling it on Groupon, believe me there is a reason!!!

Y5nZXxJQVXMFd0ZmjnSOfA.text: The buffet is one of the smaller ones in Vegas. I would call it mediocre. The desserts are over hyped and the soups are really salty. I will grieve credit for the truffle mac and cheese though.

sdUOJO26pd-ju7lq-pvqTQ.text: I like their food and they had a decent  choices from others. Love their steak, i woulf love to comeback here for more..

VgVhDE8N26xqgG4RRpWk7Q.text: We did a reservation on opentable for breakfast and good thing we did otherwise we would've had to wait for 30 minutes in line. When we went in, there were a lot of tables still empty so I don't really understand why their line was so long. Since we came in at 10:30, we got to experience both breakfast and lunch dishes.  We came here because my mom desperately wanted to try their AYCE macarons. She said they were a disappointment because good macarons are supposed to melt in your mouth and their's didn't. That failure aside, many of their dessert dishes were pretty good, like the creme brulee and fruit tart. Their crepe was a bummer. The batter was tasteless and the berries were sour. The candied nuts they use are not fresh and have that refrigerated taste. All the meat dishes I tried were delicious. The prime rib was cooked just right and the pork apple dish was yummy, much better than the dry chewy crap at The Bacchanal. Their hot cherries were good. I think it's hilarious how they have sushi.  Service was average as far as buffets go. Our server came to our table so infrequently that we had to place our finished dishes on a nearby table.   Overall, I enjoyed the food and would probably go again. Lots of quality desserts and meats to choose from is always a bonus for me.

74ACps5nhYKVD3lRRVn1TA.text: I was with a group of ten people. We obviously hung over wanted to eat and recover. This was by far the best decision. Over all we spend $35 a head but I'm not kidding, everything you could possibly eat was here..not just breakfast food. We ate like royalty! Not to mention... Bottom less mimosas? HECK YEA!! We were set to go for the rest of the day..I would absolutely go again in a heart beat.

4GAL0FxivSRFbT6PowbfzQ.text: This definitely is at the top of my bf and I's buffet list for Vegas. We tried out Wicked Spoon, which is constantly raved about everywhere, and were VERY unimpressed.  Le Village, a bit of a walk in past the casinos and easily identifiable by its long lines, has great menus. We came here just between the brunch/dinner transition on Saturday, and found ourselves enjoying unlimited crepes (2 at a time though), bottomless mimosas, and creme brulees galore. Oh yeah, and the prime rib, and the cod (mmm), and the salmon, and the crab, and the...yeah. There's some things that aren't that great but fill yourself up on the good things and it'll be well worth your $32 (Saturday brunch/dinner price) and you'll be raving about it afterwards. I think the crepes really biased me...despite having to wait like 20 minutes in line for it while my group was already on their 3rd plates by the time I got back to the table...  Since this is one of the included buffets on the Buffet of Buffets, I'd highly recommend it even if you only plan on going to 2 buffets. Paris' Le Village is definitely worth more than half of the cost already.  I might also mention that the inside decor is great and really makes you feel like you're in a little city in France, AND the waitresses are super friendly and are all dressed just like I'd imagine they would be in France too. :)

2yX_cTD0NoRzlQIeWnS-UQ.text: Disappointing. Quality and value poor. Far from any type of resemblance to any type of authentic French cuisine..  Setting was nice and service good.

ax_a6fru14ZH3Y1bVQ-Dtg.text: Las vegas had such amazing places to eat and this is not one of them... This is a very typical breakfast buffet but way overpriced :first once they sat us down they took a good 10min to take our drink order.... Mimosas were not included which i found funny because come on for $25-something dollar person you would think it would be included:( yet you play slot machines for .50 and drink for free) they had an omelet station with very little topics .. their bakery items were okay bear claws , blue berry muffins and chocolate muffins . their fruit selection was very sad.. cheap fruit like cantaloupe , pineapple and bananas. they had runny eggs and different kind of sausages that were okay. I will give it to them though the buffet itself is super cute really ties in with the whole french theme. I felt like i was in the beauty and the beast french corner lol. They did have a nice crepe station which im sure this why they charge so much.. i had a nice nutella banana crepe . Overall the place is really just OK. I wanted to check it out since the first time i went to vegas so this was just a vegas bucket list sort of thing. I would not come back here for that $$ just for breakfast/

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

X9jHOe0xOM8NbrM7rqHLXw.text: Casino buffets aren't expected to be the best quality food, but this is one of the lower quality ones. The only good item I'd recommend is the steamed crab legs. The rest is just mediocre diner-quality food.

0JfbS4Y7OXoZlH6upUtfwA.text: I've officially sworn off buffets; I was leaning in that direction to begin with, but our experience at Le Village Buffet sealed the deal.  The buffets in Vegas have been heading in the same direction over the past five years - more expensive, while less quality. I've seen this happen at Rio, Wynn and now Paris. I lived in Vegas for three years and worked as a supervisor in one of the largest casinos there; as a frequent visitor to buffets, I can say this isn't simply speculation; it's what's gone down.  Le Buffet when it opened, was one of the finest in Vegas; a fantastic assortment of food stations, incredible service and desserts to die for. When we returned to this buffet in January, I was so disappointed, I felt sick all night that we'd payed about $70 for two of us to eat here.  The buffet caters primarily toward seafood now, which is great if you're a seafood lover; I am not. There were very few options that were appealing for non-seafood fans. There is a generous mountain of shrimp to mine from and there are crab legs; I do like shellfish. However, whenever the crab legs are put out, unless you're camping there, you're going to get completely raped by the pushy folks that get there before you and blast through the pile, diligently picking it clean of the good legs, leaving the spoils to everyone else. It was frustrating and annoying as hell.  The food selections I did have were okay - but definitely not worth $30 or so per person. The dessert station was a disaster; names of desserts did NOT match what was out. Obviously, the staff here doesn't care. It was a "try your luck" situation and patrons were left to guess what treat they were actually getting.  At one station, I couldn't separate two bowls, and I passed them toward a staff member on the other side of the counter, telling her they were stuck. She looked at me like I was an idiot and slammed the bowls on the granite counter, which made them separate. She gave me one, and started putting the other BACK INTO THE CLEAN BOWLS PILE, after I'd explained to her that I gave them to her because my hands were all over them. A woman standing next to me spoke right up and asked the staffer what she was thinking; that I'd JUST told her I was touching the bowls! The staff member frowned at the other customer and removed the bowl from the stack. Totally disgusting; makes you wonder what else ends up in the clean plates stacks there.  Table clearing was slow and finding someone to refill our soda was a joke. Total contrast to when this buffet was new and it seemed that there were several bussers for each table that were on you like vultures the minute you cleaned your plate or put an empty glass on the table. Not the case anymore, sadly, and that added to my frustration.  Standing in line for another station, the final straw broke this camel's back - a woman stood in front of me eating food off of her plate and SUCKING her fingers. Then, you guessed it, she went right on using that hand to use tongs and spoons getting more food from the buffet.  And really, that's the core problem with ANY buffet. People are disgusting. They are piggish and pushy and dirty. You can somewhat control the level of a dining experience, but you can never completely control the other customers.
