If you're picking and choosing I would definitely go to Bacchanal in ceasers palace over this one.  However it is worth a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The wonderful ambience
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some of the tastiness

E-4T8X056iW0jytg8jUwLw.text: We went here for breakfast during our Buffet of Buffets expedition. They have a nice selection of egg dishes and breakfast meats, as well as a few healthier items such as fruit and turkey bacon/sausage.   I had the eggs benedict and a freshly prepared Nutella crepe. They were both delicious! The coffee is also quite good.   We actually returned here for lunch the same day after a terrible attempt at lunch at Planet Hollywood's Spice Market.   At lunch, I just had one of the savory crepes (the vegetarian one) and a cone of chocolate custard. The crepe, again, was so delicous and the custard was sooooo good! I did try a macaron here as well and it was pretty terrible. Bacchanal's are better, which is odd seeing as how you would think the Paris ones would be the best.   Overall, the atmosphere is really pleasant (it's like sitting in an outdoor French cafe, despite being inside) and the food is pretty good, especially for breakfast.

4XVAVJMmh-l92Gwq5fdC5Q.text: We just visited this buffet today. It was the worst tasting food ever. One of the chefs actually took a spoon put it in the rice put it to his mouth and then put it back  into the rice in the buffet. We called the manager which with Keith justice. He gave us a refund on all of her food. In addition to that then he took all of the food we were eating. He paced back-and-forth until we left.  It was very rude.  I was eating my dessert and he took it for me not asking if I was done or not. He did that to several other friends that were with me. This restaurant need to clean up their act. It used to be a very good buffet and now the worst.

-jpLgNv6LqB9GCmgdWxqlQ.text: Went for dinner this time and it seemed less noisy. We had about a 30 minute wait. The food was good in quality, better than most buffets and there was a good variety. The creme brulee was better than the stuff I bought at the bakery. Since it was Vegas I started the meal with dessert and ended it with more dessert. Very good.

3S3C0rKLH86uTKNLQJ2CYw.text: Buffets are the food manifestations of real life stereo types. The Japanese section always features sushi, American section fried delights, and the Italian section a sad play on the fried American foods.  This buffet avoids that problem by focusing heavily on "French" foods. The effect is good, with some unexpected items like bouillabaisse. Unfortunately the foods done best are still the typical dishes and nothing particularly French or special.  Come for the crepes, made to order.

rgc01LCusk8quLqbIAypmA.text: A little over priced and kinda underwhelming. Was expecting more. The Prime Rib was good, but nothing to make a special trip for. There are definitely better buffets in Vegas for the price.

b2Sp8vdfR5YAt5kz_frp5w.text: Sorry to burst your bubble guys but this buffet SUCKS..... I  lived in Vegas for 9.5 years and had never tried it.... but last month was in town and got the buffet of buffets pass so we decided to go..... Im soooo glad I waited and didn't pay full price for this buffet alone.... none of the food outside of some sauteed mushrooms was edible.... Im sorry but Duck Pate'... um NO.... I AM French and I wouldn't touch a damn thing on this buffet..... "the Macarons were ok though"

H55REimnuYXV84Tc5O1Kpw.text: Prime Rib. One and done.  The brie & bacon Mac n Cheese was outstanding. Pork chops were tender, the list goes on. What was really impressive was their customer service. We bought a dinner for 2, then saw a Groupon for the same buffet. We were refunded and seated right away with endless Blue Moon and Mimosas. The life....

jGwLMS5YfkuochJJY79pgA.text: Our server was terrible . No personality  he made us feel like he was doing us a favor , serving us. The food was ok.

E7HjRSOKRNIfcxM-Ng88GA.text: After a brutal 6 am flight from Seattle to Las Vegas, my friend and I were more than ready for some food and drink upon getting to Sin City. We stowed our bags at Planet Hollywood and made our way to Paris, where we were able to pay the $24.99 "breakfast" price due to our pre-10 am arrival. Our wait in line was probably around 10 minutes, more than enough time for us to deduce that the additional ~$13 fee for "All You Can Drink" (beer, wine, Champagne, mimosas, Bloody Marys) would be money well-spent. And well-spent it was. Our server Deborah was just the sweetest gal, and she kept those mimosa glasses topped off.  Overall, we were pretty impressed with the food at Le Village. Of all the things I sampled, the only weak spot was the Eggs Benedict. The scrambled egg dishes, however, were great as were the hashbrowns. The bacon was paper-thin but tasty! I loved the pretzel rolls, and my friend raved about the apple-filled pastry she got. She would have loved to have tried a savory crepe, but unfortunately the line for that station was always pretty long.  It turned out that we had great timing for our visit as around 10:30-11:00 the breakfast foods began to be transitioned over to lunch items - caprese salad, pastas, mashed potatoes and dolmas were all excellent. There was also a lunchtime selection of seafood, carved roast, and various Asian selections that I didn't really explore but might on a future visit! And a future visit there will be...Le Village is a great buffet, especially for the price.

1Sx-rul1PIpi9UhE7j2HRg.text: For buffets in Vegas, Le Village could use a little improvement, but offers enough for me to want to go back.  The food itself wasn't too crazy.  Le Village doesn't really go the "international" route.  All the items have more of a European touch to it or some sort of preparation that seems more "French." Marinated artichoke hearts, French onion soup, caprese, and stuffed soles are few of the standout for me.  There's a carving station serving prime rib and roast beef.  The prime rib was pure awesomeness with the middle still pink and I went crazy on the delicious au jus.  it's probably the best item in the whole buffet.  There's grilled chicken and a apple grilled pork chop that may be a little dry.  There's also Bourguignonne sauce for your meat, which is a mushroom based sauce.  Since I went for the brunch, a significant part of it was dedicated to breakfast items: eggs, bacon, sausages, pancakes, and French toast.  Fairly typical.  The tiny thick Belgian waffles though, are great.  I usually don't expect buffets to do waffles well, but it's fluffy on the inside and they have hot maple syrup ready.  There's a crepe station, but... skip it, unless you want to get a sugar overload?  The fillings are the typical sweetened fruit fillings that is super sweet.  But right next to the crepe station though are these pecan sticky buns.  If you're a fan of sweet, sticky, nutty goodness, then that's for you!  I barely touched the seafood section since we were seated near there and when I saw them refill the area, it made me to not want it since it's all out of boxes in plastic bags.  At least do a better job of presenting/preparing it :P  Dessert selections could use a little help but I do like how they serve chocolate dipped ice cream cones for the soft serve machines.  There's macaroons but the filling is just jam, which is a little disappointing.  The weekend brunch price for around $30 is the Champagne brunch, which is great if you like bubbly but price is horrible if you want just want a meal.  Take advantage of the unlimited champagne!  The decor is pretty unique for a buffet since they try to make you feel like you are eating at the courtyard of a village.  However, it's dimly lit in some areas so it feels a little... old.  Service... is a little inconsistent.  Our first waitress was slow and looked like she couldn't wait to get out of there.  We eventually flagged down another waitress and she was great, and helped us throughout the meal.  All in all, Le Village isn't bad and $30 for unlimited champagne brunch is a fair price for Vegas buffets.  If they paid a little more attention to detail, then it would be a much more enjoyable meal.  Little things like soup could've been hotter, ice cream rather than soft serve, or even having a staff that actually cares about cleanliness.  Saw a cook refilling the soup and the water boiler overflowed after the pot was dropped it and she didn't bother wiping the station, even if it is only water.

Jfu-hfRsy-wTJguF43hwxQ.text: Every time I go to Vegas whether I stay in Paris or not I will make my trip to this buffet. This last time was such a great/amazing experience Roxane our waitress was so welcoming and made our experience welcoming! That's why we left her a big tip!!!!! The food is so good, their crepes are my favorite!

2LStAewWFfRGO8zLLC1siA.text: Went here for dinner on 06/04/14.  The crepes were soggy even though it was made to order. A predetermined menu gave you a selection. No "alittle of this and alittle of that". Station was dirty and was shocked to see a large plastic cup with TIPS written on it sitting on the counter.   Went to get a roll and was honestly horrified at the broken and chipped 'sneeze guard' (not sure of the official name) that was being held together with MASKING TAPE! Yes...MASKING TAPE! What? No manager in his or her right mind would allow this if they were paying attention to it. Side Note: Bread was stale.  Food counters were filthy and looked like they hadn't seen a good scrub down or even wipe down in days.  Desserts - total disappointment.  What a disappointment you are to me my dear Paris.  I will not be back.

rsWYJttkSSHdQU-bhSfv6g.text: We went here in May with the 2 for 1 Groupon deal with alcohol.  For the $45 we paid for the 2 of us to have a great dinner and 3 glasses each of champagne each, we loved it.  If we would have been paying full price ($40 each), I might not have loved it as much.  The highlights for us was the seafood: crab legs (split already for you!), steamer clams, a seafood stew, and shrimp.    We also enjoyed the cheeses, crepes, pasta, and the different meats.  We left with a nice buzz and full tummies.    Our waitress Isela, needs a shout out.  She was really nice and kept the drinks coming and plates cleared quickly.  If this comes up on groupon or any discount site again - I'd definitely go for it!

ChFKi1_JTzQfSnvhTpTQvA.text: We decided come to come to this buffet during our trip to Vegas simply because we couldn't make up our minds as to where to go and we just happened to be at Paris that day. The line looked long when we arrived, but it didn't take long to get to the front. Each person was almost $30 if I remember correctly, $24.99 plus tax came out to almost $30 on a weekend lunch. We were seated in an appropriate manner that didn't take too long, thank goodness. We got tables for 6 in an almost room like area where it was slightly closed off, which made it a little quieter.  FOOD: I don't remember anything that stood out, had the usual meat slices and mashed potatoes and vegetables. I also had the shrimp cocktail which were relatively fresh with a good crunch, the cocktail sauce itself tasted really weird almost like medicine. I was really grossed out by it, definitely didn't get seconds on that. They were all pretty meh, I only ended up having two plates of food. For dessert we had the creme brulee that was a little too soggy and didn't have that good crunch on top. But they had this really cool crepe station that makes crepes to order, I ordered a sweet crepe, Le Siege that consisted of whipped cream, nutella, and bananas. It was actually really good, I liked the outside batter when its fresh off the cooker thing but it gets really soggy if you don't eat it quick enough. I loved it because they put so much nutella in it! Mmmm!  SERVICE: Quick to clean the dishes and often offered to refill our drinks for us. They were also very friendly and happy to assist us when we had questions as to where something was.

YCk-OmaS_o1UF3djKfKrTw.text: One of my favorite buffets in Las Vegas. Last time I came was probably a good 5-6 years ago, but I remember the wait gets really really long if you don't get there super early. Hence, my group rushed to get there by 530 to beat the wait.   There was probably 20-30 people ahead of us for dinner. The line moved quite quickly as they were still trying to seat people when we arrived. The ambiance definitely stands out compared to any other buffet I've been to. They have a little building in the middle just for the dozens of desserts that they offer.   The prime rib here is pretty good although this time around, a lot of the meat was medium rare. They have a crepe station that serves both savory and sweet. The sweet crepe is very filling so be sure to save that till the very end.   This buffet has a lot of variety and it's hard not to find something that you would like.   Key: When I was leaving around 700-730, there was a line with at least 75 people in it. The wait is usually up to 90 minutes around then.

vFOm9PDPDddZ-Jcz1gYhCQ.text: Despite our meals being comp'ed b/c of Diamond membership, it was still a crappy experience.  We were told that they had Alaska King crab legs, they substituted regular ones and called them Alaska King. wtf? do you think we don't know the difference? Service was mediocre, drinks were not filled despite asking several times. The only thing preventing me from giving a one-star is the crepes bar - a gigantic crepe customized to your liking. Definitely Americanized French food, but hey, we are in Vegas where everyone pigs out.

wM_sZXZjzscDAo6zX399sA.text: Had the lunch buffet. But only the apple pork and crepe are worth to have. Pudding taste okay too. Other things are so bad. 3 stars it is.

9fWCBOWJ1tKlvo2IDuhbRA.text: Totally disappointed! Not only was most of the good old and gross looking the drinks were terrible, so was the service! Not to mention my husband got the runs after eating here! Worst money ever spent, we were on a "try new things" kick and we should have just had mon ami gabi!

u0H_w3YXgT1IUY1rL6DUnQ.text: I heard so many good things about this buffet and how delicious the food was, but my recent trip had very little to be desired. My boyfriend and I got in before the dinner rush so we were seated as soon as we arrived, but it took ten minutes for our server to come and take our drink orders. Our drinks were empty the majority of the time, and our plates were stacked on our little table. The food was the most disappointing thing of all - the prime rib was dry and flavorless and there was a very small selection of foods in general. I was hoping for more from the buffet, and I am sad to say that I will never return again.

7k7vDl7fbK6QjgMyhY769Q.text: My wife and I decided to visit this place for dinner on 05/20/13.  After eating here, quite frankly this place isn't much different from any other buffet. If I were to compare this with any other buffet that I've been to then I'll say that this buffet isn't worse nor is it better than those buffets I've attended.  They do have a very reasonable amount of dinner items, and I tried to taste as many things as my stomach would allow me. Other than their mashed potatoes and their seafood items nothing really stood out and inspired me to make an urgent return. Even their dessert was nothing special to me. They had a few items that were satisfying but nothing that made me want to come .back again.  I don't think this is a bad buffet and I'm pretty sure that you will be able to find something you enjoy eating here. I mean its a buffet.  Hey this isn't the best buffet I've been to but I do believe that it can get the job done in filling you up.  I haven't decided if I'll ever come back to this buffet because there are so many buffets in Vegas. I guess if I'm on limited time and don't have the time to go to any other buffet then I would come to this one. Other than that I have to try the other buffets out in Vegas before making the decision to come back.  Happy eating people!

iH31Q0gOraEPCzTqHyXyLw.text: I love to experience vegas buffets and this one did not disappoint! The food was high quality and delicious. The ambiance was superb, I felt like I was eating in a cute little village in Paris. I absolutely loved the variety they had and how it was sectioned. They also had a crepe station where the chef prepares the crepe exactly how you want it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème brûlée
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crème caramel
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Main entree.

HCVfn9l4_Dj9KsSr5kDlDg.text: Tried this buffet because of the buffet of buffet deals.   In my opinion, this is probably the smallest of all the buffets. I've tried the majority on the list, but I could be wrong.   The lines for the crepes were long, the food was okay, and the selection was small. I like to get lost at the buffet, like at the Wynn buffet.   The line was insanely long for this teeny, tiny buffet. If you have the patience, then you should at least try it once. Otherwise go to the Wynn or M resort. Their selection and food is so much better.

nSUZ_Ehid1TGcaqs8Xkj_A.text: On the plus side, the mushroom/spinach crepe was outstanding! The food was fresh and pretty good. They could put some more effort into cleaning around all the food. It was pretty messy in some spots. Our waitress was terrible. She spent more time talking to patrons than doing her job. I felt really neglected.

8DShwpIsuFeKjdXiAto97w.text: Earns a 4 star for recent improvements and better attention; however, come here expecting the longest of lines- sometimes 90 minutes to get in.  They have a great selection of seafood, desserts, Krepes, cheese, and deli. Also, some great French styled cuisine. Service is a solid 4-star, design is also about 4 stars.  Located right between Ballys and Paris Las Vegas, it is at the center of a lot of traffic. Come here with your Buffet of Buffets pass.

kNhmPAJO0Dm6VcFpEY-F5w.text: Gets packed at night. Long line. Make a reservation at the concierge and go right in. Great crepes and dessert. We went at 3pm. They had a good selection of seafood: shrimp, crab legs, salmon, clams, sole, oysters. Great onion soup, salads, carving stations and misc. choices.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry crepes
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apples crepes

GVMgwv0yULMqZfVxEX70PA.text: This place is located in the Paris hotel,the buffet for breakfast is around 26 bucks and dinner is around 30.99. We went here twice for breakfast and also dinner... For breakfast my favorite was the crepe they make In front of you with Nutella, banana, and hazelnut... There are many choices from sweet to savory.... You will find other great things from prime rib, True key, and ham.. We went to dinner around 7 pm and of course you have prime rib and crab legs.. The crab legs are cut in half and are cold... They are very very watery though...come and get some French food though

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

oeFeLWuLitWQk0bgXZOnhg.text: I am sitting in the buffet writing this.  I am so disappointed in this buffet.  I remember when it was good.  It is subpar now.  Food is cold.  Plates and bowls are hard to find.  The sushi rolls were turning brown. Deserts were made completely wrong.  Fish was bad.  Again. So disappointed.  I will NEVER come here again.  Not worth the money at all.

8BzpEBf3RUjUz_aD3BfpNg.text: Grate staff but food us not a 25.00 Buffett   Good to the kids but then if unlike pasta then It's for you. It's a eaters pick ether you love it or hate it. I'm giving 3 out of 5

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bEwHE4L0ZPzdda8RuP-bZg.text: The Buffet was not like a buffet at all. They didn't have tasty foods and not in different variety as well. The dishes were not filled properly and they just had the simplest kind of food. They didn't have even any soups for dinner and Salads Bar and desserts was very very simple as well. We even stayed in line for an hour to enter and they charged us 40$ each which was not worth it at all. I will never go to this buffer again.

hpy8iLhwMph5Q5XLds6bdQ.text: Stopped by with my gf to try more stuff in Vegas... I'm a bit spoiled because I've ate at Caesars Palace Buffet and comparing this to that is like comparing Disneyland to Disneyworld.   Cost is pretty cheap and the environment looks cool but after finishing my food it's pretty cheap looking as well.   The variety is only about 5 different stations for food.  Staff seem like they don't care or want to smile.  Seating is awkward...they seated us in a separate room. No music in a small space with other people = uncomfortable.  I feel like I have to whisper.  Food was good not great.   I would honestly say this place is a pass unless you are looking for novelty and price point.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The few selections of fruit and dessert

8gi6eCPC62lMXjsSt9rlZw.text: "That might be the worst thing I have ever put in my mouth." - Scott Conant, Chopped.  I'm so disappointed in this place.  Bad food, bad service, high prices.  How can it get worse?  I figured with all the good things I heard about their brunch, if I chose my items carefully, I could turn this 3.5 star rated place into a 4 star experience -- so wrong.  When over-done prime rib and dry turkey are what "save" a place, that speaks to how bad everything else was.  To make matters worse, very poor, rude service at the cashier --  felt like a stereotypical Chinese restaurant, killing the Paris escapism. And I'm Chinese!  $25 for my 13 year old daughter who ate half a crepe?    Here's a rundown of the foods sampled:  - prime rib - unevenly cooked, but mostly grey over done.  - turkey - bone dry, the gravy was solidified and chunky so I didn't use it.  - mussels/clams - flavorless  - pastas - bland, dry, room temp  - fruits - not sweet, watery, flavorless  - bread - stale  - pate - big clunky pieces, no finesse   - cheeses - ditto  - orange juice - like tang  I honestly can't understand why anyone would like this place.  Are they so excited to be in Vegas they overlook quality?  First time at a buffet?  Because they have a crepe station?  This place makes Hometown Buffet feel special.  I REALLY hate wasting food and would always make an effort to finish something, even if I don't care for it.  But sadly on this day, we wasted quite a bit of food.  I feel so violated.  My tip.... Go to somewhere like Texas De Brazil or Fogo De Chao for lunch, if you want a high quality buffet.  You'll spend less than dinner prices, and if you think Village Buffet is good, you'll think you're in heaven.

RZzg26uEvWsQ_dahz9CdVA.text: My boyfriend and I came here around 9pm, which was about an hour before closing time. Surprisingly there was still a line! We asked a worker when the last call was and was told that it was 10:45pm. We figured it was enough time to stuff our faces and decided to wait it out. We were seated about half an hour later.  My favorites were the mashed potatoes, crab legs, and raspberry cheesecakes. Everything else was just okay...I was excited to eat the clams and mussels but they were kind of fishy. It was probably because we came at the very end of the day though.  Our server was Tam and he was amazing!!! He always checked up on us and the tables around us. What a great guy. We ordered the all you can drink special from him. My boyfriend always got the blue moon and I got the house red wine. Tam was very quick with our drink refills! We never had to wait with an empty glass (which was great because time was of the essence!). He noticed that I was struggling to finish my last wine glass and told me that I could take it to go! Bizarre but amazing!   Although I felt the food really deserved a 3 or 4 star rating, the service that I received from Tam made me feel like I was getting a 5 star experience.

nV6cMJAXaaKdLwAZUhGbhg.text: My husband and I visited on a Thursday night around 5. We waited in line for about 40 minutes. The line moved rather quickly. Once we were seated, I went to use the ladie's room.  When I entered, there was vomit on the floor with a wet floor sign. After this unpleasant experience, I found it difficult to eat. Overall, the selection was minimal. My husband said the prime rib was good. What I did eat was salty and rather flavorless. After waiting awhile I decided to see if I could use the ladie's room. Nope, vomit was still there...twenty to thirty minutes later. Really? I informed a waiter and hoped it would be taken care of. I gave up on any hope of using the bathroom. The only really good thing we found in this visit was our waiter. He was great about bringing drinks when ours were empty. Desserts tasted cheap and mass produced. When I ordered a crepe the cook seemed annoyed to have to serve me. I would not suggest this buffet as there are so many others to visit.

JJhHV3doh6KnO_6Rt3qJeQ.text: I am sorry to say what a let down. Only 7pm and the  food lines looked like they were closed. Soups Luke warm,  presentation of the lines did not look appealing. The staff not friendly and the manager looked tired. The utensil needed to be changed they had dry food and people still used them. All I can say a waste of $31.00.

UGzigQIcsf4d3cKyRmw98A.text: I came here around 3pm on a weekday, and the line to get seated was short but took way too long. There wasn't a host/ess attending to the line, and when one finally did appear, they would leave after seating one party. Minutes later, a diff. host/ess would come saying they weren't sure how long the wait would be, etc. It was just a mess.    When we were finally seated, the service was great! Our server was super sweet and brought our drinks over and picked up our plates in a timely fashion. This made up for lack of service at the beginning.  The king crab legs, mussels, and truffled pasta are the top three things to get at this buffet. Along with the eclairs and creme brulee for dessert, you're set for a looooong food coma!   Otherwise, the rest of the food isn't anything special, though they do have a crepe station which has an extensive menu- sweet and savory options.   The one thing I do like about this place is the decor. The hotel has an ongoing Paris theme  that carries into the buffet. From the ceiling looking like the sky to the floor being a pebbled sidewalk, each area you're sitting in has a different view. It truly resembles a village in Paris!

qvJ-E1yA3LLitiDKiJTdcg.text: The staff is friendly, the food is nothing special, and the ambiance is meh. The place is poorly lit, which doesn't help at all with making the food look appetizing, and you're basically in a giant hall, subdivided in smaller dining rooms with a constant barrage of dirty plates being rolled around on carts around you. There are not a lot of choices in the buffet and much of the food is overcooked. Except for the crepes, those were undercooked. Not worth the long wait.

LQUU95ofrWi6rEsxPFRp-g.text: Great buffet but you need to come with an empty belly. The food is very good and so is the service. Check out all the stations. All have something for everyone. Don't fill up at one you will not have room for all the others.  It is so pretty inside. Coffee mimosas and teas are all included for Sunday brunch. Charlotte was our waitress and she was delightful. Always had a smile on her face.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers to the brides on the left. The got married yesterday
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0Hthd2YKtUvpGjtQwwh2HA.text: How embarrasing!  Please, please do not go.  So many better options.  As a local I will tell you any hotel around is better.  Le village please change the signs on your buffet to give us an idea what dish you are attempting to serve.  You really should be ashamed to charge so much.

MVZSF3rCCeUM3V9vL6Tcmw.text: pretty good selection. got a couple $ off of brunch with my Total Rewards. not as many stations as other buffets, but, quality was spot on, which i prefer. i don't want 40 stations of crap. place was clean and line for brunch turned quick. our "server' cleared up our plates with the quickness. overall, very satisfied with this buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Za4dkZB6gAcXAxVk90bQ2w.text: Way to much money for what they offer. Seriously 4 sausage stations for this small buffet.  The bus station is a traveling cart that for some reason was always inches from our table and he is scrapping dirty dishes while we  eat. The gravy has sat so long with no one using it that it looks a half inch thick with skin. Really disappointed in date night dinner. I lost my appetite and couldn't eat. No wonder there was no line. See my view for dinner

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YDgYw4dMiufgKEb1UFqx4g.text: Came here for breakfast...omelettes and crepes made to order. Yum! Great for breakfast and service top notch too!

xpCMudoAJedVPK_kwqjbug.text: Came here to eat with my brothers at the buffet and trust me when I say I never will go here again. Let me just start off with the food. Everything tasted old nothing seemed to be fresh, we tried out the crab and asked the lady if she could heat the crab up and she told us we have to be I believe Diamond card for her to heat up the carb for us so I guess the 80$ I payed wasn't enough to get hot crab :/,and now with the waitress .... just seemed very unhappy with us she brought us our drink quick but then never came back again for refills or to check up on us, we had to ask to get our table cleaned a couple times. Over all I will never recommend this place to anyone be aware go somewhere else and eat bcc if you eat here you will not enjoy the food time or atmosphere.

yxdnV5Ya84zbii1sLQuMuw.text: This place was great, although a ton smaller than I had imagined. I had been meaning to check this place out for a while, and was glad I did. There was no line on a Saturday night when we were there, which is a plus because I've seen outrageous lines here when walking through Paris. Dinner is $33.99  There is a good selection of seafood and non-seafood items at the buffet, as well as a crepe bar, carving station and dessert area. The highlights were the juicy prime rib, freshly made crepes (both sweet or savory) and macaroons for dessert. The staff was very fast and efficient and seemed to clear our plates as we were done eating off of them. My only regret is that I didn't eat as much as I wanted to/could have because our friends were running late and by the time we had a couple plates it was already 9 pm...will definitely have to go back to check this place out again when I have more time. Definitely one of the better buffets on the strip

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroons!

c8ISHGZOeM8JFnlfK8d1pQ.text: My daughter and I bought the 24-hour "Buffet of Buffets" pass while in Vegas for a conference. We were fairly confident we could get our money's worth and so commenced our Tour de Fatties, Vegas 2018.  In the first 10 hours we made it to 3 of the 5 hotel buffets that are included in the price of the 24-hour pass - Paris Hotel, Flamingo Hotel and Planet Hollywood (you can pay extra for access to a couple more of the higher-end buffets). Since we are staying at Bally's, adjacent to The Paris Hotel, we started at Le Village Buffet at 2 PM with empty stomachs and high expectations. Sadly, we were underwhelmed with the quality of food and found it to be just slightly better than Old Country Buffet.  The best offering, hands down, was found at the crepe station. We each had a crepe made to order, topped with fruit and whipped cream. In fact, tomorrow we plan on stopping by Le Village Buffet to split a savory breakfast crepe and grab some coffee before we head over to our favorite buffet of The Tour:  Paradise Garden Buffet at The Flamingo Hotel.  **The thought of stopping at one buffet ON THE WAY to another buffet is shamefully gluttonous.  In our defense, the rest of our time was spent walking up and down The Strip.

qAUZ2N08yHqlwPePJeuOJg.text: JUST NO. One of the hardest things about vegas buffets is that once you start eating at the higher end ones, the older ones just don't seem as good. Le Village buffet for brunch was a waste of $, it was basically like paying for an overpriced Hometown Buffet. Maybe even worse 'cause at least Hometown Buffet offers carved ham. THAT'S RIGHT, LE VILLAGE DOESN'T SERVE CARVED HAM FOR BRUNCH!! I've never been to a buffet where they didn't have ham for brunch lol.  I don't even know where to start w/ the review on this buffet. I've never been to this buffet so we decided to try it. The line was moving pretty quickly and wait wasn't that long. It was $30 sunday w/ unlimited champagne, but too bad it took forever for our server to refill the drinks and on top of that she spilled TWICE on the table and it got on my friends. The service here is the worst I've seen, all the employees look like they hate their job and are miserable.  One of the MOST unorganized buffets EVER. Food items didn't match the labels and on top of that they put the omelette station at the window of the dessert station, like wtf? I requested an EGG WHITE omelette and the chef was giving attitude/lied that he didn't have egg whites left. LIKE BRO it's still early in the morning and your buffet isn't that busy, there's no way you have no more egg whites, so I said fine make it w/ the yolk then. After he finishes making the omelette he decided to say ok let me go to the back and check if there are any egg whites. LIKE WTF?! WHY DIDN'T U JUST GO IN THE BEGINNING BEFORE WASTING AN OMELETTE?!!? ON TOP OF THAT, WHEN HE WENT TO CHECK, HE LEFT MY MUSHROOMS/VEGGIES COOKING. They were near burning when he returned. The other chef in the dessert station even gave me the "wtf? why'd he leave this cooking unattended" look.  The desserts here sucked, for a buffet that is supposed to represent Paris, their pastries were HORRIBLE. Croissants were worse than costco, the macarons were nasty as well as the variety of carrot cake, cheese cake, etc. Tasted too artificial and worst than store bought at Albertson's. Talk about waste of calories for this buffet. The only good thing was the Crepe station and soft serve ice cream. Crepe station you can select from their menu of sweet or savory crepes. The banana nutella hazlenut crepe I got w/ vanilla ice cream was good, but the crepe needed more texture to it.  The prime rib and roast beef lacked flavor even w/ au jus added. It was cooked to medium rare but still tasted dry. The mushroom truffle flavor mac n cheese was horrible. The macaroni noodles were mush, not al dente at all, but at least the truffle flavor was there. The steamed veggies were like mush as well. The crab legs were constantly running out and it wasn't even that good. The crab meat seemed old.  BTW, they have restrooms in the buffet, but TOUGH LUCK! It is as horrible as the buffet cause THERE'S ONLY ONE STALL!!! I can just keep ranting on and on about how horrible this buffet is, but I'm sure ya'll get the point already. AVOID AT ALL COST!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halfway eating through our crepe, we see this huge stick thing in it

xKvXj0-jkFFYT3u9ShRzAg.text: The food was dry and had no taste. Very disappointed in the service in general, and for the rudeness of the people who are serving behind the counter in the different cottages. The quality of the food was below three, and there was nothing French about the food. No sauces like I said the food was very dry. The dessert  cottage was horribly dirty, the macrons were very dry like cardboard.

-lf1MWQyKDyOyq4_cAGiZg.text: An excellent value for brunch. Come at 10:30 and hit the end of the breakfast serving, and beginning of lunch at 11. Buffet is cheaper for breakfast than lunch. The crepes were very good, especially the strawberry banana and Nutella. as were the eggs, which must have had a lot of creme in them. Potatoes were not particularly fresh or crispy though the dishes did taste very good.  Croissants with chocolate (pain au chocolate) were only so-so, as were the mini pastry dessert including the fruit tart. Somehow at a French themed buffet I was unable to get a butter croissant. Macaroons were only so so.   As for the watch serving, the pastas were very good. One with truffle oil was super tasty, as was the mac & cheese. The puttanseca was also very good, one of the spicier ones I've had.    To summarize an excellent value at $20 per adult.

7HKf1BEOYp9-oJngb-AJQg.text: A good solid 3-3.5. Been on my list for a long time. The crepes are the star of the show. I only set aside one of the 20+ items I tried which is good. But aside from the crepe I had nothing that really stood out. I had passed this place by several times because of the line, after going through the one hour line on a weekday lunch I was disappointed to find many tables from 2 tops to 10 cleaned and available.

89PjB4Qro2cRc9r58_Y72w.text: 1.5 Stars  Underwhelming crepe station (center is still cold) Variety is limited Most of the entrees were pedestrian  Quality is questionable Price point is ok but for what you get well not worth the lunch cost of $27  Overall Thoughts  Hard pass.....not so bad to deserve a one star but damn close!

N3wIokfDuzcCQu2RfuLHFQ.text: Used to come to Themis buffet a lot when they first opened. It was one of my favorite buffets at that time and had a great food selection. I can't again for the first time in 3+ years and it was just bad. Bad, bad, bad. We payed for holiday dinner prices ($40/person) and it wasn't even worth $10/ person. I struggled to find ways to fill my first plate. We came at the beginning of the dinner rush. So food should have been the most fresh and warm. The food looked disgusting. The smoked salmon looked like it was from last week. The lettuce was browning and dry. The pasta that I put on my plate was cold (how is that possible?). The dessert section was a shame. Old fruit and soggy pasties. This is the last time I will ever come here and I really don't see how the buffet can stay open much longer with this poor quality of food. Save your money and go somewhere else. I wouldn't eat here if it was for free.

fiEhCeT4h0bHXEixZS3jeQ.text: Never gonna fall into their trap! They were hopelessly overbooked on a weekday dinner we reached around 7 and had to wait 2 hours to finally get seated. Food wasn't a great deal either i guess ppl just hype about their ambience. Not worth do much wait and my legs couldn't take it! Would give a 0 if i could!

Es5ejOr6omFX15DGdwnioA.text: Deserts are very good; creme brulee, flan,... quality and variety is good.  Ambient is nice; $40 per person worth their food and service. However, it is a big line; so better to come before 9 am or have reservation in advance. I recommend this buffet for Sunday brunch.

wNHlpZnHskH_e71uC6N2QQ.text: This is an Oo La La buffet to me! Please note that Oo La La is used here the way it is used in USA not France, where Oh la la has a different connotation.  Le Village buffet is the happiest place on earth to me as far as Vegas buffets go. We paid an arm and a leg ($55 pp if I remember correctly) at the Wynn buffet and it was a disaster.  We had the Bellagio buffet the day before and it was worse than the hometown buffet, it was worth about $10, years ago, the Bellagio was an elegant place, a buffet fit for royalties, I still remember the opulence of everything, the chicken/beef wellington, pate, cornichons. It was outrageous there was no mayonnaise and little variety in the offerings. They had olives & weir cheese in everything.   Paris hotel, Le Village buffet had my favorite pate de campagne with cornichons! they even had chicken pate, it was so yummy, aioli to kill for. Their onion soup was always good but not this time, it was thick and tasted like it came out of a can. They had a real grill where fresh beef tritip was grilled in front of your eyes, chicken, sausages, hummus, fresh grilled veggies, French bread and pita pockets were also available.  Cuisine of 5 regions of France were represented. They had a crepe station where fresh crepes were made to order, I did not want to wait so I skipped it this time. I like the bouillabaisse but this time, there were no fish or scallops, only mussels and clams.  The shrimp cocktail was very good here, Bellagio cocktail sauce was not edible, too sweet and just tasted bad.  I was so stuffed, I was not able to eat much desert, I did have a flan, it was good but not enough caramel taste, no other restaurant I have been to have caramel sauce, If I want it, I would have to make it myself or go to Paris, it simply vanished from the US.  I don't understand the complaint of some reviewers, this is a French buffet if you want ham and turkey, you come to the wrong place!. Years ago, there were a few European chefs, now all the chefs/cooks were Hispanic plus the desire to save money, the buffet had been dumbed down just like on cruise ships, you cannot expect authentic cuisine under these circumstances. That said, this is the best buffet now, I have been to every buffet in Vegas and countless cruise ships, they are all very ordinary. BTW, the eyes eat too, I uploaded a few pictures of Paris hotel, the decorations in the Village buffet created an cozy ambiance, I felt like I was in Provence or Burgundy, Brittany, etc..After dinner, you walk over to have a drink under the chandeliers, sitting on a corset bar stool, it was pretty cool!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burgundy region prime ribs, turkey, ham, Chateaubriand sauce.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They sold a drink package for $11.99, I&#39;d rather have a drink after the buffet at one of the amazing bars in the hotel.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Paris hotel bar.

kh2jQ8aB39c2_iizWiUjQw.text: This is the Paris hotel buffet.  The decor is very nice, like a French restaurant or cafe.  The breakfast buffet is one of our favorite things to get in Las Vegas. The crepes are outstanding.  There are sweet or savory selections available, and they are made before your eyes.  There are also many other items that you don't always see elsewhere:  smoked salmon, a wide variety of cheeses, slab bacon, eggs benedict, various types of potatoes and sausages, and croissants and pastries as well as several egg selections and fruit.. My wife used to prefer the Bellagio breakfast buffet, until she tried this one.

d2opylCewijyTiCC_5NZrw.text: Love the food and the ambience. My faves on the buffet were the bacon slab, Kielbasa sausage, potato au gratin, chorizo hash, vegetable quiche and all the danishes!!!

3DbT-adq50XlG6fDMdvuxg.text: 5 off with foursquare check in at total rewards desk which is a great deal!  The moules and other seafood was good. I didn't particularly enjoy the prime rib or tri tip. Fish was cooked well but make sure you stay away from the salads! It got my boyfriends dad really sick and ruined the rest of our trip. He threw it up that night and no more buffets in the land of buffets.  The macarons looked good but were stale.  The crepes are cooked to order and the #1 Monkey crepe was excellent! Banana, Nutella and chocolate. For $30, you could probably eat at a better buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaron
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Monkey

9z-0GAjqfYkrg-uxeCrgEg.text: I'm sorry to say that the buffet was really disappointing. The food quality was mediocre at best. You can go across the street to the Bellagio for about $3 more and have a delicious and elegant breakfast buffet. The Paris space feels dark and the the buffet stations are not kept particularly neat. I sampled several food items all of which were very mediocre in flavor and quality. They had small bagels that were sort of hard and no available toaster. No condiments for the bagels anywhere near by. Presentation in general was not particularly appetizing. I'm generally pretty forgiving but overall this was a disappointing visit. Go to Bellagio or Wynn for better quality and beautiful surroundings.

fXKPB06wY11uwlemw0cdYg.text: Underwhelming. Disappointing. Gross. These are the words that come to mind with this buffet. For being a hotel directly on the strip and with a name like Paris I feel like this buffet had a name to live up to and it sure did disappoint.   First of all the service sucked.  We saw our server once the whole time we were there. Only when he asked what we wanted to drink. We got no refills, no plates cleared, no "do you need anything else." nothing.   Food was even worse. For the food that was there, since most items were empty, it was either underwhelming and bland or saltier then the sea. Everything looked old and made you question just how long everything was out. Only a couple of the dishes were labeled correctly so everything was a guessing game. Buffet in general was very small as well. Selection was tiny. Was looking forward to dessert hoping it would save the night but boy was I wrong. Flan was gross. Tasted packaged. The FRENCH macaroons weren't even made properly. (for those of you who do or don't know the smooth side is supposed to be out where you can see it and the ugly rough side should be inside) well then had it all wrong. And the only filling they had was chocolate on different color shells. Food overall was bad.  Now let's go for cleaniness. All the windows to guard the food had grease and grime all over it. Since they don't spend time on the food they should at least clean now and then.   Overall a very very disappointing buffet.

vn-yFPxOLWijFcNAW3gUfQ.text: We keep returning to Le Village Buffet year after year - my kids love the tradition of going back to eat every year, and we keep getting the Buffet of Buffets pass -, and we continue to see it declining in offerings.  I think anyone paying full price would be disappointed.  We went both for dinner and breakfast - both times avoiding the line by making OpenTable reservations.    For dinner, they seemed to have fewer and poorer offerings this year.  There is no more lamb, tri-tip or pork belly - or elaborate French dishes.  Cassoulet and a dry duck a l'orange seemed to be it.  The crepes are still fantastic, but they have reduced the types offered and also downgraded ingredients - no more mixed berries or chopped hazelnuts.  They only had one crepemaker working during both the dinner and breakfast rush, so waits can be very long.    Service was good during dinner, rushed over breakfast.    All in all, it was disappointing.  I wouldn't go back without the kids pressuring us to do so.

n7gWrobIjBnrCzjMnbTi_w.text: Crepes crepes crepes all day long, crepes crepes crepes while I sing this song. Seriously, the crepes at Le Village Buffet are to die for! There is always a wait for the crepes, but it is worth it. The crepes are made right in front of you and exactly to your liking. I always get 1 sweet crepe and 1 savory crepe. For the savory I go with the ham and cheese and for the sweet I go with the Nutella and hazelnuts. The only reason I can't give this place 5 stars is because I never really eat anything else at the buffet. After the crepes I usually fill up a plate with a variety of things I pick at, but by that point I'm so full that I don't taste anything else LOL.

nQ_qk4ew8-3f9uze4mKN4A.text: I think I made my last visit to this buffet tonight.  And it's a shame, because this used to be one of the absolute best buffets in Vegas.  I had probably visited half a dozen times over the years, and am saddened that it has really gone downhill.  Once there were several bowls of a large variety of salads. Tonight most of the bowls were empty, and the remainder had very little in them.  Once the cheeses were imported, with a delicious blue.  Tonight the cheeses were what one would find in your neighborhood Safeway  At one point, each of the regional sections had a wide variety of fare from that region.  Tonight, each station had but a few selections, and nothing particularly special about any of them.  Once the dessert station was packed with many choices.  Tonight, most of the display was entirely empty, and what was there was sub-standard.  Too bad.  But there are many other choices...

wlF6m0882dRGIZuJl5gPKQ.text: Nice seating and decoration.  The roast beef was juicy.   The snow crab legs are too salty, I could not taste the meat at all.  The cheese and desserts were a big disappointment.

_yq2Of0DRVcH4pXIcPfoKw.text: Cindy, the general manager had excellent leadership and professional service that seem to reflect on the good customer service of the staff.

bfozEVZOz8YiOC6CF4Xrrw.text: Pleasantly surprised after seeing mixed reviews.  Food was fresh and delicious.  Decor is one of a kind and felt like a village.  Will def return!

02qEyhJVOTQ3P-SserNC5w.text: The Buffet King (my hubby) hereby proclaims Le Village Buffet the best in the land of buffets. Coming from him, that's big praise. He lives for buffets. We met up with over 40 others (mostly Hawaii relatives) to celebrate my auntie's 80th B-day. We were given our own section to make merry. Oh lord, were we noisy! "Banzai!" from the Japanese bunch. "Mabuhai!" from the Filipino bunch. "Here, here!" from our haoles. Even had one of our younger generation performing a lovely hula for all of us and those seated by our section. That's us...spreading the Aloha spirit even when in Paris! The dinner food selection was outstanding! The various stations were well spaced so that, even on a busy Saturday night, civility reigned. They even had a grilled section that was perfect for me. Grilled veggies, meats & fish that I could enjoy without the fear of suffering from sauce overload later. My stomach was already dancing from eating elsewhere, so this was appreciated. The seafood cocktail section was pretty much wiped out by our clan. Once they discovered how sweet & meaty the crab legs were, loaded up plates kept coming into our section to be shared. I tried two claws, but I think they might have been previously frozen. I stuck mostly to the peel shrimp and made my own horseradish cocktail sauce. yelp.com/biz_photos/ZkGD... Of course the menfolk were going crazy at the meat carving stations. I was eyeing the big variety of foods coming to our table from the other gal cousins and was in envy. A lot of French cuisine that I would have loved to try. Pasta too. I was sorely tempted by the risotto that was popular with the gals. From their exclamations, I'd say they were enthusiastic about mostly everything they tried. We had a lovely birthday cake for Auntie, but the others hit up that dessert station anyways. I caved when someone put a creme brulee in front of me. Soooooo good. One of little kids in our group had four ice cream cones. I did try a bite of one of those macarons that seems to be popular these days. S'okay. Service was good. Our group was assigned two servers who were really on top of their game. The section we were placed in was pretty spacious. We didn't feel hemmed in. For some reason though, I kept getting confused about our location and walked into two other group's parties. "Where'd this ol' Japanese lady come from?!?" Oops. I know we'll be back someday. The Buffet King said so.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_0s2vimZbYlVQTJxtX0fyg.text: We came for breakfast Feb '13... And we just loved it! Service was great and wait was brief. All stations were well stocked and appealing. The highlights of my meal were the very fresh lox paired with goat cheese and the Nutella/banana crepes... Fantastic! We'll be back!

Md1GzQFpwaX901kUQzMVvQ.text: This is a relative four. I am on the border between a three and four.  This buffet use to be one of the best in Las Vegas.  The Wynn group combined about 10 casino buffets including this one.  I was comp'd at two of the other buffets at Planet Hollywood and Harrah's.  The reason it is a relative four is that Planet Hollywood is comprable to Home Town Buffet or other local buffet and Harrah's was SOS inedible, if I wasn't comp'd (I was comp'd as part of deal, not by Harrah's) for this place I would have been pissed.  So the four stars is that this buffet is still far above the rest, but no longer the best of the best.  The food went from great to good.

qPY8NGZul9dJ-YTTOWp-_A.text: Since we stay at the Paris hotel often when we come to las vegas we always enjoy our dinning at LE Village Buffet doesn't matter if its breakfast ,lunch or even dinner . The food is simply amazing here  and so many different choices of foods its crazy . I just love the  decor is so welcoming and i love the waitress and waiters outfits you just feel like Ur in Paris and not to mention the friendly  service everyone provides.   The main thing is get there early for breakfast because if you come after 10 the line is pretty long which is no fun at all but its well worth the wait that's for sure. They sell beer,wine and cocktails but there mimosas are just Delicious .  Can't say enough great things about this place yes its a buffet but its a pretty good one and everything has such great taste and lots of flavor  and is so fresh which is a good thing .  Like i said every time I'm in Vegas i eat here its just that good

EP0BPj9RDbgB8YjvDg2gEg.text: Just ate lunch here and not impressed. I have been to a few buffets on the strip and this is one of the worst. Runny potatoes, cold sausage, and just a bad selection. Take a walk down to planet Hollywood instead you won't regret it.  This review was from July 2013.

MbM95nf78B5X239gfmUepg.text: Great service with great food. Had a trouble at the front, but overall great dinning experience at vegas.

6Kg-UAcodx--eOeNZ45Rcw.text: The only thing Le Village has going is its convenient location. This place is sooooo tired you feel like you're dining in the geriatric wing. The servers are indifferent at best; the food is barely adequate; and the place is just a mess, which is just inexcusable. Filthy food trays and trays of dirty utensils are just left in aisles.  The only reason we are there is because the buffet came with our room package.  Otherwise, you"ll never catch me there again.

C5rUQlLK-wZkGLZ38_0mgQ.text: Love love love this buffet. Good meat, salads and dessert. Incredible atmosphere.. We had buffet 3 times and perfect experience each time .

MAK2lcGezhnjwVG-0IrvNQ.text: We tried the buffet at Le Village in Paris Paris on a friday night. We were smart to get the Groupon that came out recently so it was a good deal. I did see almost all the people pay retail $$$. The line was crazy, we waited almost an hour.  Firstly, I couldn't understand what all the fuss was about. I get that the ambience of the place was nice, but apart from that I wasn't impressed. The French ambience does make the experience a little nicer, as the buffet is organized by food from different provinces in France. That was the only interesting part , the food and service were really average.  Food - I wasn't impressed by the variety, It contained only French varieties, and no delicacies. In Vegas, one does walk in expecting some level of opulence, delicacies and surprises, especially if I am paying $40pp, which were missing. Of course, since it was only French menu, the few dishes they had were well prepared. However, as a vegetarian, there was barely anything tasty to eat. The made to order crepes were the saviors. Although, they were very nice, delicate and well prepared, I have had better crepes in food trucks in Austin. Apart from that, all there was, were 4 different kinds of potatoes to eat! Really, after All the hype about French cooking, I was expecting some nicely prepared vegetarian options. Even the bread collection was so mundane, you can find those in your local cafeteria.  The macaroons were the highlight of the dessert section, but again, what if they're flour less and delicate? A cookie is still just a cookie, bake me a nice cake! No cheesecakes, no tortes, no ice cream. The seafood collection seemed ton be nice and people were enjoying the crab legs. There was a decent grilled chicken in a so called Mediterranean section, but nothing else looked interesting. I saw shrimp, clams but nothing seemed grilled or spiced. Probably the worst hummus I've had was here. Even the usual suspects, like pizza, Mac n cheese which are kid friendly were missing or scarce.  The drinks and Service - we had the bottle of wine with our package, but didn't feel like having it then. The server said, their policy was that they had to open it! Bummer. We got the red wine and it was a nice balanced Cabernet. There were other drinks like ice teas, sodas, mimosas,beers etc. The server didn't return for the remainder of our dinner and never asked to refill our drinks or bring any other. They have waitresses dressing up in old French maid costumes but they are really old and cannot keep up with the tables. There were so many empty tables, but they couldn't get them cleaned in time to get guests seated.  I'd say, forget the French hype and go for a more traditional buffet next door at pH.

nYMMK9s8LCGtx8xXg5yY-w.text: Without a doubt the best buffet I've had in Vegas...and I'm a local! I know I haven't tried them all but this one was amazing. I didn't have anything I didn't like and everything was high quality. Mussels, clams, crab legs, duck, truffle cavatapi, crepes, and so much more. Yum!

6fQ3C2DW1yz8lunAscMRAw.text: So we did the deal "Buffet of Buffets" for 44.95 for a rolling 24 hours which means you can eat at Harrah's property Buffets. Paris/Bally's, Rio, Imperial Palace, Harrahs, and Caesars when they reopen it in mid summer. So you will see a couple of reviews for Buffets here.   The Paris/Bally's buffet (which is misleading because it says Bally's and Paris have their own separate buffets but they don't) is pretty decent. They have fresh cut meats, their Creme brulee is to die for, and they have a crepe station that you can order desert or dinner crepes.   Service was pretty bad, getting drinks refilled was almost impossible. They also have an all you can drink wine/beer that you can tack on for 19.99 (Don't do it here...Harrah's does the same and it includes champagne for 10.00)  The quality of food here is about 4 star but the 3 star rating was for the service. Our drink waiter was not attentive and that was frustrating.

8vOG0FTqnUou-7qYhqH5tQ.text: Le Village Buffet is part of the Buffet of Buffets deal ($45 to dine for 24 hours). We went here twice and were happy both times. The deal is totally worth it at these buffets and we loved how Le Village offers bottomless mimosas for breakfast/brunch. How awesome is that? Service is super nice and always check on you. There's a great variety of different French-styled foods and desserts. Definitely worth checking out and one of the more memorable buffets I've had in Sin City.

lxFxBmXrEpSlH31O8ufRfA.text: Came shortly after 8am and was seated right away. I went straight to the crepe station and ordered the ham & cheese. It was wonderful. They had a nice selection of fresh fruit and assorted pastries. I had several slices of smoked salmon and capers to round off my breakfast. The only reason the score is so low my waitress never refilled my water or my juice. Ugh poor customer service.

do2qfNXNZPnOEWkwnTlczA.text: 4-stars for the breakfast & brunch. HIghlighted by the crepe buffet. Never had dinner here.

F14l_MKQE_knCUN0oc754A.text: I bought the Buffet of Buffets pass and went here for breakfast.  All I can say is wow - what a meal!  I went here for breakfast on a Monday, and the line was about 30 minutes long.  First of all, if you dine here for breakfast, you must try the crepes.  I got a berry-filled crepe with raspberry coulis and it was one of the top crepes I've had.  The only issue with this station is that they really stick to their menu and don't customize your choice.  So you're pretty much out of luck if you wanted to add some bananas to your berry crepe.  There was a vast selection of breakfast food - they had every type of breakfast potato, including hash browns, roasted, scalloped and shredded - and it didn't taste like cheap buffet food.  Next time I'm in Vegas, I am definitely returning here for breakfast.

PzfAlkRtk6AuuzMWV_nSlw.text: So after eating at all the popular buffets in Vegas, I was so disappointed in this one! We arrived at the buffet pretty late (for dinner) because we didn't want to wait in the huge lines, but our plan failed. After getting into the dining area, I was shocked at how small and limited the stations were. The seafood selection there totally sucked; the crab legs were tasteless and didn't even hold before chewing....All of the meat selections were extremely dry and hard to access because of the lines and positioning of the food. The best thing this buffet has to offer is their roasted vegetables, and deserts. That's it. I was craving a nice salad after eating so unhealthy and they only had one type of salad with about 3 toppings.   The waitstaff was pretty friendly but they were overwhelmed by how many people were in there at once. We even had to come back to a couple of stations that ran out of food because there wasn't more prepared to be put out right away. For $25, I would not recommend this place.

nH9SZ6oW09rtMVOadfEoMg.text: If you like having 5-8 different kinds of eggs for breakfast, then come here.  Le Village Buffet looks like it was taken out of Belle's running through the town and singing scene in Beauty and the Beast.  It's a mimic of the outdoors even though you're really inside and it has that Disneyland cheese factor to it.  Breakfast food has always been obsolete in my life.  I like eating whatever it is in the fridge, albeit not falling into traditional breakfast food categories.  So being overly exposed to five kinds of eggs, eight kinds of bagels, three kinds of sausages, and 10 kinds of breads plus many more varieties of the essentially the same thing... is nauseating.  The line gets really long once you get near 11am from people checking out, finally getting through their hangovers, and what not.  This normally costs $19.99 but like I had said for my review of Cafe Lago, this can be part of the $34.99 all day buffet pass you get.

5ua9swCIeD84V-WeEObzVA.text: My friends and I woke up late for breakfast and decided to head over to Paris for brunch.  I did not stay in Paris so I can't review the hotel but as I walked through the hotel to the buffet I got a glimpse of it and it was so cute. They have little patisseries and French signs all over to make it feel authentic. The line for the buffet was quite long but moved surprisingly quickly. I was adamant about eating a crepe for breakfast so I refused to leave. What I really liked about this buffet in particular is they do not take a break from breakfast to lunch or dinner they just gradually change the dishes so I got to sample the breakfast and lunch buffet. The food was soooooo good. I had this amazing steak and potato has with real chunks of tender beef, smoked salmon, something that resempled scalloped potatoes without the cheese but lots of sauteed onions and mussels. They have stations that represent the different regions in france which I thought was a good idea and helps break stereotypes. I have no complaints about the food!  I wanted to go on my last day but I didn't have enough time. The crepes were divine. I ordered the mixed berry one and walked over to the ice cream stations and topped it off. PERFECTION! Next time I'm in vegas I will be stopping here for brunch.   My only point of criticism if the bathroom. There was only one toilet in a buffet! Which means line ups. Wasn't too pleased about that but the food made up for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything I could possible fit
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon Sammie and fresh fruit
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crepe

Y4EUFH0_qYv6Le8AVE-IJQ.text: Amazing -- all you can eat crab legs neatly sawed open for you to eat on the half shell for quick/easy eating---delectable!!  Prime rib like butter!!  Crepe station with the most sophisticated savory crepe combos -- makes it all worth it.  Fresh-grilled tri-tip or chicken.  Individual Creme Brulee's or various fancy Macaroons!!  Personable service.  Go.

2H6o0_6DOXGWNXm-kcOY-w.text: It was a buffet. Thought it would be superb. Got up early cause the lines are always long. Of course there are easy options. Food, for me it was so so. Eggs were runny and tasteless. For the price I thought they would have more options. I was disappointed.

ZmV2GvCfZt7nYn7OkoMNLg.text: Came during Memorial Day weekend (Sunday). Arrived around 11:30am and the line was already long. I had a party of 12 and keep in mind that 17% gratuity is added for parties of 8 or more. Ask to sit in Kay & Billy's service. They do a great job at making sure you are taken care of and are super sweet.  Highlights: -HOLIDAY BRUNCH: $34.99 -Create your own crepe bar & omelet bar -BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS. Just wish you could take the bottle of champagne with you if you aren't done with it :( -Crab legs are pre-cut -Creme Brulee was good, macarons weren't. -Prime Rib was decent especially with mashed potatoes and sauteed mushroom -Everything else was just okay.  Other than that, I would probably come back at some point.

pm5lWSR4eU4Lg7o-JAjO5A.text: PROS: We had a groupon and i would say the food was well worth it. The crepes were outstanding. All of the desserts were fresh and delicious, the carrot cake, chocolate cake, cookies, custard and banana nutella crepe.  I'm a vegetarian and I had more than enough food to choose from. My husband enjoys his meats and had plenty also. Cons: The service was slow. More than one station had everything labeled incorrectly.  Overall great dinner!

SmRohSESXtgt6EcDFwQCgw.text: I'm rating Le Village Buffet breakfast only. For about $16 for breakfast this is not a bad deal. I've spent more ordering an orange juice and entree at MGM. I wish I never did that. Since Le Village is French, you will get some pastries to go along with your normal breakfast variety. In Vegas, you must eat breakfast as a hangover cure, if you can wake up. Unfortunately, the breakfast closes at 11am, so be there early. There is always a line, because this buffet is very popular.  I was able to spoil myself with fresh made omelets, Eggs Benedict, and both French Toast and pancakes. Don't forget to have a crepe for dessert. I know that sounds like a lot of food, but hey this is a Vegas buffet so SSHH! Diets and feeling fat can wait until you return home. I recommend looking for $5 off coupons or 2 for 1 coupons if you can. I'm not sure if they apply to breakfast though. If you are a breakfast fan, head over to Paris and give it a try. Don't except a True Paris experience, but the American will work just fine. The decorations and server clothing kind of reminds me of Disneyland.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Crepe w/ chocolate. Mini waffle and whip cream (with emphasis on the &#34;H&#34;)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict. So good someone ate 2 of them while waiting in line for crepes.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Toast, Omelet, bacon, and hash brown the best way to start a morning.

k_SBiSw3EDnVTg_u0SQxgQ.text: One of my fav brunch spots on the Strip. Love the crepe bar where you can get fresh made to order crepes. Food selection is huge, and great quality. Never disappointed here. We usually get the 24 hr buffet pass for $50, which includes this buffet and many other on the strip at Caesar properties. If you want to check out a few of the Vegas buffets, definitely the best way to go.

cokR80nw2oAkFhLvfAm4eg.text: The buffet was pretty good -- no line for breakfast. Crepe line moved quickly. The food was lukewarm in some places. Not the best quality -- some clearly not fresh. The meat carving station was good. I would not go back or necessarily recommend it -- I would try something else first.

A7Lkpzyqcl5zQvkYoAdk3Q.text: Big disappointment   Ambiance waiting to be renovated (French village too old)  The food was mediocre, but not great. I enjoyed the hot meats, crab legs. Some meat was over cooked so it was a little tough and the sushi did not look fresh, the veggies look old & cold. The macrons way too crunchy, cookies, cakes, creme brulee, etc.... crepe fill with frozen strawberry - the batter too thick - never again  Cooked mussels & clams - unflavored Pasta dishes which all looked unappealing,  Chicken soup - Awful  Missing is a little more ethnic food variety- expect from a French-themed restaurant.   Next time in Vegas will try Buffet of Buffets (~$80 for 24 hrs of Total Rewards buffets - so worth it!)   Did not enjoyed at all

6LeZFLwlRK_1QN0e-W_Cjg.text: The food here is not good - most of the items had been sitting out for far too long. Any seafood was overcooked and mushy. Veggies were also overcooked and under seasoned. The only reason for even 1 star are the desserts and crepe station. I would take that $31 and invest it in a nice a la carte meal. Only went here because my parents were real hungry and stayed at Paris - convenience really. It's mostly just sad in here.

y34XNN0ks5iWt2ZR9iVXiQ.text: My party and I came here for breakfast around 10am and was seated right away. Loved the decor! Made me feel like I was in Paris again    They didn't have a huge selection of food, I'm not sure if it's because it was breakfast and there's not much you can really serve. They had the basic American breakfast; pancakes, eggs, sausage, omelets etc. And they had a section for a bit of French breakfast--sorry I forgot what they were. I just ate several plates of salad (lol) and typcial pancake with sauages and bacon! It was good, nothing special.... But their OJ...that was bomb! Tasted like it was freshly squeezed!  The best part of this buffet was the dessert's table. There was unlimited, as you can expect at a French restaurant, all you can eat macaroons! THEY WERE SO GOOD. There were several flavors and all of them were delicious! Not too hard, not too soft, not too sweet! My brothers who are normally indifferent about macaroons ate several of them!   We all had the buffet of buffet pass so we literal came back into the Le Village throughout the day just to snag several macaroons! Short lines, 24 hr pass, unlimited macaroons, why not?

5YcbqD8cp6_G_Q7sW0c_jA.text: There is really good food here. Have no complaints about it but it could have been warmer. Food was a little cold for my taste but will be coming back. It was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Definitely good food.

v62iNSLnLUBv9pmZPw7MCw.text: This buffet is just OK. It's got my two faves--crab legs and prime rib. However, this isn't the best buffet you're going to find in Vegas. It is part of the 24-hour buffet pass but I would skip this one next time.   The decor is cute and very French village-esque. However, the selection seems small. The crab legs ran out and weren't refilled quickly. So, I only got to have a small serving. I do like they are already cut in half for easy eating though. I liked the mussels in arrabbiata sauce but I don't know if this is just a specialty item. There isn't anything too out of the ordinary in the dessert section either. Mostly just pastries.  FYI- they are strict with carding here for the mimosa brunch so don't forget your ID. Also, the bathroom in the actual buffet is small so make sure to go to the casino instead!

FzVYyXVtTl0AnUbhF7kETA.text: The best part of this buffet is the Crepe station. I am somewhat of a crepe connoisseur and this place being a French inspired buffet did not disappoint at all  with their crepes. They have a savory section and a sweet section so I tried one from each and both were really good. When it comes to crepe it's really all about the batter because the filling is almost the same everywhere else.  The other highlight of this buffet is their prime rib, which they also serve for lunch as well. Those were really the main highlights of it.   The selection in general is not very extensive or specialized. It's on a much smaller scale with their food selection compared to the other buffets in Vegas. But do try out their crepes! And I'd go to that station first since there's usually a line for it.

tVQCRDLLyoZ3qJfMuS3GfQ.text: How disappointing. We were a group of three and it was Easter. They charged a premium price because it was a holiday. I expected a premium meal.  There were lots of choices but they fell way below our expectations. For example, the grilled squash was too garlic, slimy with olive oil and cold. The prime rib was flavorless and filled with grizzle. It was not palatable at all. For desert I chose an eclair that was school cafeteria quality. I spent over $150.00 for three of us to eat and drink. I doubt I will ever return to Las Vegas but if I do, I will steer clear of Paris. It is Memorial Day weekend, if you are in Las Vegas, look somewhere else for a decent meal. There are many great places.

xMsfgvnlyDKzkv8zT9Wy_g.text: OK if you can get it comped. Otherwise, go to Bellagio, Aria, Planet Hollywood-these are larger, well run & clean. Service was terrible-almost nonexistent. The buffet workers were also missing from several stations. I asked one what one of the dishes was & she answered "I don't know any of these, they sent me from another station." No plates at or anywhere near the dessert station & lots of empty spaces where desserts hadn't been replenished. Messy in lots of areas. No excuse because it wasn't busy at 5 PM on a Friday.

aTp6QyVolZeupSS8wbrYfg.text: I came here last year in November for brunch with my family and really really enjoyed it. They serve mimosas on the weekends so we were able to enjoy that last time. I went here this past week with my husband, as a part of the Buffet of Buffets deal. We tried Rio & Planet Hollywood and agreed this was the better of the 3. Line wasn't long around dinnertime so I only waited about 7 minutes total to be seated. The waiters are very friendly, and the theme is very nice. I think I enjoyed my experience much more last time because it was my first time there, but I felt the food wasn't as fresh this time around.  Dinner:  A good portion of the hot items were dry because they had been left out for a while, and the Truffle mac n cheese (which I enjoyed last time) was very, very dry. Crab legs were cut in half, which made eating more convenient, but I thought they didn't taste very fresh. I remember the cut tri-tips being amazing last time, but the ones at dinner were dry on the top, which made for tough chewing. Everything else is pretty decent. Ended dinner with creme brulee. yumm.  Brunch: We came back the following morning for brunch because we wanted to give this buffet another chance. Truffle Mac n cheese was gooey and fresh this time, and the roast beef was pretty good too. I really enjoyed the sausages (really tasty) and brussel sprouts. Crepes didn't really spark my interest so I decided to go for the fresh omelettes, which were quite tasty. Ended my brunch with creme brulee. yumm  Tip: Try filling your plate with small, bite-size portions so you'll get a taste of everything and know what you like. I highly recommend going in the early afternoon because it's busier and food is constantly being refreshed. 3 stars for dinner, 4 stars for breakfast..soo 3.5 stars actually haha

cJaLPy5Ax5WBtYg_M-LCQA.text: 24 hour buffet run...It sounded like a good idea on paper....But after one meal, I vow to never eat again...lol  The theme of this place is so adorable and cute.  We went for brunch so we could get a taste of lunch and breakfast.  I didn't think anything was really a standout, most buffet food tastes the same to me.    I stood in line at the crepe station for a long ass time...it wasn't really worth it to me, but it was still pretty good.    There was so many different eggs and breakfast meat/sausage type things, I always wonder why white folk come in hoards for breakfast...it always tastes the same to me...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tmiQcWA5j1P0Uv_3FZeL3g.text: We will not be going again.  We just had breakfast buffet Sunday morning.  We arrived about an hour after they opened and were seated right away.  I researched blogs, and ratings and this buffet came up as one of the best in Las Vegas. I was willing to pay the extra for what was described as a really good buffet.    I was so excited, and unfortunately was very disappointed.   The good:  The ambiance and service was good.  I liked the sweet polenta, lox's and the sliced ham.  My husband liked the savory sausage bread pudding. The mediocre:  Pretty much all other food was so so and nothing to rave about.  The crepe bar was a nice touch, but the actual product wasn't a big deal. The Bad:   1. If you are going to charge $25.00 a person for a breakfast buffet you should not be recycling your bread products!  Really???  One of the least expensive things, and they couldn't toss the incredibly stale leftovers from the day before?  I got a bagel and it was a definite leftover from the day before.  I thought maybe I had just picked a bad one, I went back and checked all flavors with the tongs, and a sampling of all bagels in each basket thinking maybe they put the fresh ones towards the back...nope.  They bagged up yesterdays, and put them back out in the morning.  The croissants were small and over cooked and nothing special....for a french themed buffet you'd think they could have had some fresh baked ones to offer.  Again the pastries and bread products are subpar. 2. The melon offerings were thin and not replenished - empty bowls sitting there. 3. Quite a few of the signs telling you what the item was that was on the buffet were wrong.  I'll assume no one took the time to change the signs from the buffet the night before?  Or maybe they have been like that for months...who knows.  I wish we had gone to Golden Corral (do they have one in Vegas) for  1/2 the price and in my opinion a lot better breakfast offerings.  I feel ripped off.

cZn5Tgucae1gsnkN4Smk9w.text: Been here a few times when I'm in Vegas. They have an average food selection. But this place does give off a cute French vibe that makes you feel like you're in Paris. I wish they had more meats to choose from though because I'm a huge meat person. The only meat that was good was the prime rib. The rest were average.

Iw3UmzP_7DIO4dmNBNyT3g.text: I liked it.
