I was here at lunch and ate mostly seafood (mussels, shrimp, Seafood Bouillabaisse) and later crab (we had a late lunch and they switch their menu to dinner at 3pm on week days) and it was all good. Also tried some grilled veggies (but grilling makes them all taste the same). The caprese salad was good. Sushi was a miss (there were 2 types and they weren't good). For dessert I enjoyed some flan and creme brulee. I was excited about the macaroons, but the 2 that i tried were too sweet. Wish I left some room for the infamous crepes, but I didn't so I just had a bite of someone else's berry crepe and it was delicious!

lKfDYVNgrt-iOcm5sNRMjg.text: This was my gf and my first stop on our Buffet of Buffets tour of 24 hour dining through Total Rewards. It is such a great deal if you have never tried it.   The champagne brunch on Sunday was just terrific as you can have unlimited champagne or mimosa's. The buffet here has a lot of variety and you can get crepes here made to order plus other cooking stations around for made to order items. The prime rib and tri-tip steak was just heavenly good, tender and moist. Yumm!!!  This is one of my favorites in term of ambience because it looks like a small village inside the buffet. Very cozy if you can get a table right in the middle of where the buffet area is at and the lighting is lower there.  The service was great as they always refilled our glass with champagne glasses over and over a few times without asking even though they were very busy.

wKtGoXAbeSzGQTHwic5Yqw.text: HOLY MOLY!!  This place is so surreal! This is my favorite buffet!  Crepes?! Unlimited?!  Pairs!  Eiffel Tower it has it all  This is a very good buffet to enjoy for breakfast! The waitress are very outgoing and friendly   The atmosphere is so phenomenal!! It's basically like your in pairs the staff are dressed up you have clouds in the ceiling, the walls have bricks they dim the lights the line wait is very well worth it

hjOARWizW2w3P0hViT9sKQ.text: The moment we walked into this buffet, it felt like we took a step into a french town square. The lighting was dimmed and there were trees all around and a sky above. There were different stations for serving up the food with different french names for each such as Le Maison or Le Creperie. They had a wide selection of food and it was all fresh. The Yukon gold mashed potatoes were so amazing. Their steak and prime rib were really good too. I was full pretty quickly which makes me partially regret the high cost of the buffet but hey its Vegas! Not only was the dinner good but the dessert bar had every pastry you could think of! I'd be back soon if there weren't so many other good places to try on the strip!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheese anyone?
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mmm yukon potatoes!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French Market Theme

hS4vmbMmDijku69pvVMriA.text: It's a pretty restaurant, like most of the buffet restaurant in Vegas, this one decorated as a French village. Selection weren't too wide and definitely not enough. My favorites were the snow crab legs and desserts. Beverages were included, great service. Must visit the crepe station! $30.99 for a not bad dinner buffet in Vegas. Come early to avoid the long line.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nBbr-f-u4Sda78PJY-emBw.text: Pricey for all you can eat buffet, as each individual was 20$. There were many different types of options, ranging from eggs, sausages, bakery items, made to order crepes, and fruit. I ordered the #2 sweet crepe, which was too filled with berries. They also scooped some whipped cream on top of the crepe, which made it perfect. Our waitress was marvelous and was very attentive to our needs.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 sweet crepe, berry crepe

ExbitL2DSvcsrawwCp3M9Q.text: This review pertains to the Le Village breakfast buffet only. Meh...Mass production and it tastes like it.  Not horrible but nothing here that I would order off a menu. Too expensive for breakfast given the lack of quality. The eggs Benedict were over poached to the point of hard boil stage.  The corned beef hash was missing corned beef and thus lacked a distinct flavor beyond the potatoes.    Not worth a special trip.  You're better off ordering something you really like and made to order at a decent breakfast place.  Last point... The "maple syrup" is not.  It's not even maple flavored.

E1AF9qjDGZ-VUy9ni1splQ.text: We came back for another family gathering. Everything was clean. We were happy that prior issues were resolved. We still enjoy the food and atmosphere. Will be coming back again.

1If6X7LKooDCaoPVMayZeg.text: Came here for breakfast and I made sure I got enough food that I paid for. They have a large arrangement of foods. I got fruit, pancakes, hashbrowns, their definition of oatmeal, turkey bacon and sausage.  Let me start off with the negative and finish with the good.  Pancakes are one of my favorite food no matter what they, I can eat it for lunch, dinner or anytime in between. These pancakes are small and I have no complaints there, easier for them to fit in my mouth. The only problem I had with them is that they kinda taste like school cafeteria pancakes, at least the first 4 did but the other 2 didn't really taste that bad. I've had better pancakes at home. Their hashbrowns had no flavor what so ever. Where the seasonings at? The potatoe triangle I got was kinda hard. The waffle wasn't that amazing, nor was I expecting it to taste so great based on the rating. They were just regular ol waffles to me. Don't get me started on the oatmeal. I usually don't put brown sugar in my oatmeal but I had to this time because let me tell, this oatmeal had no flavor whatsoever. It could be because it's all natural but even Trader Joe's Steel Cut oats have more flavor than their oatmeal. The turkey bacon, the turkey bacon spiked my blood pressure, I can feel it. It was soft and had too much salt, although some people may like their turkey bacon soft but I like it more with a crisp crunch to it, like the regular bacon they had out. I had to eat it cause I don't just waste food like that.  Now let's end with the good.  Turkey sausage was one of best things I had. Didn't taste any different from the ones at home. The fruit, I give it up to who ever picks out their fruit cause they had flavorful, sweet, juicy pieces of pineapple, cantaloupe and honeydew. You will occasionally get those non good pieces but those that were sweet were good. I can't even pick out a ripe honeydew or fruit if my life depended on it. That's the only reason I gave it 4 stars.

xStVXtNI7lFtTy5ECPvSWA.text: I love the European inspired dishes. I almost always eat here when I'm in town. The prime rib is very good quality here, so tender! Even just the mashed potatoes and gravy make me happy :). For a buffet, the quality is impressive. I haven't had a bad experience eating here. The crepe station is a bonus.

AUP1HX2Ettvm6WfcWyxxsQ.text: I went here on a groupon, I have to say BEST CREME BRULEE EVER. Often I don't like creme brulee because it has a weird burnt taste. Maybe I am just too much of a plebe to understand the joy of it. However, I LOVED it here.  The place is sort of interesting because we went on a monday and the line was ENORMOUS. We stood in line for a while and were checked in and god two bottles of wine which was pretty terrible, but it was with our meals so I couldn't complain about it too much. Also we were seated at a table, which had no utensils and it took them forever to get u the utensils.  I personally thought that the food was very good for a buffet type setting. If the food was not in the buffet medium I probably would be more harsh on it, but for what it was, it was pretty decent. The dolma were kinda aweful, but the different stews and pasta dishes were very decent especially considering the medium of buffet.   The decor wasn't anything to write home about, and I don't know if I would go back, but it is an awesome place to take your family to eat.

JXIn-TPkH61e22dzk2ZtKw.text: Really bad and comparatively the worst amongst many fine buffets in Las Vegas.  Spend $10 more and go to the Bellagio for quality.  The restaurant was dirty and even the wait staff seemed embarrassed.  Our waitress was very nice, but the food was horrible.

-OuvosuDHR8BYdso--oFew.text: This review is for the breakfast buffet. I love breakfast foods and this buffet pretty much has it all. And with a beautiful, serene environment that makes you feel like you are in a small outdoor cafe in the early evening.   There is a Crepe bar (i had strawberry/banana), an omelet station, of course, then there were the benedicts, quiches, and other egg dishes. Many different potato dishes and corned beef hash (to die for). And don't forget the sliced ham, bacon, and/or sausages. Of course there were multitudes of pastries, bagels, french toast, and the likes. And for a decent buffet price.   Bottom line: if you want a variety of breakfast items, this is the buffet for you.

485kCV_ab96lpYTBSQ4A4Q.text: Great price for great food. The truffle Mac and cheese was buy far my favorite. They have a carving station and the dessert section is amazing. The staff is helpful and the atmosphere is very relaxing.

2E4Ma4NqsJBBUKeYw2xW7Q.text: Years ago, I went to this buffet and enjoyed it quite immensely as it was one of my first Vegas buffets. Last week, I came back to this former favorite to see what had become of it. It was a little bit disappointing.  I tried to hit a little bit of all the appetizing items. The prime rib was pretty solid. The beef bourguignon, pork belly, and the bouillabaisse were probably the standouts of the whole thing. Well, except for desserts. There were some really nice options, like the creme brulee and the cheesecake. My dessert crepe (#2 I believe, with the berries) was also good, if a little big.  The big problem is that the crab legs mostly sucked, and there was such a small serving area for it compared to huge platter that they used to have. What gives? Everybody knows you go to a Vegas buffet for crab legs. Also, the lamb was pretty dry, and there just wasn't as much of a variety as there are at some of the bigger buffets.  Luckily, I was able to use the Groupon on this trip and enjoyed a couple glasses of Blue Moon. They also have red table wine and something else that didn't sound appealing to my memory banks. Not too bad if you're looking to get a little buzzed with your meal. But if you're just gonna go eat, then hit the Bacchanal, which I'm still in love with despite news of their ever-increasing prices.

YQtoGkG2nZFdMe2sBZ4jcw.text: Our server was lovely!  She was friendly and attentive.  (I didn't get her name though.)  There was plenty of food.  I was so hungry that I ate so much so fast that I didn't even have room for dessert, which is a first for me.  There should always be room for dessert.  LOL.  But I guess I enjoyed the Truffle pasta a bit too much.    The food is good.  Nothing too spectacular about it.    Plus, I can't really complain because I ate here for FREE.  (Sign up to be a Platinum Total Rewards member and (if approved) you can receive a pass for a free buffet to any of their casinos for you and a guest.)

F56MMUCF2m1gMNamEfcQNg.text: Ok, so going to Vegas, you have to do at least one buffet. However this place should not be on your bucket list.  Crab legs...yes, prime rib yes....but both were of low quality and the prime rib was super dry. And yah, it's supposed to be a French buffet so they did have some of my macarons, but they were gross and unappealing. They didn't care about the presentation at all with respect to the macarons.  The food handles were sticky and gross. There's no wet naps or purell nearby. It's like someone purposefully lathered the the food handles with syrup and pretty much played a prank on everyone. Gross, and unattended, and lack of ownership amongst the cleaners and food servers.  The waitress knows who you are too, ethnicity, etc...so when she saw a bunch of filipinos, she got into Filipino mode. I guess she really wants to provide that awesome customer service, that or she wants a fat tip at the end. Either way, she was pretty attentive.   It was a Sunday, so champagne was included. They went all out with the Wycliff Jean champagne....whewwww. Mix with the oj and you get the mimosa. Not bad, they even allowed us to keep the bottle to walk aimlessly throughout the casino and along the vegas strip.  For $30, I would probably invest a little more somewhere else next time. This was more of a cafeteria leftovers like food with mediocre quality instead of the higher more quality food that can be found elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nPnU0aE-n3ohSOubbnHOsA.text: The food here is great while the decoration was kind of a disappointment to me. I prefer a buffet dining environment with more light. It doesn't have nearly as big of a food selection as Bacchanal, but it allowed me to taste almost everything they have. One thing you absolutely need to try here is their crepe. I had #6 crepe that had ham and cheese in it and it was super tasty! Other items I really liked were their crab leg and creme brulee.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and cheese crepe

YIDWSu990YzoLWXb3OsSlw.text: nice atmosphere! feels like you're dining outdoors in paris.  the food here is okay. nothing special, but its not bad either. hit the crab legs and prime rib to get the most bang for your buck and end the meal with a fresh made dessert crepe. (strawberry, banana, nutella and cream to be exact) :)  the line gets pretty lengthy around dinner time, so come a pinch earlier (5-5:45pm) and you'll be good during off season.

4PSOulUc_8nYnVGWUh7bLA.text: Must try. The creme brulee. Fantabulous. Very creamy and flavorful.   I'm spoiled by some great buffets... And I'd have to say this place is better than the average buffet, but truly doesn't have any unforgettable moments. Yes, it has a crepe station. But it's only average at best. Options are very simple. Choose your fruit. Choose your sauce. Second time I went, they had run out/didn't put out the nutella. Boooooo.  But it's great for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Le Village doesn't go out of their way to impress you by something impressive or new-  you're sure to find familiar foods here.   For sure, nothing bad. You'll get full. But not something I'd go out of my way for.

KQapSbljph3-X3gMucBUug.text: During our stay in Las Vegas we went to try this buffet in Paris hotel. We came for a brunch and I found it a little expensive. The food was great but the service wasn't very good.  I was also a little disappointed that they didn't have any fish option! The place is beautiful in the inside. It looks like a small village in Paris, the servers are dressed as villagers. For breakfast I had scramble eggs, home style potatoes and they were really  good. I also had a banana crepe they made. It was delicious!!! That was actually my favorite part. Then I went and had some steaks, pork and mash potatoes. Everything was good buy like I said I was a little disappointed they didn't have fish!! They had crab legs that were cut in half so it made them easier to eat. I didn't like the service because the lady barely showed up to our table. The plate piled up and I ran out of water. I Couldn't leave without trying the dessert section in that section they also make the omelets ( I found out too late :'( ) The dessert section had macaroons, and a bunch of cakes, croissants, ice cream. It was amazing!! Hopefully for my next experience I will get better service but I would definetely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!!!

lrf3w2DywVI7KFOoLZ38Yg.text: This is my first time to Las Vegas, and quite honestly, probably my last. I'm not a gambler but I did find some things to enjoy. This buffet had a few negative reviews, mostly centered around peoples' expectations or their service. Well, I figured out the secret - if you have a large group, reserve ahead of time on Open Table (at least a day or so).  I came solo on a business trip, had no wait, and fantastic service. I overheard the waitstaff talking and the area I was seated in is referred to as VIP - reason being, I tipped and was polite.   Food wise, there are some fantastic options. My favorites were the truffle oil Mac and cheese, the fresh roast beef, stuffed lamb, and the sauteed mushrooms. They have crab legs, but they are cold and I didn't see a means to warm them on the buffet itself. There is a $12.99 all you can drink special (that's alcohol, folks) - so if that's your thing it's absolutely worth it.   I enjoyed my time at La Village and would definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The view from my seat. Each station is a different &#34;city.&#34;

jJ4rkC_z0HB3Aty9sf13-Q.text: Waited in a long line only to be seated in a dirty feeling little room that smelled like old fish. Left without eating.

tHclWtpYbWUIAbLdz_tp2Q.text: This buffet reminds me of the Bellagio Buffet as far as selection goes. It's a solid step below Wicked Spoon, but still leagues better than Luxor. But I also feel that there are plenty of off Strip buffets that are better than this one (such as The M and Red Rock).   Some things didn't seem to be quite as fresh as they should be (the tri-tip and the duck), but others were fine. My husband particularly enjoyed the prime rib and said it was actually some of the best he's ever had. He also enjoyed the mac n cheese. My favorites were the andouille sausage and the potatoes gratin.   Now their dessert spread I thought was a little better (except for the Macarons, which were VERY dry). They had chewy brownies, warm sauces to top your crepe or bread pudding and the creme Brulee was decent.   The service was actually pretty great! I've come to have low expectations, but these servers were on top of it!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu - mmmmm!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Mac N Cheese
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Creme Brûlée - pretty darn yummy!

LuHTxFZN27SXA4mMI3fXkQ.text: This was our last stop on our Buffet of Buffets. I can easily say I would not come back here if it were not for their crepes and prime rib. The service was nonexistent. Our waitress pretty much forgot about us. She did not bring us the right drinks, nor did she even get us refills. She brought water.   The crepes are the best I've ever had. Made right in front of you however you want it. The chef made my girlfriend a special one with the whipped cream on the inside and refused to make it like that for anyone else who asked. Thought that was funny. The prime rib was also amazing. It was perfectly medium rare, not raw like at Bacchanal, and seasoned to perfection.   I always enjoy restaurants that go above and beyond with their theme and I have to say that Paris does a great job at this. Not having been to Paris, I can safely say that this is the closest to the real thing. It feels like you can just forget about real life and pretend for a while. Very nice decor and atmosphere at this buffet (and casino in general).   The service is not great, but everything else is.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Two cents?! (When you use Buffet of Buffets, they give you this fun receipt.)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. That&#39;s a lovely cheese platter.

XTZZzdCWf2FBevGxLa4DHQ.text: This used to be  my favorite buffet in Las Vegas, but it is  not anymore, and it is not because of the service, but because of very limited variety of dishes and not fresh meals they serve.

bFkw-vba5akMgob7xXvVSw.text: ALL YOU CAN EAT CRAB!!! How can something that sounds so nice, be horrendous? The Paris Buffet was recommended by so many, however, I dont know why? Walking into this buffet was exciting and so was seeing the crab. Taking the crab back to the table, not so much. The crab was ice cold, yes ice cold and so was every other dish. Apparently, to have warm food you need to be a VIP. In other words, Total Rewards Diamond status. 15 trips to vegas from now, I have the possibility of being allowed warm food. HOW EXCITING.   Furthing the buffet, total cost averaged $33.00 per person. Not terrible. Crepe's were available for dessert, again not terrible, therefore, I would have awarded the buffet at two stars. However, the entire staff was rude and because of so, one star.   Cool food + Bad service = Never returning (unless I'm craving cold entrees, LOL)

VIiIOW-131jpRPfETqC7kA.text: It has been years since I have been here for Sunday brunch. The last time I can was before I knew I had celiac disease. I had such found memories of leisurely eating brunch with my father and brother when we were here to celebrate my Dad's 65th.  My brother lives overseas so it is even more special when the 3 of us can get together. The brunch was still fabulous. They still serve unlimited mimosas which is always wonderful. I did find out the I could make a GF version of eggs Benedict since hollandaise sauce is house made without gluten as it should be  the service was MUCH better today then last night.  laVillage does have a fairly good list for people with food allergies, but it is not publicly known and you have to ask your hostess for one. It doesn't not have everything one the menu so you may still need to ask.  The one thing I was very disappointed with is that the macaroons have gluten . This is the one sweet thing I totally enjoyed while I was in Paris last year.   they will change that soon. Otherwise if you have a sweet tooth and need GF, your only options are bananas foster or Creme brulee (when available)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Y-FycAIv2qv64uYpaELSog.text: Le Village Buffet! WHAT HAPPENED TO YOU? :(  Take the negative reviews seriously and AVOID spending the money and time in line. It's a shame to see this place become subpar. It was one of the best buffets on the Strip and worth the price.   Unfortunately, the current selections and quality has gone way downhill..... crab legs were flavorless and we actually saw them being taken out of a plastic bag and dumped in the tray during our visit (Another Yelper described them as being "still FROZEN"!).   The crepes took forever to be made by a guy who could be The Soup Nazi's brother (seriously) and we were the only ones in line....which should have been our first clue...there's usually a very long line. Don't get the chicken & mushroom crepe unless you like crumbled up chicken pieces and large fingery mushrooms.... (no sauce or cheese, making it DRY ingredients inside of a crepe shell....NO).   Pastry Chef: Your Worker Bee is putting the Macaron filling on the WRONG side. Just sayin'.....  Two of the most iconic French cuisine items that should have been on point, well.... were NOT.  "The Fish Stinks From the Head"..... aka Management FAIL.   Au Revoir, Le Village Buffet. :'-(

ASJo1jfAqBgGSDU9WLgWeA.text: We came to this buffet while staying at the Hotel on a recent trip to Vegas. We arrived for breakfast, and eith the reviews I wasn't sure what to expect. That being said, I didn't want to set my expectations too high.  And I was pleasantly surprised. Maybe lunch and dinner is different than breakfast, but I was super impressed with the selection of food. Lots of breakfast meats. Crepe station, omelette station, pastries, waffles with strawberry sauce, fruits, yogurt, oatmeal, cereal, quiches - the list probably goes on! I would recommend eating here and the prices are decent.  People were commenting on the staff being rude. I didn't come across one rude person, in fact,  they were all super sweet, friendly and helpful. The omelette guy was amazing and entertaining. Our waitress always had our drinks filled and someone else was removing plates from our table as we finished with them.  We did make a reservation which wasn't needed at the time we went. But regardless, I'd make a reservation. We tried for dinner one night and the wait was an hour and a half.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few selections from the buffet. Everything was great.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ambiance
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I got a strawberry banana crepe.

GT6OwL76cXcCO9o-3VXhwA.text: Went for breakfast and dinner. We got the buffet of buffet passes so for dinner we just checked out to see what there was and if there was anything that looked good after one lap around the buffet we just left. We went back for breakfast and it was much better looking and decided to stay and I'm so glad we did. The waffles were great and the omelette station was amazing! Everything was fresh and warm still definitely would go back for breakfast!

WdFW6Waq5zURpvDESPjRzQ.text: I was excited to take my daughter to a Vegas buffet, and we decided to give Le Village a try.  We liked the setting and decor, but the food was mediocre at best.  We felt like it was a waste of money.  With so many great restaurants and buffets to choose from in Vegas, we definitely will not be coming back.

Uyo4seFDNt_6ubZszE_6Bw.text: Delicious breakfast buffet. The crepe station and quiches were my favorite. The staff is very courteous, attentive, and professional. Our waitress Krystina was amazing at making sure we had everything we needed.

NrabUYaxJjXGEGmb3ryokg.text: I have no comment at all after what I saw today. The guy who serve in the dessert booth consistently yelled at the kids when the kids requested some help from him. I also witness that the same guy who wear the gloves, wash the table cleaning towel, wiped the dessert counter, which is good.  However, he used his hand with the same gloves, picked up the macaron one by one and moved them to the serving tray to serve the customers. In addition, I oVer heard another worker told an customer that "I don't have a spoon, go ask your server, don't ask me". I don't know if I'm too picky or not, you make the call.....The only thing I can tell you is, for sure the kids don't like that place if they were treated badly.

UX9Ftj7FRZ5_SiGrqzbLyQ.text: This buffet is just OK, and rather expensive.  We spent about $80 for rather dry meats and just so-so seafood and desserts.  The service was pretty good, but I cannot really recommend this buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Part of Desserts
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Various Clam Dishes
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seafood Dishes

CnVOsvGn9QjpfdscY_pMGg.text: Go for the ambiance. Good selection. Lots of veggie dishes. Not huge but I found plenty to eat. Get the buffet of buffets package and eat up. Definitely stop here.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YELYMYxFbU59dSw7qw7XiQ.text: Food was okay but there were a few that stood out to me. The made to order crepes was the best. You can choose sweet or savory. I ordered the banana and nutella. It was the best dessert. The whip cream is homemade and great. I added ice cream to mine and it was sooo good!!  Another favorite of mine was the Yukon mash potato. It was buttery and creamy.  The prime rib was great too, depending on the cook. The first half of our dining experience had a great chef that made the prime rib, juicy and tender. When I went for thirds, it was a new chef and a new slab of meat and it wasn't as good as the first.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana &amp; Nutella Crepe with ice cream
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Making out crepes

LBJsAlM5AR_Xa4DU240Now.text: Came here for breakfast on a Wednesday morning, no line.  Staff was courteous and sat us right away.  Food presentation, quality and taste were on par for a typical buffet.  I had a custom omelette, croissant and a Nutella crepe.  The crepe was the best out of the 3.  Coffee was just okay, on the strong side.  OJ was good.  Out of convenience of staying on property, this buffet fit the bill.  If searching for a higher caliber buffet, you may want to seek out other ones.

MrETmkMQsEyh7BO-nYmwAg.text: We went for breakfast as it had decent reviews on several sites (I should have checked here first) - the decor is very tired and the food is not the best. Definitely doesn't have the same food turnover as some of the more expensive buffets. A lot of the food is warm at best and dried out. Coffee was not great and I didn't know there were so many ways to cook potatoes so poorly. Ultimately I would rather pay for a nicer buffet and have a better experience.

5ctmFXD5aT4xeI2X09C5nw.text: Where to begin?!?  Horrible food, minimal selection and dirty!    DON'T waste your money here.    The food is just low quality to begin with and bad execution of dishes.  Duck was dry, prime rib had a different texture to it, crab legs were thinking, just horrible.  I filled up on bread and butter.  The dessert area had fruit flys on the macaroons and the station was filthy with dirty, oily ceiling and frames.  With that said, I didn't dare try any desserts.  I'm sure the ice cream/yogurt machine was fine.    How do I add the video of the fruit flies?

nz76bV1o1x5Mq1IAhh7aqw.text: First impression was already off to a bad start with the incredibly rude cashier, Evelyn. If she refuses to move one step to her left from her spot behind her register to grab the card of the person she is doing the transaction with in an incredibly crowded line, maybe she should wait until I'm closer to the register before initiating the transaction, rather than have me push and reach over the group in front of me to hand her my card.  Was not impressed with the food or selection.  Wasn't terrible, but it also wasn't what I'd expect from a Vegas buffet that charges $30 for brunch.  Also, the fly on top of a croissant that flew away as I picked up the tongs wasn't very appetizing.   Our server was terrible. We got drinks and were not offered refills until we were already done with our meals. Our plates for a party of 5 sat stacked on our table for at least 15 minutes before we decided to bus our own table and take them to a busboy who just stood next to the dirty plate cart, avoiding eye contact with us as we tried to get his attention.   Overall, not a good experience. We will not be back, and I would not recommend this buffet if you plan to visit Vegas. There is no shortage of other great restaurants with quality food and service that you should search for on Yelp before making a decision on where to spend your hard-earned money to dine.

FXaY9-PEVv9dw8Itx81lDg.text: Buffets have never been my cup of tea. I think that the price that the buffet has is way too steep for average food. This buffet has a variety of foods. They have a salad bar, variety of meats, some vegetables, and crepes. They don't have too many vegan or vegetarian options. I would be nice if they had some healthier and fresher alternatives.  I would say that the best part of this place would be the crepes. They are made fresh by the chef. They have so many different options. It's really so hard to chose just one.  What would make this buffet better would be having fresher options and having more options. Perhaps, having more French food would be cool. I don't dislike eating there, it just isn't my first choice.

nQ7pWYQh3E8qfEoef5jmWw.text: Nice ambiance. Mediocre food selection. Expensive. Kind of like an overpriced Hometown Buffet with a nicer view.

bLnB5D-KJlcDCohh-BWJYA.text: All you can eat for less than $30. Good food and free champagne before 3pm on weekends if you want.  Everything from sushi, pasta, to steaks.  Good service too.

36Qe99PseY7y__k51ueBGA.text: My boyfriend and I went here for breakfast after purchasing the 24-hour buffet pass.  Pro's: 1. unlimited mimosa's, =) -- Sunday's only I believe 2. Crepe's are to die for - had both a sweet and a savory one 3. delicious breakfast food and TONS of options! 4. fun and silly atmosphere - kind of like Disneyland.... (but so is the hotel itself I guess)  Con's; 1. Not all food is breakfast food - lots of 'dinner' type options 2. I have never seen the line NOT be long, and the wait takes awhile

mh0AH7vsqpklSOhK78XeYA.text: I didn't enjoy the experience of going to Le Village, and I wouldn't go again.   The Wait: The line took 43 minutes and at peak dinner time. Caesars Bacchanal took us 25 minutes at peak time.   The Price: $33 with tax per person at dinner time. They did have a $13 with tax option for unlimited wine or beer, but we didn't go for that.   The Seating: They seated us in a small room where you couldn't enjoy much of the Parisian atmosphere that was the main reason we wanted to try Le Village. I asked the waiter if we could move to one of the small empty tables and he actually started laughing. It was very unprofessional.   So I asked a manager if we could have one of the empty tables for two rather than the one for four that we were seated at in a small room off to the side. She said no -- and that that those tables were for members of Total Rewards Platinum or whatever the higher categories are. Seriously, this is a buffet not a fancy restaurant. And there were empty tables everywhere and we had to sit in a small room where you can't see anything. We just wanted to see the Parisian themes and the buffet itself. Denied.   The Seafood: They had crab legs but they were very salty. They were not as good as at Caesars, Bellagio, or Aria buffet. All those three others had raw oysters, and Le VIllage didn't. The shrimp at Le Village were very small and not worth the time. They did have good cooked mussels.   The Meats: OK.    The Service: WORST of the ones I mentioned above. The don't seem to care as much about giving good service. Even asked to have a manager call me so I could make some suggestions and never heard back. That says a lot.

O-ruTMB3jFSL36f_JBJLRg.text: We had brunch, the prime rib was amazing, macarons were crushed or broken, the crepe station was ok. There was definitely not enough choices. The sushi area was so sad. 2 choices of rice wrapped in seaweed. I don't even know why they tried with the sushi.

7HrN0v_RskFKQn5VzR8r5A.text: Best breakfast buffet in Vegas! Love, love, love the crepes station. Grab the one with banana & Nutella... You won't be disappointed!!

0BTO-8_3VeUy7rcPpiOu_g.text: After eating at 3 buffet stype restaurants,  Le Village gets the lowest rating of all. Customer Service is horrible. People were left to stand in line for 25-42 minutes, with any saying sorry or explanation. Then when I walked in the we're at least 20 tables un-use. Waiting staff walked around like Zombie without asking everyone if there were ok or needed help.

MA7l5lE8BzqIpG4AHQPe_A.text: The monkey crepe was worth the wait. Light fluffy batter made a great start to the meal.

PwusNoCe2khHPwXrC3YfIw.text: Haven't had a dish here I didn't like. All-you-can-eat crepes, great duck and prime rib, huge selection. Will be back next time!

jTIFpwOeYA0-upst8n5yWw.text: I've ate here 3 times. Once in 2011 and twice March 2013. I liked it.   Food I thought was great/delicious: prime rib and mashed potatoes! Mini square cheesecakes with a raspberry sauce. Mimosas!  Food I thought was just "good": This last time I tried the omelet station, it was good, but not great. Same with the potatoes and biscuits and gravy.  Service: 2 of 3 were good waitresses, one was just grouchy. But the other two more than made up for it.  Value: It's a tad expensive, but we tried another buffet about the same price (on the strip) and Le Village was definitely tastier and better quality.

MxloxQQbiYgF5Yob732uDQ.text: Just ate here last night. I'm so disappointed in the trajectory of the quality of this buffet. I remember when most of the food stations had a chef cooking fresh dishes right there in front of you. The dessert area has also suffered a reduction of uniqueness and selection.

wfglyH6Uku7M1CnA-jfjsQ.text: Disappointed....  Nice environment nice location. But the food is just not that good. Don't have many varieties and it just taste average. Not worth the price at all.

HXrVwfmU-5FwKF_7pKfbVw.text: Now Le Village is probably the best thing with regards to the Paris Hotel (cramped quarters and decent pool, but this is where the place shines, at least in my opinion).  If I had to place a my current favorites would have to be... Bellagio being the better one over Paris. But going back on topic, the highlights of this buffet were the following and will be updated once pics are uploaded and such:  *-Indicates my personal favorites...  Drinks: Waters all around w/ my Glass of Sprite  First Round: -Prime Rib (red and succulent, a bit tough to chew) -Short Rib (perfectly cooked, came off the bone quite nicely)* -Pesto Pasta (consistent with what I've had in the past) -Truffle Mash Potatoes (barely got the taste of truffle, maybe it wasn't accented) -Roasted Duck (too much oil and lacked any protein to consume)  Second Round: -Duck Confit (much better in seasoning, not as oily, full of skin)* -Greens w/ Balsamic Vinaigrette (lettuce and dressing, nothing more) -Ravioli (Cannot recall the type of cheese, it escapes me, but filling) -Mac and Cheese (I can make better, it was shaved with a lot of Parmesan and something else)  Third Round (Dessert): -Peanut Butter Cookie (second favorite dessert, moist and gooey) -Creme Brulee (yeah it's that good; not pictured I consumed four more; perfectly caramelized crunch on top, the creamy core is magnificent)****** -Whipped Lemon Tart (I'm not a big fan of lemon meringue, it's tart and moist for the most part) -Raspberry Cheesecake (again moist, with a good balance of tart raspberry would have preferred it to be Strawberry)  Total cost of Buffet came out to about $22.00 with tip. Good times, I ordered about two other plates for which I did not have pictures of. But all I remember was being a fatty and consuming more Creme Brulees, Duck Confit, Short Rib, and Salad. 3.5 is my rating for now.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round Three (Dessert)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round two.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Round one.

lyx12ms_y8XBOiOmb0hUsg.text: I love that they offer Middle Eastern Food! The lamb was yummy! Not to mention the endless mimosa's was a plus!

JyBLXMAzhatpcQGz5nSCgQ.text: This was okay, not quite as big or as wide a selection as some of the other ones, at least for lunch. A few very good dishes, like wine poached pears and the French onion soup.   Probably should have tried the desserts, people were saying good things about the creme brulee and the crepes looked very good but were huge and we were doing the 24 hour buffet of buffets and didn't want to stuff ourselves.  Sorry to be picky, but the reason I knocked it down to only two stars was because everything was incredibly poorly labeled. Or unlabeled. Or had labels still lying around from breakfast that were clearly wrong. It was just frustrating and wasteful to end up with some stuff you didn't know what it was or like.

05pVtZ47dWMByaCTNdmjkg.text: EXCEPTIONAL BREAKFAST. Really really good. Tons of pastries, 'Merican food, fancy food, crepes, stuff... all very yummy and fresh. Bigger than many of the other casinos' buffets and prettier.  We got the 5-buffets-for-24-hours deal, and managed to hit this one up for breakfast twice ;D go first 2 hrs or something after they open, then come back the next day right when they open. Of all the buffets we tried via this dealio (although Caesars was CLOSED FOR REMODELING grrrrr), this was my favorite.  The Paris hotel has gotten a lot of things right - the atmosphere is awesome, the Sugar Factory is kickarse, and Le Village is tres bon. Ou est la bibliotheque? Je ne sais pas, mais je suis un saucisse! :D

LFpq94eNk3l_O9ugIsRNRA.text: I won't visit here ever again.  The server tried to sit us in a room which was dark and somewhat humid. It reminded me a room where the servatns and maids are eating in ancient time. When I asked to sit some other place, I could see the displeasure of the lady who led us to there. After waiting more than 10 minutes, we were guided to a table right next to a pillar. Obviously not very pleasant place to sit. They shouldn't have any table placed in such location.  Foods there are generally good looking and has a good variety, but I am not sure how long they've been there. Many seafood dishes are over-cooked because they have been in the warmers too long (I know what I am trying to say). The waiter was not very friendly, nor very attentive. One time we had 4 empty dishes along with 3 dishes we are working on. Everytime I needed something, I had to look around and find the waiter for few minutes.  The only nice thing about this buffet is the ambience is French street. If oyu have to feel that without spending time and money to travel France, this is the place to be. Otherwise, I recommend you not to visit this place.

0gkkJRt6V3VMQKQxKUyr_A.text: Wow so terrible! What happened to to place!!?!?!?! Went for the dinner and everything was so bland or too salty! Also every meat in there was overcooked and dry!  all the variety seems like they were just repeating but just a little different flavors was added. nothing special here. dont waste your time. go to the spice market in planet hollywood since its next to Paris thats if you are around there and dont want to go any further down.

dY3aMlOf_cAViAR1Mr8q4Q.text: LOVED this buffet. We got access through the $59 for 24 hour access deal and ate here twice, one dinner and one breakfast. They had a line for fresh made crapes, as well as all the usual buffet staples. There was plenty to sample with every empty plate, that looked delicious (and mostly was).  One thing I will say is they do not staff wisely there. I tend to eat late, so 4:00 (which was my lunch) was a perfect time to just walk in. But just a half hour later the line spans down the block of Paris. All of this while the restaurant is half empty, they should really get more staff.  So of the buffet of buffet deals, this was by far the best of the four restaurants I tried.

z62hFzyWmk991FmF62M9Wg.text: Ate breakfast here on my last day in Vegas, and I have to say I didn't really love the place. It had similar quality food to the MGM Grand buffet that we had eaten breakfast at the day before, but less selection. They have a crepe station thingy here, but I didn't think those were all that great, so what is the damn point.   Really, I would only be giving it two stars, except for one thing: You can pay an extra $10 per person and get right to the front of the line! Yessir, capitalism at its finest, and I was more then happy to pony up the extra dough at noon on a Sunday when every breakfast buffet in town had an hour wait to get it.   So, if you're a stepper, and you're starving, and all the buffets in town are packed, this is a good place. If you're a mooch, and the line is long, keep walking.

2UQYKgVdboUvOEt8Qy9eKQ.text: This was a decent buffet on the strip. They offered a lot of variety at each station with good quality food. The dessert bar was my favorite- the creme brulee and macaroons were the highlight. However, the wait to get in was a bit long. We stood in line for 30 min waiting for a table for 4 to open up at 3 pm on a Tuesday.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts :)

PJQxdP9H3RXJY8Cj0gxk_Q.text: Oh what a shame. The quality of this buffet has gone down so much it's almost as bad as the writing in my original review.   When we arrived on Memorial Day weekend for Champagne brunch, we found no line. The cashier told us the buffet would be self serve, which didn't click initially to me (aren't all buffets 'self serve'?). As our host escorted us to our seats, she reiterated that our experience would be self serve, including non-alcoholic and alcoholic drinks. They had recently added a section of fountain drinks and the bar was available for ordering unlimited mimosas.   The sad part about this change is that it degrades Le Village Buffet into Souplantation or Hometown Buffet status. The service is essentially nonexistent and with that came tables upon tables that were un-bussed.   The saving grace? The prime rib and the crepe station. These are probably the only items worth eating in the entire buffet. The crab legs here were horrible, thin, icy, and bland. Most other dishes were forgettable.   The other reason you might consider coming here? It's a lot cheaper than a lot of the other high end buffets that have taken over the strip like Bacchanal and Wicked Spoon. The price point being around $40/person makes it a much more affordable option.   Pro tip: If you're looking for the omelette station, it's in the middle of the dessert bar.

RR0ZCurA7tFi7Pwev-0jKw.text: No good for 30.99  Just the beverage dispenser alone was horrible. One good dish they had was the french toast.

wRv32lr2i2EAdZo26RHTeA.text: In the morning lights of Paris we again find the buffet. They make some tasty omelettes as they heat up whatever u decide to toss inside the omelette. On the other hand, the crepes are made fresh but there's no place to warm up the savory omelette ingredients such as the ham, spinach and artichokes. There's plenty of breads, pastries, and flatbread if you need to load up on some carbs. Their flatbread is tasty and has been one of my favorites for years.   The buffet for the most part has become a bit tired and offers the same thing over and over. Last night the steamer was not working so it was just cold crab legs.   The french onion soup they serve for lunch and dinner has always been delicious. If you like onions you will love this soup, as it's loaded with onions. Overall, the food is very average. You have to go super high end like the Bacchanal, Wynn's and The Bellagio for fantastic buffets.

PzShC_k4hR7t_rEKpekpPQ.text: This is actually my first review ever for a buffet. I never go to buffets because I just can't comprehend how people stuff themselves to the point of stomach achiness and exhaustion, lol. Btw...yeah I can't handle Golden Corral either....hehehe.  But here I was....visiting Las Vegas for the weekend with a couple of friends. And my one buddy who had eaten here in the past, swore by this place.  Since we were all compromising on our group decisions for what to see and do....off we went...over to Le Village Buffet for a rip your face off, all you can eat buffet!  We visited on a random Saturday evening around 7pm over the summer time and the line to be seated was pretty long...extended out the door! We waited roughly 30 minutes before making it to the front.   Along the way, while standing in line, you pay for the buffet. Since I wasn't used to eating at buffets, it was a pretty large shock to my system when the hostess mentioned it was $35!!!  Wow, I was thinking maybe Paris Hotel is pretty upscale and that's how they charge so much??  Or I thought as well, maybe since I never visit buffets, in this day and age...that's how much buffets cost! Or maybe exclusively while vacationing in Vegas...that's how things work! Oh well...we were on vacation and it was okay to pay $35....it was just a surprise, that's all.  Finally being seated....I must give this place credit. It genuinely felt like I was sitting down in a quaint little cafe in Paris and having an authentic French meal. The atmosphere was pretty cool and certainly helped me forget $35 (which didn't include gratuity). Btw...I had heard from other guests while standing in line that you can combine buffet meals over a 24 hour period at different locations on the strip all for one reasonable price. Though....I just can't understand how after someone eats at a buffet for one meal....the very next day they can return for a whole new buffet?!?! Ugh, this whole process reminded me of being stranded on a cruise ship where you eat unlimited for 1 week and gain 15 pounds, lol. Whatever...  The buffet was good though. Instead of holding back, I dove straight in and helped myself to almost everything. Le Village's selections of entrees and side items included mostly any type of French cuisine you could think of. Some dishes that stood out included...prime rib, snow crab legs, truffle mac and cheese and mouthwatering pretzel rolls!  Incredible....for dessert you can have you own made to order crepes! I couldn't believe how I even had an ounce of appetite left for dessert. Since crepes are one of my favorite sweets...I splurged and somehow found room, lol. Yeah the crepes were delicious and fresh.  Ultimately, I pigged out at Le Village Buffet....and although I haven't returned to a buffet since this gargantuan meal back in June, it was still a pleasant and traditional way of dining the way tourists do while living it up in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My own made to order dessert crepe...best part of the entire buffet!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A plate full - every type French cuisine you could think of. I&#39;m overwhelmed just looking at this, lol
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Inside....surroundings remind you of sitting down at a quaint little French café.

KZro1KrWnxX5oHy4IlHA2w.text: When I visited this buffet in 2000 I thought how could anyone ever beat it? It still has the quantity of desserts , but the quality just isn't there, and it feels as though the layout hasn't changed at all , it just feels dated and ready for a "Paris Lights" makeover with lots of artistic elements, I will say however the Customer Service I received was Extra Super Stellar! My water cup was never empty, and my table was kept clean in a nice quick way, when I come to review the buffet I make it a point to try a little bit of everything , tonight was difficult because the food quality just was not there. The food tastes like it comes from Sysco, and then is "remastered" in the kitchen .. my poor Macroons they were crunchy , The desserts looked really good but didn't taste exceptionally how I had hoped it's all good though,  I'll come back again sometime later this year and try it out one more time.  Please Consider a Fabulous Caesars Sized Makeover.

GmS7_2w-gb5LFciTzwojJg.text: It's the CRAB on a weekday that brought me inn and they were yummy other than that place is average I remember like five years ago eating here and was much better buffet it's like $70 for 2 people and parking is like between 12-15 dollars at casino hotel!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet seating area
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab

0Q6hRwV5U6fg8MLldC2K3g.text: Le Village Buffet is located in the Paris Las Vegas hotel on the same floor as the casino which is ground level. Overall the experience was quite mediocre for my first time ever being at this location. I use to always see the long lines for this buffet but when I came recently it was dead empty. Didn't have to wait for even a single person. Inside had some people but for sure it wasn't at all busy.   I would say the food here was a tad bit better than the Mandalay Buffet but still it was just alright. The coffee that was in the mug was quite cold and we had to re order it for the table.   The variety of food is pretty good, I did enjoy the salad bar. I'm more of a salad fan for sure and I'm glad they did have a lot of different options to choose from.   Dessert was plentiful with donuts, pies and crepes. Whatever you fancied you probably could find it here.   Still I felt like it was missing something I just wasn't super satisfied with this choice of buffet. It's average but not spectacular.

AsB5HVrNHnLDWsTxHbATVQ.text: Just $30 per person then you could get unlimited Champagne. What else could you say ? Ins: glikeg2018

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NQmfOTIsZLtsSl_52dBcnQ.text: Did the 24 hr $49.99 pass. Plan to eat lunch 11:40am today, then dinner, breakfast and lunch at 11:20 tomorrow. So 4 meals at fifty bucks and get to try different buffets. I don't overeat though. I couldn't imagine overeating each buffet. I also have food allergies so it's important I select the foods that make me feel good.  Reasonably priced buffet (for Vegas) with quality food selection, nice ambiance and nice staff. Really the ambiance is the best in Vegas. It's so pretty and charming like a little village for piggies.  I am watching a girl now put hot fudge in the bottom of the cone before she fills with custard ice cream. Hilarious I wonder how long she dreamed up this magic. But really if you want to eat lite and not pig out, then only select a few of the top choices. I made one plate with prime rib, grilled veggies, greens, and green beans then added capers on top. Totally delicious then had a little melon and few cooked prunes with tiny bit of ice cream. Delish and the iced tea tastes great too.

VJ4l2Y7laQ5aZbfpARMj1Q.text: We got there at 8pm for dinner. The options were limited,no fresh vegetables, some of the potatoes wasn't cooked enough, not eatable at all. The service at the bar was really poor, needed to wait for the bartender to show up because the guy who replaced him wasn't professional and couldn't do more then to refuel your beer. The crab legs were tasteless and not fresh. Definitely wouldn't recommend this buffet. Pretty sure you can find better place to eat for 90$ for 2 people.

S2EBnzFzVeg9hHG1Zk2mlQ.text: Unsalted food. Over priced for what they have to serve. Rude guy who seats you at your tables. No variety of food. "Chefs"  look and sounded inexperienced from some comments made during my search for something good to eat.  First thing i ate were desserts because I did not find any food that looked fresh and while finally picking my desserts found a nasty apple sitting for who knows how many day next to the desserts.  Would be great to test the icecream and see how many bacterias are in it, im positive they dont wash daily the icecream match

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moldy fruit. Unsanitary food sold more than what it&#39;s worth.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QOH2ZMCIS-SUGHapvLhJ4A.text: Great buffet! We were up early on a Saturday due to jet lag, so we had the place to ourselves pretty much. Tons of options, I'm gluten and dairy free but I was still able to find enough food to leave super full.

ULovaF4ldmvZ3f0Twk_luw.text: My review is solely for the breakfast buffet. Do not come here for lunch. Do not come here for dinner. This buffet excels at breakfast, though, and that's where its talents shine. The nutella crepes for breakfast were AMAZING and my only regret is that I couldn't finish more than one. I also enjoyed their selection of other breakfast items, such as eggs, potatoes and different kinds of sausages. I also didn't mind the self-serve drinks concept because it made it a lot easier to keep my glass filled with what I wanted.   Oh, and if you come here during breakfast, right on the edge of brunch time, they start putting out mimosas that taste divine. So, yeah, come here for the crepes and the mimosas and you won't be disappointed.

mj71ST0uu6J2uzjDTwN2Xg.text: I could not finish my Las Vegas trip without experiencing the famous buffet scene in Las Vegas so we tried the Le Village Buffet for brunch. The setting was absolutely gorgeous and felt like sitting in a small french themed village at night. The total cost came out to $33.50 per person which I think is a decent price. The food was good and the unlimited champagne option is definitely attractive. The french dessert options are by far the best reason to come to this buffet. However, the savory options felt quite limiting so i had to stick to one or two dishes that I actually enjoyed. There were a lot of simple breakfast options as well (eggs, bacon, potatoes) which while good for some people seemed to lack creativity for me. The "sushi" they had was the farthest thing a sushi lover like myself would consider premium sushi. However, I would highly recommend visiting their crepe station since it was by far the highlight of my visit there!  Atmosphere: 9/10 Food quality: 7/10 Staff: 7/10 (very little interaction necessary) Price: 8/10 (not outrageous) Would I visit again?: No

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana crepe with whip cream and chocolate syrup on top!

t6AXmC-F32NtoYUAMEk2AA.text: I actually really liked this buffet. Great food, hot, and fresh! The Faroe th was fair for the price. Everything was displayed nicely and the ambiance was cool!   The reason I am giving this place 3/5 is the service was horrible! I couldn't get a refill of just water to save my life. I witnessed the waitress prefill drinks, then set them out on a table till someone asked. If you ask me that's kinda gross. I also saw the milk sitting out for almost an hour. Surprised this place has an A Rating!

QcXKWF7Sd2kLWb_Roff-aw.text: This buffet was absolutely terrible. It is NOT WORTH the money you pay. 32.00 for dinner. You would think your options would be great (Paris, great decor, etc). Nope. The food was not presented well. The only options was chicken, chicken, and dry turkey. No good sides. Just Brussels sprouts, green beans and ummm I can't even recall anything else worth eating. The desserts were awful. You would think Paris would have great desserts. Nope. Dry cakes, hard cookies. Let's talk about the salad bar. Yes what bar? It was just iceberg lettuce, field greens and croutons. The toppings were all mixed together. Looked messy. Not appetizing. I gave it two stars simply because of the decor. It's pretty cool. Too bad the food wasn't as good as the interior design. Do NOT recommend this place!

XWNbFq3kbCTeN99rO8-8mw.text: Price : I purchased an "All you can eat dinner for four with two glasses of wine or beer per person" on groupon for $115  Food : The variety is different than other buffets because this one is "french themed." The food was alright but for the price I am paying, its not worth it. The crab leg station was full of shells and hardly any crab meat. They do not offer too many options either.   Dessert (mainly my review of the macarons) : Before coming here I was excited for the AYCE macarons. Sadly, they disappointed me. The texture was stale and the taste was almost awful. They offered 4 flavors but I only liked the coffee one. Crepes were additionally offered but I did not get to try them. The other desserts were generic ones you can find at any other vegas buffet.

b3lnH8ZP-I-tUbAqqC4yvw.text: I had mixed feelings heading here this morning after reading recent reviews. I guess I thought I was pickier than most in my judgement. I thought the food was good, the selection was good, and the service was fair. All of the food was very familiar in taste. Nothing was crazy interesting but they had quite a few breakfast items that I really thought worked well. The egg selection included everything from scrambled plain, poached, scrambled with veggies in a frittata, build your own omelette, and quiches with meat or spinach. They had all the usual bread products that are on the usual menu. I loved the pecan roll baked with caramel sauce on the side and the crepes were excellent. Mixed berries were super flavorful. They are known for their French baked goods and I have to agree. Great selection and fresh baked. The meat selection had everything from Lox to turkey sausage patties and even some smoked trout. Fresh carved ham and sausage were good eventhough they were somewhat salty to me. We ate all we could and sampled most everything. The only lacking part was our server. Ate my first plate of food and still no beverage service. After my 3rd plate, the first 2 were still sitting on the table waiting to be cleared. Not really a big deal but then neither was my tip. It was not crowded at all and we never had to wait in any lines for food. Overall, I would definitely come here again for breakfast!

RKh0EfOAdv0ZsQ6purEJyw.text: Worst buffet I've been to.  Used to be the best many years ago.  The crab looks like Jenny Craig got to it.
