We used our total rewards cards to get the discount which really isn't much, but the points are great. After being seated and having our drinks ordered, the 4 of us all went our separate ways in search of our brunches. I for one, like to peruse the entire buffet before settling on items while my husband just grabs the first thing that looks good to him. Because of this, he completely missed the omelette station and didn't even know where it was (odd structure located in the middle of the floor). Another friend of ours immediately got in line for the crepes which was very smart since the line tended to back up. I decided on fresh lox and prime rib hash to start. Both were excellent! I also tried a banana nutella crepe (amazing), eggs benedict (meh), and bacon (duh). The coffee left much to be desired and I found some of the staff to be quite rude but I guess that's to be expected when you're in "Paris"? Overall not the best buffet in Vegas, nor the most creative but it got the job done and we would gladly go again.

TWEI0M_nrRYa0FKKeQYyYg.text: Who the heck told me that Paris has the BEST breakfast buffet??? I need to punch you.  Okay, man who made fresh omelettes to my liking, I liked you.  BUT THAT'S ALL!  I could eat the exact same yummy omelette every morning in a dorm cafeteria, I wouldn't exactly call the omelette at Le Village extra special.  And the rest!?  Scrambled eggs 10 ways.  Whacksauce!!!!!!!  Crepe station....meh.  And don't be fooled into thinking the pastries are just like France either....they are SO not.  That'll be $22.99 for the omelette that I liked.  Oh dear!  I would so rather eat a breakfast sandwich at Earl's.  At least I came at 7:30 and didn't have to wait in the hour line that was formed by the time I finished.  So I didn't exactly pay $22.99, I did the 24 hour buffet pass...And well,  I decided to come back here for lunch to see if it could redeem itself.  Verdict?  The prime rib was good, but the only excellent item was the creme brulee.  Overall, the wait here is way too long and the food is not good enough to make up for it.  Not the complete picture but let's just say breakfast and lunch didn't impress me enough to ever try dinner.  COLLECT  $79.97 (breakfast: 22.99, lunch 23.99, and dinner 32.99) and PASS GO. As in, go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only thing worth eating at this place: creme brulee

RlVEx3E4djIoPD5J97Il5g.text: I bought the groupon for our Vegas trip. We chose to go to the breakfast buffet. There are lots of options to choose from. They even have gluten free eggs Benedict, which was a pleasant surprise to me.  The lady at the front who brings you to your table, I think her name is Trish, was very rude.  Not to us personally, but I witnessed her become rude with other customers. She also would use her walkie talkie loudly in front of customers saying things like, "They've been here for a long time and we need that table." Just didn't seem appropriate to be having those conversations in front of a bunch of customers trying to enjoy their meal. The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because or server, Admat, was awesome. And the crepes were delicious!

qiZjrrZgeE62180DclMoew.text: Don't come here! I got angry within 10 minutes after starting the buffet, and wrote the reviews even before I left.  Crab legs: cold and extremely salty. It was like then you won't eat too much of them. Even pickles would be more tasty! Other meat or seafood: extremely salty, some have sands, some have a very strong "meat" flavor - if you know what I'm saying. Desserts: not many choices, nothing special, too sweet.   The only thing I felt okay was the smashed potato.   Oh the fake sky. It made me feel like something heavy was hanging over me, and I can't breathe smoothly.

9cfKFBW0M_4I6KSm8te9Fg.text: My first morning buffet after arriving to Las Vegas was the Le Village Buffet at Paris. I enjoy coming here because of the unique foods and french cuisine. The Brioche French Toast had so much flavor and when coupled with some blueberry topanade, it was an explosion of breakfast goodness. With many breakfast buffets, there are the traditional fixings like sausage,egg,bacon, and pancakes to subdue any nervous hunger trauma from anything with a peculiar taste. Definitely check out the crepe and omelette stations, both worthy of serving delicious wholesome dishes.

ZRg_1-pFRv-2hUfGsxmdOg.text: We wanted to visit this place about two years ago but wait time was outside common sense (1h+) so we're surprised to see no wait today. And it seems it was for the reason: mediocre food for high price tag. Selection is subpar: we ordered three crepes (all the same: spinach with chicken) and all three were thrown away- cold spinach is not something eatable, the guy who did crepes seems does not know how to do them. Meet was so-so, sushi (i know this is not sushi place but decided to try as everything else was meh) were two kinds : tuna roll and vegi roll, both tasted like shit. Deserts were strong 'C', eatable but without pleasure. Skip it, seems no line now for a reason.

r2RDpYb9DYhLwCOjdYvxzw.text: Don't waste your time and money! The food is terrible so as the service. We got here for dinner and there were not enough food options and the desserts were not fresh ...

u0q_qvmFktW27IYR43OZOg.text: Out of all the buffets we went to, this one was my favorite. We went for lunch on Thursday and stood in line for 30 minutes. They had a wider selection of salad and fresh stuff I noticed. The dessert bar was half sugar free, which was not appealing to my dad and husband, but I think it was worth noting for people who need it sugar free.   I wish we would have went back here for dinner, but we ran out of time and when we did come back a few days later, we opted out of the buffet scene.   The atmosphere here reminded me of the Blue Bayou restaurant at Disneyland, where you eat inside of the Pirates of the Caribbean ride. This buffet has the faux sky ceiling and fake building fronts and waitresses are dressed in character for old Paris.

E8mC9AJdAbbzx_bs4ftLrw.text: Food is surprisingly good for a buffet, and a lot of different things to eat. Not really French recipes, but world food. The themed rooms represent different regions of France and waiters are dressed accordingly. Service was good. Would deserve 4 stars, but THERE ARE NO French fries... That was disappointing.

Mx0wKzN7cTo9Zt6BcqaHtA.text: Don't do it! This was the third of the buffets we visited for brunch/lunch and the most expensive but by far the worst. Food was mislabeled, dry, old, and underseasoned. Even the desserts were crap with no flavor and overcooked. We were seated in the corridor of a noisy shopping center so even the ambience was missing. Horrible service never receiving refills probably because they are understaffed. All staff seemed angry. Go for Wynn or Wicked Spoon which was our favorite.

yVI7-O0N-6-ba3b63-4-Cg.text: Came here for the brunch buffet also known as the champagne buffet priced at $30.99 or about $37 with tax and gratuity. There was a good variety of food from your standard breakfast food to bratwurst to prime rib to a crepe station. The food is just mediocre about 3 stars. This buffet is not comparable to Bellagio or Wynn buffet. The snow crab legs were tasteless. However, I had to tact on an additional star for service. Our server Wendy was so sweet and attentive. We had a table of nine girls and she never failed to refill our mimosas.

d6H-Q_CVqcP-suVtLFBahQ.text: Normally I go to a to fill up on food after working out or not eating, basically looking for quantity and decent quality food.  I don't expect to have a 3 star Michelin experience a buffet or even a 1 star.  In Vegas most of the buffets are decent with the standard prime rib (which is probably "choice" and not "prime") and other favorites like crab and shrimp.    This was the first time that I've been to Le Village Buffet and will probably make it a place to go when ever I'm in Vegas.  First off, the variety is top notch with a full array of a French menu.    What really surprised me was the braised pork belly with apple and sweet potato.  It was juicy with just enough fat to really add flavor.  And by the way, exercise dieticians state that you need fat in your diet to provide energy for your work outs.    Other things to try are the macaroni in a truffle cream sauce (probably ground truffles or truffle oil), crepes (both savory and sweet) and vegetable side dishes (which I usually avoid since you need to maximize your dollar value).  They had shrimp and crab legs, which I guess can be considered French cuisine, except it was just blanched and served cold.   What was weird was the small section of sushi with a couple of trays of tekka maki and California role.  I guess they wanted to cater a little to the Japanese tourists.  But the ones I saw were eating everything but the sushi.  Now the important part...the desserts!  Creme brulee, flan, macaroons, crepes, frozen custard, bread pudding, fruit tarts and lots of cookies.  Yes, I tried them all.  I don't really like the macaroons, but I had to give them a try.  Still don't like them.  If you want to go to a Vegas buffet, go directly to Paris.  In my opinion its the best on the strip!

_cXiJHtqrRPeM4pROmZLPQ.text: The worst dinner buffet experience ever. Terrible service, no freaking food because it was towards "closing" time. Not worth your money especially during the holiday season.

6n9uE3pP3rsfIjZFWTqoJg.text: I loved this buffet! Maybe I am bias because I love crepes but the made to order crepes were amazing! Outside the buffet you can buy a crepe for $10.50, or you can go to the lunch buffet for a little more and get a crepe and other food also! It was all very yummy!

M3SKVPkCD1ioe3qv5H8jDQ.text: Loved the crape station. It is expensive though so plan on spending an easy $55 AT LEAST. Compared to the rest of the prices in Vegas you're really getting a deal if you're hungry.

cIjkc2kj0LPO2sT6KMxNrw.text: the crab legs were cut in half so it was hard to eat. macarons tasted like cardboard and were assembled bottom side up. the scenery was nice. bland food. below mediocre. not worth $35.00

LFazFqcZ0u5X3keOc4jXCQ.text: First was here six years ago and would've given a 5 star..... Two half years ago 2-3 stars. Yesterday one is generous. Looking very run down and not as big of a selection as once was. For over $70 for wife an I very overpriced & extremely underwhelmed.

bMBvRLA1UTF3wSxTBNgehw.text: Great waitstaff. Friendly place and the all-around fun atmosphere of the Paris Hotel. But not the place you should go for a buffet. Stale Shrimps and Crab legs. Go to Bellagios buffet instead or add an extra $10 to go to Bacchanal, it's the best out there.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

BRcCBQw81r0SxkCUQdizVQ.text: We've been going to the Le Village Buffet for the past 4 years, but I'm really over it at this point. Over the years they have significantly cut costs, so the food isn't the same quality as if once was. They've also changed the Crepe station one too many times. Less options to choose from, cheaper sauces used, less meat, lack of quality, etc. Meanwhile, carving station meats are mostly overdone, tough, and under seasoned. Pastas taste like they were initially frozen and made me feel nauseous after eating. I could go on, but long story short the best time to come is breakfast. Omelette station is good and most of the breakfast items are a hit. Other than that I wouldn't come back for lunch or dinner.

WCoBjcAyK2rmZzRgCRu_cg.text: My family and I came here for the dinner buffet. After waiting what seemed like forever to pay (quite literally, even the manager could not understand why the line was so backed up for so long), we were finally seated. I wish I could say that our experience got better after that but it didn't. It took about ten minutes for our waiter to show up with utensils and drinks. He seemed really discombobulated as he had forgotten his pen and paper in the back and had to attempt to memorize our drink order. Once we received our drinks, he basically disappeared forever AKA we had to bus our own dishes when the table started to overflow with plates (we eat a lot) and spent most of the meal with empty water/soda glasses even though he had come over and had promised to return with refills.   Other than the help, the food was pretty good. For the price (30 pp for dinner), it isn't really worth it. The variety is lacking, although there are plenty of the usual meat and potato type foods. I feel as if my expectations were much higher than what I actually received. Probably won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quaint aesthetic

iHZBVviHngZVagMuRO_gcw.text: As a disclaimer, this is the only buffet we visited in Vegas, so I can't offer any advice as to how this buffet may stack up to other buffets. We picked Le Village because we had seen it the day before when we were inside the Paris Hotel & Casino. Also, by the time we walked down The Strip and were near Paris, we were pretty hungry, so it was a good place to stop for lunch, given that some of the other buffets would have been a longer walk.   We went for lunch, which was $24.99/person, not including tip. I am not sure what other Vegas buffets offer, but overhearing one table over, they were surprised that this buffet did not include a glass of wine. Soda and soft drinks were included (Pepsi products). At lunchtime the buffet wasn't that crowded and we were seated at a table in the main section near the dessert area. Our waitress was friendly and did a good job of keeping up with clearing plates.   The buffet had the usual staples - shrimp, a carving station with prime rib, ham, and turkey. They also had an extensive salad bar area that also contained various types of soups and fresh fruit. One of my favorite dishes was truffle pasta. There also was roasted chicken that was quite tasty that I went back for on one of my many trips back up to the buffet after my friend recommended it.  I enjoyed the crepe station that the buffet had and got a delicious strawberry and nutella crepe. The menu also had other interesting crepe flavor combinations that looked good as well. One of my favorite desserts were the macarons and there were plenty of flavors to pick from.   Overall, we were beyond full after dining at the buffet and I thought the selection was pretty decent and the quality of the food was good.

jksygIyLbMwLITP3a2QjgA.text: Although there were many selections some of the food tasted like it was not fully cooked. The mashed potatoes and mac and cheese were the best dishes. Suprisingly their sushi rools were not bad. The fruit seemed old and the lettuce was not fresh. For the price expected more. Would not try again.

lG5uzT-7wqD_t_ZSuafBMA.text: They maybe save $1 not serving their cheap champagne for their "champagne brunch" to the table. The price factors in unlimited champagne, however it is a 20 min wait in a line if you wish to have any. Trash.

2X2VQ6ruK68TP8Fe6QgvHQ.text: We have been here several times. This time was horrible. At noon the buffet had many empty items. Employees seemed not to care. Not a smile on any faces. The food that was in supply was fine. Several items were never available while we were there. I will not return. To many options. This used to be my favorite go to buffet. No more.

SRSeFxYsPgnv9ZpCEy5DiA.text: Aside from the crepe station I dont think I have much more nice things to say. If a picture speaks a thousand word....here are half a million.  Half the items had no name plate to tell you what the item was.   There was saran wrap tied to the buffet and then to two stanchions used as a rope. The name plates around the buffet all had years for grime and food particles around them.  The ones that did have a name plate on it, the plate couldnt go in all the way due to food being stuck in the crevice.  When I told the guy at the bakery the name played were on the wrong items...ie. carrot cake on chocolate cake. He came out and just removed them and complained he doesnt have time for this  instead of just switch them. If you look at the top glass on bakery display....it looks frosted. I assure u it is not frosted glass but years of dirty....see pic. The whole place was filthy. I spoke with manager and he didnt want to walk through with me to see all the areas and just wanted to comp me a buffet.  Why would I eat here again. I am already taking a serious food borne illness chance as it it.  I gave the comp to my parents and then upped their life insurance to 5 million.  When I went to wash my hands an employee came out of the toilet and walked right out past the sink that a customer was using.  I can only pray that he washed his hands in the back kitchen but being he tied his apron, I can only pray again.  I tried to go make contact with hotel management but no luck there on a Saturday.  If this is the way they treat the most visible part of the restaurant then who knows what systemic issues are in the kitchen.  Oh our server was great.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yep...not frosted glass. Just years of neglect of never being wiped down.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice frost glass...took years to make.....nope that&#39;s dust and grime...see next pic
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Name plate wouldn&#39;t fit due to food in crevice.

-UfNsbawoPk18Nt3wzbifg.text: We very disappointed.   New rules is terrible.  I paid for 2 people 67$ and need take cofee myself.  Choises of food so pure.  Sweet goods choise pure too.  We were one year ago it was great. Now very upset. Last time here

-xzP62sOr0tL_wtUzVmS-Q.text: Gross food. Cold and greasy. Nothing labeled correctly, let alone cooked correctly. Service was horrible while paying and getting seated. The drab lighting really tries to hide how horrible and gross this food was. Couldn't even finish a plate sadly.

ZHuDSa10sjB4Nwl9_WUKxw.text: The service is awful.you have to get your own coffee and milk and Juice no table service at all. You walk through the whole  crowed restaurant with hot coffee  I guess there looking for a slip and fall or burnt lawsuits

CSNpR3NnEeVpnKRiX9rmaw.text: This was our FIRST stop in Vegas for the first time with my partner. First off we had a LONG wait in line to get inside. Then when we get in the staff was horrible. First a guy comes drops off 4 mimosas for my partner and I then leaves without asking anything else. My partner doesn't drink alcohol so we had to wave him down to get waters and ice tea. The guy brings them then we never see him again and I guess he's switched out w a woman who never stops by to ask if we are okay. All our glasses pile up and she doesn't take them. My partner FINALLY waves her down to get water and she drops it off leaving all the empty glasses and plates.   My partner finally gets fed up w having to wave her down to ask her for water and asks for a pitcher. Which she responds are you okay? Are you too hot? Or just too much fun in Vegas?  Like it took everything in me to not yell at this woman for being so insulting and telling her no we want a pitcher because your service is HORRIBLE.   The food was okay. Pretty slow to refill food. The labels on the food section didn't correlate with the food selection.   I wouldn't rerun. There's too many other selections to accept this behavior and like I said the food isn't that great.

jknXPlvsYyMggBUTAHUPsg.text: I only gave those three stars because the breakfast buffet is decent. We had breakfast and dinner here a few times. Breakfast is pretty good but dinner is God awful. They kept running out of food and the quality really wasn't that good. Horrible prime rib and roast beef. I would never eat dinner here again. I would eat breakfast only because it's convenient when staying at Paris.

d-ffeiIgQ-WZmlLQI51NUw.text: This buffet has all the good stuff a buffet has to offer. It is not a high-end buffet but it is a good quality one that has a great variety of food. I give it 5 stars because I've been there a couple of times and I was always satisfied with the food. The price is fair for dining on the strip at a buffet inside a hotel. There might be better options out there so I do suggest you take a look at it first and see if it's for you. But I can say its above all the buffets from the old side of the strip, LUXOR, EXCALIBUR, etc

-9V487tSH-nkWu4mvNhDCQ.text: Out of the 4 buffets I've tried on my 24 hour buffet of buffet pass, I enjoyed Le Village Buffet the most. Most of the other buffets were serving items very similar to each other. At Le village, you get a spin of French cuisine. Their mussels and clams were very good. They also had crab legs as well. If you want something different go here. The ambience here was very relaxed. There was dimmed lighting, and great architecture. The buffet dining area didn't look simple like the other buffets on the buffet pass. The desserts were good. I liked the flan and cheesecake. The only down side was the line for the meat cuts were very long.

b48waNWtJhlBtJSXczivKw.text: Customer service sucks. The crepe lady has so much attitude and messed up a basic order. Pretty expensive for buffet but since it's were staying here decided it's a good choice. So many other buffets but that ladies attitude was enough to go back to other buffets

RiIeYHBqgcIhM0hxtg29lg.text: Breakfast: a basic buffet, not worth the money and bad service  Thankfully we used a Groupon for this buffet so didn't pay full price and got unlimited drinks  The waitress mist have hearing problems, or just didn't care, we asked for water and she started at us for a moment so my husband and I repeated "waters" - a min later she returned with 1 water for 2 people - -Um.. okay? Coffee was on the table but no cream, and she never offered or asked to vring some. I noticed the tables around us had similar problems not getting water, cream and having to ask for things more than once. The food, again pretty basic. Lots of different types of eggs and pastrys  Crepes made to order where good although the strawberrieswere cold, my husband's strawberries were still half frozen. Overall if you're willing to spend the money go somewhere else. If you want a basic buffet don't waste you're money.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry ricotta crepe - good would have been better if strawberries weren&#39;t still cold

I7oFa2k94azqaEjO32d8OA.text: Sad sad sad  We hadn't been to this buffet for a couple of years. It used to be our favorite, but I can honestly say we won't be back again. We arrived at 2 pm on Sunday and almost every item was either gone or picked over like it was  a Venezuelan grocery store. They were in no hurry to bring out anything fresh either. The staff could have cared less too.  If you're going to spend this much money for a buffet .. go to Aria! We've never been disappointed there .

R-D_CN3NoEubNX8jphwyEg.text: This rating is for the breakfast buffet. Everything I got this morning was amazing. The omelet was perfectly cooked, the slab bacon was juicy and flavorful, and both the corned beef and chorizo hashes were fantastic. Actually one of the best corned beef hashes I've ever had. They have a huge variety of sweet options too if that's your thing.   At 25 dollars for the breakfast buffet, it seems pretty average price for the Strip, and is well worth it in my opinion.  No really, try the corned beef hash.

la-xFXkaZarEVkYCCr6BiA.text: You can pass on this place. It's really gone down in quality over the last few years.  The crab legs were cut then frozen so they are very dry, salad bar had very few extras, macarons which should be their forte disappointed, far too many people near me did not eat the roast beef, etc. So very sad as this used to be one of my highlights of Vegas.  My opinion is not alone as there used to be a line but it was only 75% full tonight.    The custard machine was great. Pairs well with the bananas foster.

A0W1gYAmCsEu5Id_ZCAGlA.text: Le Village Buffet at Paris in Las Vegas was a nice place. I intended on enjoying steak... And they had prime rib (crab legs, Japanese seafood, chicken, turkey, pork loin), however, I only eat meat cooked completely cooked through...   I was content with the cooked vegetarian sides (eggs, dinner roll, corn, brusselsprouts, mash potatoes, mushrooms, haricots, gingered carrots, purple cauliflower, hb eggs) and desserts (banana macaroon, carrot square, creme brulee, ricotta cup). I really did enjoy the dinner buffet. My waitress was upset that I was single and choose to eat meatless. She offered me mimosas, but I drank earlier at Bally's. Not to worry, I took some tea to drink later.   Excellent buffet coupled with great customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea assortment
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert plate
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French vegetable sides with eggs

av9fGYiTRZML4dQYj-Eelg.text: This used to be my favorite buffet in Vegas.. always worth the wait .. then one time I brought some family and it was very average .. so I hesitated coming back..  The wait was not terrible (15min).. we were seated in one of the little rooms set up as dining room, with several small tables   Food options are not repeated so you should walk around first so you're making good choices .. everything is labeled and all the serving trays were full..  the roast beef and savory crepe stations are a must.. plenty of protein options duck, salmon, roast beef, prime rib, crusted fish, chicken, crab legs, shrimp, sausage.. seafood paella  lots of veggie options roasted root veggies, corn, mushrooms, roasted carrots, mashed potatoes, Brussels sprouts and of course a full salad bar  Must try one of the dessert crepes being made to order .. on today's visit they had the banana Nutella crepe and berry crepe (don't forget to tip the chef!) both were amazing!!   It's a serve your own beverage kind of place, not my favorite .. the coffee cups are small so you're walking around with a mini coffee cup trying not to burn your hand and get as much of it in the cup back to your table  It's a buffet so hit and miss on some items .. bread was hard.. they bus tables only so don't expect any table service and it's busy.. the macaroons were put together inside to topside instead of inside surface to inside surface..

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berries crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Macaroons &amp; coffee

QaDRTM8vVkEWBcRKDMx25A.text: Enjoyed the buffet tonight. Not too much selection but the food offered was tasty. Lots of meat selection - prime rib, turkey, duck, sausages, chicken and more. My husband enjoyed the salmon and the crab legs even though they were tiny.   Wish the salad bar had more salads - options offered were very small.   Desserts were good. Only offered two different types of crepes - wish they had more options. The gentlemen working at the crepe station was amazing though! Very nice man  The ambience was so nice! Really feels like you're dining in a tiny village.   Will I be back? Probably with a group

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wjvkQ3Dxeih87sLXrIf4Dg.text: I'll start by saying than I'm not a fan of buffet-s in general. Reading Bourdain's books gave me more reasons to avoid them.  But while we were staying at Paris Casino, we felt like we should try Le Village Buffet since it seemed nice, with French food from various regions of the country. Sounds like fun, right?  Nothing I tasted reminded me of anything I had in France, everything seemed bland, overpriced. After a while you get tired of keep trying mediocre food hoping that the cuisine from a certain region is better executed. Not!  On top, the place was noisy with kids running around and screaming. So much for that classy atmosphere!

PYbadExdUytzO2RMgqF3_g.text: Breakfast was a great deal. We got a 15% Off coupon from the concierge at the hotel and it turned at be about $22.    Also ate at 9:30am so while we were eating the lunch selections started coming out!  Crab legs!!  Highlights included built to order omelets and crepes.    Drawbacks.  Seemed to be out of coffee all the time.

wc7iLNSPp1f5SEPljzFi3w.text: We went to this restaurant for brunch on weekend, You gonna like this restaurant if you like  European architecture ! The decorations and atmosphere was really nice!  Food was really tasty and fresh . You could make your own scrambled egg  or crepe. Price was around 40$ for weekend . Totally happy with service and food.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm buffet
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm buffet
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hash browns

cbhBlt6CSkgXhG9Ng32YkQ.text: WOW is all I can say there Is so much to talk about so much food. Kinda normal price for Vegas but it's a buffet they have seafood (crap legs) which is something we don't have in Kentucky at most other restaurants. They cooked me a huge omelette loaded and let me tell you it was great. My wife founds donuts, cakes, and pancakes. My son destroyed the bacon and smoked sausage. The best part drinks are included in the price.

aHYsiG5aMcl-PHvVOBAuUA.text: WOW  A delicious buffer without waiting (at 1 pm) for brunch?!   The staff were quick on removing the plates from our table.   Tip: Check Groupon because my bf and I got brunch for two plus four total drinks for $22 each.   Not to mention the food for brunch both Saturday and Sunday were well worth this and above.  The breads and crepes were amazing.  I unfortunately didn't have any room to taste the desserts. :(  next time !

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made my own salmon eggs Benedict
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. On letters and hash browns

UTP9LkAVneerTmoR1eDFVQ.text: It had been 10 years since last time I came here. I remember it was so good that's why I came back this time when I visited Las Vegas. But it was really disappointing. Their food is no longer good. We came during Labor Day weekend and the menu was "holiday buffet" but there are not many selections.   The customer service is terrible. The price is expensive for no reason. Their dessert is even worse than Golden Corral.

vInBNipYnmyHbaU0Ql4g5Q.text: This is a mediocre buffet. It's not terrible. It's not the best I've ever had either.   They did have a large selection for breakfast. They had donuts, pastries, omelette bar, crepe bar, 3+ different types of breakfast potatoes, fruits, scrambled eggs, breakfast meats and etc.   The guy at the omelette bar was great! I got an egg white with bacon, ham, spinach, tomatoes and cheese. Really good. Probably my favorite item.  The pastries with stale and dry. I was disappointed.   I loved the different varieties of potatoes.   I'm not sure I would come back here.

wlIykhVU6ACPBEGv47fLCg.text: Been here twice, the first time was many years ago and i can't remember if it was good or not.  So, just been there today and oh boy, the $31 lunch is not worth the money!!! Horrible food and very very few selection.  Not so many food and not so many options in the buffet.  Very dissatisfied and very disappointed.  The place is nice and very cozy, receptionists (old people) needs to smile and talk gently.  I will never go back to this buffet ever again!

dxE7juXkeZPU4Onmn5uKUA.text: IF YOUR ARE STARVING DONT ever think about going to this place BAD IDEA... WE EXPECTED A GOOD FOOD BECAUSE IT WAS FRIDAY DINNER.. it's our first time eating at this place and we're definitely NOT coming back ever again.. foods were all dry and over cooked even the PRIME RIB..TURKEY..ROAST BEEF..RICE PILAF..QUICHE DRINKS WERE WATER DOWN it taste nothing more on water (root beer,pepsi) ugghhh!!! there's not so many options to eat either and they even put the wrong foods to the wrong label smh So i went to dessert area to get some of my FAVORITE which is MACAROONS and some of the brownies i got had a piece of hair on the whipped cream Oh god it's unbelievable so i guess the only good food we've had was the SALMON wasn't bad at all.. it's not WORTH it..it's definitely NOT CLASSY & it's a WASTE of money.

ORSqPQ9v97B-j95jKWNzKw.text: Came here for this breakfast and enjoyed their freshly made sweet crepes. They have option for savory crepes as well but this morning all I wanted was sweet delicious Nutella cream filled banana crepes. Yum! They have have a variety of quiches, different styles of eggs, and delicious pastries. My all time favorites are silk their chocolate croissants.   Service was OK. Long line getting in but food was worth the wait. Enjoy!

_NvRxoIq-W8hU2H4F5Yf3g.text: I have had better. Beautiful ambience great staff and friendly. The minus would be the silly way they state all you can drink till 3pm momosa/champagne but do not inform you that most of your time if you want a drink you have to stand in a long line that takes a ridiculous amount of time to get 1 glass of champagne. Lord please there is a better system. Have wrister bands and just walk through to get drinks. Or better yet have 2 waitress walking around serving us fir drinks. What a joke

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Checking in

FJxqBzzGhWuWMnVioyXrJg.text: I was expecting too much from this place. The food selection wasn't great the coffee was weak and the crepes were mediocre. I would have skipped it if I had walked around and seen everything they had. The dessert table wasn't as restocked as it should have been maybe 50% of it was stocked. The main thing it has going for it is the tribtip and beef roast.   Este lugar me decepciono no tiene la gran seleccion de comida. Las crepas estaban mediocres. Si yo hubiera ido a ver la comida antes de pagas no lo hubiera hecho. Los postres no estaban rellenos, alomejor nadamas el 50%. Lo que si me gusto fue el tribtip y el roast beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ES9wywVjvxESbvApoVjH_w.text: Expectations too high, since this is located on the strip? Probably, but this is not an impressive place to experience a buffet.  The sushi broke apart way to easily and impossible to grab with tongs.  Steer clear as it was not a popular dish and just sitting out the whole time.   The crab legs were thin,  shelly and not worth the effort for so little reward.  The residue from the cracked shells would be on the crab meat and left an extra grainy texture. Apparently,  if you have platinum status they will heat the cold crab legs and offer it by the plateful.  I'm guessing the appeal is having French cuisine all in one place. The crepe station,  macarons,  creme brulee, all basic and just so-so. None of the cooked dishes were memorable. $30 something for dinner, but on a positive note,  the leek potato soup was comforting for a chilly restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decor

ia0NBBE12BECjaNhyJMkUg.text: We didn't get sick! So that's a plus.... but we also didn't get full. If you're not a huge seafood lover, it would be safe to say that this buffet isn't for you(and to be honest, if you are a seafood lover, I still don't know if this is the buffet for you). For $30 or so a person for lunch, we didn't have much to choose from, and what we did get on our plates, wasn't amazing by any means.   On a Thursday in February, the line was nonexistent, so that was a plus. We walked right in. Our waitress was nice enough and cleared the plates and refilled the drinks. The building was beautiful and I loved that!   Lots of pasta type dishes.   Lots of veggies.   Not a lot of meats to choose from.   My roll was great!   I'm really grasping f straws here people.   The food we ate wasn't gross, but besides the Mac and cheese, nothing from my first plate got a round two for my second plate, which isn't the norm for me at buffets.   We might go back if we got free vouchers for sitting in a timeshare presentation or something... we wouldn't pay to eat here again though.

WXTBcADFbgwWluh7HEkGDQ.text: I was told by a man I know best buffet. Unless he is nuts, not even remotely. No selection, 4 kinds of potatoes, ridiculous. I didn't even eat the salad it was so unappealing. What is the point. Not tasty at all.  Saving money?????? Nice server. but the food and appearance not doable!!!!!!

nzEpFiThOgaFJDGfX3UHjg.text: Been there for lunch last week and was very satisfied (same as in previous years when visiting Las Vegas). This may be even a distinguishing factor from some other Las Vegas buffets that seem to collect positive reviews about dinner time, and often negative ones about the lunch.   Food is very tasty, especially meat.  On the negative side, a very long waiting to get a table and not necessarily because of many people. Just a very slow service. A lady comes and takes a party to a table and explains about the stuff around the buffet, in 2-3 minutes comes back for the next party.. A man in front of me even started to openly complain about this using a colorful language, which sped up things only a little.

E_BoAhIEdGnw8S-fvLT3GA.text: Pros : Prime rib was seasoned and perfectly cooked, the selection was really diverse.  Liked the duck as well. They also have a crepes area where you can order a savory or sweet crepe or make your own. I got the mushroom and spinach, that was very good! Their dessert bar was great, with lemon tarts, chocolate shell tarts, cheesecake, and many pies and cookies. We had a group of 5 and got seated in a really quaint quiet room so that was nice. Our server also brought over a plate of crab legs which was a nice gesture.   Cons: Nothing much about this place except the lack of seafood. And the fish I ate had bones in it which I ended up swallowing since it wasn't expected.

6qZJ_pqlsHSFhkzLblxLDA.text: So disappointing.  The entrees for the most part were cold.  Variety was limited.  There was not a lot to choose from in the desert department but what we had was good.  We had been there several years ago and the buffet was much better then.  Not worth the price.

rG5icU6bU8PYBYSaB0egkA.text: Well, my prior experience was good, but I am not sure what had happened to this place.  I personally picked this place from my own experience from few years back and this time, I took a large group of my co workers on Friday night.   I should have known the quality, when I saw very small lines formed, when it is normally, should be a busy hour.  Like a previous reviewer on the YELP, the cashiers were not happy to be there.  Kind of like, " Okay, who is next"  kinda of vibe from one of them. (there are two cashiers).  Foods were just okay, but Prime Rib was so dried that it was close to a Beef Jerky level.   Most of the foods were kind of mediocre, few thing that stand out were.  Crapes and Macaroons  other than that, I am not sure I will pay $32 to have this food again.   Will I revisit this place again.  Well, Probably not anytime soon.  I would pay extra and go some other places.

2Q6QVtlo7wgIirwsF3SHvg.text: $24.99 for dinner is honestly a lot of money for me for a buffet. But it was worth it.  Roast lamb, duck, veal, crabs, everything gourmet. Yum Yum Yum! I'm deducting one star because the service was HORRIBLE!!!!!! I mean absolutely the worst service and it's a buffet. Honestly, how hard is this??  Oh freshly made crepe! I would go maybe if I had money to spare but I would want to try Wynn or Bellagio first.

2fzca1D5kdXJ0ualLZMcEQ.text: *This review is for the breakfast buffet*  This buffet is reliably good and has a cute setting. They have a lot of good options for breakfast everything from fritattas to crepes, to bagels and smoked salmon. The line went pretty fast, which made the whole thing much more enjoyable. I did stay clear of the steam table scrambled eggs which are never good, ever. Bacon, french toast, and crepes. Delish.   One of the best buffets on the strip.

7NOorzd2eF_zNrNQs_qh-Q.text: Not a place I would go back to, at least for brunch, which was about $18 per person on Friday. We arrived at 10 and had a 10 minute wait. I liked the selection and variety they had (fruits, eggs, sausages, bacon, omeletes, bagels, pastries, potatoes, biscuits, smoked salmon, yogurt, ice cream in chocolate covered cones w/ almond sprinkles etc). The handmade crepe was good, even though the fruit inside kept falling out. The pastries didn't look very appetizing, and the ones that were did not taste very good. Nice staff. The juice and coffee kept coming. Plates were cleared quickly. Cute decor. Great atmosphere. Feels like evening. Food was nothing special compared to other places on the strip, though.

OSwWDpruoxeWk_iwDNE39Q.text: Works in a pinch. If you are staying at the Paris casino, or find yourself with feet tired of walking up and down the strip all day, this buffet will get the job done.  However, if you have the time and energy, I recommend checking out one of the other buffets on the strip such as Wynn or Bellagio.  We had the Buffet of Buffets pass, so we could go to 8 buffets in 24 hours that are all part of the Harrah's casino chain.  (No we didn't make it to all 8, but oh did we try!)  Le Village is the little brother of buffets on the strip, with more limited offerings and a smaller seating area.    The wait wasn't too bad, so if you hate lines you might have a better chance of getting in quick here.  Although I have generally found that the longer the line the better the buffet!  When we were seated and started our multiple rounds of plate filling and emptying I found that a lot of the stations were slow to re-stock.  It was about 8:00, and they close at 10:00, so I think they stopped replacing the food in order to reduce throw-away.  Makes sense, but still disappointing since I am not one of those people who come back from the the buffet counters with the leaning tower of food stuffs on my plate.  By the time I went to get some of the dishes, it was only to find that they had run out.  Going off the assumption that Paris is a French place, and Le Village sounded distinctly French, I planned to go directly to the foods that were hard to pronounce expecting to be wowed by something more unique than the standard Prime Rib that all buffets have.    Ratatouille - Not bad for a vegetarian dish.  It had a little spice and heat to it which made it very flavorful.  Since my only prior experience with Ratatouille was the mouse movie I was pleasantly surprised.  Crepes - Yes, everyone has crepes these days, but they are admittedly very good here!  The crepe chef wasn't French, but I will give them a pass on that one.  Chateaubriant sauce - This French sounding sauce goes with the non-French sounding beef tri-tip and was absolutely amazing.  Viva le fusion!  French Onion Soup - It is right there in the name everyone.  However I have had much better at local restaurants here in LA.  And since it is buffet style, it was missing the cheese covered topping on the bowl that I associate and love with this dish.  Sauteed Mushrooms - A very simple dish and pretty universal, but they used some amazing marinade that really kicked it up a notch.  I made two trips for these guys before they ran out and never re-stocked them.  Crab - A staple in all great buffets, was practically non-existent.  Don't go here if you are looking for great seafood in general.  The rest of the food was either at or below par with other buffets, so nothing to really comment on.  To re-iterate my initial assessment, this place will work in a pinch, but if you have the time and energy, try one of the bigger buffets on the strip and eat up!

WrC1392Gy7KfbxGtKs09Jg.text: Came here for dinner.  It's not a great variety here.  It's a smaller buffet.  There wasn't much of a wait on a Sunday night.  Took about 15 minutes.  Everyone else in line seemed to be on the buffet of buffet deal.  We were on a comp from a hotel deal.    Only two things are great.  Their prime rib and creme brulee.  I had 4 pieces of prime rib.  Even the center part,which is usually less flavorful and dry, is just as good as the coveted outside portion.  They didn't cut slices but pieces for you.  At first, I was a bit offended to receive a chunk of prime rib rather than a slice.  Then i realized it didn't matter which part you got.    I got 4 of their creme brulees.  I don't know which other buffets have them so I kept going back.    They also have lamb if you like that.  Their tri tip was a bit dry.  I like their cookies as well.  I know some other people have mentioned the mac and cheese but that wasn't very good.

u59L11ht8pnQw9_vM0YJkg.text: Very dirty place. The bussers stroll around with big smelly carts with food leftovers between the tables to collect dirty dishes. DISGUSTING!!   The food is mediocre at best.

PgBDrYZLGTeJfV6Gu3UJtg.text: We had a horrible time in Vegas, found the place in general to be smelly, over priced, loud and not attractive. So it was a nice surprise to find Le Village Buffet in the beautiful Paris hotel. They had a great range, tables weren't too cramped and the staff were lovely. It was great to get away from the cigarettes, hustle and bustle that was Vegas and have a nice meal for a decent price.

eN3C2eOy0gI9oLHzgp4Xzw.text: This review is for breakfast and dinner.    They had stellar prime rib hash and stewed breakfast fruits.  Also very good and fresh real corned beef hash.   The coffee at breakfast was quite good too.  Dinner is good, but not as good as the breakfast.  Like the gourmet cheeses, fresh bread and french influence.  There is a good variety.  Get the 24 hour buffet pass to do this, you won't be disappointed.

KLqH3Rwh9XWfdciWEnq0tg.text: Buffet was pretty good.  Loved the crab legs.  The apple cinnamon crepe was exceptional.  Glad we got there early because the line moved slow.

Ry_sSO922vzPOUtOXYLX7A.text: The appearance outside of the buffet seems to be lacking of business and happiness. But the line was short and mom and I were hungry anyway. Price for lunch is $25. If you are a lover of crepes which they also sell outside, I prefer you to come here. As for the food, kinda shitty. They basically had veggies cooked in three ways in each section. Also serving mashed potatoes, overly heavy pasta, turkey and prime rib which I didn't have. Horrible selection of sushi and fruit. Sushi rolls seemed like raw white urchins. Fruit was in a dressing pot which only had melon, pineapple, and melon. So you get my point. Dessert was basically cookies, brownies, "cakes", just like at any other $10 buffet. Later they started serving macaroons. Personally, I don't like them and trying one made me want to spit the calories back out. So please, if you come here.... Eat two or three crepes and it will be worth it. (Custom or the flavors are on the wall)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry crepe with raspberry sauce, vanilla sauce, and whipped cream on the side.

kcqdW0WCNoy8O7zQqng-JQ.text: All of the meats were amazing. Sausages tasted great, tri-tip packed with flavors, but most important....breads weren't hard (haha).   I used our 24 hr buffet pass that we bought, so didn't have to pay for anything. I highly suggest getting that pass if you plan on eating alot, I for one don't eat alot, but was sucker in by my family.   Frozen Custard, YUM!! I think I went to this station about 4 times. No food was cold, everything was hot and ready, all you need was yourself.   Service was fair, but one I really really hated was that they took FOREVER to remove our dirty plates.

j9HWLWG1hWTkRiT2R6c8_Q.text: The food was average at best. There were no plates to be found on multiple stations. The prime rib was extremely rare, and we like rare but not that rare! The flow of the restuarant was not organized and did not seem to have any thought to it. I would not go again.

aYY52JqMdSSFLJDUgfvQHA.text: Figured I'd give this buffet a shot and went for Sunday dinner. I expected it to be good especially since it's on the higher end of the price scale but I was wrong. There seriously wasn't a thing in this place that I thought was good except the crepes. Skip this buffet!

cw91Apuhv_PZ4_FBOQguNw.text: Although this buffet is good, compared to others on the strip it's not one of the best.  We came here more for those long eiffel tower cups that you can fill to the top with margarita to sort of kill two birds with one stone and fill our hungry stomachs as well.    This buffet is convenient in that its right in the heart of the strip and close to all the other casinos if you want to walk off your food and check out what else Vegas has to offer.   Wait was a good 45 minutes but I did like the crab legs with butter and lemon...mmmm.   There's also bottomless wine that comes with your meal so if we didnt already have drinks in hand and was buzzing, we'd take advantage of that as well.

kvaKLesDhxW8HOPArj6LHg.text: This buffet, compared to the Caesar's Palace one, is way better. They do have a wider selection of food here, and it is of better quality. It tasted better, and most noticeable was the service was way better here.   I have nothing much to say that to come here and it would be a great choice for those that it is their first time in Vegas as how it was my first time, in which this was my very first buffet here.

vB_ypC-vYUBMbda3tMvElw.text: Best food ever. We too took advantage of the Groupon deal which made it sweeter yet. We alway eat at Le Buffet when in Vegas

-VxpjWkKtkv4vkxJy2eHJw.text: I dont know if peoples standards are snobbishly high, or if they had a one off experience but we were there a few weeks ago and it was great!  Tons of choices and the crepe station is amazing, plus they are huge!  Staff was courteous and responsive, and we were seated immediately. In fact, we were celebrating my sons birthday and didnt tell the staff, so we started singing happy birthday to him and our server was right by our table and came up and joined in!  I loved the atmosphere and the way its made to look like a quaint village in France was out of a fairy tale.  We had a couple picky eaters in our group and everyone found something they loved and then some!  For those complaining about having to run a maze to get back to your table, etc. sounds like you need to go to a regular restaurant where someone will cater to your every need and want, not a buffet, no matter how nice it is because you do have to walk around and get your food!

eJqkNBh3X6cYj8jV1EXH5A.text: I came here on labor day weekend I had their brunch. We had purchased the 24 hour buffet pass and came here for our last meal and the brunch was pretty awesome! The line wasn't long at all and they had everything from your standard breakfast with eggs and bacon and biscuits and gravy to greek food and even some crab legs but they weren't monstrous. Additionally, this place has a crepe station and they had a menu with sweet and savory crepes to pick from. I also enjoyed the roast beef and the real slabs of bacon they had. Additionally with the buffet you get unlimited mimosa and they constantly refill it.

_S6d1oHS22rB2j8WWzmJZw.text: Avoid this place for dinner. It is not worth the three hour wait. Every buffet I've been to in vegas the wait staff were kind and accommodating.  I usually order hot tea with oj and when I did here the waiter questioned my drink choice as if it was added work for him. The only pro is the crepe station until some random person cuts in because they know someone at the front.  Overall  it's not worth it, food is subpar, go to Aria instead.

CS1_Y4h3_zYk5xE141QudQ.text: I don't remember Le Village Buffet being THIS bad!  I honestly believe their quality went down over the years because I seriously don't remember not wanting to return after eating here.  If it weren't for the Buffet of Buffets 24 hour pass, I'd be seriously angry.  We waited over an hour to eat lunch and when we got in, the food was anything BUT French.  I've been to Paris and they've done a nice little job decorating the place but the food was terrible.  I can usually tell how good a buffet is by my desire to return to get seconds.  Well, after my first run through, I wasn't excited whatsoever.  I ended up stuffing myself on crab legs that weren't cracked and on shrimp that were partially peeled.  I recall Paris having awesome desserts.  When I got there, I saw flan and was excited to get that for dessert but they stopped serving it!  OMG, how can they stop serving flan?!  Not to mention, they didn't even have creme brulee like they did in the past.  Half the dessert weren't even French and the lady working at the dessert station threatened me because I took too many fruits, saying I can't take them out because they have security at the door.  That statement is laughable in so many ways.  First of all, I took the fruit because there were nothing to eat and way to be presumptuous!  And security to check to make sure we weren't smuggling fruits out of the buffet? LOL!!  I'm sure they'd really pay someone money to stand at the exit to pat people down before they left.  C'mon!  Oh and the crepes station?  OVERRATED!  It's nothing like the real thing, trust me.

szrJxlrijj602nKU4cU2VA.text: Ah, Buffets... When you're in Vegas, it's a staple that you simply have to go to a buffet and stuff your face with over load amount of food for a prefixed (roughly $30) plate.   To be honest, the price of food in Vegas is so cheap that it doesn't really make sense to go to many buffets. You're just indulging yourself with more sin. And this is coming from someone who is an atheist. It's just not all that healthy and I haven't had a post-buffet experience where I said to myself  "You know, I don't regret eating all that."   No, it's usually "Why the fuck did I eat all that god damn food?" and followed by me being of no use to anyone for a couple of hours as I recover from a food coma as well as just not wanting to do much activities.. and given that this is Vegas, that's a tragic tragic thing.   This buffet has a quaint look and feel to it. Of course being in Paris it has a certain Beauty and the beast feel to it. In fact I was wondering when Gaston to show up and brag about how much he won in the nickle slots.   The buffet is sectioned off. Was stuck in some little fake make shift house. Way to kill my line of sight to the fake blue sky painted above, Buffet wait staff! As for the food selection - There was some decent stations. The carving station seems to be my favorite. There's something magical and fresh feeling with getting meat sliced off a whole shank.  The fruit selection was pretty dismal. The dessert selection, while good, I was a little underwhelmed. You're themed after a french continental location, I'm sure Remy the rat could make better dessert options. Maybe he was too busy making some of that thrown together sushi.    The fish station has shrimp and crab legs. Some staples I was proud of. Over all, it's a good spot for a meal, but my adverse feelings towards buffets as a whole just doesn't allow me to rank it more than an A-Okay.

PpunAsoAfRIZ22S6C98QPw.text: I read several negative reviews of this Buffet, but I cannot see what people were whining about.  I like the atmosphere, we were in a seperate area but yet still close enough to the food....The variety was adequete and everything we tried was very tasty.  Not as big as the RIO but great variety of food you might see when in France!

uN-M0IboKL84fFRYPpRCuQ.text: We decided to get the 24 hour buffet pass and went here first for a sunday brunch.  The wait was a but long bit it was well worth it.  I had crepes, various meats, including a fantastic prime rib, mac and cheese, and chocolate croissants done closer to French style than American style. The service was excellent.  The chocolate croissants would probably have been better earlier in the day since by the time we showed up they were a bit old, but still tastey.  Would definitely go back.  Well worth the price, especially if you get it as some sort of deal.  I have spent more money on food with much poorer quality.

pw8t1MsV3cooK6FWdm-Y1A.text: We had the 24 hr buffet pass and we loved this buffet that we came here for dinner and brunch the next morning. Granted we only visited one other on the list, Carnival World Buffet, but it was enough for us to notice if we wanted food w/ good flavor that Le Village Buffet was where it was at.  It is one of the smaller buffet's I've been to but they offer a lot of dishes of french cuisine that you can't find in any other buffets. Their prime rib was perfectly cooked and juicy. I LOVED their mussels cooked in this wine reduction, the duck was tender, and their potato dishes were delicious. I loved that some of the things were simple little dishes, but packed with great flavor.   They do have a crepe station! They can make them with any fruits and toppings they have on hand for you and they're all so delicious. If you come for breakfast/brunch they do have an omelette station and offer unlimited small bottles of Korbel champagne.  The wait staff and service is slow. We came on a Saturday night and after being seated it took over 15 minutes to get our drinks. I was wondering what was taking so long and noticed it was only one guy taking drink orders and serving them on our side of the buffet. They are extremely over worked.  Their creme brulee was the best ending to a delicious meal. A second creme brulee was even better ;)

XpbS38G8PZ1ujP6dwuoPmg.text: Love this buffet! it's my favorite!  Awesome food Great selection Good service Fantastic dessert  Only drawback is that sometimes there is a wait to get in and the price isn't cheap.   But soooooo worth it!

SnZTpwe5jY3tioEoP7Ulwg.text: This place was pretty good. The selection was good and we found it had the best dessert table of all of the buffets that are similarly priced. We got the 24hr wristbands and found that this was the best option for a dinner buffet.

i1nBw3WkogAPjLvkb0l-WQ.text: Best Buffet for Breakfast. BBB bitchez!    Things I like: 1. Lox Lox Lox, you wont find it else where on the strip smoked salmon and bagels yummmm  2. Its not your run of the mill buffet, the typical ham and roast beef, crab legs. Yes they have these, but at Le Village you get a more specialized dining experience different cheeses, pates, and their desserts and french pastries all unique items  3. Champagne Brunch! all you can drink, make some mimosas   dislikes: 1. Well waiting in line does suck, but it's inevitable at any decent vegas buffet

OcNmIgw5caKUqIlYqZMLqA.text: As soon as we walked in to see the line, we thought about turning around but realized all buffets at 11am or so were most likely the same turnout.  However, we found out if you are willing to pay 10 bucks on top of the original set price, you can get in at a shorter line.   I am amazed at the amount of choices you can get here. Be forewarned, this is my first time to Vegas so this buffet was like a food high for me. It took me about 5 minutes to figure out what I wanted to start with and ended up with french toast, sausage, eggs, and a crepe. While my eggs weren't all that great, everything was pretty good. To top off my amazing breakfast, we were served champagne! After my several glasses of champagne and coffee, I ended up with some dessert.    Even though they have just about anything you can think of from crab legs to salad, I couldn't bring myself to eat that for breakfast.   Oh, the champagne actually went well with my food. Whenever our glasses became empty they were promptly refilled. Service was friendly and efficient even though it was jam packed in the restaurant.  I see people criticizing the place for not being a real french buffet, nonsense! It's good enough for me! I believe we paid about $43.00 a person without tip but I tried my best to get my monies worth.

6VRhqonNRYl2HfGGxOY1mg.text: Quelle Horreur!!  Ugh. I had high hopes for this one, but was completely let down. The reoccurring theme was dry: pork, roast beef, tri-tip, duck -- all dry, and scarily enough, all tasted vaguely the same! Prime rib looked way better than it tasted.  Run away from the truffle macaroni-- it is evil incarnate and stunk like funky garbage. Totally pungent nastiness.  The majority of other items I tried tasted uninspired, as if cooked with total apathy--like tone deaf cooking. Sauces were questionable and bland. Coq au Vin sauce  tasted like vinegar, not "vin"!!  1 star for the service-- staff were friendly and helpful, which I certainly appreciate. Also, the crepes and crab were good, but its pretty hard to screw that up, right?  Yes, the village ambiance is quaint and cute, but without decent food to back it up, it's just a gimmick.  Not worth the cost AT ALL. Will I be back?  Absolument pas!

0nVXbmbuSVdTaoDQKcIQLQ.text: Try their crepes! Don't be discouraged by the crepe line wait in the morning, it's worth the wait! They make them for lunch as well and the line is shorter.

UXeNUzdM-rWS7AV9KqdalQ.text: This was our favorite buffet from the buffet of buffets choices. There were a lot of choices and everything we tasted was great.   We got there around 9:15 on a Monday and only waited about 10 minutes to be seated.   All in all, we loved it and so will you.

N_EFJgtlVFT1pR-v_fE-QA.text: Best buffet in Vegas! Only issue I had was with the line being sooooo long. It's was also a little pricey! You would expect with the amount of money they bring in that their buffet would be a little cheaper. But then again they have the Best quality food any any buffet I've eaten at in Vegas!

svyQ-IHMVGvcd_v6X9v3VA.text: PROS: - The selection of food here is good. They have crab legs. You can make your own crepes. The meats here tastes good, such as prime rib.  CONS: - This place always has one of the longest lines for a buffet in Vegas. I had to wait at least 1 hour every time. - The place is not as spacious as other big buffets.

AuN0iHsjLtGfedeQjNlE1Q.text: Went here for the brunch buffet. I don't really recall eating anything french so if they were supposed to have french stuff I missed it. Their wasn't much of a wait when we went so that was good since I was starving. The coffee is awful so stay away! The food is ok, not great but not awful.  The best part about this buffet is the scenery. Set up to look like the streets of paris I suppose (anyone who has been there might argue otherwise) and I thought it was just very cozy for a buffet.  When in Vegas I would go again.

1HIQtyOnUPOe2a-pC8iA4Q.text: This was the first stop on our buffet of buffets journey. I had lyonnaise potatoes, chicken and bacon sausage, an assortment of cheeses, warm cherries, scrambled eggs with lox, and poached pear. It was all very good.   My wife had a banana and blueberry crepe and eggs florentine which were also good.   The waitresses were extremely friendly and the setting was very unique and Parisian.

cWbPAjCGU2Hm2EOjzHziTQ.text: Weekend holiday prices doesn't generally mean weekend holiday food.  Why charge extra when the menu is generally the same!?   Came here yesterday (Sat) around 1 pm - line was ~ 15 minutes.  Nothing really stood out.  Even so, Paris is still as others have said... a "safe bet".  It has all the standard breakfast items, sushi rolls, crab legs, shrimp, prime rib.    Dropping a star because prices have gone up but the quality of food has weakened a tad.    I would still go to this buffet if we didn't want to wait 45 minutes at Wynn or Bellagio.

TqH_b-V1HaL6ktp5eV44yQ.text: I am not into buffets but my boyfriend loved all things French and wanted to go.  I am glad I did.  The line to go in for an early dinner was long but we got in fairly shortly.  If you love home cooking then you would love this place, there are meats and fish with gravys and cream sauces on many things.  The price for lunch and dinner is $17-25.

50n8gBW03O7nudoOgl_sUA.text: I generally hate buffets but this one is pretty keen. Everything was good enough to make my stomach hurt of overconsumption at the end of the night. In my opinion, on par with the overestimated Bellagio buffet. Decent decor stayed in the background. I don't remember the service which means that it wasn't awful. Competitively priced. Would return.

7HN25HxRCaFyZuoNipnkCw.text: A good buffet at a average price. Most items looked good but were nothing special. I liked the dessert bar it had enough selection to satisfy.

Hxs8bjX2u27wJT18Sz8JLQ.text: We came here for breakfast the last morning in vegas. The service was fast and very nice. There was a huge selection of food, about everything you could ever think of wanting for breakfast and more. Unfortunately they switched out the food while we were eating to the lunch menu. I was hungover and tired didn't want lunch, just breakfast! So we left, probably better anyways i didn't need to eat anything more. If ever staying at the paris hotel again i would come here again.

YEmfyIQdRdeFVX4-z8mP3A.text: I've only dined here for the champagne brunch but it is definitely worth a return every time I'm in Vegas for either work or play. The buffet has a huge variety and is satisfying to all palettes that may be in your party. It's a bit pricey but if you're in Vegas you should have known you were going to come out of pocket for just about anything there is to do here. The restaurant is designed in a very "beauty and the beast this provincial town" way with an occasional Parisian singing troupe performing on the cobble stone streets in front of the restaurant yet very lovely and charming for the nearby ching ching environment. Don't miss this brunch!

X6tpSEEGDFIavwKcstWW5w.text: the french themed atomesphere restaurant was very cozy and comfortable.  It was crowded when we got there around 10am on ssaturday for brunch though, waited for an hr to get in.    prime rib was soft and tender, didn't try many other hot dishes.. pretty typical.  Their famous desserts were the best! we personally did not like thier cook to order crepes, but we both loved flan and creme brulee!! Don't expect the seafood to be good here... crab legs and shrimps were not so good, salty and cold...

h8LoMNZt37-Fat6q5ck_MQ.text: This was the best of the 4 buffets we tried with our Buffet of Buffets pass.  The quality was good and choices were plenty.  We had dinner there, and wished we tried their breakfast.  Would definitely come back the next time we are in Vegas.

Vp-tMhvc8_m-p60X9RBqRg.text: Go here for breakfast.  You can still get many of the lunch/dinner entrees but to experience it all, get the breakfast.  Although I remember the crab legs weren't the best, the rest of the food is great.  The desserts are great too.

PJytRS2ud-_5CIMjUszK8A.text: Mmmm-- bacon, cocktail shrimp, mini waffles, omelets made to order, smoked salmon, and bananas foster all in one place. Plus champagne. Your stomach will die of happiness here. Only downside is that on Saturdays you have to wait in a pretty long line if you come around prime brunch time (~after 11am), but while you wait you can always stare up at the "sky" ceiling and admire the fake French neighborhood around you.

80KA-TFNGi-5HNKEbsHIsg.text: Not as much variaty as Bellagio or Wynns

_1ZUp-2BejJ9sVGM1pcCcw.text: Hands down the best buffet in Vegas!  And yes, I've tried the Wynn's buffet, too.  Everything had flavor, and there were a lot of different food items that you don't always see at a buffet.  My one recommendation is to go early, because if you're like me and you go at around 12:30 pm, expect an hour wait.  Still, even our 2 kids (aged 10 and 15) thought that the buffet was worth the wait, and that's saying something coming from impatient kids.

mijNsuTi0e5xqiBnV3LsxA.text: I'm a huge fan of buffets. PERIOD. When i go to vegas, i don't go to gamble much.. i go for the buffets!!!!!!!   Paris buffet is probably my 3rd avorite buffet to go to after bellagio (first) and planet hollywood (2nd).   25.99 for dinner on a friday night. long wait. but it was all worth it.   We got seated and waited forever to get someone to take our drink order. My boyfriend was excited that the drink was included. So he ordered a water, iced tea and a sprite. For some reason, the server gave us attitude, "3 drinks for one guy?". Dude Lady, we paid for drink included and we're getting our freakin moneys worth! I'm all about customer service, but she was just rude and dissrespectful.   My favorite items are OF course: Shrimp Cocktail  CRAB LEGS! with lots of clarified butter!!!!!!! Bouillabaise (seafood soup. i love the potato balls!)  Cheeses!!!!  Creme Brulee  Straight up, delcious buffet. Good Eats for a good price.   Awesome array of desserts but not as good as bellagio's or spice market.   A MUST!!!!!!!

qdsLsimvAh9l0TPXlv5eJw.text: I adore buffet because I am a fat ass and variety wins for me at least once in awhile.  Especially in Las Vegas.  The line I saw was ususally really long but on the Sunday afternoon we came it was only about 15 minutes.  The decor was adorable and didn't look like a trashy buffet place at all, in fact it looked like a little parisian village!  The fruits, vegetables, cheeses, and seafood was surpsingly fresh and plentiful.  There were a lot of pastas and heavy things that I wasn't that into but still delicious.  Best part was the desserts of course, since it is France!  Try the pot de creme, the creme brulee, and the cannolis.  Although it was a good buffet, it probably wasn't worth the 800 I lost before! Most expensive meal of my life!

cO6fA2DxAkiYAq5SDmiR5A.text: This place used to be good - but it's gone downhill in the last 2 years - the quality of the food at this buffet has declined greatly - the "fresh" seafood smelled fishy and tasted old - the meat was pretty bland - but the desserts were the saving grace.  Service is generally slow and unhelpful, there are better places to go for a $25 dinner buffet.

b4iCm9phbGBoLLLKrapqmw.text: So, I'm not much of a buffet person, but after reading these reviews (and the fact that we stayed at Paris), I decided we should give it a whirl.  We showed up at about 10:50am on a Thursday, so they were just about to switch out the breakfast items with lunch.  First stop was the omelette station.  I don't think the guy cooked my omelette enough since it wound up being a little runny.  Oh well, the made to order crepes (which are HUGE!!!!!) more than made up for it!  I also enjoyed the little quiches.  The brownies are super yummy....I grabbed one on the way out.  Basically, this is an awesome place to come when you want to eat 20 thousand calories.  :)

6fGQ41Pp3xIyYcQCp5_zOQ.text: I thought it was expensive and you didn't have sharp distinctions between regions.  My parents loved the sliced fruit.  Service was okay.  The food is generally bland but the line is long.  Whenever kobe beef was available it would be gone once I heard about it.

8J_CQ_D5_wNsvou9Ye_5rQ.text: I used to love this place, but having eaten here again on my latest trip, I'd have to say that the quality has declined.  Service is poor...we would have to flag someone down to have our dishes taken away.  We were seated at a tiny two-person table, so its not as if we could have just piled the dishes to the side.  We did see our server a couple of times for drinks, but were unimpressed by her "what do you want" manner.  Food was mediocore and bland.  Reminded me of Hometown Buffet.  Le Village's saving grace was its prime rib, which was juicy, tender and flavorful.  They also had creme brulee, yum yum.  We came towards the end of lunch time, which may have contributed to the poor quality of food.  The dinner items, which included king crab legs and salmon, definitely looked better.

ZKqWBQTcLxgWSIflpy-NVA.text: I'm not sure why this is three and a half stars, for a buffet this place was awesome. I've only been to Home Town Buffet and some Chinese one back at my home town, so I guess it would be obvious I'd find this one above and beyond average :]  Minus one star for the service...I really don't want to but I can't help but feel like my table was being ignored. Not only that the table next to us wasn't cleared and it wasn't pleasant sitting next to an empty, dirty, table. Not to mention we had to ask 2 people to bring us new silverware because my bf dropped his knife ;[ And it took them a while to pick up our dirty dishes, so that when I came back from getting more food there was still a dirty dish there at the table D:  Other than that the food was delicious! I loved the selection, breakfast, lunch, dessert, sweets, veggies, seafood. All you could ask for, and they served champagne, super fancy! x3  I know this doesn't really matter when it comes to rating restaurants but when in line for the first time I ended up behind this really stuck up person! I assumed she was just upset about something and told myself to calm down, but what really pissed me off was when one of her friends came up to her and started a convo (which I didn't really mind I mean w/e, theres plenty of food and making a big deal out of cutting is kind of childish) and the person in front of me said, "Yeah I don't see anyone with fruits" and she turned around, locked eyes with me, looked me up and down, and turned around all stuck up like!! The second I saw a break in the line I jumped ahead and got my self away from that pile of bad ju-ju. Yuck! Dx  What evs, I enjoyed myself and I really liked the buffet :3

T3AyR3Ayy-RRuSInCQnPqA.text: I've tried many of the buffets on the Vegas strip and this is by far one of my favorites for Brunch. The selection of food is plentiful and varies in many cuisine types. The refillable champagne and orange juice to make a Mimosa is a big plus. Best of all, I enjoyed the Omelette or Omelete prepared by one of the chefs there. I forgot his name but as soon as I remember, I will post it as he is worth mentioning here based on his fine way to cook that omelette, compared to the other chefs there. It was so delicious, I went to him twice. The rest of the food is good. I like the smoked salmon sashimi slices, and the bacon most of all. The only down fall is that they overcook the prime rib and other meats there. The waitresses and waiters are nice but can get very busy at times and you sometimes have to track them down to get a refill or any other request. I can't say more about this place as other have already mentioned them in their reviews, both good and bad, but I like this buffet and find it worth it especially if you buy the 24 hour pass that allows you to eat at any of the hotel chain's buffets for a 24 hour period since time of purchase.

jzQcyX8EbN941Uwl8NlwzA.text: Okay so for the first time my boyfriend and I did the 24 hour 7 buffet pass thing.  So we decided to try the champagne brunch at Paris' buffet this past Saturday morning.  First of all the line was INSANE!  We showed up at 11:30am... which okay I'll admit that is probably prime time for brunch but that line was not moving.  Luckily if you go to the Diamond club entrance they let you pay $10 per person to cut in front of the line.  Paying the $10 is well worth it.  However I do have a warning to give.  The staff in there is super RUDE! I don't know if everyone in there was having a bad day or if they were just trying to be in character, but they wouldn't make arrangements for us to sit with the rest of our party ( who paid separately) and the hostess practically left us behind making it hard to follow her.  Our drink server was nice but forgetful.  However, they did keep the bubbly coming and always made sure my glass was full :)  The food was pretty okay.  Some of the meats were dry but the pasta selection was pretty good.  The Crepe station was nice- I got nutella with bananas and strawberries- it pretty much rocked!  But the dessert selection was so so.  I was a bit disappointed with the dessert and on top of that nothing was labeled.  So if there wasn't anyone there to answer your questions about  which dessert was which, you had to pretty much guess what you were about to eat.

_mW2t4Ese53jz2gQkTD85A.text: We had been a bad streak on buffets, and Paris buffet for breakfast was no exception. In past visits, I remembered the food to be fresh, flavorful, and full of variety. This time around, everything was just the opposite. What had happened? Are we playing roulette with the quality of Vegas buffets now?   Since it was breakfast, and we weren't big eaters during the early morning, I was resigned to the fact that the food would just have to suffice. We always received friendly and efficient service in the past. This time around, we found ourselves stuck with strange and grouchy service. I was at the crepes station and asked for strawberries. The lady behind the counter snapped back, "we don't have strawberries!" Oooh kay... I guess someone woke up on the wrong side the bed.  Back at the table, we asked our waitress for orange juice, but a few minutes later she came back saying they were all out and offered grapefruit juice instead. Huh? A breakfast buffet out of OJ at 9 am? We thought that was strange, to say the least. Sure enough, tables all around us received tall glasses of OJ. The funniest thing is, we see people throwing away empty boxes of juice from the market. Why, of course.

KewdeKdNbeVlsiz4JWwRBw.text: Yuck! I didn't like this place at all. I felt absolutely cheated paying a buffet price for the amount of food I ate. My husband booked some discount-price tickets to this place, so we went there for dinner one night during our Vegas vacation.   There are different stations, like any buffet, where you can get different kinds of food, most of it European. I tried really hard to like the food. Not much of it looked appetizing. Even less of it tasted that way.   Shrimp and crab legs are my go-to items for Las Vegas buffets. They're usually safe, right? Well, the crab legs were cold, not hot. The melted butter was barely lukewarm, so by the time you walked back to your table with it, it was congealing. Still, I could make do with the crab legs, but that's not much of a buffet, is it? The absolute worst part for me was the shrimp. I dipped it in butter, bit down, and CRUNCH. What the hell kind of lazy-ass place doesn't de-shell the shrimp before serving it? Plus, if it's not de-shelled, then it's certainly not de-veined! Crunchy, poop-filled shrimp should not be on anyone's list of things to eat while in Las Vegas. If you want real seafood (and variety) at a reasonable price, go to the buffet at Harrah's.

1Ja6XfCbbaZ7h1PteX5SSg.text: The only uniquely different buffet in Las Vegas.  Every other buffet in town is more or less the same thing.  Not here, if you want a unique buffet experience, this is the place.  You better like simple excellent French food, if not go to the 100 other crab leg & pizza buffets in town.
