9Mt3scxyJKC1pBtNCLSXjw.text: The buffet at the Paris hotel never disappoints me. I've been here for both the breakfast and dinner buffet and they are both great. The food choices are "French/American."  The breakfast buffet has more pastry options, but I love how you can get crepe during dinner as well.  The chef makes the crepe in front of you and is hot and fresh. I always get the banana/Nutella crepe with whipped cream. The atmosphere is amazing and makes the whole experience a pleasant one.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana/Nutella crepe

IzGHRSbn5SLbg9cxCEjn1g.text: Not friendly. Poor service. Bad food. Worse chefs. I went to the meat section, the chef went directly to the back. He kept looking out to see if I left or not... Never saw this before. If your food is good, you can do this. However, this is the worse buffet in town I heard. So funny.

WdoADl2mhGSR_ePxclEj7Q.text: I enjoyed the food there. Definitely not the best buffet in town, but still satisfying. If you go, definitely go for the truffle Mac and cheese. Hands down my favorite food there. The desserts are also pretty good

ta1s5iWywiRgaViXobfAHA.text: This is my 3rd or 4th time to stay at Paris .  I really enjoy the breakfast at the buffet .  They have crepes , eggs Benedict and tons of different cheeses to choose from .  I came for the brunch today and was really disappointed.  One caveat here is that i did co e at 2 pm, about an hour before the dinner service started .  I thought the whole conveyor of a brunch was to have breakfast and lunch the while time .  The eggs Benedict were cold and hard and almost. I Hollandaise sauce .  The cheese station was relegated to one half filled plate .  I figured I would try the prime rib.  They only had straight horseradish - too strong for me .  I asked about the mix with the sour cream and was told - that's not my station - . So I found the guy at the right station and he said - yeah , someone probably forgot to mix it .  He then said they were out of sour cream.  The rest of the items  on the buffet looked like they had been sitting there for a while and 1/2 if the dessert trays were empty . Sad that my go to to spot is gone . . . .

MqI51zYCKsAmytofTM88yA.text: for price and quality on vegas strip without spending your life savings this is good, nothing spectacular but my experience with vegas...the food isnt that great and is way over priced!  so at least at this breakfast and brunch buffet there are lots of options from regional french foods. so you will at least have many options and be full. we arrived on a saturday at 9 and did not have to wait long.  the waitress did bring drinks and was very friendly

dustB-EXeNjrVA5ksfBPrw.text: Had not been here in about 10 years. It did not disappoint. We made reservations for Sunday buffet. Highly recommend reservations to avoid the long line.  The selection is mind boggling. The sausages and quiche were fabulous. The crepes are beyond delicious! Omelettes made to order. Dessert selection is huge! The coffee and mimosa is excellent. The service is very good too. Add it to your list when in Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes.... Ridiculously good!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes and purple pears.... Coffee and mimosa... Yum

O_NpvuYdE-MVo1eRl7bHPg.text: Came here for breakfast and it was a lot of fun. The wait wasn't too bad for us, maybe around ten minutes or so. Our server was very nice. Their options do not disappoint. They have a crepe station as well, which was very good. I really enjoyed the atmosphere as well, which gives you the feeling of being outdoors at a Paris cafe. I'd return.

bjGVsz2zG05sfDZ_9ruMAQ.text: First time coming here. Service was horrible. Server Jason never checked on us and when we stopped him to ask for water or juice, he gave us an attitude. He was complaining to his lead about wanting to go home or something in front of guests. You're supposed to keep that behind closed doors. That being said, the food was pretty good. Definitely recommended the mac and cheese. The crepe station was nice and I particularly liked the ham and cheese crepe. All sorts of good looking desserts too, but I filled up on pasta. :3

SUmRIPjRfg7EzMpReX2yxQ.text: This used to be one of my favorite buffets in Vegas.  Sadly, I think that this last trip here will be my last.  First they have decreased the size on the far left side to accommodate other restaurant expansions meaning your selection has suffered.  In the last 2 months I have been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Breakfast buffets in Las Vegas are one of my favorite things.  There are so many great foods you can do on the cheap and in a variety of ways.  The options were extremely limited. They didn't even have basic French toast or waffles.  I did not notice a significant difference in the food choices between lunch and dinner.  In the past one my favorite dishes to get here was the coq au vin.  They seem to have removed this from the menu.  Rest of the choices are uninspiring with the only exception being the seafood bouillabaisse.  The biggest travesty when it comes to lack of selection is no longer offering the cookie butter fluffernutter crepe.  Anytime I was in Vegas I would make a special trip here just for that one item. It appears to be gone from the menu.  The biggest problem I've noticed recently is the poor service from the wait staff. Sometimes it's due to having too large of an area to cover. Other times the problem stems from poor communication between the hostess and the wait staff. Ultimately though I believe the wait staff is just slow. They really don't do much other than bringing you drinks. This problem could be reduced if they had self service beverage stations like Spice Market at Planet Hollywood.  I'm sad to see what was once a must visit buffet now be cut my list of "to-do's" in Vegas.

GUu7yYrPt4bROTEt2gRmlA.text: Bon Appetit!!  I've been here several times, but my recent visit to Vegas during the summer we did the 5 Buffet of Buffets 24 hours pass for $45. Without it, price for regular brunch and dinner is $30, but for $15 more you can visit one of several different local buffets as many times as you'd like in a 24 hour period. Definitely a good deal and worth it.   Out of all the buffets in Vegas, Le Village Buffet is truly a theme type buffet transporting guest to a French countryside, complete with cobblestone streets, sky, trees and French village. It feels more like an attraction in a Disneyland theme park without the rides and you're greeted with amazing foods from the five provinces of France (Alsace, Brittany, Burgundy, Normandy, and Provence). So hang on to your forks and spoons cause you're about to take a ride for some good grub.   As for the food, most were delicious, good quality and prepared fresh. When doing the 24hr deal, best time to come here is during breakfast or lunch. Since Caesar's Bacchanal was closed for remodeling, we ended up here (saved Rio for dinner). My favorite dishes and suggestions include:  Cream brulee - Nice crisp texture from carmelize sugar and sweet creamy custard so wonderfully good.  Salads - standards selection and basic dressings - Ok Pistachio lemon macarons - tasty, more like cookies. I prefer Lettes thou. Brie Mac N Cheese - savory, good firm texture (not creamy or mushy) and good. Flan - sweet custard and okay (better off having cream brulee). Bananas Foster - okay (better at Planet Hollywood - Spice Market Buffet) Churros - okay (even Costco taste better) Breakfast sausage, bacon, pancakes and french toast - standard, decent and okay. Duck confit - savory and delicious (anything cooked in its own fat is always good). Tiramisu - Ok (better at Rio). Fresh Made Crepes - Stuffed banana, nutella, and hazelnut, strawberry - average and tasty. Not sure if its worth 15-20 minute wait sometimes. Bring two plates so you don't have to wait in line again. Eggs Benedict - Good Sushi - Ok. Pasta with Truffles - Anything with truffles is good. Veal, Lamb & Prime rib - tender and excellent. Salmon - Tasty and good. Shrimp  - Average size and comes with shell. Mussels - Tasty and good. Crabs legs - not pre-cracked (more work), but good.  Overall - 3.5. Service was pretty decent and attentive. Nice ambience and beautiful scenery. Waitress came by regularly to refill our drinks and clear our used plates. Cette nourriture est delicieux (Food is Delicious)!!   Cons - Killer lines during main lunch and dinner hours. Get here early or pay extra $10 to cut in front of the line.

JJ4JzAElsQCSjCXbxURNAg.text: I love going to Vegas for their buffets. I would rate the Paris Buffet in the B+ zone. It is good and worth the wait. However, if you are already going to spend this much on a buffet let alone eat this much, I would go the whole nine yards and go to the Wynn Buffet.   What I especially like about this buffet is the the King crab legs. I've never had such good, easily cut crab and I am a huge fan of crab. This made it worth the price.

1u0oo3_9z30GBGF6Hb9kIg.text: The food wasn't anything different from the other buffets at the other casino hotels. I was disappointed with the amount of time it took for the drinks to come. The drinks arrived WAYYYYYY after we finished our meals AND dessert....just as we were about to leave. There isn't enough staff to handle the amount of people they were seating. The poor waitress was pleasant and you could see she was doing the best she can...mgmt should be changed there.  The price is another reason for the poor rating. I'm from NYC so I know how expensive things are but $35 per person for a breakfast???Give me a break. Keep doing that and word of mouth is going to be to head to other destinations for fun.  I recommend passing on this place!

xeJ2b7C46SnqjrysVRnXdg.text: Good food and good scenery for a moderate price. The style of the restaurant was very in the relation to the theme of the casino. The crepes and dessert bar were very delicious. Hope to go back soon!

A750tXmKRU_zJYFPAnx6Bg.text: What a great Buffet! The best time to do this would be brunch. Bouillabaise (which is not really French but Cajun but who would differentiate in a town as tacky as Las Vegas) starts my course, followed by some custom made crepes (1 savory and 1 sweet) and some sausage and clams. Finish it off with easily the best Creme Brullee I've ever had. Four stars!

ttCXNnanJ_oNs4tS8VuDAg.text: This place has really taken a nose dive since we were here 9 years ago. We went there for dinner and for the price, the food selection and quality is quite poor. We remember this restaurant being a lot better 9 years ago. Meat was dry and sitting out for much too long. Really not much to choose from for our 6yr old. This place is on par to your local Hometown Buffet. Everyone seemed so miserable working there. From the cashiers to meat slicer to crepe pourer to servers; everyone had this scowl on their faces that screams: I HATE MY JOB or I HATE MY BOSS. I spoke to 2 of the dealers at the pai gow tables later that night and both agree that Le Village has TANKED in recent years. I can't recommend.

Lco36OUwDSGh4Ir62hrCQQ.text: I really enjoyed this buffet. Mostly because of the atmosphere and there was a huge selection to choose from. I didnt stay at the paris but glad i went through to come across this place they have everything a buffet can offer!! :)

NvX6gWxCIU5V8Q0kqtEPGg.text: We came here based off the Yelp rating. It was 3.5 stars and better than the other casino buffets. For two of us the cost was $67. The staff was nice and very friendly; however, that does not make up for the quality of the food. The temperature of the meat was slightly cooler than room temperature, quiche was dry, the bread solid as a rock. The French onion soup was cool and a little too salty even for French Onion Soup. The pasta was the best part of the menu and it too would have been better warmer. If you have an extra $67 to spend in Vegas, I would not recommend blowing it here. We will probably not be back.

bniyxfd_oKmgow4yb2lwkw.text: Cute French setting. the turkey, despite adding gravy was a bit dry.  The saffron rice ...well, went back for more :). Food sum up: a little bit if everything.  One thing I did not like was waiting in life for the bathroom;  For the multitude of people who come and dine here, there should be more bathroom stalls!!!

SPGJwOcVSAxvRmg7DQ6ycQ.text: Haven't really ever had any issues here but this visit was different.  We had the buffet of buffets pass and I am a diamond member so we always hit the buffets without having to wait in the long lines.  We were sat in the diamond area and didn't realize that they had put platinum on the receipt.  The server was literally at the table when we were sat.  So we sit, we already ordered our drinks at the entrance counter, went around the entire buffet, I even got a crepe.  Get back to the table and my bestie informs me that the waitress just got our drink order.  While waiting the 12 minutes for our drinks to come back, a hostess starts questioning us about who sat us there and why we were sitting at that table.  I informed her that another hostess sat us here because I was a diamond member, she huffed and puffed and didn't believe me until I showed her my card, that was already on the table, and then started murmuring something about the counter people needing to do their jobs better.  Our waitress has finally come back with our drinks and cups and started walking off with the coffee.  She said maybe she should stop smoking so much, so either she was taking a smoke break while she was supposed to be getting our drinks or she smokes too much pot and can't handle being a glorified busser.  The only saving grace on this trip to the buffet was the crepe guys, they were fantastic!

c8sXCXenR-gCVGZUJ7Ue0Q.text: This used to be my favorite buffet but it has changed quite a bit. There wasn't a single item that I felt worth the price paid. More importantly, the service fell several miles short! The woman behind the dessert station was rude and couldn't bother to help anyone. The server wasn't available to bring me my drinks until after I got the second serving. Furthermore, this place had the saddest salad bar I've seen in quite a while.

-7ltYmYH0eVZ3Y2h09-S7A.text: Best buffet in Vegas...  Quality not quantity like others...every time I go to Vegas i try a new buffet but I always come back to The Village buffet.. Can't never find nothing better....

MKLfNIft5ce_uu9-pNPHvw.text: Excellent Excellent Excellent the Gold Standard of buffets. The Bacon here is so good it's other worldly. A great array of delectable delights. Creamy sauces and that bacon did I say bacon....superb!! Fresh breads and the eggs were fantastic!! Come hungry and enjoy the food coma....

ZOZoY3jwlq5X8W5mEfnL-w.text: The quality has definitely gone down. It used to be one of my favorite vegas buffet, but not anymore. I came here with with friends and there was really no selection. Only a few options. I think it is for sure worth paying extra 25$ and eat at cesears palace buffet. They still have a lot of food but food seems old! Just heads up!

rRSWf_iiDmVGytGNXHFMrA.text: Go to this buffet if you're leaning towards desserts and seafood(mussels and clams). There isn't too much of a selection compared to maybe Caesers or Rio, but it's decent.

MlmppQzPQRQg5TpKaWFI9A.text: If you expect your 9 year old to be a child's price you are mistaken. Children are only considered 4-8. If your 9 year old can eat $25 worth of food go for it otherwise it's a total rip off.

FFtjJvt_l6ojn7DCTDR13A.text: So, I went here with people out of desperation for food. Someone who had been here before recommended it so here I was at 8 PM. Service had placed us in a corner of a room and it was very stuffy.   In terms of the food, all I could taste was cheese, butter, and salt. I mean, I guess I expected it since it was a buffet.. Crab legs tasted funny and the soups were very oily.  Service was interesting because I felt like their waiters waited for tips. During the time I was eating, our waiter disappeared forever and the people next to me had a huge stack of plates that was piling. No one got refills of water and the place was looking dirty. You could always see the waiter with a dish cart near by, but he just kind of stood there and stared at us through the door way - it was kind of creepy.   The people next to us left without tipping, so after the waiter saw that, he began hawking us and constantly took away our dishes/gave us refills. There were moments where he just stood there in the room counting his money in front of us (signaling that we should give him a tip). The whole time he was doing this, the empty tables by us were still filled with stacks of dirty dishes.  Overall, the food is sub-par and the service is creepy. :) Good luck.

izgUefN1tB_gsxfmI31aJQ.text: The workers were very rude. I am wondering how they keep their job. We complained to the  manager about the poor customer service. Food was below average.  Price is way too expensive compare to the quality of food. I would recommend not to go there. You will waste your money.

W0esYTVo9d9HGeguDVCtCA.text: Best brunch buffet! The line was long but the decor in The Paris is so relaxing that we didn't even mind. I also like that the VIP members go through a separate entrance so you don't have to glare at them as they skip the line and remind you how lowly you are in the buffet caste system.  Food was awesome: delicious breads and cheeses to make believe that I was really in Paris, brie/bacon macaroni, french toast, and customizable crepes.    PS, the waitresses wear these hideous French dresses which is probably horrific for them but funny for me....but hey, at least it made me want to tip more.

mePE0XdIvg3_Sf_vdwO4zw.text: The dinner buffet was one of the worst I have ever been too. There wasn't much of a variety of cultures. The cost was outrageous for what they had to offer. The service was limited. I will never go there for dinner again. I'm not sure how the breakfast is.

erBIbipKmC8DDZdxjkLQxQ.text: Le Village Buffet is a nice buffet w/ nice European/French chateau style decor. Many good quality foods here. The style here isnt broken up by type of foods but all together. They have lots of european syle cuisine that seem to be wine infused. They have crepe station, serve escargot, Duck, pastas, chicken, fish with different types of sauces but definitely good quality...Oh yeah they french pastries and a minimal choice of desserts but good...

9w36LBugxCwMHCwBgkOrIw.text: This is hands down my favorite buffet in Las Vegas.  They do fewer dishes than Rio (for example) but what they do, they do very, very well.  I have been here for breakfast and dinner, and can honestly say it is the only buffet in town I thought was truly worth the hefty price tag.

njxIv9DJ9hHiILfQSAxB5Q.text: da pasta dishes r really good! and our server was really nice. da setting is cute...i felt like i was really in Paris.

CDVkoyMvG1eNcI5nYU_2Dg.text: Wow I almost fainted!  A best buffet place I went to during my trip to Las Vegas.  Food is delicious and looks good too!  Worth every penny eating there.  Crepe station is awesome, wish they had strawberries tho..  I can' t decide what to take to eat because everything looks good.  Vegetables are deliciously grilled.  I definitely will go back for a lunch buffet.  I hope it stays the same or even better next time!

rFdEHzsqSP9Oqox40jekZQ.text: Went to this place for dinner after reading reviews here. Food was over rated and bland.

fveXmPESmFu7FFnOa-45Fw.text: Wow, what a disappointing start to Vegas buffets. Only found a couple entrees that were even remotely tasty. It is sad when the best dish was the mashed potatoes. The prime rib and salmon would have been good except for the random chunks of salts that made it completely inedible. The only redeeming aspect of this place were the deserts. The one cake I had was amazing, it reminded me of a Ferro Roche.

5pNSH6omzL7b95tA837q-w.text: Okay, I tried this place in '05 and honestly, I don't remember anything special about it so maybe 3 stars is still too many. If this place theme is suppose to be Paris, should there be more French food? Kind of generic. Well, at least this place isn't bad.

icEP0v0dc4ksPSIEuZJrXg.text: if you have not tried the buffet in Paris! u are so missing out!! I go back to this buffet everytime I'm In Vegas!!!! it's has what you would eat in Paris!!  i had no problems what so ever. the price is decent comapred to the other high priced buffets!!!  I would definately recommend this one!!

omHAaiTC26KmCoXuok5T2A.text: God, what happened to the Paris buffet? This used to be my favorite 10 years ago and on Sunday the food was not even recognizable any longer. Went for breakfast, the deal not so bad, about $35 for two people. The food selection, absolute crap. Don't even bother or waste your time, it was just cafeteria food. The only reason to go is the crepes but even that wasn't great. I saw in another review someone comparing it to Hometown Buffet, that's an insult to Hometown. Ha! Somebody else said Sysco food, and bingo, that's it. I think this whole Buffet of Buffet thing has ruined them. In putting my business acumen to work I would speculate that all the hotels involved in the B of B got together, buy a bulk of food at a nice discount, and then just distribute it amongst themselves. That's why it doesn't stand out and that's why the quality has eroded. The toppings look old for some reason, no better way to describe it. The workers there seem miserable, I don't know exactly why. If a crepe is what you seek, go across the hallway to the crepe baker and save your time waiting in line for this place. Never again, especially after having the Wynn. How sad.

8Ksps4nMuy2raqY1K8ZFPQ.text: This is my favorite buffet in las vegas!  The desert bar is awesome, you have got to try the flan!  There are several stations which serve different types of food from around the world (chinese, mexican, american, italian, etc.)  I always enjoy the prime rib, crab legs and shrimp.  The price is reasonable and the food is superb!

9MU_AVgCx_QJknEZ5hoEsw.text: I just came back from the buffet with a terrible stomach ache, something I ate was bad, I think were the crab legs. As previous comments I have always considered this restaurant one of the best. I started to doubt the quality when I was charged $24.99 for dinner, which I thought it was cheap and the comments from my party were, hopefully quality remains the same, WRONG quality is going downhill,

8d2e1Wot7MnF-nBFfHt36g.text: We were there this weekend for breakfast, and ended up having brunch due to the long line.  It was $24.99 for brunch.  The wait was long but the food was ok.  I like from a scale of 1 to 10, I give it a 6, compared to the Wynn which I give a 9.  A lot of their food lacked flavor.  The line was long and the dessert bar SUCKED!  I love dessert, and it is a 3 compared to the Wynn which i give a 10.  I guess you get what you pay for.  Taste wise, I did not care for it.  Our waitress was great, she was very busy, but she tried to keep up with our needs especially the mimosa refills, which I guess was the only good thing about the buffet because it was included and non stop refills.  I would have given this place a 3 star except for the situation that happened while we were waiting for a table.  Originally we had 4 people for the buffet, and a few of our friends joined us and it turned into 9.  Which after waiting for an hour and a half in line, we didn't want to wait for a larger table.  There was a large group in front of us maybe about 20 before we got there and they waited for a while for a table.  So we decided that we were going to split into 2 groups since we weren't going to leave the restaurant at the same time anyways.  So we told our waitress that we wanted to go from 9 people into 2 groups of 4 and 5.  Well, when we told her that she got mad, but we weren't even next in line for a table.  We were maybe about 10 people behind being next.  So we did ask if we can get seated near each other if possible but when we told her, Marta the hostess got all mad at us and started giving us dirty looks.  We were then seated and a few minutes later my friends that met us up there were seated as well, they were seated on the opposite side of the restaurant where there was another table that was vacant the whole entire time they were there even before they were seated.  So Marta could have seated us together but she didn't and while we were eating the whole time she kept giving us dirty looks.  We later realized that if it was a party of 8 people or more the gratuity charge is 18%.  So we were given bad service with dirty looks because our hostess wasn't going to get the 18% gratuity charge.  I have been to Rio and the Wynn's buffet, and never at any of the other two buffets had we had bad service due to a gratuity charge.  Like I said you get what you pay for.  And another thing that I almost forgot to mention if you are looking for the omelet station, look at the dessert bar, because it's not near where the savory food is, but if you are looking for the crepe bar, it is next to where the savory food are and oh don't get banana's for your crepe, because they are brown and mushy.

vT8cJYBv-SrA1fGBCvx0RQ.text: If you love shrimp cocktail, crab legs and desserts as much as I do, you will enjoy Paris Buffet.

Wn1V2oBUol-Cm2lgSFs7Vw.text: when i got there around 9pm and the line was very long passing the enters way. i thought this was a great place to eat but i was wrong. the food was very salty and didn't have any favor. very disappointing.

Oa12QrYY7uAMLReFr8WS9A.text: If you would have asked me about this buffet 2 years ago ..I would give it a million stars. I had been solidly in love with this place for about 4 years straight. I would plan the whole vegas trip around their sunday champagne brunch. I was able to over look their ultra crappy service.. yes its a buffet but SOMEONE has to bring you champagne, and they do it when they feel like it. I went on Easter Sunday, I waited in line for a 100 yrs. No Champagne. I guess they were too religious to serve champagne. Whatever, its vegas. They were unapologetic, rude, and ridiculous. We had done many a birthday meal here, 20+ people for years and years. The food is great, the pastry area alone is worth it. But I can't stand crappy service and their ambivalence to having their short comings pointed out. I am currently 'buffetless' in vegas, and considering I think most buffets are a hepatitis bar anyway.... oh well.

QSUxUntrfDSoCM97p6xhlA.text: I'm not a buffet person, especially waiting over half an hour for one, but this was OK.  We went on a Sunday, and it cost us $14.99.  Since we were bordering on breakfast/champagne brunch, we got the best of both worlds, with breakfast and brunch fare, which ranged from prime rib, seafood, and all the good stuff for the cheap price.  People who came after 11am had to pay the more expensive price for the brunch.

IzsWeRbUbVFh35qtot1X8A.text: As someone who has actually traveled to Paris and had crepes, etc. there I have to say this is possibly the *worst* imitation I've ever had.  The food is just two steps short of inedible, specifically the crepes.  The chef has a horrible attitude.  So unless you like your crepes to taste more like pancakes with disgusting canned fillings, take your appetite somewhere else.  Perhaps even somewhere without lighting so dreary and dark that you can barely see your food or your dining companions.  My best guess about this place is that they purposely make it miserable so people leave quickly.  Depressing experience, both food and atmosphere wise.   Enjoyed the buffet at Aria or they Wynn much more.

4mJ4TowhxB_vdF8W0uBB7A.text: Wife and I had dinner Jan. 4, 2012, Line was 50 minutes long and since i don't do lines paid extra for line pass. I can only think that the line is so long because people like ourselves hadn't been there before and the French village setting is very appealing. Except for a very good waiter, it was all downhill from there. The selection of food was mediocre, which corresponded with it's quality and flavor. The only thing I thought was decent was the prime rib and I was looking for something a little more exciting. My wife stood in line for a crepe (lines -- not me). The person cooking them was desperately trying to find help to bring her ingredients as she was running out.  My wife finally got her crepe, it wasn't cooked properly and inside was cold. I expected to find excellent breads and pastries -- I was extremely disappointed.  And it was dirty too -- no one was cleaning up around spills etc., along the buffet dishes.

5BGrlmAfFjMyZLfGsyHCYQ.text: Located in Paris Las Vegas, the ambiance in here is just so cute! A small French and a street where you eat (of course with a formal table and chairs). The streets are decorated with streetlights, signs, bells, and other things that really make you feeling like being in a actual French town. The sections where you get the foods are those small shops by the street, which make you feel like buying things from different shops on that traditional French town. The food is not the best food in Paris Las Vegas, but you get to east A LOT OF DIFFERENT FOODS, including a variety of meat from prime rib, turkey breast, ham, lamb, fried turkey, sausages, and seafood include crabs, shrimps, and a lot more, and the most special that no other buffet has it - crepe, a kind of French pancake with fruits and stuffing of your choice wrapped inside with or without chocolate syrup. The price is ok, not expansive but not cheap, that it costs $24.99 per adult on a regular day, $29.99 for peak travel period or holidays. Tip is optional since you pay before you go in.

BhHpcj9tZfpgNZyl86oakg.text: I've eaten here a few times in the last several years, but I never really want to come back.  I only come here if I'm staying at Paris or Bally's, or someone I'm with wants to go.  I never remember anything special about this buffet, other than they have a crepes station (which actually only tasted so-so this time, they ran out of nutella!).  Not that the food was bad, it actually tasted pretty good.  I had some of the prime rib, which was decent and cooked to a nice medium rare (that doesn't happen too often at buffets), fancy mac n cheese, creamed spinach...these I remember as tasting good.  I also sampled lots of other things but don't remember them.  They have a tiny sushi station now (??) that seems very out of place and frankly would be better without it as it only served crap (like pseudo california rolls with imitation crab sticks, bleh).  I was disappointed by their dessert selection (but I forgot/didn't see any creme brulee!).  Just had a mediocre crepe and raspberry cheesecake.  So, the food tastes decent but not memorable, and seems like a small selection (I prefer the bigger places like Rio's buffet) and not worth the price ($25 for dinner).

rSCfK2GT2oVbmUGEdsUNOw.text: This is an excellent buffet. The reason I only gave it 3 stars? They advertised crab, but when I asked for crab only found a nasty, messy ice pit of broken crab shells. However.... Just before I left, I noticed a gentleman at the table next to us feasting on a huge bowl of HOT STEAMING CRAB LEGS. I asked our waitress what's the deal, she replied it was a VIP gambler, only VIP's get the hot crab. Excuse me? I just dropped almost $100 for two people and I don't get the steamed crab? Wow. Ripoff. Not cool. Other than this glaring defect we enjoyed most of the other items, good tasting sauces on some of the chicken items, the meatballs and a couple other items. Spend a few more bucks and go to Ceasars Bacchanal buffet, my current favorite and a supreme feast for about $50.

oorkNhaNra4ebJgzT29N8w.text: My favorite buffet in Vegas! Their breakfast selection is sooo good!   Tips: - if you're staying at least 2 days in Vegas, get the buffet of buffet deal! It will save you a lot of money if you decide to just eat at buffets. - come to Le Village buffet EARLY for dinner because the wait can go anywhere from 20mins-an hour!

9k_Qi2ddO97bicO-pTajeQ.text: Solid buffet but not the best I've had in Vegas. We got a Groupon for the buffet which turned out to be an excellent deal for two since it not included food but also unlimited mimosas, wine and beer (usually a $11.99 add on). The interior and set up of Le Village Buffet is amazing and I kind of felt like I should be bicycling through it while donning a beret! They make a lot of use out of the space and it's like you're in a little French village (so I think at least, I've never been but that's how I picture it). They have stations for different cuisines and items such as sushi, meats, salad, seafood, dessert, etc. But when I saw the crepe bar I started to get really excited because I adore crepes so game was on. They have about eight varieties of both sweet and savory crepes and the banana nutella crepes made my day! They were absolutely perfect and smothered in chocolate and whipped cream, I was in fatty fat heaven! Unfortunately that was the pinnacle of the buffet-I tried other items such as grilled lamb (flavorless), crab legs (skimpy), cooked veggies like brussel sprouts (overcooked) and nothing really tickled my palate that much after the crepes. Unlimited mimosas and our excellent server, Mitzy, made up for it though!  I would go here again with a coupon or discounted price but I wouldn't pay full price for it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The crepe lady
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana and nutella crepes. Yeah, it tasted as amazing as it looked!

_sm-iBBRw8aS31yyUSzs2A.text: This is the best buffet out of the buffet of buffet deal. The Le Village buffet is located in the paris hotel. The buffet has beautiful decor giving you a romantic outdoor feel without dealing with bugs!  In addition to the beautiful outdoor section they have nice sectioned off rooms with really quaint french decor.  The food has always been really delicious at these buffet ( maybe not the best but I think the best bargain for the quality of atmosphere and food) The dessert area is really mind blowing. I dare you to leave without wanting to eat something from their dessert bar! IT JUST DOESN'T HAPPEN!  I had to try everything from the creme brulee, cheescake, cake balls, parfaits, flan, and colored macaroons. I'm still shocked that I don't have diabetes from going to this buffet. My friends loved this buffet so much we had to come here twice!

jNyoKf8Crzm25umu3OjN7A.text: Ok, here I am 4 years after my first review of Le Village Buffet.  My friend works for the company and had free passes, so I decided to give this another chance, even though I said I wouldn't,  because a lot can change in 4, 6, 8 years.  So let's see what changed...oh yes! they had Creme Brulee!  I didn't get to eat it, because I had a creme brulee phase 4 years ago, now it's over so I don't really care for it anymore. Their crepe station was excellent, along with their crepe chef, who was very nice and funny (5 stars for this alone if I could do that)...   What else, what else....think...thinking...thinking...nothing.  Nothing much has changed - still A-OK per Yelp's 3-star standard. So sorry, but won't be visiting the buffet at Paris again. Instead, I'll stick to the creperie or the pizza place across the way.

UfuiqY_Iqd7ODRsk3-O-Xg.text: If you go early, this is a great buffet. Don't go after 8:30am or you'll wait for a long time. Food was good, plentiful and well presented.

cKeRUClKxyg7khhq6Hpobw.text: Let me just say this:  My first visit to Paris buffet was for the Sunday brunch, which my group waited almost two hours for. We spent most of that time standing, sitting on the floor and leaning on walls as we needed to. When we all were seated, we ran for our first rounds and devoured our food, drinking unlimited mimosas as we went along. Between the first and second rounds a MOTHER EFFING CURTAIN ROD fell from the wall above us, swung down and almost knocked the life out of my friend (whose skull was spared because I motioned him closer to say something at the very instant the rod came crashing down).   Meal refunds, a switch from unlimited mimomas to straight up champagne (which our server kept pouring), three rounds of food, and a year later, WE WENT BACK.   It's THAT good.   Granted, after the whole curtain rod debacle, we were terrified to be seated in one of the "indoor" areas, but the food drew us back in. The meats are cooked really well and are good quality- so are all the other hot dishes. The bread selection is exceptional, which is to be expected of a french buffet. I wish I could've had more of the dinner options, but was out there was great (just can't remember what I had). Lastly, the dessert and crepes lent to making it one of the better buffets for sweets (this coming from a person who hates most buffet desserts).   I haven't been back for a while since Studio B and M stole my attention, but this ranks high amongst my choices.

EXOKxeHuerO18OvrumapVg.text: Not even remotely worth your time standing in line. Unless you want to spend half your vacation standing in line for buffet style breakfast, avoid this place like the plague.

GSmXRvRCl4g8Yb1TjDqu-w.text: My family went in and the hostess thought we were with another family. I told her were separated and she slammed down her pen in frustration. Wow sorry for making your job hard. Short Hispanic lady.  At our table our server was very pleasant taking good care of us despite being 7 of us.  I needed more creamer and was looking around there was this lady named trish and yells across the small dining area to my husband yes amigo what do you need.  He says cream.  Server gets back and trish tell her she's getting stuff for her and starts arguing with her. We can clearly see trish is in a bad mood with a attitude.  We don't say anything . At the prime rib station there's this hispanic maybe oriental lady cutting prime rib. Clearly it's med rare. I ask if I can get a well done piece for son.  She rolls her eyes and offers a med prime. I tell her no its still red.  She offers another piece of the same prime !! I ask her can My family went in and the hostess thought we were with another family. I told her were separated and she slammed down her pen in frustration. Wow sorry for making your job hard. Short Hispanic lady. Server gets back and trish tell her she's getting stuff for her and starts arguing with her. We can clearly see trish is in a bad mood with a attitude.  We don't say anything . At the prime rib station there's this hispanic maybe oriental lady cutting prime rib. Clearly it's med rare. I ask if I can get a well done piece for son.  She rolls her eyes and offers a med prime. I tell her no its still red.  She offers another piece of the same prime !! I ask her can you just please just have it cook in the back . She stabs the prime doesn't answer and takes it to the back.  Clearly you can see this place lacks customer service.  It's a shame because all this we are not returning here ever.

zgCK5HJtqaz9lXOPRXe_4w.text: Wish I Spent that Money Elsewhere We paid $130 for three of us to have dinner. We really aren't an "Al You Can Eat" kind of family but we are willing to pay for a quality meal. Unfortunately we didn't receive that. Luckily, we made reservations in advance on Open Table so we did not need to wait in the 1 hour plus line. We were seated after payment was taken and the server came by to get our drink orders. My 12 year old daughter, husband and I walked around the buffet to take in the offering before choosing what we wanted to eat. I started with a small bit of the two salads they offered and a half a cup of their potato leek soup. The salads weren't worth finishing, so I didn't figuring I would go back for something tastier. The soup was very good but also very fatty. My daughter go a piece of turkey with gravy and mashed potatoes. These were both good. Not amazing, but good. My husband got several crab legs that he said were "pretty good". On our second trip, I got the Truffle Macaroni and a roll. The Truffle Mac was very good and the roll wasn't anything special. My daughter got a plate of fruit which she said wasn't ripe. My husband got the Turkey and mashed potatoes. Then, since we hadn't been wow'd yet, we decided to try the crepes, which is what everyone raves about. My husband and I stood in line for 20 minutes to get our crepes. When we got back to the table, I cut open my Caprese crepe to find that the cheese wasn't even melted and the tomatoes were still cold. The same was True for my husbands ham and cheese crepe. In addition, the ham seemed low quality. What a bummer! My daughter then went to the crepe station and waited 25 minutes for her Nutella Crepe. This one was very good. I think they are trying to pump crepes out so fast that they aren't making them properly. There should be more stations to accommodate the busier hours. For Dessert we tried a selection of most of what they had to offering. The only things worth having more than one bite was the Creme Brulee and the Purple Macaroon.  I felt really disappointed by this dining experience. For this price I could have gone to one of the nice restaurants on the strip and enjoyed a meal much more.

B7AVCqPYB5gS7j9OqoNbYA.text: The food was alright: some things were too salty, some too sweet. The waitresses are very kind and welcoming, but the man making crepes was insanely rude. However the entire area is very unique and pleasant to look at. The buildings that surround you and the lanterns and street lights really give that Parisian vibe. As Vegas buffets go, I would come here just for the experience, but probably wouldn't return myself.

-lvKTBjxMWgJs0-8kRqSIQ.text: We went to Le Village Buffet for dinner. I was disappointed that there is no macaroons, and the dish selection is kinda of limited. The crepe station has a very long line. Lots of dishes were mislabeled.   Service is not good neither. Our empty plates were not collected for the entire dinner.

WqocJ4tON1Dm_TfBvWKrhQ.text: First buffet i have been to that had hummus!! The variety in food at this buffet was awesome.... you can have a six course meal and not have the same thing twice.  About $30 a person, A little pricey, yes but it is Vegas, it is a huge buffet. Just go super dooper hungry to get your money's worth!

gKNMqhjcBg1GD7yBzh43JQ.text: Unfortunately as mentioned, there was a huge line up to get in here for breakfast but it is definitely worth the wait.  They do provide a $10pp VIP line-bypass as well which we opted for since we were wanting to go about our day rather than wait an hour in line.   Overall the buffet was excellent with plenty of selection.  Most noteable would definitely by the brandy-apple crepe that I split with my wife.  They had an almost overwhelming selection of breakfast meats, including about 5-6 different types of sausage alone, with the andouille being my favourite.    Overall, a great meal for a reasonable price.  The service unfortunately is atrocious, which I wouldn't have expected, especially with "VIP" entrance.  We waited for 15 minutes before we actually had to walk up to a waitress to order our beverages.

ceFDwRxcmxnqJGydzhoyTw.text: The variety here is pretty small, you'll make your rounds in less than 5 minutes.    Their grill has steak, chicken, and sausages, roasted peppers and that's pretty much it.  A lot of sausages.  Quiche Lorraine, wasn't very good, but their crepes were tasty!  Other meats were a bit dry and encrusted in salt.  Just not a very good variety.  Soups are generally not very good either, I don't like "Cream of Leek."   Mashed potatoes with gravy and regular sauteed veggies are spot on! Delicious!  Desserts are good and tasty, but I don't like how they're displayed out in the open and little kids touch them and cough/sneeze on them, gross.    It's also a bit dark in there, has a weird atmosphere, kind of cold and dim, it's just weird.  Someone's watching you.  Heh, It's an okay buffet that's better than The Spice Market, but I prefer Rio's Carnival Buffet, where most food items are edible.  Be cautious, happy eating!

JveOVDZLeVRHh82NXlgQgw.text: Let me start by saying that my husband and I are not buffet people. I hate the idea of over-paying for mediocre food, just so that you can stuff yourself to near unconsciousness (to "get your money's worth") and feel disgusting afterwards. This has been my experience with most buffets in the past and why Le Village Buffet at Paris Hotel and Casino was such a pleasant and delicious surprise.   I went to this Buffet with my mom, husband, and two kids for the Champagne Brunch on a Sunday. First of all, UNLIMITED MIMOSAS...nuff said, right? But then they took it a step further and had amazing food. The French Toast was incredible, scrambled eggs were well seasoned (which is rare, even if you're not at a buffet), sausage was plump and juicy, and the bacon was crisp and perfectly cooked. But the real show-stealer was the crepe station. There was a bit of a line, but it was well worth the wait. They had about 8 selections to choose from (4 sweet, 4 savory) and each was made to order right in front of you. This buffet is worth coming to for the mimosas and crepes alone. But I of course had to try the creme brulee as well, and it was fantastic...not the best I've had, but no doubt delicious.   The only reason I did not give this buffet 5 stars is because only the breakfast food was enjoyable. Being brunch, I felt that some of the more lunch-type items were seriously lacking in comparison to their breakfast counterparts. Not even worth eating, in my opinion. But our server was friendly and attentive (also a rarity at a buffet) and she kept the mimosas coming. All in all, I think Le Village Buffet may have restored my faith in buffets and made me willing to try more...if only I can resist going back to this one every time.

7_mn7VzYFA2aI5-0WiTukA.text: My kids and I are in love with this buffet; the food was amazing. That's all we can say about this Le Village Buffet. Not only that but the desserts are the bomb.com. Must try the creme Brule, macaroon and flan. Definitely will come back when we are back in Vegas. Oh you can make reservation to avoid the crowds.

roLjuKPjS88VDxK0MyoHqg.text: Meh sums it up.  For the price, definitely not worth it.  The food was decent, but no real standouts.  It didn't even seem particularly French.  Granted we went for a normal breakfast (not brunch), but we expected a good variety of decent French pastries.  The variety was seriously underwhelming as was the quality.    Best things here are the made to order crepes, the sausage bread pudding and the prime rib hash.  We were very disappointed by the lack of variety in fresh fruit or anything else fresh for that matter.  There was no salad bar at all. The eggs benedict were poorly cooked.  Whoever heard of hard-boiled eggs benedict?     On the upside.  We had the nicest waitress.  Very good service from her and she was so friendly.    The Bellagio buffet for nearly the same price (and lunch too) is a much, much better deal.  With far better food.

fs-WPmRWqpDBFg_ToouXGQ.text: Opting to do at least one Las Vegas buffet, we decided on doing so in Paris: charmed by the themeing and reviews that mentioned it was one of the better options to try. While the food it self wasn't particularly memorable (we have done the buffet at the Palace hotel in San Francisco, which is the best buffet) the ambiance set the scene for what was an enjoyable experience.  The food selection here is diverse and will please most, unless they come expecting mostly French cuisine. The options range from everything from Japanese (sushi) to Mediterranean (hummus). While there are some big winners to pick, like the mozzarella and tomatoes or the crepes, there are some so-so options you will have to deal with as well. The real allure of Le Village Buffet, however, is its appearance. The theme is a quiet little village, while capturing a slightly overdone decor (think Fantasyland at Disneyland) to make it memorable. Was almost worth it alone just to sit in those settings, in fact. In terms of price, it's more expensive than the other options, but does enough to differentiate itself to make it worth it.  Overall, we won't be back, but we are happy we went and feel it's a suggestible activity to try out.

tlpQSw3JfSk2E-4LOYbtbg.text: Overall a good value priced buffet.  Sadly the prime rib tasted factory brined and was poor quality.  Good items were the smoked salmon the pita and hummus, but stay away from the dolma.  Odd that they've discontinued the lamb in favor of tritip but it was good tri tip.  Pastries were generally very good and a good solid buffet just not a wow omg type of buffet but I would do it again.

ldMSkzXu5WacNRnxM3bVYw.text: Being a buffet, you gotta compare this to other vegas buffets, and I must say I was expecting better after reading some of the reviews.  First impression were the staff who work there to seat you, and none of them looked like they wanted to be there or help you - not a smile, thank you, nary a pleasantry from anyone.  The one drink waiter who did seem amiable was not very attentive in clearing our used plates and checking in on the drinks that we ordered.  But, being a buffet, you can get away with that if the food is special, and I must say, the only thing special here are the crepes. Yes- they are good, and if you've got a hankering, then this is probably the buffet for you. But the rest of the food was, at best, average, and at worst, cold and bland.  Soups were way over-salted, an admission made by the servers themselves! Salad selections were sparse, meats were mediocre. Desserts were tasty.  Maybe it was an off-day for the buffet, but all I can say overall is that I've definitely have had better buffets in Vegas.

ykwHVguo8XSa15LDyNCHYA.text: This place has gone downhill since the last time I ate here a few years ago.  First of all, the wait to get in was ridiculous.  We waited almost 2 freaking hours in line and when we finally got in, I saw there was a whole section of empty tables in the side area that they could have used to seat people faster.  WTF?  Anyway, we went for dinner and the selection of food was extremely limited.  Definitely not how I remember this place.  Also, the food was pretty tasteless, especially the meats (chicken, lamb) that I tried.  I really only ate some of their pastas, totally not worth paying $26!!  I did, however, try a lot of the desserts (since there was nothing else to eat) and they were really good.  Unless you just wanna eat desserts, I would avoid this place and try other buffets, it's not worth your money.

l3Z4Eem50J1RqtaXtUKRAg.text: My friend & I had breakfast here last week & I wasn't that impressed. I must say I'm not a fan of eggs, so I can't tell u how good those were. There is a large assortment of them, frm eggs benedict to regular scrambled & several in btwn. There is a crepe section, the selection is pre-set, sort of like ordering a combo at mcdonalds. U ask for a #7 & u get a mozzarella, pesto & tomato crepe, it was pretty good, but not great. They hv a good selection of various potatoes & pastries. The croissants were good, but I wasn't impressed . I have heard good things about it so I expected better. I was especially dissapointed in their restroom, yes there is only 1 women's restroom, not several stalls. It was not clean & the soap dispenser was broken. Really? Not something you'd expect to find at this hotel. Its way too expensive & not worth it. Save some $ & take a shuttle to the Orleans buffet, a huge array of good filling food at a cheap price, generally $7.95-$13.95 or so.

NV4pYOjc4QIkVCPD5hxQjQ.text: a very nice looking buffet in terms of decor, but the food presentation was bad, the food wasn't that great, and I didn't get to sit out where the nice decor was.

Ynj1lEpvA3HCkrM-RSx-FQ.text: ummm greasy food heavy cream makes for a not so fab body to lay out near the pool.  french food buffet style just isnt a good idea.  definitely not as good as the Bellagio buffet and variety and space is lacking as well.

R3mBpu0YxgzjCo_rebJ5cA.text: Got the breakfast buffet here after catching a sunrise on top of the PH parking lot...was extremely satisfying. Cute setting, tons of pastries, and attentive service! Brought me back to wandering around France a bit...will definitely check this place out for lunch and dinner sometime, and that champagne Sunday brunch sounds incredible!

HfGM34UzVk1mvQh8acKRCg.text: So I have been told, many times, that Paris has the best breakfast buffet.  Seeing as how I am not an early riser, especially on a trip to Vega$, I never make it for breakfast.  However, this time I made it for lunch.  For some odd reason, this buffet reminded me of Disneyland, and I don't know why.  Maybe the lines, or the uniforms the waitresses had on, or just the feel.  It just reminded me of New Orleans Square in Disneyland.  Anyway, the food was nice, lots of different choices.  I really liked the croissants and the fruit.  The selection of grilled veggies and hummus was also nice.  I was expecting a little more french food, but it's a buffet, so it's not going to be really nice.  Fiance had some duck, cheese, and pate, but didn't really like any of them.  Not bad though, not bad at all.  Maybe next time I will get up early for breakfast, especially since it is my favorite meal of the day.

67ltG7TkR9Rdi49C4XerNw.text: We arrived for Sunday Brunch about 11 am and had a 2 hour wait. $24.99 plus tax per person. Apparently there was a party of 70 that must have been seated when we arrived. I liked the selection and variety they had. I agree the sushi selection was pitiful, but I was surprised they even had a selection. Sushi is not what I think of when I go to Paris. I tried the handmade crepe and really enjoyed it. I also had a ton of crab. It was very flavorful and not watery like some places. I wasn't sure if it was a champagne brunch or not and finally had to ask someone. Then I had to ask the waitress for some. Once I'd done that, she was good about keeping it coming. Overall I really enjoyed it and would go back. I would just try to show up earlier.

iZ_FJCMgtP4yRKhd8gZ--w.text: Unfortunately I wasn't too hungry when I went. I also didn't think that they had tooooo much of a selection. For those reasons I was happy at the price ($25 for dinner - it's good enough). Having said that, I was still awed by the amount of food and the quality of the fresh seafood. I'm not much of a sweets person but I was also impressed by the numerous choices of desserts. I loved the decor though - quite authentic feel of Paris.

xez9uAIFzGDXy27PjTKE7A.text: such a yummy vegas buffet!, go to this place if your super hungry, there is a great selection of different foods and desserts! there may be a line to be seated because this place is always pretty busy when its open, its around 30$ per person..make sure you hit up the Crepe station..MmmmmGood :)

vklrZPtgKKE_hSg1hE7GRA.text: my favorite vegas buffet of all time. i have t come here almost every trip to vegas because its reasonably priced and the food is always fantastic. they have the perfect variety for me and i love paris. even if its too long a wait, there are plenty of really good cafes within a short walking distance. but bring a jacket... it gets cod in here. oh, one area for improvement: the dessert selection would d well for itself to stock a moist chocolate cake.

v9aXjSxvzuKjvVbFEEoLUg.text: 2 times I've been to Vegas = 2 times I visited Le Village Buffet for dinner. Incredible range of choices, reasonable price for the food/location/ambiance, and overall just a wonderful treat. The other buffet I tried was at Todai in Planet Hollywood which was also a good place, but Todai was an in-house buffet while  Le Village has a unique atmosphere which resembles, well, a cute little French village right inside the Paris hotel. I loved everything at Le Village, and with the wide variety of food, it's almost impossible to have room for desserts - but you simply have to. Those pretty, tasty, dreamy desserts are just too good to pass. Next time you're in Vegas, come to Paris and dine at Le Village. Then, if you feel like it, take the tour up the 1/2-sized Eiffel Tower to watch the entire Vegas sparkling at night. The dinner and tour will definitely remind you of how much you actually love Vegas ;)

RUTj6ObuGoOttSlYfjh_eQ.text: Yum, yum, yum, I love buffets!  This one is up there on my list.  It had maaany different options to choose from, although most where french themed.  My favorites were the breads, the lamb, the creme brulee, the chocolate rimmed ice cream cones, the crab legs, the salad, the goat cheese, and last but not leas the Hummus! Yeah, I know, you say who eats hummus at a buffet?  Well, this was the best hummus I have ever had, and I don't even like hummus, AND I'm Greek...so there...eat hummus at this buffet.  I went here 2 days in a row, I don't usually do buffet twice in a weekend but my friend wanted to.  The first time we went for friday night dinner there was no line and I paid about $20 cause I got 5$ off from a reciept that I had from lunch at the hotel that day.  Saturday and Sunday they have champagne brunch even though they don't really advertise it...$26...and the line was huge.  The items I think you should not waste your stomach space on are the sushi (obviously, right?) the rice was nasty and the cheesecake.

q3h_bQKTRVlNnMbehUWlPw.text: We were at the restaurant for early dinner around 5 pm. The restaurant was getting crowded already, so better to go early. We liked the food (e.g. Grilled Salmon) and the atmosphere. But the restaurant was dark which makes your foods look not so appealing...and the waiters and waitresses were so focus on collecting the plates and nearly took our plates that we are still working on. So, overall, it was a good but not so spectacular experience. We got the discount tickets from the half price show/restaurant ticket booth. In retrospect, we paid for 4 dollars for the ticket so if you can get discount tickets from your hotel, that may be cheaper.

SQbNEtFkZ0uz5Qokk3Uhag.text: Really long line for dinner around 7pm.  My favorite part was the dessert bar.  Other than that the other food was ok.  As for breakfast, the selection was disappointing especially in the dessert bar.  Overall, not memorable.  Go to Bellagio's buffet, it's much better.

2ngW8o0NBbXVIZvIufXEig.text: This lunch buffet was probably the best buffet I have ever been to - but I don't go to buffets that often. It was a lot better than I had anticipated. They had some nice things like grilled veggies and some French-inspired dishes that made it easy to fill up 2+ plates. I'd definitely go back.

7A-jgp0QJCp0trsbGB3rBw.text: Had dinner here on Jan. 4, 2012. Read many reviews before we went that rated this buffet quite highly. I feel compelled to add a review to possibly help others from wasting their time and money and so they can enjoy dinner elsewhere. As noted in other reviews, the setting is very nice. And I would give our waiter 5 stars (Milton was his name I think). Pretty much everything else was awful or average at best. My chair was used so much there was no more cushion in the seat and it was so wobbly I thought it might collapse.  I traded it with another chair at the table and it was in the same condition. Compared to other buffets, the number of food selections are limited. And that wouldn't be such a bad thing if the food was good -- it was poor. Wasn't all that tasty and much of what was supposed to be hot wasn't. The prime rib was the only item I found to be favorable. I was looking forward to excellent desserts and they were extremely disappointing as well. And yet the dinner line was so long that the wife and I opted to pay the additional $10 per person for the line pass and to be seated right away. We did the 24 hour buffet pass. Had breakfast and dinner next door at Spice Market Buffet at Planet Hollywood. It was excellent. Vast selections that were fresh and tasty and the desserts put Village buffet to shame as well -- even their creme brulee was better. And if you like crab legs, while both buffets have them, at Spice Market you can have them hot or cold and the legs are already split for you. Likewise the shrimp are already peeled unlike Village. Oh...and if you like cleanliness you'll enjoy Spice Market more too. At Village they never cleaned the front of the buffet where food would be spilled or dropped. At Spice Market it was done on a continual basis.  If it wasn't for our waiter or the ambiance I would not have even rated this two stars.

Z8gp6HZrpPLPk3xidmBmmw.text: The line was really long for early dinner at 6:30pm. After around 30 mins or so we finally got seated. The food was ok. Lots of pastas...they had sushi but u hardly see the fish hehe. The desserts is awesome tho...there was a lot of choices to choose from but i was so full that i hardly had room for desserts :( we ended up wasting a lot of food but i guess walking everyday and night up and down the strip paid off for it.

b-tQk9-WR1lLvf3MQ32M5A.text: the food is so-so.  The sushi left an unbelievably bad taste in my mouth, the pasta was heavy and oily, presentation was relatively unappealing, the shrimp/crab bar was pretty good.  The service (drink) was good.

Q_iAP06omfhNHAjcRBHPMg.text: Not worth the money.  Their selection is not as good as some of the other places on the Strip.  I was very disappointed at how few the dishes were ... I think I managed to eat a bite of everything -- a feat that could not be accomplished at the other buffets.  For a buffet that got a French name, I was especially disappointed at their dessert section.  Both the quality and variety were not up to par with the other buffets.

oFzYfKcP3W7kOp6CvbBQKQ.text: I don't know what happened to this place tonight.  We had the worst service ever.  Our server, Erika, claims that she was new with only a couple of months on the job. Boy, does she still need a lot of training!  The service was bad enough when the bus boy, Federico, came out to clear our table while we were still eating and was flat out rude.  He even tried to kick us out of the restaurant because, according to him, they had to go home.  When I asked him why he was telling us to leave when he wasn't saying anything to the people at the other tables around us, he just made a nasty remark, left, and called our server.  I made sure I got his name so I could report him to management.   What makes it sad is this is one of our favorite buffets in the Caesars Entertainment family of hotel/casinos in Las Vegas. Being a Total Rewards Diamond member, we do not have to wait in the long lines. We always try to have at least one dinner here whenever we're here in Vegas. We like the variety of foods they offer especially the crepes and the steamed crab legs.  We've always had great service here before that's why we were surprised to have such a horrible experience tonight.  The wait staff had always been great and very attentive. They even anticipated our needs a lot of times. That's why we love coming back.   I hope what happened here tonight was a fluke perpetrated by two incompetent, rude, obnoxious employees who do not deserve to be working in the service industry.  I hope that those employees get some kind of disciplinary action. I hope this is not an ongoing trend at Caesars Entertainment properties.

eS7d9l_dS0p3yTQwolwwhg.text: If I could give this buffet negative stars I would. The food was horrible. The cantaloupe tasted like the fish it was sitting out next to, the eggs were very undercooked, the bacon was sitting in a vat of grease, the macaroons were falling apart and filled with whipped cream, the ham in the eggs Benedict was rubbery and the eggs weren't runny, the crepe was made with pie type filling instead of actual fruit just to name a few things.   In terms of the atmosphere, none of the wait staff was friendly, only half the food was labeled and the food that was labeled was labeled incorrectly.   On top of it all, our waitress wouldn't give us additional mimosas even though we supposedly paid for "unlimited" because she couldn't give us more than one glass each. Meanwhile, other tables were allowed full bottles of champagne. She went so far as to tell my friend she had to finish her glass before it could be refilled.   When we decided literally nothing was editable, we complained to the manager and without any hesitation at all he gave us a full refund which tells you just how often people must complain. The Paris hotel looks beautiful but the buffet should be shut down by the department of health.

yaW4at1KXRR1OmHGKfz3vQ.text: Maybe because my standards were too high from my previous night's buffet. But this place is not good at all. Yes, it gave you the illusion of being in a french cafe area, but the food do not meet that standard. The buffet items were not too great. I got a mild stomach cramp like an hour after we ate here (definitely from here cuz I didn't eat anything until here for lunch and the time).  I only ate the cooked mussels from here. Cooked, just to be safe. That was probably my favorite thing out of everything I ate here. Parmesan truffle potatoes were too hard with not enough truffle flavor. Desserts were alright but not extraordinary. Bread was super hard. Macarons were way too crunchy (not the style I like nor my boyfriend). Our waitress went missing after our drink orders. We didn't get our drink for another 20-30 minutes after. Even then, someone ELSE brought us our drinks after we were looking around and she realized we didn't have drinks on our table but had food.  I wouldn't go back to this buffet.

SQqTNtqDj2szFEx2GXAUug.text: For it being a long line, it went by very fast. When someone came by to collect some of our empty plates, they failed to replace our utensils. I had to steal some from an empty table. The creme brulee and strawberry & creme crepes are to die for. Mashed potatoes were very good!! (If you don't mind potato skin in it) the only thing I wasn't a fan of was the 3 cheese Mac and cheese. It is waaaaay too salty.

SWuYpQdGOC7jRw3y4vLwMw.text: Great buffet...plenty of choices...what stood out was the chorizo hash...and the andouille sausage...they were both very tasty.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The breakfast was so good yesterday that we decided to come back on our final day in vegas
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

eE7KkS1Emt_QtMeirZEa1Q.text: According to some list I read, this buffet regularly ranks in the top five in Vegas. Unfortunately, there's a really big gap between #1 (Bacchanal) and anywhere else. Like most buffets, this place has some solid dishes and a lot of fillers. Their gimmick, being in the Paris casino, is having French dishes. Unfortunately, buffet-quality French simply isn't that great.  HITS: chicken de Provence, truffle and veggie cavatappi pasta, prime rib was solid, eggs were cheesy as hell if you're into that sort of thing, crepe station, Sunday brunch includes champagne that is surprisingly good despite low retail price, limited dessert selection for  a place that's hyping up their French affiliation.  MISSES:  French onion soup is super salty dregs, pate at charcuterie area is not good, their entire sushi selection consists of literally a single crab maki roll, entirely too many breakfast options still out at 2PM, heated plates at dessert station lead to melted desserts.   SERVICE: They're busy, I get that. Hostess is inefficient, three groups of 6+ held up the line for half an hour until someone came up and figured out that pairs could be seated immediately and the line started moving again. Our server either had far too many tables or short term memory loss, served half our drink order then forgot the alcohol until we reminded her half an hour later (the next time we saw her).  Not the best buffet but certainly not the worst. Pricing is decent, but only if you like filling up on grilled meats and think a selection of  fancy breads makes you "French".

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Champagne brunch, get the whole bottle- its good
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pricing current as of dec 2014

ENmVmEY-GvKdeN-llE1_Pw.text: I came here for brunch, through the Diamond entrance and it was grand. It's like stepping into a village of food full of stations, waiters and servers for a foodie experience. I was amazed at their omelet sheet given at the table, pick your fillings and the server brings it to you when ready. I wish I came for dinner because I hear it's fabulous. The crepe station looked amazing I can't believe I skipped that. There's charcuterie and caprese salads, light to rich foods such as pastas and a carving station. The desserts were awesome and if you are going to make the drive to Cali right after, be sure to get some coffee and to go cups. =)

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very Parisian

x4BlATsdbS2ORz5tapI3Zw.text: If you are reading this, chances are you saw the Groupon deal and is tempted.  You should skip this place and move on.  I came here many years ago, recalling it being pretty good.  Well speed to present day, WHOA, has it changed?!  The service is poor, the quality of the food is even worse.  Let me easily point out 2 things I found comical.  They had sushi,  1 type, the ones with a bunch of guords, the kind you would never eat or order.  #2, the title plate for Macaroons... Oh come on!  This is Paris Hotel, Le Village Buffet, they should know the difference between Macarons and Macaroons, and how to properly sandwich one... the puffy sides faces out!  However, for the 1 star, I will compliment the crepe bar.  I am not a big crepe person, but I was told it is not bad.  And you can make reservations 24 hours before.    In total skip it, for $60 (Groupon) + $10 parking fee, you should go to The Buffet at The Wynn Hotel, it would come out the same price, considering the parking is still free.

IarpJusyy1KPncVElscGBA.text: Came here with a bunch of girlfriends for brunch and I must say this was one of the best brunch buffets I have been to in a very long time.. Everything was made fresh, tasted good and the servers were helpful and attentive.  My favorite station was the crepe... both savory and sweet made to your liking... everything tasted delicious!!  never a long line and many different types of food to please any palette.  Cute decoration makes you think you are sitting in a lil cafe in a village in Paris... very nice touch.  Very satisfied for coming here and will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My Nutella banana and hazelnut crepe!! Yumm

DmN7jyqMAtDezFwDyrE3uQ.text: Went here for dinner on a Friday night to celebrate my birthday. On the plus side, the food was great! I also really enjoyed the decor. Definitely I would dine here again.  On the negative (keeping me from giving it 5 stars), we had a party of 8, but paid separately. We did not realize that we should have told the cashier so they could include gratuity on our bill since there is a mandatory gratuity for parties of 7 or more. When it was time to be seated the hostess gave us a hard time and said we could not sit together since gratuity had not been included. We told her that we would be happy to leave the gratuity, but we definitely wanted to sit together or at tables near each other. The woman gave us a hard time and was unwilling to be flexible, so I told her to get the manager. Another hostess stepped in an took care of the situation for us. She was very friendly and made sure we were happy.

ROzq9pa6dsqcR7-Y6bPzMA.text: I will never go back again. I purchase a groupon today for $59 for buffet for 2 with unlimited beer and wine. I was reading the reviews of those people who purchase it couple hours before I did.   When i was about to show my groupon, they told me its not valid because it is a holiday weekend. What the hell? When does easter become a holiday?????  They me to se it when I come back. She said that we can only use it from Monday to Friday. So I paid for the full price and didnt my free drinks.   What a service? Never buy from groupon. It is deceiving.

w2sV02lilDoEOrmA8Cbkpg.text: Eh... $18.99 per person for breakfast during the week . Should be $10.99. Breakfast basics are served. Not much selection. Nothing stood out except for the omelette station. Quality of food was passable but nothing extraordinary. I encountered 2 rude food service workers and 2 that provided great service. I understand that the theme here is Paris & they are trying to emulate French dishes but they really weren't well executed. However, this is a buffet and it's located on the strip. What more can you really expect? If you're hungry and want to fill your gut, give it a try but don't expect excellent food. I think there are much better choices in Vegas for the money though. The Orleans and Gold Coast Casino offers a better buffet for a fraction of the price. Get a B-Connected Card and you'll receive a discount on the price. There's a free shuttle to both hotels (both owned by Boyd Gaming-shuffle drops off at both casinos on same route) that has a pick up stop in the back of Harrahs and it runs about every 15 minutes.

ABbp0EcYzXOIyvcbL9kfwg.text: What I liked: -Ambiance was very nice and fit with the overall hotel theme of Paris -Truffle mac n cheese was very good -You can get steamed king crab legs if you ask your server (cold ones are readily available at the buffet) -Crepes are very delicious -Loved their french onion soup as it was sweet and not overly salty like what I usually experience at other places The pork belly in the cassoulet was delicious! Smoky flavour -While the selection was not as extensive as other major buffets on the strip, it was a good size and the quality of the selection was good (for the most part) -Very good prime rib  What I didnt like: -Sushi selection and quality was poor - restaurant could do without this on their menu -Salad bar was small and wasnt very appealing

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plenty of king crab legs available at the buffet
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Got the cold King crab legs and then the server brought out the basket of freshly steamed ones. Dip it in butter and OH SO GOOOOD
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes made to order with both savoury and sweet options

28musZ5he8AXTurJdzMFqg.text: It's very disappointing. Pretty expensive for little variety. I know better places that are less expensive. Although there were seats available and a very short line it took 15 minutes until I got seated

56hZe42SHQ25GyV_mTTEJg.text: My husband and I ate at the Holiday Brunch today at 11:30a and it was extremely disappointing.  The price was $80 for two and it was not worth half of it. We got seated and then went to get food and returned to a lady sitting at our table on the phone.  We had to ask her to leave which was awkward to say the least.    Service was slow and everything that should have been hot/warm was cold except the coffee.  For example, the tomato soup and chicken crepes were luke warm at best and we began eating as soon as we got our food.   The taste of many food items was highly disappointing as well.  Few items tasted really good which was not the case on our last few visits.  Also, there was prime rib but it was mostly fat and gristle and nearly raw.  Further we were never told (and didn't recall) that champagne or fresh juice was an option.  :(  We've been here several times and have always loved it but today will be our last time as the value proposition and poor service and unappealing cuisine makes it a poor choice for us.  One last critique for Paris...their self parking set up is a bloody nightmare.  Nobody can figure out how to use the pay system so we spent 15 min waiting and backing out and switching lanes because the people in front couldn't figure it out in two different lanes.  The system is not user friendly and causes unnecessary delays and frustration from guests.    Thanks for allowing me to share.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross

q5HX6Gf8v-xFK3VaPKc0qw.text: Still one of the best buffets in vegas.  But not quite as ggod as last year.  They have cutdown their buffet a little an it seams luke they do notoffer as many new thins.  But both dinne and breakfast were very good.

o11vuM0Ifnm1WiRXMl8IoA.text: Have not had a buffet in over 10 years and when in Vegas why not I say it's prob going to be fantastic unfortunately it was not worth my wait. The selection was boring, they ran out of salmon, tilapia was tough, muscles were over cooked sushi was hard old and a waste of food.  Best part was bread pudding and prime rib with that said not worth $80 for 2 ppl. Not to mention my glass was cracked. Service was nice but will not eat here again. Looking fwd to dinner I'm sure Gordon Ramsey's stk house will be a guaranteed winner.

EH77xPGZUMNSnCWJdTePWw.text: I dont give out 1 star review but I just cannot give it anything higher. I have been to many Vegas buffets and this has to be the worst one yet. It is one of the cheaper ones which shows because the quality of food is horrible. They dont have many options and the food that they do have out looks dry and like its been sitting out for hours. The ambiance is really dark and unwelcoming. The only thing going for it is the endless mimosa which is included in the price of the buffet. Our server was also on top of it and friendly. Unfortunately, not a buffet we will be trying again -our party of 7 were all on the same page.

fn6eMzAqzXWt9xxQg7Yfog.text: Probably my favorite buffet dinner. Really good prime rib and they bring a bowl of crab legs to your table if you wish. The mac 'n' cheese is a must try.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bowl of crab legs.

bGBmW67pM0qPdxQ0kKV4yA.text: Love the onstage flow of different foods during our seating.  Did not enjoy the constant hovering of waitstaff about paying the bill for drinks.  Wanted a more leisurely experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Disney world for Big Girls at Paris Casino

xJN8oZyGB_rpIHlOqh4ZPg.text: My group visited the Le Village Buffet twice for breakfast.  Each time we had made to order omelettes and crepes which were large and delicious.  Our first server was very slow and disappeared frequently but overall the staff and service were good.  The ham and bacon from the carving stations were very good.  While the buffet entrees did not look too appealing, for a breakfast on the Strip, especially for the Paris, the breakfast buffet is a good deal.

zmVQ5k6NtcHVYEF3aGjevQ.text: Hands down the worse buffet we ever ate. Dropped a $101.00 for 3 people for dinner. All the buffet bowls were almost empty or looked like they had been sitting for a while. Food was dry and old tasting. At 430 pm you'd think it'd be more fresh getting ready for the dinner crowd.
