The lady making crepes had no teeth and was probably 80 years old, and I wondered if she was an authentic Parisian crepe professional. This was the only buffet we went to that had crab legs, and I love king crab legs.  They were delicious.  So if you're into king crab but don't want to pay $100 for buffet, then come to Le Village.  I had about 20 of them, which didn't leave much room for other stuff, but I did manage more: shrimp cocktail (shell still on), a nutella crepe (freshly made for you), chocolate lollipops, among other things.  My husband had the prime rib at all three buffets and preferred the one here at Le Village, saying it was tastiest.  So if you're into meat, that's another plus.  Also the sausage and andouille were excellent.  So were the cheeses. I vote yes when it comes to Le Village, though it is not a spectacle, and it does not have the selection of other buffets.

zHZJ-1DcBxLb4jXswLrSKw.text: My dining experience was accentuated by the presence of a frenchman with a very rat-like snout.  It reminded me of Ratatouille the movie and lended a certain authenticity to le village.  The food tasted more French and I could picture waitresses lopping off heads on the cobblestone.  Lunch is a much better deal here than dinner.  Don't leave without getting the seafood mix in a bread bowl.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. veal

y1ETV-jYdHvMoLZ5eRGGzQ.text: We came here for the lunch buffet. Although it was a weekday we still had to wait 15 min to get seated- I guess it's a pretty popular buffet.  The selection of food was not as good as the pricier buffets, but we still found a few things we enjoyed. The best meat dish was this braised beef - the meat was off the bones tender. Paired with the leek mashed potato and an assortment of grilled veggies, the braised beef made a delicious entree. As for the other savory items, we sampled a little of everything, but nothing stood out. I was disappointed at first that the crepe station did not have banana and nutella for the day, but ended up enjoying the fresh blueberry crepe drizzled with apricot sauce in the end. I would definitely try this combination again. The creme brulee was as good as everyone said-the BF and I practically inhaled a plate of these creamy dessert.  Overall, I might come back again foe breakfast or brunch. For dinner, you can get much higher quality and more variety at other buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A4wxqRIOJWNTaAlNw7tgyw.text: The BEST buffet I've ever had and certainly the best I've had in Vegas. It's inside of The Paris and easy to find. The food selection was outstanding and the quality of flavors and ingredients was mind-blowing. All-you-can eat and a glass of wine for $31 and it was SO good.

plvXdnIRKBrMmcis6PFVqA.text: One of my favorite buffets in Vegas. French style cuisine, so don't expect tacos and orange chicken. Excellent selection and superior quality food. Best part is the baker will custom make your Crepe to your liking.  Delicieux

gfPLT7BTqd2mJQ449BTrpw.text: Fresh shrimp, crab legs to enjoy. Prime Ribs & Leg of lamb on carving table. Many different other dishes. A lot of desserts, including crepes made to order. Weekday price is more worth it.

EDKm_PNVEf3BIaUzXo8m5w.text: there is an advertisement that said the buffet is 18.99, DO NOT LOOK AT THIS FROM AFAR AND WALK RIGHT IN because it is the WEEK DAY price, i'm not sure why they display this on a SUNDAY.   i went here for brunch, saw the sign and walked right in, paid for 2 and it was 53 dollars, 53!?!??! while trying to do the math in my head.. 18.99 x 2 + tax.. hmnnn.  they were very tricky, oh well let's just eat!  wrong!! the service sucks, the service REALLY REALLY REALLY sucks there with drinks and getting you seated.   the food, meh. they have great chicken though, i must admit, and the pork loin is fair too.  stay away from the seafood, yuck, and stay away from the prime rib or any other steaks. the bread pudding was good as well as the ice cream, but none of the other desserts.   honestly, i'd say stay away from this buffet. go somewhere else.

nUKoZUUEC6145i7EwUxZcA.text: The long line in addition to the mediocre food and service suggest that you should spend your money elsewhere.

dDDQpEiNDu2lOKuyY1DFYg.text: This was a brilliant buffet - just like the reviews stated.  We went here for breakfast and were not disappointed.  The highlight was definitely the crepe station.  I got a crepe filled with strawberries drizzled with chocolate sauce and my husband chose one filled with apples and strawberries with caramel sauce.  They were amazing.  I wasn't as impressed with their pastry selection - I was expected a little bit more from a French style buffet, but the few pastries we did try were delicious, especially the bear claw.  There were some interesting choices of food such as pate, but we were too full to try! Good buffet!

vJ0n3nPPs5CRb3RAHokz1Q.text: I went in at about 10:30, paid $15 for breakfast...and eventually 11:00 came around and lunch was available as well ; )  Okay since it's Paris, I really don't have any idea what I'm eating. I just pick a little bit of each stuff and sample it. Eventually I was already kind of full when lunch came around.  For breakfast I enjoyed the crepes (mix fruit), this cheese omelette looking thing, and their hash browns. I know not much.  Lunch...I love their pasta! I enjoyed the veal ribs. They use to serve crab legs for lunch (5 years ago?) but not anymore. Dessert was good, I love the chocolate mousse looking thing that comes in a little plastic cup.   Inside decorations are beautiful. It's kind of an outdoor scene, with buildings surrounding you. I enjoyed it but my mom said she felt 'stuffy' in there.   Only complaint...the bathroom has exactly ONE toilet.

jl_WM3rinLlJDpMbqT2Yyg.text: I used to come here all the time and I made sure I always made it here when I came to Las Vegas. However, on my most recent visit, the food was just not good. The pastas were bland and the crepes were only as good as one you can get at ihop. On a brighter note, the coq au vin was quite good as well as the prime rib. I probably won't come back as there are so many better buffet options here.

xmcg0d_4f8YvSoik0vsbCg.text: This was our favorite buffet on the strip until now. I think it rated so poorly  due to no fault but our own. After reading the reviews and tips on here we thought we would try the "arrive just when lunch is changing to dinner" and pay the lunch price and get the dinner items. We won't do that again and we should have known better, that's what you get for being cheap! The lunch was pretty much over and many of the dishes were empty and dinner items were not brought out until an hour or so after the dinner price/time began. But if we had gotten there and paid the dinner price when dinner was supposed to start I'd have been upset. What was out was not good.

O-MwfpGvuq5c-zwU6xpxTg.text: A must-have!!! The food was so well cooked, lots of veggie and healthy options. Ambience is awesome - it's got an evening feel to it!! We had the breakfast buffet there. The queue was long - had to be in line for about 30mins before our turn came but totally worth it!! Absolutely great value for money!!

lyAU-eylPgprb7vx1tFcIQ.text: Cute ambiance. Made me feel I was at Disneyland. The buffet is not the best buffet in the world, but it was descent. I recommend mainly to get full on the crepes, roast beef, mashed potatoes, and the caramelized onions. Everything else was whatever. The pasta was bland and the deserts looked better than they tasted. The creme brulee was not the creme de la creme. The crispy caramelized layer tasted funky and the custard part was bland and not that rich. Pretty disappointing.

Z54-ssb69Mx_lG1YtJ6N1g.text: Hella food there!! Cocktail shrimps are great!! Many different kind of food and desserts!! Only $24.95, great deal!!

76G6jBoa5zkwfRzJgj8DAA.text: Arrived at 9:30 am on 12/24 for breakfast but were seated after 11 am, so what we had was actually lunch. Overall, I think it is worth the money but not worth the 1.5 hr wait.  The dessert station was great. I also liked the grilled mushrooms and the scallops in the mixed seafood dish. Clam chowder was good. Can't remember anything else that were particularly good. Crepes were not as good as those in Todai.  I will only go again when I don't have to wait more than 20 minutes.

8VfNiHQPUXx3l2cIcSXnYw.text: I waited 30mins. to be seated for dinner and boy was it worth the wait.  The food was delicious and soooo many choices!!  The best part was the crepe station and the desserts.  The waiters were very attentive andthe price for the buffet was reasonable.

bdYgaCae4KlKW2Y9BTrOww.text: Been here a couple times years ago and i thought it was great, just ate here this past weekend and i was so dissapointed and vowed to never come back here. What kind of buffet has shrimp you have to peel yourself, too much work. However the waitress was super nice. I think the bellagio, wynn and mirage are the better buffets.

AJ8p4d38SLTb-P2unSfE0g.text: Go only if you're staying at The Paris.  Do not make this a destination buffet.  Both breakfast and dinner are adequate at best.  No better and a lot worse than any other hotel buffet.  Don't believe the hype that this is French food--it's not!

A8OhwU9h6J6I3WnChlOVzw.text: I was blown away! We got strawberries dipped at our table for us, crab when we asked, and the food was amazing! I loved how they broke it down by regions of France!

5rYZy35Ckduvkwg2_CEUEQ.text: The food at this buffet was average but the service was good.  I liked the fact that they have fresh crepes but the seafood was mediocre and all of the types of bread available that day were old and chewy.  I thought the price for the buffet was cheap so you pretty much get what you pay for.

RBK48FV50RtGBpU4oG_dPQ.text: I love this buffet for dinner.  They have the best tasting meat and multi-culture food selection.  It's a little expensive, but it's well worth it.

Bz2l-Ar4qvql4v2l6TvKFA.text: The environment is awesome. :) the dessert is not bad ;)...french style.  The food are ok -.-..  I would say it's not bad.

x5lVlCGVfYSh0CBPQPcMlQ.text: their desserts were awesome but the rest of the food was just okay... very average. good ambience and friendly service  though. the line-up here was ridiculously long for some reason (like more than an hour)

oAukgaYaxV1iPXR1fhEkOQ.text: Decided to eat here after finding out that the line for Bachanaal and Wicked Spoon were over 2 hours long! Went here on a Saturday, around 12pm, waited about 40 minutes for a table. Reading the reviews, was kind of mixed on whether we would enjoy this or not, but it was a pleasant surprise. Granted it was our one and only trip to a buffet in Vegas, but super pleased with it. Had pretty much anything you could want and it was all delicious. We got the brunch, so it was unlimited Mimosas (hey I'm a southern lady, love Mimosas ;)  The prime rib was excellent. Also they had a crepe station and you could either pick from their menu or just tell the guy making them what you would like on yours. They were delicious. Oh and for the price compared to the other places, we were really happy with our choice. It seemed "cheap" compared to the other hotels, but there was nothing cheap about the quality, quantity or flavor of the food.

nnGyh6vMOLoxLVprF1tpYQ.text: I come to Las Vegas with my girlfriend every 2 months from the bay area. We usually go to the Wynn buffet every time we come here, but this time we wanted to try something new. So we gave this place a try after looking at the reviews on yelp. I'd like to say it is far from tasty and doesn't have a great selection of food. I only ate 2 plates worth of food, which I was disappointed I wasted. The first plate consisted of Prime Rib, Mashed Potatoes, and cream spinach. The prime rib was extremely well done. (Rubber)... mashed potatoes were mediocre... cream spinach was alright. I thought they served a wide selection of drinks(All You Can Drink) but came to know that they only serve Miller Beer, Champagne, and Wine. The 2nd plate was Crab and Mussels. The crab legs were tiny and the mussels were not the best. They did not have a wide selection of desserts and what they did have was unappetizing. I am an honest reviewer and I only give 5 stars to restaurants that deserve it. I might give this place a try if they change a lot. Next time I will definitely go to the Wynn Buffet its about 110.00 for two, but is the best in Vegas.

cGe8dt2RPmW7ttOhUjFoRA.text: Came here for lunch on a friday, had such a LONG wait in line (even if the line wasn't that long , apparently there was a big group inside so they were splitting up the tables after they left)  was I glad we didn't leave the line.   First off, the prime rib was real tasty , they even had the Canard a l'Orange that tasted exactly like the one I had when I was in Paris (France , not vegas). The selections were great and everything was tasty.  I can go on and on about how great the food was (maybe because I love french food) but the dessert was THE main event for me.  2 things : the crepe station and the creme brulee  The crepe station was amazing since you can pretty much think of what ever crepe you want, and they will make it for you and you can come back for more.  Now for the creme brulee , the fact that you can eat as much creme brulee as you want makes the price more than worth it.

wfUzvop-4WMCOA5hNuYlag.text: I purchased one of the $45-50 Buffet of Buffet passes--giving me access to 7 different casino buffets in a 24-hour period. Some of the choices seemed not-so-good, but I remembered this buffet as being halfway decent when I had tried it years and years ago.   The line was much shorter than on my first trip. I remember about 8-9 years ago, the line went out the door almost into the casino. This time, there were maybe 15-25 people ahead of us. They were a little slow with seating, but nothing outrageous.   The food? Pretty good. I'd say the quality is fairly good, but the selection is a bit lower than my favorite (Bellagio), but still, you are presented with a pretty impressive spread. Then again, I just need a few staples done well with a few flourishes and I'm pretty happy. I'm fairly gluttonous at all-you-can-eat buffet set ups, and I was able to eat my fill. I think of everything I tried, there was only one thing that I didn't really enjoy.   TL;DR: it's one of the cheaper buffets on the strip, the line wasn't ridiculous, you can get it as part of a package deal. Fairly good food if you just want a few staple items to shovel into your face.

ZnSXBdGP-SMcTWE4Ax4B1w.text: Just fantastic.  Come for lunch, stay for dinner.  There were a lot of "exotic" choices (for a homegrown guy like me), but I was able to find enough to sustain myself.  Plus, crepes.  It's a nice little village-y themed place, so it's easy on the eyes, too.  So far, the last three buffets I've encountered (Aria, PH and Paris) have all been really great.

uqMkWLsphglWqQu0x2bGPA.text: Horrible Buffet experience. don't waste your money here. Asked to speak with manager did absolutely nothing to make our dining experience better.the food was really low quality.anywhere is better than here.

Y0BPfXFt4uDWRKe0lOapBQ.text: Awful buffet!  Food wasn't delicious and there wasn't a croissant in sight. Total bummer.

sm6h3relT1Z1VEveJaYxrw.text: Line here moves relatively fast, they got something for everyone, and the trick is to come for the lunch price and stay for dinner :)

sZbe-1oMj74i5hhX1Z5nLA.text: We waited in line for about 25 minutes to get seated. Well I felt pretty disappointed overall to say the least. The lamb and pork were edible. Can't say as much for the chicken and beef. Kind of sad when the best things on the buffet were the vegetables and dessert. Even then heck I feel as a decent cook I could have done something much more flavorful. For about eighties buck a couple I could have stayed home and made an outrageous gourmet meal. Really can't really recomend this bloated fare to anyone high or low who enjoys buffets.

HQdLXOU_1zODBmEnd2Z0UA.text: I don't know why, but Le Village Buffet in Paris is one of my favorite buffets to go when I'm in Vegas. They have everything from steaks to omelets.   My favorite has to be the creme burlee desserts. It never disappointments.   I'm always there on Sunday with their great brunches. Orange juice and champagne. They go together like peanut better and jelly!  Expect to wait in line for about an hour but if your hungry tummy can't deal then for an extra $15 you can go front of line.

eJJ6UtnHxUEYaQ25E_-q5A.text: I frequently go to las vegas and stay in different hotels,however, on my last trip i decided to stay at the Paris Hotel&casino.Well, when i went to eat at the Paris buffet and met with long lines of diners waiting.It took nearly an hour just to be seated.Although the service was good i was very disappointed with the food.It seems to me  that the high quality and standards that this buffet use to were lost somewhere since this place opened.

YADV-xE-DSS-gkfLYxpBmQ.text: Very good buffet. Crepes are amazing. The real reason we come here. Food is good for buffet food. Lines are usually long though.

5ZQOY54yC0AZkJA1RvTvdw.text: This buffet was quite the disappointment. The food didn't look appetizing and they still had breakfast food at 3pm. There weren't that many options and the options that were there wasn't great. Would not return.

dyr3fe4K6PTcD8fD3l_Fcw.text: I've been here twice in the last two years. Food quality and service sucked both times. Their crab legs were a one star as well as the rest.This is definitely not a top 10 las vegas buffet.  Trust me, save the real estate in your stomach for one of the top five buffets. Come here only if you are desperately hungry and can't wait to get to another nearby casino buffet. To the chefs and management of this place: get your act together, this is an embarrassment.

O2wljId9diukbYVMxZAnfQ.text: Le Village was the first buffet we went to on the 'buffet of buffets' package. Overall, the food is really great, considering its buffet nature, and the made-to-order stations are awesome.  Particularly we liked the crepe station as well as the meat carving stations. We liked it so much, we ended up having a breakfast, a lunch and a dinner at the place, which was coincidentally right below our hotel room.   Other choice things to look out for include, - Breakfast omelet -- tasty and made fresh. We did not even experience a long line at the station! - Braised duck. Does more need to be said? - Meat carving stations. Delicious, and the meat tastes as if brined so it has a wonderfully salty flavor throughout.  - Pastas. Surprisingly, these are not a waste of time.  We thought the atmosphere, while completely fake, was charming. The restaurant is in a kind of perpetual dusk, no matter the time of day. The staff were always very nice and helpful.

hnDYYgPiI-00-yZRjIQ6Jg.text: Le Village Buffet = The king of all buffets.  I came here twice within 4 days. For a Vegas buffet, I'd say the price was rather fair. You can pig out on the most delicious French foods that you can't find at home (or at least I can't). The decor is exceptional - with the fake buildings and bright blue sky above you, you feel like you're outdoors in the streets of Paris. They also have a huge variety of desserts. We tried every one of them.

KXJJj6K1ApHd6Swa1BS2Ow.text: We love this place for breakfast!  The crepe station is worth the price of admission.  Make reservations online and skip the line.

SzJzRPp7M55MqAas7Ijrlw.text: I went there for the lunch buffet this time. There were some good options at this buffet. The seaweed salad was tasty, but the sushi was lackluster. They didn't have any chopsticks, either, which is odd for serving that kind of food. The cheddar cheese was very good, and the havarti was decent. The beef tips were tender and juicy, a good choice. The pork belly with apples was also a win. I was very happy to find a variety of vegetables because I bought the Buffet of Buffets pass, so this was the third buffet I had been to in that time period, and the vegetable options had seemed to be limited at some of the other buffets. The brussel sprouts were tender and buttery, but not overcooked. The asparagus, carrots and broccoli were equally as delicious, as were the fingerling potatoes. With the desserts, my absolute favorite was the raspberry topped cheesecake. It was the perfect balance of light creaminess with the fruity topping adding sweetness to the savory. Their chocolate cake was also tasty. They have a good variety of sugar free options, too, but I didn't get any.  The staff in there are friendly enough, but some of them aren't worried about helping someone not in their section. They'd rather hurry right by you and not stop and take a moment to see what you need. I had breakfast here last year and got a crepe, which I enjoyed. I thought they had a good breakfast buffet, and I liked it better than the lunch. I don't know what I'd expect from the dinner buffet from them, though.  It's worth a go with the Buffet of Buffets pass, but I don't know if I'd purchase a way in on its own.

c4L7JqGK1gq6I5_tV79ubA.text: HAHAHA, "Le DAYUM" indeed!!!  Hands down, one of the best buffets on the strip.  The lunch serivce was awesome. Features a wide variety of selection from French locales. Also, random, but they had sushi during the lunch service. Good sushi though!  Be prepared to stand in line. Know that in Vegas, people tend to start their days late. So, if you don't want to stand in line---WAKE UP EARLY.  But seriously, this place is pretty awesome.  P.S TRI TIP!!!!

Jdnv-ufoqxys0idtmKr1gQ.text: I honestly think this is the best value buffet on the strip. We had a Groupon but I would pay full price in the heart beat next time - and there will be a next time! Unbelievable breads, creative dishes like apples and pork belly (SO GOOD), and this pasta I could eat for every meal and just love. All these things would give it 4 stars but then the CREPE! Omg the apple crepe is literally to die for. Find room for it. Highly recommend - and I've eaten at all the major buffets on the strip.

veMXFgnATHPMfxAPHf6MFg.text: After walking around the Paris and seeing how charming the "Le Village" buffet's picturesque decor was we decided to go there for breakfast the next day. It was the worst buffet experience I have had in Las Vegas. I waited in line for about 20 minutes for a crepe. There were 7 people in front of me. The crepe chef was painfully slow and inexperienced. When I got my strawberry and ricotta crepe, I went back to my table, cut into it and discovered that the strawberry filling was frozen. The strawberries were rock hard frozen. The "ricotta" topping was mostly cool whip. I went to the fresh fruit table and picked up a strawberry that was covered with green mold. Moved on to the nearby cheeses. Smoked Gouda pasteurized processed cheese food slices. Cheddar. Pepper jack. Not a single French cheese to be found. The croissants were dry and stale. The baguettes tasted like they came from a poor quality super market. I just gave up in disgust. It really was a charming ambience. I really wanted to like this buffet. But the quality of the food was abysmal. Such an insult to the culinary culture of France. If you want a buffet with good French pastries, breads, and cheese, go to across the Blvd to Bellagio

90oQNbjMfHxOHDIv9e6bZw.text: Been to a few other buffets in Vegas (Rio and Bellagio), and I'd have to say this was by far my least enjoyed. I'm not sure if it was because we came around brunch (11 AM), or it was just the day of the week (Thurs) but we were quite disappointed with the selection, as well as the freshness of the food, especially coming from the French! We got mostly breakfast/brunch food, but they were swapping out the food as we were starting. They had a lot of breakfast foods like sausage, benedict, crepes, fruit, cheese, most of the standard stuff. As they were bringing in more of the lunch items (paella, prime rib, shrimp) we switched to those items but weren't very impressed with what we got. A lot of the dishes were dry or bland, not very tasty at all.  The best part was the dessert, which consisted of some flan, macrons, custard, and ice cream, among the array of cakes. It's not a terrible price ~ $30 after taxes and tip, but if we were closer to Rio we would go somewhere else instead. Definitely will try somewhere else next time.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area

ki2j04qXXWt_O2MbZBhFyw.text: This is the grossest buffet I've ever eaten. If it weren't for the crab I'd ask for refund. Who keeps eggs Benedict in warm water.  Ham and Canadian ham kept in warm water. I just hope I don't get sick later.

cVQKR5v7vGKQOr-Mye1tCg.text: The quality of the buffet itself is not on par with the prices they charge. I paid over $30 for just one person, and I was very disappointed. The service and atmosphere are great! You can tell at one time, upper management actually cared about what they served. They do have a pretty wide selection of food, but nothing was really notable or special in my opinion. I would simply look for another buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet Marquee.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating area &amp; Buffet.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Seating area.

bgD6XNSIw-eGW3iEAcZJfQ.text: Very impressed with the selection of food and quality! Not the biggest but definitely one of the best we have had so far here in Vegas. Husband and I had everything from the chicken, duck, seafood, sushi, prime rib and so on. The dessert was great and staff were friendly. Will definitely be back!

4D0S1JxzZiI86nthbjNOyA.text: We were give some vouchers for our meals so I decided that we will try this buffet with a Parisian touch. The first thing I noticed were the macarons, crepe station and giant pile of snow crab legs! The rest of the food was decent. The leg of lamb was very good!  Sadly, most of the macarons only had a chocolate filling.... the outside was different but inside all the same? And too sweet... My favourite was the crepe station....

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ApgdEyDRV3K6YUDRGD-IaA.text: Located in the Paris Hotel Casino on the Famous Las Vegas Strip. A shell of its former self. I am terribly sad to report this, but there it is. This was once a glorious buffet, that could rival Bellagio. Now it's just another average overpriced buffet on the strip. The first time I went here several year ago, I was blown away by the unusual and elegant selection. Now, not so much. I think it's time for a reboot. So if you're on the strip, spend your hard earned bucks at Cesars, Bellagio, or Wynn. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gSs4BMUIsAhxgLbHHxelhw.text: Really please do not take your family here, the food is gross the macaroons were made incorrectly. If I could have given it no stars I would. I know it has a lot of good reviews. But this place is gross I also had a dead fly in my mimosa. Everything seem like they had made it two days prior all the food look fake.

yMdlQRWJXZ3CCgzp3mUMpg.text: Terrible. Don't waste your time. Definitely don't waste your money. Nothing is labeled correctly, the crab legs were frozen, the prime rib was cold. Crepes were good but you couldn't customize. You get what's on the menu or nothing at all. The servers are rude. Everything about this place is awful. Waste of time and calories.

tI0v4GDm9vatVzm6l0ZSkw.text: Completely unexpected.  We would have had a better experience at Palms AYCE.    Seafood is served but chilled.  No options - some Mexican but no Asian.  Maybe they were aiming for a solely French experience?  Roast was dry.  No pasta station.  They didn't even have the pre-requisite Vegas buffet item - pizza.  The food was old - even an hour after the menu was swapped to dinner only an hour ag  Cleanup attendants walked past twice and didn't bat an eye - their stations were empty.  They were pushing around empty cleanup carts for 5 minutes.    Our waitress Roxanne was exceptional even if she was tending to way too many tables on her own.  This place doesn't make sense - for all the French accoutrements and decor, you'd think it would have a menu to match.  Not so.  Harrah's bought Paris. It's gone downhill since.  This is a place to avoid.  Don't be fooled by the Groupon deal for 2 - not worth the $64 we spent.  Roxanne sent the manager over and we spoke with Cindy, who invited us back for breakfast- not brunch.  We'll review again if we decide to come back.

kYMqhZpZeUdUz7aiJ1RaHg.text: Oooh la la!  Picture a buffet that has all yummy items. Except in a French sexy way. Welcome to Le Village Buffet! The last thing I want to do is walk for miles and miles in the hot sun with a full gut. But how could you not eat all the crepes? OMG, its crepe heaven up in this place. And no one to stop you? It's like injecting crepes. And I can do all my own creations! Here Jacques, add some more Nutella to that bad boy. Go man go!   What a wonderful buffet, nothing but smiles every time we go

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go baby go
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

W9m-4t0TAGMNiLULErU2rw.text: Showed up with a party of 9. 1 was a child who wasn't feeling well and wasn't planning to eat.  This was meant to be a birthday celebration.   The staff at the front and who sat is made near impossible for us to start the celebration. Since we didn't tell the people at the register that we were a party of 9 they couldn't seat us together or in the same section. They would have to separate us per ticket. Seriously?!?!   First they took the party of 4. Sat us far out away from the other 5. This was the "Best" that they could do for not being aware. There were many empty tables but they went out of their way to make sure our group.   The birthday girl was fed up and asked to speak to the manager. Instead of just calling. She (I didn't get her name) just gave total attitude and mimicked the Birthday girls request. She called someone on the radio and walked away.   This is where Nina stepped in. Nina was the second lady working on seating people. She wasn't crazy about anything that had been going on. She gave us attitude as we're but she came through in the end. Nina actually showed some compassion. She was finally willing to sit us together as a group.   We were finally able to start our birthday celebration!  Our waitress was absolutely amazing!  I'm glad we were able to get past the seating issue and get to the food & great company.

NzBjuV35j5QSpIXb9KuCVQ.text: Without spending $50 at Bellagio or Caesars, I was a bit skeptic about finding a good breakfast buffet for a decent price due to all of the avg reviews, but this place was really good....and $27! Tons of options including a crepes and omelette station. I chose raisin french toast, fingerling potatoes, chorizo hash, mini waffles w warm cherries, xtra crispy bacon...even got a lil' taste of the lunch menu before we left: crabs, shrimp & prime rib. And, the freshly squeezed orange juice was an added bonus. Very satisfied, great choice!

PocJli7h0Gk78j2NjJwjqg.text: Le Village has many, many options from different cuisines across the world. The bread is freshly baked, and they have fresh seafood options available too. The desert station also has many options for those with sweet teeth.

eEmOVgEQTpUiWpqNHR7c0A.text: This place doesn't even deserve 1 star. Went out for a Friday night dinner at this buffet. We thought it would be nice because of the location in the Paris, however, it was the worst place we've eaten in Vegas. First, you get charged and leave a tip on your ticket when you arrive only to find out that have to get your own drinks and once in a while, there is a staff member to clear up any dishes. There were no dinner plates available. We were told to wait for the dishwasher. We used salad plates the while time. The crab legs were picked over, the other food was not good and the dessert area should be shut down.  There was even a bowl of apples and oranges at the dessert station. I've never wanted to peel an orange at a buffet! Anyway, don't waste your time and money. There are way better places to eat!

2ThJfm2a_ayNL8NHPvP8gg.text: I was so excited to try out this buffet. I was very disappointed. Cold food very low quality. I spent 125 for 4 people. Also service wasn't good at all waiters would not come to pick up dishes. Anyway won't be coming back.

tWmREmwcfbQlE951Y1ivMQ.text: Holy cow this place sucksssssss, don't come here. You'll wait 30 minutes just to get your own drinks as it's practically all self serve, the alcohol line is literally a 30 minute wait and the food options are slim to none!! Just do yourself a favor and pick something else!

VNVSmHhxpfy9mgyGrJVMOw.text: On their website, they claim it is a departure from traditional expectations. And, it is a departure from traditional expectations you would have of French food--it is traditional American food and poorly made. Some buffet's at least have good deserts, but this one has bland, poor looking and dry deserts. If you want what they advertise they have, go elsewhere or you will be disappointed.

x_J4w5lmoLswpFkCdvp01g.text: I used to love this buffet, today the only good thing remaining is the crepes!  This place is dirty, horrible customer service, careless cooks eating while working with no gloves while customers are present, imagine what they do when they think no one is watching! Never again coming here.

tq1mduuaPcrHBrpxPi_bkQ.text: We went here for breakfast and I got a little piece of everything, just so I could try it all. As with most of the hotel/casino buffets, all of it was edible, but very little of it was mesmerizing. It's a typical buffet.  The variety is good and the atmosphere is quite nice, Howe the flow of the restaurant is a bit crowded.   Likes: my favorite and a must try was the smoked trout, sausage links, and bear claws. I didn't try the omelette, but they looked great.   Dislikes: the crepe station was such a let down. We got the berry crepe with cream. There was so much cream put on it that you couldn't taste anything else. The cream was also full fat cream and actually made me gag. The crepe shell itself has a traditional crepe flavor, the berries and cream were just a bit off putting. The eggs Benedict hollandaise sauce was made out of mayonnaise and therefore was disappointing in flavor. The food was also behind low glass dividers which made you have to bed down and reach under to get the food in the back.   Overall I would go to a good diner and get custom made food. The variety did not make up for the lack of flavor.

_qkwdyQXpONkxX7uXmBvsw.text: I've been coming to Vegas just about annually since 2003. Easily my worst meal. The place smells weird, the "truffle Mac" tasted like it came out of a box, the roast beef was tough, the macaroons tasted like plastic, the crepes are too thick, and the crab legs leave much to be desired.

PMy_D97iMwSSDjHn7X43Cg.text: I was so disappointed.  I purchase a Groupon for this buffet which was $60, and included unlimited wine and beer.  The food that was supposed to be hot was cold.  The worse thing and what prompted this review is that at the ice cream machine, there was a mess of chocolate and vanilla ice cream, in a puddle at the bottom of the machine.  I will say that their deserts are really good.  They have macaroons which the lemon ones were really good.  Their peel and eat shrimp was good too.  They were big and fresh.  I don't need to ever go back there again.

njnMp3l6dCaordcIrv43dA.text: I went to 3 buffet places while in Vegas, and this is easily my favorite one of the 3 without a doubt. It costs a little more than the other places, but the food is much better IMO, and worth a visit at least once while you're in Vegas. The food was good for the most part here(only a few very minor misses food-wise), and my favorite part was definitely the station where you could order 8 selections of crepes(4 savory, 4 sweet). Macarons(sp?) also weren't bad, either. Cool interior faux-French and European style interior, as well.  We got here not long after it opened on a February weekday, and the line wasn't too bad to enter. I imagine it can get really long and bad at times to get inside and eat, though.  4.5 stars.

gNBqU1xzULJwQKunP543tg.text: Ask them to grill your bleeding prime rib slice, turns out mouthgasmic :'O  Made to order crepes but that guy is NOT happy to be there. I somehow experienced a guilt trip through just his energy and cutting of the eyes at me. Eeeeesh...awwwwwwkwarrrrrd.  The prime rib re-grilled slice is why i'll keep coming back. AND its part of the 24-hour buffet pass!

M_66bfNG27BqzwqWZtSOLg.text: For starters, over an hour and a half wait in line on a Monday evening...thankfully our server was perfectly nice and on top of her game. However the quality and taste of the food just did not make up for the long wait time. Prime rib, what we were most looking forward to, was just ok. The snow crab legs were great, as was the truffle pasta and mashed potatoes. But an hour and a half wait for good pasta? With as many buffets as there are in Las Vegas, Le Village needs to up its game. 'Just ok' is just not good enough.

x4Kuw8xW7WJpm3zeI7FX6g.text: I was pretty disappointed by this buffet. I found the lay out to be bizarre, and there were limited options. Basically there were just variations of the same food at every station (i.e.  Mashed potatoes, potatoes au gratin, roasted potatoes etc.). The crab legs were the best part, the prime rib disappointed and was poorly cooked.

s5za8pF6oYjjjFQI8cRNxg.text: By far, the worst food we had while in Vegas. My sister & I came here for an early dinner one night & paid $33 a piece. At first glance, it seemed to be full of great choices & we couldn't wait to make it to the great looking dessert station. We tried a lot of different things. The pesto pasta salad was the most memorable thing I got. Everything else was just ok or not good. Many things weren't flavored well or weren't at the right temperature. We pushed our plates aside to make our way to the lovely looking desserts. We piled on the sweets so we could sample most everything. The only good things were the peanut butter cookies & the apple torte crumble. Everything else was disappointing to say the least. Everything that should have been cold, like the cheesecake, was room temp or slightly warm. The macaroons the just plain nasty. I literally had to spit mine out. It tasted like badly burned coffee with a chewy texture. This place was a total waste of $60+. Only reason for 2 stars is that we didn't get food poisoning.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They look good, but looks can be deceiving. The peanut butter cookie was good.

LOAMbo9A9tdao_b8EQGbTg.text: This place is so cute! don't forget to reserve a table through opentable.com to skip the lines! we didnt know there was another area to be checked in, and waited a long time only to find out we were in the wrong line! Their buffet items were pretty good, although the crepes were just ok. It had a nice feel to the entire restaurant as it seems like you're strolling along the streets of paris. We also had a groupon deal and it came with a bottle of wine. Unfortunately, we're not wine drinkers, so we substituted the wine for other beverages. Too bad they didnt let us take it out of the restaurant without uncorking it.

Jstqczz3Kv0pnvc0GIPmtw.text: Amazingly good food for a buffet.  I was in the Bally's hotel and this was very close by.  The atmosphere is excellent and the setting was great.  I stuck with the seafood and was more than satisfied.  Finished with a crepe and coffee - a very good meal indeed.  Will come back again!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

0VIv4fYWA2qI-bIAGhq9mw.text: I was hoping the food was going to be fantastic but I was extremely disappointed. Especially since the wait was about 45mins. The atmosphere itself was okay. It could definitely use some updating. The choices or options of the food weren't the greatest. Usually my favorite part are the varieties at buffets for desert but it was a huge let down. The signs were all labeled incorrectly. The only food worthwhile were the pretzel rolls, if that tells you anything. We go to Las Vegas every year for SEMA and next time, we won't be going to this buffet nor will we recommend it to anyone. There are so many awesome restaurants and buffets to go too, erase this one off the bucket list. Try the Wynn, it's pricey but beyond worth it.

meSNdW1iwgvi8ZkNdTplYw.text: Eh this one honestly didn't impress me all too much. LOL once I did find it that is. I will say that they have a beautiful ceiling painting in here and several of the normal things you would find at a buffet but not much stood otu to me except they had decent quiche, spinach dip, and beautiful desserts. This is part of the buffet of buffets and was my second breakfast/ brunch. Overall I probably would skip this one if I were doing the Buffet of Buffets again

g_-truOalDX9mW7LEe-tKQ.text: The ambiance is amazing here. Their exterior inside the buffet takes me back to eating outside in Paris in a smaller scale.   Thanks from other Yelpers recommended this place for breakfast especially with a 24 hour buffet pass.   There is a huge variety for breakfast. They have make your own omelettes and sweet/savory crepes. There are regular scrambled eggs and egg whites. The usually toast, bagels, pancakes, french toast, bacon, and sausages. They serve bacon slabs at the carving area which taste way better than regular bacon.   The service is superb.   The lighting for breakfast is really dim. It felts like the sun just started to rise up at 5 am. Hopefully they can change the lighting for different hours in the day.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little Paris in Vegas
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It&#39;s a very nice ambience but a little dim for breakfast.

vRxf6RGBucFEwpTzHau0Fg.text: We come here with our family on every visit to Vegas. There's a big selection of different kinds of foods and deserts. My favorite is definitely the crepe station. It's about $40 a person, so it's okay for the price. Servers are very fast and friendly.

LwCG-tWOo4oy6cSXQuai0A.text: Started with this buffet for lunch.  Waited about 30 min.  Serivice was not so hot.  We had gotten up to get our 1st plate of food and by the time we got back, we were still waiting on our drinks.  She was very nice but I think she just had too many tables.    The beef was tough.  You have to time it just right.  I got the shrimp cocktail which was great.  The pastas were were not bad as well.  Long lines for the crepes so be prepared to wait.    Desserts were great, loved the creme brulee & flan  The esclairs were also good and the ice cream.  I prefer more seafood which they didn't have a lot at lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. desserts

GReKls-u5qk18CKI7XvotA.text: The service here is equally as bad as the food. They are not incompetent as they are un-helpful. The food and options are limited and some of the worst I've tasted in Vegas. The desert is better, but again limited. I got hurt from one of their crab claws for which I asked for the shell cracker which they didn't have and I got cut and had to talk to the manager to get a bandaid. No sympathy for any of the problem they caused. Do Not Go there if it's coming out of your pocket! If it's not, be careful.

4RI1IWhAsiHayKUUhRW6Qw.text: Recently, we tried dining at Le Village during our short holiday vacation from California. We were pleasantly surprised by the great quality and variety of entrees prepared for the hearty diners.  I enjoyed the savory duck with an orange sauce, chilled crab legs, very lean and great choice of prime rib. It was so tender that I could cut my meat with a fork.  One down side was the pork buns were over cooked in the steamer.  Probably 4-6 hours siting in the steamer.  The Chinese selection needs some updating.  Some of the serving trays were empty.  Our table server was too busy, so we had to ask for water numerous times.

OHxCSLTHRXWu_dU9ii3xsQ.text: Came here on a Saturday evening and there was no wait.  Highlights are the prime rib, crab legs, and creme brulee.  Everything else was about average.  Service was prompt and friendly.

0529NQNKhApo3-GeghINBQ.text: This buffet is overpriced and has mediocre dishes.  They consider a child an adult at 9 years old, which is a scam.  Quality and authenticity are sorely lacking.  For example, their lacklustre macaroons were upside down and mismatched, and were made with fake (unhealthy) food colouring.  For a family of 5 (husband, wife, daughter age 13, son age 12, daughter age 10) we dropped $150.00 for this sorry meal.  Avoid this buffet if at all possible, and head to the Palms, where the pricing is reasonable and the food quality is superior.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZcwFE13rhZGVWKb_jv22Cg.text: We ate here Thursday night.  Called ahead the day before made reservations for 630 pm.  Was able to walk right in pay and go get a table.  No lines!  Not sure what our servers name was right now.  He was amazing though!  He offered us a bucket of steamed crab legs!  So much better than what is on the buffet.  They had good shrimps, really good fish,  the mussels/clams were delicious!   Truffle Mac and cheese yummy!   Their selection of desserts omg!  I had 4 yes 4 of the creme brulee! Tried a bite of my sisters macaroons the red and green (red filling tasted like fluff). (Green was coffee). So good!   My hubby & grandma were bragging on the prime rib (apparently to die for) Will definitely be back here!  .

yaLOmRiIYpQ1XB5ymUFDsw.text: We came here for a large group of family for a dinner the day before my bf's counsin's wedding.  I really enjoyed this place.  I thought they had a ton of food and desert options.  All the food was good quality and hot.  They even had a crepe station that made you HUGE crepes.

ZzJ_wAs92wIDCJBWNLJgNg.text: Lot of selection, the decor is really pretty and the atmosphere is much different than most places.  The staff is very friendly (especially that gentleman that was doing the carvery early in the morning - A super friendly black guy).  He was super nice and deserved a tip, but he doesnt have a tipping bowl.    The crepe and omlette in the morning have tipping bowls, and if I don't tip I get the most rudest and mean service for getting one of them ever.  I mean, for something like an omelette or crepe where they're just doing their job, I don't see why I would tip.  I'm glad to tip for people who provide me with service and give me a smile regardless, then I go back to tip... but out of all buffets, this is the only place that literally has gigantic tip bowls and they expect you to tip (not like you've already paid for the buffet and need to tip the server as well).  Shady to me, also the service if you don't tip is offensive!  Anyways, the food is okay, and the crepes are okay as well..

w0jHf2Vo2xCyeAJ-gY_ptw.text: This is my favorite dinner Buffet that I have tried in Vegas, I have been here many times and was never unsatisfied. They have the best Creme Brulee, Their prime rib was very good as well. & I love the sautee'd mushrooms.  I have to come here every-time I visit Vegas. Their deserts are very good, I just had a problem finding a small plate that wasen't heated for them, otherwise I would have given 5 stars. Oh, & the "let me take your picture & try to sell it to you" thing.

-oYMxFyNL1y5l2BMEnIXkg.text: We arrived at 10 am for breakfast and so happy we did because we also got to try their lunch menu at 11 am. Expect a wait of 30 min. It's a beautiful space with friendly servers who are eager to refill your glass. Good quality was high and fresh. My favorite was the omelette bar and dessert area. We loved it so much, we came back the next day!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Raspberry and chocolate macaron with a pistachio tart. Yum!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nibbles: pate, clams, Brussel sprout and baby carrot.
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Trying a bit of everything.

_bndOYS-AH2vtwFoJK3xEA.text: Super disappointing Champagne Brunch. We tried the dinner buffet before and thought it was average, so why not try it again since the line wasn't too bad.... wish we didn't. The only thing I ate that was okay was the prime rib. Other than that I pretty much had one bite and tossed the rest. Kudos to the crepe chef though. He was multi-tasking like crazy between the crepe and waffle stations. If you MUST eat here remember to bring your players card for a "discount".

6Jj6Ln1p5aSIAABQG19beA.text: Coffee is the best. Signs are not up. Lack of special dish. Disorganized. Nice waitress. Very so so crepe.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9Zm3TNT06Y76nH4-O2vKbw.text: Save your money and go somewhere else. Vegas is full of better buffets and this is definitely not one of them. The pastries were stale and the whip cream garnish on them was so old that it wouldn't even spread. The food was bland and the service was beyond slow. I had to ask our hostess to clear our plates and to bring us drinks so many times. We had waited 15minutes until she took our drink order. They clearly lack customer service. Definitely a waste of money and not worth the 35+ a person.

IGQzpIJlYBPPOLdzTUV8xA.text: I wanted to oh-la-la this place since its so charming inside.  Faux French chateau lined the walls with trees that looked like birds could fly out, sit on your finger and sing a lullybye with you.  However, all that Cinderella animation sing-a-long came crashing down when I started eating the breakfast buffet.  Here's my bad experience list: 1) coffee - wasn't strong enough and they served the cream in a plastic cup.  How tacky is that? 2) After getting every egg dish out there, I needed my ketchup and hot sauce.  The server never looked our way, never checked on us, and was not able to see my waves of desperation.  Unfortunately, I swiped the bottles away from another table, after the couple left.  Sigh... 3)  Every egg dish was bad.  Lox scrambled eggs tasted like rotten salmon fishy runny eggs.  Scrambled eggs was just mush.  Eggs Benedict was hard as heck and the hollandaise sauce was not flavorful.  Ham and cheese omlets - bleh again! 4) Every potato dish was bad.  Hash browns was dry.  Square hash brown was super hard and super dry.  Sliced potato fries was just greasy. 5) Corn beef hash - wow, this a big ol' greasy spoon  Okay side: 6) Bacon - I guess you can't really go wrong with this one 7) Waffle and maple syrup - it was warm and the syrup was okay  Good!: 8) Sour dough toast with strawberry jam  To top things off, I was never able to get my server to provide me with water.  I was stuck drinking washed out coffee.  I had higher expectations from Paris and it failed me.

8tyd5fYQMnj1_XRKW7Ow8w.text: "A-Ok" if you come on a groupon deal and just want to chow down on some sliced snow crab legs with minimal effort while downing a bottle of wine included in the deal.  This place used to be on the elite end of buffets a while back alongside Bellagio, but they too have joined the ranks of mediocrity.  The prime rib was overdone and nothing special (buffet at Aria still has the best buffet prime rib).  The highlight of the meal would be the crepe station at the end, but forget getting a "savory" crepe that would have cheese meat and veggies as the lady cooking the crepe is in such a rush to get your crepe done and go on to the next, that the cheese inside the crepe hasn't melted even 1%...it's like eating a fork full of shredded cheese out of a bag at the supermarket...so go for the sweet crepe for dessert and skip the savory as any part of your meal.  Everything else wasn't worth mentioning.   The ambiance is nice but the food has really slipped. I would kick myself for paying full price.

OC6OJ1f7rrOyPsAD40qvKQ.text: I'm not a fan of crepes, so it's obvious where this review is going. Lunch was good. Definitely glad we chose to do the buffet of buffets, otherwise we would have been upset had we paid regular price.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dining area
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to Le Village Buffet

98vw5JvrYKjD3upA6j9mQA.text: Mediocre food served with a side of attitude from the hostess?!?! No thanks!   She must be on the rag. Chill the eff out lady!

4he8lRyoeJIglPuod-wXZQ.text: Not too good in my opinion, the ambiance is super nice though. We sat so far away from the food that I got lost to where our seat was. Not that much seafood and their varieties do not seem that appealing. Everything you see, you probably have eaten before. Nothing special. For $36.00 a person, I was expecting a bit more. I wouldn't come back to this buffet, it is a good one time experience at least.

WjwDj2DsaiUOR61JuTd6NA.text: The worst buffet I've ever been to in my visits to Las Vegas. Waste of money and time. I'd rather go to McDonald's next time than waste my time here, at least I know I'll get a warm fresh food from McDonald's than here. The food are cold, old and stale with no turnover whatsoever, who knows how long those food have been out on display. Even the dessert was awful. It was the most miserable feeling with every bite of food I had to take in. No chance of getting back nor recommending this place to  anyone ever. The servers or the one that we got her name is Sue seem to not care at all, no tip for this one. Very bad place to eat at. Should've trusted my gut on this one. Bring a bottle of tums or any antacids if u want to go eat here. Or if you're constipated u might want to eat here coz their food will make u want to have a loose bowel movement. SMH

DL19Jg3bldEArqZ6v1DdXw.text: My friends and I visited the Le Village Buffet twice, once for dinner and the second was for breakfast, due in part because we purchased the Buffet of Buffets pass. After reading some tips in regards to the buffet of buffets my friends and I decided that the Le Village Buffet and the Spice Market Buffet were the only 2 buffets worth visiting.   The Le Village Buffet definitely feels like a Vegas buffet. The interior resembles a small French village that successfully makes you believe that you've been transported to another country, but that is as French as it gets. Once you see the entrees offered you'll realize that the Le Village Buffet is just like any other Vegas buffet, with the exception of a full packed crepe station. Luckily the food at the Le Village Buffet is cooked very well.  Breakfast: When we came for breakfast, my friends and I were excited to try some authentic crepes. Unfortunately the majority of the crepes offered were a let down. I tried a berry filled crepe, a banana nutella crepe, a ham and cheese crepe, and lastly a green onion chicken crepe. Out of the 4 the best was the banana nutella crepe and my least favorite was the green onion chicken crepe (I'd actually recommend not even ordering the green onion chicken crepe).  The other breakfast items offered were delicious. I strongly recommend grabbing an eggs benedict, (the hollandaise sauce was light but not overpowering, unlike the Spice Markets benedict which was unappetizing, due to the strong mayonaise taste), the carved ham was cooked to perfection, and the maple syrup polenta was simply too good. I'd avoid the bacon slab, which is basically a large thick cut of bacon; there was just too much fat and it was way too salty.   Dinner: Just a FYI, there's literally no special French entrees, so just keep that in mind when coming here for dinner. Overall the dinner items offered are very good. There's a good variety of selections, with the carving station being the highlight. The prime rib was moist and tender, and topping it off with some aju only made it better. I'd stay away from the crab legs though, they didn't seem very fresh and one of my friends actually left a little sick. Other than that the rest of dinner items offered were quite good.  Overall I'd definitely come back to Le Village Buffet, and if I do get the buffet of buffets pass again then I'll probably visit only this buffet, unless you purchase the premium buffets.  To good eatings :)

S7QQkRbaPwwuDvYZW4CvwA.text: This was the best buffet out of the 3 I visited using the Buffet of Buffets 24 hour pass! PH Spice Market & Harrah ' s Flavors. Dinner is excellent and dessert is on point! Great customer service!

BUhIHPlht3eHp-iT7OhEZQ.text: Having dinner with family and could not be more disappointed. All the food stations look abandoned. The food is dry, unflavored, and some stations haven't been refilled the entire time. It's overpriced considering what you're getting. The lady at the rotisserie station managed to serve me BIG chunks of fat from the prime rib, even after I asked her multiple times to give me a different piece. They need better staff, better food, better service. The one star is for the kind waitress we got.

ufFuHlEz_QA76pKILmtaxA.text: Finally! After trying to eat here on 2 or 3 other vacations, I ate at here!!  The line is always long at prime meal hours, so get there early!!  We ate our late lunch/early dinner at like 3:30 - no problem, since we had to make it an early night because we were leaving to drive to Disneyland the next morning at 4 am!  The selection is not as vast as I envisioned, but there was a lot to choose from.  We made about 3 or 4 rounds, and I was ready to roll out of there afterward.  I really can't remember what I grabbed - some salad, some meats, roasted veggies, more meat, crab legs (pre split for your convenience!), crepes, ice cream, I'm getting hungry just thinking about it!  Most of the food was good, fresh and well prepared.  I had a small serving of roast beef that was a little dry.  Service was kinda slow - we had to wave down our server to get refills on drinks and our plates weren't taken away as fast as we would have liked them to.  I don't think I'll be returning to this buffet, but I'm glad I finally got to eat hear - crossing it off my Vegas Eats list!

5cf24FrzDZ-H3X9DpW2rfA.text: This Buffet is very disappointing, the fruit tastes old, the food sits out for long periods and they will occasionally come and stirred up to make it look like  it hasn't been crusted over from the heat lamps LOL Nothing inspiring, nothing fresh, it's all tasteless, definitely skip this buffet for breakfast.

PLTCReIij4ubbKu9BNmqrw.text: Probably the worst buffet money can buy. I went on a thanksgiving weekends and it was packed. An hour long wait for cold dry meat and bad tasting coffee. The "sushi" they served were imitation crabmeat on old rice. The actual crabs they had were hard.  The lines were super long everywhere and the variety was paltry. They served sausages that compares to what you would buy at 7 eleven.  This buffet was so bad by far that I took 5 hours just to drive there to have the biggest disappointment of the year. By the way Paris hotel if you're gonna send me vouchers, send it to a dog shelter instead. Actually scratch that, not even dogs will eat your food.

WkmDe9CjnDZKX6YPIYF-7w.text: I thought it was overpriced and underwhelming. They didn't bring the drinks until 10 minutes after we started eating. The sliced roast beef was oversalted and the unconventional items like sushi were downright terrible.

B5ExPW_EkviZ8A3DqChVAA.text: As a proud glutton, here's a tip: come for breakfast at 10:15am and you can stay for lunch.  When I go on a trip, first and foremost, I need to know that my tummy is going to be taken care of. I don't give a hoot about scenery, I just want to eat. Maybe it's the Filipino in me, but I need breakfast, snack, lunck, snack, dinner and then after maybe something to tide me over till bedtime. Buffet of Buffets takes care of that and this is our first stop.   We line up around 10am and it takes about 20 mins to get to the cashier. It's like Disneyland: you wait in line and just when you think you're inside, there's another snake-y line. So we pay and since I have a Total Rewards Card, a) it's cheaper by like $5 and b) I don't get to wear a bracelet all the live long day... you see this, you think it's for a club... no, it's for a buffet... ahahaaa...  Our server is such a nice guy. So happy, so full of life... totally happy to help us get enough coffee, juice, pop (for me) and water... it must have been because he was off soon because another woman who looked really unhappy became our server. Still brought us our stuff, but I felt bad asking her.  I started out with bacon and sausage... I picked up some macaron-y looking things and some yogurt with mangoes. Obviously, the meat was good. Who can screw up bacon? The macaron-y things were wonderful. I got two to start in case they were weird, but they were really crispy chewy with lemon curd in the middle. The mangoes were under ripe. My only complaint. Why can't I find good mango anywhere? Before breakfast was over, I ran and made sure I got a biscuit with country gravy. You wanna do this right? Get a bowl from the yogurt area to allow for maximum gravy on your biscuit without getting it all over your macarons.  Then, the change over! Like a mad dash, all the people in the restaurant clamor to get in line. I have a slice of prime rib. Wow. The meat is cooked to my liking- rare and it's so tender. To go with that, I get some of the truffle mac and cheese. I wish I had gotten more. It's so creamy and the flavour is dare I say, AMAZING! So good. I've googled how to make it, but I don't even want to attempt in case I sully the good memory of this mac and cheese. Of course, I grab more desserts, but this time it's two creme brulees. The sugar was crackly... sometimes at buffets, the tops can be sub-par, but not here.   Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wH_mEWCQA39tQ9FSQTTswQ.text: This place ranked top best 5 buffets in Vegas so had to try.  Well...definitely top 5.  Great food with variety of choices.  And the deserts....woo!!!  Macaroons, Flans, Chocolate cakes, Crepes and the warm Cheeries and Prunes over Vanilla icecream was to die for.  Man oh man i am stuff!!!!  Time for some Pokers and Black Jacks - I am out!

_yxUvZ3LoLeLmokVBRdvUQ.text: Hungover we dragged ourselves to this Buffet for brunch. The wait wasn't that long and right when we were seated we had all ordered some mimosa's and it was promptly brought to us. Best way to start off the morning, we all then split up and got some grub. The prime rib was delicious and the eggs Benedict wasn't the best I ever had so I barely touched that, the smoked salmon was a bit stronger flavor than I'm used to and the best of it all was the giant plate of crab we shared at our table. This place was decent for $30 per person. I think what won us over was the great customer service, we had a chef who personally went to get us rice even though they did not have any and went to the other buffet to get us some, cuz us asians can't live without it and our waitress was VERY attentive, talk about fast refills on mimosas!

9WICeSpxA9A9YfR-tYzWGQ.text: Attn Yelpers: THIS BUFFET HAS GONE TO SHIT.  I used to eat here semi-regularly 3-4 years ago. Went again this trip after having not gone in a while.   Service was good, but everything I had was bland and overcooked...had to eat extra desserts and bread just to get full as the meat was inedible (even the freshly carved prime rib. The freshly carved pork was ok.)  Kind of sad. I will miss this place.

J_nCTZ-Iv0n9OHz2-Tf09g.text: Cavatappi with truffle cream sauce is the bomb! It tastes amazing. It's better when it's fresh. Everything here is intriguing, the atmosphere, the food, and the employee uniforms. I will come back here again

x9ACBiGY_yvuwfquypfJnQ.text: Wasn't horrible but wasn't fabulous either.  We went here on a Friday for lunch.  We were staying at the Bally's so we got these $5 off coupons for this buffet.  Ended up being $14 a person so really can't complain.  They had a crepe bar which was pretty great but only sweet crepes.  Great selection but once again, food wasn't amazing.  I think the only thing I had seconds of was the pasta area, oh and the soft serve ice cream of course!

moNrk-L2DPjkrcKbQ17QTQ.text: paris is my favorite breakfast/brunch buffet in vegas.    my only complaint right now is about one of the operators that answer the phone, lorenz (phonetic)  the 10YO really wanted king crab legs, and i called around to different buffets to see which ones offered it earlier in the day. (we were leaving that day)  all the buffets i called prior to calling paris only served them with dinner.  when i called paris to see whether they had crab legs for breakfast or lunch, i was told that they don't.  then i asked what time the crab legs came out (because i really wanted to eat at paris before leaving)  and lorenz said they came out at 11:30 or so.    ME:  "Um, i thought you said they weren't served for breakfast or lunch." LORENZ:  "They're not.  king crab legs are served during brunch"  REALLY?  are we playing word games here?    basically, had i not asked what time the crab legs came out, i wouldn't have known, and we would have eaten elsewhere.  what an arse

J1QhcqpMAja5bP3_0RTA4g.text: A champagne brunch on Sunday here with gratuity costs $34 per person (we were in a large group).  If you like cold seafood like crab legs and shrimp cocktail, this is the place for you. For others who don't, there are quite a few other things you can try that will tingle your taste buds. For example, the crepes are great. Have one with nutella and banana, or try the pasta or any of the breads they have. The Greek food station was average, and they skimped on the chicken in the fetuccini.   I thought they lacked a bit of variety. Service was great though and the champagne was actually nice (not the cheap stuff that tastes like cheap wine with fizz).  Overall, an average experience, and a bit over-hyped.

HUAkz38eObAgDqfp6He6sg.text: Excellent all around.  Inspired French-themed buffet choices with everything a tasty delight.  From the faux Parisian street cafe decor to the savory cheeses & meats, saucy ratatouille and crispy-skinned creme brulee.  Deservedly popular, and an included venue for the "Buffet of Buffets," so anticipate a wait.  Come hungry and ooh-la-la!

3JQ5putoZn3Si9X9IoeLUw.text: My first Las Vegas buffet!  Came here last year with two of my girl friends. We got in line and were immediately greeted by a manager who took us out of the line and brought us through a  roped off special entrance to the left. We payed for the buffet, he sat us immediately, snapped to the waiter and ordered us champagne on the house. The food was really good and the waiters were amazing. I am going back with my husband next week. I'm sure the service will be a bit different but I am still looking forward to the food!

WwuEK3OyVnfVuMb724z5MQ.text: Love, love, love this buffet. Breakfast is by far my favorite meal of the day, and this buffet has an excellent selection.  Everything was great, but the ham and cheese croissants were to die for and the chocolate chip cookies are awesome (ok, not really a breakfast food, but who can't eat a cookie anytime!).  This is the only Vegas buffet I've been to, but I've stopped looking - I need no other.

Ad71PZ5rd0DR3yLVWJxmjw.text: Just spent the week at Paris la's Vegas. We had dinner at their buffet everything. I tried was luke warm and over cooked and very very very bland.  I would skip this one for sure!

9A_YnRvs3ItJOeeg25saIw.text: Yum.  Lots of varieties and not overpriced.  I love the interior/exterior lookalike.  Mmmmm BREAD PUDDING!!!  Long lines... so try not to go when everyone else is going...

RH273_RvrjDBPxsPMojc4g.text: There are way too many good buffets in the world and the top 50 are probably in Las Vegas. But this one in Paris Las Vegas is one of the absolute best.  Lot of choices here Asian, South of the Border, Italian and of course French. Here are the items I love to fill my plate:  -Crab Legs, so many of them -Crepe: yes, there's a crepe chef on duty. -Quiche or whatever that pastry thing is with the soup in it. -Prime Rib: got to have a carvery in the buffet. and -Cheescake: always good.  The prices are usually moderate here, not overly cheap and not overly expensive. I'd estimate they're from $20-$35. Is that right? Good stuff, great stuff...I eat here before watching Mamma Mia at Mandalay.

pUuuIGKOVZtOWGd1F1HXjQ.text: I confess:  when in Vegas, I'm an absolute brunch buffet pig.  Well, OK, I really am a pig everyday, so there.  As enterprising as every little piggie should be, I've made pretty good rounds around Vegas town for those hyped up "best of Las Vegas" buffets.  Rio, Mandalay, Bellagio, Venetian, Wynn ,Caesars.  Whatever.  After a while, I've learned they're all pretty much the same thing with highly variable pricing standards.  Having said that, I think The Village in Paris LV wins hands down for balance in quality of food and value.  Not to mention pig-out factor.

Fu4ThE-TgyAO1WdIsm_Piw.text: Solid buffet. One of my favorites next to the one at Bellagio (yelp.com/biz/the-buffet-...). They have all of your standard buffet foods which would cost a lot if ordered individually at a fancy restaurant - prime rib, seafood, etc. and they have a lot of French pastries and desserts. I get full just looking at all the food I collect on my plate. I'm always comfortable when I come to this buffet. I've been here a bunch of times on different occasions with family members and friends.

brVs9v68jbL-R4Tq9ET-Rg.text: No more made to order omelets and you can't pick exactly what you want in your crepes, instead you just pick from a predetermined list of crepes and pre-made scrambled eggs. I understand that the change makes it faster getting through lines but it definitely isn't as great of a value as it was. The rest of the food was just mediocre

XPjx41AvCTEsec3Fvy5S5w.text: the most fun i've had at a buffet ever! maybe cuz of the champagne brunch which means unlimited mimosas.   the wait was a bit long, but i think worth it. it was 27.99 for the champagne brunch. there were eggs, bacon, toast, pancakes, duck, prime rib, roast beef, sausages....the sushi was lame. really good seafood soup!!! and we added mussels in it. OMG soooo delicious. the shrimp and crab legs tasted fresh. their creme brulee wass tastyyy. they had a lot of good things, and fruits and ice cream. of course we had to drink our money worth of mimosas so of course we got a little giddy. but definitely fun! we were all extremely full and satisfied.

f89bt0AVEIkcyoOYbVNRig.text: This buffet is good, but I wasn't really impressed. Other than having shrimp and lobster every night it isn't much different than a lot of buffets I have been to. Actually they do have a crepe station so that also sets it apart. I have only been to one other seafood buffet, kinda just getting into eating crab legs, I know I am so late, but I found that the crab legs here are extremely salty. I wonder if they cook them with the same water where they were found. The crab legs at The Cannery Row Buffet are not salty.   Another con is that the buffet looks huge from the outside, but when you get inside you realize most of that is just seating. There is usually a long line to get in, but I imagine that is how most of the casino buffets are so no surprises for anyone there.   In conclusion, I would rather got to The Cannery on Seafood night and pay about the same price.

1zEcss_K9KM0Q9lEkVFwTA.text: Oh man... why does this place exist???? It's the best buffet in Vegas... and I've tried all sorts of buffets in Vegas. I went here for their Saturday Morning Champagne Brunch-- long line, but worth the wait.   They have every kind of food you can think of. They have the best hummus, pasta, desserts, seafood,  oh and not to mention the CREPES  Oh so good!

m8AHj3rJ112u6MMddECYuw.text: Slow service, rude hostess and cold food. What's the point when you have so many options?

aCnrvB9f5cFoBju7kU7ajg.text: We had the "champagne brunch" on a Saturday morning.  We waited for about 30-45 minutes in line, which kind of sucked, but it was OK.  The best part of the meal was the free (and very liberal) multiple champagne refills.  We also really loved our server, who was very attentive, especially for a buffet.  The food was pretty not good, though.  I really wanted a good crepe, but it wasn't good at all.  If I weren't riding the champagne buzz, it's doubtful that I would have enjoyed the meal haha.  We went here bc we didn't want to shell out for the Bellagio or Wynn, but perhaps we should have.  Hmm.

YOw-RIFhSSfP-kYcm3KkvQ.text: This buffet was SO GOOD! Not to mention, AMAZING customer service. I will definitely be back every time I am in Vegas.

HtPiDbN2VX_4VPipDC4kog.text: Having eaten at this buffet 5 times over the past 6 years I can`t believe what terrible food along with service has taken place.Waiting in line to pay and get in took 1 hour with employees not really showing any care in the world.The assortment of food options and quality was embarrassing and disappointing to me and my guest..Can you believe any casino buffet that even after inferior entries now going to the dessert section doesn't have one piece of any kind of cake or pie?  Don't go!

5AH5r5IIjRNePOEMz775eQ.text: This was our first buffet in our Buffet of Buffets visit, we were impressed.  However, it wasn't until well into our first plate that the server came over and took our drink order, and she was less than friendly.  The food was all great, I though.  My favorite was the steak.  I love buffets that have ice cream cones so you can take your treat to go!

ASUP7bod9eWZgbYuF17DbQ.text: I am biased: I hate buffets. I have been to this one 3 times. And it is always OK. I do like the mashed potatoes here a lot though. Everything else is rather standard for the buffet. Of course, there is a long typical Vegas buffet line wait to get seated. The service is good. The restaurant itself looks nice. The hotel is ok, not much to do there. But give this buffet at least one try. They have a lot of good desserts (eclairs).

M5pJGTuZPOWUiZL7OTNLbQ.text: YAY Paris Buffet!!! This is the one thing I was so excited about when I agreed to go to Vegas with the family--breakfast at the Paris Buffet.  The price is very reasonable--$15.99.  And, once again, because of my parents and their rewards card, we didn't have to stand in an hour-long line...  Now, I am a huge fan of the breakfast meats.  Any variety, and shape, and size.  Almost every station had at least one type of breakfast meat.  Better yet, one entire station was all breakfast meats.  I was overwhelmed!!  I took a huge breath, then made the smart choice to sample some foods before I committed and took a giant portion.  One of my faves was a beef and turkey sausage with sweet potato and maple syrup.  It's got it all in one casing!! So yummy.  I also greatly enjoyed the poached eggs Basquaise.  It was a poached egg with a really delicious, somewhat spicy tomato sauce.  My breakfast dessert was a crepe with Nutella and blueberries--YUMMO!!  And it's always nice when the coffee's good.  That way, when you bundle up to face the freezing cold of winter-time Vegas, you've got some good caffeine in your veins.  Cheers to the Paris Buffet!!

3qprJE8au5tZzgrnKsiUjQ.text: Paid $29.99 for weekend brunch! Food was Mediocre. Crepe was bad. Selection was weak, not worth the $$.  Never coming back. Good thing we didn't have to wait in line.  Should have requested for a refund!

cJ0iZxbStC8CXNY8sbbRIQ.text: I don't normally give 5's because there's so much room for improvement and comparatively, I feel that I could have been greater satisfied. However this buffet was freaking ridiculous. Compared to other buffets, this is one of the best I've been to.  Lunch buffet for 17.99. Waited 30 mins even though they quoted an hour. Definitely worth it. There was a plethora of different foods available. As the taxi driver said... my eyes were full before my stomach was. haha. Seriously it had so much... carvers had decent prime rib. lots of seafood -- clams and mussels. Tooo much to list... Got too stuffed, but that's just my fault for wanted to eat everything haha. Time to go work out now. Go here for a party in your mouth, but it may give you an unwelcomed party in the pants, and not the good kinda party.

ux2ZDTbzsuSyp5tNe0f-2A.text: I used to LOVE this buffet and goodness knows I am NOT a fan of buffets.  I love the omelete station, the made-to-order crepes, the shrimp cocktail and crab claws bar, and dessert station!  During out most recent trip, the shrimp cocktail and crab claws were missing during our lunch buffet and there was no escargot at the hot bar (budget cuts affecting Vegas buffets?)  However, I will say that the roast beef they made was so much more tender this time than previously.  The carver wouldn't cut the more "rare" center pieces for me.  And I literally stood there for 10 minutes, waiting for others to request the more well done portions so that I could get to the rare center.  Service is decent; I had no problems.  I didn't find the wait staff having a nonchalant attitude in fact, I thought they were attentive although no particularly engaging or overly warm, but they did a good job.    I will come back again just because it's a place that is relatively consistent and always has a good selection.  Please bring back the escrgot, crab claws, shrimp cocktail!

Q3s033O5qojivFg5M1jl5g.text: Don't go expecting French food.  It's all pretty much industrialized American food, sometimes with a brief nod toward something vaguely French.  The bouillabaisse was about the best thing on the Sunday brunch menu, and it was pretty gritty.  Steak with veal sauce, also good.  Creme brulee had been torched prettily, but was not crisp by the time I had mine.  Went back for breakfast...not sure why.  It was terrible.  Soggy tarts from the night before, lots of heavy American food.  The corned beef hash tasted like it had rotted a bit.  Also would hate for anyone to think the gummy little crepe wrapper was anything like the real thing.  Service both times was below par.  Had to ask twice for our drinks and flag down server for extra napkins.  Go to Mon Ami Gabi in the same casino and get a real meal and good service for about the same money.

2BhGyMi3B9hO_ZDv7uZxvg.text: Not worth the wait or the price. I didn't find many dishes of value and a few things were quite salty.
