71uReYch-qjkNAty35Bn5g.text: We went there on a Saturday brunch for the Champagne brunch.   - Their concept is interesting, they have sections named after French regions, which was fun & interesting.  - The seafood was hard to eat; their shrimp had the shells, and the crab shells were hard to crack.  - The deserts and crepes were fabulous.  - Arrived at around 10:30, we waited for more than an hour to get in.  That wait was crazy.  Overall I understand why this is one of the best buffets in Vegas.

opIEBJ4eMMetsNM59kTv3g.text: FABULOUS for BRUNCH!!!  Champagne brunch to be exact!  Champagne and Lox... Unlimited.  Can't get much better than that.    As any buffet... they have a huge selection and most places can't go wrong with breakfast.  They had everything from sweet to savory and done well considering it was a buffet.  And... did I mention Champagne?

JzYZUjRvKrnnDrsWQ9tZoA.text: We visited more buffets than I'd like to admit during our last vacation. This one was definitely the best and surprisingly a lot of fun for two Americans who lived in France once upon a time. The food was very good and a wonderful variety. We even got the sample some regional styles we hadn't tried before. The crepe bar was my favorite part and the decor was a lot of fun.

5svhJBewompVJRuv17fvtA.text: Every time we passed this place there was always a line, which could be a good thing. In Vegas, we always make time for the buffet because we're gluttons and love a little bit of everything. Why order one breakfast item when you can have 20?  The hotel gave us a coupon book for different activities and restauants. There was a coupon f or $5.00 off per person for the buffet so we decided we had to go for breakfast, despite the line. While in line, I pulled up their Yelp review. Reviews were mixed, most good, some bad. We just went for it and boy was it worth it.  With your total rewards card you receive $3.00 then we had the coupon for $5.00 more off which came to a total of $23.00 for two. Not too bad at a Vegas buffet. We were seated pretty quickly after paying then it was on.  There were variations of eggs, french toast, bacon, pancakes and even crepes (which we totally worth the wait, by the way). There weren't as many desserts as I hoped but the ones they had were definitely quality.  I will certainly be back again. Worth every penny!

tQ-6ECv2rHqFCPV1ce2XkA.text: Went there for Christmas eve holiday dinner with my family of four - spouse and two kids under 12 (6 and 11). Over priced ($150!! Kids pay adult price), over crowded and not that great of selection. Cashier couldn't justify the extra charge ($7/pp) for so called "holiday dinner". Service was generally slow and cooks couldn't replenish fast enough. 30 minute wait at 3pm in afternoon. Overall experience was mediocre and a huge rip-off.

4OEJUnXbbFUrRZHyArSUuw.text: This place is pretty vanilla. Food is so basic, nothing French about it. Service was really good but the food was mediocre. Try another buffet like the Wicked Spoon at the Cosmo.

lsVVzyOE2laJeXOJV3UP7Q.text: Underwhelming. This was hyped as being one of the best buffets but was just OK and is expensive. They have a variety of European dishes. Very limited dessert selection.

yFFBHBsdyt-olWRRaA9hFA.text: It's a fatty's paradise!  Even my husband - who hates hates hates hates hates buffets, loved this place!  Seafood as far as the eye can see...roast beef, roast lamb, roasted pork - basically if it was meat it could be roasted...and my ultimate favorite...ALL YOU CAN DRINK CHAMPAGNE.  Yes, it's a little pricy (it's $25) and the lines can get pretty ridiculously long, but if you're a Yelper worth his or her salt, you can easily drink/eat/drink that $25 back without breaking into sweat.  Plus, you'll be drunk/full/drunk for the rest of the day!  WIN!

Om2VBv5AiTJuH5jv9KQL2A.text: Food was cold. The lady who seats you was rude when I asked for a different table. She said "make up your mind " seriously who says that. I am a diamond member and worst customer service ever. Only one person checking you in at the diamond entrance. Food was not very hot and I saw a cock roach on the wall. Health dept. should inspect this place

IvBCe8cGp0nHse0WYAaroA.text: Not many options of food but the quality is pretty good. The service is good. But if you're a big fan of deserts than this place is for you :)

gmq6-_KNFrQYV74m87DTvA.text: We went there at 9pm Sunday and closing time was 10pm. Cashier said the food will keep coming until 10:45pm. At 10:00pm a staff said "we will stop bringing out food after 20 mins so fill up your plates now." The cashier lied! And I don't understand the hype and the long lines at this buffet?! The food quality is below average. The choices were not appetizing. The food options were not delightful.

6FBCoB-O1fHIZifF9MRQFg.text: Got the Buffet of Buffets pass a couple of weekends ago and started here with brunch. It was equally as awesome as the last time I went, and my dad and brothers agreed. Of all the buffet prime rib in Vegas, theirs may be the best. I had an end and my brother had another piece somewhere in the middle, and we both agreed it was juicy and well seasoned. The tri tip is also really good, as is the eggs benedict. We sat outside and got to people watch during our meal, which further enhanced this experience. The waitress also kept their champagne glasses full and was very attentive to us. We had a wonderful dining experience here, which my brother won't stop talking about, and I highly recommend this place. I've done brunch at the Bellagio and the Wicked Spoon, and Paris is every bit as good as theirs is.

JVucb2aAHL4UvkVMXaIzyQ.text: Las Vegas is the land of buffets, but choosing the right one is the difference between getting yourself sick with wonderful dishes and getting yourself sick with hepatitis A. Le Village Buffet will poison you with two main delicacies: their dishes and their prices. Relative to other buffets, Le Village is not only more economic but more worthy of your time and palate. Their many stations offer food from various regions of France. You will also get your typical buffet items like salad and dessert bars. Weekend brunch with champagne and mimosas is not to be missed. Their crepe station and coffee are my personal favorites. Make a free reservation through Open Table and skip the ridiculous line. Choose this place over Wicked Spoon and The Buffet at Wynn any time.

waS2sv75l761b4x73jLFsg.text: No expectations when it comes to Buffet joints but this was the absolute worst buffet place I've ever been to. Selection sucked and for $65 bucks for two, we should have gone to Harrah's buffet which was only a few minutes away.  I would not come back here again .

DRC-w_dG1NoT1vZcLAY9Iw.text: My best man and matron of honor and I all ate here for brunch.  The price was $35 each and included mimosas and bloody marys.  There was a wide selection of food to choose from including seafood and sushi.  The food was so-so but I had a nice time.

smtLZQ0k5FNYB0Il2qOuIA.text: This is what I need in Vegas: GOOD PRICES, GOOD FOOD!  Came here with my two home girls because one of them said that she had it for dinner and that it was pretty delicious. Interior decor seriously reminds one of a little outdoor cafe, especially with the painted ceiling. It feels very cozy and a very fun place to eat. Went in for lunch when there was no line and paid about $20. Had to wait a few minutes for a table and it only served to increase my hunger which was helpful =).  Food was mostly your standard buffet fare with some French-style dishes which I did not attempt to try. As with all buffets I usually hit up the carved meats which I feel give you the most bang-for-your-buck. It was here that I got THE most tender prime rib that excelled that of the $43 Wynn buffet. They did get a minus in my book though for not shelling their shrimp which was a bit annoying but it just served for me to get more meat and pasta.  Overall a decent buffet in a nice environment if you're not looking to break the bank. I am definitely coming back here to eat whenever I hit up Sin City.

sfjfHEZwfif7J5UP8PPHew.text: without a doubt, THE absolutely worst buffet not only here, but anywhere. Terrible food, selection, quality, you name it. Only giving 1 star because: A) yelp doesnt allow negatives B) our server Mimi was delightful.  Back to the grub... The carving station's roast beef was beyond awful...need a chainsaw to cut and jaws of steel to chew. WOW Went around 11.30am, there were half-assed breakfast items that were gross, most not replaced, lunch items only highlight is the big square cheese crackers like the italian ones, and the iced crab legs were ok. Potato leek soup decent, and the rest of the buffet there were so many disgusting items, I lost count. Very bad selection, not even a good salad bar, lifeless limp and limited it was. I wanted to take pics but didnt wanna gross out anyone. Its really, really bad. Anyone giving this buffet over 2* really needs to check into a taste bud clinic or something. No pizzas, no decent salads, oversauced lukewarm garbage, very limited items. Hope you like bread, crab legs (for lunch/dinner) and omelettes/croissants in the morning, rest is absolute shit with piss on top.

EcyQ5GnCvrXhT9duA3VUjQ.text: I'm not a big buffet eater, but you have to do at least one while in Vegas. Thank goodness we read the reviews and completely agree with the assessment of the majority of other yelpers in 2012. We went for lunch and it was really good. We had 2 helping of prime rib because it was just that good. We tried a slew items including the "fish & chips" and were pleasantly surprised that everything was seasoned and spiced accordingly. My fear in going to buffets is that most of the food is bland, but this was really good and we would definitely go there again. Have FUN and Happy Eating!!

dKjUzcFOW_1X164OX_o4Qg.text: Paris, Las Vegas. I've been to many vegas buffets, ranging from MGM, Bally's, and Rio, to Luxor Bellagio, Mirage, and many other ones in between.  I went to the IHeartRadio Music Festival in Vegas on Friday with my friend. We were staying at the LVH, but I decided to take her to the Le Village in Paris Hotel and Casino for the lunch buffet. We went around 1:30 on a Friday afternoon, and there was no wait, which was nice. The setting was nice and dark for a romantic mood. The service there was really good. Had my drinks ready when they were out and plates cleared out when new ones came in.    Now onto the food itself. They had Prime Rib for lunch, which is kind of rare since most of the lunch buffets I've been to don't really have prime rib, they have roast beef. I tried their prime rib, which is probably my go to dish when I go to buffet's in vegas. It was pretty good. The rareness is perfect, I like my prime rib as rare as possible, but of course it has to be hot haha.. Not cold uncooked prime rib. There were lots of food choices, On my first plate I tried some clam, quiche (taste meh), mashed potatoes, pasta, and some cocktailed shrimp (however the shell isn't peeled which sucks..ended up just eating the shell and feet, at least they clean the poop out). Prime rib was the only thing that stood out. Everything else was kind of filler. I went back again for a second prime rib and this time they gave me a thick a$$ slice, it was probably equivalent to 3-4 prime rib slices they normally give. After eating that, I was just stuffed. Couldn't eat anything else but dessert.   Dessert:  My friend ordered a banana, nutella, hazelnut crepe. It was presented very nice, but tasted ok. The nutella didn't really taste like nutella, and the nutella was like a syrup was like put on top not inside of the crepe. Only the banana was inside. They also put a huge load of whipped cream...which was too much.   Next, my friend and I went on a dessert sampler..We got like one of each dessert available. We started off with creme brulee, brownies, some sort of raspberry cake, some cookies, flan and more. We basically only took a bite of each except for creme brulee... The creme brulee was really good, We went on and grabbed 2 more haha. That's the only dessert worth getting in my opinion.   Overall,  I give it 3 stars, there are other choices that I feel taste better such as Bellagio, MGM and the buffet in the Mirage.   It cost 21.99 a person, and personally did not feel like it was worth it. Go try something else. Maybe it taste better at night. For now I'll tick with Bellagio.

d2Vc_-yTYJRTPOgDsmqtJg.text: Not that great but it was OK that's why I gave 3 stars. I think there are better buffets out there, but this price on the strip is ideal for the stop prices that is.

8OLsDb8X5RBp7hmgShuZLg.text: Came here for breakfast included in the Buffet of Buffet pass that allows you to eat at several Total Rewards buffet locations.  The line at 8:30 was non existent but I've I have come later and faced an hour wait.  The standout favorite for this buffet is the fresh crepe station. The brioche French toast is also a favorite of mine.

lyDFwBBVZc-X8q72CgFXuw.text: Variety is lacking....Vegas buffet. $32 on Sundays. Includes decent Wycliff champagne. We asked for the extra orange juice to make mimosas  Great small village decor. Americanized french food. Hearty meats for ya'll meat lovers. Very good crepes. The food is pretty rich. Potatoes Au Gratin was great.  We prefer an overall healthier mixture of food though. Veg options were pretty low. Salad fixings were basic.   I recommend the Belagio Buffet the best! $20 for lunch. Diverse food and elegant experience.

PMdtXVdPxBnG-rQxtb3amA.text: Breakfast at least village is great way to start your day. The ambience inside make you feel like you are in the street cafe at Paris. Omelette station was out standing. Thank god my platinum TR card get me into VIP lane, the line is too long.

7ZfDSKlE-N1dcfshhWeFZA.text: Pros: connected to Ballys (where we stayed) , huge variety of food, & crepe station .   Cons : same food repeated every day   I was kind of disappointed that this was the only buffet I tried while in Vegas. Only because my group and I were extremely hung over and hungry. We were not willing to walk to other buffets in the blazing hot sun! Let alone take a taxi , and wait in the long buffet lines .   Food was ok, but I wish they changed it up a bit . Service was consistent , very polite workers.   I loved the crepe station! It's a must try while there!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rUNIvBsmQV745TPKl6AJ6g.text: The people working there are always swamped so always give them a little more room as they get cranky gamblers, swarms of families on a daily basis.   I thought the food could use more work as I was surprised to find sushi rolls and sesame seaweed in the selection.

vEnl_36bAmy6GpUQfPGGkw.text: This is my second time eating here at the buffet. I came here as a child with my parents and from what I remember the place inside looks the same. The food is different than other buffets on the strip and that's always refreshing.   I love the crepes they make you fresh! Only problem was that when you order a savory crepe, they weren't cooking it long enough so the cheese and/or ham, whatever it's stuffed with, will be left unmelted or cold inside. I made a small complaint to our wonderful server Mimi and she let the chef and her manager know. I went back for a second serving and I also asked the chef to please cook it longer and it was so delicious!!   My boyfriend and I were served warm crab legs (bonus for being a platinum rewards member) and the legs were good as well.   Bottomless mimosas are a nice touch, we didn't drink as much as we normally would but the refills on the champagne were a little slow. I just didn't care because I didn't feel like getting drunk.   Didn't get to try all the food because I was in love with the crepes and waffles (so fresh!) and their different potatoes and Mac and cheese is good. Their eggs Benedict, I'm sorry to say, is pretty bad. Dry, over-cooked egg with a hard muffin and tasteless hollandaise sauce, that was a little disappointing.  Their macarons are ok; they're made right texture-wise but the filling is just super sweet chocolate and not very good. That's a shame because macarons are amazing and it should be a highlight at a French buffet.   All in all, great experience again at this buffet. Mimi is a wonderful server she was funny and kind and took her time to make sure everything was to our liking. Even the ladies at the front who take your payment were very friendly. I can't wait to come back and eat here again(especially the crepes!)

YNaH8aryOnYT_rYJSDQZeg.text: The buffet itself was great... especially the dessert house :) Wish they serve espresso instead of regular coffee.

a-VMI0gIOEm1xW1hrtO5Xg.text: Dennys quality at $25 each and since it's a buffet, you get to wait your own table. Would have been happier getting drive through mcDonalds and it would have been far better value. The orange juice was watered down. To be fair: the scrambled eggs and sausages were good.

Hzko600M1ARZ-MT_Xr1lEQ.text: When we checked in next door at Bally's, the man helping us mentioned this great 24hr buffet deal for $50 dollars. Basically he said you can visit ALL of the Caesar resorts buffets as much as you want for 24 hrs. We though this was an amazing deal, we could have lunch at the Paris, dinner at Caesar's, and breakfast somewhere else all for $50 dollars!  We purchased our wrist bands at Paris and the woman said "Yes, this is good at ALL Caesar's resorts." We went to have dinner at Caesar's later that day and after checking in with the hostess she said "oh, you know you have to pay an ADDITONAL $30 per person, right?" WHAT?! What a total rip off. We should have known the "good deal" was too good to be True. They stamp a little thing on the back of your receipt stating "pay as little as $15 for upgrade to Caesars buffet." Who bothers to read the fine print on the back of a receipt? If we would have known it would have been extra, we would have never bothered. We also wouldn't have had to walk my 74 year old father clear across the strip for all the trouble. Paris didn't offer to do anything to rectify the confusion, and I really feel bad for other people falling for this "deal."   All that being said, The Paris buffet had some good things to it in regards to food:  The brioche French toast, the salmon, roasted sweet potatoes, the pasta dishes were all favorites.   Some not so good: Lack of fresh fruit and veggies - the salad offerings were very poor.  The crepe station...the "bananas" on the nutella crepes were mushy and weird, swimming in some sweet mystery liquid and then drenched in whipped topping and lord knows what else.   Go across the way to "La Creperie" and pay $10 for a decent crepe.  There are too many other places in Vegas to eat, I wouldn't come again,

PfUHye4Yvd8pBC7hz5SdiQ.text: 50 minutes waiting just to be seated. No plates. After asking for a high chair four times we just went and found one.   Restrooms are... No words to describe.   Is there any management running this place?  Food is ok. Service is. Well there is no service.

X79ah6o4ufzbEKP683k1ow.text: Came here on a Friday morning, and my bf and I weren't impressed. The buffet has a pretty good selection for breakfast, but the quality was subpar. A lot of things seemed old, such as the smoked salmon that did not look fresh at all.  They served a variety of sausages--some were good and some were bad. I liked the Andouille sausage. I think this place is known for its crepe station, but after the food I ate, I wasn't in the mood to wait in line for a crepe. I saw an omelette station too.  There was a line when we got there around 9am, but it moved fairly fast.

UyVIViEp9YVNsBB0eLayQw.text: Food is horrible, not too many options and it's very cold. There warmers aren't hot at all so everything is cold. The crepes are really bad,  there isn't even fresh fruit and they don't cook it long enough so it's super cold as well. Crepes need fresh fruit not the disgusting fruit from cans with syrup all over them. Would not recommend at all! Very disappointed by it all. Don't waste your money!!

r-ikeHGhbR0NU038XxPT3A.text: 5 buffets in 36 hours... Vegas baby! Yeah!  3rd of 5 I wasn't hungry in the morning, but great breakfast here!  Crepes were excellent here. This is what stands out to me the most.  You can easily get lost in here.  My mother in law was getting food and got lost looking for the table.  I had to find her and bring her back.  Good service!  Restrooms were a bit far from the food area, but they were still within its bounds which was fine.  Not easy to change a diaper in those restrooms though.  Don't forget to bring single dollars to tip the crepes maker and waitress.

V_L1BEZsU-G77mDabsWIOw.text: We went there for breakfast this mor ing and I am very dissapointed with the service and selection.   Well for starters, they sat us next to the herring and whitefish so the entire time we were smelling fish.  The waitress never came to take our drink order, just plopped a jug of coffee on the table and walked away. When we asked her for a drink she gave us a death stare. Came back with orange juice instead of a diet coke like we ordered.   Some other issues: - too pricey the selection was minimal for breakfast - the lady at the crepe station was fighting with a customer of crepes - they left metal serving spoons on top of the burners and they were 1000 degrees when you went to grab food - the staff all looked miserable  - I had a stack of 3 plates going before she finally took the plates off the table. - they indicate on the table reciept if you tipped before you were sat. At this point you didn't provide a service, why the hell would I tip.  Highly don't recommend. Avoid at all costs.

hr0krjYf4SZmh0bEjDfdhA.text: A bit pricey however food is very good. Service is top notch so overall a good experience. Decor is pretty cool!

Q1seiGyOgXMx3wDv0pyGZw.text: I tried the buffet here, I was not impressed (not worth the money). I was charged holiday cost even though there was no mention of it on their website. It was a dinner on Saturday so I expected to pay $30.99 as stated on their website, but nope it cost me more. So that was not cool. Additionally, there wasn't a lot of food options. What I liked most was the macaroons (only had 2 flavors) and flan. What also got to me was the unfriendliness by the staff and my waitress poor service because I'm so thirsty and she's not around to refill my drink. Also, tip was expected upfront before you try the food and service so I thought that was backwards. Defeats the point of tipping.

Uo3XWVMOisO4yci6eShLuQ.text: The food is pretty good.  they have just about everything here, except Bathrooms.  Big bummer.   Drink service is sort of slow.   Overall good tho

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad bar

YVKIIoyiVamrDsthTU-kLQ.text: We came back here twice! Our server was a singer and really an entertaining gem. She reminded me of a really cheerful Bella from Beauty & the Beast only with darker skin :)  The food: $31. for dinner   Carving station rocked perfectly cooked, prime rib, turkey, duck, & pork wrapped something really tasty???  Crab legs were cut open in half so no fighting with them and they weren't dried out, seafood was tasty, great variety of sausages, and sides. They had a cheese station and like 7 -8 different rolls. Desserts were out of this world! Sushi was great, crepes were made to order yummm! My only complaint couldn't get a martini :(  With all the choices we had we went back a 2nd time.

BKR_qi61S3Q3kZGMBcwEqw.text: I'm a fan of French food, so I was pleasantly surprised by the offerings at Le Village. Their menu includes unique seafood dishes, an entire array of fresh-cut meats and French staples like French Onion Soup.  The price is also very reasonable for a Vegas buffet; with all the options you have at this place, you'd imagine to be paying at least $10 more. I think we only payed about $25 each for dinner on a Sunday night.  The ambiance is also warm and quaint, reminiscent of old-school themed Vegas hotels and possibly even Europe. I'll definitely be back to Le Village.

Rkzpg86OfdyUm0KblMYFfw.text: Arrived around 11 AM on a Friday, and luckily the line wasn't too long. The wait was around 15-20 minutes before we were seated at a table and asked what we wanted to drink.   There's the typical food that most buffets have - salad, cheeses, Mexican, dessert, prime ribs, lots and lots of bread, etc. But what caught my eye, and my friends' eyes, was the crepes station! There were eight different crepes to choose from, with the maximum of two at a time. Four were savory and four were sweet. I opted for the sweeter crepes, and ordered the berries one and the apples one. The line took about half an hour before I finally got my crepe. After the long line, I'd have to say that the crepes were okay, but not great. The skin was a little too thick for my liking. For my berries crepe, I thought the berries were too sour. I liked the apple one a lot, but there was too much caramel sauce drizzled on top for me to enjoy. I was also able to try La Caprese (the pesto one), the chicken one, the ham one, and the banana and nutella one. Basically everything offered that morning. The best would have to be the ham one. The mozzarella cheese and pesto - the mozzarella balls didn't melt so it was pretty blehh. There's a jar to tip the chef for their hard work, as there is only one pasty chef making the crepes at a time.   As for the other food, I heard the prime rib was not too good here compared to Rio. The mushrooms were pretty tasty, but a little too much sauce. I didn't see any crab legs that the other reviewers commented upon, but I suppose there was a good variety.   The best best part of the buffet was the creme brulee. Oh my goodness, it was so melt in your mouth sweet and delicious, and the top perfectly burnt. Must try! There wasn't any more fruit tarts when we went, but we asked one of the pastry chefs who had some hidden! He said he only gave them to the people who asked since there were so limited left. They were pretty good, too :)   The atmosphere is really cool - live birds flying around your head and the whole place looking like a french cafe or village. You can sit "inside" or "outside" - very delightful. I do wish that there was more than one bathroom! A buffet with only one toilet? There was a super long line in the ladies room. We thought there was complimentary mimosa, but I guess that didn't come with the BoB's.   Overall, not too bad. I did like it more than Rio, but then again, I didn't eat too much.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crepe with whipped cream and caramel sauce

6uufDE-SwEHcUh6F_g7jRg.text: This place is great because it's a buffet and not just any buffet but it has SO many different types of food to satisfy any type of mood your in. From different types of meats, sea food, vegetarian dishes and desserts. I recommend making a reservation because they serve you right away to a table of not you might be waiting in a line like your waiting to get on a ride at a theme park. That's never fun when your starving watching everyone eat delicious food right in front of you.   I love the decor in this restaurant, it has such a Paris feel to it with the painted ceilings and design on the walls and doors. It's picture worthy. Beautiful lighting in this place so you can also attend here for like a dinner date, it does have a romantic feel to it. There recreating a parish feel so of course that would be their gauge.   Also, there's plenty of small shops and bars around and the casino is nearby as well as the Eiffel Tower experience which is an excellent treat right after a delicious dinner!

hcqzVjL0z_IVwEgiWTn25A.text: I was pretty disappointed in this place. I was excited to go based on previous reviews however I was completely let down. We arrived and the line at door was approximately 30 min. They were seating people with larger parties over ours of 4. We were finally seated. It took such a long time for someone to.come to our table to order our drinks we just got up and went to get food. After asking multiple times if a server would be coming,  they kept saying soon. The food on the buffet was pretty mediocre and either the items not available because they didn't bring fresh food out in time or the flavor was not good. The prime rub was bland and very rubbery. The crab legs were so frozen solid even after sitting them on on our table the whole time to thaw while we ate they were still frozen and inedible. The desert table with the creme brulee took almost 20 min for them to restock... Another wait. Definitely WILL NOT ever go back again!

HvfP98OyAbWkfq2-LoO9CA.text: I thought this place was okay. I felt like it used to be better and many years ago the lines extended forever. I was surprised to just walk up with no wait (for a Sat night dinner) and I guess I should have suspected that perhaps the quality of the food just isn't quite the same. I thought everything was fine but I don't know if I would go back. In that sense, it's pretty disappointing.

Os85L7h50EaxOMKGux-8uw.text: Disappointments this time at 5 pm dinner:  onion soup was too thick and almost gummy, spinach-artichoke- brie crepe was ice cold in the center,  the  Bouillabaisse was gritty with sand, the arugula was yellowed and there was no chocolate mousse.  Stepped-on crab legs were on the floor for 15 minutes and pasta was all over the counter from 2 bowls.  The three stars are for the rest of the food, which was good.

nCY4wdAzZv5dOLGFfj_V9w.text: I used to really like this buffet, and I still like the atmosphere here, but it's been going downhill.  The last 2 years I went, the food wasn't quite as good as it used to be.  There are still items that were good.  The prime rib wasn't overcooked, which is great and rare for buffets.  The frozen vanilla custard was delicious.  The made to order crepes are just okay.  They batter isn't that great, and resembles pancake batter.  I like my crepes a little crispier.  Also, I don't like how they put the nutella on the outside, and they put way too much chocolate sauce, so you can't even taste the nutella.  This place specializes in French cuisine, so when you think French, you think amazing breads and cheeses, right?  The bread is always old tasting and lackluster.  It is so disappointing.  As for the crabs-- they are typical fair, except they are cold and hard to open.I prefer warm crab claws.  I prefer this place for breakfast over dinner and lunch.  The selection it pretty good for breakfast.  The Eggs Benedict was way over cooked, and the English Muffin underneath was soggy.  I had one of the muffins, and it was the most disgusting muffing I've ever had.  But they had some good items including a nice assortments of eggs, an omelet station, savory crepes made to order, etc...    Also, the service here used to be great, but I swear, the waitresses are ignoring me on purpose, now.  When they come by the first time, I just got water.  Then, around dessert time, I wanted coffee.  It took me 10 mins. to flag the waitress down.  It was like I was at an Asian cafe back home in LA.  The atmosphere is still great, but service is not what it used to be.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZfWnwyGuE04nPI1FbArUtA.text: I remember coming here as a kid years ago and being just absolutely amazed by all that this place has to offer. Come back here much older and much less jaded by Vegas, I can think clearly about how this place actually is.  The GOOD: + I really like how the stations are organized into little french houses/store fronts. It makes the whole atmosphere really cute and unique. I felt like I was getting crepe at a crepe shop and bread at a bread shop. + Food definitely tasted good. They had a large variety of foods for breakfast and lunch.  + Breakfast: make your own crepe station, waffles, biscuits and gravy, eggs benedict, ham, sausage, bacon, eggs, potatoes, hash brown, and all sorts of dessert items. Lots of things to try and taste. + Lunch: asparagus, prime rib, chicken, 3 different pastas, fish, and all sorts of other stuff.   The BAD: + The line was easily a 2 hour wait any time around breakfast... I felt like there was no good time to go. (Tip: You can pay an extra $10 to cut the line at any time, per person. Also if you have anything above a Diamond card, you can cut the line for free.) +  Breakfast is served till 11 AM... and they will switch on you with NO warning. I was in line for the crepes and was looking forward to getting the rest of my breakfast items but when I got out of line, EVERYTHING was changed from breakfast to lunch.... everything basically just disappeared without warning. After paying to cut the line... I was VERY disappointed by the fact that I couldn't actually eat breakfast...  I think if you plan properly (ie. check times and plan ahead to wait in line or pay to cut), you will enjoy the food here. It's tough getting in, but after that, you can plenty of chances to enjoy a delicious buffet.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert =P

hpNYFfT7wUChzdS7zhT5xQ.text: I went to Las Vegas during the winter holiday season last year, so I expected it to be packed and for the lines to be really long.   What I did not expect, however, was for the buffet line to have a wait time of 3-4 hours for dinner. Thankfully, we were one of the last few who were able to eat before the buffet closed, but I pity the poor souls who had to wait in line for 2-3 hours and end up not being able to eat at all.  With my grievances about the wait put aside, the price for the buffet is pretty standard as far as buffets go in Vegas, probably a little on the cheaper side. However, the food was mediocre, if even that. I don't know if it's because we were eating right before close time, but the food was getting cold and less stocked. In addition, for being called a "French" buffet, the macaroons were subpar.   That being said, the wait staff and chefs were still quite friendly even though they'd had a long day.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. buffet offerings

2NXVGqoOcF-EcUUalsuQpA.text: Food was not good. We read reviews and decided to go here but worst idea ever. The food was not good everything was either dried out or not cooked right. The only semi good thing was the crepes and for the amount they charge it's not worth it all. My Apple juice tasted like beer and it was so bad I couldn't even drink it and I love Apple jucie. Will never be going back and the fact we wasted our money sucks. Do not go here for food it's not worth ur money and your time.

7CKRfwyjNk3e1E93tJBTQA.text: I seriously gotta give this place 5 stars! My girl and I had went for breakfast, came out to about $55+ on a Saturday morning.  The overall environment was great. Really felt like we were in a little town in Paris, especially how we were able to be sat "outside". My lady wants to make this place more than an occasional dine-in. Many different sausages to try, many many selections, and the two men (one making the crepes and the other making the omelets) were super nice and friendly; and as well as our server. Make sure to tip them lol.  Food highlights: I really enjoyed the smoked lox, of course the awesome crepes (we had a strawberry ricotta crepe), and of course the many different sausages. Carving station had three choices: slab of bacon, ham, and pork(?) I believe.  They also had a lot of bread and pastries, assuming in France they must really love bread lol. Go try this place for breakfast!!

lKC9K5xtYoWRY1IRIvCDFQ.text: You walk in and you pay more than they say. Than you wait to be seated.  Salads ok, no sizzle.  Corn on the cob, has no taste. They left it in water too long.  And I won't talk about the chicken,

Rzqd5ei-Eish4TyOvww2fA.text: We decided to give this buffet a second chance after about 6 years to see if it had improved.  Yikes!  It was almost worse than I remember.  Really sad that this buffet sucks so bad especially for the price you pay.  Luckily we didn't pay or I would have been super annoyed.  I don't understand how there is always a super long line for this buffet.  I would much rather walk to another hotel to get a waaay better Vegas buffet experience.  The food selection is pretty weak.  The one good thing that I had was the Ratatouille and the freshly made crepes.  Other than that, there isn't much that is hot or has decent flavor.  The sushi selection is just laughable.  It was like the "chef" took his rolls and threw them into a bowl.  It was embarrassing how the restaurant wouldn't pull that platter to present it in a nicer fashion.  All of the desserts were not labeled so it's a gamble about what you are getting.  I watched some guy grab a dessert plate, put it in his arms against his chest and as the worker told him "NO!"  he put the plate back!!!! EWWWWW!   If you see the line at this buffet, please don't think it's because the food is good.  Take the time to go somewhere else!  I promise you that you aren't missing anything.  The Rio Carnaval buffet, Wicked Spoon, and Bacchanal are the top choices for Vegas buffets.

um2HTm_WTDVY9tHRHV8K2Q.text: Food is good for the most part. There's good selection, but some items are hit or miss. That can be expected at pretty much any place like this. The rare prime rib was good. It surprised me to see two selections of prime rib, the other was well done. I asked if anyone ever requests that. Seems like a shame to me; overcooked meat should be against the law lol. The deserts were delicious; at least what I tried.

YjB1Wz6-KCF4yK_KjZfnNw.text: A joke.  Three servers asked what I wanted to drink. One finally brought it to me. And they had no Coke, only Pepsi.  Of the vast buffet spread, only 2 or 3 items looked halfway appetizing. The sushi, rock hard and cold and made of the wrong type of rice, was especially atrocious, making the packaged stuff at Kroger seem fit for Japanese royalty.  I think $3.49 is the appropriate price for this buffet, but I paid ten times that -- after an inexplicably long wait to get in.

yyBSsVa11Te9HBxwo_ispg.text: We went for breakfast and for dinner and to be honest we liked the breakfast better because the person who made the omelets was the best! As for dinner the prime rib and cucumber sushi was great. The man who was our server for our table at dinner was awesome!

cNEMERtk9v74GdMmwk_hcw.text: 88The Staff  was friendly.  They sat us immediately  and gave us a private  room . The food was clod . Very limited  selection.  Some of the food  was sitting.  The sushi had no flavor . Desert may be their  best . It is not worth  the price

IXDEWnbhwW2JbqbrsQxRhA.text: Went for breakfast as a part of our pass and I loved it! The eggs, omelet station and crepes made for good breakfast. I love crepes! First one we got we annihilated. The second one with chicken the chicken tasted funky, I couldn't eat it, recommendation get it without chicken. The Caprese crepe was not made with fresh mozzarella make a note and they put wayyyy too much balsamic so ask for it on the side or to go easy. The whipped cream was amazing as was their sweet crepes, good service would go again and do recommend.

IfviLC3DPhJFUY-7QT0SLg.text: The wife and I ate here on our second day in Vegas. We arrived during their holiday brunch. Very disappointing. The food was not the greatest and the variety was low.   I hate when people compare buffets to sit down restaurants because they expect that for the cost they get the same quality with unlimited food. Buffets wouldn't exist if that were the case.   However, judging this place for what it is, a buffet, is at the bottom of he list in Vegas. The wife and I did not enjoyed. For the price I would recommend going to the The Buffet at the Wynn.

gyYKWcd6wkHcATPuggvD0g.text: The buffet at Paris was great! Good selection, great food and mimosas to go along. We went for brunch and had crab legs, shrimp, clams, and everything else! It is pretty pricey at $35 each but they gave us a 2 dollar discount for having a players card (really 2 bucks WoW ??? )  Anyway, overall experience was good. We had mimosas with our food which was nice. They had a nice selection of desserts and sweets. Really wanted to try a crepe but was way too full.  Only complaint would be the price. But all the other buffets charge as much too which is pretty stupid.

8Im2eOwzfmX0ZzwZYm3cWA.text: Truly some of the best prime rib I have ever had... but here is the catch:  when we went back the next day the prime rib was not nearly as good a quality as the night before????  What the heck?  The desserts were nothing to write home about so don't go for that.  So unimpressive I cannot even remember any of them and I checked them out twice!   The crab legs at dinner were some of the best at a buffet ever!  They were ice cold and not sitting in hot water like I have had so many times, so they were very flavorful and not watered down.  One of my favorite dishes was the creamy pasta with truffle oil!  Yummy flavor!  The service both times was very good.  There was a line but I don't know how long the wait was because I got to skip the lines ;-)  It's a buffet and kinda expensive but what isn't in Vegas?    My recommendation is to only go once to this (and probably any) buffet on your visit to Vegas because the lunch had the exact same food as the dinner minus the crab legs!

gmRXOxO5vyPT36jewJLIfg.text: So disappointed. came because of all the raves and pictures of luscious desserts. apparently when you come early for brunch you only get boring sweet rolls you could get at your local supermarket. The make to order crepe station was the only saving grace at this brunch.    For me this brunch was not worth the price.

AyCg7Yh9ECoZx7ejwgGrKg.text: First time eating at the Paris buffet for lunch. Had a good variety including Prime rib and crab legs! Decent desserts!

qm44BsQAt23h9XBPgrjVgQ.text: Upon payment and check in, I had a party of 4 and my friends family with a party of 4 plus a baby. We asked if we could please be seated together, their response " did you pay the 17% gratuity?!" No, we didn't but can you seat us near each other? "No, you will be seated far, far away from each other." Really?!! We just wanted to be seated near each other. There were plenty of tables available, but they made sure to put us on opposite ends of the buffet. They wrote on our receipts "split"  Then my friend wanted prime rib, but she doesn't eat raw meat and requested an end piece. The Carver said " what do you want me to do?! (And throws her hands in air) I can't do it, you see the meat is wobbling! ( and pokes the  meat with her serving forks) it's thanksgiving, you work in hospitality, this was the worst buffet experience by far. None of the other Caesar hotels required us to pay a 17% gratuity charge to be seated near each other.   If I can give this place a negative star I would.

wSDvMB_gKgEs0cxMALctWQ.text: This is a late review. We took advantage of a groupon deal(50% off+ free bottle of wine)in mid-January for dinner. We avoided the long lines by booking our table thru opentable.  The moment you enter the restaurant, it's like being transported into a small town somewhere in France. Impressive, until you notice all the tables that are so close to one another.   Went around and there is so much food to choose from. Of course I starved myself expecting to be awed by the food and the wine. Here's the verdict:  Wine(Red) - tasted like vinegar :( ...could have used it as a dipping sauce for the crab meat  Food - I love crab legs. They had them but they were still half frozen, no taste and barely had any meat in them. Disappointing. Their mediterranean station was tucked into a corner. The food looked like it's been sitting there forever. Nothing really impressed me except the crepe station. The dessert station had a lot of varieties but only the creme brulee was good.  Our server was nice but seemed overwhelmed.  Would I pay full price to dine at Le Village? No way! It's not even worth the deal we got from groupon.

I1oH6shmIWJdyataPIHWMw.text: My wife and I came here during for Sunday brunch. A Sunday CHAMPAGNE brunch.   We sat in a room a little ways away from the buffet, but it only had a few tables, so it wasn't packed in there. We didn't wait long at all for the table either.  Our server was happy to keep the champagne flowing and he really liked my wife. A little too much.  Its not the best buffet in town, but it's a lot better than the worst. The food was good and I would return.   I was on a carrot cake mission in Vegas. Every place we went to, I would eat several slices of cake. It rated very high up on the list, getting a 3.7 out of 5.

HFmy5lXkXkL76z4eROyppw.text: This buffeet  was ok. Like the separate little rooms with quick wait staff. Went for breakfast/lunch. Lots of egg choices which was nice. Most items were just good, not great. Decent value for the price. Wynn is wayyyyyyyyy better.

mqF4cEi3N01s8hsWJe_3AA.text: I was expecting more from a $30 buffet.  The food was pretty good and the desserts were excellent, but there weren't any entrees that wowed me.  Nothing was bad, but for $30, I expect more than "not bad".

IcVbzlqluqfJdhqquItiVg.text: Maybe it was the (far) less than stellar service. Or the rude waitstaff. Or the price. But actually it was all of this combined with the crappy food (and lack of swift replacement) and high price that made me think this is one Vegas' worst buffets.

NgqurtPyBMRRFxaYhuKx4g.text: Le village is not  the place to go for HUGE selection like the one in MGM.  In my opinion, they concentrate on quality by limiting their selection.

EgsOldI7WDezw_CfM1XvNA.text: This is by far the best buffet I've had in Vegas. We came here for breakfast and I LOVED their made to order crepes... Mmm drizzled in Nutella and banana.. Soo good! The atmosphere is nice, smaller than Planet Hollywood, but I like it. It feels like you're in France! I've never had any other meals here except for breakfast. It's cheaper than any other buffets too and their quality is great!

vVy0mx_9zaUBrbhHbGTFUw.text: Okay, I kind of expected more after reading the reviews. We went here for the dinner buffet to try something a little different. They do have some special items that set them apart from others, but I would've liked to try bellagio's buffet instead since everyone keeps raving about it. There is typically a very long wait for dinners, we waited about an hour. Those who work at the cash registers before entering the buffet can be quite rude and ignore you while they talk amongst themselves. They act like that can't see you when you're clearly trying to make eye contact in order to pay. We had a party of four, even though the interior is nice it feels rather cramped. I do however enjoy their creme brulee. Despite being a major crab lover, I stayed away from theirs. The crabs for cold and tasteless.

THjLEYy_UZlEYCwW1TeTiw.text: Went here for their lunch buffet because we got a coupon when we bought KA tickets. Ended up paying around $25 for two people so it ended up being a pretty good deal. Got our moneys worth and ate a lot. Nothing special food-wise though as far as lunch buffets go. They had all the usuals--but the standouts for me were the french onion soup (how appropriate) and the New York Steaks. Aside from the food, I really like the ambiance of the hotel and the restaurant--I admit I am a francophile (or at least wannabe) and this place is very Parisian pretty to me. Good place for an affordable and decent lunch buffet if you are hungry but want to save some money for gambling later.

O9LuYu1Bktqtna0PnHoPMg.text: If you go on a non weekend day, breakfast ends at 11 am.  Lunch starts at 11 am.  We barely made it for breakfast but we didn't get much time to try their breakfast items since they were already starting to change for lunch items.  Breakfast is $15.99 and Lunch is $17.99 on a weekenday.  Food is ok and your standard buffet food.  Kinda mediocre.  Best thing about this buffet - their made-to-order crepes!  There's a long line but it's good.  Also, if you like nutella, tell them you want nutella.  I did not know they had it until I already got my crepe and someone else ordered it after me.  =(  They have a wide selection of desserts but I was way too full to try any more.  They also give you a small bowl of 4 chocolate covered strawberries.  Yum!!   My friends and I thought it felt a lot like Disneyland's French Quarter.

3mgsPlHdxxvVrUJAvgmZrA.text: I love this buffet! How could you not?? They have a crepe station!! Their desserts are awesome and the hot food is pretty good. I try to come here every time I go to Vegas. The lines are long so try to come early or really late.

ge8NOtuV4tFR8bqU2ujI-w.text: muy delicioso y no quiero comer nada mas! i don't know why, but when i get really full, spanish becomes my first language (although i have no latin blood whatsoever, must be from a past life)!   i've been to paris' buffet three times now, and this third time was THE BEST! i'll never forget the sugar-free raspberry chocolate mousse that forced me to ignore the pain and anguish but rather to keep going 'til the last forbidden bite...and then get up and grab another one.   seven of us took our sweet time, made our br rounds, let loose a few buttons, smuggled a few chewy cookies, and even my friend "eskeleto" got up for 3-4 plates and was deeply pleased with the veal (i don't do veal, but to see her skinny famished ass enjoy it so much made me smile big).   we definitely got our money's worth...$25 for a painfully never ending tummy pleasing feast. marathon diet starts NOW (okay, after the weekend, here we come mario's)!

nhWsaRr6HprnBpuHRYCR6A.text: I go here for the breakfast/brunch buffet (go to Wynn for dinner)! The first time I went here was for champagne brunch after NYE 2000. Ever since then, I try to come here if I can get up early enough. I didn't get a chance to go this past weekend because the Venetian got the best of me, but my sister and bro-in-law went and had a great time. You have to try to the pate!

AZJTek-RhVvnQJOulw3AwQ.text: 3 - number of weekends in a row i escaped LA to Vegas.  and in that 3 weekends....  5 - number of nights i went clubbing 120 - number of dollars i lost in gambling during the 3 weekends 1 - number of girls i got a phone number from (yea yea i know what you're gonna say but this is my personal best... lol ) 2 - number of times i ate at Le Village Buffet. 5 - number of pounds i gained as a result...!!  well.., from the stats listed above, it clearly shows i have the love for Le Village Buffet.  i mean, why else would i go Vegas 3 weekends in a row?  (ahem aside from pool, girls, booze, girls, food, girls...) and actually ate here twice in 3 weeks?  well first of all, their price isn't bad at all (like $10 cheaper than Bellagio).  second, they have good food; crab legs and shrimp cocktail to die for, and dessert selections that will forever be an uphill battle for undisciplined eaters like me.  but hey, you only live once.  twice in three weeks isn't that bad, is it?  damn the guilty conscience.  here is a tip, come hungry, but during like 2-3pm time frame.  because shortly after they will start bringing out dinner selections.  also, they have champagne brunch saturdays and sundays until 3 or 330pm.  CHOMP AWAY SINFULLY, Yelpers and more...!

PzVvA0wDWzOWeseuZ-L0-Q.text: i love love the paris buffet. been there many times, but this is the first time reviewing. i usually come for dinner, and the food is great (prime rib, italian, seafood... ) but what i really go for are the crab legs, creme brulee and customized crepes!  $25 for dinner. the line is always long for dinner though. be prepared to wait 30-60 min.

0n7PthdSWhTBgBl2N4_wmw.text: I really like this buffet.  I am not sure if it is the cute "outside in Paris" theme, the creme brulee, or the CHEESE BUFFET, but I really like it.  We have eaten here twice, and although the wait time is atrocious, I would go back again!  Last time there were pushy line cutters behind us, but we made it through.  The different food choices are what makes this for me.  If you avoid the horde at the crab leg section, you can find a nice sample of traditional French dishes to try.  Me, i just fill up on cheese.  :)  Service is usually good - for a buffet.  Dessert selection is one of the better ones, with creme brulee and frozen custard.  Try to go during the week to avoid waiting 1+ hours in line!

WjRFgx5G61E4CnOgnzhkLw.text: I went in for dinner last night. Spending $31 per person and receiving bad service was a waste of money. Our waitress ignored us for the majority of our meal. Keep in mind, this is a buffet where everything is mostly self served. All the wait staff has to do ,is take our drink order and clear the plates. The entire crew were too busy socializing rather than doing their jobs. For anyone working in any service industry, please realize that most of your money comes from tips. Tips from tourist that chose to eat at your establishment. When the service is bad, it's unfortunate for people who are on vacation and want to have a good time. Needless to say, I will never return to this.

KJTS7SHiIM4tTuosut6aBg.text: Amazing.  I'm not really a buffet person but for brunch I can't say no.   $25 for a huge buffet and all you can drink champagne...it doesn't get much better than that! Except..... when you have 4 people that were just drinking for about 12 hours straight you should bring them drinks asap. Just put out glasses of water on the table, I don't care. It seemed like we waited so long for the waitress to take our drink orders...it could have been 5 minutes or 45 minutes...I couldn't really tell at that point.  However, the food was good and bountiful.  The Eggs Benedict were amazing- definitely go there first! The cannolis were eh, and the French toast was dry. Everything else was fantastic

C1T-Aby8part2jeCLOlHeA.text: We stopped in for breakfast this morning before our drive home, and the experience was average.  While I give props to the crepe and omelette stations, finding woody stems in the mushrooms in your crepes is never pleasant.  Plus, our tiny plastic tumblers of juice went empty for nearly 20 minutes, after which a server came and took the empty glasses without asking if we wanted more!   Food average, service could be better.  Meh.

faW0-iXfxv2v5NCKCQs7Tg.text: Don't waste your time going.  Yesterday I went for breakfast and it's was $15.99.  All the eggs were dry and I didn't see anything good.  After one plate, I was done.  The only French thing I saw were the rude waitresses.  Of all the great places to Vegas, make sure to skip this place.

Wj836SND9-bgSfhuIO9O1A.text: I learned a trick- come during the last part of breakfast and stay long enough for brunch. Cheap breakfast and you get to sample the brunch. The food was good, although the crab was pretty salty and cold. I kind of wish I'd gotten a crepe, seeing as how I was in the Paris hotel and all, but I was trying not to fill up. Maybe my expectations are a little too high, but I thought they could have a little more seafood and dessert variety.

QcdqrgHwcLlDtP-putQEaw.text: Food was not good and not a lot to choose from. The restaurant is dark, it needs more light inside.  Cups had a not to pleasant smell.

_HpbBA2RVSys7yMqgGAFBQ.text: Worst experience ever! I came here for the dessert. There was no name plate for any dessert. Nobody had cleaned the surrounding for a while. Lots of fallen or mashed cakes. Macaroons were wayyy over baked. It was crunchy!!! You could hear me biting into it. Anyone who had a legit macaroon can tell you that's not how it supposed to be. From the photo you can see, they had macaroons with mixed color green and red. Not sure what they wanted to achieve, but it looked more like somebody didn't clean the piping bag and just said screw it. Also, the bottom shell was upside down. Maybe someone decided it looked better that way, but totally disagree.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HfdqFXyt_5y2wiMCqL2XfQ.text: The line being short kind of told the tale for Le Village before we got in. However we were on a buffet pass so we felt obligated to try it. It was rough. The drink service was impossibly slow, and most of the food was just as if it was out too long.

6JewG9NMT3c1F7_hQ2SnwA.text: If you're looking for the worst buffet in Vegas, look no further. I had been to this buffet years ago and back then it was amazing. This time, far from it.   There wasn't one edible or semi-good tasting item at this place. To start, half of the food wasn't labeled and the other half was labeled incorrectly. I'm glad I don't have any food allergies or I would have been in serious trouble (although a trip to the ER would have fared better than this buffet). The scrambled eggs were watery and under cooked, the bacon was chewy and sitting in a large puddle of its own grease, the fruit was set out next to the fish so had a fishy taste to it, the macarons were stale, falling apart and filled with whipped cream (how do you mess up a macaron at a FRENCH buffet?), the crepes were filled with canned pie filling rather than fresh fruit, the waffles were ice cold and hard.  Not to mention that everything looked dirty and old as well. The areas around the food bins were filthy and had bits of food all over them.   The waitstaff didn't help the cause either. Everyone was incredibly rude. Bottomless mimosas are included in the price. My friend asked for one while she still had half of a glass in front of her. The waitress told her "finish that first then I'll get you more". Thanks mom. Meanwhile, other tables had full bottles of champagne on them.   We were so appalled that we asked for a refund and the manager didn't even blink an eye. To me, that says that he gets complains like this all the time.    Do yourself a favor and spend the extra money to go to Wicked Spoon at the Como. Steer clear of this place.

76bQJMftJYibIUiWq2GKlw.text: Let me start by saying that this was my family's favorite buffet for the last few trips we've made to Vegas.   We didn't eat anything all day in anticipation of the delicious handmade crepes, crab legs, and the various pastries.   We arrived early (5:00pm) and went to the crepe station first, as it used to get a long line.  We were happy to see that there was no line.  Then we discovered the reason.  When my daughter ordered a ham and cheese crepe she was told she had to go find a plate first.   When she returned with a plate from  across the dining room, she again ordered a ham and cheese crepe. The guy told her there was no ham or chicken.  We asked if they were going to have more ham soon, he said no and was quite rude.   Maybe they should have erased those choices from the menu board.    Most dishes around the buffet were unkept, not filled, and some we're unappetizing to look at.  There were crab legs in the serving bowl that should have just been thrown away, unless crab meat is supposed to be yellow.   Now for the desserts.   The macrons were stale, the chocolate chip cookies were never replenished, and we had to ask to even get a creme brulee.     Currently looking for a new favorite buffet :(

nb_orXMz4tUTpxdPRRPIgw.text: We checked in around 8pm and the food are almost all empty. Crab legs are dried and looks stale already. I've been here so many times but today was the worst time ever. Food tables looks dirty and not presentable anymore. It seem the food was prepared fast and tasteless.

1QbNda7fx1DX8SWb4ufJsw.text: This use be one of my favorite places to come to on our visits to Las Vegas but today there is no service and food was subpar.  The self serve drinks for breakfast were watered down. Couldn't drink the orange juice or apple juice. The coffee was awful. I won't be coming back.

ts5T3u8PsEguQW7w4dG4lw.text: Our waitress Manivanh was the sweetest, funniest, and coolest waitress we've ever had in Vegas. She's funny and told us stories and served us excellently. Gave us recommendations, told us about things to do in Vegas. She made our experience at Le Village Buffet memorable and we really loved her and definitely want to come back to the restaurant because of her excellent service. Thank you!

AxcjhlUr0kmQRrWkRnB7RQ.text: What happened to the quality of all the buffets in Vegas? Vegas used to be famous for its extravagant and delicious buffets but after we tried 2 buffets at Le Village and Bacchanal, we gave up. Not only the prices goes up significantly (dinner costs $57.99 per person  on the weekend at Bacchanal), the quality are poor and the selections are quite limited. We came to Le Village for lunch and were quite disappointed. I took my empty plate passing by several food stations before finding something good to eat. The only good options were the prime rib and the crepe station where we could order our own crepe (they have both sweet and savory options). The dessert station looked delicious with all the tempting treats but they were terrible. The macarons were too sweet. I had the eclair but the filling inside was bland and flavorless. The flan and creme brulee were ok but not very exceptional.   We were extremely disappointed at the quality and selections of food at this place. About  $25 per person for lunch is a bit steep compared with the kind of food we got. Not really worth it. We probably will not come back to this place or try any buffet in Vegas again.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry crepe with chocolate and caramel sauces
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flan, creme brulee, tiramisu and cannoli cup
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of desserts but none was exceptional

8EWImce3jtkSWhs7f0ceaw.text: Initially my girlfriend and I wanted to have lunch at a restaurant for a change. After looking through a few menus, we discovered that the buffet at Paris was only $25 per person for lunch. It was a little bit more than going to a restaurant, but at least we'd have a wide variety of different foods.  Prior to this visit, the last time I ate here was probably a solid 5-6 years ago? It wasn't bad from what I could recall. Last time the line was painfully long, but we were fortunate enough to be able to walk right in and be seated immediately.  Luckily for me it was already lunch time. After a quick look at what they had to offer, the food looked very promising and once I finally fixed up a plate, the food tasted as good as it looked! A few things were a little on the salty side, but overall everything was good.   I'm not going to get into every single detail of everything I ate, but I'd say for $25, it was absolutely worth the price.

6hRnshYJI4XGcfWtLwuY9g.text: There are other buffets on the strip that will offer a buffet at a similar price but way better quality. I feel like the food that I had on my experience was quite bland. What really made up for it was the dessert, but buffets shouldn't have the dessert as the highlight of their menu.   Service was pretty good and kind. They refilled waters frequently and cleared our plates most of the time.

VnukpJDni2trGV07uzXkSA.text: I am sorry to say but this buffet is not at all as good as it used to be. We went last night with guests that were in town visiting us. We had a Groupon for 4-people and we all were very disappointed. My wife and I have always counted this as one of our favorites but not any more. This degraded quality/service has been noticeable for the last few years.   The waiter/waitress staff have been trimmed to the bone and the service was not good at all. We had to wait and wait for someone to pick up our plates so we could get more food. We had to wait and wait for someone to refill our drinks. It was just not good!!!   The food is also not near the quality that it used to be. There are items mentioned on their web that just do not exist anymore. The food didn't seem to be as warm/hot as it should be either. And it seems the desert area has even been trimmed and not as good of quality as it has been in the past.   My wife is a Platinum players card holder and we get special seating but that did not matter, the service was bad!!!  We will not be back!!!

V3BB-K3hFmOEuCICnew_0g.text: I wanted to try their Sunday brunch, and happened to make it to the register 2 min before the breakfast to brunch price change. Score! That was mostly because there was practically no line when I showed up.That should've been a hint.   The buffet felt really limited in their offerings. Two stations had the exact same breakfast items. Even though it was brunch, I didn't see many lunch options. The main saving grace for this place was their to-order crepe station. They offered both sweet and savory crepes. I also tried the tiny crab legs offered, and was pleasantly that there was actually flavor packed in. It could've done with a bit less salt though.   Service was excellent though. Drinks kept coming, even when we didn't ask for it. Dirty plates were picked up quickly as well.   Would I come back though? I think once was enough.

eM8Qt7FHLy9GxnaxAmuw7g.text: I've read some of the other reviews and some mentioned this, the food IS WAY TOO SALTY. From the chicken, fish, vegetables, crab legs. I don't know why. For many of the dishes the first thing you taste is salt.   This buffet is pretty bad. You can tell it's seen better days. The food is barely enough just to qualify as a French themed buffet. None of it is good, even the crepes. The staff is robotic, they don't care. I mean I wouldn't have cared about that as long as the food was good but it wasn't. Skip this buffet, don't go. I wouldn't go back even if it was 10 bucks.

b0L_OQDCJfs1pTGCkaQHKg.text: Arrived at 2 pm seated at 3 pm. Host was so rude and sat us Down to a bad table with a promise to move us. Then proceeded to the buffet. What a disaster! Food was empty from 50% of the items. Food labels not matching the items . Just so disappointing. Lack of varieties from entrees to desserts...  bellagio or Caesar are much better buffets

jvxYr6DjzVD7kRfLaI_vjA.text: It's a good solid three stars, mostly for the value. Paid $30.99 for a Friday night, which we felt was very reasonable (versus close to $60 for Caesars or Wynn buffets).   The place is not beautiful nor is the food top notch, but a decent value for the price. I enjoyed the prime rib the best. Crab legs and shrimp were so so.  Again, I would only recommend this place if you're looking for a lower cost buffet, located in the central strip.

9EOJ2xX6dagd5yoJXFATvg.text: Amazing! The food was fantastic from the prime rib to desserts. The Prime rib and Creme Brulee were our favorite dishes, my kids loved the macaroons. Worth the money, you won't be disappointed!

4FlNvZq3rz9Hu6iDHKZ88A.text: The food is good, just the service is lackluster. They have one staff member handling 10 tables at a time.

yE_xG7ucl1V04kutLJ6bVg.text: A 30 minute wait and generally mediocre entrees. The crepe filling was premixed and subpar. Many dishes reminded me of a discount truck stop buffet instead of what I expected in a top tier casino.

OeaFQbowyMM99beoFMCcKg.text: This was my favorite buffet at Vegas. I know there are places with better food, but the decor and food selection is just right up my ally. It feels like everything I love about brunch.   This is NOT a place my husband would enjoy, however, it was my daughters 21st birthday, and we chose here!   Tips:  -Set up a reservation online to avoid the lines. Then you can walk in through the VIP side with a much shorter wait.  -There is a groupon online, we unfortunately could not use it because of the day we chose to eat brunch, but, it is a great deal to check out before you come. (I think you can only use it on weekends) -Rather than ask for 2 mimosas, ask for champagne and just make your own mimosas at the table. Save your waitress time people.  -If you see the crepe line is 4 people deep or less, run to the line. This line fluctuates and goes pretty slow, because the crepe men are pretty awesome perfecting each one.

xNLc2dJjDjWwot_bNBMp-A.text: Food Poisoning!!! Stay away!!  So normally we have been very impressed with this buffet, however this time we were extremely disappointed. Our waitress had to be asked multiple times to bring my dad his iced tea. She also left a coke on our table that she said she'd be back for, which she never did pick up. The food was overall pretty bland and dry. Another table also complained about the same thing. The crab legs actually had mold growing on them. However, the worst part was that my grandma got food poisoning. The only things she had that we didn't were a salad and a chicken breast, which she complained tasted off. Within thirty minutes she was complaining about a dry mouth and an upset stomach. Within an hour after, she became violently ill, throwing up during a show we were at. Please don't waste your money here. There are plenty of other restaurants in the hotel to try!

fqwEde0cFZleWYN6377Zag.text: I'm sorry for those that love Le Village Buffet, but I'm going to have to lower my rating. I've had breakfast here a couple times before a long while back and it was decent back then. Unfortunately, breakfast this time around was not as good as it was compared to my last time there. I got a little unlucky with their eggs benedict since they were sitting out too long making the eggs not runny. And the gluten free version too tough that it was almost like a hockey puck. (bit.ly/2leEUzm). I made sure to try their crepe station which is always talked about. I had their Truffle Mushroom crepe and it was the only saving grace for me. I thought it tasted pretty good. (bit.ly/2lfcuW2). Overall, it's hard for me to give Le Village Buffet a higher rating after this experience. Especially when compared to my breakfast experiences at the higher end buffets on the Strip like Wicked Spoon and Bacchanal. Fortunately, my mom used her comp dollars for us which softened the blow, but I think those comp dollars could've been put to better use at another restaurant that serves better quality food.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten Free Eggs Benedict (hash brown) and Eggs Benedict (English muffin)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Mushroom Crepe

kP75vDd7W5QZe9KmzrcQHw.text: Came here because a family member gave me a Groupon and everything I chose tasted so bland and mediocre. Even the dessert was meh. I left hungry which sucks. This place used to be amazing years ago too bad the quality has gone way down.

lJkdbmP3O2oPqO2ffTyE6Q.text: Came here for breakfast/lunch as part of the Buffet of Buffets. Although the line up was excruciatingly long, the food was classic french with the egg omlettes, mussels, different meats and a large assortment of different foods! My favourite thing here was their crepes...they were made to order and absolutely delectable! We tried the apple brandy, nutella banana and mushroom truffle and the batter was thin while the filling was plentiful! They were hot and fresh made making up for their absolutely disgusting and rock hard macarons.   Overall, not bad for a buffet!

fhIVF-d4lN1AJJ4PGufU9A.text: I am so sad to write this review update but my most recent visit to this buffet was less than stellar food wise. Service was still excellent, but I can't get over how bad the food was. We arrived at the beginning of dinner service and most of the food items were old or empty. You would think we had arrived at closing by the amount of food they has available. I walked past the crab legs and there were none. 30 minutes into our meal crab legs arrived and they were horribly salty. Getting a made-to-order crepe was always one of my favorite things from this buffet. However, that too was disappointing. The lady who was making crepes wasn't cooking them all the way so they were under cooked. I tried a fruit tart and it was also pretty bad. The only good thing was the prime rib, however, with the variety of choices for buffets in Vegas I can't say that I recommend this buffet anymore.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salty crab legs :(

w3TbPxPLOH0OgqLOWAjFKg.text: We were staying at Paris hotel so we figured we'd give the dinner buffet a try.....steer clear of this place. It was fairly pricey in comparison to other buffets and definitely wasn't worth the price we paid. The food was tasteless and the "service" was horrible. We didn't have anyone come by our table to take dishes or ask if we were doing okay the entire time we were in there. I had to ask a worker for another fork and he suggested I walk back to the front where the hostess might give me another full setting. Many of the desserts were gone and weren't replenished. We were very disappointed in the food and service, the price was way too high for what we received (or lack there of). Save your money and skip out on this buffet.

tbWtBZgSfa_l0zAVXCcTKQ.text: What's French for "cheapened up and pedestrian"? This used to be a great buffet alternative, full of French regional specialties carefully prepared. Now I'm afraid it has gone WAY downhill. Prime rib and lamb were overdone and tough. Cold mussels. Gone are the interesting beef Bourguignon and similar delicacies. You could be at any buffet now, minus the Asian, Mexican and Italian areas. It is that nondescript. Many of the identifying placards were missing so you didn't know what you were eating. Maybe a good thing in retrospect.  Waiter picked up dishes but never refilled water, certainly no offer of coffee. No eye contact on leaving, no "thank you". No wonder the self-serve beverage stations are all the rage now.  There were some highlights, a nice herb tilapia for instance. And the atmosphere is still charming. But if you have been here in years past you will notice the difference.  The biggest sin is that they shut off and shut down "le rotisserie" section which made steaks and chops to order. (To make room for a new "sekushi sushi" eatery.) Even the crab legs were picked over and small. Ugh. And twelve bucks to park on top of it? Poor value here. Do yourself le faveur and try AYCE at the Palms instead. You'll save a ton and be happier.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. In a nutshell.

Tr7voSaxT1v6JCr9XAVgJQ.text: Worst buffet experience in Las Vegas. This was the 3rd buffet I was trying in Vegas and the worst ever!!! I barely could find something to eat!!!  Nothing was fresh, the breads was too dry, their fish smelled really, desserts tastes like sugar only, salad tastes like the fridge!  My friends and I all felt sick after leaving the buffet!  Worst food experience in Vegas!  Absolutely not worth the 2 hour line and price. Don't waste your time and money here!

IGNQ2uChHQwp6pQu9ilK5w.text: This place is extremely subpar. Servers don't do anything except take your plate. You have to self serve everything for yourself. Brunch price was NOT worth it. Mimosas were free with brunch which was cool, but line was massive. Also, the two things most worth it had a 15-30 minute wait, the omelette station and the crepe station. Food was not as hot as it should be. Different options, but really not much that you couldn't just get anywhere. If you're looking for a place to eat a buffet with mediocre food & long wait lines, this is the place. If you are in a rush, this isn't your place.

YDL1X31kY1xoqkUv_b7v5Q.text: We used to love this buffet but unfortunately there was a major change that ruins the experience.  We fly to Vegas often and Le Buffet at Paris was a favorite for one simple reason, the excellent service. Thanks to corporate greed that's no longer True. All of their exceptional wait staff have been relegated to simple bus boys. Everything is now self-serve. I can self-serve at home and I don't need to spend hundreds of dollars and fly thousands of miles to do it.  One of our favorite servers was Roxanne. Roxanne if you reading this, you are an exceptional.  Please leave Paris and go where your attitude, hard work and amazing customer service is appreciated, not just by your customers, peers and managers but also the bean counters who recognize that not everything can be quantified in dollars and cents. We won't be back until Paris realizes the error of their ways.

Eg5k68oEsWP4ByFsfPZm4A.text: Disgusting. One of the worst buffets in Las Vegas. Pls save your time and try another place like the Wicked Spoon Buffet. Why is there such a a long line to even get in? This place is terrible and mismanaged. The food is so gross and they barely have any good options. The crepes are the main attraction and even that is sub par. There was even a fucking bug by the guy making the crepes. Also people were tipping in right near the food. Like it cool that they want to give him stuff but they really had to put gross money right next to the fruits and crepe toppings?! I could not even go through my ham and cheese crepe. I am sure places like this can only go downhill unless there is a serious renovation. Also they made the macaron wrong which irritated the hell out of me.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The disappointing crepe

MO-hdZNrI_CNJo2QQVi9DQ.text: Very minimal selections, the pasta dishes were cold. Prime rib and roast beef were dry and under seasoned. Mussels were cold. The crepe was freshly prepared however it was under cooked. The savory filling inside was cold and nasty. The cookies were dried and stale.  Please do not come to this place. It's not worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

O4bS3G_3yuIaIf74lNwwsw.text: The most memorable breakfast buffet on the strip! I don't understand all the negative reviews, we absolutely adored this buffet and thought it was worth the $50 for the two of us. We waited around an hour to get in (Thursday around 10am) and when we finally got in, the selection was astounding.  They have every kind of breakfast food you could want (American, French, and English) and the made to order crepe kitchen was our favorite! Best crepe I've ever had. Food was good quality, even the eggs tasted better than normal buffet style eggs.   The atmosphere was so cool!! It felt like we were in France, on a quaint little street. The service was amazing, our waitress was very attentive and I swear was trying to get me drunk with all the unlimited mimosas!!   Next time I'm in Vegas, we will definitely be coming back. Amazing!!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OcBszErUKFjQXlaecF4K3g.text: Don't waste your money.   The omelet and crepes were good... but that is about it.   Try Hexx... or even the little place that sells pizza over this place.

xN_7vYDtcxtBhEAZ2Oarog.text: Have been here a couple of times before, and the food and service we're excellent!
