She said that this is the place we had to go because she liked it.  So we went there and waited in line for over an hour while. I was thinking maybe they'll have something different, you know maybe some thing European. This is just like any other buffet in LV. It has it's meats, noodles and salads. Asian foods are there too so I was a little disappointed with that. All that wait for garbage.  The best thing they have there is the made to order Crepe station.   So you wait about an hour to get into this place, empty your wallet than go to the Crepe station where you'll have to wait...in line.  Great isn't it? Try something else.

CfzeVkSfc3qPqdcG9vfPrA.text: What is better than a little brunch after partying the night before? A champagne brunch in  what seems like is the middle of the village from Beauty and the Beast!!!  You have to wait in line so take that into account when you make plans to go. My bf and I got there at 9:15am and got seated exactly at 10am. The champagne brunch starts at 10, so we were totally fine with that.   At first, the service seemed to be a little off because they were so busy, but then we had this wonderful lady who was extremely attentive. I'm bummed I can't remember her name, but she was awesome. She actually just gave us a cold bottle of champagne, since we kept on getting refills, and she continued to refill our flutes after.   The food quality and selection was wonderful..they have fresh crepes, omelets, a sushi chef (basic stuff), crab legs (nom nom nom) and creme brulee (my favorite dessert) that they were actually caramelizing in from of you.  At about 30 bucks a person, it's well worth it. Just be prepared to wait.

Dr1EA0fJzfPqqLO9CIzXpg.text: Ah, quite disappointing! The line was long and totally not worth it. Yelp, you've let me down this time!  Wynn Buffet is much better... this is just pretty average =/

QZxWrQcTkQ66j_bYKi2GQg.text: The only major negative was the 45 minute wait to get in. This buffet is located in the Paris. I went for brunch. The pastries were all amazingly delicious. I also really liked the waffles and crepes, although the crepes could have benefited from a bit more fruit filling from the less than personable crepe maker. The meats were all pretty good (bacon, sausage, sirloin, pork loin) and I also liked the domas. Fruits, crab legs, eggs, hashbrowns, salads...quite a wide variety of things to pick from.  Not the very best of the Vegas buffets but certainly in the second tier.

I2ZYyC26NXmMlB2WIfZ7ew.text: This place is ok.  It's 2ed to the Ceaser's palace buffet in my eyes.  I love the environment setting here just because it feels like outside dining. Other then that the food is somewhat quality and it's a good experience.

bpbY1HQrz8lJMvzgwdzGQA.text: Every time I come to Vegas, I have to hit up this particular buffet because it is SO delicious. It is my favorite in Vegas above Bellagio and some of the other more hyped up buffets. I like how they serve very distinctively different food from different regions and make ALL of it good instead of, say, focusing on one of their main dishes (prime rib) and only making that good.   Their seafood area is awesome :D ... love love love.  Don't like the long lines however, if you start standing in line after 1:00 PM ... good luck ... haha ...  Their champagne weekend brunches are definitely worth the wait though!

8cMQOcDdvJ01CzmybbLtJA.text: Le Village was about the size of the Bellagio buffet, and the "little French town" decor was extremely cheery and pleasant.  The food quality in the morning was great - the crepe and omelette stations were terrific, and the baked goods, sausage and other staples were excellent.  This may be blasphemy, but I preferred Paris for breakfast over the Bellagio for lunch.

HttftYpPpbF7Nr7fdUVMOg.text: I feel bad giving this buffet three stars since it was my idea to go there.  My friends were late so I bought myself an Eiffel Tower of Margarita just outside the buffet to enjoy while waiting.  That was the best part o the entire meal.  For only $14.99, you can get a solid brain freeze.   We had a larger party and apparently if you have more than 8 people in your party, they charge some insane amount of gratuity.  We were cheap so we split into two tables.  The crepes were decent and the prime rib was really yummy.  I had about 10 little creme brulee cups for dessert.  The highlight/lowlight of my evening was my war with the crab.  Yes, Mr. Crableg (who was already cooked) won the battle.  I tried to crack the shell open and instead I got a deep cut on my index finger. Even after applying pressure on the wound for about 10 minutes, it was still bleeding. The bandaid on my finger ruined my sexy outfit for the evening.  Maybe I'm deducting stars because I'm still bitter about Mr. Crableg.

3m3W0-Hfmxg7DjR6u3YPMQ.text: We came here and there was a line, but the line was moving really fast. I was glad because I was starving. I thought this buffet was okay. Better than the one at Caesars, but nothing compared to the buffets in Rio! Food was fresh and I thought the selection was pretty good. On a side note, for some reason the outside of the buffet reminded me of Downtown/Main Street of Disney with the way things were set up.  Food was edible, but nothing too spectacular.

UYx-2wCGSfx4QN_fXmQ1Cw.text: I purchased a lunch groupon for this buffet and my husband and I tried it out over the weekend. The groupon included a bottle of wine, and 2 lunch buffets for $35 and it was quite the deal.   The buffet itself is okay, most of the stuff was yummy, and the spread was good. Some of the food was cold though (not supposed to be), so that turned me off a little bit. Prime rib was okay, more fat than meat, but nice flavor. The made to order crepe station was awesome. Lots of seafood, even though it was a lunch buffet. HUGE dessert selection.  Our service was fantastic, our waitress was always around to get us drink refills which was a big deal, as we were kind of dehydrated from the night before ! I would return here again, the food was way better than some of the other buffets we've been to in Vegas.

RwPPuBsVvtAvs8NmGJgfOw.text: I came for dinner, really enjoyed. We had to wait in line for about 20minutes. The ambiance is also very nice. I would definitely return on my next visit to Vegas

KvF3-0O6PyRnVYGFA728xw.text: I don't know what happened but. It used to be really good.   This time we visit again. Was  very bad.    Looks like they changed management or something. Not really good food.  No salmon. Very low selection. The desert are great.

0sUqKv8HlfW6J0LonIMjVA.text: As buffets go, this is a good one.  Plenty of meat caring for the carnivores.  Broad selection of fish and seafood for non-meat eaters.  The desserts are plentiful with a very French touch - crepes, macarons, etc.  The real treat was an unsuspecting pasta dish with asparagus and mushrooms with a light cheese sauce with truffle oil.  Head and shoulders over the scalloped potatoes or the mac & cheese with peas.

-l5Ex5uH3A6CDMIdh2o_qA.text: PRIME RIB was sooo on point that my friends and i keep going back for more!!!   Flan was delicious.... Creme Brulee wasn't all that great that day and the Crepe wasn't either :(  Lines will be long so come early!! I love buffets in Vegas! oink oink!

uItQEovmsVoNSmHL0XiHww.text: It's a really good buffet.  A good variety of choices. The food is really tasty and the crepes are delicious.  The ice tea was amazing.  I loved it!

0Fwq0EHAtMqZorNrkcmZCA.text: Went here for lunch and dinner. The meat wasn't good and a cockroach past right by me inside the restaurant...

wBsisgLGGtev3SZiU7hORg.text: I bought a groupon deal and had dinner here on a Sunday night. Came here around 7ish & holy Hera the wait was about 45 min long! When we finally got seated, our server took forever to get our drinks and we had to wait for utensils. Food here is definitely overrated and I honestly did not think I got my money's worth even though I got a "deal" on it. The only good things were prime rib and the crepes. Macaroons were over done and tasted like they were 1+ days old. Everything else was meh & dessert was almost like out of a hometown buffet. I will not be coming back here.

TUF8DD3xkAjeLKcoRCCg0w.text: First time buffet experience in Vegas:  2 hour line at 1p.m. on Saturday...and it wasn't spring break. Price:  $30 including tax Express line:  Pay additional $10 to not stand in line...not worth it.  Highlights: Sausage and Crepe station.    Everything else was mediocre...and for $30, recommend going to the Crepe restaurant across from this location, which will save you $20 and a 2 hour line.

xQN7AXzUT-qrwNsTG_Qf6g.text: The first time I came here was in 2003. It wasn't that great then, and they've succeeded in keeping it that way. The food isn't that great, but what's really bad is the staff. Unattentive, and slow; especially the hosts and servers. We almost finished our first plate and the drink server never came around. I had to flag down one of their hostesses to get someone to bring us a beverage. When I think about the cost for dinner, I should have stuck to my (still) favorite buffet on the Las Vegas strip - The Spice Market Buffet in Aladdin, oops, I mean Planet Hollywood!  Save yourself the trouble and avoid Le Village Buffet.

d-UJxjqnu3FZC_-qiUtLYA.text: This used to be one of my go-to places on every trip to Vegas but, wow, has this place gone downhill.  The selection of items seems to be almost half of what it used to be and the quality has gone way down. I've been going here for 10 years but will never be back.  We even asked one of the servers about it and she said,  yeah, it's depressing how many cuts they have made.  2 days later we went to the Wynn Buffet and it was fantastic;  do yourself a favor and go to Wynn instead.

KsBXjSa2BvDQOc15920PWQ.text: I don't understand the haters because this buffet was excellent!  I had an omelette and a dessert crepe made to order and they were both great. high marks also to the prime rib and turkey carving station and the regional cuisine dishes i had (tasty ratatouille, etc). my vegetarian wife and our young kid also happily left with full bellies. the mimosas were a huge plus, too.  i have honestly nothing to nitpick regarding this place- it's one of the best buffets I've been to in Vegas. I hope to come back sometime for more.

-TFZrTSg6EEojwOiACEgrQ.text: I have actually been here about three times. I actually do not think this buffet is that great, but when you get brunch, you get bottomless mimosas! It's amazing for so many things to taste bad. I will tell you right now what's good: -fresh made omelette -fresh crepes- savory or sweet! they do run out of ingredients (mushrooms, spinach). I was only able to get ham and cheese :(  -prime rib- This will come out a little later around 10:30/11:00 am. If you come too early, it won't be available.  -quiche- part of breakfast and will be gone around 11.  -CREME BRULEEEEEEE :) My favorite part and my sisters all agreed it was delicious. Be careful because they have a caramel cream thing that looks exactly like it, but without the crystallized sugar on top. As far as comfort goes, the women's bathroom is a single bathroom stall for the whole buffet. It's incredible in a bad way.  The sushi rice was completely dry, it was disgusting. Crab legs were not very special either. The worker kind of burnt my crepe because his skillet was too hot. The service was subpar. When I came in, the lady at the front looked nice, but she was rude. I don't always buy groupons, but I did because we were coming for my sister's bachelorette party so I did. I had two groupon codes and i meant to use one for 4 people, and accidentally opened the one for 2 people. When she said for 2 people, I said no. Then she clicked the redeem voucher anyway. I made a mistake but she didn't even listen to my answer. So I ended up wasting the groupon for 1 person because I had 5 people instead of 6. I lost about $28.00. It wouldve been more okay if she didn't laugh at my helpless situation.The groupon really wasn't that worth it, so I would advise against it unless you go to dinner or breakfast and want two drinks. Each one came with two free beers/mimosas. But brunch price is $30.00 with bottomless mimosas. It's only a little more for all you can drink. The server at our table was also a little rude. I could tell she didn't really want to help us. I am very likely to not come back at my own achord

ggUs32iSn0lSKvRN7KW6Eg.text: Definitely have to tag along with the reviews here. Le Village Buffet just isn't done right at all.  We came on a Sunday morning and we came hungry! It's $24 pp which I now think is ridiculous because they literally offer just about nothing for breakfast. There was no wow factor at all. The buffet consisted of your typical eggs and sausage, a crepe station, and some fruit. Two sides of the buffet were exactly the same thing too which made it even more limited on what you could eat. As for breakfast I really don't recommend coming to Paris. Go to the Ballegio where you can get a bang for your buck.

gdJ94IF6nuNVZRCS7nEAsg.text: I ate here many years ago, and I was so excited to make a return visit. Unfortunately, my friends and I were rather disappointed. Not only did we not receive any "guidance" from our server (where to obtain beverages - alcoholic and non, meal stations, etc.) , dirty plates were left on tables all over the restaurant and ours wasn't cleaned until the very end. What used to be such an upscale buffet on the strip has suffered from its fame and obviously no longer needs to impress. The food was pretty much as remembered, but the poor service really was distasteful (pun intended).

rCVwRbs1b5agYgBTpcZE3g.text: I came here one night for dinner with some family that was visiting. One of the people in our party is a VIP so our experience was a little different. There was no line when we went. The staff quickly got us seated and our drink orders filled. I noticed that VIP guests were served drinks in glass cups and non-VIP were served in plastic. The service we received was good, nothing to complain about.  We were able to request hot crab legs brought to our table which was nice since they only had cold crab legs at the buffet. The prime rib was good.   I found that there was not a lot of variety. I'm a local so for the price, variety, and service (I'm not a VIP) I would receive, this is not a place I will be returning.

PrM4spgtTw25HLMLyqIc7w.text: So bad. So, so bad.  Hungry for breakfast, my mom and I ventured over to Paris. My mission was to go to one of my favorite breakfast places, Mon Ami Gabi, but at the entrance to the restaurant, I mistakenly told my mom I'd heard Paris has a decent breakfast buffet. As an extreme lover of buffets, she had been convinced with just that one line and decided we must try it!  With conventions in town, the line was about 25 people deep but moved fairly quickly. Tables were pretty full so we were seated at the first table past the entrance. When we asked for better seating, the hostess told us our only other option was to sit in a private room area as the open tables closer to the buffet were reserved.   I've never been to a buffet where I struggled to find things to eat and still I walked away hungry. There are a few stations that can be summed up in three categories: bread, potato, and fake egg. I'm not a big bread fan so I skipped the toast, bagels, french bread, etc. There were plenty of potatoes: diced and sauteed, roasted fingerling, two things of shaved hash browns, and fried hash brown patties. Same situation with the eggs: scrambled, scrambled with things, scrambled with other things. There are two made-to-order stations: an omelette station and their famous crepe station. Otherwise, big bowls of yogurt, watery questionably fresh fruit, and store-brought danishes and other bread. Many of the items were low or close to empty as if they couldn't keep up with the volume, and when we arrived half the items didn't have labels.   Other than the gentleman at the crepe station, we didn't have any good service and everyone seemed slightly annoyed. I don't blame them at all-- this is an older staff and they were probably overwhelmed by the volume of patrons.   The other really disturbing thing here was the questionable cleanliness. There was a chef constantly wiping the stations with a rag and I witnessed food inadvertently wiped into the serving trays. My silverware was dirty and my mom noticed the pans and such were also grimy.   More painful than remembering you paid $22 + tax and tip to eat food of such quality is having to suppress the realization that Mon Ami Gabi is cheaper, much better quality, and just a few yards away.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #2 Cookie crepe

JrFd6ciq-xsnopMCkFq0jA.text: Buy the Buffet of Buffets pass for 24 hours and eat here first.  This was my favorite of the  standard  casino buffets. Le Village stands out in both food and service.  Many french dishes (obviously you cannot get these at other buffets) = including (nutella / strawberry and cream!) crepes and quiche and some very good french preparations of meats and vegetables.   I ate here three times on my last Vegas trip. This is a good place to go and get two nice plates without totally stuffing yourself. Definitely a good deal considering the french theme and preparations. Very satisfying.   Each time I went the service was good - but especially at breakfast. I was happy to have an extra glass of orange juice without asking and a full pot of coffee during both my breakfast visits. This is a good place to have breakfast before hitting up the card tables and pretending to be one of the guys from Rounders.   *Please tip you crepe maker. You can get extra whip creme for the asking!*  Highly Recommended.

9CMc6-neDggllmT0vNQ2qw.text: Nothing too special buffet-wise. Has standard variety, but you get what you pay for! It's A-OK, which is what 3 stars denotes, right? :)  Honestly, didn't find anything too special here. Nothing made me want to go back for seconds. One up is that they have a bottomless mimosa option for brunch. When in Vegas...!

ntZkqh8SsUFryai9qtCcCw.text: Now, I'm warning you now, this buffet is really meh to me. They have very little variety of food. The food they serve at this buffet is similar to things that the French would eat, just clearly not as good.   If I had to rate this place on the food alone (not including the sweets), I'd probably only give this place 2/5 stars.   Tbh, the main reason I like this place is because they have a crepe station and I absolutely love crepes. They have both sweet and savory crepes. (There is an option to tip the crepe maker. It is not required but I would recommend it considering he stands there making freshly made crepes for you lol). They have other amazing desserts but I didn't have any during my recent visit.   Another reason why I'm not giving this place more stars is because the staff is kind of meh. There was a long line to enter the buffet and one of the cashier's helped out these customers that just waltzed in saying they were waiting in line for a long time. Luckily, the 2nd cashier shut them down the second time they needed help saying we've been waiting a long time too. (We were and people kept tryna cut through the line lol). Also, the man in charge of drinks at our table didn't give me a refill until I was pretty much done eating.   Setting wise, the place was nice and clean. It isn't as nice as Caesars or Bellagio or anything but it is pretty nice and decently priced. The setting inside the buffet is like you're city around eating in the city of Paris. I definitely would recommend coming at least once to experience it. But this is not my personal Vegas buffet choice.

aNVhCIhhwtgaSwR_feZT9w.text: Exceptional service, Nina was incredibly kind and helpful in seating me in a comfortable place as I was traveling alone on business. All of the wait staff did such a great job! The reason for 2 stars is really the quality of food has gone down hill, this used to be my favorite buffet I hope they correct it soon!

lw9-Jc4engw4JfThX5ApPA.text: Food is extraordinary! Customer service, is bad.  We ate a LOT of the yummy prime rib here and the price of the buffet is worth it just for their selection of meat.  However, the ladies working the registers are rude. Won't talk to you or say have a good day. The hosts are rude and won't make eye contact with you. They'll walk by you several times without acknowledging you. Margarita and Jessica were rude along with Trish.  We had to keep telling our waitress we wanted refills.... the customer service here is just lacking.  We're locals.. and we wanna come back.. but we need something done.

0JKOSUlNW6OqMWGRC9Ll4A.text: I remember this buffet being pretty decent the last time I was here. This time around, it wasn't as great. However, I'd still say it's edible and enjoyable.  The servers had cute little maid uniforms and hurried around with drinks and empty plates. It was cute. Even though the one helping me brought me Pepsi even though I asked for Sprite. Oh well.  If you have a sweet tooth, you'd love this place! I enjoyed the endless amount of delicious macaroons. The made to order crepe was cute but I have a crepe machine at home so I wasn't gagging for it.  *MUST READ TIP: So... they do not keep an eye on you as they're super busy. I had placed a tupper ware bowl in my bag and every time there weren't anybody near by, I'd empty out a tray of macaroons into the tupper ware. I think I was able to leave the place with 30-40 macaroons. And then, I packed about 5 to 10 into little pretty plastic bags I had brought from home, and wrapped them nicely. Went downstairs to the gift shop and asked for small shopping bags that says "PARIS LAS VEGAS" on it. That's how you save money by not buying souvenirs! I gave a bag to my in-laws, a couple to my co-workers and some to my kids' teacher. :D I think I saved at least $120 from it! Learn this tip, henny.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

erziLuG9BC96dgO54K_W6w.text: I'm not usually this harsh on a restaurant but, I have absolutely nothing positive to say here.  It's a filthy restaurant that is also extremely dimly lit, perhaps for the best.  The food is bland, poorly presented and the staff is sloppy. The tables were wobbly, the floor sticky and the food stations had food spilled out of their containers.  The price was as expected at any buffet but the cost is irrelevant because no matter the cost, food service should not be this poor. A lower cost would not make the experience any better.  There was a time when the Paris Buffet was good, that was a lifetime ago.  There are 100s of places in Vegas where you can get a far better meal for a fraction of the price.

wA_k9QFk3rYOsLclOxMJYA.text: It's become more expensive and lass option  Low quality of food  I was there I talk to frank the manager about the option makes me come to Paris buffet was not available  This year  He just said sorry we can't do anything for you  We pay 90$ for 2 with tip we didn't enjoy the food

ljV-B03ehZzoB_cp2PpDSw.text: I use to be such a huge fan of this place. I got a free buffet and still felt cheated. Their food selection has be drastically reduced. The best thing they have going for them is the crepe station and I had to wait in line 10 mins to get one. I am not sure why they changed their menu but it was a huge mistake, I feel the quality has went done as well. You will do better to add a few dollars and get Cesar's or wicked spoon. The waitress was nice and attentive, but sadly she didn't make up for the food. You know a place has not much to offer when you don't leave full from a buffet.

Pl3Syyb5VyE1pJ-q-hYzGg.text: This is the worst buffet in Las Vegas.  I though that I will find some French  food here at lunch but what I have is just scramble egg and ham. The savory crepe is suck with still cold ham and unmelted cheese.  What you eat here are mostly American food from Hometown Buffet.  The price is not cheap. By the way, service is very bad too.

d7AC1WKKZ9Xep57-WBpvSQ.text: Had a very bad encounter with an employee by the name of Martha last week. Awful customer service. She was rude and condescending when we asked for more information about how the 24 hour buffet pass worked. The couple ahead of us in line said he heard how she spoke to us and he agreed and went on to share how he had a bad experience with the people at hotel registration upon checking in.  Seemed like an ongoing theme within customer service around Paris hotel.   When I was going to get my food, I noticed a young man asking for more mac & cheese and the chef straight up looked at him, turned his back and walked away. Felt bad for him. The food was not very good, not much of a selection, and not very tasty. Will likely never visit this location again. Thumbs down all around.

rAJyNhWjt5_vIxOBY6xJSw.text: So disappointing. I have been to this buffet many times in the past and the Paris Buffet has always been known as the best buffet on the strip. Well worth the wait in the long line.   I haven't been here for about 3 years. What a disappointment. The food quality has gone down dramatically, they've closed down a couple of the stations and the selections are now limited. The Luxor has a better buffet now. Very sad . No longer worth waiting in the long line to get in.

xPJEpF1OhqEigz4a7HtHFA.text: Please don't spend your money on this buffet. I mean come on this is Vegas! You would expect everything to be at least pretty good to my jaw fell off from how good that was.  Well this place isn't it, sizzler would get a Michelin star before this place would.  Anywhere else is better than here.  If they stepped to their food game for the price they charge you it would be worth it but for their Streep price for a very bad buffet is a waste of your time and money.

Itlp9qgdBf9XsyfWXvE0GA.text: Second worst meal of my life. Only the crackers were good. Everything else was disgusting and inedible, I had always thought this was one of the better buffets in Vegas. Crap.

BuD8fzvZVOPDAsJzKIQVdg.text: This used to be one of the better brunch buffets but it has really gone down hill. At 10am on a Sunday a lot of the hot food did not look very fresh and quite unappetizing, as if it had been siting under the heat lamps for a long time. The fruit and salad setup Looked like a sad school cafeteria. Bagels were stale, pastries were soggy and the selection was poor, the frozen custard poured out melted liquid and was a disgusting mess. A total ripoff at nearly $30pp with tip, never again.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gross.

dqXosQ_foymM2rWZIsTqNw.text: This is my first time here but considering the plethora of options of high end buffets in Vegas, I will not be back. It wasn't horrible but you can taste the haphazard lack of standards.  For instance, they for some reason decided to sprinkle salt straight onto the food post cooking. This meant crunching on a glob of salt that was beyond revolting. More than 1/2 of the food descriptions tags were blank so you often had to ask or guess. A good example of failure to care about details or standards is the frnch macaroons being assembled wrong but more on that later. The variety for a buffet at this level was lacking.  They had "bouillabaisse" with clams and crawfish, and mussels and next to it they had a dish of "seafood bouillabaisse"... A made to order crepe station had decent filling but the crepe itself was very soggy. This is due to cooking heat being too low or batter being too thick. THE PRIME RIB WAS HOWEVER ONE OF THE BEST I'VE EVER HAD. It was so tender that a knife was not really need.  As a French inspired buffet, you would expect amazing desserts.  The tiramisu in the chocolate cup was fantastic and almost made up for the lack of options (Except tiramisu is Italian and not French). The creme brulee flavor was ok and the little brulee they had was done well. The texture however indicated it over cooked. French macaroons were stale and tasted like hard cookies with nutella sandwiched and not the crunchy outer layer and chewy center. They even sandwiched it wrong. They stacked it and not put it together face to face. The food alone is enough to avoid this place but the service was also lackluster. That is saying something seeing as it is a buffet and the bar for service is already very low. When a first time customer is approached and asked what he wanted to drink, him asking what the options are does not warrant an eyeroll and a repeat in louder and slower voice. I speak English just fine thank you! And louder and slower wouldn't suddenly improve my vocubalary regardless. From that point on I did not see my server but other servers and the bussers who had tables in the viscinity stepped up and filled the void so service did not suffer TOO much.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ILA1krYzuhqqpQoDqBBVJw.text: Here's a tip: If you do Buffet of Buffets (~$80 for 24 hrs of Total Rewards buffets - so worth it!) do two brunches at Le Village.   Hands down the best quality of food on the list. Brunch includes pretty much all of the dinner options plus more breakfast items (omlette and crepe stations) and unlimited champagne and mimosas (no extra charge) for Sunday brunch!  Really, the only thing it's missing is a little more ethnic food variety. I guess you get what you'd expect from a French-themed restaurant.   Regardless, this place just can't be beat.   Get the prime rib.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cold/frozen/soggy crab legs at the brunch hour. Thankfully no bits of shell on these guys (unlike some other Vegas buffets...)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pretty but dry. I&#39;ll eat the small bits of brulee off ALL the cremes though!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety is my middle name. Au jus, I could drink you.

16-zExbaitYfzqNWqp0Z_g.text: For the price this buffet is ridiculous. Food is not great ... husband and I spent $80 not including tip for brunch and left still hungry because the food is not appetizing. I munched on 2 little plates and left. Also you pay gratuity up front and there is no server.... you get your own drinks and mimosas so idk what the point of tipping is. Save your money and go to a better buffet... or any brunch place for that matter.

E93H-P7VCO_9-0TVsnDWaQ.text: Super disappointing! Crab legs were dinky and extra tedious to pick at with the gianormous forks you are given. Shrimp was shelled and cocktail sauce looked suspiciously chunky. Macarons were hard and dyed strange bright colors and were not authentic at all. Overall selection of food tasted below average to average. The only few things that "stood out" were the crepe station, apple pie, and paella. Oh and the mashed potatoes...  We bought a deal off of Groupon so we saved some money, but it still was not worth it. I pity everyone who paid full price for this! I would NOT come back.  Looks like many recent reviews rate this buffet poorly. THEY ARE RIGHT!

JY9rE20hUcb9S3jK7jUV5w.text: The best buffet ever! Prime rib and desserts specially the praline one is the best! Worth every penny!!! Will definitely go back once in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WMP6CFaKHvrtMeri0AMd5w.text: I went here for breakfast and since I am a vegas local I am a seasoned buffet eater.  I can say that there are MUCH better places for the price that you pay here, and I was very disappointed.  The selection was boring and there were very few French cuisine inspired foods other than the crepe station and a few pain au chocolat, which you can find at any decent buffet in town.  Try the Feast Buffet at Palace Station, or the AYCE buffet at the Palms for less cost and better food/selection.

5TmUVtWGQph3simKPIEcoA.text: This buffet is ok for lunch or brunch or whatever it is called. There isnt much to eat, i spent most of the morning peeling shrimp cause there aint much to eat lol. Guess it was what i paid for. The desserts are prettt decent and the croissants were nice and flaky

2aaoHgY1KAG1btMIvDK0vQ.text: I didn't think I would like this place after reading the low reviews but I personally like it!   I particularly love the cassoulet, the seafood bouillabaisse, yukon mash taters, roasted mushrooms and steamed various colored cauliflower. I do love french food particularly Provence dishes which they have here so most of the dishes are perfect for me.  The desserts are okay. Macarons, creme brulee, vanilla or chocolate custard to name a few.  It's a great price for lunch! 2 for $54.95

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

15SJbTyt5wSJnH43LoxI4A.text: Came here for dinner with coworkers. Let me get to the pros and cons:  Pros:  Decent pricing for a buffet We got seated pretty fast even when the line was zig zagging out the door. THEY SERVE PRIME RIB? (it was good!) Amazing dessert choices  Cons: They do NOT take same day reservations. Their spinach dip is horrible The veggies in the salad bar might be frozen. Why? I think their fridge is either too cold or hey left the tray under the vent in the fridge. and... They dont have these amazing food where I live  Tips and tricks: Want ice cream but not in a cone or plate? They have bowls near the soup section. Avoid the fillers; rice, potato, pasta, or carbs in general. EAT THE EXPENSIVE STUFF.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My prime rib is so rare, it is bleeding

TT10zSeiBZh2wYuGJzFnLw.text: I think the breakfast is better.  I arrived at 11am then cashier charged me the breakfast and my friend  and I ate until 3pm..It was long but we surely got all our price back.  Good Service and the employees are nice.  Strongly suggest for hot water and lemons easy digest all food you consumed!!!

uJhrm6C7sYxpXhOrUCk1VA.text: This review is for the buffet, lunch buffet.   I almost feel bad having to give them a one-star, but I realize there are no zero stars!   The only good thing about the place was our waitress, and our cold beer.  The food was less than average, the selection was minimal. But the reason for my one star is the following: At 1:00 p.m., which is about 90 minutes into lunch buffet, there were almost discarded trays of desserts from the breakfast buffet, with labels indicating completely different food items. Patrons were walking into food set-up areas to get desserts which were there waiting to be placed in windows for long long time. I would never condone such behavior, but I do understand why. We had to flag down a manager to show them.  I am not referring to one spot, or one tray. The whole area of desserts...   This is in the Paris Hotel, in Vegas. I had been there few years back, and it was phenomenal. What happened? I expect more, and by that I don't mean more food, but more organization, and just decent presentation of food.   Needless to say it was very disappointing, and I am embarrassed for them.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This was left so for over 45 minutes!
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yes, sadly this was the dessert tray during our lunch buffet.

XAl5xJq6sYgA3BZaNI6kwg.text: Thanks to making a reservation we didn't have to wait in the long line at the door. We were able to enter the VIP entrance and were taken care of immediately.   The food selection was great. We got there at the end of breakfast and just before brunch so we were able to get the best of both worlds. The price was reasonable, I believe we paid the breakfast price of $24.99 per person and that included champagne.

OiOcMHXWhpZyoCyYSJQwxw.text: Two stars due to the limited gluten free options. I'm glad I came here as part of the buffet pass, to learn about the options. There is very, very little here that's gluten free at lunch time. The crepe station looked amazing, though!

GLR84w3FFqfWqXAf4xra1A.text: Stayed at Paris during Christmas and tried Le Village. They charged 5-8 dollars over normal rates for the holidays as it was after all, tis the season! Considering the price and the ridiculous wait time, food was below average to bad. I remember downing half a glass of water after eating a scoop of paella as it was beyond salty. The rest were the same or slightly worse than golden corral, with the only saving grace coming from the omelet and crepe stations. Someone here commented highly on their desert offerings but I personally could not tell the difference between the ones I saw and my local supermarket 's. They were no French, nor European, just mere cheap unimaginative sugar loaded selections for the undemanding holiday guests.. I ended up going to normal restaurants as Le Village gave me such a bad impression of Vegas buffets. Please stay away!!

bvrb_QYywiLEmUntdCsOcw.text: It's not good ,every thing about that place is no no no . The food is horrible, the selection is terrible .

UgBBsaLvJI-Vt7XR7X7Wrw.text: I haven't tried eating during lunch or dinner. This is our go to buffet for BREAKFAST only!    Their breakfast is amazing. Lots of favorites including their crepe station. Lots of meat, potatoes, eggs, fruit, breads, and a whole lot more.

F7hEgQUyBD8YOQxUYBaGWA.text: Awesome experience! You get high quality food at a buffet for a reasonable price! I tried to eat as much as I could but there were so many options. They must've had over 100 different desserts. The only part I did not enjoy was trying not to pop as I walked back to my car.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

demFaz-DjUGSdHGHKzHd3Q.text: Chose this place for a Christmas Luncheon and paid big bucks for holiday feast. But this turned out to be a bummer!!! Not a lot of items we liked and the ones we did, were not available after first servings even though it was early in the day.  Desserts - the ones we were looking forward to wasn't up to the mark either. Silverware provided had food stuck on it. Yuck! Wouldn't recommend this place if you don't have an exact palette for French food and are ready to splash out extra cash when you can get better value for money at other global buffets in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh silverware???

qvH_Fu_ejZrb8B565umrFg.text: The food is is OK but the atmosphere is fun and the staff was great. It isn't a place that I'd go again unless someone in my group wanted to. There are better buffets in Vegas but isn't a total loss. We had fun, lots of food, great staff and hardly a wait.

IMHgCEa_5aoBgrHSwKKRsA.text: Definitely not worth the money. The food is extremely salty and that's all you can taste

sP4WAQblpYHb91xnouCxXQ.text: Paris was once an amazing casino with an unbelievable buffet.  It has gone downhill over the past several years as Caesar's has decided to spend money elsewhere and neglect some of its (formerly exceptional) properties.  I used to rave about this buffet to friends, and ALWAYS brought friends to Le Village Buffet for breakfast.  Especially if they were first time visitors to Las Vegas.  It is fairly expensive but it used to be worth it.  Well it only took one final experience, no longer will I be taking people here.  EVER.    The food- the quality has gone way down hill.  There is no longer the extensive list of French foods in this once great buffet.  They have downgraded to just basic food, the omelets are bland, and there isn't the dessert selection that they used to have.  Read to the end to see the final straw- I don't want to gross people out.    The service- in my time with my friends the wait staff came around twice.  We were there for about an hour.    The Ambiance- still nice, looks like French villages and it is a pleasant dining atmosphere.    The final straw- please forgive me for grossing you out, but there were ants on my pastry.  Yes I did find a pastry that seemed palatable but there was an added protein element.  When I want protein, I will go to the meat sections, not the dessert section.    I will avoid this buffet at all costs.  I will not be back, and it is definitely not worth the price.

MB7CiqWC3n_vM-Z641Z0MA.text: I have been to Le Village buffet a number of times but it has always been for lunch or dinner.  Today, I met some friends from the East who I was taking hiking at Mount Charleston and we decided to have breakfast here.  It was a good choice.  We were there when it opened at 7 AM, and we were the first at the omelette/fresh egg station.  I got an omelette made with mushrooms, spinach, jalapenos, and cheese.  The omelette was quickly done by the cook and it was very good.  I also had a few slices of bacon.  It was not crisp nor limp but somewhere in between.  Now it was time for dessert.  I walked over to the crepe section.  I studied the list of crepes and decided on the second one, the crepe made with fresh strawberries, raspberries, and blueberries.  The cook poured the batter, spread it around the griddle with his little crepe plow, evening out the batter so it was a thin pancake on the griddle.  He turned it and then filled it with the fruit listed above.  After folding it expertly, he topped it with some fresh whipped cream and then spread some raspberry coulis on the whipped cream.  The crepe was so hot, the whipped cream slid off as I walked back to the table.  I thoroughly enjoyed breakfast here.  Service was good and the individual stations had great choices.  I could go back again and have several completely different things.    This is a very strong breakfast buffet!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My strawberry, raspberry, and blueberry crèpe (#2 La Baie) with raspberry coulis on the whipped cream that slid off the crèpe.

3bgJqYLAZwtwxnjWeceSOQ.text: This Buffet food selection and quality isn't worth the price of $30.99. Stick to the prices that are $40+ you get what you pay for remember. The only reason that I am even giving this place a 2 star because our waitress was excellent.

FpuEmY5Brd-T6l9L7JppVw.text: In the end, these places wouldn't know how to fry an egg properly. The ONLY reason I gave them 2 stars is because of the variety. NONE of it is great, most of it is under or over cooked, but there WAS a good amount of variety.  But 35 bucks? Fuggetaboutit...

Kdn1mq4ZKcHNQvSkoSmwig.text: I got a free buffet ticket for signing up for Total Rewards and earning 50 gambling credits within 24 hours. There are other options to choose from and the Paris buffet was the most high end from the list (Rio, Harrah, Flamingos, etc) so I thought. It's the Monday after Christmas weekend therefore it's considered holiday pricing normally $30 vs $38. The one big mistake I forgot to do is make a reservation, they do it one day in advance. Instead we had to wait 1.5 hours 6pm on a Monday. The hostess was really nice and sat us in a quieter room away from the crowds. However, once you get in, I felt instantly overwhelmed by all the people rushing to get food. There were tons of large families. The restaurant did a good job cranking out food, stocking utensils, clearing tables, grabbing refills. They are certainly making their money, however it just felt very impersonal, rushed, etc. The staff definitely works hard but I felt they were way understaffed. I saw a waiter just give 2 of every drink to keep people occupied. $12 unlimited drink add on is worth it but I passed this time.   Now the food, one their website they are known for truffle mac and cheese, prime rib, and crab legs. Those were exactly the highlights of the meal. Everything else was very sub par. I actually like they had lots of vegetarian options but the taste was awful, under seasoned, seems they just boiled them. Not too much meat option they had pre cut rotisserie chicken and lamb leg. The seafood wasn't the best quality, yes there is shrimp and crab legs but they are skimpy. The sushi and soup station was messy and unappetizing. They had a large variety of bread and desserts. The one big plus is a custom crepe stand!   After my second plate, I was over navigating around the hoards of people filing up their plates to get their money's worth.   Also, for the whole restaurant there is only one stall per gender!

-Yl8ux8m3Tlrjv195htYqw.text: I typically hatebuffets... The thought of other people getting food off of the table in front of me is not appealing. The warm temperature of the food and the idea that it may have been sitting there a while also leaves me room to question the foods freshness. But this buffet was great! Everything was fresh the tri tip was cooked perfectly, they had prime rib and crab legs ...the French dishes tasted authentic, and the desserts were just beautiful! The fruits and salads were fresh and the soup was so rich and creamy, they definitely pulled all the stops! I will not visit another buffet in Las Vegas, except for this one I've been to a few other ones that were supposed to be great, that were only mediocre at best... But this one was quite memorable. Seriously check this one out , it's worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. One of each please!

rQ2rE_za9VKMVfZjVNcIRw.text: I am very disappointed with this place. We love seafood, love crab legs, but I can't eat it more than 2 pieces because it was very very salty. I thought those crab legs might soak in salt water for days. Other options of food were boring, dry, and tasteless. Silverware were dirty. I gave this place second chance but no more.  I won't go back anymore.

5mlg2aytXWpbC1hAD4kt4A.text: The crepe station is really delicious. Other than that, the dessert selection is poor for being French. The entrees and sides are off beat and look tired.  One carved meat and its only rare. Staff don't speak English very well.  The tables and chairs are in poor condition. I would pick another buffet.  I preferred the buffet at the Mirage.

o1gEGhhz8a1So9NsCymb3g.text: Came here for the brunch munch better then the Luxor . Huge variety love it customer service is nice  Rewriting my review our server Billy not very prompt about checking to see how we were doing or our drinks that we've waited for 15 minutes but Mary ended up helping us out so very nice and she ended up taking care of us when we need forks, napkins and our drinks very very pleased with Mary's customer service friendly and you can tell that she works hard! 10 stars for Mary!

SDk1K9iZTPxfraRtcz2Nqw.text: Really expensive and awful taste buffet. On Sunday evening, the price is around $35/ person. Crab legs not fresh. A lot of pots were empty. Food taste ugly. No high quality meat. No fresh seafood. Worst buffet I had in Las Vegas. Not even want to go back!

7mdvN5D69p_NVcGQD4W9zA.text: I like to stop here for Sunday morning Brunch. Its awesome, some mimosas eggs Benedict hits the spot after a long night. I would give this place five stars but reserve those for anything other than fast food and buffets.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cheers

Dv0dezsJFa9B8Kkx4I8Dvg.text: We went there for breakfast. It was a semi long wait to get in on a weekday (abt 30 mins). The waiter we had didn't refill drinks at all so wasn't impressed with the service. But as for the thing that matters, the food was pretty good. The omelette station, crepe station and others were pretty good. One disappointing thing is that I didn't see any cheeses and baguettes. I think they were out or something or we arrived a little late.  This was the best breakfast buffet of the ones we tried when it comes to food quality, but the wait and the service isn't.

KIKyirj6aBD4d-B_9yX7lg.text: One of THE WORST buffet I have ever eaten in my life. Don't waste your money here. Take that money and go to the Bacchanal Buffet in the Caesars Palace and you can thank me later ;)

33ASPyjqrAV3WyUdhe1l_A.text: Underwhelmed. It was OK. Not worth the price. Not bad, but I wouldn't recommend it to family or friends.

AwJfHWDF9r3AI5KAZxhtbQ.text: I don't know why all the bad reviews.  I've been to a few different buffets on the strip and his one is good.  It's relatively cheap compared to others.  About $25 for lunch. Good variety and they had the best prime rib hands down.  Melted in your mouth. I went to Bellagio buffet the next day and paid $36 and it wasn't as good. Their prime rib was tough.  The only complaint I had was that most of their dish descriptions didn't match what was being offered.  The service was fine and waitress refilled our drinks often.

L7uqZU4zYXmCOmWdmd-3dg.text: Besides the prime rib, the food was sub par at best. Edible, but not anything I would want to go back for seconds for and that's the point of a buffet isn't it? Also, if you're mostly going to have French food try not to throw sushi and what not in there. You might as well throw in other country's food and be a real buffet.

SUgfROhlEcdABQuRljRgBw.text: So i looked at top buffets in Vegas and this was one of the top, but it seems like maybe they just dont care anymore of the quality. From burnt dessert to super under cooked prime rib (they were upset to cook it well done). Im happy i got the buffet pass i wont have to eat here anymore today. Our server she was nice.

mpaZ9YVFIsXbpETVVT2MHg.text: Breakfast was pretty good. Line was long but moved quickly. Service wasn't that great probably because they were so crowded. A bit expensive but you can get your money's worth if you eat a lot

fKRexr2q9KfQku6M0TW5TA.text: Good Ambience, but large waits during peak hours, esp for dinner. Had a variety of food for the buffet. They should employ more waiters to serve the crowd.

vYF0XfyGKQjWT3CVwe28vQ.text: No matter where I go for a buffet I always compare to Le Village Buffet. The price is reasonable for what you get compared to what Wynn and Bellagio is charging for their buffets.  This is what they had during the Sunday Brunch:  -Snow Crabs- Soo fresh and sweet. make sure you get some butter -Dungenes Crab- Not as fresh as I would like them to be. I would pass on this one. -Made to order omelettes- I'm not usually an omelets person but I loved them here. -Ham and cheese croissants.- This one was sooo good. The croissant used in the ham and cheese croissant was much better than the plain ones they had sitting at the dessert bar. -Peel to ear shrimp- I remember them to be bigger. Still great though. -Prime Rib- It was ok. I expected to be a lot better. I wasn't there for the prime rib anyways. -French Onion Soup. -Fresh grilled veggies -Made to order crepes. I'm still salivating thinking about them. -Bouillabaisse very goood. There was a bunch of other stuff but that's what I ate.  Oh and dessert... -Creme brulee *Yum* -Flan (perfect consistency, doesn't have that yolk smell* -fruit tarts, cakes oh my..  The server was a bit slow but I think she had too many tables on her hands. Very sweet woman. My party and ate for two hours so we gave her a $15 tip for holding her table up.  This buffet is a must everytime I'm in Vegas

VbngkALgeBpjyKf2aKDAWQ.text: The lines for this buffett are outrageous! We finally mustered up the gumption to wait in line at breakfast one morning just to see what all the fuss was about. I have to say, the food was really good and they had a very wide selection. I had the made to order crepes, hey when in Paris, which were delicious and then later some of the egg dishes and carved ham. My man, being a meatoholic enjoyed some of the more greasy fair. For the price it was worth it, but go hungry in order to get your money's worth and be prepared to wait in line for a while. Also, make sure you take your ID if you want to use your room card for payment, the gate keeper would not allow me to use mine because it happened to be the one time I left the room without an ID. I can understand that I suppose and luckily we had cash otherwise we'd have been back at the end of the (long) queue!

2i5UOo3OMUEi47bszFbePw.text: Great place to stuff your self with great food, arrive early because the line does get long.. one of the best buffet in my opinion in vegas hands down..

QfIAUTXJua0GbCR4CQP3Lg.text: It's a few days until my first wedding anniversary, so I thought the the most fitting place to take the prestigious spot of my 50th Review would be the place where we held our wedding dinner reception almost one year ago - Le Village Buffet in the Paris Hotel.   Ohhhh yeah. Mmmhhmmm. That's right, we did this buffet style!!! Best believe.    I'm pretty sure my husband was relieved to see that I did not morph into Bridezilla during the months leading up to our wedding day.  Truth be known, I'm pretty easy to please.  I didn't need the eleborate bells and whistles on my wedding day.  I wanted it to be fun, unpretentious and memorable. Plain and simple.    So what better way to please the 90 nearest and dearest friends and family members that made it out to Vegas than to treat them to a meal buffet-style after the ceremony in the Paris Hotel chapel.  It was only $25 a head and there were LOADS and LOADS of food options to choose from.  Forget about the glitz and glamour of a 3 course meal.  No worries on having to add Meat, Fish or Chicken check boxes on our RSVP cards.  I wanted my guests to feel like they could grub on their own terms.  And believe me - the hubby and I both come from families that take food SERIOUSLY.  Our families love food.  So the option of people heading for seconds (and thirds, fourths...) was a plus.  Being that it was the Paris hotel, the menu echoed of French dishes. The food was amazingly delicious for a buffet!   They were even able to provide us with a private section of the restaurant just for our party.  The decor was breathtaking - the ceilings were painted to look like a bright blue sky with puffs of white clouds.  The floors mimicked cobblestone sidewalks and the buffet stations were made to look like old French houses.   Each "Station" showcased food from the 6 different regions of France.They were also able to provide our awesome 3 tier wedding cake (vanilla cake with fresh berries) and champagne for the toast.    We received nothing but praises from our guests on how outstanding the food was.    I had to go to Vegas for business during the summer of '07 and I took my husband with me.  Where did we stop for our first meal? Uh huh, Le Village Buffet.  We heard so much about the awesome Breakfast/Brunch buffet that they had, we had to give it a go.  And it was sooooo worth it.  In fact, I'll be heading back to Vegas on business again in a couple of weeks, and the Le Village Buffet will definitely be on my itinerary.

x9jYpFgTpiBfD5hpKz15CQ.text: I think the buffet at Paris is just as good as the one at Bellagio, and it's cheaper too. Luckily I got to stay here a lot when I was in town on business, so invariably we ended up here. It's even better when it's on the company's dime.

1iZtJGkTFCa2xVSBdo8Byg.text: OMG where do I start? I love Le Village! I've been here every time I came to Vegas except for last time which allows me to vote for this place as the best buffet in Vegas bc I went to Wicked Spoon and I was not impressed whatsoever. Food was just meh and at $45, I mean you've gotta have something that sets you apart. Nope! I'm coming back to Le Village once I finish my final exams next month yay. Top notch dishes: The salmon, truffle pasta and oh my goodness the olive salad. Absolutely love the dessert section. Like everyone says, the creme brulee is wonderful. My sister thinks the flan is even better but I'm a creme brulee fan. I've tried a few of the crepes and so far I realllyy liked the one I got with apples sauteed in brandy and candied walnuts. Yum. Cons: You will feel like a balloon when you leave. It's impossible to resist overeating here so come with an empty stomach. I usually stop eating the day before I plan to go here lol :D

JABrVvB5Q2fJj73udWGAeA.text: Disclaimer: I'm not being fair as I have zero tolerance for food prepared for 200 people sitting in the chafing dish for hours slowly getting burnt on the bottom and cold on the top.    It is ironic to have to wait for 45 minutes to be seated (and be $24.95 + tax poorer), considering that I managed to get into The Bank the night before with no wait (and not have to be out of pocket).    In any case, the food never fails to disappoint.  I once watched a feature on TV (PS: the only thing that I watch is Food Network and Travel... and occassional bit of American Idol) on how they source the ingredients for buffet food.  While it was not able to gross me out and put me off buffet forever, it's enough to get me into thinking that the prime rib that they had served in Le Village Buffet is the one that is near or past the expiry date @ Les Artistes.  I could not help but be slightly perturbed.

YBwqQ4UgtYncaAJh1hlLeQ.text: I thought the service was great... I went for the dinner buffet. The prime rib was delish and the creme brulee was amazing!! Aside from that I thought everything was pretty standard.

moFE6ttc8QGrcqCl8deb9Q.text: We've heard good thing about this place from a friend. And judging from the line outside during lunch time, we thought it would be worth the wait. So we join the gang, and one hour later we were finally in the restaurant.  After eating at the Wicked Spoon a couple of days ago, I felt I wanted to leave this place right away. It feels like a school cafeteria. I honestly could not find anything appetizing in this place. The prime rib is served almost well down, and tough. The Orange duck is quite juicy but it's not better than any roast duck from Chinatown. The cut is very poorly done too.   I expected the desert to at least give me something to justify our 1-hour wait but again it's very disappointing. There is nothing that says "French". the creme bulee is alright but nothing more than what you can get from grocery store, frozen. There is not even a single piece of cake worth mentioning.   I don't mind spending the $19 for lunch but the hour wait is a total waste of time.  Skip this at all cost and go to Bellagio or Wicked Spoon.

B_lULQVpU8joabfHm9xKlg.text: Very good selection, Not a bad price for a Vegas buffett~ The man was very pleased.. and full :) Success

zbhR5JkHH77Hn1x4AIAUFQ.text: I'm a buffet person, so first night in town, My bf & I decided to try out this place 'cause it's near the hotel we'd stayed, as well as I heard good reviews about it. The waited was 45 min. Usually when we are hungry, we find everything tastes good to us, but this spot failed. Even though they had a big sections of variety of food, but we couldnt find anything that we thought was best, except I like their crepes. For going to any buffet, I have at least 3 plates and up, but at this place, I had to stop on a second plate and were still hungry, that how tasteless it was. Stafff  were so so. Anyhoo, I'll take this name out of my list next time im in Vegas.

XsKO_yRlMHur0Ru4B4e27A.text: The prime rib here is seriously THE BEST!! Cooked just the way I like (medium rare), tender, juicy, DELICIOUS- it totally exceeded my expectations. The only other thing that stood out for me was the creme brulee. I didnt really think this buffet had a lot of variety, but the food was definitely good and there was a lot of dessert items to choose from. We also got 2 plates of the king crab legs and it was murdered- once we started we couldnt stop!! The service here was awesome!

Du0E1inrKl1RZLfAp7jZiQ.text: We went here for lunch.  Other than the flan (which why I didn't give it one star) everything else was just bland.  Not worth the money.

UWrkunwRoVELpbKS-_W5-g.text: Out of most of the buffets I have been to, this is definitely the best! The seating area and decorations is very nice! It feels like you are truly outside in a street in Paris! The food there is very exquisite and taste better than most places! At certain times it can be a long line. But all in all the food is worth it! They have a wide variety of food AND deserts! It is also for a decent price!  They also have good deals for all day to eat at the buffet! A must do in Vegas...... Eat at this buffet!!!

EEyN8aIEMGTL3fduKQTjbQ.text: Eh is about it for here. 90% of the food was unlabelled, and I felt like I was eating in Munchkinland with the cheesy faux french decor. I had high expecations for this place after reading on yelp, and especially after waiting in line for 45 minutes. Food was cold, rubbery and just downright nasty. The ONLY saving grace here for star #2 is the custom made crepe station. However, I'd surely have felt better paying $8.00 for my nutella crepe than $27 after tax for the rubbish here.

wUOUTUvo8Op96r9Fq98VTw.text: The only thing that impresses with this buffet is the speediness of moving thru the line.  There are alot of food options however I am never impressed with the taste or the quality.  We eat here since it was part of the buffet pass for 24 hours.  I would prefer the food at the RIO buffet.

IHKLkLCLavbWv4PYYFNx_Q.text: Review for the $40 holiday buffet (New Years) but was comped  Horrible experience.  The salad was nothing special, food was nothing special and dessert was nothing special.  Service was close to non existence.  They had "lobster" for their NY holiday buffet which was the only good thing to eat but was limited to only one per person.  We asked our waiter if we could have a second one because the group of 10 next to us received seconds from their waitress but our waiter told us only limit one.    Typically a bad buffet will end up with good dessert but they didn't even have real ice cream.  What they had was some custard soft serve.  I sure would not be coming back here again.

-VT-70VqOn1q27OnSf3XNQ.text: On June 11th, we decided to come here for breakfast.  It's always nice to have a friend who is a platinum member at Harrahs because we got to sit in the platinum dining area where we had our own omelette guy!  How cool is that?  The other food is good, not great but the omelette and orange juice were the best items that day!!!

NxuicIuQ36Y-5AzpC31JUg.text: Wowee, Breakfast and Dinner were so good.  We did the 24-hour up to 6 buffet's for $49.99 (total rewards member) and we ate two fabulous meals here.  It was by far and away an experience my waist line will not forget.

0Vlm-4E_CGtdjo5w7sEjKA.text: If not for their desert area, Paris buffet would have got two stars. Made to order crepe station is best part of this buffet along with their colorful macaroons.  Quality have gone down tremendously through the year.  Either that, or I have outgrown my taste for buffet.  No selection of food besides sausages and mollusks. Had like 5 different kind of sausages and 4 different kind of mollusks  based entrees such as clams and mussels.

bWSGhu8zB2l2fhCV2_erCg.text: Decent buffet with all the standard offerings, plus a crepe station. The warm sticky buns, available by the crepes, are quite tasty.

Rw4GOJvHn2mDvIuH0CStAQ.text: After trying a couple of buffets in Vegas over various trips one of my friends had a coupon for here so we made a second round to what Paris's buffet had to offer during dinner.  I wasn't super impressed the first time however we did arrive during the transition between brunch and dinner so I figured maybe not as many options were available.  To my surprise I actually preferred brunch time since they had more dishes that catered to my personal tastes; eggs benidict and smoked salmon? That's pretty much all I need in my life with some good dessert haha.   Everything in general is just kind of 'meh' and didn't feel it's worth the money. One of my friends was actually really disappointed with the place and wish we would have went elsewhere for our buffet fix.  If you want some prime rib, turkey or stuffed lamb be prepared to wait in another pretty long line. The lamb was good but not that great. I can get soooooo much better lamb near where I live. My friends really enjoyed their prime rib but boyfriend said it wasn't the best he'd had either.  There's never really a line for any of the other sections of the buffet. Potatoes are whatever...but like I said most things served here is medicore with nothing particularly standing out. And to my disappointment the dessert here was lacking. Come on, the french revolutionized patisserie! I would have expected a lot better. Oh well.  Overall I'd say if you're gonna go to a buffet go big and go to Bacchanal if you're really into your seafood (they had the best/freshest options for that department in my opinion) or I really enjoyed Bellagios (my personal favorite) buffet which had the most options overall at only $30 a person.

islaMELJyWNPKd-oDJRHNg.text: Best breakfast in vegas. The place looks like you are at Paris. The service was super b.  The best crepes in vegas.. will come back again...

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepes #1 with bananas and Nutella

Sa6v6jcClSEnPfoHjjF91Q.text: The food isn't that great. There is nothing extra ordinary! The deserts are pretty good though. The service is good also.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crepe&#39; #2

xCIT798uvIyjb1to9xO7MQ.text: Middle of the road buffet at best. There's very little variety and the sole was nasty nasty. It's like 2yrs old and they just slathered a whole bunch of preservatives on it.  Everything was old and falling apart. Why would they keep this place running is beyond me. The bathroom had 1 stall. The tiles were falling off and duck type was used to hold it in place. Yes, duck tape ladies and gentlemen. The furniture was nasty, the food was nasty and the place was just unkept. Really a restaurant on the strip? Who is the general manger for this place? There are so many options. Don't go here.   Oh, the 1 extra star is for the French macaroons. They are actually chewy and had the right taste and texture. All other deserts aren't even made in house.

I3Vhq0wzQCx_Vh_C2RZdJg.text: I am really angry with their bad service and the weird design for the restroom! I got liquid soap on my cuff three times!!! It is not worthy for waiting nearly two hours.

YoLxBKGEwLUvl5CmUI6SjA.text: Used the holiday buffet pass ($70/pp) here. My sister waited 2 hours for dinner...she loves her vegas buffet. She didnt care about the 2 hr wait. Fine with us.  Bachannal met their dinner quota at 2pmon this day and was sheer madness. Plus you have to pay $30 more on top of your buffet pass.  Honestly, if i could, i would've eaten $30 worth of pasta/ mac n cheese. Thats all i ate here.  Everything else was mediocre vegas buffet food.  The salad was drenched in dressing. The macaron was a fake macaron with chocolate gumball drop in the center.  Bellagio macarons are so much better.  The sweet mashed potatoes, brussel sprouts, and mushrooms were delicious.   The service was terrible but understandable because of holiday madness.   Love the ambiance ... 2 stars for the ambiance, veggies, and mac n cheese.  Although, wicked spoons has the best mac n cheese and dessert selection thus far.

nJ0ON2Jxo1m8OOsHuZvvwA.text: This place is definitely the best buffet of all the 6 buffet of buffets.  I had a great waitress and I love the atmosphere of the restaurant.    Their crepes were delicious and please make sure to try their prime rib too.  Their creme brulee and mac & cheese were good too!  They are probably not the best buffet in Las Vegas but definitely the best for the 24hr buffet deal.

Yc9JVEypmtNZ5JNbjWBe1g.text: I came here on a whim when walking around Paris trying to find a decent place to eat. I only eat at buffets once in a long while, but we figured we'd probably end up spending the same amount ($25pp) at any of the other restaurants, so why not?  I really love how they went all out with the "village" theme. When you walk in, it really feels like you're strolling through a little village. There are signs, street lamps, little rooms, and buffet stations that look like little cottages. I'm always a sucker for any kind of themed restaurant, so I loved this.  We were quickly seated in one of the rooms and had our drink orders taken. Then we went out to explore the buffet. It looked like they just restocked everything, so I was pretty delighted. There was also a very large selection that seems to continue all throughout the room with separate stations for dessert and soup/salad. I got some broccoli, mushrooms, 3 different pastas, mussels, potatoes, fish, strips of steak, sushi, green beans, roast beef, sausage, cold crab legs, and cam chowder. To be honest, I didn't expect that to fill be up, but it did, so i went on to dessert and got two creme brulees, a couple cookies, and flan (I'm a slave to dessert).   Overall, this is definitely a great buffet. The selection is very diverse, the food is fresh, and the service is fast and friendly.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dL6s7sSe5nO6vl-TFC_81A.text: This is my favorite breakfast buffett in vegas. It has everything you can ever desire (for breakfast), i love the pastries, the different stations with a wide variety of food. It is worth the price! Wake up early and get there before the line is huge.

88b6VeNcvTD99sqc6PeNOA.text: Best buffet I've had in Vegas! Lots of great options and the crepe maker was awesome! The food was good, although some food was cold. The food that wasn't cold was great. Went to a different buffet a day later and regretted my choice. Should have went to Le Village!

MjdKKRGN2_MoJLJSgkYC5g.text: Super unimpressed! We only went here because we had a 2 for 1 coupon and it still wasn't even worth that price. Poor selection, lack of flavor & quality.

7bPyH9HVUE2t-SSaKP5iTw.text: The customer service and waiters are extremely nice , not pretending but u can tell they are happy and welcoming, enjoyed my time and food, the kids found all they want... all fresh and delicious

VBeXTDcoiGO-qvqlAaHZYg.text: Wow!  The Le Village Buffet at the Paris Hotel and Casino is really bad.  There was a huge selection of foods, but the quality and appearance just made the whole experience not worth it.              Duck L'orange=dry and overly sweet      Standing rib roast=very dry no taste      Sauteed mushrooms=only used cheap button mushrooms, no taste,      over cooked      Sushi=why sushi?  Mushy rice, frozen fish.  Why sushi for a French themed buffet?      Brussel sprouts=over boiled, mushy, no taste  This is coming from someone who didn't have to wait in long lines, and who didn't pay the full price, as my smart, lovely wife purchased a groupon deal.  The deal also included a bottle of wine-more like grape juice.  There was no bright spot for the food.  The entire menu, and recipes need to be redone-soon!  As previous reviewers noted, service was slow.  I will give credit though, our server was really trying hard.  She brought out drinks as fast as her feet would allow, and she was very pleasant, polite, and professional considering the circumstances she works under.  The gentleman who seems to be the front of the house manager needs to get his act together.  Instead of scolding and criticizing your staff maybe you should help clear tables, or service your customers.  Le Village Buffet in the Paris Hotel and Casino should be avoided until there is a total revamp of; management, menu, recipes, and service.

eIFaefV3DpxT22MCm3Gh1g.text: Yummy!! We hit Paris to start our buffet of buffets about 3 pm on a Friday.  The off time allowed us to walk right in.   What a treat! The crepe making station was SO good!! I had 2 and couldn't eat another bite or I would have had more! They have an awesome selection for non meat eaters such as myself.  Great pastas, soups, cheeses, bread and did I mention crepes?! The Mac and cheese with truffles and peas was to die for and so were the scalloped potatoes.     Husband who eats meat wasn't as impressed, but really he can eat at any buffet and be happy.  He also didn't have Nutella crepes!     The service was really great, friendly waitress and quick drink refills.  You can't go wrong here!

GyjB3EhRL_cI3VU7uN0TQA.text: I wish I could leave zero stars. I'm a Diamond member and the service was terrible. They seated us coincidentally next to people we knew and they tried to claim that because we were talking to them we were a party of 8 and insisted on charging us more.   The manager in charge didnt care that it was they who seated us so close, they insisted on delivering us a quote to charge us for the extra service. Even though there was literally kess than 20 people in the entire buffet. Not to forget that they didnt give us any drinks at all at that point.  To top it off the food is a rehash of all the same food they have at their other resorts but their venue is smaller makes this place a recipe for disaster.  Needless to say, we left without tipping or paying their gratuity fine.  Avoid this place if you like to be treated as a guest.

khPmc-oOePGP1-Ib_Lp-mg.text: I've been here a few times over the years & this last time didn't feel as good.  We first tried the made to order crepes, they were pretty good.  The hot foods were good, eggs benedict were good.  The best part was the creme brulee!  Yum!  Weekend brunch includes champagne, that meant bottomless mimosas for me!  :)  The ambiance is very cute, feels like your in a small quaint french village.   Overall, I'd come again for the variety, but it's pretty pricey for what you get.

Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. nutella &amp; banana crepe

8zyLlt5uNxJFfrE9OLVUNA.text: I came here during my trip because I found a Groupon for this place. When I get there, I realized we paid the same amount on Groupon they charge for dinner so I thought what was so special about our Groupon then? We got unlimited Mimosas, wine, and beer with our Groupon and that didn't matter to me because I don't drink like that. Anyway, this place is French inspired so there is lamb, duck, cheese trays and whatnot. I tried the tri-tip and the lamb and they tasted exactly the same to me, it was weird. The selection to choose from was not large at all. I ordered a mimosa and the orange juice was bad, tasted very cheap. The only thing that was cool and good was the crepe station. There was a man making crepes with anything you wanted and they were really good to. That was the only reason why I gave two stars. Lines was long and slow. We had to wait 40 minutes just to be seated. Not returning.

t4J_QKNvjreH1n0N670hKA.text: Solid selection.  Best deal on the Buffet-of-Buffets without the up charge.  I have ranked the buffets we tried because the reviews on here can be deceiving... #1 Bacchanal Buffet at Caesars...worth the up charge.  You must go. #2 Le Village at Paris...does not compare to Bacchanal but the best quality of food without the up charge. #3 Carnival World Cafe at Rio #4 Spice Market at Planet Hollywood #5 Flavors at Harrahs  The last three in my opinion were very similar and mediocre buffet style food.  #1 and #2 had more gormet style food.

3r8JIo_U96G7VxoE6Scz_w.text: This buffet was very good, and a great value. Servers were friendly and attentive. We caught the tail end of the bottomless mimosa brunch special, and I appreciated that it lasted throughout our meal. The variety was great, especially the crepes, cheese, warmed cherries, poached pears, leek soup, and dessert. Would go back.

ekjka49CLd50YCgzP6pRlg.text: Wow, this restaurant is one of the worst in Las Vegas. We came here on Mother's day and it was $30/person. Other than its location and interior settings, the restaurant is nearly worthless.  The food is either tasteless or overcooked and the service is extremely poor. Our server forgot to give us our utensils/table settings even after we asked him twice. We had our plates of food on the table for more than 10 minutes, but still no utensils are given, so we have to ask another server to give us some forks/spoons. This is just ridiculous.. Also, the server only picked up our used plates once at the beginning of the meal, by the time we leave, we have 5 completely-full used plates on the table, which has been sitting there for more than 20 minutes.. I can't believe Le Village would hire guys like him..  I understand Las Vegas Paris is not Wynn, but still, it's hard to believe they let Le Village operate like this..

-m5WRcYVkdJiPRvySEQ8cQ.text: THE +'s: the service. those were some friendly servers.  THE -'s: the food was gross...everything that you'd think bad about buffet food can be found here. lukewarm and overcooked selection of all the basic buffet food groups. they had some french inspired stuff (this is the paris casino afterall) but, as previously mentioned, just cooked terribly. oh yieah, grungy/sticky furnishings in a "flowers-puked-all-over" decor. dark lighting -- probably so you can't see the bad food too clearly.  SUM: it's somewhat less expensive than other dinner buffets but not worth the amount paid cuz when i go to a buffet, i go to eat my fill. and i can't eat my fill if the food is icky-poo. i hate to be mean in reviews but damn, i just don't like it here.

lAOWKCEfBRj8MFHSPMpQNg.text: I only tried Le Village because I had already purchased the Buffet of Buffets.  There were a few okay things on the buffet, such as the roasted chicken and the mashed potatoes, but most things were pretty forgettable.  The buffet's hallmark is the crepe station.  I waited in line for nearly 20 minutes for a crepe because there was only one person working the station and she was allowing people to order 3, 4, and even 5 crepes at a time.  Aside from being tacky on the part of the customers, it really should against policy in the interest of moving the line.  When I finally had my chance, I ordered a crepe with chicken and cheese.  When I bit into it, I noticed the filling was just as cold as it was in the refrigerator.  After about 2 bites, I gave up, disappointed that I waited in line that long.  I suppose the sweet crepes are the better option there.

GAzrAHRWPhuBs0E5bfL-ug.text: Le Village is one of my 2 favorite buffets in Vegas!  Everything was delicious, my mouth is watering just thinking about it!  We loved it so much we ate here twice during a 4 day trip!

i1PKIqwx7u2nGD7FQ7usow.text: Food:  Top notch.  Crepes.  Crepes.   Crepes.  I would have literally eaten every single option they offered if I could have.  My sister in law and I loved them!  Quite extensive and yummy food too.    Awesome.   Service.  Sucked.  Not even a single drink refill.  Plates would stack up as we sat there.  Not in the least bit impressed.  Good thing the food was so good I didn't care.  We were with a party of 8 so they tried to charge us up front an automatic 17% tip, I hate it when places do that.  Feel like it's an excuse for them to provide crappy service, which was indeed the case.  Price: $23.99 for a weekend brunch which I thought was ok.  You get $5 off with a rewards card.  Go and enjoy!!!!!

XYH514BoJvEeuvA2TmxveA.text: Our group of four decided to try the brunch buffet at the Paris since we heard it was unlimited champagne. It made the $25 price tag worth it to us just for that fact!
