We arrived around 11:30 pm on a Saturday morning, so while there was a line, it moved pretty quickly and we only waited for around 15 minutes. By the time we left around 1 pm, the line was much much longer. Service was the best I have ever received at a buffet - our waitress kept the champagne flowing and the orange juice glasses full.  Overall, I found the food very underwhelming, especially the pastries. I was expecting good pastries at the Paris buffet, but was disappointed with the pain au chocolat that my husband and I split. The eclair was better, but still not amazing. The hash browns were practically burnt and chilly by the time I got to them in line. The farfalle pasta with pesto was by far the best thing I ate at the buffet. One of our friends got the crab legs, but ended up not being able to eat them due to not being able to get a cracker for them. Also, I would have liked brie since there was baguette. If there was brie and I missed it, it was hidden.  I'm glad we tried this buffet and I really appreciated all the champagne, but there are better brunch or lunch options on the Strip.

aL5CxPIk4GaYokrTQNCHOw.text: The line for Sunday brunch is sooo long!    Over all the food was A-ok.  Selection wise -I don't think is as good as other newer hotels.  Their dessert selection is quite good.  A must try is their Macaroons, it's just very good!

x2Cu8F2Gh3FvIA8jNfTVAg.text: The food here is amazing!  I try to make here once a year.  The roast beef & turkey were tender & delicious.  After having the awesome mashed potatoes & vegetables, i tried the ham crepes.  It was delicious!!! There are different crepes.  I think all are tasty.

bjobQQycIrsb_XtG8zRLmw.text: We always go here when we are in Vegas. It's not real French food, but its kinda close. I have to admit, for some reason, we always come here whenever we are in Las Vegas. It seems like the trip may not be complete without stopping here for a buffet.  The place can be crowded and the wait can be long, especially for lunch and dinner. There are a variety of food you can devour here. They are not all French food, majority is really more American style buffet food.  Sometimes, the smoke from the casino can travel inside the restaurant. Just remember, you are in a casino, so that is not unusual. The staff are very friendly and they are very responsive.  We probably will come back here again whenever we are in Las Vegas. It is one of our go-to places since it opened and our trip to Las Vegas seems incomplete if we don't stop by at le Village Buffet.

uD7_VkkKg8ITnMntCN_fmQ.text: I was very excited to try the Paris Buffet because I heard it was pretty good... but NO GOOD!   Food was very salty. Meat is extremely dry. I didn't eat a lot of the stuff on my plate because it just wasn't good. The crepe bar was nice, but that's a given considering we're in "Paris". Very average buffet that I probably would not go to again.  However our server was extremely friendly and kind. +1 for that =) I didn't think it was worth the price for the dinner buffet.. I would think it's better for a lunch/brunch. It's probably worth a stop if you buy the Buffet of Buffets (~40 for 24 hour buffet pass at 7 buffets) which is what I did the next day.

rtMbnd-zxpWs_tm0Dd1oKA.text: My favorite buffet! Maybe I am just a crepe addict, but man oh man Nutella, bananas foster, savory crepes.... The works! Very pricey though, like eat till you can no longer breathe to get your money's worth. Service was eh, the lady at the crepe station didn't say a word to me... But whatever, she made my crepe perfect so that's what matters I guess.

jUIiRC3Y-p8Nrs4arjxnnA.text: Pretty disappointing, especially for a Christmas brunch. I ordered a chocolate and strawberry crepe from the crepe bar and I'm pretty sure they were just using Hershey's chocolate syrup. Ick. Why not use chocolate chips that melt down as the crepe cooks?! That's what I do... lol.  Everything else was pretty bland, and not very French, for that matter. Where were the croque monsieurs? Croissants? Baguettes? Le sigh.  I did like their French onion soup... And their creme brulee was pretty good, but honestly, the one at Planet Hollywood's buffet was better, oddly enough.

YdVS_4SKYLGTHpaGJXGkyw.text: The crepes were the correct texture for me.  There is a very large assortment of food to choose from in this buffet.  The pastas with the white sauces were excellent.  The waitress was very attentive to refill my drink.  The crab shell has indents on it to make it easier to crack open.  The dipping butter for the crab has a hint of garlic.  This buffet is wonderful as always!

I4a1asMnBkzDIBYOjvc-OA.text: Just like any other buffet places on the strip, basically serving everything you need. They do have crab legs, and they have an on-site crepe station providing a variety of choices. The other spotlight will be the desert selection.....you need check that one out yourselves! :)

SzjN-jsma8LAra2XtiUUwg.text: Came to Vegas for the weekend for the Mayweather/Mosley fight. MGM where I was staying was a mad house. So to get a break from the crowd I walk down the strip to Paris and Planet Hollywood. Im not a buffet person at all. I'd rather go to a nice sit down restaurant. Mass produced food usually isnt as good. But on this trip it just didnt work out that way. So out of the three buffets I went to on my trip I enjoyed Paris the most by far. I liked Italian food there, along with the prime rib. I have to say pretty decent food for guy who doesn't like buffets.

DaBSFQqDGTl-_PtlyxYSiQ.text: I came here two weeks ago with my friend. I found that there is less variety of food. The service here was ok. I found it wrong that our server served the table drinks behind us when my friend and I were there before them.  My review is about the same as  my previous one, but minus one star for the service.

MIz3s1wWgEgVxV8Q9KBA7w.text: Went to the dinner buffet here tonight.  It is $30.99 plus tax per person.  We were in line for about 30 minutes.  Had a great table under a "tree."  As you may have noticed we're in town for a few nights and had been to the Bellagio a few nights ago but weren't too impressed with the food although the Bellagio service was great.  Tonight, the food at Le Village was great but the service was a little shabby.  Never mind, we were more interested in the food.  The prime rib was good but so were the grilled chicken and the bouillabaisse (who knew) as were many other things in between.  For dessert there were nice little cakes and sweets and, of course, the crepes.  I ordered the number 2 and asked the lady to put a little of the brandied apples in as well.  Then she drizzled some raspberry sauce on top and I added some chocolate.  Oh my, it was the biggest crepe I ever had but it was sooooo good - could not finish it though.  We had gone for Sunday brunch a while back and liked that too.  The best thing for this place is to get Bellagio to provide the service for the Le Village food.  That would be a 5-star Vegas buffet.

pYpdQt5UYZKv_FJd0E_ZRQ.text: Disgusting and over priced, at least for breakfast.  The line is long, the food is bland, and options are limited.  You are much better off going to IHop

j7TJ-_o2nv36UPCKQV7ZRQ.text: I like this buffet! Went here once and would definitely go again.  We were staying in Paris back in 2009 so we decided to try out the buffet. When we got down there, the line was so long! It was a Sunday morning after all. To the left of the buffet, they have a special line where youp ay about $10 more and you get to skip right to the front of the line. Totally worth it. You also get some mimosas. The food is unique and full of the flavor. The layout is also adorable. The food is very french inspired. It is split up into the 5 French provinces I think. I recommend this buffet! It's different and delicious.

HtWiGRgU7804pd2Y7KGMxg.text: Even if you hate buffets, just try this place. If you're using the Buffet of Buffets offer that is basically unlimited buffets at all the Harrah's properties for 24 hours for $45, you'll want to come back again and again.  Most buffets have a hunk of dry roast beef they try to pass off as Prime Rib, this one will actually serve steak.  Ice cream? No, these guys do gelato. Speaking of dessert, how about a freshly made crepe made-to-order?  I would be giving this place five stars but the particular waiter we had was very inattentive and it was difficult to get our drinks filled.

4og2l83_JRh-KUcuUXQHHA.text: We came here for lunch on the 24 Hour Buffet of Buffets pass. Nothing stellar in our opinion. The desserts were the worst. Absolutely nothing was labeled (so you had no clue what anything was). Between us, we had some of the meats/proteins and sides. The mushroom chicken had the best flavor but the ham and turkey were very bland and didn't have a lot of flavor. Also, a lot of the signs were mixed up for the food it was assigned to. This is only the second buffet we've visited but overwhelmingly, the Spice Market Buffet in Planet Hollywood had better all around flavor.

JBOijdTRsTR6E3h_RChBxw.text: Can't go wrong with breakfast. The wait wasn't that long either. They're smart, they start with a lot of eggs and carby stuff. Then you get to the better stuff. I got a bunch of stuff, as you can see on my stuffed plate picture. anyways, I liked the eggs and multiple type of sausages. I had a ton of bacon. They even have corned beef and hash there! Oh that's my favorite!!!!! I didn't wait in line for the omelette bar. And I do agree with Shannon L. and Hana C., the inside decor does remind you of Beauty and the Beast, maybe that's what made the food more enjoyable.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GM6OA4sZNujEYQrqf-BWvg.text: bleh.  i should have known better... if i'm paying this much for a buffet, i should have gone to the bellago, wicket spoon or the wynn... no exceptions.   i didn't see anything that warranted the 35 bucks price tag.  however i didn't try the crepe station, i don't think it would have changed my mind.  the only redeeming factor about this place was the prime rib.  it was its only saving grace... and to be honest, it was mediocre at best.    the seafood/sushi section... i don't even want to talk about it.. i'm going to save my energy to write my next review..  it was "bleh"  the dessert station was alright.. the best thing in my opinion was the creme brelee.   they need to remodel this place and give it more of a wow factor.  it looks very grungy and archaic..  i feel like this place caters towards the older crowd... like 50+.  haha

Xh4xJHqeB_yCKYspU3ovkQ.text: We wanted to avoid the typical buffets in Las Vegas, but was so glad we ate here.  the food was great, my wife and i debated if we should try the crepes, we are so glad we did!  the line for the restaurant moves quick dont get discouraged. unlimited beer wine for  only 12 bucks!

oZA5PjEFsfrisx7oyV3x9g.text: I have visited this place today for my dinner with friends,  after reading reviews this supposed to be one of the best after Bellagia and Caesars,  but I was totally disappointed,  entries are awful,  we didt like any dish as exceptional in fact deserts as well not good as other place.

ie-DgBW3mO7j_4zTWRmoRw.text: I didnt like this buffet! I wont go again. We can buy one meal or 24h, fortunately, we just bought for one meal.  For this price we could have a pretty better food. The food was "okay", and I only enjoy the dessert. I wont recommend it for anyone.

fY2sBj34KMH2a0pgrWRV1g.text: We had pre-purchased the 7-buffet pass for $34.99, which allows you to go to as many Harrah-owned buffets (Rio, Caesar's, Flamingo, Paris, etc) as you can within a 24-hour time frame.    We had tried Lago Buffet at Caesar's Palace the night before, so we squeezed in Breakfast here before we departed.  We got here at 8:45am and the line was pretty minimal, but by 9am, it started getting really long.  So get here early if you can!  They have a huge variety of breakfast items here, with a variety of eggs, breads, muffins, bagels, fruits, and sausages.  Other items included quiches, baked oatmeal, cereal, and pastries.  They also have an omelet and crepes station.  Suffice to say, you won't go hungry here.

H92z-HreHLCjJo4RI3KVKg.text: We got to Vegas late on a Sunday and planned on getting the buffet of buffets pass and decided to start at Paris. Great choice. Never being to Vegas and walking into this place for my first meal in Vegas was great. We paid the up charge for all you can drink and we literally had seven drinks sitting on our table at one time. Miguel was our server and he was awesome. He even got us drinks to go. But the food, wow. I wanted to take pictures of all the food before I ate it and it tasted just as good. It really felt like a high end restaurant and it was a buffet. The scenery was also beautiful. Highly recommend. Also can't beat the price at 55 dollars for dinner, breakfast, lunch, and dinner again. We were able to eat at several other buffets but this place was the best.

_CAiL_wB0g1Xd9fh24UHOQ.text: I have been to Vegas over 50 times across a 20 year time frame and this is the worst buffet ever. I am not a hard person to please and rarely leave negative reviews. Bad food, bad service, dirty and dark. Save your time, money and energy. My buffet was comped and I am still upset that I wasted my time. Only tried it because the St Louis cafe next door is excellent. As I type this Im 14 minutes into waiting for a coffee. Absolutely ridiculous when I am capable of getting it myself.

XxNtA_-kB6jP7WS1iUrbkQ.text: WOW - this is definitely one of the WORST places to go to eat in Las Vegas. I used to hear about how great this buffet was and I just never got the chance to try it. Well, I finally did and wish I didn't!  In fact, I wish I could put no stars because that's what this restaurant deserves!  I am definitely a foodie and when I get to enjoy good food, I am a happy person. This last trip to Vegas, I got to enjoy many great buffets - Wicked Spoon (lunch and dinner), Bachannal Buffet and the Buffet @ the Wynn.  Le Village's standard is worse than Hometown Buffet. Everything is laden with salt. Don't bother trying the seafood dishes either. Everything tasted frozen and old.  Even the breads were cold and stale. How can you mess that up? And as for presentation - it reminded me of the horrible buffet from the movie, "Vegas Vacation". Everything looked brown, saucy and yellow.  And to top of our visit, we were sat in the section with the worst waiter. An older gentlemen who said "oh my god" as he came to our table. When I asked him for an ice tea, after he forgot the first time, he scolded me and cut me off with "okay, don't worry, i got it". And then never bringing me my ice tea - EVER. He disappeared after that. He didn't even take away our dirty plates. I had to take my plates and my guests plates over to the bus boy station, myself.  TO SUM IT UP -- DON'T GO HERE! Everything from service to food deserves a big giant F!!!

Fcs3jWGfnaFTru4BPYOCUA.text: I went for the Sunday Champagne & the Champagne itself was just ok..(they're not gonna give u the good stuff 4 Buffets anyways...) we ended up making Mimosas with the Champagne & OJ =) They take your drink orders upfront @ the cashier 1st & then the waiter/waitress brings your drinks 4 u afterwards when you're seated...(weird, but that's how they do it)..the waiters here seem to be very unorganized..we kept getting approached by several different waiters asking us the same question...don't they know/ have assigned section as to who's waiting who?? crazy..  I do not know WHY everyone is raving about the crab legs here...they're all SO skinny with absolutely no meat inside...not worth working on...& it looked like people had been picking through them already..Yuckk.. =/ This is definitely NOT the place 2go 2 for crab legs!! If you REALLy like crab legs, go to Bellagio / Rio's Buffet...they have an awesome selection of seafoods..  The dessert section/bar was extremely lacking..I was expecting more of a variety due to the "French" theme that they were going for here... the only thing that was actually good for desserts was the Creme Brulee (which was way too small)..the ice cream machine was broken, so that sucked.. The crepes were good, but I wished that they had more toppings &fruits to choose from to put into /on them.. =/  I know that they received several awards several years earlier, but it's funny how they haven't gotten any recently?? I wonder why?? Hmm...maybe cuz the service & the quality of food has gone downhill perhaps?? yupp.. that must be it.. I'm def. not gonna come back..I'd rather go to Bellagio / Rio's Buffet...WAY more worth it...

VKL-nne4b7TRPdmh3cDc6Q.text: Great buffet at an awesome price! Less than $35 for a great variety of food choices and bottomless mimosas. What else can you ask for? We came here yesterday for Sunday brunch and loved it. The only negative thing that I will mention is the long line. We waited for about 30 minutes before getting to our table but it was so worth the wait. We will definitely visit this place again.

_4CMtcc1yLb_9H8YdaEFIw.text: We stayed at the Paris hotel and a few of us wanted quick and fast food that didn't require a dress code.  This was our buffet in our hotel and it was $20 for our lunch meal.  They really didn't have anything good to eat.  The only place I thought would have been worth my money, was the crepe stand, but the crepes were soggy and moist by the time I got back to my eating area.   My favorite part of this buffet was the sauteed mushrooms and the onion soup.  Even the prime rib was over done and dry.   I was so desperate, I went to the pasta stand and asked them to just boil me pasta and I made my own onion, pasta soup.   I was sad when I left. THEY DIDN'T EVEN HAVE BACON!  Will not be back, I rather take my buffet experience elsewhere and pay more for quality food.

UPt9DEAAUhWoapIvaJPhtg.text: So sad :( This buffet used to be our favorite place! It has really gone downhill in the past few years. The food was bland and very few selections. Their dessert area looked like a tornado went through it. And where's the Creme brulee? All they had last night was a few hard macaroons and some cake. I'm never coming here again.

eZzkXQRk1883jvyCGnJtBw.text: Best breakfast I had in Vegas! The decor is very cute, made to look like you're eating in a French village. Each station has the name of a neighborhood or village in France, but I think that's more for lunch/dinner than for breakfast.  The made-to-order crepe station is definitely the thing you have to get. There are 8 crepe options, but you could probably get a custom one if you want. When I went, there was only one guy making crepes, so I stood in line for a good 10 or 15 minutes. Still worth it.  Biscuits and gravy were also delicious, and the egg guy made my two eggs over medium perfectly. My husband said this buffet has the best smoked salmon he's ever eaten. Coffee was pretty decent, too.  Go here for breakfast and you can't go wrong. We came using the Buffet of Buffet passes--definitely worth it!

R6k1OMaXP-udSiOmb_n85Q.text: I highly recommend this place for breakfast. Of course breakfast is the only time I've ever been here. I'm not sure why they sat me as far as possible from everything since I was by myself. I had to walk past 6 empty two sweater table for the hour I was there. But that aside, make sure you do not skip the crepe bar!  And bring a buck with you. Those guys deserve a tip! ;) I got the #2 crepe which was full of berries drizzled with raspberry syrup. Outstanding. Not too sweet. Just sweet enough. I would defiantly go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First bite was amazingness!!!

QabuezeLu4PdzNajcJHsbA.text: I don't see what everybody is complaining about. The food here is great, they have a good theme, but, the service was a bit slow. Some of the meats were a little drier than I expected, but the prime rib was tasty. I have to recommend the crepes. The dessert crepes were excellent. Speaking of dessert, the ice cream was very high quality.  All in all, it was the best buffet that I have gone to and it was very good, the service was lacking and they could work on some things. Four stars. Not the best food, but for a buffet it was great, price was right, but it wasn't perfect.

rWffD4DjMXd4is3V9EK17w.text: I'm a little bit crazy, in that I generally don't eat at buffets...unless I'm in Las Vegas. Yeah, I know. Weird.  ANYWAY, there always seemed to be a really long line for Le Village, so we avoided it in the past. However, I was recently in Vegas for a work event, and was gifted with Diamond status for the Harrah's "family" of hotels and casinos, so I was able to use my VIP status to bypass the line, go through the fancy area, and get seated right away. YAY!  The ambiance of the Le Village buffet gets 4 stars. They really try to make you feel like you're in a little courtyard somewhere in France, which is cool with me. Especially when I was coming down from a stressful weekend and just wanted to relax, eat, and drink. I didn't feel like I was in Vegas, which totally worked for me. Our server was really nice, and had iced teas and mimosas (YAY, mimosas!!) on the table right away, and our mimosa glasses really didn't ever get empty. I'm a big fan of free unlimited mimosas, so I was a pretty happy girl from that standpoint.  Now, the food. Honestly, from the ever-present line and a lot of the reviews, I was expecting to be wowed. And I really wasn't. I mean, the food was good, and this buffet is definitely better than some, but there wasn't anything terribly French. Or many things that I couldn't get at any other buffet, really. But there were some pretty good dishes that I did break my one plate rule for and went back for seconds: bacon and brie pasta, spicy mussels, garlic mushrooms, roasted tomatoes, lamb tips, shrimp (oh, shrimp. How I love you.), and the antipasti plate. The creme brulee for dessert was nice, but nothing to swoon over. The rest of the desserts didn't do it for me, which was probably good, after the second plate of the things I mentioned above!  The price was comparable to other Vegas buffets, and for the quality of the food, a better deal than at some of the other hotels. All in all, was it good? Yep. Was it my favorite Las Vegas buffet? Nope. Would I be back again? Yes, but I wouldn't wait for ages in a line. It's a solid option, though, and like I said...the ambiance is worth it, especially if you want to feel like you're not in Vegas for awhile.

3rLIHkuz4FAXuVPFbeqiNA.text: If I learned anything from my brief love affair with Texas Hold 'Em it'd be the importance of value in gambling. The pot was raised when I heard about the 24-hour all-you-can-eat deal, and then raised some more with rave reviews from friends and Yelp. In our little quartet, me agreeing to do the buffet deal would make two frequent guests friends happy, and my boyfriend full of food, so the expectations were positive, so I went all-in.  The result? The food was pretty good! And by my math, three meals came to ~$15 each, which is a steal for Vegas (you can't even get a drink at a club for that price). The veggies were fresh, the meat was surprisingly juicy, but the real star of the show was the crepe area. Oh boy, I threw in some poached pears and drizzled raspberry sauce on top - delightful.   I don't know how to end my poker analogy because if you know anything about poker you can tell I don't quite understand "value" even though I know it's important. So, I'll end with something like, it's no Big Slick, but it's like getting dealt a pair of 9s. Yeah, it could be better, but still pretty good. Eh?

u90lbrqYl_1biQyIlmOxEg.text: I was quite disappointed because i expected more French cuisine at this buffet. Turned out this was just a regular American buffet.   Not too many selections of meat and seafood. Booo. It was a far cry from Bacchanal.  Plus sides were the decoration was beautiful. There were more desserts but not that much.  I went here on a game night when the Warriors were playing the Thunder in Game 7. It was a good feeling when, after finishing the buffet, I had a chance to walk back to my hotel (Planet of Hollywood) and watched the Warriors winning game 7 against the Thunder together with the pro-Warriors crowd there.  Cost $38 including tips and tax.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

fUnklcedIWUSJWwGvmwYDg.text: Went around 5 pm for dinner today (Sunday). It was $31.99/pp which we thought wasn't too bad for a buffet at The Paris Hotel. When we went there were only a couple people ahead of us paying for their dinner. After we paid we waited a few minutes to be seated by the hostess. Once we were seated we waited several minutes before being greeted by our waitress and asked what we'd like for our drinks.   The buffet was so small and they did double of some of the items so that made it even less of a variety. There was NOTHING there I actually liked. Everything in the Asian section was so old, the Steamed buns were as hard as a rock and all the lo Mein noodles were smooshy and stuck together.   The "prime rib" tasted like stew meat and wasn't juicy or red. When we were done eating we weren't satisfied at all, with anything. All of the desserts were a miss. Some of the macaroons were ok but I expected so so so much better.   I tried the crepe station where the first time I went there was no one there and I stood there for a minute thinking they might not be doing it today - I went off to get food elsewhere. I saw her there the next time I got up and asked for a banana Nutella crepe. She had already made a crepe before I got there and she just tossed it on the heat and splattered bananas in it. It was cold and the crepe was already getting stale. :(   We also didn't have any utensils or napkins on our table - my boyfriend got up and grabbed some off an unoccupied table and our table and chairs still had crumbs all over it that we wiped off on our own. Our cups were completely empty and we had to finally ask for a refill to actually get more. There were a lot of people here but still all of the food looked untouched.   We have had much better food and service at buffets for half the price of this one. Who cares about the beautiful decor inside. Just walk through the shops or something, the whole Paris hotel and casino is beautiful enough.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella Crepe

eBj5qz81bI9LK3oRYgO1lQ.text: Gross. Most of the food was just barely on the bad side of mediocre. The seafood was boring, the meats were dry, the pastas were unexceptional, and the macarons were a travesty. The only thing I enjoyed was the lobster rotini, and while the price of entry correlates well to a lobster dish, it would've been much better elsewhere. This buffet was, in my opinion, an utter insult to my time and money.

GzZxYFIOmjg9ba4tWumJ2w.text: French onion soup was good, but sadly missing the cheese. WTF is FOS without the cheese?!?! Prime rib is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!! Rolls were dry. Truffle Mac and cheese was amazing! Creamy and so much flavor. Skip the pasta and go for thirds on the prime rib. Seriously. I will dream about that prime rib. Shrimp are very fresh. Truffle mushroom crepe is so light and fluffy...words don't do it justice. Small desserts were just okay. Creme Brule was sadly disappointing. Banana Nutella crepe was middle of the road - edible but not outstanding. Cookie dough crepe was HORRID! Stay away.   The breakfast is the best on the strip IMHO. Just make sure you go late morning so you can stay while they switch for lunch

hUapGUlVDSlngQSQyGE0Og.text: My wife and I tried the breakfast buffet for a treat - $23.99 per person.  We were disappointed in the food, and the service was not good.  There were some tasty items, but at $25 pp (with tax) you want to be blown away, we were not.  We had such a difficult time getting more coffee, my wife took a carafe off a table where the folks had left (that was after waiting 15 minutes for someone to pick up our empty carafe).  They seemed to focused on clearing tables more than providing good service.  The slab bacon was all fat.  The crepe was ok - but was reheated in front of me instead of being made fresh.  This place was ranked #3 for breakfast buffets on a website I reviewed.  If that's True, I recommend staying away from the buffets.

FnIWptHmKKWJ9TTHMC8iKA.text: Headed to Le Village Buffet on a Friday night and it was great. Line was kind of long which scared me a bit but so is every other buffet line on The Strip. It was worth the wait and price was average. LOVED the variety of food and the service was great. Everyone was very attentive of our table and I was able to eat more than my fair share. Hello Photo Ops being inside Paris Hotel (a dream of mine).

eEL8kb-emu-XbiABW8IJMw.text: Breakfast want too bad. Worth the money i paid. Slots laid for my meal. Will come back for dinner another day

jHIWQlskYvckX5l-ZckH3Q.text: We came here the week of Christmas for dinner buffet.  Price was $29.99 for adult and kids.  The wait to get in was about 30 minutes which was ok with us.  Food: sushi was horrible. The spicy tuna did not taste a bit like tuna.  Crab legs were ok. Prime ribs     were very good.  Moist and tender.  French onion soup was too salty.  The crepe station had a very long line with one poor guy making crepes.  I waited at least 30 mins for it.  It was good but how not worth waiting in line for 30 mins good.  I can't believe they did not add another person to help that poor guy to make crepes.  The dessert station offered many varieties of pasties and cakes.  I tried the cream brulee and fruit tarts. Both were ok.  Service: our service was very attentive and friendly.    Parking: Valet or self parking   The last time I dined here was a few years ago.  After this time, the food was not that great for the price I paid.  I don't think I will be back any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Waited 30 minutes in line for the crepes.

_OFB9-l-QwUyBzlAlT2bgA.text: I'm not sure if we arrived at the wrong time during their lunch hours but they seemed to have ran out on a lot of their food items. There wasn't much of a variety but their beef stew was pretty good. I gave the three stars solely based on their desert menu because that was the most impressive part of theirmenu. Needless to say I don't plan on returning unless I have a really strong sweet tooth.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wioUOVw6u3yRl-x0NE1nRQ.text: Salmon here is delicious - well done for a buffet. Praline cake led me to return a second day. Macarons should be chewier although it's a nice thing to have at a buffet. Fresh made crepes are lovely although the berries in mine were still cold. Waitstaff and bussers are amazing!

ChmpdoqzhAO0W5B7RwAA3Q.text: I love my fair share of buffets and food! I have to say this did not disappoint. They have hot or cold crab legs, prime rib, different stations and a cute little dessert station. The only complaint we had was the food carver. But once we told the manager he took her right off the floor. Great customer service!!! And our waiter was awesome

krgS-4RYkeWgx5uDI4UBXQ.text: I came for dinner using a Groupon deal! This is my favorite buffet in Vegas!! There may be less variety in terms of types of food, but the quality and taste of food is better than some of the more expensive Vegas buffets!! The prime rib is always tender and I enjoy the variety of sides, including mashed potatoes, green beans, mushrooms, and these braised lentils that were really delicious! There is definitely plenty of vegetable offerings, which is scarce in other budgets. The soups -cream of leek and French onion were also very good. Saving room for the crepes is a must!! You can pick from mixed berries , strawberries, and Nutella and bananas. I got mixed berries with whipped cream, and it was the best crepe I've ever had in my life! The whipped cream was soooo good!! I wish I had room to try all 3! There are also savory crepes! I would highly recommend this buffet. The taste and value can't be beat!

jgPJCYg-MTWqJaI0yOaLmA.text: Came here for breakfast and over all the experience went well. Very nicely decorated to give you that Paris feel atmosphere. The service was great from all the dining staff so that made the meal more relaxed and comforting. Large variety of meals to choose from that will leave you full and satisfied. The loxs are a MUST! So delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First plate from the breakfast buffet! Bomb!

FgHsYh-6lCXG8s71A7j4Lg.text: Came to this buffet before leaving Vegas. One of the crepe machines was down so the line took a very long time and the food was, for the most part, not impressive.  The item I found that did outshine the others was the andouille sausage. Very juicy and full of flavor.  The rest of the food was subpar - sushi looked like it was rotting, the ice cream was just normal soft serve, and mostly everything else around looked like it was sitting there for a while.   If you're going to get a lot of food, this place does the trick, but not great quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tWm3GXp5icSG_FOt7j_B-g.text: Came for breakfast,  21.99. It was good, good selection of food as t the buffet.  Our waiter was not attentive at all. Mite be back if in the mood for a crepe.

lBrcy6KSJofbcMRgZ7iHNg.text: Little food selection. When you ask the workers for help they give attitude and get upset

FfCxpRNsMkBWk0F7BFBb4Q.text: Love this buffet! The line is insane though but it turns out you can book the day before on open table!! Gorgeous inside and out. Great crepes made right in front of you. Love this one.

YnbnpNqANdZBMSHGCKqUBA.text: Here in Vegas on our 25th anniversary. Decided to give the buffet in Paris Hotel a try. Went onto Groupon and got 2 dinner buffets with bottomless beer and wine for only $59.99tx considering we are in Vegas it's actually a good deal! The line to start off with a little bit however: was made up by the great service and the wide variety of foods from prime rib or roasted chicken to salmon or crab or just pasta. Not to mention all the delicious desserts and the great atmosphere hard to believe you're in a building yet when you're sitting down it looks like you're in the courtyard in Paris. The waitress was really on top of her game and make sure we never were thirsty and constantly replenished our drinks before we even had to ask which is very rare. Long story short if you're in the area and looking for a buffet it's worth a try!

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious desserts
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_3uBCpOtwNxg9_-nBeK47g.text: I appreciated the low price for being a Vegas buffet, especially taking the option of crab legs into consideration. However, I do think you can taste the low price. The crab legs are conveniently split down the middle making feasting simple and fast. I was a little disappointed in the taste. Overall, I was a little disappointed in the quality of food offered, but I would be back for the low price and decent options.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs split down the middle

IBJRjg3OcU0gxabGoI3vVg.text: Really dissatisfied with the selection here. Complete waste of money. Food doesn't seem fresh, pricing changes without notice, even if you call the casino!

NuOJWC_LvusDxJAdvI-b2w.text: Le Village Buffet (Paris) Las Vegas Strip, NV 9am Tuesday 6th August 2013 Four Stars  No matter the day or how early we get up, there is always a line which is sort of a testament of how good this brunch buffet is.  After 30 minutes in line, we paid $22 for the Buffet and $12 for AYCD (Mimosas/Bloody Mary's).  I ate 7 types of meat (Bacon, Turkey Bacon, Canadian Bacon, Smoke Bacon, Ham, Andouille, and Corned Beef), 4 types of Potatoes, (Regular Hash Browns, Triangle Hash Browns, Potato Lyonese, and Hash, and 3 types of eggs (poached, scramble, omelet).  I also enjoyed an asparagus, chicken, cheese and tomato crepe with a garlic cream sauce.   I love Buffets because you can make your own unique food.  I took one of their mini waffles and topped it with a poached egg, Hollandaise, and Corned Beef & Hash.    The service was slow on my mimosas, I only enjoyed 4 flute glasses worth.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Waffle Topped with Poached Egg, Hollandaise, and Corn Beef Hash
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ridiculous Plate of Meat and Potatoes

82FeM7DVJC7zK_1ouayd4Q.text: Went there for breakfast.I was there for dinner a few years ago and it was decent but the breakfast buffet was pretty bad.I felt sick to my stomach for a few hours after I left.I really don't understand the line there

MvoLKCUQB-OkTSkQKNrF6Q.text: This place used to be really good once, but when I returned again, I was very disappointed by the price and quality of the food. First off, for 4 people to eat I spent a little over $100. And let me tell you, it wasn't worth the money or the wait.  The food is such poor quality, and they cook way too much of it. Don't get me wrong, I know it's a Buffet, but if it's 12 pm and there's still a whole tub of bacon and waffles still sitting there from this morning, then something's wrong. And like i said, it's just way too much things they make, yet it's so tasteless and not the best quality.   The salmon lox tasted obviously like it's been frozen and defrosted. It didn't taste fresh. The cream cheese they used on the side wasn't even good too. It wouldn't go on the plate and it was stuck to the serving spoon. And something about the texture of it didn't seem right.   The croissants tasted obviously store bought. They were stale, not flaky, and chewy. Also not buttery, almost like eating regular chewy old bread.   The rice they had there was also undercooked. It was also a little watery and lacked flavor. Very disappointed by that.  The cheese and salami was pretty bad too. The salami tasted like the salami out of a lunchables pack and the cheese wasn't very good quality either and not fresh.  Although, the prime rib was actually pretty good. I didn't have a problem with it. Also since I saw them make it and how they make it, It was pretty nice.  But other than that it the good was disappointing. Sausages were flavorless and mashed potatoes were flavorless too. The country gravy was awful and just super chunky. And it didn't taste very good.  Overall my experience here was pretty bad. The service was pretty nice and the servers were friendly and helpful. But the food is just straight out pretty horrible. Would I come here again? Obviously not. If you're looking for a nice buffet in Vegas, this is obviously not your go to destination. There's much better out there in Vegas trust me.

DBwBeJ6ZEK8CCxADj6ogdg.text: The theme is meant to be French, but that would be a stretch. This is "French" food the way Panda Express is "Chinese" food or Taco Bell is "Mexican" food. That may be fine for some people, but I certainly didn't enjoy it. This is a very solid 2 stars. Mediocre at best, with a few highlights. Vegetables were often overcooked, lots of the food didn't have much flavor, and items were often mislabeled.  My husband and in-laws enjoyed it, and they ate a lot of the meat dishes. Then again, they were going for quantity and cost over quality. If you enjoy eating lots of food versus enjoying quality food, this is a good option because it's relatively cheap by Vegas buffets.  As a vegetarian, there are few options with protein (and I'd say vegans are screwed). There were a few semi-decent pasta options--two "gourmet" mac and cheese ones (and one Mediterranean one that tasted really funky), plenty of vegetables (many overcooked), and a salad bar. The mac and cheese with peas was one of the highlights, along with the mashed potatoes.  For meat eaters, there was plenty--crab legs, prime rib, mussels, chicken, pork, and more.  Dessert was pretty bad. They had "macarons" but they were a really chewy, flavorless merengue and the fillings weren't good. Tiramisu had no coffee flavor, cheesecake just had no flavor at all, and many others were tasteless or were just sweet. Most of the desserts were mislabeled, which made them even less enjoyable, since you might think you were eating one thing, only to find out it was something else (this happened multiple times--cannoli tarts were labeled lemon tarts, chocolate cake was labeled tiramisu, tiramisu [which came in a chocolate cup where all you could see in the cup was custard] was labeled as creme brulee). It was like the kitchen staff didn't know what the desserts were and made their best guess when putting them out.   Anyway, in case it's not obvious, I would not recommend this place. Pay extra and go to a better buffet (or just a nice restaurant), or pay less and enjoy a meal somewhere else.

gkUXIbZXRkhdHOJ9drTjSA.text: This was our first time in Vegas so we had to do one buffet. And now I can say I've done one and leave it at that.  This one was ok, decently priced ($1 off if you have Total Rewards). With plenty of options. The reason we chose this one is because of the crepes station, which was quite tasty.  It's a buffet, it is filled with buffet lovers and that kinda of food. The bacon was limp and not great. The pastries were good. I will say the sausage gravy was absolutely excellent.  There are a lot of options but the sausage gravy was the only thing that really stuck out to me. The coffee was meh, the service meh, and the food just a-ok. But there are options for everyone. This was good for a hangover, plenty of greasy options to soak it all up.  By far the highlight was a girl coming to the counter to pay "Do you guys like have a big breakfast?" Um. It's a buffet sweetheart, says that outside. It provided a good chuckle.

il9L0649dVobdBweZ5VNtg.text: What a terrible experience in this venue was for my family a party of 10 on Thanksgiving evening -we originally had a reservation for six that was placed through OpenTable -when four more people joined our group I needed to change the reservation to a party of 10 I called the restaurant and spoke with an assistant manager who assured me that he would change the reservation to a party of 10 and I was to cancel the open table reservation which I did.  Upon arriving Thanksgiving eveningThe manager came out extremely rude his name was Frank was very abrupt-  basically telling me I made up the whole story and there's no way that any of his employees would ever do that then asked me to pull up the email showing the canceled open table reservation which I did - He still would not admit to any wrong doing on the part of his staff and took a very pompous attitude with me -I would never recommend anyone to ever go to the Paris buffet this manager Frank was absolutely horrible and should not be working in the public sector

ufFd3JcKf8IeFOe0fH8t2A.text: Great ambiance, lines usually long, like anywhere else.  Ohhh Laaa Laaa Enjoyed lots of visits here except for the last were the food was sitting out too long and the people behind the carving station were lacking in experience. The seafood had been sitting out way too long and............. I could make a better crepe any day of the week blindfolded. Yes, blindfolded!

kqs3WAbq1QGKJa3iHRpvuw.text: I had breakfast here with my wife and we both loved the food. Best buffet food and amazing service, and at half the price of the higher end buffets.

AYdpP8tltAJDV8yYVBNUmw.text: Le Village Buffet offers all things French! Macaroons till Monday, baguettes galore, and seafood heaven. This buffet will have you screaming for more. I love the seating, it's very Disney-like, specifically Pirates of the Caribbean the restaurant. Wonderful service, they're very friendly, hard working and attentive.   I recommend seating in one of the little rooms, just ask your host if you can sit in one, they'll usually seat you unless it's completely full.   For breakfast: arrive early, I'm talking about 9-9:30am on a weekday, probably 8:30am on a weekend or a holiday. We arrived at 9:50 and got seated by 10:20 and the line just kept building up. The crepes are ok. They get ya by having them made in front of you but that's where it ends. The sausage selection on the other hand is game. They have at least 10 different sausages to choose from. Also you have to try the potatoes and corned beef. Their breakfast is really really good.   For dinner: arrive early, we came by at 6pm on a weekday and there was practically no line. The struggle was real. We were trying so hard not to over eat because everything was so good. I loved the seafood, pretty basic, and all the desserts. Also had an arnold palmer which was a really nice touch to our meal.   Overall a fantastic buffet. We had the 24 hour pass which was around $60 after tax... it basically gives you access to a few buffets and lets you use it up to five times in a 24 hour period. Since we were staying at Planet Hollywood we mostly just went to Spice Market and Le Village. Both are really great buffets and a more economical approach to dining in Las Vegas.

RgmKJhGz2GCk2BESNR9cCw.text: I wasnt too impressed with this buffet. We went for brunch and the food wasnt great. The service service was terrible- our server was so slow I had to ask for two drinks at a time because who knew when I would see her again.

oqwMYMtq8rmHx0tOYI45MQ.text: My favorite buffet in Vegas.  So many good vegetables and meat that I am almost able to control the carb overload that I expect when I see the amazing desserts.   This one offers reservations so DEFINITELY plan the day before so you can skip the loooong lines and lengthy waits.  You will walk right in with a reservation just like the high rollers.

rvFu61O3NUI4jkaFwx1f7A.text: Sounds like a great idea - unlimited French food. Unfortunately its all very bland and not very tasty at all. Only reason i'm giving it 2 stars is because its got beautiful decor and feels like you are sitting in a French Village. You would think, with it being in the famous Paris hotel that the food was be really good quality - its just not. Pretty much the same as any other buffet in town really, with maybe a few more 'French' items thrown in so they can justify it as a French food buffet.

z8FaPD6Fkznq6J2yIICanA.text: Not what it used to be when they first opened. Seems they have cut corners in several ways, the grille section is gone due to a new Asian place next door, the quality of the dishes just isn't the same, even the Nutella crepes are no longer Nutella, it is a diluted concoction that resembles a cheap chocolate syrup. Really too bad as this was the buffet of all buffets over a decade ago.

u-AXyNs7AAnvZnmJu0NSnw.text: Safe to say that this is my least favorite buffet in Vegas.  Save your money & spend it elsewhere!  For the price I paid, I was pretty disappointed in food they offered. I paid about $40? for brunch on a Sunday and when I walked in, I could already tell the selection was limited. I literally went through the entire buffet my first round & had gotten everything that looked appealing to me.  (Which wasn't much)  When it was time for my second round, I ended up just getting the same thing over again.  The food was not very appetizing at all--it was either really bland, cold or salty.  Nothing stood out & I was so sad that it was such a waste of money.  Never again.  The place itself needs to remodel... I mean, there are so many nicer buffets in Vegas now, they should try to keep up. Honestly, whenever I pass by this buffet I just wonder to myself, "seriously?? A line for THIS mediocre buffet" pfttt.  Throw more $$ down and go to Bacchanal buffet instead--well worth the money.

pFk3N_MREcyTkWG27NDbWg.text: Food is luke warm to cold. Limited options and the staff doesnt bother to refill the empty dishes. I read the review's online before going here and can say they are accurate towards negative side. Crepe station was no good either.

4kzrehfS6mij3R8MfHxaew.text: Lots of selections of food.  Monday-Thursday Lunch about $27 including tax (if you are a Rewards member you can get about a $1 off)  $11.99 additional for unlimited Wine, beer and champagne.  Line wasn't too bad.  Prime rib was nice and juicy. Shrimp was good too no frozen after taste. Nice cheese selection. Clams and mussels are yum Desserts ...love the variety of macaroons

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CGfYJLfCAyPPLYNha3VKjw.text: We've eaten here twice. The first time wasn't that bad of an experience - 2012, but that's because we hadn't been to any other Vegas buffets in years.  This time - 2015 - we had more discernment for what we liked.   We weren't impressed by anything being served, we only liked our super nice waiter.   It didn't look horrible, or anything, just not as appealing as the other buffets we've been to. Of course, it's not a famous or especially big one. We hopped back to Planet Hollywood's Buffet with our Buffet of Buffets pass instead of completing a meal here.

LFf5seYXfKPhtrRxnqaXiA.text: Pretty terrible service, good atmosphere, okay food....pretty much sums it up!   We made a reservation and after checking in, we were sat down after about 10 minutes. They took our drink orders in line, so I figured when we sat down after getting food, we'd have the drinks waiting for us. That did not happen.  We went and got all our food and there were still no drinks. In fact, I finished my entire first round of food before even one person looked in our direction. I had to flag someone down to come and get our drinks. I'm not really sure why we ordered them in the beginning if nobody was going to bring them to us.  After that, she came back one time to offer refills. We didn't leave a tip.  The actual look of the entire place was really cute and it looked like a village. So that was probably my favorite part of the meal.  The actual food was okay. Since it was a brunch, it was a mixture of breakfast and lunch items including made to order crepes, waffles, eggs, bacon etc. Plus an assortment of fish, sushi, pasta, meats, etc.   They also had a pretty good dessert selection including French macaroons that were delicious.  I wouldn't avoid this buffet again, but because the service was so terrible I wouldn't make it a destination.

2CaaMT3vRKEacqoukuyB0g.text: Decent mid-price Vegas buffet. The crepe bar was enjoyable. I'd been before and I'll probably go again. For a basic ass buffet on the Strip, this is a good bet by comparison.

lRHUUaUADvsjG6kTJOtqBg.text: This buffet is ok. The topping options for salad are dismal, quiche is gross and anything noodle based is soggy and congealed. The potatoes are ok. The fruit, breads and desserts were good.  Mixed feelings about the crepe station. I ordered  caprese and strawberry Nutella crepes. The caprese crepe was horrible, but the strawberry and Nutella crepe was good and had a pretty presentation too.  A lot of things were not good or just ok, there are not enough items besides dessert and fruit that are good or excellent to make the cost or caloric intake worth it. I was especially disappointed after having such a good buffet at the the Aria yesterday.

lI-KrjzVQR5xkRwjSW0TEQ.text: I dined here on a Wednesday evening and had the worst buffet experience.  The food was not fresh and some of the items were not even available.  I am very disappointed with the quality and selection, especially for the ridiculous price.  Do not eat here whatever you do.

5gGWzRWpKo_a2y3-0CeSpg.text: This is hands down the best buffet i have ever been to. 5 star food for sure. I dont normally go to the same places on different vacas but youve won another visit from me!

xa2_JbIe38dZPwT4u0IOmg.text: First of all, if you have a smartphone, check in to Paris Casino on Foursquare because you'll get a $5 off voucher to the buffet. Considering that the buffet is $19 per person, the discount is pretty substantial. We went for lunch on a wednesday around 1, and there were no lines. The cashier lady was nice enough to extend my one $5 off voucher to my boyfriend as well, so we really saved $10 in the end. :) :) :) I WAS SO HAPPY. We thought the buffet would be our splurge meal! On to the food... THERE IS SO MUCH FOOD. I know you're only supposed to take a bite of everything the first time around, but I was too distracted by the roast duck. It had some sort of sweet fruit glaze on the outside; I took double helpings-- bad idea. i92.photobucket.com/albu... The shellfish wasn't too great, and I'm a little sad I wasted precious stomach space on them. Focaccia roll? Nice and chewy. Roast mushrooms? Perfectly seasoned. Tri-tip? Nice and pink in the middle. Buffet food is typically pretty meh, but how can you miss out on a Vegas buffet? This was one of the better buffets I've been to during the last 10 years. $15 well spent. Round 2: i92.photobucket.com/albu... More mushrooms! Caesar salad + plain romaine (pre-mixed salads are often so heavy on the dressing!), creamed spinach + artichoke (YUM), sole, marinated tomato and mozzarella balls. My tips would be to go easy on the pasta, get the duck and roast beef, get veggies (minus the asparagus), and don't get shellfish. The fish is alright, the mediterranean section's got great sauces (pesto aioli! :D), and SAVE ROOM FOR DESSERT! Observe: i92.photobucket.com/albu... And that's only one side of the dessert island! I tried a little of several desserts... i92.photobucket.com/albu... Macarons. So Frenchy and so good! I also heard the creme brulee and custard were good, but I was SO full I couldn't even think about putting creamy, heavy food into my stomach. However, I did squeeze in a little bit of space for a childhood favorite. The apple crumble was divine-- hello, childhood memories! Paired with a dollop of soft serve, it was fantabulous! i92.photobucket.com/albu... The bf and I were stuffed for the rest of the day; we made use of a groupon on our way home, but took home most of the food. I legitimately thought I was going to die of fullness. Standing up straight was definitely an issue, but boy am I glad I went to Le Village! I did a little research beforehand on best buffets on the Strip, but ended up choosing Village over Bellagio due to the reviews for the dessert bar. ;) Sweet tooth win.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The fruit tart was bomb
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the roasted mushrooms :)
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 1/7 of all the desserts?!? Note: macarons!!!

ZdyDQzh0dGzUBGggTkgk-Q.text: The food was delicious and the decoration was really cute. Their crepes were amazing, so were their croissants. The only reason I gave it three stars was its service, which was horrible. The host was rude and extremely slow. There were plenty of empty tables in the restaurant, yet it took them forever to seat us. I would definitely recommend this place, but just beware of their terrible service.

QUy08mm3BiONjDkflbTQEg.text: I usually try to avoid buffets whenever possible, but wound up here for a Sunday brunch, with bottomless mimosas. Most of the food was not bad but it was not great either, considering the price. I was letdown by the desserts (I expect more from a French place).

o33s_qxX2ZBd-dwUsKp5EQ.text: I love love love this Buffet.  I love French food to begin with.  An added pleasure is that they have a wonderful creperie in the buffet which can make custom crepes for you.  Love it love it love it.  I hate the lines though- especially during the weekends.  But the lines are proof in itself that the food here is delicious.  Bring your total rewards card when you check in here so you get the points.

400thKoQiGEt03MFc-aMiA.text: A year ago this was my favorite buffet in Vegas.  Perhaps I had just tried a few better places since that visit, but I felt very disappointed in the offerings this year. There were no hot crab legs, most of the mussels were closed and inedible, and the macarons were dry and stale tasting. I couldn't find much that I wanted to eat- even the cheese selection was lacking. I sipped on some onion soup and ate a cold baguette and left disappointed. Hopefully it was just an off night, but I won't be back to find out.

SeMSkE-RIB-XHT_VxQXMCQ.text: The setting at Le Village is a little off in my opinion. Atmosphere feels stuffy and there wasn't anything particularly drawing or fancy about it. The aisles are a little confusing to navigate because they stretch all the way around the back and have a center island.  I would say I enjoyed having champagne being brought to me for brunch but I can't justify the quality of food and its appeal. Visually speaking, it wasn't a lot. Everything is pretty standard fare for a non-$50 Vegas buffet.  The good is that there are macarons (which I adore!!!) and crepes!  Quick Tip: Make reservations through Open Table, there was an intense line when I went!

ykEPPLXKSwLyzCWmtH_53A.text: Yeah its a good place to eat but not good with the server asked us what drink we want and we said lemonade my sister asked for coke what the server man respond was go to other place  pepsi only .he didt even say we dont have it just pepsi. But i guess hes something.

wQfM5Pb_0dKQqJpbCvUvAQ.text: We got the 24 hour buffet pass and came here for lunch. I started with a penne pasta dish that was delicious because it had a spiciness to it, I also got the pork and apples which was also quite well made. The prime rib was really tender but a bit saltier than I would like. The roast beef was too tough to cut and to chew. I did get a pot pie that tasted pretty good as well. There were clams and crab legs and both were mediocre. The crepes are pretty amazing and the fruits within are fresh. I had a variety of other desserts like the lemon tarts, creme brulee, flan, cake pops, cheese cake etc. I liked the tart and the creme brulee the best the flan and cake pops were far too sweet. This is a good buffet compared to planet Hollywood, I think it was better, and almost comparable to Caesar's since it's not the extra $25. The wait staff was way more attentive than both Caesar and Planet Hollywood and asked us how we were throughout the dining experience. The decor was adorable as well.

il8Tc6yjstG0vMNUgbrR5Q.text: Don't waste your money!! Terrible service, terrible  food. Had the salmon, dry. Had the roast beef, again dry. Chicken did not look fresh, and the mash potatoes has a crusty been sitting out too long completion. Server only brought one beverage, then never saw her again. Absolutely no variety. Some stations were closed, and don't disturb the servers in the back that are suppose to be assisting you (meat carver). When you ask for assistance, the look given could sear the meat. Desserts? Creme brulee had a puddle of syrup on top, and probably holding a temperature of 101 degrees. There we're a lot of small individual pastries, however it was hard to tell what they were, no labels. I did taste something that was suppose to be tiramisu....I think. Soft were ice cream was decent, along with the cute lollypop macaroons. Not one of my Vegas favorites.

3hCpdToF25RV6QjUA3bd6Q.text: Breakfast is average, service very friendly and down to earth. THE GOOD: quiches. And I don't even like quiche. strawberries. They are a different breed or something, very sweet, just lovely. Of the dishes we tried, i would go for seconds for the chocolate croissant, smoked salmon, bacon slabs,  and eggs Benedict.  THE HIT OR MISS: crepes. My husband was not impressed, but I loved two of the four I ordered (ok so we went bananas for the crepes). The crepe batter, sauces, and nuts/granola mixings were superb. How they are cooked though is chef dependent. We tried banana Nutella, 2 Berries, and apple cinnamon. The banana Nutella was decadent, and 1 of the berries were good. THE SO-SO: Dessert selection was non-existent at breakfast understandably. Bakery selection was limited to Danishes and croissants, too small for a French buffet in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana Nutella crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Berry crepe
Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon, strawberries

Mw2MOuo4UxYCxKY73FIYaA.text: Came to a Conference in Las Vegas and had a late lunch here. Irma was our server and she was Great !!!!! The food was so good.

photos.caption: Photo of Le Village Buffet - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooo good

HM-MCx0apdXbmjAUw0whnA.text: I've tried maybe a total 7 buffets out on the strip (including Wynn & Mandalay) and I used to think that Bellagio was the best (still have to try Cosmo & Caesars,) but now Bellagio might have the share that ranking with Le Village Buffet from Paris Casino.  I thought they had an eclectic mix as opposed to your typical buffet with pork belly, chicken caccitorie and beef bourgurgmon served in miniature iron skillets.  Bellagio's pastas are better, but Paris is a close second.  I dunno if I ran across a Vegas buffet that serves lamb, but Paris does.  I didn't really venture off to the salad bar because I opted for the spinach & artichoke as well as some of the steamed vegetables.  The desserts are pretty similar to Bellagio & Wynn, but hopefully you had enough of the main selection to not even think of heading in that direction.  pointers:  if you have a free Total Rewards card, that reduces the price and you can even reduce the fee even more by clicking into Paris Casino on Foursquare and get a $5.00 off voucher that you have show your phone at the Total Rewards booth in the casino.

Y9bB42gj27sDL_LF1iznBA.text: While our recent meal at the buffet was OK, it was nowhere near as good as our last visit several years ago.  We had high expectations of a buffet that led down several Parisian side streets with french-type food stations laid out intermittently.  What happened to the design?  It is now just one open buffet area with common buffet items.  No longer worth the cost.

g7FBuOrN5wxMV7rnmwERkw.text: We ended up staying an extra night in Vegas because of Traffic on the Sunday after Thanksgiving was horrendous! We turned back on the 15 and I called Total Rewards and I did a comp room at Paris. Staying here , we decided to do the Buffet here. I have been before on previous trips and the food is always pretty good!   I'm giving them 3 stars, because of service, not food. This most recent trip we came in at 8:45 p.m. and the line was short, but there were people waiting to be seated. From the time we purchased, until the time we were seated was 30 minutes! The place was not busy, so we ask what's going on, and they told us that they had some call outs. I totally understand. Our server took longer then normal, but she was working really hard and did an awesome job. Would come back, just hope the management could handle staff callouts better. It should not ever take 30 minutes to be seated in a nearly empty buffet.

UUEhuYXK4ZDmfEkvBMqcjw.text: I would give 0 stars if I could. The worst buffet Ever! Food was cold, "all you can drink" for $12 with the cheapest bottle of head ache wine. Spoke with mgr and said I'd pay the price for 1 glass of good wine...he actually argued with me. Service was awful and dessert lady was as rude as they get. I will never eat here again. Food was discussing too.

UTN91VmNlTPnPVPtr6dy6g.text: Ate here last night. Very, very disappointed. The beef wasn't just rare, it was RAW. The crab legs were disorganized as if everyone handled them then threw them back. The cooks never brought in fresh crab legs either. Was here a couple of years go and the service was excellent, what happened? Won't be back.

nAv45VhnTY61WGgsixQQ6Q.text: Love this place. Used to stay at Paris and usually every time, we'd stop by this place for lunch of dinner.  This buffet is good quality, nice ambience, and affordable.  I'd also throw in there that not everything out there is a homerun. It is a buffet so there are times when things sit there too long or have the occasional bad batch... just use common sense and don't eat those.  Good to take friends, dates, coworkers, and potentially customers.

RL1ryCPtp22ok3stg8SQXw.text: Pretty darn good and a lot cheaper than some other buffets in Las Vegas. We went for brunch  on Sunday for 4th of July weekend and champagne and mimosas were included in the $35 price. The breakfast food looked bland but it actually was flavored very well. My favorite lunch food was the prime rib. The desserts looked a little sloppy/crumbled but I ended up only having room for the custard which was good too. I didn't like the organization of the buffet line as the breakfast and lunch food were all mixed together and out of order but overall I enjoyed my experience and would probably return again.

0_7xCBA3jAb_SZo5JRqYSA.text: Good quality food, good mixture.  Crepe bar is nice and some solid mediteranean selections.  The lamb was excellent and prime rib is a go.  One of the better buffets in town.

4Z9hQsgNV1puTJNERT4rTw.text: A very bad buffet.  It's old and outdated. Everything is kept warm with heat lamps. The crab legs for dinner were probably made a few days ago... Just terrible. Le Village isn't worth a penny over $10.  Trust me, go somewhere else. Bacchanal at Caesars costs way more, but it's way better.

zNCh2FT1YnvRYeA7RXxf-g.text: My group utilized the buffet of buffets wristband and did the line cutting with the $15 express thing they had.  We were seated quickly. I ordered three drinks: AJ, Choc milk, Coffee and I received it all with the addition of water.  One of the first places I attacked was crepe area. Fortunately the line was short. People making the crepes looked miserable. Then again, some of them come across customers like this one lady that held up the line because she forced the lady to remake her crepe because she supposedly put the wrong topping on her crepe". Everyone in line made sure that chick knew she was dumb. So after she got her crepe, the same lady made mine. I felt bad for how that lady was to her so I tipped her a dollar. She instantly put a smile on her face and I think she felt appreciated and treated me well also. This buffet had snow crabs and shrimp galore. It made me a happy gal as I love seafood! The rest is history, and I waddled my way out (not really, but you know that means I ate my money's worth). I was extremely satisfied with their buffet.

uYuFZiMJNSqJg3SsPEk-lQ.text: The service was great but food was not that good as I expected. I was so disappointed with the selection of food they had.. kind of wasted my money and time..

j6zVdqxtfWmgeuIk25oWgQ.text: This buffet used to have some of the best food in town, but now they're charging more for less. That's not to say that you still can't get your money's worth. They have a made to order crepe station, which they sell outside the buffet for $10/each (which is still overprice). Other than that, they've cut back on fresh fruits and the carving station meat. It's nothing special anymore.

zJ3_6CErz979ASaXu7qS4w.text: This place got good reviews so again we were expecting good breakfast.  We got there about 10:20am and we waited in line for about 25minutes to get in.  The food was ok.  Maybe because we were so tired, we couldn't eat all that much.  I don't really remember any of their food standing out.   Their atmosphere was good, and service was pretty good as well.  They didn't charge anything extra for our 3 year old, which was a plus.    How good was the buffet?  We thought the buffet at Planet Hollywood next door was actually better (surprisingly).  If you think Le Village Buffet was the best, you haven't tried Wynn's The Buffet..

SiBYY0gMGVsfISvZcZq93A.text: After the kids spent their 1o dollars at Circus Circus in order to win 2 pillows, 4 bouncy balls, and a light up toy, we met up with the rest of the family at the Paris Hotel for our New Year dinner.  Le Village Buffet, along with the buffet at the Bellagio, are two of my favorite buffets on the strip, although I haven't tried the one at Wynn's yet. The ambience here is wonderful and brings me memories of me and hubby sitting outside a cafe in the real Paris sucking on escargot. Well, just me with the escargot bit because hubby would never eat snails.  The snow crab legs and cocktail shrimps are always good here, and this time around they had Jonah crab claws. I was surprised to find out that Jonah crabs used to be considered a nuisance to New England lobstermen, as I found them sweet and delicious. There were delicious baked oysters too, but no raw ones.  The dessert section is wondeful. Their creme brulee is perfect, and they have a crepe bar where they will make your crepe to order. We always seem to end our dinner with soft serve.  They also have good flan, nice and light.   My mom was able to have her crab legs warmed up by the waiter, although I prefer my snow crab legs fresh and chilled as I find them juicier that way. The waiters, of course, bring you all the drinks you want.  Full review and more photos on my blog.

plCFg8D50mLAL32FgiizSw.text: All I have to say is that the crab legs were REALLY good...All I can remember is the staff being somewhat rude but the food makes up for it.  Pastry section was bare, not much to offer in that department besides the generic stuff like cookies and small cakes.  All nonremarkable.  The food makes you feel stuffed!  The dining atmosphere is crowded and noisy but what can you expect from a buffet?  I like the patio area because it looks like youre really outside when really youre eating indoors with their mock sky and lightening.  Overall an interesting experience.

Ie5n2M0re8YUBhwCdy44tQ.text: +1 star for made to order crepes +1 for short line +1 for price  This place seems like it needs more light. Feels like I'm dining in the forest late at night near Europe. But overall the selections are ok for the $24/person dinner here. Although if I'm really craving for a good buffet, there's other places on the strip. Not bad for those spending couple days in vegas.

BUjpOKZ6nvgtHwxcgi904A.text: Good food. - The prime rib was tasty (med rare) - NY steak was (med well) not to my liking - Roast duck was a bit overdone - Roast chicken was OK, nothing special - Oven backed Sole, pretty good with a thick but small portion - Turkey sausage OK - Crab legs/claws had some pre-cuts into the shell to make it easier to crack - Tomato soup was good - Crepe bar was nice - most of the dessert offerings were a bit stale. - Banana Foster was OK. - Roasted vegetables were not bad but unspectacular.  Overall, not bad for the price, but probably could have been a bit better quality for a Las Vegas buffet.

d_NEYo2cjmXI7Q5IXHhBIQ.text: Food was great! (5 star) Huge variety of different choices, most top notch.  Desserts were a highlight. Service was poor.  Since it's a buffet, this only made it hard to get drinks.  Our waiter spent most his time folding napkins. He only looked up to see if anyone was leaving so he could check the table for tips.  When we did get his attention he alternated between being friendly and surly--a real Jeckyl & Hyde type!

Q1wVk6YydlcIwiPF3vM6xA.text: this just might be my favorite buffet place in all of vegas for brunch! bottomless champagnes and crepes! i feel like this place is really underrated compared to the other "bigger" buffets at the more popular newer hotels. The price is reasonable when you compare it the other brunch buffets and especially restaurants. the way i eat, there's no way i can get a better deal anywhere else. the food they have here is pretty standard, you have your meats, desserts, and seafood stations. what makes this place totally worth it for me is the crepe station. holy crap their friggin savory crepes are to die for. i haven't tried TOO many crepe places, but i can't imagine it being any better than le village. i definitely try my hardest to make it to brunch here everytime i'm in vegas

i-zuoc_W55_qU2poTdQinw.text: We usually eat here every time we go to Vegas. I thought the quality has gone down since they were added to the 24 hr buffet listing. The dessert was the highlight of the meal. The crepes were HUGE. It was delicious. I was pretty stuffed so I couldn't finish it.

E92xkpPs8s6af_2_Y_g74Q.text: This place was wonderful. The service was amazing. The Asian woman I believe her name is Lora was 5 stars. Very attentive and helpful and always smiling, she was lovely. The food was amazing. Such a variety! Check it out for sure, definitely a fan. The decor, architecture of the buildings, and painting made it feel like a fairytale setting and like we were in Paris.

dDdV1i0Frcbf_1wOjDIOzw.text: We had a groupon so it was pretty good deal.  Also I found out that I can make a reservation, so there was no waiting in line this time !  Foods were all good.  Especially prime rib and crape.  I wish they have more salads though. Sushi was not good. 1 item that I never tried before was " white anchovies ". I tried and liked it.

Ux1uSpCJzF49ho_uwsaVKw.text: A bit of a line as usual but a little gab with the hostess and we are goin in through the VIP entrance.  (waiting in line is for suckas)    All the usual suspects of the buffet here, but executed well.  They had stone crab which was great, although I have seemed to develop an allergy to shellfish but I had to have some.  Large variety of French themed items, I stuck to what I know....thick cut of prime rib seared on the grill=very tender rib eye steak.  (try it, you'll like it) just ask the cook, they will always oblige.  I had some mashed potatoes, some sort of I don't know what, with some other brown stuff, some kinda green things, all with French names I couldn't pronounce, le brown stuff, le green stuff, le poopoo....  Everybody's dessert looked good, I'm not a dessert person so I can't tell you much....  Overall a good value for $27, can't say as much for the Wynn buffet at $43, yikes!  Oh, and they served Newcastle beer, the one and only...,  til next time, good eating!

ZHU0ifqBo-Pt7P7iIAO4Cg.text: Decent selection of food. The draw is the crepe station. Was expecting a food-crepe station (i.e. non dessert crepes), but it was just dessert crepes. The egg station was good too. Actually, I didn't end up eating crepes or eggs because I ate some other things first and then was full.  The pastries seemed like the typical buffet pastries - little things on plates. The creme brulee was gross. The soft serve ice cream machine was fun and the ice cream cones were the good sugar-cone type.  The eggs benedict was ok, but I've tasted better hollandaise sauce.  Maybe my buffet bar was raised because I had just eatten at the Bellagio buffet... but Le Village Buffet was ok.

82n4CbzIct5ZhU-5I80hug.text: We ate here three of the four mornings we were in Vegas.  Tim loves this buffet for breakfast and looks really sad if we go somewhere else.  He loved the omelets and coffee.  I don't eat eggs so as long as a buffet has hashbrown, bacon, fruit and if I am really lucky, the little waffles that I can put the fruit on, then I am good.  This buffet had all of those things and everything tasted good.   This wasn't the premier meal of my life, it was just a breakfast buffet.  Nothing more, nothing less.

HqEqs_I8oAbwc6hn18_t6g.text: Get ready to wait for an hour just to sit down and eat, the service is horrible the buffet looks is half empty but for some reason it takes forever to be seated

66EVY5l6IC2dFG4b0-RanA.text: Not my favorite buffet. I suggest going to Aria or Wynn for buffet

HFRtFGcHUiLmiyc4wLnM3A.text: I was sorely disappointed with this buffet.  My girlfriend and I went between breakfast and lunch, so we could try a little of what each meal had to offer.  In short, the pancakes, french toast, and english muffins under the eggs benedict were stiff, even after I watched the chefs put out a new bin. The crepes were also a real disappointment.  They were moist and chewy, almost underdone.  The fruit topping was more like pie filling.  For lunch, the lamb and prime rib were both below room temperature, though that happens at a lot of buffets since they skimp out by cutting the slices way thin.  Most of the other dishes were simply not worth remembering.  The one thing I did like about this place was that it was cheap, after getting a players club card and using the included coupon, it was 10 bucks per person.  But when the only saving grace to a place is the price, especially in a place like Vegas, it's a little more than disappointing.

W0UDfrnqkPvphHdAeFkRkA.text: The best buffet I had in Vegas was ironically the cheapest. Came here for brunch and I finished pretty much everything I put on my plate. My eyes are bigger than my stomach, so I tend to waste a lot of food at a buffet. But not here. The quiches were superb. My friend had raved about the creme brulee, but I found there was a weird metallic taste to it.....ick. They also had churros, how awesome is that?!  The line to get in was long, but it was worth the wait! My only complaint was they only gave out 1 copy of the receipt, which had to be given to the hostess, and then returned to you when seated. The hostess would take multiple receipts at once, but apparently did not keep track of which belonged to who...so even though I paid with a credit card, I ended up with another party's paid-in-cash receipt.  I guess I'm anal, but I didn't like the idea of some random person out there having a receipt with my name on it along with part of my credit card number.

xR5wiOL0mQOnTzbCVIPREQ.text: A plethora of French delights...and sushi?  I usually skip bread at ANY buffet in order to maximize my stomach-intake-to-dollar-spent ratio, but the rolls here are nothing short of ethereal.  Made-to-order crepes...yummy!  The quiche is outstanding, as it should be.  Also, look for the chocolate mousse in chocolate shells.  Amazing.  Save room for two.  Or seven!

qKvEXaT0B_KtBl1COUVp8A.text: I am not a buffet person. You'd think that because of my picky palette that I would be... but no. I usually find the food very bland and mediocre.  While, the food here was nothing special, it was a beautiful location. The cobblestone, and the tables, it had a great setup. One of the nicest of the buffets I've been to in Las Vegas (and I've been going almost every year since I was 3 years old). That explains the third star.  The fourth star is because of the kindness and customer service we received. My mother is somewhat of a kleptomaniac, except she asks before she takes. She was enamored with the coffee cups that the buffet had. They were very cute. She asked the waitress if she could buy them or take them, etc, and the waitress said, "One moment , let me check". Usually, when my mom does this, we are given rude responses. When the waitress returned, she gave my mother a set of 6 coffee cups for free. We left her a great tip, and my mom was very happy.  This was around 2003 or so, and we still have the coffee cups. I wish I could say more about the food, but it's a buffet, that's about all I can say.
